author: {'steamid': '76561199086588165', 'num_games_owned': 560, 'num_reviews': 279, 'playtime_forever': 7, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 7, 'playtime_at_review': 7, 'last_played': 1710648113}
review:
Nearly unplayable... especially with controller.

First off, the settings (that you supposedly can change AND save) do revert at random.
No controller support. You'll need a mod for this and change controller settings template (until that part, left is up, right is down, up is right and down is left). 

Sometimes, the game will decide to not respond at all to controls.

I have had issues that forced me to close the game, restart and hope for the best before i could even finish the prologue ! Who knows after that... I would not be surprised to read that the game is broken enough to prevent from finishing it.

Add to that that launching from steam or the game's launcher crashes the game on start 100% of time i tried.
Launching it from the game's exe (not the shortcut though) lowers it to roughly 60% of the time.

0.25/10 (this port)
7/10 (PS3 version)

DO NOT BUY.

author: {'steamid': '76561198273523223', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 1422, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1422, 'last_played': 1705556153}
review:
I love this game but the port doesn't work on PC.
I've tried to play it twice (once a few years ago, once this year) and both times it would eventually seem to decide that the fun is over and crash after a cut scene. The first attempt, the cutscene was one of the town hall cutscenes, while the second attempt was earlier, at the end of the hospital. I don't know what determines causing it to crash and none of my attempted fixes worked. 
If it was just crashing normally, I could struggle through reloading it. But each save file seems cursed to explode after a completely random point without reason, and with no ability to mitigate or anticipate the issue.
Real pity because this game is top-tier weird bullshit.

author: {'steamid': '76561198257693714', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2147, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 2147, 'playtime_at_review': 2147, 'last_played': 1710411913}
review:
Hoo man, where to start?

This is not my first time playing Deadly Premonition and I definitely do not recommend this port for your first time either, unless you're willing to jump through hoops on fire. I was curious to try this version out after hearing how bad it is and for the low price of $1 I figured it was worth the try. Despite all sorts of problems it is in fact possible to complete the game 100%, so things could certainly be a lot worse.

Let me walk you through my experience:

My controller is not detected by the game/launcher.

Turns out you need to go to USB controller setup in Windows and then set your controller as the preferred device in the advanced settings.


I boot up the game and it crashes after the intro cutscene.

The game dislikes LAV filters for WMV playback which you probably have installed if you use MPC-HC or such.


The game boots up but things seem to be running at 15 fps.

The solution to this of all things is restarting your computer, I still don't understand why.


The control stick ranges bugged out a few hours in and barely register.

Downloading a controller profile with Steam Input seemingly corrected this. Still mystifies me.


The game might randomly crash.

Patching the executable to support 4 GB of virtual memory may have alleviated this but I can't say or sure.


The game crashes consistently during a cutscene that plays when grabbing the guitar.

Windows XP compatibility mode on the executable solved this (why?) and also smoothed out the FPS which had been juddery. I only noticed later that it also comes with the caveat that your aiming range breaks and becomes greatly limited which makes some spots awfully difficult to clear. (again, why???)

Things were quite smooth sailing after all of that was figured out but then the dreaded chapter 9 hit me. Something about that intro cutscene does not like to be played from a fresh boot up of the game so you need to make sure you save the game after watching it first. I lost about 3 hours of progress to that which would've been a lot more had I not created a back up save.

Then there's the crash at the cutscene after visiting the diner. Entering the cigarette smoking screen is somehow enough to avoid it. At this point I stop questioning the solutions. I had some side quest cutscenes crash on me too during that chapter which the smoking screen helped me avoid. I have no idea why it is so unstable.

After chapter 9 there were no further problems aside from needing to deal with the broken aiming from time to time.

I would love for some reverse engineer expert to look at this game to figure out what's going on under the hood. And maybe to try fixing the game too, would be really appreciated because Rising Star hasn't done anything for 10 years and the community needed to come up with all these workarounds. Had this all not been figured out I would've given up multiple times.

It's a damn shame too because this port is so close to being good. Being on PC makes it really accessible, the discounted price is impossible to beat and you'd be hard pressed to find another version that runs at a relatively smooth 60 fps the whole way through. And this pulls it off with very low spec requirements too which I find very impressive when compared to something like the PS3 port.

All that said, if you actually want to experience this game properly, you will need to get your hands on an Xbox One or Series console to play the original Xbox 360 version which you can thankfully buy from the Microsoft Store for $20. Forking over 200-350 just to play a single game is silly of course but maybe one of your friends has one laying around covered in dust that you can borrow? Just an idea. Maybe you'll figure something out.

It's been over 10 years and nothing has changed with this port. Unless you're a fan of the game and willing to troubleshoot all sorts of issues like me, steer clear of this sad mess.

author: {'steamid': '76561198169757717', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 2381, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 2401, 'playtime_at_review': 1145, 'last_played': 1710947649}
review:
I have no idea how they made fetch quests so much more fun than the combat and that's one of the least weird thing in this game. Each of its mechanics aren't really unique per se but having them all put together does give a pretty unique experience. 

Bug's pretty frustrating though so if you can get a better port on a different platform, get that one instead.

author: {'steamid': '76561198090697492', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 91, 'playtime_forever': 250, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 250, 'last_played': 1649227633}
review:
one of the most interesting games ever made. Worth trying, especially on sale for less than 2 bucks. poor shooting sequences bog down what is almost essentially an open world video game adaptation of Twin Peaks. David Lynch's series heavily influences the characters and setting.

Most gameplay is exploration and time based. you will drive around Greenvale, while being aware of your car's gas and using turn signals. Francis York Morgan will often talk to an unseen entity he calls Zach, using these one sided conversations as a way to both occupy time and to help him connect clues together. As time passes, you will have to investigate areas and talk to people at the right times to advance the plot or complete side objectives.

When the gameplay switches to its action segments, the game borrows from Resident Evil 4, but without any of that game's skill or depowering horror. York carries a sidearm with infinite ammo. SWERY didn't even want action at all, but was somewhat forced to implement it.

The story and characters are really interesting. its best to go in with as little information as possible.

this game's flaws are a little too present and nagging to really consider this game a "flawed masterpiece" but its still one of the best bad games out there.

also, i think its oldest game with real-time beard growth.

review: Sounds bad, feels bad, looks bad, prone to crashing, can corrupt your save file, difficult to run without tinkering with files and using community mods and fixes. review: Do i recommend playing this game? yes. Do i recommend playing it via the steam port? no. Over seven years ago i watched my favorite youtube channel play the first two chapters of this game. i found it charming and hilarious, but it wasn't until now that i saw it on sale and decided to see for myself how it actually ends. I might have had high expectations, and as of right now i'm not sure if my expectations were met. However, i'm glad that i played it. It's an odd little gem. I love the characters, i love the town, and overall i love the story. The port though.. I have nothing nice to say about it. If you're looking at reviews you'll see how many people were unable to run it. I fought tooth and nail to see the end of the game, and questioned if it would be worth it the whole time. If you are as determined as me, just know that along side running in windows 98 and running the launcher as administrator, sometimes you will have to switch to windowed mode. And when that doesn't solve crashing issues, you will have to download an unofficial patch for the game and place it in the files. That helps with some crashes, but causes others so you will be switching from removing the patch and putting it back. And when the crashing persists no matter what, you will have to restart your computer and then miraculously it will finally stop that specific crash. That being said, i did finish the game and got every achievement, so if you set your mind to it, you can absolutely make it work.

review:
I like Deadly Premonition more than the next guy, but avoid the PC port. The game itself is insanely ambitious and has a janky charm, but the PC version is borderline unplayable. Check out the PC Gaming Wiki page on DP Director's Cut to see the longest section of potential fixes and workarounds I've ever seen on a game. 

Great game, awful port, play literally any other version ( Xbox 360 > Switch > PS3 > ............ PC)

review:
THIS REVIEW IS FOR THE STEAM/PC PORT, NOT THE GAME. I LOVE DEADLY PREMONITION. DO NOT BOTHER BUYING IT ON STEAM.

There was initial issues with even booting up the game which I installed bug fixers etc for. Played the game up to the town hall and the town hall always froze/crash. This game on steam is completely unplayable and absolutely not worth even risking buying. 

I recently bought this on switch instead (Deadly Premonition: Origins) and have been enjoying finally getting to play through the game.

In conclusion, absolutely worth playing, just not on Steam/PC.

author: {'steamid': '76561198068273664', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 1218, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 52, 'last_played': 1705116768}
review:
As the age old addage goes; keep your expectations low, and even then you may be dissapointed.
But you won't be too dissapointed if you keep trying to make this work.
Set DP.exe to run as administrator and run in compatibility for Windows 8.
Set DPLaucher.exe to also run as administrator.
Out of all the fixes, for some reason this works... I'm on Windows 11 if that helps anyone else, seems like it's just trial and error for most people.
Before I couldn't even launch the game, now Zach and I are catching up having a good old time just like my coffee said we would

Update 1
Hit my first frozen blackscreen. As others in the community suggested, I changed DP.exe to run in compatibility for Windows XP Service Pack 3. I have no idea where this will lead us, but I have a definite feeling it will be a place both wonderful and strange.

Update 2
Needed to change the compatibility back and forth from Windows XP to 8 to get through the 
[spoiler] Community Centre Gathering [/spoiler] chapter from the game freezing at certain points. It's schizophrenia, isn't it Zach?

Update 3
The game crashes in Episode 2 right before you go to meet [spoiler] Olivia behind the diner [/spoiler] and will work in XP Service Pack 3, but now this feels like it's running at 10fps. Playing in windowed mode helps a tiny bit before I could turn back to Windows 8 compatibility. 

So what makes me keep playing this game? It feels special enough to want to try to finish it. It's a game with the setting and vibes of Twin Peaks, some influence in encounters and experiences from Silent Hill, the voice acting is masterful in bringing the characters to life. And ofcourse it's absolutely goofy in parts. I'm enjoying the story, small town murder turns into finding whats festering underneath the community. 

I'd ONLY recommend this on sale from how horrific the port for this game is, like others have said, I kind of wish I had brought this on Switch. Oh well, it gives me more time to think about which movie I'll watch after this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198079216405', 'num_games_owned': 76, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 1961, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1961, 'last_played': 1703085995}
review:
Ci tengo a precisare che, seppur negativa, questa recensione Ã¨ scritta da una persona che ha giocato a questo titolo per ore, apprezzandone moltissimo la storia. Deadly Premonition Ã¨ un gioco unico nel suo genere, con un ottima trama, piena di sorprese e momenti inaspettati, un cast di personaggi eccezionale e una colonna sonora memorabile. Tuttavia, queste caratteristiche sono le uniche che si salvano. Questo gioco soffre di numerosi problemi tecnici e di design che rendono l'esperienza di gioco frustrante e poco piacevole, un ottima idea affidata a sviluppatori incompetenti.

La versione PC Ã¨ totalmente instabile, con crash e corruzioni di salvataggi continui, e mentre questo non Ã¨ il primo gioco ottimizzato male per PC che abbia mai giocato, questo Ã¨ l'UNICO che mi ha dato continui grattacapi anche dopo aver installato tutte le patch e mod correttive in circolazione. PiÃ¹ volte durante il mio playthrough ho rischiato di rimanere bloccato per colpa del gioco che crasha costantemente in alcuni punti.
Il caso piÃ¹ grave Ã¨ stato durante il capitolo 9 dove il gioco crashava in continuazione dopo essere usciti dalla galleria d'arte, ma fortunatamente sono riuscito a proseguire solo dopo ore di ricerche online e smanettando con le impostazioni del gioco. 
Un altro caso grave Ã¨ stato quando sono rimasto bloccato dentro l'ospedale perchÃ¨ ogni volta che provavo ad uscire il gioco crashava (avevo salvato DENTRO l'ospedale quindi ad ogni riavvio mi ritrovavo bloccato), sono riuscito a risolvere solo facendo scorrere il tempo fino all'orario di chiusura, ma se fosse stato un luogo aperto H24 avrei perso tutti i miei progressi di gioco.
Anche fuori dalla storia principale il gioco crasha quando provi ad avviare alcune missioni secondarie o durante i caricamenti. Come ciliegina sulla torta, alcuni achievement di Steam si sono buggati, costringendomi ad usare Steam Achievement Manager per sbloccarli.

Quando il gioco non crasha, hai l'opportunitÃ  di visitare uno dei peggiori open world mai creati. Il gioco Ã¨ ambientato in una cittadina di campagna di nome Greenvale, che si presenta spoglia perchÃ© in giro si possono trovare solo i personaggi principali della storia, non ci sono NPC che popolano le strade come in molti giochi di questo genere, se non alcune auto che girano per la cittÃ . L'ambientazione in se Ã¨ poco interessante e poco dettagliata, con poche cose da fare a parte le missioni secondarie, inutilmente grande e sparsa, il 70% della mappa Ã¨ composto da strade in mezzo al nulla che collegano punti diversi della cittÃ  distanti tra loro qualche chilometro. Sarebbe stato cinquanta volte meglio fare un ambientazione piÃ¹ piccola ma piÃ¹ dettagliata.

Le fasi di combattimento sono noiose e ripetitive, la maggior parte si svolgono in corridoi e stanze infinite, e si affrontano sempre gli stessi nemici lenti, che rappresentano un pericolo solo in spazi stretti dove il gioco li fa comparire all'infinito. Il 90% dei combattimenti Ã¨ cosÃ¬ inutile che rimuovendoli dal gioco non si perde nulla della trama, e gli unici interessanti sono le due boss fight contro [spoiler]George[/spoiler] e [spoiler]Kaysen[/spoiler] verso la fine del gioco.

Ci tengo ad aprire una piccola parentesi per il sistema di guida delle auto nel gioco; tutti i veicoli sono noiosi, troppo silenziosi, e non si danneggiano visivamente quando sbatti contro qualcosa. La fisica Ã¨ fatta male, quando vai troppo veloce l'auto sbanda spesso a caso senza motivo anche se stai andando dritto su una strada piana.

La grafica Ã¨ letteralmente l'ultima cosa che guardo in un videogioco, ma questa Ã¨ fin troppo antiquata, i colori sono troppo spenti e molte texture sono a bassa risoluzione. Menzione speciale per la vegetazione, per essere un gioco ambientato in campagna, Ã¨ troppo spoglia e da l'impressione di trovarsi in un campo da calcio con qualche albero e collinetta qua e lÃ . Questo gioco Ã¨ uscito nel 2010, quando in circolazione c'erano giochi open world del calibro di Saints Row 2, GTA IV e Mafia 2, eppure ha una grafica ed un gameplay degno di un gioco per PS2 dei primi anni 2000.

Se volete provarlo consiglio di lasciar perdere la versione PC e prenderlo su console, il gioco Ã¨ disponibile su Xbox 360, PS3 e Switch. Se non avete nessuna di queste console consiglio di emulare la versione PS3 su PC (ha piÃ¹ contenuti rispetto alla versione 360). Se proprio non avete altra scelta oltre al PC consiglio di seguire questa guida prima di iniziare a giocare, cosÃ¬ da renderlo un po piÃ¹ giocabile:
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1957819200

Purtroppo, a differenza di molti altri giochi, nessuna patch o mod Ã¨ in grado di sistemare definitivamente questo gioco. Ãˆ assolutamente vergognoso che Steam permetta la vendita di prodotti difettosi e non funzionanti ai propri utenti.

This game sure is amazing,isnt that right zach?
the story is captivating and the songs like "life is beautiful"
and "the woods and the goddess" are repeated throught the entire game, but they make you feel things when they play, and also the characters are multi layered and deep.
But heres a hint for all that plan to buy this game 
ignore the grandaughter scenes.
Its just fluff the directors cut added that was retconned with deadly premonition 2 a blessing in disguise, 
its a shame that you cant turn them off but you can skip them at least, and plus the added scenes to the ending dont ruin it too, since its just the original ending plus few more scenes added after the og ending so you can just skip them.
Well zach i guess this is a farewell then life sure is beautiful.

author: {'steamid': '76561199114628348', 'num_games_owned': 287, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 573, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 367, 'last_played': 1702623977}
review:
Be warned you will need to mess with this to get it to run. However! I say snag it on sale for around 3-ish bucks USD. Unless you have a Switch, I've seen alot of good about the Switch port.

 It's a cult classic through and through. The game knows it's a game and that it's janky. i.e. it doesn't take it's self too seriously, which is VERY refreshing amidst modern gaming. 

Remember, real men smoke two cigarettes at a time!

PRGE approved!

author: {'steamid': '76561199014667464', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1513, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1513, 'last_played': 1700733651}
review:
I'll be brief:
It's buggy. It crashes a lot. You'll need a fanpatch to run it well, and even that has issues, like seriously hamstringing the aiming system, which WILL be an issue if you don't work it out.
I personally don't think it's a good game, and I will probably never play it again.
But I would say, if nothing else, it's worth going through once to laugh at some of the absurd things that happen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198020205810', 'num_games_owned': 553, 'num_reviews': 70, 'playtime_forever': 1844, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1844, 'last_played': 1700602433}
review:
This is a video game equivalent of a "so bad, it's good movie". It has A LOT of technical issues, gameplay shortcomings and partgs of mechanical imcompetence, but coupled with serious attemnts, lots of effort, and charming characters, those weird things become hillarious. 
Easiest way to summarise the game is: imagine some weird japanese auteur game designer and a fan of american cinema, got high while binding his box set of Twin Peaks and them came up with a game design document for a similar murder mystery, but was later forced by the publisher to add action gameplay to it because "Resident Evil 4 is really popular". 
The results is a weird coctail that you'll either love or absolutely hate. There's no middle ground with this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198154978974', 'num_games_owned': 861, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 3829, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3829, 'last_played': 1697235046}
review: If you think going through eight circles of hell is horrible, you are sorely mistaken. Your deepest fears will be revealed to you and you will realise the hopelessness of your situation. Have fun....

author: {'steamid': '76561198134864878', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 360, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 201, 'last_played': 1700522762}
review: I knew the PC version was atrocious and I still bought to at least do the achievements with the lowest possible expectations... and this is still a horrible disappointment!! At least while the console versions are also their own levels of atrociousness they will actually let you play the game... at buttery smooth 20 fps. The ONLY solution to some of the crashes in the PC ports is to skip cutscenes and dialogue and at that point what's the point of playing? If you're playing deadly premonition for the gameplay you belong on a psych ward. Some people can run this game with success, though still with the DPfix mod, but that is wholly based on how the stars align. PS3 emulation is the solution. Its at the point where even if you're on a weak system its not even worthwhile to consider the PC port, because at least the console version will run without crashing and probably even at 30 fps, which is an improvement over the original release. If your PC is half decent you can upscale the PS3 version, unlock the framerate, and improve the anti-aliasing and you're almost at DPfix levels with a playable game! The game is awesome and absolutely worth playing, but I wouldn't get the PC version even if it was them paying me instead.

author: {'steamid': '76561198001488382', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 1770, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1770, 'last_played': 1699994202}
review:
I loved this game unironically right after finishing Twin Peaks! Reminds me of early PS2 games in all the good ways. 

Took me around 25 hours with some side-questing and 20 deaths overall. Ran in windows 98 compatibility and as administrator, still handful of crashes after hours-long sessions but game encourages saving so never lost more than few steps.

author: {'steamid': '76561198047913698', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 2238, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2238, 'last_played': 1699371938}
review: It was very painful to get through this game but I feel some sense of accomplishment now that I've completed it. As a huge Twin Peaks fan, I can say this game is a must-play but it's certainly not for everyone given the poor porting, crashes, etc. Even with the fixes and workarounds, the experience in terms of game play left a lot to be desired. If you can manage to pick this game up on a sale and don't mind dedicating a week or so to just dig in and work out the "quirks" of the game itself, you're in for a treat. Otherwise, at least watch a Let's Play or the cutscenes (you really won't miss much in terms of an actual game experience IMO).

author: {'steamid': '76561198027720090', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 2785, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2785, 'last_played': 1699004410}
review:
Itâ€™s like watching Twin Peaks if the ad breaks were replaced with fishing minigames, trivia quizzes, sliding block puzzles, and escort missions for a crazy one-shoed pot lady.

The game crashed about 30 times before, and only 5 times after I was forced to play in Windows 98 compatibility mode. Driving vehicles is a nightmare, weapon aiming is clunky, and youâ€™ll be stopped constantly to rewatch the same long animations for every single interactable object 

 â€“ and it is all absolutely worth it. 

Be bewildered by the bizarre cutscenes and grow fond of the eccentric Greenvale citizens as you (the enigmatic FBI Agent York) piece together the mysterious murder of young Anna.

Donâ€™t try to make sense of it â€“ just enjoy the ride.

author: {'steamid': '76561197978139741', 'num_games_owned': 1480, 'num_reviews': 160, 'playtime_forever': 3086, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3086, 'last_played': 1697044395}
review: I will not blame anyone for trying this port out and then putting it down immediately, the finish rate of just chapter 1 is abysmal, and for good reason. But if you make the time and effort to wrestle it into submission, you will absolutely fall in love with its charm. The most stable I could get the game, I was still getting crashes once every 2 hours or so, but even so I still went for the 100% and I'm so happy I did.

author: {'steamid': '76561198154898862', 'num_games_owned': 504, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1564, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 738, 'last_played': 1699128707}
review:
The most broken game in pc gaming history
I really liked the concept and overall the game but game wont let me play it.
It crashes every hour. I fix one problem, then another problem appears.
I played for about ten hours, but most of the time I was trying to fix the game.
By the ninth chapter, the game was crashing at every cutscene. I downloaded many saves and tried to play. But after the 21st crash in the ninth episode, I lost all patience for this game
Just don't buy this garbage port. I can't believe the developers actually sold this broken game.

review:
AtÃ© que enfim esse jogo funcionou no meu win11. Fui atÃ© a biblioteca da Steam, cliquei com o botÃ£o direito do mouse no jogo, fui em Propriedades, Arquivos Instalados, Explore..., depois disso fui no DP LAUNCHER.(tome cuidado para nÃ£o apertar no inicializador do jogo (DP). Cliquei com o botÃ£o direito, fui em Propriedades, depois em Compatibilidade, e coloquei para ser compatÃ­vel com o Windows 7. Apliquei e cliquei em OK. Fechei tudo o que precisei abrir e fui jogar sem bug/crash .


Infelizmente, nem mesmo com esse patch, eu consegui me livrar de um crash que o jogo estÃ¡ dando logo no primeiro capÃ­tulo. Por conta da frustraÃ§Ã£o, a minha anÃ¡lise positiva agora ficou negativa. Infelizmente, nÃ£o conseguirei terminar o jogo. Quem sabe um dia venha um patch para fazer algo que os desenvolvedores nÃ£o conseguiram, usem o patch vai que no de vcs funciona :)

O jogo em si Ã© Ã³timo (ignorando o port problemÃ¡tico da Steam). O modo como ele te mantÃ©m tenso e, depois de 30 segundos, faz vocÃª rir Ã© excelente. Por fim, o jogo Ã© realmente muito bom, uma histÃ³ria excelente de investigaÃ§Ã£o com um agente do FBI em um mistÃ©rio na pequena cidade de Greenvale. author: {'steamid': '76561198121171783', 'num_games_owned': 667, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 2264, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2264, 'last_played': 1694004704}
review:
Are you here Zack ? Letâ€™s remember our old case and talk about it in 2023.
So Deadly Premonition released in 2010 on PS3, Xbox and PC, and maybe should say that graphics of this game looks like this came out on PS2. Looking at this fact, I will start with the fact that if for you the graphics in the game is an important part of the game and you cannot play the game despite the good story, forget about Deadly Premonition. Unfortunately this game looks worse. But if you donâ€™t care about the graphics and just want to enjoy a good story and interesting characters, this game is what you need. While playing this game, you meet interesting characters with their storyline. Some stories are copies from Twin Peaks, and the main part also has similar moments from the True Detective.
And now a few words about the gameplay. This game has technological problems such as crashes (never save the game near the Milkbar store). Regarding the shooting mechanics, the game is trying to copy Resident Evil 4, but they failed in quality. The requirements for completing several side quests were difficult, but there are also good ones that are not difficult to complete. If you missed side quests you can go back to a specific chapter and complete them there. Deadly Premonition is both a good and bad game at the same time. If you like a good detective story with interesting characters, you should definitely try this game. But if you are not familiar with the Japanese mentality or have not watched series like Twin Peaks and True Detective, you will have a hard time understanding this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000588904', 'num_games_owned': 1591, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1463, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1454, 'last_played': 1695034991}

The devs need to sort this issue, even the community guides don't help.

author: {'steamid': '76561197989771388', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 91, 'playtime_forever': 1338, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1338, 'last_played': 1693949196}
review:
Odiado o amado, no hay punto medio para este tÃ­tulo.

Por hacer un anÃ¡lisis rÃ¡pido: Guionistas excelentes, programadores malos aunque en el fondo creo que ellos querÃ­an que este juego se viera y funcionara asÃ­ de mal a propÃ³sito,  hay demasiadas referencias al cine de serie B y creo que aquÃ­ han querido que el juego fuera de segunda.

AÃºn asÃ­ me parece un juego disfrutable si consigues arreglar los problemas de rendimiento, crasheos, archivos de guardado corruptos entre otros.

MecÃ¡nicas de principios de los 2000, texturas feÃ­simas, sonidos falsÃ­simos, combate horroroso pero..., de verdad, vale todo la pena por una gran historia detrÃ¡s de toda esa fachada de serie B.

Personajes carismÃ¡ticos con historias detrÃ¡s de cada uno, muchas interacciones y misiones secundarias, un mapa abierto que explorar en un survival horror (primera vez que lo veo) hacen que mi voto sea positivo, sobre todo la historia.

Si tuviese que compararlos supongo que es con lo que todo el mundo lo compara, una mezcla de Twin Peaks en la ambientaciÃ³n y Shenmue en lo jugable y mundo "vivo".

Por los precios que suele rondar en oferta no pierdes mucho y seguramente si estÃ¡s leyendo esto es porque te llame la atenciÃ³n de verdad asÃ­ que no lo dudes, pero no te rindas ante los primeros problemas de rendimiento y fallos, si buscas un poco por Google verÃ¡s que la comunidad tiene distintas soluciones. Yo he tenido que descargar un archivo de guardado de internet porque le mÃ­o se corrompiÃ³, cosa que hubiese hecho que dejara el juego si fuese otro tÃ­tulo pero la historia me tenÃ­a tan enganchado que me encabezonÃ© en arreglarlo.

Disftruta de la historia Zach!

author: {'steamid': '76561198071545213', 'num_games_owned': 518, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 1889, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1889, 'last_played': 1408041583}
review:
Dear Diane, I've been playing a game recently and feel the need to share my thoughts on it. The game in question is Deadly Premonition.

First and foremost, Diane, I must inform you that this game is not for the faint of heart. Its bizarre nature and unique charm are what make it stand out, but may be off-putting for some. I, however, found myself intrigued by its odd storytelling and quirky characters.

Taking on the role of Agent Francis York Morgan, I found myself solving a murder mystery in the small town of Greenvale. York, as he likes to be called, is quite a peculiar character with a strange love for coffee and cherry pie. Moreover, his constant conversations with "Zach," an imaginary friend that only he can see, make for some fascinating dialogues.

The visuals of the game are quite dated, but in this case, I believe they add to the game's charm. It reminded me of the good ol' days when gameplay and story were more important than flashy graphics.

I must mention the soundtrack, though. The music complements the game perfectly, with its ethereal tunes heightening the overall sense of mystery. It has definitely left a lasting impression on me.

Now, Diane, I must caution that the game does have its fair share of glitches and bugs. While some of them can be frustrating, I've found that they don't detract from the overall experience too much. One could even say they add to the game's quirky charm.

In conclusion, Deadly Premonition is an odd, one-of-a-kind experience that isn't for everyone, but I must say, it's certainly worth a try. Its unique storytelling, eclectic characters, and haunting soundtrack make it an unforgettable journey. So, Diane, if you ever find yourself in the mood for something different, pick up this game. You might just find yourself immersed in the strange, yet fascinating world of Deadly Premonition.

Take care, Diane. Until next time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198065895896', 'num_games_owned': 878, 'num_reviews': 152, 'playtime_forever': 320, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 154, 'last_played': 1693266928}
review:
This game is so bad that it's good, York is eccentric to put it lightly, and it's the pure epitome of cheese, but man, even with mods, this PC version is unplayable. Crashes during the hospital cutscene, and both the windowed fix AND the gamesave fix on the PCGamingWiki doesn't work to fix it. Just loads into a complete black screen. According to someone on the Steam forums, DXVK fixes the game crashing, but the current issue is that there's no way to chainload a proxy DLL through DXVK that would allow for DPFix to function. Even after trying it with just DXVK, same issue occurs. Plenty of places where the game can softlock or corrupt your save too. This PC port is just completely busted.

Keep in mind, this is with these modifications:
- DPFix (The game itself doesn't have issues hitting 60FPS at 3440x1440 with this mod and with mostly maxed settings, but on my other setup with a Ryzen 5 5600X, it had really bad performance issues)
- The intro skip, ultrawide patch, and large memory address aware modifications to the game executable
- Windows 98/ME Compatibility Mode (Which apparently fixes some crashing)
- Application-based DPI scaling in compatibility settings (So you can use a high DPI without being messed up)
- The Immersive Premonition mod (that is available on the Steam forums) which aims to fix color grading issues, alongside making the game more "immersive"
- The assorted HD texture packs and PlayStation button prompts mod

Please for all that is holy, just buy the Switch version, dump a ROM of it, and emulate that at 60FPS, or (if you have a Bluray drive for your PC), dump the game files for RPCS3 using a physical PS3 copy of the game. This is such a shame since I honestly like what I've played so far.

The developers of this port seemingly haven't fixed the major issues with it. How is this port even being sold on Steam to begin with when it may as well not come with the executable at this point?

EDIT: Restarting my PC did the trick for the hospital crashing issue, alongside the fixes I mentioned previously (yes, including the save).

author: {'steamid': '76561198050398519', 'num_games_owned': 242, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 1175, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1175, 'last_played': 1692056236}
review:
Deadly Premonition is often touted as a so-bad-it's-good game. I disagree. It's an excellent game that just so happens to have very jank production values. Special mention has to go to the director, Swery, and his drive to create an immersive world that he can populate with wacky, lovable characters. This guy went to small town USA to measure the roads so he could make sure the width was just right for this game. You don't get much more dedicated than that.

That isn't to say the PC version isn't a pain in the neck to run. Make no mistake, this port is fucking terrible. But it just shows how much I loved this game that I was willing to work around the bugs, to tolerate the crashes, to set the compatibility mode to Windows 98 to get this hack job to even function. That's the magic of Deadly Premonition, and why it continues to be so beloved. What it lacks in budget, it more than makes up for in heart. In spite of all its technical flaws, the game is beautiful: hilarious, awkward, tragic - the whole rigmarole. It's as the good book says: same things that make us laugh, make us cry.

author: {'steamid': '76561198089295389', 'num_games_owned': 657, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 1356, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1127, 'last_played': 1692244229}
review:
I haven't beaten the game yet, but it's really interesting, I've been aware of this game, and I watched Twin Peaks with my Family a long time ago. Playing through this makes me want to watch it again. and I've summarized this game to be like, "A Person watched Twin Peaks without the Subtitles and from what they took form it, they made their own."

An Open-World, (Semi-Action)-Horror game, With Survival Elements.
The game has a lot you can appreciate and a quite a few things you can dislike throughout the game. It's honestly surreal this game manages to be as playable as it is.
It's difficult to get immersed from it being a game, but you can get immersed into the game and the world if you play for long stretches. The Game Rewards you really easily, and honestly if you're not familiar with this game, it's better to go in without expecting the best experience in the world, but expect something that is unique. Cause this game is one-of-a-kind. I've yet to think of a game that does everything the same as this game, but doesn't crash.
Even then, I consider the crashing as part of the experience even if it's not something I look forward to.(It just means I can do some stuff in a more time efficient manner with how I see it)

How is the Main Story? - Interesting, and engaging, keep tabs on the story of the game.
Is there something I should look out for? - If you're doing Side Quests, I'd recommend just using a guide, the numbering of a lot of them seem really random, even as chained quests.
Is this the best possible way to play the game? - Supposedly the Xbox 360 Version is the best way to play it, it's the 'Least Buggy' way to play, every other version has a chance of crashing, and gets a more likely chance with each later iteration.

I play this game, as it stays a buggy mess.
The guides I went though were just a mere test.
Seeing the issues arise as I play.
The funny fast car glitch is the one I wish could stay.
(So Says, Mr. Stewart.)

Crashing and errors pop-up throughout my play.
aiming is broken and a guide said "compatibility Win98"
Some of these fixes just flat out don't work sometimes.
Definitely play on a console or patch this game.
Even edit the exe, so it will use more than 2gigs of ram.(It made the game also look better)

I'd make a guide to how to make the game work and how to beat it from my personal experience with this very broken game game.

I found two guides that made the game run well, and I found some things that stayed broken so I had to look through discussions. I might make a mega guide or something if I note things down soon enough.

review:
Ich hÃ¤tte Deadly Premonition wirklich gerne eine gute Bewertung gegeben. Ich bin groÃŸer Twin Peaks Fan und habe auch schon recht viel von dem Spiel in Videos gesehen, darum wusste ich bereits was mich in etwa inhaltlich erwartet. Das war auch der Grund weswegen ich das Spiel gekauft habe.

Dieses Problem tritt wohl nicht bei allen Nutzern auf, aber doch bei einigen. Ich nutze einen X-Box One Controller und mit den Zusatzeinstellungen von Steam konnte ich dieses Problem immerhin lÃ¶sen. 
DafÃ¼r versinken aber immernoch regelmÃ¤ÃŸig Autos im Boden und Ã¤hnliches. Das grÃ¶ÃŸte Problem auf das ich aber bisher gestoÃŸen bin und was mir den SpielspaÃŸ wirklich komplett genommen hat, ist, dass ich das Spiel einfach nicht dazu bringe flÃ¼ssig zu laufen. Die Systemanforderungen erfÃ¼llt mein PC locker, darum nehme ich an, dass es am technischen Zustand des Spiels liegen muss. So ist es leider eine einzige Ruckelparty und macht keinen SpaÃŸ.

author: {'steamid': '76561198129736263', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 3722, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3722, 'last_played': 1689132094}
review:
Negatives - Game has myriad of technical issues. Lots of bugs, crashes, etc. (but if you are lucky they can be worked around). 
There are some parts of the gameplay that are really annoying, and kinda of stupid. When you are being chased by the main antagonist. And some other parts later on. (not a big deal though for me)
There are a few other things regarding the story that I have issues with but that would be me flirting with spoilers, so I'll keep it in my pants right now.

The positives.
Everything the f@#$ else.
As a huge fan of who done it genre this game blew me away. Whenever I thought I figured out who the main antagonist was the game made me feel like an amateur, a fool of the highest order.
Even in a such a dark setting , the whole atmosphere of the game felt really light hearted. 
There were so many times I had to pause to laugh at the quirks of main character.
And to top it all off, the supernatural elements really meshed with grounded murder mystery as well. 
I could go on but I don't want to spoil even a tiny detail of the story so. 

Play it NERDS.

If you can't run the game, just watch a playthrough , you will enjoy it as a story.
And if you can figure out who the Raincoat killer is, you have my utmost respect.
Signing off.
Call me Elric! Everyone calls me that.

review: I've never seen a game before where 'never judge a book by its cover' could be applied more than this game. It really deserves the chance BUT play it on ANY OTHER platform other than pc, you don't want to troubleshoot it everytime you decide to open up the game. author: {'steamid': '76561198117885332', 'num_games_owned': 679, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 556, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 509, 'last_played': 1694929010}
review:
[b]This game is broken, completely and utterly broken.[/b] I'm only 8 hours in, barely finished with chapter 1, and it's nigh unplayable sometimes. It doesn't work at all without a slew of bug fixes and .ini file tweaks. And once you're in-game, it's a mess. AI vehicles will drive in circles, their pathfinding completely broken. Touching a physics object has a 50% chance to break the crash the game. The lighting bugs out during rainstorms, and gives everything blinding textures. I've softlocked myself several times, and I nearly permanently broke my save when I messed with a scripted chase ahead of time on accident. And to top it off, it crashes at random. [b]This is a horrible, horrible port.[/b]

That being said, I still kinda love this game. Despite this being maybe the worst way to experience it, I love a lot of what it's doing. The main character is insufferable in a wonderful way. The story is weird and bizarre but just good enough to keep you hooked. The world is so open and so ambitious that you almost forget it doesn't work. The dialogue is unintentionally hilarious, with stilted deliveries and tangents that go nowhere. It's a game that shouldn't work at all, but somehow does. And there's a lot of charm here, just waiting to be experienced.

Do I recommend this game [b]in general?[/b] Absolutely. If you're a fan of those bizarre Playstation 1/2 horror games, and can appreciate an old janky game, you'll love this. It carries that atmosphere and feeling perfectly. 

Do I recommend you buy [b]this version[/b] of the game? No, not at all. This is probably the [i]worst[/i] way to experience Deadly Premonition, and you'd be better off emulating it or playing it on a console. If you've got no other option though, you can get this version into a sort of playable state. Just go in with a lot of patience, and save every two minutes.

author: {'steamid': '76561198161205253', 'num_games_owned': 919, 'num_reviews': 297, 'playtime_forever': 1275, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1275, 'last_played': 1688114084}

review: i really want to give the game a good score but I can't. The game completely crashes every 20 minutes or so which already undoes a lot of progress if you don't save religiously, but it completely crashes my computer which requires a hard reset every time. On top of that I am literally stuck now because the game crashes every time I go to the town hall in Episode 1. However the story was pretty interesting.

author: {'steamid': '76561197961464258', 'num_games_owned': 1375, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 1365, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1365, 'last_played': 1688372870}
review:
Fantastic game. Great story, combat is a bit boring. 

Game has this cool horror mechanic where it crashes randomly every 10-90 minutes. Really ups the tension not knowing whether or not you'll make it to the next save point, or have to replay the last 30 minutes of gameplay. Bravo SWERY, was on edge the entire playthrough.

author: {'steamid': '76561197984713783', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 5733, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5733, 'last_played': 1688359905}
review: Excellent game. Ignore the bad reviews based on being unplayable on modern systems. The game can be fixed to run almost perfectly. Though the occasional crash isn't unexpected. Just check out https://www.pcgamingwiki.com/wiki/Deadly_Premonition:_The_Director%27s_Cut to get it running right.

author: {'steamid': '76561198020424473', 'num_games_owned': 703, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1681, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1588, 'last_played': 1688058880}
review:
Crashes and Bugs aside. 
This game had me hooked, going to finish the rest to get 100%.
Very good Story with not so obviouse twists, you doute your ideas of the bad guy sometimes.
The bad Sound design has something to it, funny but also somehow fitting for the game.

Its like a bad movie, which is super good, its still all in all a bad movie , but the package is nearly perfect.

author: {'steamid': '76561198100478817', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 141, 'playtime_forever': 2854, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1375, 'last_played': 1687632268}
review:
God awful port. You need to install a bunch of mods to make it work and it still barely functions. Crashes every 20 mins. Bugs fucking everywhere. Audio is complete garbage. Somehow the controller cameras are flipped, so looking up and down is now right to left and looking right to left is now up and down. 

Darts mini game is a piece of shit and horribly bugged. The darts never land where you are aiming its random. I keep watching guides of people nailing it over and over, but when i aim perfectly at the spot it goes nowhere near where I am aiming. Seriously whoever designed this dart game, I wish nothing but the worst for you. 

Generally not worth the time. I played it years ago, its an alright game with some interesting stuff in it. But its not worth the time and effort to get it to work. Just watch Twin Peaks. This game hardcore rips it off anyway. 

This is the worst port I have ever seen in my entire life and this shouldn't be up for purchase on steam. Whatever company ported this, should not be allowed near any game again. Fucking disaster. You should be embarrassed by this shitshow of a job you did on this port. 

Seriously fuck you. 

Edit: I looked into it. The darts mini-game is 100% broken. They are always vertical for me so they never go even remotely where I am aiming. I followed a bunch of fixes and none of them work. This makes the entire mini-game random because the darts can land anywhere they want on the board. If you watch guides, everyone's darts go straight to where they aim. No vertical darts. Even if you watch random let's plays, people just randomly playing it, all their darts go straight no vertical. 

Its impossible to win this mini-game now. I've tried everything. I tried with DPFIX, someone said you can fix it by removing DPFIX and running the game in default resolution. It didn't work. I even tried using cheat engine to change my score and that doesn't even work. The game made me resort to having to use a cheat engine to try and beat it and its so broken that you can't cheat it. Fucking dumb. 

Update: I FUCKING DID IT!!!!! I BEAT THE STUPID SCORE WITH VERTICAL DARTS!!!! FUCK YOU DART GAME!!!!!!

Update 2: I 100% the game. Don't buy this. It crashed around 250-300 times during this playthrough. I lost count around there. This shouldn't be allowed to be sold on steam. Its a broken mess. If you have to play this game, then get it on literally any other platform or emulate it. 

My favorite part of the whole ordeal is when the game crashed on the last ten seconds of the final cutscene. It had to do it one more time before I departed the game. I will never play this again on steam. Its a disaster.

author: {'steamid': '76561197979153841', 'num_games_owned': 275, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 2363, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2363, 'last_played': 1629752988}
review:
I bought this so I can morally justify playing it on an emulator because it's a great game, but quite possibly the worst PC port I've ever played, likely worse than Saints Row 2.

The controls are janky and the game is as stable as your average padded cell dweller, it's such a good game that you'll be tempted to power through the terrible pain that whoever ported it chose to inflict upon you and others, but you'd be tainting your experience of such a delightfully compelling and eccentric story.

author: {'steamid': '76561198051764316', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 77, 'playtime_forever': 378, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 378, 'last_played': 1686589706}
review: While the story so far is very interesting reminds me of Twin Peaks and there is lot of side content in a interesting sleepy little town to explore this is a bad port there is a fix to make it little more tolerable but after while performance drops and I have to constantly quit and restart the game every 1 to 2 hours to fix issues. Also disable sticky keys if you plan to play this, the game itself isn't bad but this port to PC is buggy and performs bad so I can't recommend it as a good port.

author: {'steamid': '76561198840134910', 'num_games_owned': 184, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 139, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 137, 'last_played': 1691460954}
review:
this game feels like someone watched twin peaks, thought twin peaks was an accurate depiction of american society, then tried to do a satire of american culture themselves.

then turned it into one of the worst put together games I've ever seen

to quote another review I saw on here "damn fine video game" Damn fine video game indeed.

author: {'steamid': '76561198082508010', 'num_games_owned': 70, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 1268, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1268, 'last_played': 1687361063}
review:
One of worst games I ever played.
The gameplay is very bad, it reduces the playability of the game, everything is very slow... And the scenario is depressing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198062173297', 'num_games_owned': 282, 'num_reviews': 59, 'playtime_forever': 1463, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1463, 'last_played': 1686429880}
review:
Es ist schwer eine Bewertung fÃ¼r diese Spiel zu schreiben. Zu allererst das Spiel ist nichts fÃ¼r Leute die nicht ein wenig dazu bereit sind an den Spieldateien rum zufummeln. Ohne ein wenig extra Arbeit wird man das Spiel nicht zum laufen kriegen. Wenn man dies allerdings getan schafft man das Spiel grÃ¶ÃŸtenteils ohne Crashes zu spielen.

Dann wird man im Spiel mit ziemlich mittelmÃ¤ÃŸigem Gameplay konfrontiert, welches nicht furchtbar ist aber selbst fÃ¼r die Zeit in dem das Spiel herauskam veraltet wirkt.

Dann kommt allerdings der Punkt in dem das Spiel strahlt und das ist die Story, die gut geschriebenen Dialoge und Charaktere. Wenn man bereit ist sich mit den technischen Schwierigkeiten auseinander zu setzen wird man hier mit einer tollen Story belohnt.

author: {'steamid': '76561198051708541', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1391, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1369, 'last_played': 1687601193}
review: Game was buggy overall, but the captivating story and characters kept me coming back for another episode to see how it unveils. Got me emotional. Combat sucks, but characters gold.

author: {'steamid': '76561198236569698', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2021, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1308, 'last_played': 1707717591}
review: If you can look pass some of the limitations and issues that Deadly Premonition has (mostly crashes), you'll find a game with an interesting plot and a unique set of characters! The combat system is a little slow and clunky, but that works out for me since I'm not fast-paced in shooting games lol. I have thoroughly enjoyed the game so far, and recommend it to those who don't mind the game crashing every now and then. :]

author: {'steamid': '76561198394729024', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 2195, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2195, 'last_played': 1668976915}
review: Truly a memorable experience, of course the constant crashing wasn't helpful, but nonetheless I found this game to be worth every bit of time spent. It's the perfect blend of horror and humor, this is a unique game for what it is. I genuinely wish I could play it for the first time again.

author: {'steamid': '76561198258139877', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 2101, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 742, 'last_played': 1694547233}
review:
Zach, looks like we found our favorite game of all time!

(This game's biggest sin is the lack of updates and fixes, fixing this game yourself might be a pain, but it's ABSOLUTELY WORTH IT to complete it at least once)

author: {'steamid': '76561198118553227', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 2540, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 231, 'playtime_at_review': 2309, 'last_played': 1710342003}
review:
game itself is... certainly interesting, and i wouldn't recommend against playing a better version of it, but this port is [u]totally abysmal[/u] and both the devs and steam should feel ashamed about selling this for any price at all. wouldn't even recommend picking this one up on sale, if you're playing it for FREE you still paid too much. 

i will say, this is one of the only games i've ever played where the totally nonfunctional port of the game, its constant weird bugs, memory leaks, and crashes actually feel fitting to the tone and world of the game - it's difficult to describe why, but the whole thing is just... extremely janky, so it didn't feel like a stretch to go from the awful sound mixing and weird dialogue in a cutscene straight to a crash, lol. a few of the bugs i encountered were as unique as the game, too - for some reason my right analog stick controls were totally swapped, with left tilt moving the camera down and upward tilt moving the camera right. never experienced that in any game before or since. i enjoyed the layer of challenge it took to get the game to run and to [i]keep[/i] running, it was almost a game in itself having to stop playing, copy over files to an unpatched version of the game and run it in windows 98 compatability mode to get past certain consistent crashes, but that's something entirely personal to me and i cannot in good faith recommend anyone else try to work with that experience. [b]it's a lot of extra work to just continue the story, and it's not on any intentional level.[/b]

i imagine as new windows versions become commonplace, this game will become even more difficult to play, so i'd just recommend trying to grab one of the console versions if you're interested. i've heard the switch version works well. the game, when it's playable, has this ugly-cute charm i think is easy to appreciate if you're a fan of quirky or janky games. it attracts a lot of comparison to twin peaks, and rightly so, but be prepared for the game to start shedding the more high-brow aspects of that show around the halfway point of the main plot - it starts to meander out into sophomoric-nonsensical territory pretty fast after that. be sure to take the time to do the side quests during the story, too - the game's strength lies frequently in the personalities and connections of its townsfolk, and working with them in these smaller ways can really bolster your experience of the main storyline. the combat just sucks and is boring but is mercifully very easy to get through (excepting the boss battles, which can pose a challenge especially if you're having issues aiming). the protagonist, york, is a distinct bright spot in the game - his voice actor is excellent, and he has a specific lack of social sensibility that i find really engaging and fun,

i think the reviews are certainly correct when they emphasise the uniqueness of the game - there really is nothing else i could directly compare it to. i think it's definitely worth a shot if it interests you, but try to get it for cheap or free, or at least buy it somewhere you can ask for a refund if it's not up your alley. [b]100%, do not buy this port.[/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561198405762579', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 1926, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1173, 'last_played': 1702580930}
review: It is an excellent game, if you like Yakuza style games, this is definitely for you, it is a sandbox, full of good side quest, with an interesting main story, full of characters with a lot of personality and well-written dialogues, the port without patches is unplayable, but with two simple patches or fixes made by the community, the game works perfectly, without crashes, and with improved graphic quality (dpfix and 4gbpatch With these two simple files you will be able to play the game without problems), This game has been a pleasant surprise, it's definitely a cult classic, I recommend it, especially if you get it for less than 5 dollars, "I think I'm going to get more people to live this experience, don't you think it's great Zach".

review: Dieses Spiel ist wirklich absolut einzigartig. Der Titel "bestes schlechtestes Spiel aller Zeiten" beschreibt dieses StÃ¼ck Unterhaltungskunst auf jeden Fall treffend! Die Probleme gehen schon beim Start los. Ohne einen Fix aus dem Netz will das Spiel nicht so recht laufen. OK, es ist ja schon etwas Ã¤lter.... Die UnterstÃ¼tzung des Controllers bedarf (obwohl im Game vorgesehen) einiges an Fummelei- geschenkt!! Bekommt man das Spiel dann endlich zum Laufen erwartet den geneigten Gamer eine Grafik auf PS2 Niveau mit einer absolut hÃ¶lzernen Spielmechanik. Die Autofahrten sind ein Graus - Es ist immer nur ein Ausschnitt der Karte abzurufen die sich dann im Spiel mitdreht! Orientierung  ist am Abfang gleich Null und man landet Ã¶fters in einer Sackgasse. Vom Angeln will ich gar nicht mal reden, eine absolute Tortur. Wer sich allerdings mit all diesen Wermutstropfen arrangieren kann, den erwartet eine absolut packende Story die David Lynch nicht besser hÃ¤tte inszenieren kÃ¶nnen. Klar ist es fast eine reine Twin Peaks Kopie. Die Traumsequenzen, die roten VorhÃ¤nge und Agent Cooper Ã¤hh York...Twin Peaks Fans werden dieses Spiel lieben. An jeder Ecke lauern skurrile Gestalten die irgendwie verdÃ¤chtig erscheinen. Trotz der schlechten Spielmechanik ist man Ã¼bermotiviert und mÃ¶chte wissen wie die Story weitergeht! Das hat bei mir noch kein Spiel in den letzten 30 Jahren geschafft. Totale Kaufempfehlung fÃ¼r Leute die storylastige Action Adventure spielen!

review:
Ce jeu sâ€™inspire de lâ€™ambiance si particuliÃ¨re de la sÃ©rie â€œTwin peaksâ€ mais avec un cÃ´tÃ© Japonais dÃ» au dÃ©veloppeur qui donne une ambiance vraiment originale.
On suit lâ€™histoire de York, un agent du FBI envoyÃ© dans une petite ville des Etats Unis pour enquÃªter sur un meurtre vraiment Ã©trange. York, en plus de parler sans cesse Ã  quelqu'un dans son oreillette qui ne nous rÃ©pond jamais et qui ne nous a jamais prÃ©sentÃ©, se retrouve par moment dans un monde dÃ©moniaque Ã  affronter des monstres sans jamais que la transition entre la rÃ©alitÃ© et cet univers parallÃ¨le ne soit expliquÃ©e.
Bref, beaucoup de mystÃ¨re et une ambiance vraiment particuliÃ¨re font que ce jeu est vraiment prenant et quâ€™on a pas envie de s'arrÃªter pour en apprendre toujours plus.

Et puis ce jeu propose des idÃ©es que je nâ€™ai jamais vu ailleurs comme la gestion de l'hygiÃ¨ne de notre personnage qui peut avoir un impact sur la maniÃ¨re dont nous perÃ§oit certains personnages et dâ€™autres aspects que je vous propose de dÃ©couvrir par vous-mÃªme !
Au niveau de la structure, tout se dÃ©roule dans un Open World qui prend en compte la ville et ses alentours. Ce qui ajoute Ã  lâ€™ambiance si particuliÃ¨re câ€™est les citoyens de cette ville qui nous sont tous prÃ©sentÃ©s au cours de lâ€™intrigue et qui ont chacun une personnalitÃ© et une routine uniques que l'on peut voir lors de sÃ©quences d'enquÃªtes oÃ¹ lâ€™on devra faire attention aux heures de vies des citoyens.

Si jusque lÃ  tout semble positif, on sent que les dÃ©veloppeurs nâ€™avaient pas les moyens de suivre leurs ambitions, et on va devoir subir Ã§a. DÃ©jÃ , le jeu est moche et pas du tout optimisÃ©. Il crash souvent et câ€™est vraiment frustrant, surtout quâ€™on ne peut sauvegarder quâ€™Ã  certains endroits. 
Ensuite, les phases dâ€™actions dans le monde dÃ©moniaque ne sont pas du tout fun en plus de juste couper lâ€™intrigue. Surtout que York nâ€™est pas du tout agrÃ©able Ã  contrÃ´ler. En plus de cela dâ€™autres sÃ©quences sont vraiment chiantes Ã  faire, entre suivre un chien sur plusieurs kilomÃ¨tres et des QTE de 10 minutes face Ã  certains ennemis qui dÃ©truisent les doigts jâ€™ai vraiment hÃ©sitÃ© Ã  m'arrÃªter Ã  plusieurs moments.
Il y a beaucoup de BUG, mais vraiment beaucoup trop qui rendent certains passages irrÃ©alisables (le coup final pour achever le dernier boss qui marche presque jamais et qui fait recommencer presque tout le combat).
Le sound design est catastrophique, entre sons libres de droit bien clichÃ© et bruitage inadaptÃ© (les Ã©cureuils font des cris de singe).
Lâ€™ambiance du jeu si particuliÃ¨re ne justifie pas toujours lâ€™Ã©trangetÃ© de certaines cinÃ©matiques qui sont juste malaisantes.

MalgrÃ© tous ces dÃ©fauts, jâ€™ai quand mÃªme vraiment aimÃ© dÃ©couvrir cette histoire si atypique. 
Jâ€™ai vraiment Ã©tÃ© secouÃ© par certaines rÃ©vÃ©lations mÃªme si jâ€™ai Ã©tÃ© relativement dÃ©Ã§u par la fin.
Et puis ce jeu propose des idÃ©es que je nâ€™ai jamais vu ailleurs comme la gestion de l'hygiÃ¨ne de notre personnage qui peut avoir un impact sur la maniÃ¨re dont nous perÃ§oit certains personnages et dâ€™autres aspects que je vous propose de dÃ©couvrir par vous-mÃªme !

Play it while streaming with a friend. I know it'll crash abit. save often and just enjoy the ride.

author: {'steamid': '76561198137026460', 'num_games_owned': 1248, 'num_reviews': 199, 'playtime_forever': 668, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 668, 'last_played': 1682314451}
review:
[h1] [i] As amazing as it is broken and thus, ultimately, not worth the hassle [/i] [/h1]

Deadly Premonition was my disappointment of the year. Not because it would be bad but rater because it does everything in its power to prevent you from not only enjoying it, but also completing it. Even though the game came out in early 2010's, I have only discovered it now and it was love at first sight. See, I have a weakness for "weird" games that people would not necessarily categorized as straight up bad but neither would they think of them as hidden gems. DP has that exact signature feeling to it along with a presentation unique to that specific niche of games developed by a Japanese studio in western-style setting - quirky dialogue writing, overload of unnecessary side activities, ominous plot player has no way of understanding and that gets crazier as the game progresses.... I love it. I have weakness for that particular niche and Deadly Premonition was able to scratch it fantastically....for a time.

See, the reason why I can not, in good faith, recommend the game even though I'd love for more people to play it is its infamously broken technical state. Now, don't get me wrong - I can tolerate A LOT of bulls*it from a game if I enjoy every other part of it. I have completed numerous titles that were either incredibly buggy or kept crashing constantly - if the game itself was worth it, I was always willing to push through these issues. But this was just too much. Even if I excuse the outer, less significant technical layer consisting of pis*-poor optimization, inability of the game to run at over 60fps (struggling to keep up with that, even on modern machines), A LOT of bugs and unresponsive controls, I can not overlook the worst offender - crashes. I was going to accept the game would crash in semi-frequent intervals from time to time but it kept happening more and more often which, when you take into account that the game does NOT allow you save anytime but rather in specific spots, is irritating enough on its own. What pushed me over the edge, however, was the save-bricking and inability to progress. Twice my safe game got corrupted as a result of a crash and twice I started again because that is how much I liked Deadly Premonition but my patience ran out when the game started crashing in one specific spot in the story and I was simply unable to fix it to get through it. Hell, even PCGamingWiki has a whole list of parts of the game that are known to crash and this was not there. So I've given up. And you should avoid this entire ordeal by simply skipping the entire thing. It's a shame because underneath it all, there is a really good game but juice is not worth the squeeze here.

[h1] [b] [u] Positives & Negatives [/u] [/b] [/h1]

[table]
[tr]
	[td][b] [i] Positives [/i] [/b][/td]
	[td][b] [i] Negatives [/i] [/b][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
	[td]+ Overall story premise - as weird as it is, its also quite intriguing[/td]
	[td]- The above-mentioned technical state that makes DP a broken mess[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
	[td]+ Good voice-acting[/td]
	[td]- Graphics have not aged well - the game looks worse than Resident Evil 4 that came out in mid 2000's[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
	[td]+ Amazing level design[/td]
	[td]- Clunky and often unresponsive controls[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
	[td]+ Perfect OST (albeit with too few tracks)[/td]
	[td]- Many unnecesary activities that do not bring anything interesting to the table[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
	[td]+ Decently enjoyable gunplay[/td]
	[td]- As much driving as you need to do in this game, it is not very good [/td]
[/tr]
[/table]

author: {'steamid': '76561198140147662', 'num_games_owned': 399, 'num_reviews': 97, 'playtime_forever': 320, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 320, 'last_played': 1682018752}
review: The game itself is so weird it's interesting and with the dffix mod it works, but the port is utter garbage. Constant crashes, game breaking bugs and one I just came across where I can no longer progress through the game because it freezes every time I enter the mission trigger. I think I heard the PS3 copy is better so might just try that instead at some point. Don't even bother asking me what I think, Zach.

author: {'steamid': '76561198060215390', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 4004, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3935, 'last_played': 1681942357}
review:
Great game.
Horrendous port.

I spent more time getting it to work and restarting (and replaying long chunks) after various crashes than actually playing. Which is a shame because the game itself is charmingly weird and really fun. Do yourself a favour and borrow or buy a second hand PS3 to play it and forget about this garbage steam version.

author: {'steamid': '76561198314389329', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 945, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 945, 'last_played': 1680408229}
review:
Este port a PC que venden acÃ¡ es un desastre total rozando lo peor que puede pasar que es ser INJUGABLE. El juego esta lleno de bugs que hacen que se te crashee el juego y hasta corromper tu partida guardada.

Es cierto que la comunidad hizo un parche (DPfix) que "arregla" todo el juego y trae mejoras tÃ©cnicas como poder jugar a mayores resoluciones que 640x480 en esa resoluciÃ³n se me abrÃ­a por el juego y en ningÃºn lado habÃ­a opciÃ³n de cambiarlo ni en el launcher ni en las opciones dentro del mismo juego que son escasas.
Con parche instalado desde el principio.. despuÃ©s de 15 horas y habiendo llegado hasta el capÃ­tulo 12 ME CANSÃ‰, me cansÃ© de tener que hacer malabares como jugar algunas partes del juego en modo ventana; saltear cinemÃ¡ticas; tener que cambiarle el modo de compatibilidad al juego para evitar cualquier problema, todas esas precauciones siguiendo las guÃ­as de la comunidad para nada, ni asÃ­ hubo salvaciÃ³n de los crasheos anticipados ni los inesperados (en cualquier momento, en cualquier lugar), la partida se corrompÃ­a igual osea que ya era inutilizable, cuando te pasa eso no te queda otra para poder retomar el juego que bajar partidas guardadas de internet y ponerlas en el juego.

La verdad es que ni asÃ­, no se puede jugar un juego teniendo que preocuparse siempre por los problemas y errores tÃ©cnicos que puede presentar, los desarrolladores responsables de esto nunca les importaron los jugadores ni siquiera intentaron hacer algo para arreglar el juego que lanzaron estando mal de fÃ¡brica. Aunque la comunidad le haya puesto todas las ganas para que el pÃºblico de PC pueda jugar este tÃ­tulo, ni asÃ­ fue suficiente.

CONCLUSIÃ“N:
(-) Jugar Deadly Premonition Director's Cut en las consolas que fue lanzado originalmente (Xbox 360 y Playstation 3), el port de PC es injugable y no se merece ser comprado ni aunque lo pongan a $1, es una estafa.

(+) En lo que respecta al juego su trama (muy basada en Twin Peaks) y lo que ofrece a modo de juego son atractivos, es un mundo abierto survival-horror con muchas buenas ideas: 
*Ciclos DÃ­a-Noche con cambios climÃ¡ticos / Transcurso de los dÃ­as (creo que influye cuantos dÃ­as tardas en resolver el caso)
*Sistemas de Hambre, SueÃ±o e Higiene
*Los vehÃ­culos dependiendo de la gasolina y bueno si se daÃ±an dejan de funcionar
*Los NPCs del pueblo tienen una rutina y se los puede ver en distintos sitios, se puede hasta espiarlos por las ventanas
*Los Establecimientos del pueblo cumplen distintos horarios de apertura/cierre
*Actividades extra como carreras y misiones secundarias que te dan los habitantes del pueblo, desconozco que mas puede haber porque no tuve la oportunidad de explorarlo por problemas tÃ©cnicos obvios

*Cosas malas que he visto son principalmente sus controles: a pie, lo shooter (tipo Resident Evil 4) me sorprende el nivel de tosquedad para ser del aÃ±o 2010 y teniendo ejemplos tan buenos de hace 2 aÃ±os como Dead Space que marcaba como tenÃ­an que ser las cosas en tercera persona.

author: {'steamid': '76561197961167439', 'num_games_owned': 1579, 'num_reviews': 720, 'playtime_forever': 2092, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2092, 'last_played': 1679357621}
review:
Great unique story. Pacing is on the slow side. There are a lot of things this game does well and there are a lot of things this game doesn't do well. I could nit pick a lot of missing quality of life features, but overall the game as a whole is well done. Great music, amazing voice acting, and the character facial expressions are top notch.

I would give it a thumbs up review, but it just crashes too often. There's a large part of the game where I was just hoping for the next save point in case the inevitable happened.

review: One of my absolute favorite games now dont get me wrong the graphics are sooo bad but the story just means alot to me ive got this game on two different platforms and this version does like to crash alot so be prepared for that but if you get in on the switch it works well and it used to also be an xbox 360 game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198003232563', 'num_games_owned': 2757, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 2216, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2174, 'last_played': 1677975915}
review:
We've been through so much together, Zach.
Several different (used and unused) mods and hacks.
27 crashes. 
3 save game corruptions. (thank you kind soul who has a save for each chapter online) 
Delicious turkey sandwiches. 
Emulating 2.1 sound so the infinite loop of an e-brake wouldn't drive me (more) insane.

But you know what, Zach?
I'd do it again.

review:
So, firest of all. this is the greatest game to ever hit the steam pole platform. it is art, it is mysterious, and it is also FPS shooter with sombies or something. it is a perfect driving simulator and full size mysterious game on top of that.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049840197', 'num_games_owned': 483, 'num_reviews': 383, 'playtime_forever': 1452, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1452, 'last_played': 1670566404}
review:
I LOVE this game.

I've been making jokes about FK in the coffee for years. Hell I even tap my chest like York does when he's thinking about stuff. 
That's how much I've played this game (on other releases)

But this might be the worst way experience this cult classic. 

Yeah Deadly Premonition has a lot of problems. Guns are trash, healing is jank, the game crashes on every platform, bad graphics I could go on. But this port is by far the LEAST functional one. I can't even get the game to launch anymore and there is no mod scene to help you fix it. You might be able to get the game to run and maybe find some info somewhere to mitigate the worst of it.

But save yourself the hassle, find a good no commentary playthrough on youtube instead.

author: {'steamid': '76561198024194237', 'num_games_owned': 263, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 987, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 920, 'last_played': 1675304484}
review:
[h1]Do not purchase this game, Zach.[/h1]

The major problem here is that THIS IS THE WORST PORT EVER MADE. Even with all the community guides, bug fixing and trouble shooting, it is still an unplayable mess that will crash to desktop whenever there is a new cutscene or loading involved. I've spent way too much time with consistent crashes while attempting to fix this game, modifying DPFix.ini, running different compatibility modes, loading other people's save files, etc.

Honestly, I really, really wanted to give this a thumbs-up, a positive review. This must be one of the most interesting and quirky games I've ever played - the characters, the story and the world building are extremely fascinating and intricate. The music and voice acting stand out quite well. However, the gameplay is extremely janky and the controls haven't aged well at all. Regardless, I was committed to putting those aside and just enjoy this weird experience.

After almost 17hrs of trying to get this non-functioning game to work properly, I decide to not frustrate myself any further with this nonsense. I will instead watch this "Twin Peaks-esque" story unfold through one of those YouTube videos with compiled cinematics.

That's quite something, right Zach?

this game is objectively bad. 
its runs like shit.
it crashes every 30 mins.
my savefile corrupted twice.

author: {'steamid': '76561198064639124', 'num_games_owned': 176, 'num_reviews': 75, 'playtime_forever': 1101, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 296, 'last_played': 1697522974}
review:
I think I would recommend this game, Zach.

Deadly Premonition. From 2010, I believe. It was designed by Hidetaka Suehiro, a visionary of his time.

However Zach, I wouldn't recommend this particular version of the game. It is fraught with crashes and bugs that can supposedly even corrupt your save file. I personally would recommend playing the PS3 or Xbox 360 version of the game instead, whether emulated or on original hardware.

author: {'steamid': '76561198003321420', 'num_games_owned': 1342, 'num_reviews': 227, 'playtime_forever': 216, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 216, 'last_played': 1674067793}
review:
ğŸŸ¡[b] Requires heavy tinkering [/b]

1) DPfix fan patch. Essential to play properly:
https://community.pcgamingwiki.com/files/file/896-dpfix095zip/

2) To set resolution open DPfix.ini in game folder with notepad and set [i] renderWidth/renderHeight [/i] and [i] presentWidth/presentHeight [/i] values to desired resolution.

3) Default controller layout is wonky. Use community control layout from theraineydaze: steam://controllerconfig/247660/1665006164 (Cog icon>Manage>Controller layout>Browse Community Layouts>Community Layouts)

4) Consult PCGamingWiki page for optional improvements (Improved textures and SweetFX) and crashes fixes (if you encountered them):

https://www.pcgamingwiki.com/wiki/Deadly_Premonition%3A_The_Director%27s_Cut

Tested on: OnexPlayer Mini Pro 6800U
