author: {'steamid': '76561198071691882', 'num_games_owned': 1093, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 1418, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1418, 'last_played': 1673748906}
review:
[h1]A charming diamond in the rough, isn't it, Zach?[/h1]

Having played the game in a company of friends I can say that: Deadly Premonition[i] is far from a perfect game but it is neither a bad one nor an average one[/i]. Let's start by saying the game has a lot of love put in and is a tribute to the series "Twin Peaks" which I really like. The game might not scream AAA and have the best graphics(though it does have one of the best mirrors in video games, lmao), but it's lovely. Cutscene animations might look janky, but lot of effort has been put into them, It gives the feeling like those indie games that use PS1 era style graphics. Storywise the game is good and the plot is full of twists, though it feels a little rushed by the end, but it still feels like it ends just as it should. Characters are also lovable and distinguishable from one another.

Now let's address the elephant in the room: the port to PC. Yes it's bad, but it's manageable, there are fan made patches but it won't save you from all of the [b]crashes[/b] in game. You know what will though? [b]Smoking!(in game of course)[/b] Don't ask me why, it just works Â¯\_(ãƒ„)_/Â¯. By the way, drinking game: every time you crash! There are also bugs with the sound, like in my case the looping car skid sound when driving any car which became a running joke in our group throughout the game. And also some music might often stop abruptly and a new one start right after though I dunno if it's a bug. Also, rarely, probably due to high fps the game was running on it would play on super speed to the visuals would play at 1.5x but the audio would play at 1.0x which creates funny distortions with the visuals and the audio. 

And numerous other funny bugs like York's tie going through his chest, many funny bugs :DD

On game mechanics: the keyboard controls are not that bad once you get used to them, but it's far from perfect. And it's not the fault of the port it's most probably the fault of the fighting system in general. That said I didn't hate the fighting in the game, there were some "how?" moments but nothing worse than that, but it also doesn't have anything of note to be said about it other than it does have a great shotgun! The map requires better controls and to be able to zoom out of it more since most of the time it feels like reading a fully zoomed in google map with a magnifying glass. Also multiple save slots would help a lot, maybe to revisit previous parts of the game which you missed on. SINCE [b]some of the side-quests become unavailable[/b] as the story progresses, you can though reload a previous chapter, but you will have to fully complete it for the progress to count.

In conclusion I would WANT to recommend this game to anyone but it's hard to recommend a game where only 1 in 10 people have reached the second chapter of it. :DDD
It's a still great game to have a laugh and enjoy in my opinion :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198109957851', 'num_games_owned': 65, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1315, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1315, 'last_played': 1673674134}
review:
ReseÃ±a corta: Juego que tengo entendido estuvo/estÃ¡ muy dividido en criticas. EmpezÃ³ a gustar a una pequeÃ±a parte de la comunidad y ha ganado (desde mi perspectiva) mÃ¡s reconocimiento poco a poco, aunque actualmente siga algo desapercibido al menos en nuestro paÃ­s.

Lo que mÃ¡s me ha gustado del juego sin duda es sus personajes, su historia y el carisma que rebosa en toda la obra. No he visto Twin Peaks, pero con conocer al menos un poco de que va la cosa (algunos personajes, el pueblo, etc), a simple vista se nota la inspiraciÃ³n. 

La mÃºsica, aunque repetitiva en la mayoria del juego, me gustÃ³. 

No se muy bien, porquÃ© el final me llegÃ³. Puedo tener una idea, pero no la confirmo. Si alguien lee esto y quiere contestarme si el tambiÃ©n sintiÃ³ algo respecto a las escenas finales, que me lo diga. 

La jugabilidad, puede que sea tosca, pero para mi todo lo demÃ¡s lo acapara y no lo he notado tanto la verdad. TambiÃ©n es cierto, que llevo jugando juegos antiguos un buen tiempo, por lo que puede que me haya acostumbrado poco a poco a ciertos controles jajaja. Y si, no por ser antiguo se debe ser tosco, pero en lineas generales, es asi.

Esperaba mÃ¡s a la hora de buscar secretos por el pueblo (como la posibilidad de espiar a gente), pero tal vez no haya estado en el momento justo para que sucediera x cosa. Y no he investigado del todo (no terminÃ© ||el chantaje al de la gasolinera para que me diera informaciÃ³n|| ciertas misiones secundarias.

OjalÃ¡ segÃºn descubrias cosas, ciertas cosas del juego no sucedieran o sucedieran pero de forma distinta (yo que se, imaginaos, descubris algo antes de tiempo, por lo que podeis cambiar el rumbo de ciertas situaciones). Pero esto ya es algo personal y no una cosa no quita la otra. Este juego para mi es genial.

PD: Como punto muy negativo, es que, aunque en PC me fuÃ© mejor que en PS3, en PC a veces me crasheo. Menos mal guardaba cada vez veia un telefono.

author: {'steamid': '76561198065771641', 'num_games_owned': 173, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 2052, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2052, 'last_played': 1429479416}
review:
This game is obviously inspired by â€œTwin Peaksâ€, and most who come to play this, do so for this reason alone. However - Iâ€™d like to talk about how this game stands out on itâ€™s own.

The game is designed like a road trip/life simulator, mixed with a survival horror mystery. 

- Your character has procedural facial hair growth (this was before the Witcher 3), that you can shave in various bathroom mirrors.

- If you donâ€™t clean your suits/change your clothes, youâ€™ll actually start to smell and attract flies.

- You have to eat to manage your hunger.

- You have to sleep to manage your fatigue. This will advance time.

- Cars have to be refueled with gas, and long drives have to be weighed into account.

- side missions are time dependent, and can be entirely missed. This mechanic is similar to â€œdead risingâ€.

- The protagonist is actually well written, in a strange but endearing way. Intelligent, but deeply unhinged.

- the combat leaves a lot to be desired, and isnâ€™t worth talking about. The best parts of this game, are the most trivial parts in other games. 

Overall, I think the game design really shines here. I mean, itâ€™s truly unique and innovative. I think if a AAA game was designed like deadly premonition, itâ€™d be a GOTY contender. This isnâ€™t that - the game is really janky and fairly low budget. But the gameplay loop is so immersive and innovative, that itâ€™s still very much worth checking out.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045810638', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 1386, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 302, 'last_played': 1673111076}
review:
Definitely worth a buy on discount. It's like watching an awkward detective-thriller. You'll love to hate it at the least.
EDIT: Just finished the game. I can see the complaints about the bugs. The game is a souls-like in terms of bugs. "You'll bug a lot." Still, there are ways to solve that. Towards the ending it's gonna drag so much that you will feel tired. The story is like the best piece of meat you'll ever eat but you have to put it in a blender with the best drink you'll ever drink. Sounds cool in concept but it does not mix well. Nevertheless, it's so bad that it actually feels good. The game and the whole design of gameplay definitely felt like a labour of love. Good game! Big thanks to the developers! Right, Zach?

author: {'steamid': '76561198067449783', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1105, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 376, 'last_played': 1672985684}
review: This is most certainly a game i would recommend people to try, it has it's flaws with glitches and can be hard to get used to some of the game play mechanics but honestly it is worth the time. The story feels compelling and has plenty of foreshadowing in it, the map feels like you are actually in a small town with its size, there is a lot of attention to detail within the game world and plenty to miss if you just do the story alone. There is a lot that is strange about this game and it is inspired by David Lynch's Twin Peaks TV show, if you are able to get past some of the more annoying aspects such as not being able to zoom out on the map or occasional quick time events that take too long and the glitches then you will find that this game is really good and had a lot of love put into it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040933277', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 148, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 140, 'last_played': 1691973574}
review:
i played this game on switch, so please ignore the playtime. 

this is my favorite game. this is not my favorite pc port. the "deadly premonition experience" does not include jankiness and countless crashes, no matter how much history attempts to rewrite itself. the "deadly premonition experience" is playing this game for a few hours while laughing at how strange the cutscenes and voice acting can be. then something clicks. you can't tear yourself away from it. you're dreaming about greenvale and its citizens. you're not skipping the optional conversations and quests anymore. your viewpoint begins to shift. 

this is the best game ever made. but get it somewhere else.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042769643', 'num_games_owned': 773, 'num_reviews': 107, 'playtime_forever': 72, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 72, 'last_played': 1671797486}
review:
I immediately looked for patches before I played the game because of its reputation, but after installing the patches I am still running into bug after bug after unnecessary and incredulous bug. 

I install patches following the instructions.
The launcher opens, I click play.
Game crashes in black screen.

I verify my game cache and reinstall the mods and setting the game to windowed mode and setting exe's to run in windowed mode.
Game launches and I get a really awesome intro cutscene.
But once I get to the main menu, the start button won't work. 
I figure out that L2 = Start.
So now I've gotta check that my controller and DS4Windows work fine and of course they do, I was literally using them yesterday to play Calico, restart the game and now I realize that ALL of my buttons are scrambled for some reason??? Square = X, X = CIRCLE, you get the picture.


Why? Fix the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198122021976', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 2639, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2350, 'last_played': 1707275398}
review: Despite its bugs (of which there are many) this game ended up being one of my favorites of all time. The gameplay is maybe a 6 out of 10. The skeleton of the game however, is a 10/10, The story, characters, and setting are done to perfection. The game may not be for you however, as it's a bit unique. I'd recommend watching an episode or two of a let's play. If you like that, you'll be sure to love the rest of the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198857486670', 'num_games_owned': 814, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 355, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 287, 'last_played': 1688281968}
review:
If you haven't played Deadly Premonition before, don't make this PC port your first experience with it. 

Deadly Premonition is one of my favorite games of all time. It sucks to not want to recommend it. If you're already familiar with the game and don't mind digging for a seriously hefty amount of fan fixes and patches, you're more than welcome to give it a shot. I'm still trying to get it to run without crashing on my end.

author: {'steamid': '76561198082649849', 'num_games_owned': 3060, 'num_reviews': 256, 'playtime_forever': 278, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 278, 'last_played': 1448147951}
review:
[h1]
This game is a mess. It's infamous for being very buggy and somewhat cringy. Main pros behind this title might be its story that keeps the game rolling. Very specific atmosphere that remind of Resident Evil series, but with more focus put on dialogs and investigation part. However not much investigation is here except go here and there, check what's going on, occassionaly finding some items. Map in the game is semi open so you can access different places at a different time. Gameplay consists of driving a car, dialogs and a bit of shooting. Music and sounds however are well fit and create mysterious atmosphere also the voice acting is decent. If you can withstand frequent frame drops, constant bugs and heavy bloom effects you might enjoy it. Hardly to recommend but at least it's unique. I must say the game was kinda interesting to play.
[/h1]

author: {'steamid': '76561198199629335', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 2242, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9, 'last_played': 1671623135}
review:
!!!! RISOLTO CRASH INIZIALE !!!!

Avevo provato letteralmente DI TUTTO ma nulla, il gioco non voleva proprio partire dopo il launcher iniziale.
Ho seguito una guida qui su steam comprensiva di tutti i fix raccolti negli anni (una relativamente piÃ¹ recente, del 2016, dato che la guida omnicomprensiva del 2013 per me non aveva funzionato).
Il problema, per me su Win11, era che, oltre ad aggiornare/riparare PhyX come detto in tutte le guide, ho dovuto manualmente inserire nella root della cartella di gioco i .dll di PhyX "common", presi dalla cartella Nvidia.
Spero che questo ti faccia risparmiare qualche ora di ricerca e piÃ¹ o meno velate imprecazioni alla dea dei boschi che sono scappate a me durante il procedimento.

Deadly Premonition:
Del gioco che dire, Ã¨ legnoso e stucchevole nelle dinamiche in maniera imbarazzante ma se quello che state cercando Ã¨ una storia ricca, originale e, soprattutto, un'ATMOSFERA UNICA, qui certamente la troverete e non vi lascerÃ  piÃ¹ andare.

author: {'steamid': '76561198415838748', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1963, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 438, 'last_played': 1671555176}
review: BUYER BEWARE: this game locks you out at start if you dont have a controller, if you DO want to get in with a mouse you have to dig into its file folder, repair its startup and go directly to the dplauncher in that same folder to launch it; it will not launch from steam or desktop. If you successfully get in, its a laggy buggy mess and the FPS and camera controls are completely insane rendering it unplayable. to play it you are required to download the DPfix and patch it. The DPfix provides you with a code sheet that allows you to fiddle with the ACTUAL settings for the game (res/fps/etc) and youll have to fiddle with the settings until its playable. not to mention the constant crashes causing you to save as much as possible. the game, itself, is amazing and if youre like me, willing to put the work in to make it playable, thats great but it wasnt worth the 25$ to buy a broken game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198359329711', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 302, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 12, 'playtime_at_review': 99, 'last_played': 1710125988}
review: This game is a work of art, there is nothing subjective about it. From the brilliant atmosphere to wonderful and coherent script with game play that makes sense, I cannot recommend this game highly enough. The unskippable cutscenes are the most beautiful parts every time, truly adding to the wonderful experience that is Deadly Premonition. All the driving controls were fantastic, especially lifelike and accurate when I put on my siren and did whatever I wanted instead of following any actual road rules. I have already purchased for the highly coveted skateboarding mechanic as I was JUST thinking this game really needed a bit of Tony Hawks Pro Skater 2 to really amp it up. 100/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198145249478', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 3000, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3000, 'last_played': 1668562874}
review:
In all fairness, just about everything bad that you have heard about this game is true. And you absolutely will have technical issues running this on Windows 10 & 11. The game's extreme divisive reception is wholly earned, it's a hit or miss type of a deal...

Yet, in spite of its massive flaws, it managed to win me over like no other game has. If it clicks with you, it's a magical experience unlike any other, and will leave you like it left me, feeling turbulent emotions and being utterly touched to your core.

It's taking a risk, you might easily end up hating this game, and like I said, you will absolutely have issues of some kind (especially technical), but if there's a chance that it'll click with you as it clicked with me and many others, it's a chance you should take if you're even a bit curious. Especially if you get it on a steep sale (and with refunds being a thing), it won't hurt.

author: {'steamid': '76561198022632674', 'num_games_owned': 104, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 1585, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1585, 'last_played': 1668111344}
review:
SH!TTIEST PORT I HAVE EVER EXPERIENCED!

It's with a heavy heart that I cannot recommend this game because I really liked the story. But the constant crashes, no attempt to even have M+K, locked at 720p (unless you get a fan tweak) , and constant freezes there is no way I can recommend anyone pay any money for this. I got it for 2 bucks and I almost feel ripped off.  There was also a REALLY annoying bug where the left analog stick just quit responding and I had to reboot my computer to fix it. This happened EVERY time I played the game so if I had not come off a fresh reboot, I had to reboot the PC before launching the game. But even if the game ran perfectly on the PC, I do have other complaints about the game design.

1) This game seriously needed an editor. Some of the boring walking sequences went on for WAY too long. The car tail scene was obnoxiously long compounded by the godawful driving mechanics. I don't mind quick time events when used sparingly but if you are going to use them, don't have them go on forever FFS. That final sequence at the end where you are running down the stairs and you have to hit left and right on the analog stick for your character to run was so GD long I had to pause the game twice so my hand wouldn't cramp up. A lot of this stuff, obnoxious as it is, can be palatable in smaller portions. I guess they thought the runtime needed padding. It didn't. 

2) The game play was clearly phoned in. Maybe they ran out of time during development? but the shooting/aiming mechanics and repetitive enemies got old real quick. When you had to evade an attack, even if you evaded way too early it will still miss you. I get it was just the sloppy QTE implementation but it looked so damn goofy when York would roll to dodge an attack and the attack would come after he completed his dodge and still miss him. 

3) I know this seems to be a staple of Japanese games but I find it quite annoying when they refuse to VA lines that are not part of a cut scene. I seen them do this in the Yakuza games as well. I don't know if they are trying to save money on actors and if so quit being chinsey, you cheap fks. Especially a shame in this game because the voice acting was pretty damn good. 

In a time where 5 year old games are being re-made that have no business being remade, this one is a perfect candidate for it. The RE team at Capcom would be a nice choice. They could improve on the godawful game play mechanics and maybe spice up the puzzles a bit as they were pretty lame.  I actually really like the story and as flawed as a lot of the game design and mechanics are, I would recommend this game on PC if it weren't for the game breaking bugs.  Although I would be thrilled for more people to enjoy its quirky story and characters which has an obvious heavy influence from Twin Peaks, including the setting,  at this point you would be better off watching it on you tube.  Such a shame.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027435818', 'num_games_owned': 356, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 1316, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1316, 'last_played': 1667976452}
review:
An absolute, bonafied, cult classic unlike any other; ruined by an effortless PC Port.

Yes, play Deadly Premonition. No, for all that is good in the world, do not buy this version.

I beat the entire game through this port and I HAD TO use like 4 fan patches at once, windows compatability settings, and deal with an extremely buggy experience just to get by. Also, for some reason the aiming is totally messed up and I could not fix it, making some encounters either very difficult or downright impossible. 

Steam should not allow things like this on it's store.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048929771', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1573, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1573, 'last_played': 1657661510}
review:
Deadly Premonition has the charm and looks of the crackhead who lives down the street, whose mind has been so eroded by drug use over the years that they have developed a language all their own, and you can't understand a fucking word! 
The game follows the misadventures of Francis York Morgan, the best way to describe York -- yes, his friends call him agent York -- is to imagine what David Duchovny would be like if he had down syndrome and watched a lot of movies, yep there's your main character! 

This game also has side quests, I didn't complete them, because every time you step into a car, you suddenly turn into Nick Nolte. anyway, it's up to York and his amazing friends: Deputy floppy cans, Sheriff San Francisco on a Saturday night and Deputy Big gay L to solve the mystery of the raincoat killer.

I won't go into spoilers, but the ending will have you as disappointed as my parents
Have a great time!

author: {'steamid': '76561198003052030', 'num_games_owned': 689, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 3070, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2890, 'last_played': 1700847892}
review: There are tons of reasons to play Deadly Premonition - the story, the characters, the references to Twin Peaks. But even after the massive support from fans to reduce crashes, there are still so many unique game-breaking bugs that I cannot recommend this game. This game is held together with wishes and positive vibes. In the end, I think this game is best enjoyed via Lets' Play - you'll even get a bit of schadenfreude watching the players work around the crashes.

author: {'steamid': '76561198047474483', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 167, 'playtime_forever': 1013, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1013, 'last_played': 1650928018}
review:
"Deadly Premonition" deserves all the credit for being one the most crude, buggy, niche and sometimes downright unplayable games in existence: The bare bones "open-world"-mechanics and the driving sequences are atrocious, and this port is likely as bad as everyone claims (I encountered one game-breaking bug in the diner, but was able to solve this, thanks to the friendly community base). Furthermore the writing did not age that well by present standards, being somewhat chauvinistic and homo-/transphopic. 
So why bother? Because you will encounter nothing quite like this! It transcends the usual "so bad itÂ´s good" slur. The whole experience is so far out that you have to go through it all by yourself in order to proper understand it's bonkers appeal. A wierdly true and stylish detective-horror-mystery suprise, shamelessly dressed as the rotten egg it sometimes is!
Slaughter maniacs with wonky melee controls while listening to an exceptional cover of "Amazing Grace"? Check! Be the unshaved and dirty piece that you are if you don't change clothes and care for your hygiene? Check! Get chased by a hellhound that pops out of nowhere, while fleeing by car with bad physics? Check! Experience all this, while following the well written commentaries of the schizophenic main character that talks about cult-classic-films and punk rock all the time? Double check. 
I get it, if you don't want to get it. But I would love the see people trying this out if it's on sale!

review:
What a stellar story with some of the most janky gameplay trapped behind one of the worst and buggiest ports of all time. Do yourself a favour, fallow all the minimising crash guides, push through all the crashes and experience something special.
 
For me, after following the guides; running in windows 95 compatibility and launching the DP.exe straight from the folder rather than from steam gave me the most stable results.

Ademas, aunque la mÃºsica acompaÃ±a bastante bien en los momentos de tensiÃ³n, el resto de apartados son mediocres; los graficos, para ser un juego sacado a la venta en el 2010, parecen de la play 2 y el control deja mucho que desear. author: {'steamid': '76561198025861751', 'num_games_owned': 779, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 247, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 186, 'last_played': 1666475789}
review:
This is the most broken game I've ever put effort into playing.
First, you have to install a few fixes through mods (there are plenty of guides in the Steam Community).
Then, despite the fact playing with a controller is much better, the game will not recognize your controller. 
So you have to install community gamepad configs.
Even then, the game needs to be run as administrator or it won't work.
But then, the toolbox and inventory are very broken and you can't move items properly. So you have to run in compatibility mode (Win XP SP3) too.
And also it's a headache to run on fullscreen so I just play in windowed mode.
And, after all those tweaks, you may have to download some saved games because the game is known to have game-breaking bugs in at least two chapters.

The movement is janky, the graphics aren't very impressive for today's standards.
But.... I believe it's.... worth it?

Remember Twin Peaks? Everybody says this game is like Twin Peaks. Well, they are partially right. York could be a psychotic, socially awkward version of Cooper, cringeworthy in all his quirkyness, comparable to a high-school fanfic writer idea of an anti hero. Character reactions are stiff and weird (intentional or not, I have no idea), like Lynch's work turned up to eleven. The jankiness makes everything even more uncomfortable. It's a unusual case of "storytelling so bad it's amazing".

So, like, do you want to be weirded out? Do you believe an interesting game is worth more than a merely "good" game? Are you extremely patient? You don't mind spending some time reading modding guides? You might have found your halloween gaming experience. If you aren't sure about spending money in a broken mess, wait for a sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067513418', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 90, 'playtime_forever': 269, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 269, 'last_played': 1414627747}
review:
This is the most "Acquired Taste" game I have ever played. I never got very far before deciding it's not my cup of tea. 

The main character has a goofy charm to him, and the setting is interesting. I wanted to find it funny, but the games nuances didn't really do it for me. "F.K In The Coffee." I can see the humour, but I didn't laugh.

Still, the game is interesting because of how bizarre it is, but the terrible gameplay doesn't do it any favours.

The whistling main theme is excellent, and it compliments the bizarre tone. That is one of the most memorable aspects of this game.

Overally, I don't recommend it because it's a long game with bad gameplay. Why would you want to sit through that? Give it a watch on Youtube before investing. This game has a cult fanbase and you can definitely find a gem here if it appeals to you.

author: {'steamid': '76561197980472955', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 2136, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2136, 'last_played': 1665073431}
review:
I don't know if it's possible for any review of Deadly Premonition to do it justice, be it positive, negative or somewhere in the middle. For all the many games I've played, this stands out as oddly unique, with as much emphasis on the "oddly" as the "unique" part. 

Make no mistake though, if you decide to play this, go into it with the foreknowledge that it is an absolute technical mess. Even getting the game booted up can be an upheaval. I've crashed going from cut-scene to cut-scene. Early game my save file corrupted forcing me to use a save from elsewhere and making sure I backed my saves up manually frequently. I encountered numerous graphical bugs that took me a significant amount of time to believe I'd worked out what the problem was, only for it to still happen sporadically after taking avoiding actions. If there is a technical issue you can perceive, chances are DP has it and then some. 

Yet, the game is playable. It takes work, frustration and some trial and error, but at some point I just found myself laughing it off. Of course this quirky, charming, bizarre, baffling game would have this many issues. Of course it would. Is it worth it in the end? Probably. I'm not sure! The mechanics in-game are typically serviceable, but by the end they became second nature. The game needs to be taken as greater than the sum of its parts because realistically, many of the parts are not worth a thing. It comes together though in a kind of beautiful mess. 

This is a game where despite the abundance of characters they each stand out with their own personalities. Sure, the comparisons to Twin Peaks are numerous and essentially justified, but it stands on its own rather than simply in homage or reference to anything else. These characters make the world real because whilst they could easily be one-note, they can express other thoughts and feelings. I found myself invested in the stories of all these people because they made the town you're in immersive. 

The game's greatest strength is its writing. It's smarter than you may give it credit for. It's also hard to tell if it's winking at you when it's being funny, especially when it isn't supposed to be...you think, at least. When it wants to be tragic it manages it with few, if any, goofs undercutting the scene. It made me smile, gasp a couple of times, it really has it all. By the end, as much as I wanted to go back and complete side-quests I'd missed, I couldn't bring myself to do so. The story ends so conclusively that I was left wholly satisfied as to my experience with it. Will I play it again? I don't know! It's a hassle to play, with as much time spent in-game as out trying to find a fix for something or other, but the notion of spending more time in the world is alluring.

Deadly Premonition is a baffling game. The ambition and sincerity of the creators screams at you as loudly as the many shortfalls that surround this, but I honestly enjoyed my time with it warts and all. I don't think I'll be forgetting it in a hurry and that's not something I can say about many of the games I've played.

author: {'steamid': '76561198022941467', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 17, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 17, 'last_played': 1664684395}
review:
The game is VERY  poorly optimized.
  The controllers don't work on DirectInput (it will rapid fire ANY direction/button pressed, causing you to convulse while trying to take a step forward) , and XInput has the X and Y values for looking permanently switched. (press up and down to look left and right, and vice versa). 

 If you aren't using a controller, the mouse will auto-look back straight ahead non-stop, and keyboard is also wonky, with it randomly selecting buttons that aren't being pressed.


The FPS is horrible, and it stutters on the simplest movement.
Also, you have to be VERY specific where you are standing and looking to interact with objects, which makes it near impossible with the stuttering and mouse-auto looking ahead.  

I've asked for a refund, and am just gonna go back to the old Playstation version.

author: {'steamid': '76561198957921881', 'num_games_owned': 576, 'num_reviews': 394, 'playtime_forever': 1771, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 282, 'last_played': 1665564120}
review:
[h1] ğ”¸ğ•Ÿğ• ğ•¥ğ•™ğ•–ğ•£ "ğ•„ğ•€ğ•ğ”¼ğ”»" â„ğ•–ğ•§ğ•šğ•–ğ•¨ ğ• ğ•Ÿ ğ•’ ğ•˜ğ•’ğ•ğ•– ğ•¨ğ•šğ•¥ğ•™ ğ•’ğ•Ÿ ğ•’ğ•“ğ•¤ğ•¦ğ•£ğ•• ğ•”ğ•¦ğ•ğ•¥-ğ•—ğ• ğ•ğ•ğ• ğ•¨ğ•šğ•Ÿğ•˜... ğ”½ğ• ğ•£ ğ•¨ğ•™ğ•’ğ•¥? ğ•ğ•™ğ•  ğ•œğ•Ÿğ• ğ•¨ğ•¤! [/h1]

Welcome to Greenvale, Agent York. "Deadly Premonition" is a third-person, police-theme investigation oriented open world adventure game... You might have noticed all the genres it is classified within with a look at the game's shop interface, and you'd be aware by now that when a game claims that it does too many things all at once it just ultimately means that it's crap in all of them.  

You play as Agent York Francis, who works for the FBI and gets called to investigate a murder of a young woman in Greenvale, a secluded small village with close-minded townfolk. Right off the bat, you realize, as the player, that York isn't quite right in the head... Throughout the game, he's rumored to be a top-notch agent with so many solved cases to his name, yet he keeps mentioning and talking to this imaginary friend of his that he calls Zach. The game puts you in front of two mysteries; who killed Anna? And who the HECK is Zach?

On one hand, the game excels at being a Twin Peaks reference... The cast of characters are goofy and just spot-on, some gameplay mechanics are quite appealing, you can drive around town, meet new townfolk, do side missions for them to further the investigation, gather collectible cards, play throw darts, get a paintjob... Honestly, it's more than "L.A Noire", for example, could ever hope to accomplish. The voice-acting is quite nice and the nods to other movies and games don't seem forced at all... And although you kind of realize who the killer is right at the start, the mystery of the Raincoat killer is still present as York travels between the real world and an imaginary world that only exists in his own delusional mind. "To profile a killer, I have to inject myself into their mindset, their thinking process and even their shoes... somehow".

On the other hand!! OH MY GOD, I've BEEN RETRYING EPISODE 2 TO GET TWO CARDS FOR LIKE 7 TIMES AND EVERYTIME I REPLAY IT THERE'S A GLITCH THAT FORCES ME OUT OF THE GAME AND FORCES ME TO REPEAT CHAPTER 2 AGAIN... Holy cow, this game is buggy as hell! It's out there with the buggiest games of all time... In terms of bugs and glitches, think of it as "Assassin's Creed Unity" but ON FREAKING ROIDS... That's right! 1/8 times when you get into the menu, maybe York is hungry you want to eat a snack, the game crashes.... 2/4 times when you actually manage to get into the inventory, you'd experience the inventory bug that locks you in the inventory and you can't quit the interface... 3/6 times your car will get stuck and when you decide to leave it you fall into the map, which coincidentally takes you to Gamer Hell haha! 3/6 times when you're at the bar and look backwards, you'll get stuck!! People around you and the time will continue to move, but you can't... That's of course without mentioning the fact that the game runs at 10 fps if you've been running your PC for too long, and it forces you into a resolution you don't want, AND it forces you to use WASD for movement. 

The game is an actual mess; everything is completely and utterly wrong yet people will tell you that it's one of the best games they've ever played... It is simply because people love "Twin Peaks", and I'm one of those that would argue that this is a great game! To me, anything this goofy is worthy of praise despite its shortcomings. I'll give this game a score of [b]7/10[/b]... Its characters are very likeable, and York's cringe gives you motivation to solve this murder case with Zach's help. I recommend it to anyone willing to look past the glitches.

"Picking up where we left off! Zach, did you remember that 1986 movie called 'Aliens'... That lady had some pretty big melons... I wonder if one could have used them as pillows at some point"

author: {'steamid': '76561198214604785', 'num_games_owned': 431, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 606, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 602, 'last_played': 1691433622}
review: If you like twin peaks and silent hill you gonna love deadly premonition. But don't expect a high octane horror shooter game, at all, it's a investigation game with lots of weird and (semi-)dark humor. I love the Silent Hill franchise and i feel this game feels like a better sequel or maybe spin off than the oficial last sh games. If you see it at discount price, get it, more so if you like other investigation games like fahrenheit.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043024703', 'num_games_owned': 360, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1277, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1277, 'last_played': 1664040161}
review:
[h1]Deadly Premonition is a game quite like nothing else. The game looks like garbage, the gunplay is awful, the driving is physics-defying, and it's become one of my favourite games of all time. It's an incredibly bizarre journey through a seemingly ordinary murder investigation in the spirit of Twin Peaks that quickly takes a turn for the paranormal.[/h1]
On a technical note this port is a mess. It's incredibly unstable and the controls are awful if you're not using a controller and the game even required for me to install an external fix for it to even run. You should attempt to purchase this game on either Xbox or the Switch if possible. Consider this a review of the game's contents rather than its technical implementation.

The absolute highlight of the game has to be its characters. Everyone in the main cast is full of personality and the interactions between them are a joy to watch. Most of the side characters also fill these qualities, though not all of them. The main character, FBI special agent Francis York Morgan, everyone just calls him York, is the glue that holds these character interactions together. His dry humour and delivery, and his tendency to bleed obscure pop-culture knowledge into most conversations makes him a main character that's never boring to listen to and thatâ€™s never short on words.

The other big plus for the game is its story, which can at times feel nonsensical or even like a fever dream. The game definitely has some pacing issues with the story and feels quite rushed near the end, versus being very thin on actual content during the middle section. Ultimately though I found the story to be great fun and it managed to keep me interested in it for the entirety its time. The game takes place in rural America and follows the latest murder investigation in a series of murders across the States. From there the game incorporates the supernatural, detective work, slice of life, and a myriad of other aspects into the story.

The game also has a good soundtrack with a wide array of music for different occasions, and they are used liberally. This combined with the game's tendency to switch from suspension and surrealism to comedy or action multiple times during a single cutscene, unsurprisingly makes for some serious tonal whiplash in most cases where this happens.

If you're looking for a game with satisfying gameplay, rewarding side quests or impressive graphical fidelity, you're better off looking elsewhere. If on the other hand you're looking for a game in which the characters are charming and voice-acted fantastically, writing that will you make you laugh or maybe even shed a tear or two, and a story that is intriguing and full of mystery all the way from the beginning to the end, then Deadly Premonition is well worth your time.

[h1]Most of the game is a disaster, and I love it. If there was ever an argument made for video games being a form of art, then Deadly Premonition would be it.[/h1]

author: {'steamid': '76561198105785707', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 330, 'playtime_forever': 722, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 68, 'last_played': 1668121077}
review:
your average console game garbage. 5 minutes into the game I was shooting zombies in third person with a terribly clunky over-the-shoulder aim, and activating switches in a simplified labyrinth with PS1 graphics .
No Billy, it's not the bad port that makes the game bad, the game was never good Billy. You bought it because you wanted to justify the overpriced piece of hardware your parents bought you and this now defines your childhood.

I bought this game because I tought it might be an interesting quirky detective game with a cool twin peaks vibe. Think again....It's the same as all the japanese games. You're moving very awkwardly in a simplified labyrinth and shooting slow-moving zombies with the most annoying interface possible which is actually your main antagonist. Then endure a cutscene with nonsensical, dumb dialogues made by someone who has no idea how western people live but tries to be funny.

The japanese game industry is the septic tank of the american movie industry. If you look under the hood, there is a frail grinning man mixing a cauldron full of excrements made of recycled movies or TV shows into a non-sensical mess that'll be used  to sell overpriced consoles to fat weeaboos (it's you).

author: {'steamid': '76561199195471847', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 3300, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1462, 'last_played': 1698646774}
review: a genuine diamond in the rough but please get it with dpfix

author: {'steamid': '76561198108539769', 'num_games_owned': 917, 'num_reviews': 117, 'playtime_forever': 75, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 75, 'last_played': 1383545249}
review:
I love this game so much. It's such a wonderful hit of nostalgia, having grown up on games like this.

It's so weird and stupid, but still kind of freaky. The detective work is well done, the mystery is well written. I really can't say enough good things about this game, but you need to know what to expect when you go in or you'll hate it.

Be prepared for over the top cheese and general wtf-ness, but know that it's all worth it in the end.

review: If you can get it working then it's a wonderfully weird game. But I wouldn't bother trying and say get the Xbox 360 original for the most stable experience (even with the control scheme). If you play this version then expect constant crashes without being able to save anywhere and potentially save file corruption of which you only have one of so manual backups are annoyingly necessary.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043019089', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 2841, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2841, 'last_played': 1661950427}
review: Deadly Premonition ofrece una aventura de investigaciÃ³n sobre un crimen cometido en un pueblo. Si te gustÃ³ Twin Peaks, este juego te ofrece una historia de ese palo, con personajes interesantes, encontrar al asesino, una banda sonora muy buena y una ambientaciÃ³n perfecta. SÃ­, los grÃ¡ficos son dignos de hace 20 aÃ±os. Las animaciones son ortopÃ©dicas. El control del personaje mÃ¡s de lo mismo. Conducir el vehÃ­culo no es digno ni de play 1. Y el juego estÃ¡ plagado de errores y siendo posiblemente el peor port que te puedas encontrar. Con soluciones de la comunidad que tampoco lo dejan fino. Si aÃºn con todo eso eres capaz de seguir adelante, vas a experimentar una trama impresionante. Es una de las mejores historias que he jugado nunca.

author: {'steamid': '76561198099458236', 'num_games_owned': 1664, 'num_reviews': 128, 'playtime_forever': 2436, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2436, 'last_played': 1661383274}
review:
A fantastic and intriguing game full of character and charming idiosyncrasies that unfortunately received one of the most miserable PC ports I've had the (dis)pleasure to play. I would urge anyone reading this to buy literally any of the other versions if you want to experience the game without much hassle. But, if you insist on playing this version, later on in this review I'll describe what the setup that allowed me to 100% this game was.

I went in with what everyone has been saying about this game in mind: "low budget Twin Peaks". And even if that description is, though simplistic, accurate, Deadly Premonition has a lot more going on that instantly charmed me and made me endure the awfulness of the PC version. 

I adore games with detailed worlds to explore and interact with; DP tries it's best to do that, and while not all of the resulting material is necessarily of good quality, it is that jankiness, perhaps involuntary, that made me absolutely adore Greenvale, it's inhabitants, and the story that unfolded there. The story is very entertaining to follow, and it certainly succeeded in drawing me in and eventually leading me to 100% the game. Of course, it is far from perfect, and it's shortcomings can be evident. I found it quite funny that the disconnect between what the script was trying to describe and how it actually looked rendered on screen was massive...certainly you don't need ultra realistic graphics to get a scene across, but when what you're offered are oversaturated PS2-like graphics with character models sporting incredibly awkward body and facial animations, some of the credibility is lost. Still, that's something I found oddly enticing, but perhaps for the wrong reasons. The story touches on a lot of interesting themes and tries to depict them in a serious way, and once again, sometimes it succeeds, and sometimes it fails.

Funnily enough, the game part itself is the thing I enjoyed the least about DP. Gameplay wise, the game tries to balance being realistic while still being very game-like. Not sure what the developer's were trying to accomplish here, but the end result can be very tiring at times, as it is stuck in the middle ground between both. 

I would've loved for the investigation portion to be like proper investigation, as in, going around, gathering clues, questioning people, and you having to put all the pieces together. The way it actually plays is very scripted, mostly taking the point A to point B approach where there is little for you to actually do. On the first chapters of the game, you'll spend a lot of time driving around, going from here to there, and while it can be great to know how to move around the town, it will soon become a boring endeavor. Getting the item that allows you to teleport around is essential, but even then you still have to go to all of those places first so they register. You also have a sleep and a hunger meter, which, given how the rest of the game plays, feels like it only gets in the way, unfortunately. The third person shooter segments are not very fun and this isn't helped at all by the slipperiest aim controls I've tried in a game yet. This makes those portions hard at times, not so much because the game is difficult on its own. 

As for the rest of the game, the audiovisual presentation is certainly a strong point for me, Yes, I know I complained about it just a moment ago but, when it's not embarrassing itself, it really accomplishes the task of setting the mood and portraying a lot of the imagery required for the narrative in a very competent way. I feel like the jankiness enhances some of the moments of the story, as I can only imagine disaster if more realistic graphics were paired with some of the less serious scenes of the story. I think it will click instantly with some people, but others will simply see the result of a low budget. 

All in all, it is an experience that I enjoyed a lot from beginning to end, though it is certainly not for everyone, and specially not this version. Though flawed, the portrayal of a small American town seen through the eyes of a movie crazy japanese game director is certainly one of the most unique I've had the pleasure to experience, and I'd recommend everyone feeling intrigued by the game's concept to give it a try. 

If you do decide to try this PC port, here's what I did to minimize crashes and make the game as playable as possible:

-Install all the files listed on the "Essential Improvements" section in the PCGamingWiki article for the game. DPfix is basically obligatory. I also recommend installing SweetFX to make the game easy on your eyes. Also obligatory is to modify the game's executable to skip the intro logos, given how often the game can crash. That is also listed on the PCGW article.
-Patch the game's executable using NTCore's 4GB patch. 
-Use borderless or true windowed mode. This can be set in the DPFix config file, and it should be pretty self explanatory.
-Set both the launcher and the game's main executable to run as admin and in Windows XP Service Pack 3 compatibility mode. Unfortunately this has the side effect of making aiming weird. Removing the compatibility setting reverses this, but you'd be loosing some stability, though crashes were rare with the rest of the fixes I've listed before. 
-Save as often as you can and backup your save regularly. A lot of people talk about save corruption issues, and while I certainly never experienced it, why risk it? Saving often helps to avoid loosing too much progress to crashes.
-Disable Steam overlay in game

Have fun!

review:
I really want to play this game again, but this port is effectively broken - even with fan patches and fixes I still get unexplainable save game corruptions that prevent me from enjoying the game with my story rather than downloading generic saves to get through the blockers.

The publisher that continues to make money off this without maintaining it should be ashamed. I'm going to go back and play the version on my X360 just to get through the story and be able to enjoy the side quests in the order that I choose to.

Don't pay money for this, don't even try to find a 'free' version .. watch a playthrough/analysis on YouTube if it remotely interests you or get a copy on the X360 (from what I've seen online the PS3 and Switch ports are just as embarrassingly bad if not as technically broken).

review:
Dropeado.
Uno de los peores port que he visto en mi vida desde que juego en pc.

El juego? Entretenido, random, y curioso cuanto menos, pero no lo recomiendo porque los devs se han preocupado poco casi nada en hacer el port, por suerte compre esta mierda en oferta estando casi regalada.

- ConfiguraciÃ³n de controles hecha por y para subnormales.
- Optimizacion como tal no existe, en algunas zonas los fps se van a la mierda por mas que cumplas con los requisitos recomendados.
- A partir del EP 2 capitulo 9 el juego comienza a tener crasheos antes, durante y despuÃ©s de las cinematicas... y aviso para quien no sepa que no hay guardado desde el menÃº, solo se puede desde los telefonos, y que tampoco es que los veras cada 2 pasos. Hay soluciÃ³n para esto? 
a) Al poner los exe del juego con compatibilidad con w98 no me ha vuelto a crashear, pero el juego como mÃ¡ximo me iba a 30 fps. Y por lo visto y leÃ­do no le funciona a todos.
b) Supuestamente hay un parche de la comunidad super milagroso que... mis huevos, con parche el juego se crashea igual.

author: {'steamid': '76561198242643184', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 1473, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1473, 'last_played': 1659732270}
review:
[b]As one of the 6% who actually finished this game (according to steam achievements)[/b]
You need to know what youâ€™re buying; this game is Deadly premonition a cult classic from 2009 (I assume), a 2013 port to PC.
But this port, the Steam port is very flawed, you crash in the middle of the game and corrupts your save file so this product alone is unplayable to a certain extent and not worth itâ€™s price of 24,99 USD.

Fortunately, you can actually play this game to its entirety and it will test your patience and you will have to save every time you can because the game crashes in unpredictable moments.
You will require 3 things to play this game, a fix, patience and a save file that isnâ€™t corrupted. 
The fix: https://community.pcgamingwiki.com/files/file/896-dpfix095zip/
I wonâ€™t give you a save file, but you can find one online.

The actual game, the gameplay is okay, nothing too complex nothing too impressive for a dated game, I played it on mouse and keyboard.
The story is the only reason I bought this game, I never saw anyone beat it on youtube, itâ€™s enjoyable an original and interest concept for an idea.
The game really tricks you a lot of time, and before you think anything, this is more of a drama comedy game than a horror one since itâ€™s very cheesy.

If you actually want to buy this game, good luck and enjoy!

En rÃ©sumÃ©, un jeu Ã  Ã©viter, car la plupart d'entre vous ne parviendrez pas Ã  l'utiliser correctement.

author: {'steamid': '76561198272924179', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 1416, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1416, 'last_played': 1657151788}
review:
So I guess I was blessed by the glory of our memelord and savior Francis York Morgan since I was able to play the game through and through with no extreme crashes whatsoever.
I did install DPFix as instructed in other guides here and did experience some instances where the game closes itself, but nothing a quick reboot wouldn't fix.
In any case it was all worth it. This game, once you get into it, is actually genius.

author: {'steamid': '76561198267221584', 'num_games_owned': 294, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 243, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 243, 'last_played': 1658067158}
review: Me encanta el concepto, el humor y el desarrollo de los personajes con lo que pude llegar a avanzar, pero la verdad que el port en Steam es injugable y no lo recomiendo por eso, le descargue todos los fix que pude encontrar y hasta me descargue los saves de los capÃ­tulos a ver si podÃ­a al menos ir jugando capÃ­tulos salteados. Llegue hasta el episodio 4 ya que salte el 3 porque al final se cerraba solo, Pero a partir del episodio 5 tambiÃ©n termina ocasionando errores o borrando los avances, asÃ­ que ya me hincho las pelotas y prefiero quedarme con las ganas de jugarlo. Solo se puede jugar en consola o si tenes suerte y se le canta andar.

author: {'steamid': '76561197986480861', 'num_games_owned': 4281, 'num_reviews': 197, 'playtime_forever': 129, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 129, 'last_played': 1429805665}
review:
One of the best games in history sabotaged by a very poor budget and a disastrous port to PC.
What can I say about a game that opens with a car accident due to a phone call discussing whether Tom & Jerry are in a sadomasochistic relationship and that gets even weirder from there?
It needs mods, fixes and a lot of patience but it's still an unforgettable once-in-a-lifetime experience, right Zach?

author: {'steamid': '76561198402018262', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 1513, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1513, 'last_played': 1626895582}
review:
[h1] Just call me York, that's what everyone calls me. [/h1]

You'll either love this game or hate it. There is seriously no inbetween. It really depends on your primary expectations from a video game and the things that you're willing to turn your eyes away from. Albeit the story constructs itself around an eerie murder mystery and a bunch of tiny bizarre events and personas, the game does not treat itself that seriously so, at times, neither should you. It's not going to be the most no-nonsense experience, I assure you. You might spot so many details that don't make any sense about the world of this game or the characters that you build a companionship with. Normally, even the awfully odd character designs would be a tip off for me but I won't lie, this game somehow got me hooked after an hour or so. Having played yet another Hidetaka Suehiro murder mystery game beforehand, which was Dark Dreams Don't Die, I figured this experience was probably going to be similarly weird and captivating, so I got even more intrigued. The story has a few holes and some bad apple cliches that honestly spoil the game's complete potential. The mechanics and the interface, and the logic behind them are beyond me as a player and possibly the most impractical I've ever seen. The port itself is a complete wreck and I doubt you'll be able to get this game to work on your first try without editing some files and yada yada yada... I guess the roasting has to end at some point, so I want to say that I'd recommend this game regardless of its shortcomings and poorly designed mechanics because it. Is. Such a thrilling experience. With all of its cinematographical allure, insanely well-written characters and a solid, tempting story, it's just as easy to completely overlook the errors. Ignoring all of its mechanical problems and tiny plot holes here and there, it tells a really capturing 'whodunit' tale that might even stay with you for a while after completion since the tension keeps rising up and down throughout the game. It's a roller coaster, but in the best way possible! Assuming you were victorious in your efforts to get this god-awful port to work properly, (you are one of the selected few) I'd definitely urge you to give this bizarre little game a chance and I hope you enjoy it and cringe along as much as I did. Happy gaming!

author: {'steamid': '76561198119683275', 'num_games_owned': 543, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 1300, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1300, 'last_played': 1657251443}
review: Having just beaten the game I feel like I can finally give this thing a fair review. First of all, it was a NIGHTMARE getting this thing to run. After a lot of trial and error, I had to use these fixes (https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1957819200) and run the game in windowed mode. Proper windowed mode too, not borderless windowed mode. After finally being able to play for more than about an hour at a time the ball got rolling more smoothly. Overall the story was interesting but the combat was...not so much. I started just ignoring as many enemies as possible about halfway through the game and ignoring combat-related side-missions because they were boring. Still, if you can make it through that, the game is certainly...an experience to be sure. Hard to say just good or bad, but know you're in for some jank and some laughs.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994020145', 'num_games_owned': 1583, 'num_reviews': 82, 'playtime_forever': 2119, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1221, 'last_played': 1658260137}
review:
Deadly Premonition is about as close as someone can get to "Twin Peaks: The Video Game" without outright infringing on a copyright. Most reviews are going to mention this fact, and that's because there was no attempt to be subtle about what inspired the game. Many people often place this game into the same "it's so bad, it's good!" box as The Room, but I genuinely believe this game is more than that. The narrative is truly entertaining to watch play out. The writing for every character makes cutscenes a treat to watch. Sidequest dialogue helps further flesh out characters. The soundtrack, albeit limited, adds a lot of charm to the world, including the overly compressed, poorly mixed racing music. Characters are on a schedule, meaning you see them working their jobs, driving around, at their homes, or at bars; something that helps make things feel alive. And while some areas of the game are visually a disaster (because it's a terrible port and was supposed to be a PS2 game with a different name), it's obvious the team really cared about this project.

Now, for as much praise I can give this game, I could also make a giant list with much more talking about what's wrong with the port of this game, but I'll keep it short: Deadly Premonition is one of the worst PC ports on the market. Those low-effort Games for Windows Live ports from over a decade ago don't hold a candle to this. It's impressive how broken this port is and how much people have done to try and get it working so others can enjoy this wonderful game.

Signing up to play the PC port of Deadly Premonition is a lesson in patience. You might as well bookmark PCGamingWiki or one of the numerous Steam troubleshooting guides for this game. It will require you to mess with compatibility settings in-between missions because the game randomly decides to crash while running on your OS, but not when running in compatibility mode for Windows XP or 98. You will need to patch the EXE to increase its memory usage. You will likely need a community profile from the Steam input menu to fix the camera going up or down if you move the analog left or right and vice versa. And you will have to install DPfix, which is basically a mod that tries to fix as much of this game as possible to stop it from crashing every five minutes. And if all of that wasn't ridiculous enough, sometimes you will need to switch to windowed mode because a crash related to a specific thing only happens when in fullscreen. If you don't want to deal with how busted this port is, you have the option of emulating the PS3 or Switch version. It's hilarious and feels almost on-brand that people can run emulated versions of this game with little to no problems.

Everything aside, Deadly Premonition is often on sale for dirt cheap, and even if it's not on sale when you decide to check it out, it is worth every penny. Whether painstakingly getting this port to work or emulating it, everyone owes it to themselves to experience this game at least once.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009106252', 'num_games_owned': 329, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 1258, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1258, 'last_played': 1656512664}
review:
[h1] A game best described with the saying 
"An ugly face only a mother could love" [/h1]

[u] Pre-requisites to playing this game [/u]
1. An open mind
2. A strong sense of patience
3. A love for B-Movie and B-movie tropes
4. A particular taste for good biscuits and coffee

[u] Why it's good [/u]
- The plot is amazing
- The characters are fantastic
- Nothing makes sense
- The spooky atmosphere is always present

 [u] Why it's bad [/u]
- Combat is crap
- Game is clunky
- Hell lot of bugs (fixable)

[u] In conclusion[/u]

Deadly Premonition is understandably known as a cult classic in the video game world due to its bad but good aspect.
If you can go through the head-scratch inducing, confusion of the first act. You will greatly appreciate the charm that this small game can offer.

[b] Totally recommended 10/10 [/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561198097365246', 'num_games_owned': 263, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 95, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 95, 'last_played': 1656453914}
review:
i don't write reviews usually, so just the fact that I'm going through the hassle of doing one for this porting should give you a hint on how much outraged I am.

This is, by far, the worst pc porting of all time. Literally NOTHING works.

When you open it for the first time, you are welcomed with a window with a small art of the game and the settings, in the style of 2000 games. That is the first red flag you get aside from the "mixed" reviews on Steam.
When you press "play", the game will just crash instead of starting, because apparently you need to give the .exe admin permissions (lol). 
Even after that:
-The game doesn't adequately support controllers: I have a wireless one, if it turns off during a cutscene, the game won't pick it up when I turn it on again
-The maximum resolution is 720p
-Audio is completely fucked up if you have 5.1 or 7.1 surround
-You cannot change control inputs from inside the game, you have to exit and restart to do so
-The game randomly crashes
-Full of bugs
-If you alt-tab it literally freezes the screen
-If you start it from the steam library it freezes steam and sometimes make it crash

This porting is a glorious dumpster fire. Don't even bother buying it on sale.

I ended up uninstalling it because it was ruining the whole gaming experience. I had to buy it again on Nintendo Switch.

author: {'steamid': '76561198017986736', 'num_games_owned': 2317, 'num_reviews': 71, 'playtime_forever': 89, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11, 'last_played': 1656145141}
review:
Drakengard is a weird thing to exist, man.

The gameplay is terrible. The music is terrible. The characters are terrible and terribly written, as is the plot. By all accounts the game should have nothing going for it whether youâ€™re a pure gamer or after some kind of story-telling experience.

But people donâ€™t remember Drakengard for what it wasnâ€™t, that being good; people remember Drakengard for what it was, that being COMPLETELY INSANE.

Everyone in Drakengard is a dick. EVERYONE. You play as a mass murderer psychically linked with a misanthropic dragon. Your sisterâ€™s a passive waif and your best friendâ€™s a moron who trades away his singing voice for his own dragon from a 6-year-old little girl who is actually possessed by a god. You hang out with a cannibal, a pedophile, an immortal runt, and an alarmingly racist member of the clergy. By the end of it youâ€™ve racked up about as many kills as the sum of the first world war SINGLE-HANDEDLY, so much so that the evil empire canâ€™t even one up you by inventing nuclear weapons (which they do) and drop them (which they do) from their flying continental fortress (which they have) before they summon pan-dimensional space babies (which exist) to kill everyone (which they accomplish).

The final battle has you hurling an alien deity through a rip in the fabric of space time to engage them in a rhythm battle over a monochromatic Tokyo, after which you get shot down by the Japanese air force and proceed to infect the entire world (our world) with magical aids that either kills you or turns you into a bloodthirsty salt giant. Yes, really.

Drakengard is a terrible game, but it is nonetheless a compellingly bizarre thing to exist.

author: {'steamid': '76561199070032022', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 33, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 33, 'last_played': 1655950916}
review:
What the FUCK is this game? 

If you use a controller the aiming control axis are switched around and are all reversed and it can't be changed making using a controller utterly impossible. Trust me, you don't want to try. It took me like two god damn minutes to get this god awful control scheme to hone in on the first enemy in the game and it is BAD.

The animations are terrible and spastic. There are moments where there are absolutely no facial animations at all during what are supposed to be emotional scenes.

The voice acting is terrible, i'm talking pulling people in off the street terrible.

The audio is pretty bad.

The graphics are terrible even by mid 2000s standards and there isn't a single option for the graphics in the game as well.

There are random sounds that make absolutely no sense such as squirrels screaming like chimpanzees in a cut scene at the very start of the game.

But hey at least it hasn't crashed on me!... Yet.

How in the FUCK did this game get approved to be on consoles and or release to begin with? It is legitimately already looking like one of the worst made games I have ever played and yet I WANT to see why people love it but I am too tired and too sober to play this shit sandwich anymore tonight, i'll update this review if and when I pick it back up and play through it. If it will even work when I try to load it again that is.

author: {'steamid': '76561198400140639', 'num_games_owned': 393, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 1213, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1192, 'last_played': 1655709129}
review: First off, this game is buggy and you will have issues with it. And it will crash. But if you persevere through the bugs and issues, you will find one of the most unique, beautiful and sad games. This game blew my mind and I could not put it down. Please play this game, even if it's on console (which is where the better ports are at).

author: {'steamid': '76561198097034743', 'num_games_owned': 1073, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 2150, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2150, 'last_played': 1654079931}
review:
Now this is a good game. I've never played a game this good. I am very particular about games I'll have you know. The balance of glitches/bugs and entertainment you've achieved here... oh my... 

This is the best worst game I've ever played. It's a buggy mess but it's worth suffering through it for just how wild everything else is. It gets annoying sometimes but all of the characters are memorable and interesting. Especially Mr. Francis York Morgan and his schizophrenia. What do you think Zach?

author: {'steamid': '76561198182525366', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 664, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 661, 'last_played': 1672956086}
review:
SÃ­, recomiendo Deadly Premonition: The Director's Cut, la versiÃ³n de PC. SÃ­ estÃ¡ rota, pero es la que posee el mejor framerate de entre todas las versiones, sobre todo si la comparamos con la de PS3, la cuÃ¡l es horrible y hasta el dÃ­a de hoy siento los mareos que me dieron esos tremendos bajones. Existen numerosos parches creados por la comunidad que harÃ¡n que este juego funcione mejor.

Ahora, hablando de la obra en sÃ­ misma, es un juego que estÃ¡ fuertemente inspirado en Twin Peaks, una de mis series favoritas, y la cantidad de referencias a esta me hace lucir una sonrisa muy a menudo, pero este juego no es una copia descarada al trabajo de David Lynch, puesto que posee una enorme cantidad de elementos que lo vuelven un trabajo Ãºnico en su clase, si estÃ¡s dispuesto a lidiar con las animaciones tan extraÃ±as que tiene junto con el atroz diseÃ±o de sonido.

Su precio me parece muy razonable para lo que es: un paquete bastante grande que ha sobrevivido al borde de la cancelaciÃ³n hasta el momento de su lanzamiento, asÃ­ que no hay pierde.

Sin mÃ¡s que decir, adelante, Zach. Ha llegado el momento de resolver el misterio que se oculta en las profundidades de este tÃ­tulo. Â¡Bienvenido a Greenvale!

author: {'steamid': '76561197998943919', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1459, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1459, 'last_played': 1387128313}
review: Filmed in 1978. Produced, directed, written and edited by John De Bello. It was really awful but for some reason I still remember it pretty well. It had so many sequels and the original was re-released in 95. 87 minute long theatrical release, bumped up to a whopping 90 minutes! But that was around the time I joined the bureau. I never had a chance to see it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198022020298', 'num_games_owned': 419, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 521, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 462, 'last_played': 1655337528}
review: As much as I love this game, and think that this is a experience that everyone that is really into video games should give a try at least once, I can't for the life of me recommend this abhorrent port. Constant crashes, framerate issues, sometimes it simply decides not to open at all (I had to full format my pc to get it to work again this time), among many, MANY other issues. Do yourself a favor and play the x360/ps3 version, but please don't play this laughable attempt at a port.

author: {'steamid': '76561198450290554', 'num_games_owned': 1275, 'num_reviews': 135, 'playtime_forever': 13, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8, 'last_played': 1654403243}
review:
I am unable to move the protagonist from his place. I enter the menu and, at the slightest touch, the inventory scan shoots out uncontrollably. I exit the menu and I still can't move the character, who wobbles at the start as if he was groggy. All this while the game runs at 14fps on a computer capable of running modern titles like silk.

There are old games with clunky controls that I love. There are also indies and austere games that I love, and even poor games. But this is not even a broken game. I cannot control the character and having searched for a FIX that supposedly solves these details has not helped.

Please try to play it on Xbox360 or PS3. Right now I'm looking for a way to refund the game. I think I'll have to watch its gameplay on YouTube to find out why it's so popular.

author: {'steamid': '76561198071567735', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 102, 'playtime_forever': 871, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 871, 'last_played': 1654383421}
review:
I understand some people say this game is unique on its own and is a parody of horror games. Barely anything was hilarious in this game tbh. It was interesting but not worth playing through.

Pros:
-Unique gameplay and story. Character too. Really weird.
-Lots of characters to check out. Some interesting ones here and there.
-Gameplay is just passable.
-Puzzles are just okay. Easy to figure out.
-Animations are a bit funky and character expressions are hilarious.

Cons:
-Enemies can just shoot you even while staggered and the gun isn't pointed at you. Real dumb.
-Most likely Windows 10 issue but performance along with bugs makes this game a huge pain. Need to apply patches and stuff to make it playable. And there are still crashes.
-Make sure to limit the game to 60fps. Animations and missions get kinda screwed if you don't.

Game constantly had crashes so I stopped playing now. Decided to just check out a full playthrough on youtube instead...

author: {'steamid': '76561198444229048', 'num_games_owned': 123, 'num_reviews': 122, 'playtime_forever': 1746, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1746, 'last_played': 1653908854}
review:
Zach, Â¿CÃ³mo hago para recomendar este juegazo?

No puedo, simplemente no puedo. Se me crasheo muchas veces, tuve que recurrir a reiniciar la Pc a cada rato,  guardar constantemente y recurrir a la "soluciÃ³n" de poner al personaje a fumar antes del momento que el juego crasheara y aÃºn asÃ­ tuve que perderme la mitad de dos capÃ­tulos y usar archivos de guardado de otros jugadores ya que era imposible avanzar sin eso. Tuve que prescindir de las misiones secundarias y solo enfocarme en la historia principal...

Y luego pasa que la historia de este juego es demasiado buena y prÃ¡cticamente carrea todo el juego. No quiero hacer spoiler, por ende dirÃ© que el juego presenta una excelente historia de terror, misterio y hasta momentos de humor te mete por ahÃ­. Le sienta muy bien la influencia de la gran serie Twin Peaks.

Okay dejamos eso de lado. Pero es que el gameplay del juego es mediocre, pero por algÃºn motivo te acostumbras y lo empiezas a disfrutar.  Luego vienen mas problemas tÃ©cnicos, los malos grÃ¡ficos, la pobre optimizaciÃ³n, los problemas con los efectos sonoros. Y con todo eso, de alguna manera le vas encontrando un encanto al juego aÃºn con todos estos defectos.

Es que creo que soy masoquista porque pese a todo esto disfrute demasiado del juego, de su historia, sus personajes, su terror, su humor, su mÃºsica, hasta de su gameplay... En conclusiÃ³n un juego tan de culto, tan de autor como este, con un montÃ³n de defectos que harÃ¡n que mas de alguno no quiera seguir jugando, no me es posible recomendarlo... Â¿O quizÃ¡s si? Â¿QuÃ© opinas Zach?
