author: {'steamid': '76561198016954277', 'num_games_owned': 401, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 2756, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1622, 'last_played': 1660399954}
review:
At first, the DP PC port's technical issues made me :(
but after hours of troubleshooting, I discovered how to make this port "stable" in "4" "easy" steps. I haven't had any crashes or instability in a while :)

[h1]0) This should come pre-installed with the game at this point[/h1]
Download DPfix by Durante and install in the Deadly Premonition folder, we are never launching this through steam. DPfix.ini is the only way to have graphics options

[h1]1) Compatibility mode[/h1]
Before playing the game, set DP.exe and DPlauncher.exe to run as administrator. Check if the game can launch.
If no; set DPfix.ini to have the game run windowed (not fullscreen or borderless windowed). Check if the game can launch
If no; launch DP.exe directly
If no; set both DP.exe and DPlauncher.exe in compatibility mode for: Windows 8 -> 7 -> XP (breaks aiming, toggle lock-on to fix) -> 98/ME (sets the game to run on 1 core, how exciting!), try launching both from the launcher and DP.exe directly
If still no; it ends here, I'm sorry.

[h1]2) This game crashes when it uses >2GB of RAM[/h1]
Download CFF Explorer, part of the Explorer Suite by NTcore.
Make a copy of DP.exe and save for backup. Open the original DP.exe in CFF Explorer.
On the left side; click File Header
Right side; click "Click Here" in the Characteristics row. In the pop-up window, tick "This app can handle >2gb address space"
Close the pop-up, then click File > Save.

[b]This fixes a vast majority of crashes relating to cutscenes and scene transitions[/b]

[h1]3) Controls[/h1]
If you play on KB+M, attempt to play the game! If not:

[h1]3 - Prefix)[/h1]
Deadly Premonition's PC port reversed the X and Y axis on its controller support. Meaning that up/down = left/right respectively. It's really awesome and in the spirit of the game's programming typos, since Coffee (Black) costs 31.50 while Coffee (Milk) costs 13.50

[h1]3 - 0)[/h1]
Steam -> Settings -> Controller -> General Controller Settings
Tick "Xbox Configuration Support"

DPlauncher.exe -> Setting -> tick "Controller". Map your controls here as well when done setting up

[h1]3a) Xbox controllers:[/h1]
I have not found a remapper yet that lets you *remap analog directions*, only ones that let you invert controls or swap L/R stick functions

launch DP.exe and open steam overlay, then click Controller Configuration.

Search for the "Deadly Premonition Controller+" config by theraineydaze
Unfortunately, it turns the right analog stick into a binary input, so it's either no input or maximum input. But you get used to it :)

[h1]3b) DS4/5 controllers:[/h1]
Download DS4windows and make a new profile emulating a 360 controller
Bind right analog stick to:
Up = Left (-X)
Down = Right (+X)
Left = Up (-Y)
Right = Down (+Y)

Save and make sure DS4windows is running (it says "Stop" in the lower right of the window if it is)

Open the windows control panel -> Hardware and Sound -> Devices and Printers -> Right click a controller and click "Game Controller Settings" -> Advanced -> Set "Preferred Device" to the 360 controller

You can use a steam preset still if you want, but this way lets you have full right stick analog control

[h1]4) Cut your CPU in half*[/h1]
[b]Disable hyperthreading / simultaneous multithreading (SMT) in your BIOS.[/b]
Look up the steps how to do so for your motherboard.

Deadly Premonition does NOT know how to handle threading at all and a HUGE amount of glitches result from this, such as falling through the world while drving, having the world stop loading, randomly freezing and hard crashing your PC, etc.
Essentially, the PC port likes to bit-flip [i]its self[/i]

Also disable steam overlay after setting up your controller if applicable. This game is held together with wishes and prayers, any amount of potential instability should be avoided.

*disabling Hyperthreading/SMT does not actually cut your CPU in half. Recommended to disable this feature anyway both due to a potential exploit using your CPU cache when it's enabled, and for stability with a lot of x32/x84 applications and running things like BlueStacks

[h1]Screeching Cars[/h1]
There's severe incompatibilities with any audio set up besides Stereo and Windows' default audio driver.
If you have screeching cars, blown out audio coming from different speakers, and/or constant footsteps behind you, try:

1) Set Windows audio to stereo

2) Disable any non-windows audio software (such as a virtual audio cable, or motherboard specific programs like Sonic Studio with Asus)

3) Unplug your extra speakers, if applicable.

4) Restart your PC if still not fixed.

5) Reinstall Deadly Premonition as a last resort.

[h1]Do I actually recommend the PC port when you have to do this?[/h1]
No.
These steps don't even fix all the bcrashes. You still need to smoke a cigarette after interrogating Nick to avoid crashing when leaving the diner (save before talking to Olivia), and there's still some random crashes like going to the graveyard at certain times of day (?). But there's no more runtime errors, so it makes the game [i]playable[/i]

edit: forgot to actually review the game. It's a very uncanny, light hearted, "Horror" game, with a protagonist that is equally full of "Facts and Logic" as he is "Insanity," in a world that can't take its self seriously. A murder scene gets upstaged by "Life is Beautiful", and York recalling the case where a guy used human skulls as cups is immediately overshadowed by the fact he's comparing this to shoplifting and bar brawls.

The PC port, all things considered, also has the best audio mixing. For example, the 360 version has no directional audio, only left and right.

If you're a fan of Twin Peaks, you are probably going to find things to enjoy here. It's also very reminiscent of "Mizurna Falls" for the PSX if you're a fan of obscure Japan-only games, just in a post-RE4 world.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994276660', 'num_games_owned': 902, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 1194, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1194, 'last_played': 1651438928}
review:
The state of this port is an absolute disgrace. The game itself is quite good but beware of the technical issues, it took me about eight hours to just get the game running and when I got it working the game would crash a lot and have other issues, I wouldn't recommend it. 

If anyone is actually going to suffer through it, if you have any issue after you get it running, such as crashes or quests not starting, restart your PC. Usually restarting your PC is the last resort of technical issues with a game for me but almost all issues with this was fixed for me by restarting my PC.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013194190', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 1936, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 359, 'last_played': 1652553866}
review:
tl;dr: This game makes any EA launch title look like the Mona Lisa.

Remember in Metal Gear Solid when the game deliberately starts to glitch out and act like you just bricked your console? This game feels exactly like that from start to finish. 

Sometimes I can't tell if the game is bugging out on me or if it's part of the cryptic environment it's trying to portray. A few examples:

[list]
[*]Are the colors intentionally washing out on my screen or is it the stamina mechanic telling me I need to stop to catch my breath? 
[*]Why is this joyful tune that sounds like taken out of a Blue's Clues episode playing while I'm in a morgue investigating a murder victim? -- Did I leave YouTube open in the background again?
[*]Did that enemy just just clip through the floor and sent my car flying like a rocket or is it one of its offensive abilities?[/list] 

The game clearly draws a lot of inspiration from Twin Peaks; Not just in an Alan Wake type of inspiration, but literally copy/pasting some of the peculiar characters that made Twin Peaks so great. I.e. The oddball FBI agent with a fascination for coffee? Check. The shy and clumsy police officer? Check. The log lady? Check. A town with a backstory of lumber mills? Check. A red room in your dreams? Check. 

Swery, the director, took the Twin Peaks blueprint (too literally at times) and applied Phil Swift's Flex Tape on it in order to tell a new and unique story, and you can't help but wonder if they had to pay royalties for the source material or if it's a case of blatant plagiarism.

If you lived under a rock and were told that Deadly Premonition was the officially licensed Twin Peaks videogame, you'd have a hard time disputing that claim.

This feeling of "inspiration" (read: outright rip off) goes beyond just Twin Peaks. I.e. For some reason the female deputy sheriff you meet during the first few minutes of the game, Emily Wyatt, looks exactly like Naomi Watts, but the latter is never credited in the game.

Whether by accident or not, this game is truly a masterful experience.

EDIT 1: 
I ended up playing it on a Switch, as it turns out, these were not intended game mechanics; I kinda miss some of these flavorful glitches tho.

EDIT 2: 
The Switch version also crashes (albeit less often) and it has the same bug where windows on non-interactive buildings shine completely white (like a missing texture). The framerate is also crazy and sinks into the low 10's making it almost unplayable.

EDIT 3:
I briefly tried the Xbone version, but it has tank controls. I can't in good conscience play this game with such outdated controls.

EDIT 4: 
I ended up going back to the PC version since I can at least run it at locked 144 Hz (the darts mini-game bugs out at high framerates so I had to temporarily switch it back to 60 FPS).

EDIT 4.1 (appendix):
Things that bug out at 144 Hz:
[list]
[*]Driving: Your car goes faster than usual (which is arguably a good thing; I actually used this "glitch" to easily win all the racing side missions)
[*]The mission where you have to tail a car. Said car simply comes to a halt when going through a small slope, preventing you from completing the mission
[*]The darts minigame (the reticle does not match with where the dart lands)
[*]The mission where you have to follow an NPC (the NPC will get stuck in lamp posts and/or mailboxes)
[*] During cutscenes, York's cigarette will get stuck in his mouth while a duplicate cigarette stays in his hand. At first I thought that the protagonist simply had a crippling case of tobacco addiction, but this doesn't happen at 60 FPS.
[*]The spider-like monsters that crawl out of vents. These will stay permanently cloaked, clip through the walls and disappear. It doesn't sound so bad on paper, but defeating these monsters will often trigger a door or a cutscene so they must be defeated in order to advance to the next area.[/list] 

EDIT 5: 
I managed to get past the infamous Chapter 9 on PC so I feel like I have crossed the Rubicon. 

So far the game has crashed at least a couple dozen times and I have had to switch between "Windows XP SP3" and "Windows Vista" compatibility mode from time to time; Some sections appear to work better with either setting so it's a 50/50 bet. Also, opening the "Missions" menu soft-locks the game and forces you to Alt-F4, so you have to remember not to open that sub-menu.

The crashes mostly happen during fast-travel sequences, so I've resorted to ignoring the fast-travel mechanic and instead hauling my ass  from place to place in my in-game vehicle... it kinda adds realism and the town isn't that big to begin with so it's a good compromise.

FINAL EDIT:
I've finally beaten the game. This is an exercise of endurance and patience. I feel I've aged a decade, but the story was worth the hassle.

Other than that, there's actually an amazing game and an excellent story hidden behind all these glitches.

author: {'steamid': '76561199081168773', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 652, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 152, 'last_played': 1651004971}
review: I remember this game from when I had first played it on xbox. The graphics are crap but the story is beautifully immersive. I will say this version would be quite a disappointment if I hadn't bought it while on sale. Even if you take the time to modify files so that the game can play without crashing every 5 minutes, the loading screen times are irritating even for a patient person. If you are the type of person that enjoys a thorough tragic story with flawless story telling and fun scares, then this would be a wonderful game for you if you also have a bit of patience. Even though the graphics are just as crappy as they were years ago, the story itself is still there and that is why I wished to play this game again. There are no other games quite like this one.

author: {'steamid': '76561198878875521', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 26, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 26, 'last_played': 1650499499}
review: It doesn't work. At all. I tried to equip the pipe for about (5) minutes, & it kept giving me the stupid survival knife. I tried to look at the missions via the map screen, & it froze almost instantly. Every time I tried to get into the inventory or options menu, something went wrong. This is absolute garbage, & I genuinely regret buying it & throwing away (1/2) an hour of my time watching low-res cutscenes & trying to make it work, only to walk in a circle & (intentionally) kill myself in a tire fire. I'm incredibly annoyed & frustrated, & I want a refund.  Waste of time & money. Don't buy it. The director should be ashamed, & if this is supposed to be a special edition, the regular one must be a big steaming pile of cat turds.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049689075', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 1252, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1252, 'last_played': 1648993190}
review:
[h1]  Terrible, tedious, nonsensical, broken, and f*cking beautiful. [/h1]

[i] â€œIn life, when we are in love with someone, we are actually in love with both the good and the bad sides of that person. Weâ€™re in love with that unique blend.â€ [/i]

Director Hidetaka Suehiroâ€™s quote about the design philosophy of Deadly Premonitionâ€™s characters from GDC 2011 I think is also amazingly apropos to the relationship I and many others have to this inconceivable product- this unforeseen amalgamation of genuine creative passion and utter bamboozlement of what lies behind a conventionally 'good' game.

DP, at first sight, doesnâ€™t only shamelessly steal whole concepts from shows like Twin Peaks and games like Silent Hill 2, it also manages to blunder almost every single facet of its own gameplay. The vehicle driving is stiff. The shooting mechanics are stilted. The enemies are trivially easy to beat, resulting in virtually no genuine challenge for the player to overcome as they explore the ominous otherworlds of different locations around town, which are really nothing more than sets of hallways stapled together in unstimulating cheap knock-offs of those from the game series it borrows from. The hunger and sleep mechanics act as an unsuccessful attempt to add definition to the rest of the game outside the corridor-shooter sections, proving too easy to fulfill. The salary system whereby you earn your funds to purchase items and weapons is [i] completely [/i] unrestrained, offering you thousands upon thousands of dollars for completion of each chapter, disallowing careful decision-making over how to effectively use your money. The sound design is cliche- full of the cheapest, most bafflingly atmosphere-destructive things that make you question if this game is supposed to be a genuine attempt at a horror videogame or instead a satirical masterpiece.

Not to mention how absolutely broken this PC port is. I had to download DPFix, which is pretty much required to run the game at any reliable measure to avoid unplayably-choppy framerate and the inevitable, innumerable, [b] near-intolerable [/b] amount of crashes. Even then, I had to download DP on ANOTHER computer after an unavoidable crash halfway through the game which rendered my original installation impossible to continue on. Backing up saves is a must. To put it simply, DP can suck big pee pee a lot of the time.

But note that I did not say [i] all  [/i] the time.

For as bug-ridden, and almost totally unplayable as a game could possibly be, Deadly Premonition is nevertheless one of the most charming and endearing videogames in existence. In the intermits of pain- caused by technical problems and irrevocably flawed design- the story and characters are what ultimately manage to glue everything together; the sole reason for the cult following and undying loyalty so many have to the game.

Playing as eccentric FBI agent, Francis â€œYorkâ€ Morgan, you are brought to the northwestern town of Greenvale to investigate the mysterious murder of a local girl, following a trail of other killings involving strange red seeds. What follows from this simple premise is one of the most unpredictable, ridiculous, and downright silly video game narratives that has ever come out of the industry. The whole cast of unforgettably weird characters sticks in your mind long after playing, and as much as the [i] horror [/i] atmosphere is practically nonexistent, the atmosphere of the [i] town [/i] of Greenvale itself is likely one of the most accurate and true-to-life depictions of the American northwestern countryside youâ€™ll see- no doubt one of the few true successes of the game due to the developers traveling and studying the real life landscapes in that part of the world.

The music too is surprisingly good. Magical and floating songs like the vocal version of Greenvale, or the happily relaxing Life is Beautiful that always seems to play at the most laughably tone-deaf moments, work towards a strong, if not characteristically motley mixture of identity. 

Even more unexpected is the fact that for how f*cking stupid DPâ€™s narrative can get, there are moments of genuine poignancy that somehow work despite the general amount of insanity surrounding all else. The playerâ€™s emotional link to the protagonist by way of in-game portrayal as Yorkâ€™s imaginary friend, Zach, enables a genuine connection to the character that evolves through the course of the story. DP is oddly full of details that prove the game was legitimately developed with real ardor and effort, most notably in the mid-drive discussions of old movies, music, and previously solved cases that York has with you, Zach. By the time you get to the ending, youâ€™ll not only have felt fulfilled from the conclusion of the case, youâ€™ll also share a part of the feeling of bittersweet liberty with the goodbyes of the characters.

It is because of these things that make Deadly Premonition an inconceivable piece of art. To play through a gameplay and narrative that feels as if it were made by a child, yet at the same time get real enjoyment from the same things it fails so spectacularly at, through all odds, is incredibly inspiring and heartfelt, especially in recent times where the industry has really suffered from both an abundance of greed and loss of passion. A relic like this can remind you how stupid, fun, and sometimes touching games as an artistic medium can be.

If you can get DP on a console, [b] get it on a console. [/b] If not, well, good luck, and make sure to read guides on how best to get it running for PC.

If you can get used to the clunkiness and weirdness of the game, the story and characters are very special. Main Character Francis York Morgan speaking random movie trivia at seemingly random times was a blast.

I ended completing it on another platform and it was worth every minute. Give it a chance if you can.

author: {'steamid': '76561198429074257', 'num_games_owned': 1448, 'num_reviews': 1328, 'playtime_forever': 1869, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1869, 'last_played': 1647852202}
review:
An ambiguous project in the "horror" genre, whose passage was abandoned by more than 70% players for all 10 years of connecting games.

Yes, today we will talk about the first part of Deadly Premonition and we got our hands on the "improved" version for PC - The Director's Cut. In this version, we are waiting for clearer textures, several scenes that were not in the original version, and a more â€œrevealedâ€ plot.
But in fact, we are faced with the appearance of bugs, conventions, mysticism and innuendo in the plot.
Let's start with the main thing that catches your eye - it's graphics. Even for 2013 - the identification of statistical data. Here and there - we are met by invisible barriers - which interfere with the movement of the player and transport, rather soapy textures (even with HD improvements), problems with shadows and light (often the picture is very overexposed).
Achieve this with not the most successful control, both of the main character and the car, and you will get the game of 2006. What a small memory pool may remind you of, which is why objects appear right in front of the character while moving around the city.
But we are not here because of the graphics, but because of the mysticism and the plot! And that's enough here.
The plot for the game is written and implemented very well, although there are holes in it every now and then - no one tries to shut up or somehow explain. Mysticism comes down to the manifestation of the "other" world - in the fact that rather low and slow opponents are waiting for us. They are supposed to scare the player and be dangerous - but in fact, the bobbleheads are quickly destroyed at a distance and are not dangerous for the GG. The same can be said about highlights with bosses - which are also present in the game for show.

Fun fact - the main plot and additional quests, sex of different people. Therefore, the secondary tasks are not to delve into the ENT of the game in any way, but are entered simply in order to allow the player to complete "cards" and "weapons with endless ammo".
Also in the game, things with music are rather sadly repeated - there are literally a few tracks here - which constantly happen from time to time, during certain events. It's pretty sad =(

[b]Pros:[/b][list]
[*]+ Many additional tasks
[*]+ Lots of interesting story dialogues
[*]+ Interesting main story
[*]+ Presence of hunger and fatigue
[*]+ Change of costumes - clothes can get dirty
[*]+ The presence of hygiene - so that they donâ€™t shy away from you, wash your face!
[*]+ Dynamic weather
[*]+ Trading cards for sale
[*]+ Abundance of achievements[/list]

[b]Minuses:[/b][list]
[*]- Driving a car
[*]- Enemies (and bosses) for show
[*]- Secondary tasks (the final quest to clean up the warehouse - the main character just hums for five minutes during the dialogue)
[*]- Quests that open only under certain conditions
[*]- Big but empty world
[*]- Clumsy QTEs[/list]

[b]Total:[/b]
In fact, this is not "horror" and not "survival". Before us is a 30 hour arthouse. Moving through the shelter, the player will spit and fight the urge to abandon the passage.
But if he still overcomes himself and reaches the final - despite a million minuses - he will recommend this game as a work of art xD

author: {'steamid': '76561198102129267', 'num_games_owned': 317, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 2556, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2360, 'last_played': 1689461311}
review:
[h1] [b] Esto pudo haber sido un juegaso, Â¿Verdad Zach? [/b] [/h1]

[h1] Mi historia con este juego (no hace falta leerla) [/h1]

Antes de decir el porque si recomiendo el juego, quiero contar la historia de como conocÃ­ este juego. A este juego le tengo un cariÃ±o de amor-odio. Todo empezÃ³ cuando estaba viendo un video de un canal llamado PiviGames. Pivi recomendaba como anuncio, al principio de su video, una pÃ¡gina de keys y habÃ­a un bundle u ofertas de 1 juego por solo 1 dÃ³lar. Confiaba en lo que me decÃ­a esta persona y "fuente" si se puede decir. Decido dar un vistaso y entre todos los juegos, estaba este. No recuerdo los otros. Vi el trailer, vi algunas fotos y dije, bueno vamos a probar. Por lo que vi, el juego tenÃ­a una pinta a Resident Evil y en ese entonces estaba un poquito atento a lo que era Sillent Hill y no, no estoy igualando la saga de terror psicolÃ³gico con Deadly Premonition. Asi que sÃ­, asi fue como obtuve el Deadly Premonition un 15 de Abril de 2021 por tan solo 1 dolar en una pÃ¡gina que era desconocida para mi. Por eso no me arrepiento de haber pagado esos 168 pesos argentinos (que era lo que valÃ­a el dÃ³lar amÃ©ricano, mÃ¡s los impuestos, en ese momento).

[h1] Puntos positivos y negativos [/h1]

[i]Pros: [/i]
[list]

[*]Personajes interesantes. No me encariÃ±e con todo el elenco, pero los mÃ¡s importantes les guardo cierto cariÃ±o. QuizÃ¡s si hubiese completado todas las misiones secundarias hubiese conectado mÃ¡s con algunos y con otros no.

[*]Buena Banda Sonora Original, escÃºchenla por favor.

[*]Buena historia. No es una obra, tampoco para tanto pero no es un asco.

[*]Diferentes vehÃ­culos para coleccionar. [spoiler] Si lees esto, tranquilo, que vas a poder recuperar el coche de York. [/spoiler]

[*]Barra de sueÃ±o y hambre (bÃ¡sicamente pequeÃ±os detalles que afectan al personaje).

[*]La ropa que llevamos se ensucia pasado el tiempo, tenemos que cambiÃ¡rnosla y encima lavar la que quedÃ³ sucia.

[*]El coche se puede romper y quedarse sin gasolina. Tanto para arreglarlo como para renovar el combustible, necesitamos hacer una parada en la Ãºnica gasolinera del pueblo.

[*]Ciclos de dÃ­a y noche, como tambiÃ©n dÃ­as nublados y algunos con lluvia (este Ãºltimo es muy importante con la historia y tambiÃ©n el como afecta al mundo y juego). Podemos informarnos de esto viendo la televisiÃ³n.

[*]Podemos afeitarnos. Sencillamente algo estÃ©tico que no marca mucho, pero sirve para elegir la apariencia que mas nos guste para nuestro personaje.

[*]Asi como tiene ciclos de dÃ­a y noche, los horarios juegan un papel importante en la rutina de todos los npcâ€™s y de los lugares, haciendo que el mundo abierto se sienta bastante vivo.

[*]Podemos pescar, lo probÃ© y no es la gran cosa, pero es una forma de poder lootear comida, armas y municiÃ³n.

[*]Algo que mencionarÃ© en las contras y es que, el juego parece una parodia, es como un abridged, arruinando momentos tristes, lÃºgubres, de cualquier calibre, poniendo la mÃºsica no adecuada en dichos momentos. MÃºsica feliz mientras inspeccionamos un cadÃ¡ver, el protagonista fumando y muy relajado, despuÃ©s o durante una situaciÃ³n de estrÃ©s que requiere mucho profesionalismo. Pero es algo que me gusta, no voy a mentir.
[/list]

[i]Contras: [/i]
[list]

[*]Bugs, crasheos, problemas tÃ©cnicos en general.

[*]Dichos problemas tÃ©cnicos se debe a un mal port de pc, que fue un copia y pega de la versiÃ³n de consola (preferiblemente Xbox 360) pero sin poner una gota de sudor.

[*]Es un juego de terror, y, digamos que no es su fuerte, es una parodia y sÃ¡tira de si misma.

[*]La acciÃ³n es mala o aburrida porque, cada vez que empezamos a luchar con las â€œSombrasâ€, estos enemigos son molestos y solo hace que el jugador quiera terminar lo mÃ¡s rÃ¡pido posible con ellos.

[*]Volviendo a la acciÃ³n, no vamos a tener muchas armas al principio, son caras algunas. El apuntado es mÃ¡s incÃ³modo que los primeros Resident Evil. Para mi no fue difÃ­cil acostumbrarme.

[*]Cuando matas a un enemigo (Sombra) este muere y donde muriÃ³, parece ser que â€œsigue ahÃ­â€ ya que no nos dejarÃ¡ pasar por unos segundos. Sumado a que en algunas ocasiones los enemigos son infinitos y se genera un spawn donde muriÃ³, haciendo difÃ­cil y tedioso poder pasearse por las zonas.

[*]El detalle de que los personajes no jugables tengan una acciÃ³n diferente en ciertos momentos del dÃ­a, lo hace tedioso, ya que algunos cuando van a su casa, no te dejaran pasar. Esto es algo bastante negativo si querÃ©s hacer una misiÃ³n secundaria por puro interÃ©s o si querÃ©s completar los logros del juego.

[*]Esto conecta con el punto mencionado anteriormente, y es que el mapa y mini mapa del juego, es un problema. Es difÃ­cil estar aprendiÃ©ndose todas las localizaciones ya que el zoom para alejar, es muy poco y encima el mapa del menu rota al igual que el minimapa, termina siendo frustrante. Esto es tedioso para cuando querÃ©s seguir a un personaje, importante, que se esta yendo y lo requerÃ­s para cierta misiÃ³n, entregarle algo, recibir, etc.

[*]El sistema de conducciÃ³n es horrible, los coches no pueden ir a altas velocidades por mucho tiempo porque pierden la estabilidad y derrapan mucho, lo suficiente para que a veces, puedan volcarse o chocar.

[*]No tiene mucha dificultad el juego, es realmente un paseo, solo que se alarga debido a errores con los enemigos que mencione anteriormente. AdemÃ¡s que los rompecabezas son fÃ¡ciles de resolver, quizÃ¡s hay uno que te sea mÃ¡s difÃ­cil que otro como me paso a mi.

[*]Hay un par de misiones (no recuerdo alguna otra) que son aburridas, se trata de manejar o caminar/correr por un buen tiempo. Hace que te mueras del aburrimiento, pero muy garantizado.

[*]El jefe final es fÃ¡cil tambiÃ©n pero gracias a las limitaciones tÃ©cnicas, se produce un problema a la hora de querer matarlo, por lo cual habrÃ¡ que tener mucha paciencia, que no es imposible.

[*]Los grÃ¡ficos son bastante regulares, no sÃ© si muy malos (A mi este apartado es el que me da bastante igual, pero es un punto objetivamente negativo).
[/list]

Â¿Que decir? Me gusta el juego, los puntos negativos prevalecen sobre los positivos, pero fue tanto el amor que le tenÃ­a que aguante y lo juguÃ©, eso quiere decir que realmente vale la pena. Para restar los problemas tÃ©cnicos, [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=218647912] usÃ© esta guÃ­a en espaÃ±ol, recomendada si o si para los hispanoparlantes [/url] ya que el juego, en espaÃ±ol, esta mal traducido. Ciertos caracteres como los signos de pregunta, de exclamaciÃ³n, tildes y la poderosÃ­sima Ã‘ no estÃ¡n y es una sopa de letras y garabatos los subtÃ­tulos. La verdad que un desastre lo que no han querido hacer los responsables del port y del juego en general. Gracias a la comunidad, sobre todo a ustedes: [url=https://steamcommunity.com/id/fernandoesra] Esra [/url] y [url=https://steamcommunity.com/id/raskaipika] Raskaipika [/url] y los que ayudaron con los parches, con el DPfix y SweetFX.

Como dije anteriormente en la secciÃ³n de "Mi historia con el juego" lo comprÃ© a 1 dÃ³lar, pero por ese amor que le agarrÃ©, decidÃ­ comprar la mÃºsica del juego, que se encuentra a modo de DLC.
No recomiendo comprarlo al precio en el que estÃ¡. Hagan como yo, compren la key o esperen a rebajas. No sÃ© si el juego suele estar de oferta cada tanto y no se cuando. Pero este juego deberÃ­a estar barato por lo que ofrece.

[h1] Spoilers [/h1]

[spoiler] La pelea con el jefe final fue horrible, esta bugeadisima, literal para matarlo no podÃ­a apuntar al muÃ±eco que llevaba en el bolsillo, osease, su punto debil. Me termine el boss con un mando en vez del teclado y mouse, pensando que serÃ­a una soluciÃ³n pero valga la rebundancia que el juego tiene problemas con el joystick derecho y es que el sentido vertical y horizontal estan al revÃ©s. (El vertical es el horizontal y viceversa). Bueno querÃ­a escribir algo mÃ¡s pero Steam me lo limita. [/spoiler]

author: {'steamid': '76561197992708074', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 653, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 481, 'last_played': 1646824936}
review: I have been told that it will be worth it in the end. But only 7 hours in, I don't know if will be able to play it through. It crashes constantly, now I am at a point where it just shuts down and I cant get it to work. Everytime I have to play it I have the worst experience, technically it is just so poorly done. Driving the car is like driving a train on rails, only you are expected to be able to steer it yourself. I would not recommend this garbage to anyone. The story might be good but just watch someone else play it instead and save yourself the time and money.

author: {'steamid': '76561198357648399', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1802, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1744, 'last_played': 1678486830}
review: I've been playing this with friends watching and we've had a great time. Laughs out loud from weird dialogue, real gasps, days chatting about the mystery and sharing theories. Lines we will be quoting for years. There are game play parts like chase scenes and stuff that are repetitive and annoying. There are crashes that I had do some weird stuff to the game so I could continue playing. The entire end of the game???? There are parts that I just don't understand and could do with out. It was worth it and I loved it. I just want to go back in and drive someone's car and do side missions.

author: {'steamid': '76561197981148806', 'num_games_owned': 192, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 2318, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2318, 'last_played': 1485635023}
review:
I rate this game a Zach / Mindbreaking Car Audio Bug

On a serious note the game is good. Whilst the gameplay hasn't aged the best, the pure batshit insanity of the story will hook you immediately. This game is like if the movies Mulholland Drive and Seven had a baby, and that baby was bipolar.

Crucial story events are often accompanied by the most out of place jazz music. 

The sandbox elements and side quests add more flavor to games world and provide an insight into the motivations and background of various characters in a thought out way. The game does a good job of making you feel like a detective. 

The amount of surrealist humour in the game is unparalleled by any other game (or form of media) I have played. 

Everyone should experience this game, but get it on sale, as the bugs are annoying unless you download third party patches.

Oh, and watch out for the giant dog on the roads at night.

author: {'steamid': '76561198214493720', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 69, 'playtime_forever': 4935, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1845, 'last_played': 1647442393}
review:
This is one of the most unique games you'll ever play, between the storyline, the actual gameplay and the weird little moments therein.  I can't say too much without spoiling it, it's like the sims meets resident evil and then they all dropped acid and watched leave it to beaver.  You will feel totally safe, obnoxiously so one minute and then will be completely on your own and very unsafe, which is more unnerving than just a straight up horror game would be I think.  You need to play this game.

THAT said, it runs TERRIBLY on steam, first you'll have to download their controller schematic because the stick goes the wrong way ( left is right, etc ) and then you'll experience crashes, both at random times and at certain crucial intervals that will be game ending until you fix it.  What I did was ran it as an admin and on windows 98 compatibility mode and it fixed the major crashes, but ON 98 mode the load times are twice as long.  Also the aiming could be better.

GREAT game, def play it, but expect some problems.

author: {'steamid': '76561198051627501', 'num_games_owned': 607, 'num_reviews': 71, 'playtime_forever': 74, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10, 'last_played': 1645525054}
review:
A cult classic that is every bit uncanny as it is charming and funny. It's one of those games that I think everyone should play through at least once in their lifetime and is Swery's most seminal work out of entire his catalog. Think of the movie "The Room (2003)" had a baby with TV series "Twin Peaks", but a videogame. 

However this port is pretty god awful and is the definition of just "phoning it in". If you're willing to do a bunch of mod and config work beforehand to fix a majority of the issues in its vanilla state it is definitely worth a buy on sale. On the bright side this can probably run on a potato so it's also a good pick-up for someone who is at the moment stuck running lower spec hardware or even the Steam Deck since the native resolution for this game is 720p.

Regardless of all my rambling this is definitely worth playing through despite the really sad state of the port mainly due to vast community support to get the game in a very playable state. My negative review is a reflection of the PC port as is and not the game itself. (Also I've heard that DP2 has similar issues with another barebones port if you want to call it that which is really unfortunate, although I'm sure the community over time will fix that game too)

Sidenote: If you do buy this I recommend visiting [url=https://www.pcgamingwiki.com/wiki/Deadly_Premonition:_The_Director%27s_Cut]this page[/url] to help you get the game running in an acceptable state. Also here's some steps to fix the gamepad controls since they're messed up especially the axis for the analog sticks. Open Big Picture mode, search for Deadly Premonition -> Manage Game -> Controller Configuration -> Browse Configs (At the bottom) -> Select the Community Tab -> Choose the one that's labeled "Deadly Premonition Controller+". Hope this helps someone.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972339779', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 4062, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2641, 'last_played': 1678764611}
review:
Ok. This is going to be a review of THIS version of the game.
Short story, this version of the game (The PC Version of Deadly Premonition Director's Cut) is BROKEN. 
I have a windows 10 PC with a modern nvidia graphics card and the game out of the box did not work. 
It would crash on opening. I've tried the community fix(es) which are either a weird combination of trying different compatibility settings on the exe itself and/or the DP Fix, which is a community fix that requires adding new files to the game's directory. The DP Fix does include some extra settings like graphical adjustments, the ability to change the resolution as well. You will still need to make an adjustment to the controller profile for this game because the right stick by default is mapped wrong (up and down is left and right and vice versa by default).

Honestly the DP Fix made my experience worse, causing the game to crash often. Whereas rolling back the changes and setting the game's exe to compatibility mode for windows xp allowed me to play longer but ultimately I had the same result. The game would crash before a chapter even early on in the story. I tried practically everything I could find but nothing would work. 

While its my understanding this game is buggy on practically every system that it was ever ported to, this version in particular is... a waste of money. It just doesn't work and if for some reason you can get to work then my hat's off to you. I cannot recommend this game as it is on steam and TBH, the way that it currently is should be pulled from steam. I plan on playing through this game at some point, as it has a good and quirky story but do not plan on doing so on the PC.

review:
I purchased this game on disc a WHILE ago, and soon enough it was banned for some reason xD 

this is one game i couldnt forget about. yeah it has its kinks, like the monkey screech from the squirrel lol but over all i really love this game. I was extremely happy i got to play it again.

RECOMMEND TO EVERYONE. the story is good, thomas is hilarious, but overall, YES.

author: {'steamid': '76561198371406966', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 559, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 559, 'last_played': 1643153351}
review: I had a blast with this game for 9 hours with zero issues. Then the crashes started with Chapter 9 corrupting my save file. Did every pcgamingwiki fix there is out there, used save files from online, windowed mode, etc. to no avail. Now i'm just frigged and won't recommend this PORT to anyone. Perhaps tracking down the Xbox 360 version of this game would be wise.

author: {'steamid': '76561198022872729', 'num_games_owned': 570, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 4956, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 130, 'playtime_at_review': 1921, 'last_played': 1710898488}

author: {'steamid': '76561197972835171', 'num_games_owned': 155, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 1254, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1254, 'last_played': 1458999348}
review:
It's a good, quirky game. But, it's nearly unplayable at times. It crashes, a lot. Sometimes, you can't even progress because you'll get stuck in a crash loop you can't fix. 

Again, it's a good, quirky game with lots to offer, but its such a horrible port. I had to put it in compatibility mode for Windows 98 just for it to not crash at the load screen. Horrible port. Don't waste your money on it, even when it's on sale for less than $4 bucks like I did.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998739387', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 3524, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2486, 'last_played': 1640990177}
review:
Not Unplayable but damn near close. You'll spend 2 minutes waiting for it to load, followed by several more minutes of unfun driving only to have it crash at a cut-scene and repeat the process. Without modding it you risk crashing and lengthy load times. Without a controller configuration you won't be able to aim. 

The only positive things I can say are there are quirky moments between characters making you think there will be some fun along the way. That gets snuffed out during lengthy do-nothing segments padded with running for the sake of running. So much time gets wasted to justify this being a game and not just a visual novel/movie. 

Play a port on a console if you really want to play this, but you'll waste more time than you will doing anything fun or interesting.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025047133', 'num_games_owned': 2015, 'num_reviews': 76, 'playtime_forever': 2018, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2018, 'last_played': 1639386585}
review:
I finally bit the bullet in the last 90% off sales guy and, unbelievably, so worth it!

100% Twin Peaks vibes, pulled off in its own Japanese style. And I say that fully knowing how high a bar that is. This game hits that bar, and then goes and does its own thing later on. Combined with some lovely PS2 janky blocky open world gameplay with just enough icons on the map to keep you going. And plenty of "guess they ran out of budget here" hilarity that my partner enjoyed as well.

"this area into town looks a bit bare? we got any assets?"
"let me check... I have a bunch of 'Welcome to Greenvale' signs?"
"problem solved, plop 10 of those suckers next to each other, smokes lets go"

Yes, I installed DPfix to make it look nice, and then spent an evening grappling with the settings and Windows compatibility mode that would make the controller work. And it crashed occasionally. Save often. And I couldn't beat the last boss without revisiting all those settings (ok, this part was pretty infuriating). But I am glad I pulled through.

That said, if I wasn't playing this crap PC port I would have been keen to 100% it. But the crashing is too much to stomach that. With the story driving the game forward I happily looked past it. But I guess it is worth reiterating that the janky mess (which honestly is part of its charm) will impact your playtime.

author: {'steamid': '76561198074815250', 'num_games_owned': 186, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 706, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 674, 'last_played': 1686088992}

author: {'steamid': '76561198067178806', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 335, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 335, 'last_played': 1454411969}
review:
Un Twin Peaks in salsa nipponica ma fedele allo spirito originale (le citazioni non si contano), con la partecipazione di Naomi Watts. 
Scherzo, ma sta di fatto che la somiglianza con il personaggio di Emily Wyatt Ã¨ impressionante.
Gioco non esente da difetti, perlopiÃ¹ di natura tecnica e di gameplay ma sorprendentemente immersivo, sembra veramente di assistere ad una serie tv alla conclusione della quale si resta pienamente soddisfatti.
Graficamente sembra un gioco per la prima PS2 (anche se i volti e le espressioni dei personaggi sono resi piuttosto bene) e il gameplay, soprattutto nelle fasi di shooting, Ã¨ dimenticabilissimo ma se riuscite a passare sopra questi difetti potrebbe stupirvi.

author: {'steamid': '76561198202537416', 'num_games_owned': 413, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 1236, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 255, 'last_played': 1674214716}
review:
This game is a broken mess, I cannot believe the game devs have the nerve to charge Â£20.00 for it... I'm sorry this is unacceptable, And i have a very low bar of what i expect for a game in this day and age, namely to work.

Even with the DP fix, I found the load times to be unreal, like up to a minute or two, which might not sound to bad but a 2-min wait just to peek into and empty house window and then a 2-min load to return to your character, made me wanna give up there and then... also tons of crash to desktops.

TBH even when I played this on the PS3 I found it really glitch laden, slow and tedious. Awful map and controls. I'd recommend for Â£5 as a curiosity, not the direction I like to see gaming going in but hear we are :(

author: {'steamid': '76561198157707849', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 718, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 713, 'last_played': 1656691706}
review:
I absolutely LOVE this game!! 
This is my 3rd time playing it, (I've played it on Switch 2 times) and I absolutely love this game!!!

I wonâ€™t lie, I had slight trouble getting a controller to work with it, but googling it fixes it! 
If you look past the â€˜badâ€™ graphics and wonky controls, this game is amazing! (The graphics and controls are fine imo, not as bad as people make them out to be!!) I'm lucky and I've had 0 crashes so far, I see that its a problem some people have?

I highly recommend this game, the story is amazing, York is a delight to play as and just overall it is a good game! I guess you could say some hate it, some love it, but itâ€™s really worth a try!!

This is definitely in my top 10 favourite games!

author: {'steamid': '76561198144435585', 'num_games_owned': 193, 'num_reviews': 84, 'playtime_forever': 2302, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 449, 'last_played': 1667694421}
review: I'VE FINALLY FINISHED PLAYING IT. All I did to fix the crashes is to go to the file directory, and run the game with Windows 98 compatibility mode. Also, tick "run as administrator" After that, I have to ALWAYS run the game from the file directory using "dp.exe" (can't use the launcher, it will not work that way). This will fix the crashes, but there's no guarantee that it will be zero crash, because it still crash at rare occasion. Also, even though the game is playable with compatibility mode, there are some unpleasant side effects such as no achievement and no playtime records because Steam will no longer be able to detect that you're playing it. But hey, at least it is playable.

author: {'steamid': '76561198060022823', 'num_games_owned': 323, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 73, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 65, 'last_played': 1701793765}
review:
Fantastic game, terrible port.

The original (on Xbox 360/One/Series X with BC) is a great game. While gameplay was mediocre, The combination of unique atmosphere, solid music, horror elements, comedy (both intentional and unintentional) and absolute bonkers characters/story makes this a borderline must-play for fans of unusual/artistic games. Easily at least a 9/10.

This PC port is pretty much unplayable though, with locked low resolution, piss-poor framerate and game-breaking bugs (such as the game becoming impossible to clear) even on stronger hardware.

Do yourself a favor and pick this up on an Xbox console or even Nintendo Switch if you have to, but don't touch this or the PS3 version (it's similar to this one).

author: {'steamid': '76561197980722015', 'num_games_owned': 744, 'num_reviews': 104, 'playtime_forever': 1743, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1743, 'last_played': 1505239159}

author: {'steamid': '76561198093913293', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 201, 'playtime_forever': 66, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 54, 'last_played': 1653543395}
review:
If you can get this game work, then it's a 100% recommendation, jank, weird, and all.
Unfortunately, there's a 100% chance that you'll have to do some serious modding and editing into the game's files and properties in order to be able to play the game.
You're game might not recognize your controller, or it'll crash before you get to the menu, or you can't move your character, or it'll crash before you can save, or the audio will be messed up, or the cutscenes will be upside down, or the inputs aren't working correctly.

There's just so much trouble you'll need to brace for, and work to bare through, in order to be able play the game, despite being a 2013 modern port.
Maybe save for the Switch version, but only if you can accept playing under 20 fps half the time.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995233187', 'num_games_owned': 484, 'num_reviews': 133, 'playtime_forever': 273, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 273, 'last_played': 1634603743}
review:
as much as i enjoy the concepts of this game, and appreciate the homage to twin peaks that this game fashions itself as, i simply can't recommend a game this broken. the fact that most of the top guides are about how to download third-party patches and save files to make this game remotely playable is REALLY telling. i'm honestly shocked that the developers haven't stepped in at this point with some sort of fix, but... well, i guess that says something about their faith in this title.

i understand that this game is functional in non-steam releases, so you may want to check elsewhere for a way to experience this story. because it IS an experience to be sure.

author: {'steamid': '76561198080966616', 'num_games_owned': 1224, 'num_reviews': 98, 'playtime_forever': 2232, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2232, 'last_played': 1634347777}
review: A superstitious FBI agent with schizophrenia visits a very strange rural town to investigate the death of a young beauty. A warm welcome from red hooded citizen starts your journey in a unique comedy that is Deadly Premonition. Can you survive all horrors of a bad PC port, or the mystery will be left unsolved...

author: {'steamid': '76561198048427327', 'num_games_owned': 582, 'num_reviews': 177, 'playtime_forever': 3281, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3280, 'last_played': 1634329062}
review: The great game and it's notorious horrifically bad port. It has an excellent story with mystic horror elements. The open world is filled with quite a living characters. The battle and puzzles sections are casual. There is also a lot of unusualness here... It's like an easy walk in a crushing reality. If you want to immerse into this surreal atmospheric detective story, you will cry.. because of the constant crashes at any random moment. Technical problems will haunt you. Fan patches won't save you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198122674215', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 65, 'playtime_forever': 3327, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3327, 'last_played': 1633280605}
review:
There is a reason why Deadly Premonition is a cult classic. By almost all gaming standards, the game is not very good: game-breaking bugs, off-sync voice-overs and cutscenes, clunky controls... HOWEVER, once you spend some time in Greenvale, just like York, you will love it so much you do not want to leave! That's why I would recommend this game despite its flaws, which you can overcome by constantly backing up your save files. Finishing the game and the side mission would leave a sweet memory in your heart.

WATCH A PLAYTHROUGH OF THE FIRST FEW CHAPTER FIRST THOUGH!

author: {'steamid': '76561198232619576', 'num_games_owned': 347, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 1628, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1628, 'last_played': 1633457629}
review:
As flawed as the game is on PC (and on other consoles too), it's still a great game to experience. The writing here is surprisingly solid and the characters and charming.

If you can get over the problems this version on PC has (especially those crashing and terrible negative acceleration on the mouse), it's a damn good game with unique story and world.

Don't take my word for how good the game is, ask Zach and he'll say the same thing too.

review: EstÃ¡ plagado de bugs, los combates son bÃ¡sicos y las animaciones toscas. Los controles rozan lo inmanejable. Pese a todo, la historia y los personajes hacen que el juego merezca la pena de ser jugado. Un juego extraÃ±o de un gÃ©nero oscuro pero fascinante.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053429062', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 2651, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2378, 'last_played': 1633320640}
review: Great game on XBOX 360. Easily one of my most favorite games of all time. Awful awful awful AWFUL port. I have downloaded every fan-made fix and followed every guide obsessively to avoid horrible lag or constant crashing problems and nothing has steadily worked. Had to reinstall it fully because of these problems at least a few times because checking file integrity through Steam didn't work. Thank god no save files got corrupted. PLEASE buy this on console. I know - The game looks like an alpha test. The world is empty, the gameplay is laughably easy in it's imbalanced state even with the updated Director's Cut, the character animations remind you of an early PS2 JRPG, character stereotypes, moments that feel like it was made by an alien, but trust me... First impressions can be deceiving to it's quality for certain. It's a cult classic for a reason; those who walk away early will miss out on the absolute gem others stayed around long enough to witness. Perhaps it is with such low beginning expectations that this game can shine brilliantly like a diamond in a junkyard. This game is full of so much heart. Every character, no matter how minor, has been created with such a love for humans. The bizarre and off-beat comedy of it all blends unexpectedly amazing with the horror to make you see the beauty of being alive. A really really well written character story and some fantastic voice acting and soundtrack. BUY IT ON CONSOLE. If you think you're going to be lucky enough that you won't have problems like I did, you're taking too big of a risk. If this is your first time experiencing it, just buy it on console and save yourself massive headaches that will make you wanna give up on the game before you see any of it's beauty. The console version might not look like a stable game, but in comparison to this port, my god, it is SO much more stable and polished. You're not going to experience crashes with the XBOX360 version like you do with the PC port every hour. You're not going to run into infinite loading screens, or massive glaring graphical glitches, or accidentally fall through the floor. I am begging you to play this game, just don't buy it on PC. Please.

author: {'steamid': '76561198117638960', 'num_games_owned': 907, 'num_reviews': 243, 'playtime_forever': 4524, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4468, 'last_played': 1698543360}
review:
Eu nÃ£o sei nem por onde comeÃ§ar a falar de Deadly Premonition. De sua premissa nem tÃ£o original assim? De sua gameplay travada? De suas mecÃ¢nicas ambiciosas? De suas falhas? De seu port horrÃ­vel para o PC? De sua reputaÃ§Ã£o marcante? Ou talvez, de como ele se tornou um de meus jogos favoritos?

Um detetive do FBI chega em uma pequena cidade no noroeste americano, perto da fronteira do CanadÃ¡, para investigar a morte de uma adolescente aparentemente certinha e amada por todos. A morte afeta toda a cidade, e a investigaÃ§Ã£o vai revelando nÃ£o apenas detalhes sobre o assassino, mas tambÃ©m segredos obscuros que seus moradores estranhos nÃ£o gostariam que fossem revelados. O que comeÃ§a como um caso comum vai aos poucos demonstrando que forÃ§as sobrenaturais podem estar envolvidas. AlÃ©m disso, o agente do FBI possui mÃ©todos incomuns, Ã© viciado em cafÃ© e parece ter visÃµes relacionadas Ã  investigaÃ§Ã£o em seus sonhos, que envolvem quartos vermelhos e pessoas falando de forma estranha. Essa Ã© a premissa da sÃ©rie Twin Peaks, de 1990, e tambÃ©m de Deadly Premonition. A inspiraÃ§Ã£o aqui beira o plÃ¡gio, com alguns personagens e lugares parecidos atÃ© demais. Mas, como Twin Peaks Ã© a minha sÃ©rie favorita, tambÃ©m Ã© o motivo de eu ter jogado esse jogo.

Por sorte, a histÃ³ria em si nÃ£o Ã© uma cÃ³pia exata da sÃ©rie, e eu diria que Ã© o ponto mais alto de Deadly Premonition. Por mais que seu ponto de partida seja o mesmo, as duas histÃ³rias vÃ£o para caminhos e possuem mitologias bem diferentes. Os personagens que parecem terem vindo direto da sÃ©rie sÃ£o poucos, e os originais daqui conseguem ser atÃ© mais estranhos e caricatos do que a sÃ©rie jamais foi. O destaque Ã© com certeza o personagem principal, Francis York Morgan, que fica conversando com seu amigo imaginÃ¡rio Zach o jogo todo.  A escrita aqui Ã© bem boa, sendo no geral bem cÃ´mica e absurda mas conseguindo atingir momentos sÃ©rios quando o jogo precisa. O que interfere um pouco com a histÃ³ria, assim como todos os aspectos desse jogo, Ã© sua execuÃ§Ã£o. As mÃºsicas desse jogo sÃ£o boas, mas frequentemente usadas nos momentos errados. Junto com alguns dos piores efeitos sonoros que eu jÃ¡ vi em um jogo, isso acaba gerando um humor nÃ£o intencional que cria o charme Ãºnico e estranho desse jogo.

Quanto Ã  gameplay, o jogo possui duas partes principais. A primeira sÃ£o as sessÃµes de Survival Horror, similares a jogos como Resident Evil ou Silent Hill, onde o jogador luta com inimigos similares a zumbis ou espÃ­ritos. Aparentemente essas sessÃµes foram adicionadas de Ãºltima hora, o que faz bastante sentido considerando que sÃ£o as partes mais fracas do jogo. Pode atÃ© ser um pouco tenso quando um inimigo aparece diretamente do seu lado, mas no geral essas sessÃµes nÃ£o geram nenhum medo ou tensÃ£o. Esse jogo tambÃ©m possui algumas das piores e mais engraÃ§adas sequÃªncias de perseguiÃ§Ã£o jÃ¡ feitas. Eu nÃ£o considero essas sessÃµes necessariamente terrÃ­veis, mas a forma que elas sÃ£o usadas aqui podia ser melhor.

E entÃ£o temos a melhor das duas partes, o sistema de mundo aberto. O jogador Ã© livre para explorar a cidade inteira de Greenvale e apenas seguir a histÃ³ria principal quando quiser. MecÃ¢nicas habituais de jogos de mundo aberto estÃ£o aqui, como comprar itens em lojas, jogar minigames como pesca, dardos e corrida, e fazer side quests. As side quests desse jogo variam bastante em importÃ¢ncia narrativa, mas sÃ£o bem divertidas e recompensadoras, desenvolvendo melhor os personagens do jogo e entregando ao jogador itens extremamente Ãºteis, como armas de muniÃ§Ã£o infinita ou a habilidade de quick travel. Ã‰ nessa parte do jogo que suas mecÃ¢nicas mais ambiciosas e sua dedicaÃ§Ã£o ao realismo aparecem. Por exemplo, todos os personagens seguem uma rota diÃ¡ria, e vocÃª consegue vÃª-los vivendo suas vidas em tempo real. Inclusive, o jogador atÃ© pode espionar pela janela da maioria das casas para ver o que os personagens estÃ£o fazendo lÃ¡ dentro. AlÃ©m disso, existem nÃ­veis de fome e cansaÃ§o e mecÃ¢nicas de trocar e lavar roupa suja, se barbear (a barba de York cresce em tempo real) e abastecer seu carro. Mesmo que a mecÃ¢nica de dirigir desse jogo seja meio quebrada, a forma que esses sistemas foram implementados aqui gera uma experiÃªncia bem interessante e Ãºnica.

Agora finalmente falando da parte mais assustadora do jogo: seu port para o PC. O jogo Ã© conhecido por ser quebrado em todas as plataformas, mas a versÃ£o de PC Ã© especialmente quebrada. Primeiro de tudo, para rodar o jogo em resoluÃ§Ãµes altas (a maioria), Ã© necessÃ¡rio baixar um mod. O jogo crasha frequentemente, e possui cutscenes especÃ­ficas que congelam o jogo, e para continuar eu tive que rodar o jogo como admin, em janela e usar o modo de compatibilidade Windows XP pra passar. AlÃ©m disso, os controles com mouse e teclado nÃ£o sÃ£o muito bons, e mesmo jogando com um controle os analÃ³gicos ficam invertidos e Ã© necessÃ¡rio usar uma configuraÃ§Ã£o da Comunidade Steam pra funcionar direito. Ah, e se vocÃª ficar passando rÃ¡pido demais as locaÃ§Ãµes no mapa do jogo ele eventualmente vai parar em NÃ¡rnia e o jogo crasha logo em seguida tambÃ©m. Esses aspectos introduzem a mecÃ¢nica mais importante do jogo todo: os telefones de save. NÃ£o importa a situaÃ§Ã£o, sempre que ver um telefone corra como se sua vida dependesse disso e salve o jogo para nÃ£o perder seu progresso.

Deadly Premonition tem a reputaÃ§Ã£o de ser um jogo "tÃ£o ruim que Ã© bom", e eu nÃ£o sei se eu consigo concordar 100% com essa afirmaÃ§Ã£o. Eu nÃ£o quero dizer com isso que ele seja um jogo excelente ou subestimado, longe disso, partes dele se encaixam perfeitamente nessa descriÃ§Ã£o. PorÃ©m isso nÃ£o representa o jogo como um todo: ele tambÃ©m possui partes Ã³timas e elementos bem ambiciosos. Mas a verdade Ã© que o que faz Deadly Premonition ser tÃ£o especial sÃ£o os dois: o bom e o ruim. NÃ£o existe nenhum jogo como esse, e talvez nunca vÃ¡ existir. Ele Ã© de longe uma das melhores experiÃªncias que eu jÃ¡ tive jogando qualquer jogo e, mesmo sabendo que talvez seja um jogo que nÃ£o agrade todos, Ã© uma experiÃªncia que eu recomendaria de coraÃ§Ã£o a todos que se interessaram ou ficaram curiosos. Minha Ãºnica ressalva Ã© o port do PC, que mesmo que adicione Ã  aura de elementos quebrados do jogo tambÃ©m atrapalha e frustra bastante. No meu caso, eu acabei considerando que o bom superou o ruim e eu consegui me divertir mesmo assim. Mas, para os que decidirem dar uma chance apesar desses problemas, a experiÃªncia pode ser bem recompensadora.

NÃ£o Ã© mesmo, Zach?

author: {'steamid': '76561198079953579', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 2249, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2249, 'last_played': 1631968448}
review:
[h1] I don't even know where to start with this janky messâ€¦ [/h1] 

It's mind-blowing, that the game was published in this state. The frame rates are all over the place and without switching to Windows XP compatibility mode, youâ€™ll get nauseous quite quickly and, in my case, couldnâ€™t even interact with the menu interface. Noticed halfway through the game that the narrow aiming window is not intentional, assumed it was just bad game design... Had to switch to Windows 98 comp mode for one section to aim up and downâ€¦ I mean, jesus christ. [b] Dpfix is an absolute must! [/b]
Game crashed frequently and corrupted my save files on several occasions, [u] so you better make frequent backups [/u]. To my annoyance I had to restart the final confrontation after realising I canâ€™t finish the fight without aiming up and down and then had to switch back to XP Mode because it crashed after the loading screen.

Graphically itâ€™s atrocious, look like it belongs on the PS2 instead PS3 era.

Gameplay frontâ€™s not looking better either, it is by no means a hard or scary game. Music sounds like someone sat down on the piano keys, which obviously does nothing for keeping me tense. It's too bright to create even the slightest atmosphere, the enemies are slowly lurching around and can be outpaced by a brisk walk, so no danger whatsoever. Shooting the shambling horrors sends them tumbling like they want to send me off the pitch.
Donâ€™t know if itâ€™s a glitch or due to the insane amount of ammo dropped but I somehow never ran out of pistol or shotgun bullets. And you donâ€™t even need them for the majority of the game, melee weapons are superior in every way. Bonk them once and theyâ€™re dead!
Honourable mentions to the QTEs, which caused 100% of my death and I passionately hate. Especially the sequence near end dragged on well beyond sensible.

Driving around gets rather tedious, map is too large with too little stuff. Perfectly straight roads shot me somersaulting through the air or stopped me dead in my tracks because I apparently collided with the geometry.

The Story is a right pick â€˜nâ€™ mix. Shocking revelations are accompanied by upbeat music, awkward yet very serious dialog and townsfolk looking and animating like sock puppets lend the whole experience a rather bizarre tone. 
Plot is otherwise fine; it builds up a nice little story and kept me interested enough to finish it, mainly because of our eccentric yet likable protagonist. [b] FBI Special Agent Francis York Morgan [/b] is plain hilarious, taking everything in his stride while geeking out over his favourite movies or calmly and smilingly enter the twisted nightmare world. Having him walk around slowly like heâ€™s the terminator never got boring.

Canâ€™t recommend it enough, underneath all the janky design and questionable gameplay choices lies a unique experience that must be seen.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997528623', 'num_games_owned': 652, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 1018, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1015, 'last_played': 1667942461}
review:
I both do and do not recommend this game. It's not stable on PC, so unless you're willing to put in some effort to get it to work and to keep it stable, I would say get it on the Switch instead.

But I definitely DO recommend this game when it comes to its content. It's very much like a so-bad-it's-good B movie. The plot makes very little sense but it is very entertaining at the same time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198140185931', 'num_games_owned': 92, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 260, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 32, 'last_played': 1631505444}
review:
**Edited**

Loved this game so much. I bought copies for the Xbox360, PS3, XboxOne, and PC. 

If you're a fan of the tv series, Twin Peaks. Or the game series, Silent Hill. Then you'll definitely feel familiar with this game's elements. Swery65, did a great job with this title. Now. I won't lie. It does feel like a polished turd in terms of the controls, and graphics. But it is such a lovely polished turd, with it all its little flaws and quirks it has going for it. 

And it's real time system is pretty in-depth.

Grab this game if you're looking for something with either a David Lynch or Franz Kafka feel.

author: {'steamid': '76561199199658597', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 15, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6, 'last_played': 1669587195}
review:
If you're a fan of survival horror games & Niche indie titles, then Deadly Premonition may just be the game for you. As you've probably heard, it's known more-so for it's oddities, glitches and general weirdness, so if you're after a AAA title, you should probably give it a miss.

If you're willing to throw yourself into the experience though, there's a lot to enjoy here. The Story is engaging and keeps you guessing to the very last twist (If you were a fan of twin peaks you'll love it.) the Game play, although sluggish at times, is generally satisfying, and getting involved in the plethora of side quests available around the town and interacting with the eccentric characters is extremely satisfying.

There's a cult classic here that's definitely worth a shot!

author: {'steamid': '76561198092737245', 'num_games_owned': 589, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 4214, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2064, 'last_played': 1637007177}
review:
Bueno, aqui mi analisis de Deadly Premonition:

DescripciÃ³n general: Deadly premonition es un juego de donde encarnamos al agente del FBI York, en el caso del asesinato de Anna, una joven que ha muerto de una manera muy macabra en un pequeÃ±o pueblo de Estados Unidos. Parece que hay algo sobrenatural en todo esto, Zach...

Puntos positivos del juego:
- Historia increible, que te hace querer saber mÃ¡s todo el rato.
- Personajes muy definidos que te hacen sentir de verdad parte de la historia.
- PequeÃ±os detalles jugables que me han llamado la atenciÃ³n, como rellenar gasolina al coche o que te de la opciÃ³n de mirar por las ventanas.
- Las sidequests son bastante entretenidas, en concreto por lo que te cuentan en ellas.

Puntos negativos del juego:
- El port a PC le hace falta mods para poder ejecutarse... y aun asÃ­, hay crashes. Mirad las guias de la comunidad, que te indican que debes hacer.
- Se le nota en los grÃ¡ficos el paso del tiempo.

ValoraciÃ³n general:
Si no sabes nada del juego te sorprenderÃ¡. Muy recomendable... aunque tengas que configurar y estar atento por si hay algÃºn crash. Pero solo por la historia, es un must have.

author: {'steamid': '76561198088689369', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 1718, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1718, 'last_played': 1575180955}
review:
[h1]It's Perfectly Goofy[/h1]

In spite of this game's numerous and jarring technical issues, I'm still giving this a solid recommendation. It's a completely asinine experience packed to the brim with throw-away game mechanics and poor acting.

But then there's moments that strike you so hard because of how much they resemble real life. Who amongst us hasn't worn the same Hawaiian shirt for 3 weeks straight without showering? Who hasn't tried to subsist entirely off of coffee like some sort of demented breatharian? Who hasn't driven like an asshole through the mountains while having monologues with themselves about old movies?

Just buy it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198021800223', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 476, 'playtime_forever': 256, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 210, 'last_played': 1629888727}
review:
This video game have squirrels that sounds like monkey, 
constant gameplay slowdowns, 
framerate drops at random moments, 
optimization issues, 
really f*cked up design decisions, 
glitches everywhere, 
audio bugs, visual bugs, 
horrid controls, awkward cutscenes, 
nothing scary about it, annoying survival mechanics, 
terrible driving, laughable dialogue, 
story that have no sense at all......

Game good. Truly a blessing in disguise.
I rate it 8.5 out of 10

author: {'steamid': '76561197995346624', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 107, 'playtime_forever': 121, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 121, 'last_played': 1629473307}
review:
DO NOT BUY. 

This game doesn't start anymore.

I've bought it in 2014 and even then the game was a crashfest couldn't play more than half an hour, fixes applied. Today, it doesn't even start.

STOP SELLING THIS !

What pisses me off the most is that those rotten devs released a Switch port 2 years ago and didn't even bother to repair their shameful PC port.

Friggin lawsuit material, imagine buying a microwave oven which you need to disassemble in order to maybe cook your meal,  then the same brand releases the same one but without the disassembly part but refuses to replace the one you bought. Unbelievable.

review:
I wanted to play this, and actually manged to get it running...but the game crashing is constant even without all the other insane bugs I managed to fix (like the y and x axis being swapped on the left stick? How, even?!).

I was enjoying this quirky tv show in video game form, but it doesn't seem to be capable of running, so I'm going to say save your time, effort, and money and just watch this one on YouTube.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045726422', 'num_games_owned': 548, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 224, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 224, 'last_played': 1595791793}

author: {'steamid': '76561198081017963', 'num_games_owned': 861, 'num_reviews': 68, 'playtime_forever': 2039, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2039, 'last_played': 1624090262}
review:
Not sure where to start, but i will say i recommend it for those who are into weird, detective, story, plot twist.

The game is about a detective, who is investigating a murder case in some small town, where people know each other, the detective have weird sense of humor, loves movies, you may find that he has split personality, but that will be explained later in the game and reveals the reason of what is going on, so no spoilers here.

Gameplay is average, kinda repetitive, QTE ( quick time events ) can be super fast at times.

i like how randomly while driving a car he starts talking about old movies, he legit gives you brief story about the movie and who are some or the main actor(s) in it, a nice touch.

the story may seem weird, as what you fight has nothing to do much with how the case is going, like you would feel it is weird, but overall, it fills something to do, else the game would be empty and just puzzle solving.

annoyingly enough, on stage 2 i was being hardlocked into a stage where the game crashes, where i had to put compatibility on windows xp sp 2, literally... not win 7 or 8 or even vista, XP...

overall i give it a solid 6.5/10, buy it at discount, the story outside of the weirdness it has, is worth it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198085061022', 'num_games_owned': 1036, 'num_reviews': 143, 'playtime_forever': 1321, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 721, 'last_played': 1634637659}
review: This game is terrible, buggy and great at the same time. Worth at least 1 playtrough.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008417024', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 150, 'playtime_forever': 449, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 456, 'last_played': 1628357614}
review:
It looked charming with the monologues and the B movie atmosphere.
It was so bad that it was funny, really.
But it is too damn broken.

I installed the DPfix, I checked the guidelines for config changes I needed to make.
The number of bugs I encountered and the variety of them was amazing.
I clipped through the floor and died.
The textures for the building did not load.
It crashes when checking the side-missions, sometimes when driving the car, when starting cinematics, when entering some building, etc.
My save was unusable due to saving in a particular location, I grabbed a backups here in the guides.

I am almost sure that the game is fun and that most likely one can find a good conf to make it work good enough to be able to finish it. But for me it wasn't the case, this shit is too broken. And just to add, I have it also on ps3, in which I given up in less time than here, was too buggy as well. A shame, really.

Buggy Premonition: The non-QA Cut
