author: {'steamid': '76561198060409038', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 64, 'playtime_forever': 909, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 609, 'last_played': 1693947507}
review: The game itself is a beautiful disaster, and I honestly love it. The pc port, however, is absolutely terrible. There are some fixes with the community patches and mods that make the game playable for the most part but even with these you will still experience crashing and glitches. If you have access to the PS3 version I'd suggest that instead. The Switch "Origins" version will also work but is a port of the original 360 release and will not feature anything from the Director's Cut.

author: {'steamid': '76561198039559976', 'num_games_owned': 471, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 1719, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1402, 'last_played': 1636587148}
review:
Deadly Premonition is the closest thing there is to a Twin Peaks game. The inspiration is obvious from the start. Small town murder of a young girl, a lone FBI agent comes to investigate, links it to previous cases, takes over the entire case, with many strange townsfolk, dreams, and surreal sequences somehow helping him with the investigation, fourth wall breaks all around. For a bit, that's all the game seems to be. But it quickly develops its own flavour that distinguishes it from Twin Peaks, and it's actually pretty well written for the most part. It gets much more messed up than the original Twin Peaks, and both to it's credit and fault; much more goofy. All in all, this is what gives DP its charm. A wonderful, cheesy game that is plagued by technical issues. 

What are the technical issues then? Let's start with controls. WTF are these controls? Aiming in this game is unnecessarily awkward. By default; left is up, right is down, down is left, up is right. If you invert the vertical axis, that improves the situation by a little bit. Luckily, if you press R2/RT, you automatically centre onto your target, which helps a lot. Another big issue is the random crashing and freezing that happens occasionally. That combined with the tendency of save files to corrupt, you'll need to back up your save file for your own sake. Other than that, graphics in this game are beautiful in how terrible they are. Locked to 720P with a weird green filter, the game looks plastic, the anti-aliasing is horrible. The driving physics are hilarious, you will literally fly with a fast enough car. If you download a file named DPFIX, this will allow you to play on higher resolutions and overall improved graphics. The game then looks a lot better, but certain scenes as well as the pause menu will be darker for some reason (or at least that's what happened to me). Overall, this has to be the worst port of a game I've played in a while, but at the same time, it feels pretty good.

What do I mean? The entire game is like this. It seems like it is a horrid, awful game. But it's actually genius. The characters, the story, and the soundtrack are so likeable, that the faults begin to compliment the positives. I love these types of games,  such as Shenmue, Deus Ex, Oblivion, Chaser, Worms, Postal, etc. The characters in this game are wonderful, especially Special Agent Francis York Morgan and his friend Zach. He's cocky, rude at times, strange, spiteful, but at the same time he is kind, funny, and has a strong moral code. He's an alternative to Dale Cooper, maybe a mix of him and Albert Rosenfield. My favourite pair of characters involve Harry Stewart and his assistant Micheal Tillotson. Stewart is wheelchair-bound and struggles to be heard, so Micheal speaks for him, always in a small poem. There are many other awesome characters, but it's too hard to mention them all.

Another thing that makes DP unique is its combination of genres. It's simultaneously a horror game, a mystery, a fishing simulator, a racing game, and an open world RPG. There a total of 50 sidequests in this game, involving various members of the town. I won't spoil any of them, as they are all quite amusing. The majority of the time the gameplay flow is this: Cutscene, dream sequence, drive around, talk to people (often a cutscene), shoot zombie like enemies in strange mutated versions of in game locations, investigate for clues, run away from the killer, repeat. It's a pretty satisfying loop. There are several weapons in the game; both ranged and melee. That includes pistols, magnums, rifles, shotguns. As well as; pipes, crowbars, swords, axes. An amusing element of this game is that you get paid for nearly everything you do. Whether you shave, save the game, view the weather report, defeat enemies, collect medals or cards, drive around for a while, etc. It's well paid to be an FBI agent, apparently.

The soundtrack is delightful, and it functions the same way the Twin Peaks soundtrack does. There's a song for every situation, emotion, even for some characters. "The Woods and the Goddess" is one of the best songs I've heard in any game. "Life is Beautiful" (the whistle song) is perfect. I can't get it out of my head. It's awesome how many times this song appears in the game, and how frequently it does so in inappropriate situations. Which makes the song all the better. The rest of the soundtrack is spectacular, too. Such as the haunting "Greenvale" that flawlessly encapsulates the entire feeling of the game, reminiscent of the Laura Palmer theme. "FBI Special Agent" is incredible, feels exactly like York. Makes every drive feel important. "Comic Relief" for humorous situations. "Underground" for creepy and mysterious vibes. "After the Rain" for sadness. And a soul-stirring cover of "Amazing Grace" to top it off. A faultless soundtrack, one my favourites.

Deadly Premonition is probably the best game of all time, isn't that right, Zach?

author: {'steamid': '76561198025207250', 'num_games_owned': 522, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 6959, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4874, 'last_played': 1628304771}
review:
This game is like a vintage automobile. It might not run well or even at all at first (there's an easy to follow guide to fix that in the Steam forums), it might be a very bumpy ride, with a lot of outdated parts. But once you get it going, be ready for a wild, memorable experience.

This game feels like if the PS2 Silent Hill games let me play the real world version of the town, full of dialogue written by the writers of every codec conversation in the Metal Gear Solid games, and I think that's the highest praise I could ever give a videogame.

author: {'steamid': '76561198274312900', 'num_games_owned': 346, 'num_reviews': 97, 'playtime_forever': 65, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 33, 'last_played': 1627604121}
review: I have literally never played a game with a port this bad holy shit stay far away lmfao

author: {'steamid': '76561198098121040', 'num_games_owned': 539, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 2190, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 636, 'last_played': 1640130126}
review:
EDIT: My willpower was strong enough to make this port work (with some tips from the game forum), I manage to get every achievement and 100% it little to no issues, which was a stroke of luck. This is one of my favorite games of all time, still though... Cannot recommend this port for the simple sake of it being frustrating to setup and fix, in the case of not being as lucky as me you'll probably hit a wall and just beat yourself to it. Play it on X360 or Nintendo Switch it is worth the price!

Played this game up to Episode 1 Chapter 6 and I had a blast with it's unique dialogue, story and some really weird and funny mechanics. But this is barely playable due to one of the worst PC ports I've ever seen, I cannot recommend anyone to play this at it's state, frequent crashes, freezes, corrupting saves and etc. If you can play the Xbox 360 version, it's the most stable version of this game and it has a nice tint to it. Great game, sadly it's unplayable on PC.

author: {'steamid': '76561198820610718', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1761, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1421, 'last_played': 1668227246}
review: Un juegazo que para nada te recomiendo comprar. El juego desde su concepciÃ³n es un juego defectuoso, pÃ©simo apartado tÃ©cnico y mecÃ¡nicas horribles, cosa que compensa con una historia atrapante y personajes muy buenos. Sin embargo, y por fuera del juego mismo, el port es horrible, constantes crasheos y bugs como el del apuntado que en mi caso no me dejo terminar el juego, teniendo que ver el final en youtube. Sumando todo esto a que la desarrolladora le importo mas bien poco (por no decir absolutamente nada) arreglar los muchos problemas del juego. En resumen, despues haberlo terminado puedo decir que el juego me maravillo, pero en base a todos sus problemas no puedo hacer otra cosa que decirte que lo esquives a toda costa

author: {'steamid': '76561198007837477', 'num_games_owned': 230, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 1403, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1403, 'last_played': 1555587973}
review:
I originally got Deadly Premonition on the XBox 360 and thought I'd add it to my Steam library simply for ease of access.

Bad decision, this is one of the worst ports I've ever made the mistake of purchasing. I come back to it every now and again simply on the off chance it's been patched and fixed, but will now add to my 'Hidden' list.

For anyone who want's the directors cut my advice would be to pick it up on the Playstation store. I did just that and have played it through on my old PS3. PS3 version runs fine.

Highly recommend the game, but not on PC.

author: {'steamid': '76561198074429234', 'num_games_owned': 151, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 616, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 209, 'last_played': 1628995406}
review:
JÃ¡ zerei o jogo no Xbox 360 e resolvi comprar o tÃ£o impopular porte de PC na sale que rolou hÃ¡ alguns dias. 

Em primeiro lugar, Ã© preciso deixar claro que TODAS as versÃµes desse jogo sÃ£o problemÃ¡ticas em alguma medida diferente. A versÃ£o de 360 possui uma boa taxa de quadros, mas, por algum raio de motivo, a cÃ¢mera Ã© travada no ombro do personagem, e vocÃª nÃ£o consegue se orientar nem ver o que acontece. JÃ¡ o PS3 e o Switch rodam na casa dos 20 FPS. 

A versÃ£o de PC, que aqui estÃ¡ sendo analisada, trata-se de um port feito nas coxas, em 720p e 30 FPS, com problemas constantes envolvendo crashes, bugs no Ã¡udio e na saturaÃ§Ã£o das cores, e mapeamento dos botÃµes caso vocÃª jogue com um controle (isso se o controle for reconhecido).

Dito isso, caso vocÃª tenha paciÃªncia para passar umas boas duas horas baixando patches da comunidade e fazendo as configuraÃ§Ãµes necessÃ¡rias para corrigir todos os problemas listados, a versÃ£o de PC Ã©, ironicamente, tambÃ©m a melhor para se jogar Deadly Premonition -- que se beneficia muito bem com 4K, 60 FPS e grÃ¡ficos retrabalhados, fluidez indispensÃ¡vel para deixar um jogo jÃ¡ muito datado para sua Ã©poca adequado para quem deseja visitÃ¡-lo (ou revisitÃ¡-lo) em 2020. 

Feita a longa introduÃ§Ã£o, falarei apenas brevemente do jogo.

Deadly Premonition Ã© um jogo imperfeito, desleixado, travado e feio. Apesar de lanÃ§ado na geraÃ§Ã£o do 360/PS3, parece mais com um do inÃ­cio da geraÃ§Ã£o do PS2. Ainda assim, Ã© um dos mais singulares, originais e fascinantes jogos que vocÃª poderÃ¡ ter o prazer de jogar em sua vida. Enquanto vocÃª joga, vocÃª percebe que Ã© um jogo ambicioso e feito com amor, e que os desenvolvedores deram seu mÃ¡ximo para entregar o que pretendiam, mesmo com todas as limitaÃ§Ãµes orÃ§amentÃ¡rias e de escopo. 

As prÃ³prias limitaÃ§Ãµes do jogo acabam, por vezes, sendo subvertidas e usadas ao seu favor pelos desenvolvedores, que pareciam ter noÃ§Ã£o da falta de polimento do tÃ­tulo. Assim, o jogo muitas vezes adota um tom absurdo e nÃ£o se leva a sÃ©rio, desde os diÃ¡logos e personagens estereotipados, atÃ© o uso de recursos visuais e sonoros "bregas" para lembrar o jogador de que Deadly Premonition deve ser apreciado como um bom B-Movie de terror.

Ainda assim, apesar de toda a tosquice (proposital e acidental), a histÃ³ria aqui contada Ã© fantÃ¡stica, ao ponto de te deixar encarando os crÃ©ditos boquiaberto com o final, que dispensa comentÃ¡rios. Apesar de ser um tÃ­tulo de terror, o gameplay se assemelha muito ao de jogos como Shenmue e Yakuza: vocÃª estÃ¡ em um mundo aberto, e o principal atrativo Ã© a interatividade com tudo o que Ã© aparentemente mundano e ordinÃ¡rio, como pescar, preparar um almoÃ§o ou simplesmente conhecer as pessoas da sua vizinhanÃ§a.

Deadly Premonition nÃ£o Ã© um jogo que vai agradar a todos. Foi feito para agradar um nicho muito especÃ­fico de jogadores com um determinado tipo de sensibilidade. Se vocÃª Ã© fÃ£ de Twin Peaks e jÃ¡ se aventurou por outros "clÃ¡ssicos imperfeitos" (como o prÃ³prio Shenmue citado hÃ¡ pouco), vÃ¡ fundo, pois esse poderÃ¡ se tornar rapidamente um de seus jogos favoritos. Como jÃ¡ mencionado ao inÃ­cio dessa anÃ¡lise, o port de PC Ã© problemÃ¡tico e injogÃ¡vel sem o auxÃ­lio de patches da comunidade e outros ajustes, mas caso vocÃª tenha paciÃªncia para "polir" o jogo, serÃ¡ recompensado com um gameplay fluÃ­do, grÃ¡ficos atualizados e raros problemas tÃ©cnicos. Mas, mesmo assim, pegue-o em uma promoÃ§Ã£o; nÃ£o Ã© muito sÃ¡bio pagar valor cheio em um port problemÃ¡tico que requer esforÃ§o do jogador para funcionar como deveria.

Por fim, caso queiram uma anÃ¡lise real, detalhada e de muito bom gosto do jogo, recomendo que leiam a do site Destructoid, que deu uma nota 10 a Deadly Premonition, mesmo com os inÃºmeros defeitos do jogo. Afinal, Deadly Premonition Ã© -- perdoe-me o clichÃª -- uma experiÃªncia sem igual, e vai te marcar de um jeito que poucos jogos podem ser capazes.

author: {'steamid': '76561198066951939', 'num_games_owned': 1350, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 4121, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4109, 'last_played': 1628890591}
review:
[h1] Odisea de pura locura y misterio[/h1]

Un gran juego que, por cierta serie de televisiÃ³n, me entrÃ³ ganas de jugarlo y ver quÃ© clase de travesÃ­a me encontrarÃ­a con el detective Francis York(?) Morgan.
Ha merecido la pena, totalmente, es un juego tosco en cuanto a mecÃ¡nicas bÃ¡scias se refiere, pero aÃºn asÃ­ le di la oportunidad y resultÃ³ tener lo que me esperaba, una gran historia repleta de locuras y misterios que abundan por nuestro camino.
SÃ© muy bien que son muy pocos los elegidos para poder jugar Deadly Premonition en condiciones "casi" decentes, pero gracias a mÃ­ experiencia con tÃ­tulos similares, he podido jugarlo de manera fluida y [b]sin ningÃºn tipo de cierre (crasheo), o bug que me impida continuar mi aventura.[/b] Es un juego Ãºnico y tedioso, lo cual lo convierte en un tÃ­tulo de nicho. No todos lo disfrutan o siquiera pueden iniciar el juego sin encontrar un problema. En mÃ­ caso, todo fue perfecto. 

Yo intentarÃ© crear una guÃ­a para jugar en Ã³ptimas condiciones. JuguÃ© con el Parche de 4gb y el Compatibility Administrator (32 bits), para que funcionase de la mejor manera, bloqueÃ© los Frames a 30 fps con el RiverTurner y limitÃ© la ResoluciÃ³n a 720p (esto es debido a la resoluciÃ³n de mi laptop). No utilicÃ© el DPFix, asÃ­ que en la prÃ³xima vuelta al juego, intentarÃ© aplicar lo anterior junto con el DPfix para ver quÃ© tal corre el juego en otra PC que tengo por allÃ­, bÃ¡sicamente harÃ© una instalaciÃ³n desde 0 para ver los resultados y comunicar si funciona correctamente.

Vaya juego, satisfecho con la primera parte, ahora a esperar Deadly Premonition 2!!!

author: {'steamid': '76561197996313885', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 137, 'playtime_forever': 157, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 157, 'last_played': 1623973955}
review: I would love to have loved this game, it's absurd and ridiculous in only early PlayStation games can be with their gameplay and narrative but it's just too buggy.  A better port would have saved this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994929587', 'num_games_owned': 336, 'num_reviews': 189, 'playtime_forever': 2136, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2123, 'last_played': 1669049813}
review:
I like this game very much. It could be one of my favirite games, but for me - too much stuff in gameplay department holds this game back and it's not up there. 

[h1] Technical problems. Game often crashes on default launch settings. To anyone who planning to play this game and for some reason reading this exact review, set this game to windows xp (sp2) it would help with crashes, but you will be limited to aim up or down. So when last part of the game wil start, with all bosses - switch to windows 98 compability mode, it will allow you to aim any direction, but will significantly increase loading time[/h1]

I wanted to start my description with a plot. I've played this game just for cutscenes, humor and detective investigation. In my opinion nothing comes close to this game in balance of "who did it" mystery and setting of weird surreal realism. I like attention to the details and characters. Almost every vehicle has it's own music theme which fits it's owner. Even mini games here weird, for example I never see darts like in this game anywhere else. I'm rarely laught at comedies and intentional jokes, but this game just makes me laught all of the time with it's bizzare setups for scenes and surreal humor. Cinematography and music here great too. Some mise-en-scenes are printed in my mind, like [spoiler] shot where Emily and York kissing surrounded by "goddesses of forest" [/spoiler]. Only sometime I feel like music used randomly or without restriction, for example "Miss Stiletto Heels" used too frequently in a last portion of game in my opinion so this track loose it's emotional weight.
And now the thing which hold this game from being a masterpiece for me. It's battle sections. They are nor challenging, nor entertaining. Gameplay itself is junky, but it's not the main problem. Main problem for me is leight of levels. With battle system like this it's just feels like a chore and my brain keep thinking not about evading enemies, but why there's another hall or room? Levels like lumbermill and police station is a nightmare, the're long, not interteining, boring and fill with useless rooms. Worst offender here is long halls with a ceiling ghosts, they constantly get invincible and you're just forced to wait between attacks. 
I'm still very happy that I've played this game. For me the chores of bad battle system, boring levels and even softlocking on final boss (because of the compability mode settings) are worth to be played to see next cutscene or enjoy exploring this weird real-surreal place and characters which inhabit it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027821906', 'num_games_owned': 317, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 380, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 302, 'last_played': 1625247382}
review:
Things to keep in mind before playing:

- DPFix mod is required to play in higher resolutions
- Change your audio settings to 2-channel to avoid constant handbrake noises while driving the police car
- Run the game in compatibility mode for Windows XP to avoid some crashes

This is a terrible PC port. But if you don't mind making these adjustments and some gameplay jank, it's a one of a kind game with really amusing dialogue and an interesting mystery. If you've seen Twin Peaks you'll enjoy it a lot more.

author: {'steamid': '76561199171395804', 'num_games_owned': 285, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 1336, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 571, 'last_played': 1624138349}
review:
As much as I would love to recommand this game, DO NOT GET THE PC VERSION. It's is a mess, even with developper patches and modders patches, basic stuff barely works. There's a an annoying audio bug that will most likely drive you insane unless you cut out SFX entirely, controller is a MASSIVE, MASSIVE pain to get working right, and it will most likely have weird inverted joysticks if you don't get a community scheme. It took me about 3 1/2 to get out the prologue just trying the make the controller work right and fix other issues. 

I absolutely love this game, but do yourself a favor get the vastly superior PS3 or Switch version. At least it doesn't seem  to crash as much as people were saying it would, at least on my case, hopefuly it stays that through the game, because with many paxes and fixes,  managed to get the controller working correctly and got rid of the audio entirely while I play watching YouTube video with the game not in full screen. (Which is a shame because the music is fantastic in this game. It just feels really weird without SFX)

author: {'steamid': '76561198851321849', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 1048, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 898, 'last_played': 1680351534}
review:
This is straight up SCAM

It's claimed to have full controller support. I have Xbox One controller which works in every possible game. But It just doesn't work in this game. Option for using controller is just greyed out.

When I managed to make it work, by making .exe file to run as administrator, it worked.. BUT axis on camera joystick are set wrong! And of course you can't remap them. So you scroll to the left by R joystick UP

author: {'steamid': '76561198118273560', 'num_games_owned': 402, 'num_reviews': 72, 'playtime_forever': 55, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 47, 'last_played': 1622932700}
review:
It's god awful in the same way most B movies are. Let's talk positives.
1. Controls with keyboard and mouse feel alright. Real easy to pick up the combat system.
2. The voice acting isn't terrible when you can hear it.
3. Must be a graphical overhaul cause these don't look as shit as they did before, I feel.

Now the negatives.
1. What's happened so far has made no sense, and it's funny
2. It still looks like shit
3. Why was this man using a laptop and talking on the phone while driving? How was he using the laptop?!

Overall is it bad? Yeah.
Will I recommend it? Oh fuck yeah

author: {'steamid': '76561198326649927', 'num_games_owned': 363, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 1503, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1503, 'last_played': 1622203388}
review:
Good, Janky Twin Peaks + Resident Evil 4 + Mizzurna Falls ripoff. 
A port that is worse than the Xbox 360 original in pretty much every way. Profiling and Predicting when the game will crash is half of the experience. 

If you really wanna play this game, buy it on sale only. Otherwise play the original on the 360 or get the Origins version on Switch.

author: {'steamid': '76561198128506245', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 1831, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1830, 'last_played': 1706652700}
review:
Una piccola chicca del trash.
Consigliato su console con forte sconto e tanta pazienza. 

Il gameplay Ã¨ atroce, graficamente era vecchio giÃ  10 anni fa.
Ma i personaggi assurdi, le atmosfere estranianti ed il caso misterioso ti invogliano a continuare.

PRO: Alienante quasi sempre in senso positivo. 

CONTRO:
-Dura uno sfacelo
-Sound design da galera
-Finale delirante (non in bene), ridondante e frustrante
-Pessimo game design 
-Tediosi spostamento in auto (ovviabili ottenendo la radio in una delle prime side quest) 
-Pochi crash ma in momenti cruciali, salvataggi corrotti, achievement buggati.  
-Caricamenti infiniti e frequenti (anche su SSD). 

Che gran peccato. 


Ringrazio un paio di santi nella comunitÃ  di Steam che spiegano come moddare il gioco (per rimappare i comandi e ridurre -non evitare- i crash).

author: {'steamid': '76561198157671559', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 180, 'playtime_forever': 424, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 423, 'last_played': 1621145103}
review:
I love the atmosphere to this game, the lighting and stuff feels like a dream, the characters are interesting, especially the main character York. The combat is simple but pretty fun and gets the job done. It isn't very hard but the fact that you have infinite ammo makes it simple and sorta mindless fun. The game does feel weirdly immersive despite it's dated graphics. Sadly though after the art gallery section my game has been repeatedly crashing even after restarting my PC,, soo,, yeah it was interesting while it lasted, but I think I'm gonna call it quits here.

I'd recommend playing it just to see what it's like. I had a good time despite the game abruptly ending via constant crashes.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970719364', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 992, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 944, 'last_played': 1622010725}
review:
I was scared to buy the PC version because I have heard plenty of bad things, but I have had no issues so far. I only crashed once after 13 hrs straight of playing. I am not using any mods and using the regular Steam download version.
I do own, and have beaten the game on Nintendo Switch, but I honestly prefer this version better. Its faster than the switch and the Directors Cut items make the weak parts far less annoying/

My only real complaint about the game itself are the contextual button press boss fights. Maybe I drink too much, or smoke too much, but the timing windows are way too small.
The game itself felt like the funny side quests of Yakuza or Dead Rising mixed with the worst parts of Resident Evil 4 combat, when it tries to sprinkle in combat every here and there.

For what it is, it really does manage to hit the same area as Twin Peaks level insane

author: {'steamid': '76561198137065718', 'num_games_owned': 88, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 4931, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4228, 'last_played': 1620784490}
review:
Deadly Premonition is a masterpiece!  A perfect blend of mystery, comedy, horror and life simulator for the Twin Peaks enthusiast or just anyone looking for a good time.  The soundtrack is one of the best--I  listen to it all the time.  The characters are odd and memorable.  The town is huge fun to explore.  Best of all is the murder mystery told with a seamless mixture of the very contrasting elements of absurd silliness and grotesque bloodshed.  One of the only "Lynchian" games ever to succeed at emulating the surreal style of that director.
Its buggy, yes there's no getting around that.  Get ready for crashes.  The combat sections are often insipid or dull.  But don't let it stop you from enjoying one of the best games of the decade.  If "predictable" is something you hate in games than try Deadly Premonition for a truly novel experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028605964', 'num_games_owned': 1767, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 2076, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2076, 'last_played': 1620517299}
review:
â€¢ The launcher doesn't work without elevated privileges.
â€¢ The game itself doesn't work without elevated privileges.
â€¢ Without dpfix, resolution is locked to 1280 x 720.
â€¢ Alt + Tabbing out of the game either halves the game's effective framerate or crashes it entirely.	
â€¢ Sometimes starting the game will permanently tank the framerate for no reason. Normally running at 60 FPS, the game will instead start at 22 FPS and continue to drop as play continues (I stopped at 8 FPS before it could get any worse).
â€¢ Quick time events don't register inputs properly if the framerate drops too much. In these instances, trying to complete the QTEs associated with the Raincoat Killer becomes effectively impossible, resulting in an immediate game over until the framerate issues are fixed.
â€¢ With dpfix, the launcher no longer works, requiring a manual startup from the DP.exe itself.
â€¢ Occasionally, starting the game from DP.exe crashes the game.
â€¢ Steam Overlay crashes the game.
â€¢ After using dpfix, the game's language keeps changing to French for some reason.
â€¢ Setting the game to fullscreen using the launcher causes the game to run windowed, and vice versa.
â€¢ Saving at the wrong time permanently crashes the game when trying to reload the save file, rendering the save completely unusable (this has happened in Episode 1 - Chapter 05, Episode 2 - Chapter 09 & Chapter 12).
â€¢ The art gallery cutscene crashes the game, at the point where Forrest is seen speaking with Diane.
â€¢ Being in the wrong place at the wrong time (such as outside the police station, or a nondescript patch of grass) crashes the game.
â€¢ Smoking at the wrong time crashes the game.
â€¢ Not smoking at the right time crashes the game.
â€¢ Driving on the wrong part of a road crashes the game.
â€¢ Driving the wrong car crashes the game.
â€¢ Using flares to get a car that won't crash the game at the wrong time locks the game, rendering it unplayable.
â€¢ Going near the gas station crashes the game.
â€¢ The leg bone's connected to the -- crashed game.
â€¢ Opening the game days later to play it again crashes the game.
â€¢ Running the game in the 'wrong' compatibility mode will sometimes prevent the game opening altogether, even when it had worked previously.
â€¢ Trying to eat big dinner crashes the game.
â€¢ Walking near Emily's police truck during the stakeout crashes the game.
â€¢ Virtually every time the game is saved the game will crash shortly after.
â€¢ Helping the general with his junk crashes the game.
â€¢ Trying to collect specific trading cards (No. 30 - Gina) crashes the game.
â€¢ Getting the [Lollipop] tooltip on loading screens will sometimes crash the game.
â€¢ When tailing Nick's car in Episode 2 - Chapter 12, there are occasions where his car will be unable to gain enough speed to move up inclines, preventing the mission from proceeding and resulting in an automatic failure (the only way to fix this issue was to cap my framerate at 60 and ensure I was more than 100 yards away from him as his car went up the hill).
â€¢ Going down a ladder in a cutscene crashes the game.
â€¢ Going into a highlighted area the game expects you to go to (just outside the hotel) crashes the game.
â€¢ Trying to enter the diner through the back door crashes the game.
â€¢ Going near the police truck parked on the grass next to the diner crashes the game.
â€¢ Talking to Gina at the gas station crashes the game.
â€¢ In one instance while driving, York said to himself "...Hm? Nothing, just my imagination." followed by the immediate explosion of the car he was driving, treating me to an unceremonious game over (my car was at 33% durability at the time).
â€¢ Going near stairs during one of the final segments crashes the game.
â€¢ Completing a QTE during the final boss in a way the game seemingly does not like crashes the game.
â€¢ Doing a twirl during the final boss crashes the game.

Total playtime on Steam at the time of review: 34.6 hours
Actual playtime: 14.25 hours

author: {'steamid': '76561197994333165', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 100, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 69, 'last_played': 1627284412}
review:
Deadly Premonition is the greatest Dreamcast game never released. It is an ambitious, sloppy, incomprehensible, and downright insane love letter to one of the most equally ambitious shows to ever air on television.

It's terrible. I love it. Track down a copy for the PS3, Xbox 360, or Switch. Just don't buy it on PC.

author: {'steamid': '76561198203299588', 'num_games_owned': 630, 'num_reviews': 182, 'playtime_forever': 1155, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 554, 'last_played': 1693322262}
review:
Edit: If you have Window's 10, this will run just fine without any issues unless you have hardware issues. Just be sure if you are going to play with a controller you use a custom configuration for the controller from the Community, since for some odd reason the game has a X axis issue. If you get both of those, YES THE GAME IS WORTH IT. If you have windows 11 read below.

Let me start this off by saying if you can get this game on sale for anywhere under $5 it is absolutely worth the price on Steam... But with that being said if it IS NOT on sale STAY AWAY from this version i do not know why any developer would port games from console to PC without trying to test it and fix there issues. The PC version is pretty awful, nothing to do with the frame rate on my Nvidia 1050 you can get 60fps without any real trouble, my issues come in the form of two VERY BIG problems, One being that for some reason randomly my game will just minimize for absolutely no reason, Not Close but it will just Minimize and that gets irritating if you are either getting immersed or having fun playing the game, and i have not been able to fix that. and Number Two being the lack of the controller support functioning correctly even with downloaded custom patches that say (IT WORKS) spoiler alert IT DOESN'T. The PS3 Version has shit framerate at most times but i can still finish that version without it crashing. If you REALLY WANT to play this game, the main version is backwards compatible on Xbox One and it runs very smooth, it is a fantastic experience and the game is one of a kind, yes it can be very weird, yes the gameplay can get repetitive, but if you haven't been spoiled on the story of this game it is a fantastic time from start to finish, never have i once got bored with the games story (although there are occasional [Follow this character] Missions that do get real annoying killing the speed you wish to go) But the Xbox 360 Version of Deadly Premonition is your best bet if you want the best overall experience, if you want to see the new Directors Cut scenes just look them up on YouTube, you aren't missing much there.

author: {'steamid': '76561198059754051', 'num_games_owned': 1382, 'num_reviews': 282, 'playtime_forever': 1241, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1188, 'last_played': 1618082013}
review:
The love child of Resident Evil and The X-Files, Deadly Premonition is a wonderful game with a tremendous surreal detective story that will leave you in awe. As FBI agent Francis York Morgan, your task is to travel to the small town of Greenvale and find out what supernatural forces are sowing sorrow among the citizens. The plot is one of the most captivating video game stories I've seen - it has a great setting, very developed and unique characters with professional voice-acting, as well as many tasteful plot twists. And while it could be classified as a horror game, many of its moments are intentionally humorous. One would doubt how such a combo could ever work but amazingly it does here. All the emotions, all the tone changes are also felt through the brilliant soundtrack. It all created an experience where the more I played, the more I wanted the game to never end.

Sadly there are also plenty weak points in Deadly Premonition. You can see everywhere that this was a budget title - the graphics (almost terrible), the UI (counterintuitive, outdated and clumsy), the controls (god the atrocious controls...), the animations (wooden and repeated), the world design (a huge map with forced long journeys in cars that barely handle), the scandalous achievements (their descriptions are pure spoilers, who in their right mind would do that?) and don't get me started about the technical problems the PC port has... In order to run this game and make it playable, one needs to apply a handful of fixes/patches and then some (look up Steam guides - there are a few good fix collections packed in one place for you to download). Once you get it running it will crash every once in a while - some of these crashes you'll overcome by relaunching the game whereas some other crashes may corrupt your save data and you'll need to download a savegame made after that point to continue the story. I'm sure I missed some, but in any case this problematic side is hell.

When you sum up the downsides it may seem like this game is not even worth trying due to its issues, but I assure you - it's perfectly playable with a little effort. And I encourage all who love a good supernatural mystery to give Deadly Premonition a shot -  it's a most enjoyable, spooky and fun experience that had me thinking about it long after I'd turned it off.

P.S. Deadly Premonition 2 is coming to Steam. I'm afraid I'll buy it as soon as it hits the shelves. And I never ever do that with games.

author: {'steamid': '76561199056476190', 'num_games_owned': 172, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 269, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 197, 'last_played': 1618368970}

author: {'steamid': '76561198088480801', 'num_games_owned': 478, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1668, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1606, 'last_played': 1617962883}
review: I would recommend this game. I wouldn't recommend this specific port. It's an absolute pain to get it to run but once you do, it's great all the way through. You will have to run it as an admin in compatibility mode either on XP service pack 2 or Windows 98 as well as installing a fan made patch. I recommend getting the game either on Switch, Xbox 360 or PS3 which can be a bit irritating considering the discs are so expensive to buy now. If playing another way isn't a possibility, I would consider the game worth fixing just to play through at least once. For the money, I'm disappointed Rising Star Games haven't even tried fixing the port considering the sheer amount of problems it has but I've never seen a game with this exact kind of Twin Peaks style before.

author: {'steamid': '76561198036309579', 'num_games_owned': 439, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 22, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 22, 'last_played': 1403569273}
review:
[This review was made after multiple playthroughs on Xbox 360]

Want a bit of japanese-styled David Lynch experience? Then this is it. This game may have wonky controls, PS2-era graphics  and a pretty shaby intro, but what makes this game a one of a kind are the characters and the writing. Francis York Morgan became one of my favorite video game protagonist with all his movie talks and his weird personality and every residents of Greenvale had a unique side of them which made them charming. This is like a budget cross-over between Silent Hill and Resident Evil 4, but this game still had a lasting impact on me when I first played it in 2010. Thank you York for taking me with you on your case about Greenvale. This was a hell of a ride, isn't that right, Zack?

author: {'steamid': '76561199024836865', 'num_games_owned': 373, 'num_reviews': 97, 'playtime_forever': 1353, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1353, 'last_played': 1617279093}

author: {'steamid': '76561198106868575', 'num_games_owned': 792, 'num_reviews': 114, 'playtime_forever': 90, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 61, 'last_played': 1617346172}
review:
I've played it on PS3 and had to get it on PC for the mods. YOU SHOULD INSTALL THE MODS LISTED IN THE COMMUNITY TAB TO GET BETTER QUALITY AND SO THAT IT WON'T CRASH ON YOU KTHX :o)

If you haven't seen Twin Peaks (First of all, WHAT ARE YOU DOING?!), it's an older show from the late 80s/early 90s that was on normal cable TV despite it being "surreal, horrifying, gory, yet wholesome and hammy". This game is what would happen if Twin Peaks happened in another universe. The feel is there. It feels as if the developers got a hold of David Lynch and he said, "Yeah, that looks like Naomi Watts! I'll make sure to put her in Season 3 of Twin Peaks in 2017." (And he did)

There's something beautiful here. Lots of absurd comedy and lovey dovey moments mixed with violence, creepiness, and rich in mystery. And oh yeah, make sure you download the DPfix files so it will run better and look prettier.  

10 out of 10 damn good cups of coffee.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044265623', 'num_games_owned': 602, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 1199, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1199, 'last_played': 1617150993}
review:
This game is one of the most suspenseful and scary games I have played in years. You never know if you will get to the save point because if you donâ€™t and it crashes, you have to go through a walk/running segment all over again. I was naive and thought that other players just werenâ€™t willing to go out of their way to fix the game with constant bugs. I thought â€œWow, I can just install this fan patch and deal with some minor crashes here and there. It will be easy.â€

No I was wrong, very very wrong. This game crashed on nearly every end of every chapter. I was even hard stuck on chapter 16 and had to get another save file. It is unbelievable to me how bad of a state this game is on PC. Buyers seriously beware, if you do not want to tinker and try to fix things with this game then donâ€™t bother. It REALLY is as bad as others and I say.

However, if you get past that. This game is incredible. Being an FBI detective with an imaginary friend creates wonderful dialog along with the other oddities that happen throughout the town. About 80% of the cutscenes have something to have a giggle at. Whether that be writing, delivery, sound mixing, graphical bugs, physics with the game. Itâ€™s just great. As for gameplay, it is honestly quite bad. It is even worse than a poor mans Resident Evil 4. Enemies are barely a threat, you have a pistol with unlimited ammo, and you just shoot stuff until it dies. If they get too close just hold your breath and they will not attack you. Most melee weapons can only be used on enemies about 10 times before breaking. You can get unnecessary points for doing â€œthingsâ€ around town and also collect them. There are side quest and trading cards however I didnâ€™t try hard to get them due to being afraid of the game crashing (maybe some day). Puzzles are hardly even there. The answer is always a straight line with absolutely nothing puzzling.

But even then, with all these complaints and all of these crashes. I could not put this game down. It was a hilarious ride and I loved it all. There is something charming and lovable with all the characters. This game really is all about its story, universe, and soundtrack. However, admittedly, if I would ever do this again I would buy the switch version. This port is truly terrible something to behold. Thatâ€™s why even though I really loved the game, I cannot recommend it in good conscience. If it ever gets a patch, you best believe this is getting flipped to a recommendation.

Here are random fixes that may help you get past a crash.
-Smoke to past the time to a certain time of day
-Lower the refresh rate
-Run the game as Admin
-Run the game in various versions of windows through compatibility mode
-Press escape on black screens (this is when cutscenes donâ€™t trigger properly)
-Download another save from someone else
-Disable steam overlay

Good luck if you end up trying to run with it!

author: {'steamid': '76561197987490467', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 63, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 63, 'last_played': 1616915970}
review:
This is a buggy, awful, mess of a PC port that feels like it's held together with paper clips. However, I have gotten more enjoyment out of 1 hour of this game than I have many of the recent AAA blockbuster titles. I honestly can't tell how much of this game was meant to be absurd and how much of it is unintentional. This game is something of a happy accident, and I now finally understand why it has something of a cult following.

While I think this game is absolutely worth checking out, I cannot in good conscience give it a recommendation due to its state on PC. If you can get a hold of the Xbox360 version; play that instead. If you can't, then this version is probably worth 5-10 bucks if you are willing to fiddle with it and deal with random crashing.

PS: For those who decide to take the plunge on PC and are on Windows 10, I will give you a tip and save you some time. Right click the game executable, go to properties, then compatibility tab, and set it to Windows XP SP 3 mode or else the game will run like a slide show. Also I have had the best luck just running it windows, as painful as that sounds.

author: {'steamid': '76561198182887811', 'num_games_owned': 607, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 4236, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1371, 'last_played': 1658202303}
review:
Deadly Premonition 
This is a game i would recommend but NOT on steam if you're looking for a stable port

Deadly Premonition is a game i first picked up back in college for the Xbox 360. I asked a staff member if they'd recommend any games on a certain shelf (cheapish) and Deadly Premonition was the first one
On the 360 i loved the game, it took me a few hours to really get into it but once the story started coming together i was really enjoying the game and wanted more.
I figured out pretty well who the killer was before the ending of the game although the last few chapters did mislead me and make me question my prediction 

So, this port the main issue's are the game crashes, the game will randomly at any point shut itself down and leave you feeling like a virgin being stood up
i have had numerous crashes so far, there are some help guides online which i've used and running the DPlauncher as admin helped a bit but the crashes are still happening. It's a shame as this game is really good and underrated. If you play this be sure to safe extremely often as you might find yourself having to repeat any story from your last save.

As for controls i couldn't find a way to get the controller to work even though it says controller is supported but i'm happy using Mouse/KB so no loss for me. Shooting is a little clunky but free roam with a mouse is better and is near enough the same as the 360 version and easy to use. The weapons you get are multiple blunt/sharp objects and firearms which are good to switch into on different enemies

Driving is still as clunky as the 360 version, you kind of get used to it after a while but i find myself flipping more cars than i did when working in fast food, you can have your own car and different police cars and using  the sirens to go faster

I'm not sure if it's me but the colour seems to be very bland in comparison to the xbox version but that could be bad memory, it doesn't effect gameplay or cutscenes though

Graphics are dated but i've seen worse, there is the odd graphical glitch ere or there like a coat becoming intertwined with other clothing but again, nothing game breaking 

I know it may seem weird that i recommend the game but if you can stop the game crashing it's a great game, with a cool story, side quests to keep you busy, collectables to find and even fishing and races

One of my favourite things from Deadly Premonition though is definitely the unique soundtrack, it's a drawing point as i've not heard a soundtrack like it before but i love it.
Plenty of backstory for characters main and side and constant convo's with Zack to keep you in the loop of what's happening 

So, main story (no spoilers) You come to a small town in the middle of nowhere, there has been a murder and its' your job to solve it, the game does this very interestingly and makes each place unique with you finding clues in each locations giving you more and more leads, but with public getting in the way, who's the murderer?!

Great game, Fun story, easy combat, let down by bad stability in the port
Don't let yourself go without playing this!

author: {'steamid': '76561198376916468', 'num_games_owned': 290, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 211, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5, 'last_played': 1682963538}

author: {'steamid': '76561198048402604', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 412, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 412, 'last_played': 1616264257}
review:
I should have heeded the warnings, but, I desperately wanted to play this game for myself and experience it's cliche's in all it's glory.  Sadly, I don't have the patience to deal with the game freezing up on cutscene's which happens frequently enough that it ruins the immersion of the game for me.

Yes, there are fixes out there, not sure if any can work for Windows 10 though (I use Windows 8).  But, I don't much like the idea of downloading some sketchy files onto my computer in order to get a game running smoothly and not be reassured 100% effectiveness anyway that these fixes are gonna work for me.  Instead I looked up other fixes (safer) that got me past one set of freezes only to be thwarted by more later on.

Too much work imho to get the game playable.  I got enough out of it to know that I would enjoy playing the rest of it, but I still can't recommend because it does need a ReMaster or something to bring it up to speed with newer OS's and fixing the problems with cutscene's and whatever else is plaguing the game I haven't experienced yet.

author: {'steamid': '76561198057900166', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 2178, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2178, 'last_played': 1595463400}
review:
This game is a ride. If you strap yourself in and say "I'm gonna go for the ride" then you'll have a good time. If at any point you say 

"Who designed this ride? It's stupid, i'm better than this, my time is valuable and this ride is wasting it." 

Then your missing the point. Your not better than this. This isn't a game. Its a vibe, its a moment, it's an experience, and it doesn't run on PC. It'll probably crash consistently at the same save point and you wont be able to finish like me. 

Amazing game 12/10 would debate the rice crispy sandwich with the rhyming butler again. Probably should buy it on switch or 360.

author: {'steamid': '76561198183956818', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 242, 'playtime_forever': 2218, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1467, 'last_played': 1615155621}
review:
Finally managed to fix all the technical issues with this game, and I'm really glad because it's awesome and one of a kind that I'd never want to miss; there aren't many Twin Peaks games around. 

To enjoy this game without breaking your keyboard in frustration you ABSOLUTELY HAVE TO do the below:

1. Install the DPfix which will help with the graphics 
https://steamcommunity.com/app/247660/discussions/0/792924953013802599/?l=english

2. Apply the Large Address Aware modification to DP.exe and create a desktop shortcut directly to it (using the launcher made it crash for me), this will fix most crashes including the infamous chapter 9 ones
https://www.techpowerup.com/forums/threads/large-address-aware.112556/

3. Set DP.exe to compatibility mode with WinXP SP2 (some people recommended win 98 but that made it crash for me; your results may vary), this also helped with early crashes

author: {'steamid': '76561197997678124', 'num_games_owned': 1625, 'num_reviews': 441, 'playtime_forever': 170, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 170, 'last_played': 1601553330}
review:
The mixed reviews are correct here. This game is a terrible masterpiece. 

Within the fashion world, we would call this game 'Haute Couture'. It's so terrible that you love it. 

I didn't have the mental stamina required to slog through this bugfest, but I really appreciated the dialogue and the story at the same time. Should it be $24.99? Probably not. This title would probably sell many more copies if it were closer to $9.99. 

If you've got a soft spot for older survival horror with a sort of 'arcadey' feel to it, this'll be right up your alley. If you can find it on console instead of PC, you will probably have a better time. 

Purchase at your own discretion, friends. <3

author: {'steamid': '76561198038293797', 'num_games_owned': 651, 'num_reviews': 127, 'playtime_forever': 3861, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3861, 'last_played': 1600593190}
review:
Overall, I would say that this would probably be considered one of the best survival horror games of all time had it been released a decade or so ago. As such, the game itself feels like a relic from another era.
In terms of presentation, the game is woefully outdated. The graphics would only be impressive if it was released on the Dreamcast or PS2. The mapping and guidance system, which is seemingly borrowed from GTA is just plain terrible, when you consider how big the map is. Also, there are maybe five or six character models for enemies throughout the game. Finally, the sound during the combat missions basically consists of the enemies muttering the same two phrases over and over again. That said, Deadly Premonition offers something downright inspiring for every one of its technical shortcomings. There's an ugly world thick with idiosyncrasies and history and a fascinating lead in Agent Francis York Morgan. Even though it reminded me of some other games, it's really a mixed bag and in a league of it's own. I didn't mind that it switched genres back and forth from a Resident Evil style survival horror, to a crime thriller, to a semi-open world with random quests and people to talk to. 
Throughout Deadly Premonition, you'll find yourself in very odd situations punctuated by Agent York. This is where the game absolutely shines; the surreal interaction between York and the townsfolk, as well as the interaction between York and himself can only be described as a work of art. In a town where crimes can be solved by shooting bird nests with shotguns, trees drop severed hands that can be used as doorknobs, and countless giant dogs fall out of the sky at midnight. The game contains an intangible, eccentric atmosphere which easily overshadows its many shortcomings. This is a game simply overflowing with a vivid personality and bizarre charm. I enjoyed the diversity of the characters and the atmosphere of the town.
Ultimately I enjoyed the game, If you're the kind of person who is willing to look past the flaws and see a game as a whole, you'll have a lot of fun. Irregardless, Deadly Premonition is one of the most incredible games ever made with it's unmatched characterisation and unique story that will have you guessing as to who the Raincoat Killer is until the very end. However, this game is not for everyone; some would find themselves unsatisfied with the somewhat repetitive combat and the confusing endgame twists involving certain characters. More still will find themselves unable to stomach the odd character animations or the excessively large map.

author: {'steamid': '76561197979205126', 'num_games_owned': 957, 'num_reviews': 76, 'playtime_forever': 307, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 215, 'last_played': 1696111566}

author: {'steamid': '76561198060039541', 'num_games_owned': 848, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 44, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 44, 'last_played': 1610251169}
review:
Played Deadly Premonition countless times before across Xbox and Switch, so I figured it was time to give the PC port the good old college try.

The intro cutscene ended with a watermark for free video re-encoding software, and performance drastically dropped after briefly alt-tabbing to Discord. I think that about sums up this port and that's a shame.

Deadly Premonition is absolutely a diamond in the rough. Flawed, but ambitious and full of heart with a gripping story to boot. It's a shame that all the ports made the diamond rougher, but its the PC version that carries the most issues thanks to its strange limitations and countless technical issues. It was bad enough for me to barely want to play further into the prologue.

If you're going to play Deadly Premonition - which I do recommend along with its sequel (and most Swery games) - play the Xbox version or Switch port.

review:

Tout ce qui a Ã©tÃ© Ã©crit de nÃ©gatif sur le jeu est vrai : ses passages de tir peuvent Ãªtre vus comme hors-sujet et cassant le rythme, ses graphismes Ã©taient plus que datÃ©s Ã  la sortie du jeu (mÃªme si c'est finalement assez peu important 10 ans aprÃ¨s), les environnements sont vides, la boucle de gameplay est rÃ©pÃ©titive.

Mais il y a quelque chose qui fonctionne, dans son ambiance, dans ses personnages, dans l'ambition du titre qui permet de visiter une petite ville...
Enfin, je dis "fonctionne" mais je devrais dire "fonctionnait". AprÃ¨s environ 6 heures de jeu le jeu se met Ã  crasher systÃ©matiquement quand je sors de ma chambre dâ€™hÃ´tel. Deadly Premonition est certes un jeu qu'on a envie de dÃ©fendre malgrÃ© son cÃ´tÃ© fauchÃ© mais la version PC et ses bugs le rendant littÃ©ralement injouable le transforme en ma pire frustration vidÃ©o-ludique de l'annÃ©e 2020.

author: {'steamid': '76561197984915688', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 476, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 421, 'last_played': 1609110214}
review: I played this game originally on the PS3 way back when, but recently took to playing it again on PC and I love so much about it, but it's such a poorly made game. It's not a "so-bad-it's-good" sort of thing either, it's legitimately a great game that is unfortunately marred by a multitude of technical issues, poor controls, terrible graphics. Overall the positives outweigh the negatives however, and what you get is a completely unique game with great characters and a lot of soul.

author: {'steamid': '76561198092578632', 'num_games_owned': 851, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 1677, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1677, 'last_played': 1590862148}
review:
I had a great time with this game, the world and characters are definitely a highlight. Very similar to the show Twin Peaks with the small town murder mystery and very very strange characters. It gets weirder as it goes on with plenty of crazy twists and conspiracies. The dialogue is also very entertaining and the line deliveries make it even better.

I installed the community fixes for this game and was actually able to run it almost perfectly from start to finish. The only problem I encountered was that my controller stopped working halfway through my playthrough and I had to switch to keyboard and mouse. Controller is definately superior, but I got by fine on Keyboard and mouse. I was almost always able to get a framerate over 60fps in 1440p too. If you can find this game for a couple bucks, try it, I absolutely loved it and would highly recommend it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067858808', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 3638, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3638, 'last_played': 1607727080}
{'steamid': '76561197999307974', 'num_games_owned': 786, 'num_reviews': 180, 'playtime_forever': 2154, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 256, 'last_played': 1610241975}
review:
This game is good. In a bad-good way, [i]a la[/i] The Room. OK? OK.

I would also say it is bad-good in the same vein as Twin Peaks, but some people actually like that program? So take that how you will. There's numerous allusions and homage-stylings to Twin Peaks, and it's by far the strongest influence on the game, but what you have is that sort of a detective story - which already features an idiosyncratically bizarre protagonist, and a definitely-dementia-rattled director, [i]through the lens of a Japanese indie developer.[/i] That prospect alone is enough to sell the game, I think. 

More towards the point of a negative review, it is imperative that you are aware it is buggy as sh*t. 

Controllers don't work natively (or at least my 360 one doesn't); the game is liable to crash (I had about one every 5 hours, except for one reliable crash that mandated XP compatibility mode). If you're okay with installing 13+ pieces of remedial malware to get it to operate, that's great - and power to you! - but I think a positive review should be, as a low bar, predicated upon the game working "out of the box."

Beyond that, there's a number of frankly idiotic design choices. The game operates on an internal 24-hour clock, which is fine; the town often feels lively because of it. But all the mechanisms of interacting with it - sleeping and smoking - are painstakingly slow. Some events only happen at specific times, and both the game and the guide world are fairly quiet on this front - you've gotta tap into the logic of idiocy for it. There's also a weather system, which restricts some events, and enables others - this is fine; the game explores it in-universe - but once again it creates an [b]arbitrary block on accessibility of certain events.[/b] As far as I can tell, rain is a random (though frequent enough) occurence - but it [b]never improved my experience[/b] as a timing system. It was strictly questionable. Combine that with the knowledge that completionism, postgame, relies on infrequent saves (specifically, you lose the ability to save mid-game, and instead must finish the "chapter" you're playing to save - why? What the f*ck?). This compounds the issues of crashes with inaccessibility to create a very... unenjoyable environment.

review:
This game appears to be broken and does not appear to have any fixes planned for it.

- The controller doesn't work well if at all.

- I will look into finding ways to play the game but I am not going to invest hours into it.

Update:
- I spent about 2 hours looking up fixes and stuff for this game. Nothing actually makes this game playable. Don't waste your time with this game. It does not work.

author: {'steamid': '76561197961140452', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1230, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1230, 'last_played': 1404563154}
review: There has to be a ton of reviews linking this to David Lynch and Twin Peaks... and those reviews are right.  This will feel like it has "cult classic" status in the first 20 minutes of the game.  It's a diamond in the rough and the rough is the game itself.  Some of my favorite moments is the monologue (or is it dialogue??) in the car rides where you get neat factoids of famous movies.  So strap in for a weird and wild ride as you go back in time to the good old Dreamcast days of third person games and solve the mystery that has lead FBI Special Agent Francis York Morgan to Greenvale, Washington.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013866056', 'num_games_owned': 2627, 'num_reviews': 308, 'playtime_forever': 246, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 246, 'last_played': 1440734577}
review:
The greatest mess in gaming. Deadly Premonition is a mystery action adventure game with a town and characters inspired by media like Twin Peaks and a tone that can shift from brutal and bloody to light and absurdly humorous. 

Poor graphics, poor controls, poor driving, poor UI, annoying timed event system, bugs, dull and slow combat (though with some ok enemy designs), all dated in every way (even for when the game first released in 2010). But it is the story, characters, the town itself, the often catchy and good music, and the awkward dialogue and acting that all come together in a way that just works perfectly that makes the game worth playing even with all the other problems, at times even making some of those downsides almost charming. 

In many ways a terrible game, but even with the over 3,000 games I've played, Deadly Premonition is one of my favorites with one of the best settings and most memorable protagonists I've experienced.


Better played on one of the consoles for stability if you are able to.

author: {'steamid': '76561198016843334', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 12, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12, 'last_played': 1606162937}
review:
I donâ€™t even know how to describe my experience with this game. Deadly Premonition: Directorâ€™s Cut is one of the best AND worst games I have ever played. And I think that contradiction perfectly summarizes the experience.

Letâ€™s talk about the (quite abundant) bad first: Tech and gameplay wise this is a terrible game, I had an awful experience playing it. The controls are abysmal (that camera control for Christâ€™s sake!), there are endless bugs in the open world, the NPCs AI and the physics engine are a smorgasbord of errors, the performance is hit and miss (I had rock solid 60fps sessions and sub-20fps ones, sometimes in the same area and chapter), and donâ€™t even get me started with the stability. The game was a constant festival of crashes, and they seemed to happen at total random so I couldnâ€™t see them coming. Sometimes it crashed indoors, sometimes outdoors, sometimes during a cutscene, a conversation, a loading screenâ€¦ for me, this was the most nightmarish horror game because I played in a state of constant, increasing tension before I reached a new phone (not to save the game, but to be sure that the next crash wouldnâ€™t restart me from too long ago).

The gameplay is also absolutely dated. The missions are boring as hell, the combat system is clunky, the enemy variety is non-existent and the very few boss battles have positively nothing special. Driving around Greenvale is a pain with almost every car in the game, the map confuses you instead of being of any assistance, and the music tracks, albeit quite fine, are very scarce and play over and over again... Also, during cutscenes, the voices are almost every time out of sync and the character animations rarely fit the tone of their dialogue, producing some unsettling feeling while youâ€™re watching them.

But, you know what? Iâ€¦ actually enjoyed Deadly Premonition. I can definitely understand its â€˜cult classicâ€™ appeal.

The story is super interesting and always leaves you wanting to know more and more. The game world is very believable and the characters that inhabit in it are (at least the main ones) properly fleshed out (their voice acting is actually very good as well). Despite the obvious influence from David Lynchâ€™s work, Deadly Premonition is able to find its own unique personality and direction, and it does it with an endless supply of charm and uniqueness. The story it tells is so engaging that you start overlooking its very obvious and painful flaws and just focus on moving forward as York continues to delve deeper and deeper in the mystery of the Raincoat Killer. Every new twist and turn keeps you on your toes and Swery even manages to save some surprises until the very end. The writing here is top-notch, a surprising gem.

I guess thatâ€™s where the love of its super hardcore fanbase comes from. Deadly Premonition is so good and unique at its core that you forgive its limitations and errors to a point in which they donâ€™t even matter in your experience anymore, despite constituting 90% of it.

I screamed at the screen in frustration an infinite amount of times, I wanted to kill its creators over some god-awful design choices, or every time the game randomly crashed or made me close and restart my computer. However, I couldnâ€™t stop playing; its weirdness captivates you like very few other games in existence, casting a spell over you that numbs your senses and good jugdgment, and in the end only good memories remain.


I canâ€™t recommend this game to anyone, but I still had a memorable time with it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198058319627', 'num_games_owned': 483, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 607, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 607, 'last_played': 1594952759}
review:
One of my all-time favorites, but not on PC. Think Twin Peaks if it was written by a Japanese man who only loosely watched the pilot episode, and just tried guessing the rest of the plot. Please play this game on any other system if that sounds even remotely up your alley.

I had to give up and play on console about 8 or so hours into my playthrough due to a known savegame corrupting bug. I now know there are workarounds and savegames online to maneuver around said corruption trigger, but that was the tipping point when combined with the PC exclusive bugs and constant crashes every 5-15 minutes.

author: {'steamid': '76561198076258659', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 203, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 203, 'last_played': 1604268035}
review: A game that's over the top, but tries to take itself seriously as a horror game. Despite this, it's somehow hilariously epic. Good for the reasons it probably wasn't made to be good for.

author: {'steamid': '76561198075659486', 'num_games_owned': 221, 'num_reviews': 99, 'playtime_forever': 774, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 774, 'last_played': 1603509291}
review: I don't even know how to describe this game, it starts out like some kind of Evil Dead for the PS1 and then it starts to feel like Alan Wake but then it goes all GTA San Andreas, The Witcher 1 mixed with some cliche 90's tv show, but then the protagonist starts to talk to that Zach guy and suddenly you are in the same place but the whole place has went Silent Hill mode mixed with Resident Evil and before you know it you are back to San Andreas. IDK the game itself is like some hot garbage but it is good somehow, I guess the best analogy I can come up with is like when you see a meal and it looks like vomit but it actually tastes 10 times better than what it looks like. Also I could not play this game for 2 hours because I was actually trying to make the damn thing work but once you get it working it is actually fun and IDK why cuz everything about this game is just so bad hahaha... Yea I will recommend it 7.5/10 it's good but it annoyed me so much the game doesn't work without 1000000 patches and fixes.

author: {'steamid': '76561198083490861', 'num_games_owned': 1461, 'num_reviews': 135, 'playtime_forever': 1922, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1922, 'last_played': 1604064117}
review: This game is bad to look at and painful to play sometimes, I almost quit it since it was so buggy. My game would crash on me a bunch at some point. Even to this day I have no idea how it just fixed itself and it suddenly felt better, but I'm so happy I got to play it till the end of the stupidest boss battles I've ever played. The lore, the characters, the silly music with it's sound effects - I learned to love it more and more. I didn't take this game seriously right from the start, because I was under impression that it was just goofy and making fun of B-movies mostly. But as I got closer to the ending, I got more and more attached to little Greenvale and to its residents. This goofy game actually stirred up some feelings in me like a perfectly stirred up coffee with FK initials swimming in it. This game has a personality that a lot of other games are lacking. A real gem that people don't create anymore. It's all worth it for its amazing ending.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995373452', 'num_games_owned': 1492, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1491, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1491, 'last_played': 1604005075}
review:
Once you get past the rendering weirdness and the occasional crash, Deadly Premonition turns out to be an oddly charming little game.

Is it the best game? No. Is it a GOOD game? Arguable, for the following reasons:
-The controls are a little clumsy
-Vehicle physics are *weird*
-There's not a lot of enemy variety (I counted 3 types and 3 bosses)
-Weapons feel a little anaemic

But here's the thing... It's a really nice game all the same. What should have been downsides that would normally make me go 'no, it's bad, avoid' wound up being paired up with a really compelling story that just... charms you, and you find *everything* just adds up to be an honest and earnest attempt at making a really good story into a good game.

Definitely consider picking it up when on sale - and grab DPFix by Durante when you do so!

author: {'steamid': '76561198018941044', 'num_games_owned': 450, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 272, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 124, 'last_played': 1603729302}
review:
This title can be summed up in one word I feel.
>Trash<

But oh boy what kind of trash it is. It's probably one of the finest pieces of trash out there.
You know what they say. One mans trash is another mans treasure.

When you buy this you are spending your money on an elaborate hoax and even though you are probably aware that you are being hoaxed you cannot help but sit and watch in awe as the madness of this title unfolds.

"What the Fuck" is what you'll be saying more than once throughout your playtime here.
One weird ass cutscene is chasing another, connected by the jankiest gameplay you'll ever see.
And the soundtrack. It's on another level.

I cannot decide whether the developer is joking, creating some avant-garde art game or if it was a serious attempt at creating whatever the hell this is.

Again, it is serious jank, but it is the loveliest jank that I've ever played.

author: {'steamid': '76561198038922945', 'num_games_owned': 1137, 'num_reviews': 79, 'playtime_forever': 1512, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1512, 'last_played': 1610251918}
review:
The game is worth playing. The shooting sections are fairly janky and sometimes drag on too long, but the story and general writing make it worth playing. The story is absolutely insane, and barely lost anything during my replay on this version. York is at least in the top 10 video game protagonists. Driving around town doing sidequests and interacting with its inhabitants also has its charm.

This Director's Cut port however, is not worth playing. It crashed at least once every hour, sometimes during critical story scenes, which just destroyed any momentum they had. Usually the crashes are random, sometimes they're consistent, requiring bizarre steps like having to smoke cigarettes for an (ingame) hour to bypass.  There's all sorts of strange hiccups like constant stuttering during driving, hyper sensitive controls during driving, and QTEs not triggering properly until I just mess with the games configuration files randomly until they make me pass. The lighting is blown out in many cutscenes and makes it look like the games in a supernova. Water shaders are broken during certain cutscenes making it look like a blue paint, making an already ugly game a real eyesore. Infamous save-destroying bugs from the original version are still here. This is all with Durante's fan-patch, which the port is only quasi-playable without it (no diss towards Durante, bless him).

The new content the Director's Cut adds isn't really worth it either, basically a few new interlude cutscenes that are so pointless they may as well not exist. The PS3 version runs at like 12 FPS for the entire game on top of most of the graphical issues above. Xbox 360 version has tank controls but is otherwise the most stable by far. If you have an Xbox 360 or Xbox One XSBBQ or whatever that has backwards compatibility, go with that version instead.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007145340', 'num_games_owned': 1503, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 244, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 244, 'last_played': 1603492736}
review:
[b]Awful Console Port[/b]

Having tried a go at this several times with DPFix and other community patches, the game still plays up with a controller, randomly crashes and is just unpleasant to experience on a Windows 10 PC. I'm not even sure why the achievements aren't working. Toybox Inc. done PC players dirty with this port as I remember the PS3 version being very much playable (ignoring the quest bugs).

Very disappointed in how much effort and patience you need to see it to the end. Kudos to those that can tolerate all that as the game has a certain charm to it much like the Twin Peaks TV show.

I wouldn't recommend this version even if it was given away for free.

author: {'steamid': '76561198094390914', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 1966, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1966, 'last_played': 1602781883}
review:
[b] tl;dr: definitely play this game, but avoid the PC version if at all possible [/b]

This feels kind of wrong, because DP is genuinely a great and unique game that doesn't really have anything that can compare to it, even ten years after its release. Unfortunately, this version of the game has a whole bunch of issues that keep me from being able to recommend it.

Some of the issues I experienced include:

- I couldn't get my 360 controller to work in any way other than in win98 compatibility mode which quadrupled load times and killed the frame rate
- I got run time errors every other hour without enabling more ram, and about every three hours with 4gb of ram enabled
- I had frequent physics glitches were the game sped up my character in and outside of cars
- at some point, I got weird visual glitches during the rain that I couldn't reproduce later
- the game got stuck in a black screen during a chapter transition (fortunately, rebooting my PC fixed this)

So, the bottom line is, if at all possible, get this game on the switch (along with the sequel), or on the PS3 or 360. If you do try your luck on this version, there is a very helpful guide in the community section that makes the game considerably more stable, but even using that, I still had most of the issues described above.
