author: {'steamid': '76561198049660626', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 299, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 299, 'last_played': 1602460548}
review:
This game is great. It has quirky dialog, colorful character, and a great horror mystery. However, this port specifically is terrible, and you have no one else to blame but Toybox, Inc. This is a port of the already bad Director's Cut for the Playstation 3. 

I have tried plenty of times to get this game to work properly with DPfix patches, and it almost worked, but the game still continues to crash constantly. It's frustrating doing the same segment more than 5 times only for it to crash at the exact same time. I've given up. Save yourself the headache by not supporting this horrible port.

If you would seriously like to enjoy this Japanese Twin Peaks fan fiction then I highly encourage you to seek out the Xbox 360 version because it's the only version of the game that is not a complete mess. Plus, it is backwards compatible with the Xbox One and the Series X.

author: {'steamid': '76561198024962947', 'num_games_owned': 514, 'num_reviews': 231, 'playtime_forever': 167, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 25, 'last_played': 1676602587}
review:
Game is literally unplayable for me.  Tried multiple fixes and nothing I could do could get my Xbox controller working in a functional state.  The controls will maybe let me move an inch before I have to jerk it around to get even a step of movement.  of course, this is with the fixes applied.  I even went as far as to try multiple fixes to get this game to work.  Literaly nothing is making this game playable.

This might take the cake as the single worst PC port I have ever played.  It's so bad, I can't even get it to function.  Stick to literally any other version of the game.  After I get the Steam trading cards for this, it's uninstalled and never seeing the light of day on my computer again.

They should be ashamed of releasing such an unfisnished product and asking for money for it.  The amount of fan work gone into fixing it is insane too.

TLDR; awesome game, worst PC port you could possibly imagine.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067387732', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 2507, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 724, 'last_played': 1608967525}
review:
Excelente juego, surrealista, divertido y un poco incÃ³modo. Es como tener un sueÃ±o extraÃ±o que puede estar lleno de simbolismos o sencillamente consumiste mÃ¡s de lo debÃ­as

Pero es importante que sepas que es un desafÃ­o jugarlo de manera cÃ³moda, si lo compras tienes que ser consciente que es muy probable que tengas que estar las primeras horas configurando y pasando rabias con el juego. Muy recomendable al empezar a jugarlo contabilizar las horas de juego de modo que no sobrepasen las dos horas, para que puedas pedir reembolso si no consigues jugar en condiciones

Resumo el camino que tuve que recorrer para jugarlo. Windows 10 64 bits pc gama media (RX 580)

- El juego parece ir bien, pero estÃ¡ capado a 720p

- En el segundo arrance del juego instala archivos (vaya, que extraÃ±o que no lo hiciera antes)

- El juego deja de arrancar

- Para que vuelva arrancar, al menos en windows 10, es necesario ir al directorio donde estÃ¡ instalado el juego, carpeta redist ("\SteamLibrary\steamapps\common\Deadly Premonition The Director's Cut\redist") y abrir el archivo ejecutable "PhysX_SystemSoftware.exe" En este instalador bastarÃ­a con hacer click en "repair"

- Ahora el juego deberÃ­a volver a funcionar pero estÃ¡s en 720p y es muy probable que tengas problemas con el joystick o mando que quieras ocupar

- Existe un parche de la comunidad que ayuda, entre otras cosas, a cambiar la resoluciÃ³n. Se llama DPfix. En realidad tiene varias opciones grÃ¡ficas, puedes sencillamente subirlo a 4k o 1080p con varios filtros y mejoras
http://blog.metaclassofnil.com/wp-content/uploads/2013/12/DPfix095.zip

- Solo falta el mando, yo tuve los problemas con mando de xbox one. Si bien era reconocido en el menÃº, en el momento de jugar el personaje no consigue moverse. Los pasos que seguÃ­ para poder ocupar el mando son los siguientes:

1 - Click en ajustes de steam, opciÃ³n "Mando" y luego "Ajustes generales del mando" se abre una pantalla tipo Big Picture de steam y ahÃ­ marquÃ© "ConfiguraciÃ³n mando Xbox" y "ConfiguraciÃ³n mando genÃ©rico". Si el personaje sigue sin poder moverse intenta dejar marcada solamente la opciÃ³n de mando xbox o al revÃ©s, solamente dejar marcada la configuraciÃ³n mando genÃ©rico

2- Ahora el personaje debiera poder moverse al menos, no obstante el stick derecho tiene los ejes invertidos, vale decir mueves la palanca a la derecha y la cÃ¡mara sube, tiras la palanca hacia arriba y la cÃ¡mara se mueve a la izquierda (en este momento ya estaba al borde de las lÃ¡grimas, pero Miyazaki estarÃ­a decepcionado si me hubiera rendido xD)

3- La comunidad ha hecho un mapeado correcto para poder jugar el juego, para llegar a el mismo tienes que ir a tu biblioteca de steam, click derecho a Deadly Premonition, click en â€œAdministrarâ€ y luego â€œopciones de mandoâ€ (tienes que tener al menos un mando conectado al pc, si no tienes ningÃºn mando conectado no aparece esta opciÃ³n) luego tienes que ir a â€œexplorar configuracionesâ€ luego click en â€œcomunidadâ€ y finalmente aplicar la configuraciÃ³n â€œDeadly Premonition Controller +â€ de theraineydaze. En realidad este paso es opcional, podrÃ­as tu mismo mapear una configuraciÃ³n jugable pero es probable que a estas alturas quieras aplicar una configuraciÃ³n y que termine el sufrimiento

-Importante considerar que el juego NO cuenta con Steam Cloud, si quieres cambiar de pc o formatear y seguir jugando la partida tienes que respaldar manualmente los archivos de guardado

Tal vez alguien pregunte Â¿Vale realmente la pena?
Yo francamente dirÃ­a que sÃ­, es realmente un buen juego. Aunque claro tal vez es mejor optar por alguna versiÃ³n de consola y ahorrarse todo este dolor de cabeza

Voy a dejar la discusiÃ³n abierta si alguien quiere agregar o corregir algo

review: Zach and my coffee warned me that this was a great story, but a really terrible port.  Pride was my downfall.  I spent quite a bit of time getting DP to run on my computer and quite a bit more time trying to keep it running.  In the end, I ran out of tricks,  fixes, patches, etc. on the toolbox bug that eventually ended my game.  It was a good run, but all great things must sometimes come to an end.  So I watched the DP "movie" on YouTube to see how it all ended.  It would make an excellent B movie.  Enjoy, but install at your own risk.  Sadly, I must give this fantastic game a thumbs down due to the technical port disaster.  There's simply no thumbs up option available for the story.

author: {'steamid': '76561198005150263', 'num_games_owned': 897, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 243, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 243, 'last_played': 1598245206}
review:
A game that is a cult classic but just a terrible PC port.

I want to be nice to this game but the game can not run.  
The game needs you to repair the Physics X tool before you can launch the game.
The game is locked at 30 FPS 720P.
The game can crash frequently making you lose progress that you would have to run portions of the game again only for the game to crash right afterwards.

I love how cheesy the game is and how ridiculous the characters are.  
The story has a fun appeal to it that you want to keep playing.
The gameplay is somewhat decent that you can play through the game without feeling that the game is repetitive. 

If I am being honest.  Either play the game on the Nintendo Switch which is a bad port but will not crash or play it on the Xbox One that is the best port for the game.  Just do not buy it on PC unless Rising Star Games can patch and fix all the problems this game has.

author: {'steamid': '76561198128299093', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 2041, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2041, 'last_played': 1597955010}
review:
This is a review of my first run-through of the game (~34 hours give or take). Considering my expectations of DP, which were fairly low to begin with, I thoroughly enjoyed the gameplay but would only recommend to purchase the PC port on sale. I actually did not expect to enjoy it as much as I did. Is the game perfect? Not by any stretch of the imagination. But it is a classic. 

[b] TLDR; Buy the shit out of this â€“ but on sale!  [/b]

Here is a summary and rating (1-5) of my personal experiences with the game: 

[u] Interface/Port [/u] [b] (1) [/b]

Oh boy, where to start? Although the game provides you with the option to switch between keyboard and controller before game launch (and the default controls themselves I had no problem with), you have to pretty much jump through every hoop known to man to actually get the game to launch after the starting scene. The PC port leaves a lot to be desired and this is putting it very gently. I am one of the few lucky players who managed to find solutions around the plethora of Windows compatibility and driver issues and actually played the game through to the end. Simple achievements that are awarded for completing chapters range at 5-15% rates, which pretty much reflects how difficult it is to mould this game around your PC settings. I had to research various guides and discussion forums after experiencing a total of approximately 7 major game crashes. Buy at your own risk and if youâ€™re prepared to spend at least some time researching fixes. 

[u] Gameplay [/u] [b] (5) [/b]

I personally loved the game. With all its technical faults, it is definitely charming. The characters are pretty well written and the chemistry between them is refreshing. I think the highlight of the game is definitely our protagonist detective Agent York, who has a very quirky and unusual method of investigating crime scenes. The backstories and plot twists in this game never end! And although the story is pretty linear, I will definitely be going back for a second run-through to enjoy any bonus side quests or content. I also found the option to listen to York chat about his favourite movie classics while you drive about to be a very nice touch and make the task much less tedious (you drive around quite a lot in this game!). Overall, even though I started playing this game for shits and giggles, it genuinely grew on me over time as an endearing storyline. 

[u] Pacing [/u] [b] (4) [/b]

I would say the game is pretty well paced, although you are often left to your own devices for hours at a time and it sometimes feels a little bit like an open world without much chance for true exploration. The game map is actually quite vast, however, so if you are looking to do side quests frequently I suppose the free time given is required. 

[u] In-game Bugs/Annoyances [/u] [b] (3) [/b]

I am actually quite surprised that this game is not as buggy as anticipated. That being said, my expectations set a pretty low bar! You will experience the occasional crash between scenes. The animations can also seem a little clunky. I have had enemies pretty much teleport on top of me before, though I think this was intended for jump-scare purposes. One of my biggest pet peeves is a buggy final boss scene and this game actually does have elements of this, though not to the point that it is unplayable. 

[u] Difficulty [/u] [b] (1) [/b]

I think my cat could probably play this. Extremely easy to pick up and play, especially if youâ€™re a beginner. The game does have a â€œlock-onâ€ aim option too, which makes it easy to get targets quickly and there is a variety of weapons to choose from. Controlling your car is also pretty straight-forward. DP is very forgiving in terms of most â€œquick reactâ€ scenes, as you are able to Continue on the spot and retry. The puzzles are very easy also.  I would say overall itâ€™s a pretty casual game perfect for a Sunday afternoon. 

[u] Replayability [/u] [b] (2) [/b]

Although my score for this is rather low (as far as I am aware, this game does not have several endings to explore), I will very likely be going back to complete quests I could not do before as I thoroughly enjoyed the storyline. I have seen people with 400+ hours in game so I would say there is content to be found for sure. You are given the option to continue investigating the town even after you have finished the game. 

Note: PS3 version of the game may have additional endings.

author: {'steamid': '76561197983990340', 'num_games_owned': 804, 'num_reviews': 80, 'playtime_forever': 2880, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2825, 'last_played': 1619480280}
review:
Questo gioco Ã¨ la definizione di "So bad, it's good".  Grafica da ps2, gameplay legnoso e gioco buggato.  Il porting pc Ã¨ probabilmente il peggiore che mi sia mai capitato, soprattutto per via dei numerosi crash (a fine recensione elencherÃ² gli accorgimenti che ho seguito io per avere un'esperienza decente). Quindi perchÃ© pollice su?  PerchÃ© Ã¨ un gioco fuori dalle righe, con una trama che va dal trash al geniale, un'esperienza difficilmente classificabile. Memorabile il protagonista, sia per via del suo carattere unico che del suo aspetto a dir poco bizzarro. Insieme a lui sono ben delineati anche tutti gli strambi abitanti di Greenvale, il paese  nel quale saremo chiamati a risolvere il mistero dell'Assassino con l'impermeabile, sopravvivendo nel frattempo a momentanee incursioni in un mondo "da incubo" in stile Silent Hill. Ãˆ possibile esplorare interamente la regione di Greenvale (sia a piedi che in auto), per scoprirne i segreti e conoscere meglio gli abitanti (ognuno dei quali caratterizzato da routine giornaliere), oltre a risolvere le varie missioni secondarie presenti (fin troppo difficili da scoprire senza l'aiuto di una guida).  Il tutto culminerÃ  in un finale folle, carico di momenti toccanti e inquietanti. Menzione d'onore anche per le musiche, un mix eclettico e fuori di testa (anche se alcuni brani tendono ad essere ripetuti troppo spesso). Sicuramente non un gioco per tutti, ma riuscendo a passare oltre gli evidenti difetti si troverÃ  un'esperienza che difficilmente sarÃ  possibile dimenticare.

Di seguito, gli accorgimenti che ho seguito per stabilizzare il gioco (non garantisco che funzionino per tutti).

-Non installare il DPfix, questa mod necessaria per poter giocare a risoluzioni alte ha aumentato a dismisura il numero dei crash.
-Creare collegamenti sul desktop sia del launcher che dell'eseguibile e impostare la compatibilitÃ  con Windows 98/ME. Avviare il gioco dal launcher.
-In caso di crash durante una cutscene, riavviare prima il pc e poi il gioco. Consiglio in generale di iniziare a giocare subito dopo aver avviato il sistema, senza aprire nessuna applicazione (eccetto Steam ovviamente).

author: {'steamid': '76561198043366106', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 3163, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3163, 'last_played': 1596957440}
review: I recommend this game. Great story, goofy combat, half baked time mechanic, janky controls. I dig it. Do not play the PC version though. Save yourself the frustration and play the Switch, PS3, or Xbox 360 version. Crashes, a broken limited aiming system, and soft locks are a regular occurrence in the PC version. You can get through all of the hassle, finding tricks to get past things and downloading a save file online to replace your broken save but, all of that frustration makes it hard to enjoy a game that by design is hard to enjoy. I love the game, just play a console version.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004388581', 'num_games_owned': 1237, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 3213, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3213, 'last_played': 1595226580}
review:
Still broke as shit. But it's still got that mix of love and hate from me that encouraged me to go back and play this trash fire of a port. The story's unique, ludicrous, and has just the right elements of love that a developer has for a product that I can't put to words. It seems genuine. And that's what draws me back to this thing. 

Some tips: 

DPFix makes the game look better. It's pretty great. 
-Unconfirmed rumors however of DPFix causing more crashes so take this with a grain of salt.

If your game crashes and crashes consistently, restart your computer. 

If your game crashes at a specific cutscene when you're leaving the hospital, restart your computer and set the game to windowed mode.

For compatibility settings, right click BOTH the executable and the launcher and set them to Windows XP service pack 3. You'll have issues with aiming up while doing this, but, you can swap it off once the crashes have stopped.

For the tailing mission, if you're running it on windowed mode, swap it to full screen for just that mission then save immediately after it finishes. I don't know what it is, but I think the windows size actually influences the driving.

Get all of the bones, but don't turn them into the guy who wants them immediately. Let them get stolen. Find the bones. Turn them in. Suggest getting all the bones within the first two days before going to the community center.
Complete the spirit maps when you can.
Do the block pushing puzzle/store room stuff.  You'll thank me later. (Don't actually give the reward away.)
Bribe the gas station man. Do it as often as you can. 

Fishing is annoying.

The animations, while funny, are still really good compared to other games that came out during the time. (I'm looking at you, Oblivion.)

tl;dr: I really love this game. It's a garbage fire port, and if you're persistent you'll be rewarded with one of the oddest yet most engrossing stories in a video game I've seen to date.

author: {'steamid': '76561198153490627', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 50, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 50, 'last_played': 1595473923}
review: The game itself is awesome.  An blatant and unapologetic rip off of Twin Peaks that is nonetheless a great game.  Deliciously weird, funny, and cozy.  I can't recommend it enough, just not this version.  I was not able to get past the first cutscene, there was no way for me to move the character.  The controller worked on the little pop-up launcher and the main menu (except the d-pad), but I had to use an odd mix as some buttons worked and others didn't, and that's just the menus.  I could skip cutscenes, but the second I got to the point you start playing no input seems to do anything, and I have to go to my desktop just to exit.  I tried controllers and mouse/keyboard.  I tried to find config files, or mods to fix it, no dice.  It's such a shame because I had it on my PS3 and loved it, I was really looking forward to playing it again.

author: {'steamid': '76561198017109350', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 1435, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1435, 'last_played': 1595454040}
review:
This is what you call a "diamond in the rough".

I've heard about this game from an old dropped let's play by a known lolcow around ten years ago. The low budget J-jank aesthetic has always intrigued me, and the interesting main character made me think that this has potential, so I had to try it. While initially a lot of things turned me off, this turned out to be an amazing experience, and a legitimate example of what well-written art is.

Although some things are annoying and deserve a warning (such as sound/music cutting out inappropriately, graphical glitches and limited animations, overly long animations every time you open a door or grab an item, terrible driving controls), they did not ruin the experience. In fact, the low budget jank strangely added to the eerie feel of the game. It continuously surprised me with its' great writing and lovable characters. The weirdness of it all, which, if you've seen Twin Peaks, will make you feel right at home. The soundtrack and voice acting, are pretty decent as well. But overall, the biggest strength is the writing and the characters, that hook you in and don't let go. The final few chapters have some extremely gripping moments, and despite an extremely long and annoying quick-time sequence, the end was very satisfying and unique. I'm sure you agree, Zach.

Anyway, tl;dr - this game is flawed, but brilliant, and if you enjoy weirdness and good story - give it a try. This is as close to a Twin Peaks game that you're going to get, people.

author: {'steamid': '76561198117326886', 'num_games_owned': 945, 'num_reviews': 118, 'playtime_forever': 356, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 356, 'last_played': 1595387367}

author: {'steamid': '76561198025309409', 'num_games_owned': 14456, 'num_reviews': 161, 'playtime_forever': 4336, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4336, 'last_played': 1595135519}
review:
"Deadly Premonition" is an open-world murder mystery with horror elements. It features an interesting story with bizarre characters, action sequences that play like a slow third-person shooter, occasional easy puzzles. and a fairly large map to explore. Unfortunately the PC port is barely playable due to technical issues.

The game successfully creates a "US small-town" environment with many characters who have their own schedules, and have different things to say depending on the current state of affairs. The murder mystery is exceptionally well designed - lots of people are suspect in one way or another, but there is no obvious culprit. You always feel that there is more to the murders than you already know, and the story ends in a chain of revelations that definitely surprised me. The main plot is very linear, but the game also offers 50 side quests, and you are usually free to decide which tasks you tackle next. The side quests are, however, often completely nonsensical and feel tacked-on.

The FBI agent that you play, is a pretty interesting character (for example, he keeps talking to his partner that no one else can see, and uses his morning coffee as an oracle). However, he's also an arrogant jerk and a terrible chauvinist, he's very judgmental in his off-hand remarks about other people, and I didn't really feel comfortable playing him. I think he was intended to be a brilliant but emotionally challenged detective, but the writing was not good enough to pull that off. The writing - or perhaps rather the English translation - is unfortunately a problem for many characters and scenes throughout the game. Speakers often contradict themselves within just a few sentences, the flow of many conversations makes little sense, and it often feels as if lines were translated one by one without knowledge of the context. 

Apart from exploring the map and talking to people, a substantial part of the game takes place in a surrealistically warped version of the town's environment where zombie-like creatures try to kill you. You fight back with a variety of guns and melee weapons while also looking for clues and helpful items. The fights are fairly easy as most of the enemies move slowly and/or in predictable patterns, but they are successful in creating an eerie, creepy atmosphere. Occasionally you run into harder boss encounters with QTE elements and multiple phases.

The game provides ample room for exploration and generally rewards it with small amounts of money. There are also 65 collectibles to find.

Graphics looked already dated when the game was originally released in 2010. They look crude and primitive by today's standards, but were still good enough to not affect my enjoyment. Unfortunately the PC port is locked to a 720p resolution, which means that you can see each individual pixel on a large monitor. It also uses a washed-out color palette, which many people see as a negative compared to the original Xbox version, but I think it actually fits the atmosphere quite well.

Sound and music are competently done. The game contains some catchy, simple tunes that I liked, though they seemed much too upbeat for the atmosphere of the game. That said, they can be seen as providing welcome relaxation and relief between the more tense parts of the game. Much (but not all) of the dialogue is voiced, and the voice actors did a good job, though voice direction was clearly lacking - it's often obvious that the lines were delivered without knowledge of the context.

Usability features are a mixed bag with this game. You can rebind action keys, but that's not very useful because movement is fixed to WASD. You can invert the Y- and even X-axis separately, and you can choose different settings for camera movement and aiming, but there's no FOV slider. You can save manually, but only at dedicated save spots, and there's only one save slot.

The game's biggest problem by far are its technical issues. It kept crashing about once per 90 minutes on average, and while that can be mitigated by saving at each and every opportunity, that is a) not always possible, and b) detrimental to the experience when you keep worrying about finding a save spot rather than enjoying the story. One scene crashed every time it played, so I had to search forums for a workaround (which was, oddly enough, to let several hours of in-game time pass). Another problem is a perpetual loud screeching noise, accompanied by equally loud, high-pitched, frantic "blip" noises, whenever I was in a car (which amounts to many hours). Alt-tabbing out of the game caused it to freeze irrecoverably each and every time unless I was playing in windowed mode, but then I was limited to a 720p window. Two boss fights require you to turn off auto-aim (otherwise you _cannot_ hit your target), but auto-aim always gets automatically switched on whenever you draw a weapon, and turning it off requires a keypress that does not always work. There are community fixes for some of these issues, but they do not work for everyone. In short, this port is a terrible mess and it reflects badly on Rising Star games that they released this title in such a shoddy state without ever fixing it.

I recommend Deadly Premonition for its complex plot, immersive setting, and bizarre characters. It definitely deserves its status as a cult classic. That said, be prepared for many painful moments due to the game's technical issues. If you're not willing to accept frequent crashes and multiple other issues (like that loud screeching noise whenever you're driving), you probably won't be able to enjoy this game. The Steam achievements show that 42% of players finished the prologue, but only 12% made it through the first quarter of the game, and my guess is that most players will just decide that the technical issues are too annoying to put up with.

If you can get the game on Xbox, play it there, as all the ports have issues of some sort. If you get it on PC, wait for a steep sale and brace yourself for a rocky ride.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010906276', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 897, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 540, 'last_played': 1605772087}
review:
This game is pure art. The gameplay is pretty mediocre, the graphics aren't the best, but the story and characters and setting just oozes so much personality, and it just feels like this game was made because of someone's weird idea(s) that they wanted to put out there for many people to see.

I played this back on the Xbox 360 waaay back in 2009 or so, I don't really remember. I just remember totally falling in love with everything so weird and quirky about it. The controls take a bit to get used to, but it's not horrible or unplayable by any means.

HOWEVER, I do not recommend this port. It's a terrible port imo, and many other people have agreed. I was only able to get a few hours into the Steam version, just because there are so many issues that I doubt will ever be fixed. Playing it with a controller seems to be hit-or-miss, at least for me. I was able to use my Xbox 360 controller plugged in for a while, but trying again recently has just been total failure. I'm not really a fan of the keyboard controls, but I guess it's better than nothing if nothing else will work. 

There's also a really annoying issue with when you're driving around, where this obnoxious screeching/breaking car noise just keeps happening over and over and over again. Apparently it has something to do with audio drivers or something, I have no idea. It's just something that I guess there is a fix(?) for, but as far as I know, and as far as my experience is, it does not work all the time. That particular bug/issue doesn't seem to happen when I play through my speakers, but that's just one of the many issues I've seen and/or heard about this port.

Once again, this game is a cult classic and definitely worth checking out, but I'd say get the Xbox 360 or the PS3 version if you can. The controls are always gonna be janky and bad, but it just takes a few hours of getting used to and they don't seem to be too much of a problem, at least the way I remember it.

...What did you think of that, Zach? Was that a good enough review?

author: {'steamid': '76561198181839243', 'num_games_owned': 302, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 508, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 508, 'last_played': 1589716937}
review:
This game is weird, I mean super weird.

Protagonist is mad lad and other people surrounding him are little better than him, but only little.
Combat wise it is good to okay, downwards. Gun play is resident evil 4 style but it is not that satisfying. My favourite and satisfying weapon is pipe, seriously. It is fast and can take shadows with one or two hits. Then I unlocked unlimited weapons and my god they were god sent. Combat section was chore and many times I just run past shadows or mow them down with infinite ammo guns.
Story bit was so good. It was weird but fun. It had entertainment value and I loved it.
Bugs are annoying restarted game once because PCGamingWiki article stated one bug to break save game, and I skipped that bit of cutscene.

author: {'steamid': '76561198077089299', 'num_games_owned': 472, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 582, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 486, 'last_played': 1595007490}
review:
Deadly Premonition came out on switch not too long ago. Decided to finally play the first. Turns out there are  severe transsexual misrepresentation but the developers are working on fixing the poor translation or something. I'll wait for that before playing the second game...

Anyways, this game is broken. Seriously. Doesn't function without downloading fixes and still crashes or has framerate issues or sound issues. BUT when you manage to finally make it playable, it's good.

Love the aesthetic of eccentric detective working on a supernatural case in a small town. Go in without expectations and you'll have a surprisingly good time. Also. VERY important. Don't get it full price. Wait for the 90% sale or something

CHANGED MY MIND AFTER THE 10TH CRASH AFTER FIXES. UNPLAYABLE. I REPEAT. UNPLAYABLE.

...though i still love what they were going for content-wise

review:

Quiero recalcar que este juego es pÃ©simo, todo el aspecto tÃ©cnico estÃ¡ muy mal hecho, tiene un sin fin de errores. Es mÃ¡s, la versiÃ³n de PC es la menos recomendable. De hecho optÃ© por dejar tirada esta versiÃ³n y simplemente jugarlo en otra plataforma, lo juguÃ© en Switch.

Dejando de lado lo horrible del apartado tÃ©cnico y jugable, narrativamente es muy, pero muy bueno. DirÃ­a que es como una mala pelÃ­cula, la mayorÃ­a de personajes rayan en lo clichÃ© a propÃ³sito, pero pese a ello son terriblemente carismÃ¡ticos. La historia junto con los protagonistas se desarrolla muy bien, los giros argumentales estÃ¡n muy bien hechos. Si bien en un principio el juego posee aspectos que detesto, como lo es la disonancia ludonarrativa, al final la mayorÃ­a de huecos terminan siendo explicados.
DeberÃ¡s soportar todo por la historia, si te atrapa antes de las 2 horas, bien, juÃ©galo porque te va a encantar, si no, reembolsa en ese mismo instante.

Pienso que hubiera funcionado mucho mejor como libro, pelÃ­cula, o hasta como un juego de los de Quantic Dream. Si no, simplemente quitÃ¡ndole el 50% del gameplay hubiera quedado mejor, porque es tedioso.

review:

Un juego que tiene un desastroso apartado grÃ¡fico, animaciones pÃ©simas, fÃ­sicas horribles, gameplay tosco y podrÃ­a estar nombrando aspectos negativos sin parar pero que tiene una trama y personajes tan increÃ­bles e inolvidables que para mucha gente fue una obra maestra, entre los que me incluyo.

El personaje Francis York Morgan y su alter ego Zach, transmiten un grandÃ­simo carisma aunque tambiÃ©n sus otros personajes. 

Un juego muy influenciado por la serie Twin Peaks del fantÃ¡stico director de cine David Lynch. 

Una pena que su segunda parte sea, de momento, exclusiva de Nintendo Switch aunque parece que hay planes para portearlo a pc y demÃ¡s consolas de actual generaciÃ³n.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013375584', 'num_games_owned': 1130, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 2468, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1563, 'last_played': 1594413204}
review: First this game is a classic and honestly its wonderful in a horrible kind of way. Why I am not recommending it is because this game on PC is terrible with random crashes where it just literally feels like its just part of the game. Also its quite terrible that the only way to get past most of the crashes and make this game actually beatable/playable is with a mod called DPSfix which I was told that the developers recommend this mod to place on PC. If you need a mod to just play it its not worth getting dont make my mistake and get it on the console. But if you can strive through the crashes then whatever its still a fun loving game in its bad goofy way

review:
Itâ€™s great, butâ€¦

You should know that when someone says â€˜butâ€™ you should automatically ignore everything said until that point. The thing is, I really like this game, and I whish I could play it well. Itâ€™s funny and has charm. The problem is the port is terrible. A lot of fans on PC even made patches, these seems to work for them some of the time. The patches wonâ€™t work all the time nor will they work for everyone. I wanted to play, but after a certain point, after so many crashes on the same things itâ€™s clear I wonâ€™t be able to.
Swery is a great developer, I wanted to support him, by the port team and the producers doesnâ€™t deserve money for this port. And the Producers even got this game ported to the switch after this PC version, so it just show how much Rising Star games cares.

author: {'steamid': '76561198417961507', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 2746, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2746, 'last_played': 1585516392}
review: This is an open world mystery, and I could not be more pleased with it. The game play takes some getting used to, but you find your flow quickly. The characters are all strange and memorable. Having to take care of your character, making sure they eat and sleep and change clothes, is very grounding. It's easy to put many hours into solving the mystery, and even more exploring the town and meeting its residents. The farther you get into the game, the harder it becomes. Although there are a few bugs, and quick time events are literally killer, it's difficult but doable. It is one of my favorite games. There's a certain charm to it. Isn't that right, Zach?

author: {'steamid': '76561198139695778', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 499, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 497, 'last_played': 1595213656}
review:
Controls and game play are janky; graphics aren't good; and the voice acting and sub-titles are often awkward. HOWEVER, the music is actually pretty interesting and entertaining. The dialogues, although awkward, can be funny and even deep at times. But the real selling point is the story. If you actually take the time to understand the ENTIRE story, it is a really good story with many dark twists and turns. Plus, if you play through a second time after understanding the story, you will be able to appreciate conversations and comments that at first seem bizarre and of no meaning. After my first play through and understanding of what is happening and why, I was pleasantly surprised  on my second play through to hear things people where saying actually make a ton of sense. This game is basically a cult classic that is worth playing if you have patience to deal with tanky controls and a weird story that all unfolds into a really interesting narrative.
Plus, DP2 is coming out July 10, 2020 so now is a great time to pick this game up and possibly get the 2nd to see how Zach/York continue on!

author: {'steamid': '76561198075770670', 'num_games_owned': 255, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 53, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 53, 'last_played': 1582320160}
review: gameplay is a piece of shit even by old standards, little silent hill meets little resident evil 4. Why people keep praising this when the core mechanics are just plain bad?

author: {'steamid': '76561198025151271', 'num_games_owned': 765, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 1605, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 818, 'last_played': 1594258417}
review: This is a fantastic game!  Definitely play it!  The PC port though?  Not a great port.  Even with the fan patch, it crashes like crazy and has a lot of graphical glitches.  So play this version if you don't have access to any of the console versions, and if you do get this version, save every time you get the chance, and if there's an issue that won't go away, restart your computer. Yeah seriously.  Great game otherwise.

author: {'steamid': '76561198024259517', 'num_games_owned': 1197, 'num_reviews': 102, 'playtime_forever': 423, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 423, 'last_played': 1593649666}
review:
Stay far away from the Pc port.
You have to do so much work for a chance to get it to work.

I played this on the switch.
Less performence for sure.
But the game actually worked and i could finish it for once.

If you get the any other ports.
Its a very odd but intresting game.

Boss fights aren't the most creative and if you have played a fair amount of resident evil games you will pick up easily on what to do.

it just hurts me that so much work was put in to this game. but its so unplayable on pc.

its defiently on top of my list of favorite games that i can't play on pc.

And why this game never goes on sale anymore, 
that's becuse this game doesen't run on any pc after downloading it. 

But if you are one of those that collect's games that get delisted. i wouldent be suprised if this game will be delisted eventuelly.



Luckly i got this on a sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198128230707', 'num_games_owned': 301, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 1437, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1437, 'last_played': 1593212939}
review:
This game is wonderful, great world and characters, charming, silly, 10/10 bla bla bla but please for the love of god don't play it on PC. I must have had upwards of 20 crashes trying to play through this; couldn't get through the chapter 9 crashes no matter what i tried.

Best way to play this is the original 360 version (which you can play on XBOX One and Series). Most stable, best framerate (stable 30 iirc), best colours; it doesn't have the few extra bells and whistles and cutscenes of this version but those things don't really matter. I've been playing through the PS3 version of the Director's Cut and while the framerate is complete donkey cunt, as is the driving, I haven't experienced a single crash. Can't speak for the Switch version but it'd be impressive if it was any worse than this port. 

Makes me truly sad to say this, but unless you're willing to risk being unable to progress and struggling with crash after crash, do not buy :(

review: Ğ˜Ğ³Ñ€Ğ° Ğ¸Ğ½Ñ‚ĞµÑ€ĞµÑĞ½Ğ°Ñ, Ğ½Ğµ ÑĞ¼Ğ¾Ğ³ Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¾Ğ´Ğ¾Ğ»Ğ¶Ğ¸Ñ‚ÑŒ Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¾Ñ…Ğ¾Ğ´Ğ¸Ñ‚ÑŒ Ğ¸Ğ·-Ğ·Ğ° Ñ‚Ğ¾Ğ³Ğ¾, Ñ‡Ñ‚Ğ¾ Ğ²Ñ‹Ğ»ĞµÑ‚Ğ°ĞµÑ‚ Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¸ Ğ·Ğ°Ğ³Ñ€ÑƒĞ·ĞºĞµ ÑĞ¾Ñ…Ñ€Ğ°Ğ½ĞµĞ½Ğ¸Ñ. Ğ‘ÑƒĞ´Ñƒ Ğ´Ğ¾ÑĞ¼Ğ°Ñ‚Ñ€Ğ¸Ğ²Ğ°Ñ‚ÑŒ Ğ½Ğ° ÑÑ‚ÑƒĞ±Ğµ, Ğ²ÑĞµĞ¼ ÑĞ¾Ğ²ĞµÑ‚ÑƒÑ.

author: {'steamid': '76561198093828120', 'num_games_owned': 160, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 164, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 164, 'last_played': 1592287839}
review: While I love this game, the port to PC is absolutely terrible. I didn't have too many issues until an hour and a half in when the game would crash part way through the same cutscene every time. I skipped that cut scene and then the game would crash every time I tried to load my save file. While there are some fixes the community has put out, they seem to be kind of hit and miss and none of them worked for me. I ended up requesting a refund because the game was just unplayable. If you want to play this game, you'll probably be better off playing it on a ps3 emulator as the game runs infinitely better there. I wouldn't recommend this version as it's very possible that it just doesn't work for you, and even if it does you'll be putting in a lot of work with fixing the game just to get mediocre performance. Please save your 25-30 dollars and use them for something useful

review: The best worst game I've ever played. The core gameplay feels clunky and at times even broken. Yet the characters & setting surrounding it sells this unusual experience like no other, making it stand as a masterpiece on its own terms.

author: {'steamid': '76561198018130825', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 87, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 87, 'last_played': 1395283381}
review:
A lot of respect is paid to intricately marvelous technical accomplishments in AAA blockbuster releases, but I expect a game with a budget to rival the GDP of a small nation to have a few tricks up its sleeves, to show us rope moving as we have never seen rope move before within a digital space. But itâ€™s much more spectacular to find it here, in this game that seems as if it should not exist salvaged from an innocuously titled project called â€œRainy Woodsâ€ and made on a budget similar to my annual cigarette purchasing expenses. In a AAA game, I will ooh and aah at a passing semblance of genuine physics expressed upon a wire. In Deadly Premonition, seeing the scene or two where York enacts a reasonably rendered facsimile of pulling a sheet over his bed-bound body seems like a miracle. It is finding a pot of gold at the end of a rainbow. It is seeing a unicorn on a walk through the woods. 

	So much of Deadly Premonition works on that level â€“ the common refrain is that it is a bad game, possibly a game so bad that itâ€™s good. But, let me tell you a secret, lean in close â€“ itâ€™s actually a good game. Just out and out, a good game. It looks bad, feels worse, sounds confused, likely smells funny, and now courtesy of a Switch release with a donâ€™t-eat-this coating on the game card even tastes bad. But itâ€™s a goddamn good game, because under an obfuscating morass of outdated gamemaking it is full of moments that reflect and even outshine modern games. And that, from a title that originally released 10 years ago. 

	There is, for example, a surprise after every meandering low-impact Resident Evil 4 inspired shooting sequence. Not a surprise as in a GOTCHA but a surprise as in a dramatically rendered murder scene that transcends Lynchian inspiration and becomes Fulleresque, reminiscent of the dramatic death tableaus of Hannibal that would populate network television three years after this gameâ€™s release. And even more dramatic than the visuals are the characters reacting to them, characters built in fits and starts in ways much more accomplished than many other games â€“ Emily Wyatt, the traditional Woman Who Canâ€™t Cook who is also the only big city transplant in Greenvale expressing unequivocal horror that something like this could happen here. Meek and effeminate Thomas Maclaine who treats the investigation to lunch on a daily basis, finding time to hone his cooking craft despite late nights tending bar at his sisterâ€™s place, eating lunch to be inevitably regurgitated. George Woodbridge, the handlebar mustachioed sheriff with dumbbells called Arnold and Sylvester and an ailing mother who is stricken by how impotent all his power, physical and institutional, seems to be in the face of such grisly crimes. 

	Each of these things are surprises. To feel such attachment and empathy for these characters is testament to how well the game captures its tone of a small town full of small people caught up in something awful and big. Outside of these big moments, life goes on in Greenvale like a quiet murmur punctuated with sudden shouts. There are 27 named characters, one for literally each letter of the alphabet (and two for I â€“ twins Isaiah and Isaac, the cherubic manifestations of small town innocence in Yorkâ€™s dream sequences). Each of them have their own stories to varying degrees, ranging from the General Lysanderâ€™s veteran status haunting his graveyard to gas station owner Jack the Raging Bull who just wants bribes in the form of $100 bills to converse with. Lynchâ€™s log lady here finds a sort of analogue in Wandering Sigourney who makes her way around town with a pot, its contents a mystery but always growing cold and necessitating York giving her a breakneck ride home to reveal...literally nothing. An amusing subversion of any Twin Peaks fanâ€™s expectations. 

	I could talk all day about how bad those drives are, how the controls for vehicles feel like driving a Matchbox car down a waterslide and no passengers make any remarks as York careens into poles and shrubbery. I could talk about the weird pointlessness of the action sequences, evidently a publisher mandate to make a more salable game and actually quite decent considering that but superfluous nonetheless. I could talk about how when York goes fishing, he can catch anything from fish to trading cards to ammo and all but the first of those is represented with a big flat icon on the end of a hook in Yorkâ€™s hands rather than an actual object. 
	
	Thatâ€™s missing the rainy woods for the trees when this game, more than absolutely any other, is greater than the sum of its parts. This is a game where the phrase â€œgames as artâ€ appears twice on its Wikipedia page â€“ a full Â¼ as many times as the phrase appears on the page â€œVideo games as an art form.â€ That may be perhaps overselling it a bit â€“ the tail end of the game has a sudden series of boss encounters that wouldnâ€™t be out of place in a JRPG suggesting that the developers ran as fast and hard as they could to make art but the fact they were making a game still caught up with them. 

	Still, for most of the gameâ€™s 20ish hours it exceeds the expectations its own presentation brings on to provide a fascinating, often funny, sometimes frightening, consistently human take on small town America as filtered through a specific sort of American television. Agent Francis York Morgan â€“ his friends call him York â€“ is among gamingâ€™s most memorable and idiosyncratic characters even as he functions perfectly within the narrative as an outsider to Greenvale on par with the player. And for most of the game, his asides to an unseen â€œZachâ€ seem like they might as well be whispers to whoever is on the other side of the screen. With York as a vessel into this plasticine pastoral world, this clearly mechanical simulation full of life, the player is led into one of the most remarkably unique games in the medium.

author: {'steamid': '76561198079630549', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 4923, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2916, 'last_played': 1663208923}
review: I played Deadly Premonition back in 2016 but I still think this game is in my top 5 games and I think forever will be. The charm and the environment of the game just make it one of a kind. Even though the controls are a little wonky, I think that it adds to the experience. There is a lot of little details in this game that I wish more games nowadays had like beard hair growth (I know Red Dead 2 has that) and other details and interactions that make everything better. I experienced some crashes back when I first played but I am not sure if they are still there so be aware of that. Overall I would try it out. I would say that this is a completely different experience from anything else I played.

author: {'steamid': '76561198175471086', 'num_games_owned': 191, 'num_reviews': 77, 'playtime_forever': 2537, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2537, 'last_played': 1592260325}
review: I don't know how I found Deadly premonition but I'm glad I did. Deadly premonition is the right mix of weirdness, horror and mystery to make a perfect game. This game qualifies as art.  The story twists and turns. When you think you have it figured out the game flips everything you know on its head. The controls are a bit clunky and the graphics aren't great but they're passable. The game also has problems with crashing. This is a fantastic game and you should get it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972495251', 'num_games_owned': 3039, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 5611, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5611, 'last_played': 1591632741}
review:
Please be aware there are some technical issues with this game that may cause some frustration. I managed to work around all of them and with a few crashes managed to 100% this gem of a game.

This game is one of the best experiences I have ever had in gaming. Can't recommend it enough. The story and characters are really compelling and even though the game is 90% jank it just keeps you hooked to see what happens next! The graphics are a bit rubbish, the sound is awful sometimes, the controls aren't great, the combat is really basic and can be quite tedious and none of these issues deterred me in the slightest in enjoying it. 

Honestly can't recommend it enough, go play it! PLAY IT NOW!

author: {'steamid': '76561198096213994', 'num_games_owned': 274, 'num_reviews': 95, 'playtime_forever': 497, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 68, 'last_played': 1592832146}
review:
If you're game isn't starting and is having the same problem as me, try this:
[list]
[*]Go into wherever DP is located, probably Steam > steamapps > common > Deadly Premonition The Director's Cut
[*]Then go into the folder 'redist', scroll to the bottom and open PhysX_SystemSoftware
[*]Once you opened that, use the repair option, and then the game should open normally.
[*]Have fun!
[/list]

author: {'steamid': '76561198106422648', 'num_games_owned': 597, 'num_reviews': 59, 'playtime_forever': 3498, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3498, 'last_played': 1598736980}
review:
100% Completed!

(Please read "This Port" part too)

Deadly Premonition, in my opinion, it's a masterpiece. 
The first thing I want to mention are the characters, 
Each character is well thought out and each one is different from the other, and a lot of them are really weird too, and that makes it more fun. a lot of them also have interesting back stories, development and relationships, which can be seen during the main story and sidequests.
And the Main character, York, is just full of personality in his own way, and it's interesting to see how he holds up relationships with other characters because of his oddness. and there's also another character I felt very attached to, I was hoping that nothing would  happen to him/her in the story, because I really liked that character.

And then is the Town, Greenvale. is so full of personality, variety and things to do, it's like playing a real life simulator almost. you have a sleep meter and a hunger meter, and have to sleep the proper hours and eat the right amount, and you can shave if you want too and change or clean your suit. What's cool too, is that in this game there is a clock, where in every day each character has a routine that they follow and they are in different places or doing different things depending on the time, story placement and even if it's raining or not. This also applies in the different shops that are in town, having open and close times. This is an open world game after all, you can explore the town by walking or driving around, talk to people, enter places and do sidequests, which a lot of them can only be done at a specific time and/or at a specific episode, and they are also really great and keep adding lore to the characters and town. Sometimes it can be hard to know exactly when and where to meet a person to start a quest, but I can see past that when I actually do them, because they bring more story and interesting things to the game. You can still use a guide if you want though, here's one I used to know where to get some trading cards I was missing in the cards collection: https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=775096779&insideModal=0&requirelogin=1


And with all this of course it comes the story. I think this is one of the best stories in any game, I don't wanna say too much but it keeps adding mysteries and clues to keep it entertaining, and having all the interesting characters in it makes it so much better, maybe you will feel attached to some of them like I did. The game also has emotional moments and some heartwarming ones, that make the connection with the player even better.

You will also start wondering who the killer may be, which is fun to speculate and see who you think it is changes throughout the story.
The dialogue and voice acting is really good too, and they mark the feeling or mood of the characters really well.

and then, the gameplay. Aside from the driving and open world of the game, there are  third person shooter sections, where you explore places and have to deal with zombie-like creatures, which I found to be ok, but nothing too special.
and it has some horror and suspense elements too, but if you are not into that kind of thing I think it's okay because it's nothing too crazy. (keep in mind this is a M rated game after all, and some other very impactful things happen)

and the music is really good too, there's one really catchy song I can't get out of my head!

Here I would like to mention some things that the game lacks, but I can see over them considering all the other stuff the game offers, but for some people this may be something to notice, and may be the reason why this game got mixed reviews.
The reviews sometimes say the game lacks with the graphics and animations, but I think the game looks pretty good for its time though, and in fact I found all the details and touches made in the character models and in all of Greenvale pretty nice.
The other thing is that the controls in the third person shooter segments may be a little weird and not as good as other games. And the last thing I wanted to mention is that you can't mark a place you want to go when you're driving, which bothered me a little at first, but then I got used to the town and unlocked a teleporting item to make things faster. It's mostly technical problems, but in my opinion they don't detract from the experience, because the game at its core is fantastic.

Getting that out of the way, lastly I would like to mention that the developers seem to have put a lot of details in the game, for example if you play side quests at the last chapter of the game that could be previously played in other chapters, some dialogues change, and it's cool because just a few people may notice this but the devs added the extra detail just for them.

Overall, I really recommend this game and is one of my favorites of all time, there is nothing out there quite like it, and you can tell it had a lot of heart put into it.


THIS PORT

However, I do not recommend this version of the game. 
unfortunately, this version is very likely to crash, and I also ran into some almost game breaking crashes, but I just kept trying and trying different ways until I got past it, and I luckily got past all of them, but it cost a lot of tries and time. I have also read online that some of the ones that I have experienced made people stop playing because they just couldn't get past it like I did, or maybe didn't want to keep trying different ways until it worked, which is understandable.
It's such a shame, because this is just a great game with a lot of heart and effort put into it, but its technical problems make a lot of players back off from this experience.
I hope someday they will fix it, but I recommend getting the PS3, Xbox 360 or Nintendo Switch version instead, to avoid any problems.

But if you want to stick with this version, I recommend following the instructions in this post, it makes the game look better and run better:
https://steamcommunity.com/app/247660/discussions/0/1290691937708333615/
And if you are playing with a controller, I recommend using the Deadly Premonition controller + setting from the steam community, it solves a problem with the camera movement and it also makes the controls better in my opinion

That's it for my review, thank you for reading! :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198202535136', 'num_games_owned': 1441, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 2239, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1788, 'last_played': 1590608867}
review:
Objectively a bad game:
â—‹ Terrible graphics, even for 2010 standards, characters lips don't even sync with what they are saying.
â—‹ Lack of polish.
â—‹ The "open world" map is difficult to orient yourself with, a lack of proper zoom out function and the fact that your map turns as your character tuns makes it rather confusing. Game's only saving grace is the fast travel mechanic which you can only get by doing the nameless flower side mission which you can only find the flower on a rainy day. I found that once I'd unlocked fast travel, I did not want to travel manually anymore. Ever.
â—‹ Low budget.
â—‹ PC version crashes semi regularly. If you're a completionist, don't even start this game, but if you must, SAVE OFTEN!
â—‹ Side missions are terrible. Practically 50 fetch quests. No genuine thought put into any of them.
â—‹ Original controller settings for camera control make this game unplayable. You will need an alternative controller config.
â—‹ Lack of varied sountrack and sound effects. There's very few background tracks.
â—‹ Combat is clunky, aiming is not great and enemy variety is lacking. 
â—‹ 27 chapters, yet could have been condensed into a lot less and had the same impact. Some chapters only require talking to an NPC, finding some red seeds or the fishing "minigame".
â—‹ Speaking of the fishing minigame, it's just terrible, the use of what seems to be PNG image files and the "slots" feel to it just feels cheap and unfinished.
â—‹ Red vines are blockades but there's one in Harry's Mansion that was not programmed to stop you so you can easily walk through it.
â—‹ Driving controls are clunky and buggy,
â—‹ Tiredness and hunger mechanics don't fit in well. 1 min of game time =  1 min of real time... just does not work, even with the whole smoking to fast forward time mechanic.

Subjectively a good game:
â—‹ Story and characters are great, this probably should have been a B movie though, not a game.
â—‹There is a "charm" to this game. That's about as good as it gets though.

author: {'steamid': '76561198059971262', 'num_games_owned': 2458, 'num_reviews': 632, 'playtime_forever': 1372, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1372, 'last_played': 1578641159}
review:
I LOVE, like really, LOVE this game. 

... But I'm not recommending it. This port is atrocious, it's super hard to make it run on your computer. It's janky, it crashes a lot, but it's good, really good. 

I spent hours trying to run this game, only to finally just buy the switch version, which I enjoyed a lot. 

It's cheaply made, full of ideas and mechanics that should have stayed in the 90s, and despite all of that, it's super great. If it wasn't for its fault, the game wouldn't be as enjoyable as it is.

If you're interested, you should just try to make it run on your computer, and if it doesn't, refund it asap. Or just, buy the switch version.

author: {'steamid': '76561198114688288', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 2058, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2058, 'last_played': 1589378589}
review: A love letter to David Lynch, this is a flawed ride but one that's well worth taking. The story grips with its mystery and sheer weirdness -- I loved the very Japanese take on American culture that permeates the whole thing. Strange mini games, wild tonal shifts, and characters that will probably stay with me for a long time. Surreal, clunky, and at times quite beautiful.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010170861', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 79, 'playtime_forever': 318, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 318, 'last_played': 1589322306}
review: I've gone through hoops to play/mod other games many times over, and port issues rarely bother me, if ever. But this one is the first one that i actually gave up. I can't believe such an incompetent port could ever exist.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998163412', 'num_games_owned': 1067, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1693, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1693, 'last_played': 1589259580}
review: I would love to give this a thumbs up but not on the PC. Twice my save got corrupted at the same point in the game and even with the fan-made fixes and patches it was still crashing every hour. I could deal with the almost all the problems with the game but losing my progress twice with no fixes is enough for me. Trying it on a different platform might be your best bet for the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198093433473', 'num_games_owned': 189, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 1249, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 180, 'last_played': 1589879493}
review:
Buggy mess, the game will always freezes and crashes after you killed the 3 shotgun zombies on the hospital (episode 1 chapter 3). There's also another freeze and crash after you watch the cutscene in A&G Diner (episode 2 chapter 9). So terrible, they didn't resolve this bug in years maybe the developer didn't care about customers at all.
The graphics are total crap also, the textures are bad and even more you cannot play this game on FULL HD or better resolution, it's locked on 1280x720 resolution, framerate also locked at 30 fps.
To play this game on FULL HD or better and 60 fps you must use mod called DPFix. lol modder are way more smarter than these lazy a.s.s developers.
What a shame this game has a good story and interesting main character, it's hard to recommend this hidden gem because of these annoying bugs, there also many glitch that can cause some key items to disappear, if you save the game often also cause crash and glitch to appear more frequently, really an unfixed terrible mess. This is the most crappy experience that I ever experienced from a game lol
In order to get pass from that 2 bugs you must use a save data from pcgamingwiki.
I wonder if they fix these issues on the Nintendo Switch version (Deadly Premonition Origins), but I heard that Switch version is not based on this Director's Cut version but the original XBOX-360 game, if you play the Switch version I think you will miss a lot of things added in this version or the PS3 version.
FUNNY FACT: this game supposed to be the definitive edition or game of the year edition, but the bugs really ruins the game. If you want to play this game, beware of the bugs, glitches, and the game breaking bugs in chapter 3 & 9.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013324118', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1390, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 557, 'last_played': 1589575448}

author: {'steamid': '76561198065147088', 'num_games_owned': 860, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 659, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 178, 'last_played': 1589252181}
review:
UPDATE 1: I set DP.exe's Compatibility as Windows XP (SP2) and DPLauncher.exe as launching as administrator and FINALLY got it to work. Let's see how long it lasts.

I loved the game for the small amount I played it. But I can't recommend it. It kept freezing past Chapter 3 episode 1, no matter what I did (even if I used a save to skip that cutscene. I tried using the DPfix and other methods, but although the game ended up running in 1080p and 60 fps, the freeze persisted, so it was pretty useless).

I would recommend it if I got it to work, even with how furstrating it got. But I can't. Selling such a broken port for 25 bucks is CRIMINAL. I'm not talking about occasional crashes, the freeze I'm experiencing makes the game completely unplayable. I can't progress at all.

Hopefully I'll buy a switch soon and play the game on there. DO NOT buy it on PC.

author: {'steamid': '76561198065306405', 'num_games_owned': 712, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 2494, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2494, 'last_played': 1588018758}
review:
He jugado a este tÃ­tulo porque soy muy fan de Lynch y de Twin Peaks. Al principio me pareciÃ³ interesante el intento de copia de la serie unido a un intento de copia de Silent Hill con los cambios de escenarios y con mecÃ¡nicas de mundo abierto entre GTA y Yakuza. Pero al final se queda en eso intentos.

La navegaciÃ³n por el mapa es tediosa, ya que no puedes ver el mapa completo en ningÃºn momento y las carreteras no son precisamente intuitivas. Los zombis son una broma y en ningÃºn momento se sienten amenazantes, menos aÃºn cuando haciendo un par de secundarias tienes armas potentes con municiÃ³n infinita. 

Los personajes intentan parecer esos anticlichÃ©s que Lynch utiliza, pero terminan siendo tropos que estÃ¡n para decorar. Por ejemplo tenemos a Sigurney, la seÃ±ora del cazo, una copia barata de Margaret, la seÃ±ora del leÃ±o de twin peaks. La segunda es un punto clave dentro de la resoluciÃ³n del misterio y forma parte del lore de la serie, la primera sÃ³lo sirve para unas misiones secundarias que sirven sÃ³lo para conseguir coleccionables y coches nuevos.

En cuanto a la imitaciÃ³n de Silent Hill, tenemos al asesino del impermeable, de nuevo un intento de crear su propio Pyramid Head. A diferencia de su inspiraciÃ³n, este seÃ±or del hacha sÃ³lo es amenazante porque el juego mecÃ¡nicamente te hace imposible responder ante Ã©l y sus encuentros se reducen a hacer unos pocos quick time events que sÃ³lo son difÃ­ciles si te pillan por sorpresa.

Por Ãºltimo, el final del juego es bastante anticlimÃ¡tico. De repente el juego se cansa de ser un survival horror y se convierte en un devil may cry, pero con unas mecÃ¡nicas que no estÃ¡n hechas para estos tipos de jefes, los cuales desentonan enormemente con lo que habÃ­a sido el juego hasta ese momento. AdemÃ¡s te enfrentas a una elecciÃ³n de la cual sÃ³lo hay una respuesta correcta, supongo que intentaron dar la ilusiÃ³n de mÃºltiples finales.

En definitiva, este juego intenta muchas cosas y consigue muy pocas. La intriga que me autogeneraba yo mientras hacÃ­a las secundarias ha sido bastante mÃ¡s potente de lo que el juego ha sido capaz de generar por sÃ­ mismo.

The single worst piece of software ever created

I have 13 hours in this, and ive spent less than half playing the game. Constant crashes and softlocks, even with every community fix out there

author: {'steamid': '76561198046883678', 'num_games_owned': 111, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1341, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1341, 'last_played': 1587414106}
review:
I'm recommending this game because I managed to play it through. It has plenty of flaws, such as poor audio mixing, poor controls and annoying quick time event gameplay at times. The game also froze and crashed a few times, but not as often for me as other reviews made me think.

The plot is engaging enough to keep up my interest, but is a bit weird and could use some work on characterization. I get Twin Peaks vibes from the premise. The graphics are fine, not everything has to be realistic, but the world feels empty, the map could be smaller. The animation and lip-sync are a bit wonky and repetitive.

If you can buy this is a sale, it's an alright game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198126422246', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 116, 'playtime_forever': 215, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 170, 'last_played': 1587343943}
review:
I feel like if you know what this game is, you pretty much know what to expect.
Its a hidden gem.

One of the few games that pulls off the "so bad that it's good" title.
Played it my first time yeeeeears ago, and the amount of times it made me go "wtf" my first playthough hahaha.
But I loved every second of it.

It's a cheesy very B-horror movie in video game form. <3

author: {'steamid': '76561197967714806', 'num_games_owned': 895, 'num_reviews': 372, 'playtime_forever': 2340, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2340, 'last_played': 1393876067}
review:
A surreal fever-dream homage to David Lynch and Twin Peaks, taken through the lens of a Japanese Adventure/Life Simulation (Shenmue style).

Janky and technically broken, but worth working past all that to experience a horrifying story that twists and turns upon itself over and over.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006294884', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 777, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 768, 'last_played': 1666070024}
review: Great game encumbered by enough crashes to render it virtually unplayable even with every fix available. Get it on console, but forget this port.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008368544', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 1507, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 523, 'last_played': 1587089193}
review:
An awful port of a fun game. Really a pity. If you don't mind slogging through the crashes and if you get lucky and don't get a corrupted save it's sort of fun. Can't recommend it in this garbage state though.

Update: After suffering through a bit more, including what I thought was an inescapable crash loop, this game is too weird not to recommend. Yes, the port is absolute garbage. DPfix has helped me a bit, and when I get into a bad crash loop I find that restarting my PC will fix it. If you go into the experience knowing it is a technical disaster, perhaps you will be able to appreciate the super Japan flavored art that is this hideous gem. 

It is so bad that it is amazing. That goddamn music tho.

author: {'steamid': '76561198090857672', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 2918, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2918, 'last_played': 1422653152}
review:
Die Bugs ... spielbrechend und zwingen einen zur Konsultation entsprechender Foren und Webseiten.  
Die Grafik ... antiquiert und PS2 wÃ¼rdig. 
Das FahrgefÃ¼hl ... erinnert mich - natÃ¼rlich Ã¼berspitzt formuliert - mehr an ein StÃ¼ck rollendes Holz als ein Fahrzeug. 
Das Gameplay ... besitzt Reminiszenzen zu einem Spiel der frÃ¼hen 2000er oder spÃ¤ten 90er, nicht aus 2010. 
Die Geschichte ... das vielleicht Einzigartigste, DenkwÃ¼rdigste und Interessanteste was ich je erlebt habe. 
Der Soundtrack ... kÃ¶nnte direkt von Wolke 7 stammen. Ich habe kein Spiel davor und danach gekannt, das mich dermaÃŸen mitgerissen hat TROTZ der Grafik.
Bossfights ... unerwartet und hart, aber machbar und sehr belohnend. 

Urteil: FÃ¼r mich persÃ¶nlich definitiv unter den Top 10 der Spiele des letzten Jahrzehnts, aber wisset die Bugs erfordern Eigeninitiative! Das Spiel ist mehr als ein digitales Produkt, es ist eine mitnehmende SURREALE ERFAHRUNG.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007717593', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 1051, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1051, 'last_played': 1586352374}
review:
This game is essentially Twin Peaks the video game: Full of cheesy dialogue and silly characters, this game is a fantastic tribute to campy murder mysteries.

However, despite the charming design of the game, the sheer amount of game breaking crashes bring everything down to a very frustrating experience. I have spent around 15 desperate hours just trying to play through the first 5 chapters over and over again.

I have tried a number of methods in an attempt to stabilise the game to no avail. The infrequent save points and inability to save the game when replaying chapters means you're constantly having to gamble between losing a ton of progress or trying to go for that 100% completion rate. 

It's incredibly disappointing that this port crumbles under it's own weight.

Play it on the 360, PS3, or Switch instead. The PC version is a steaming pile of horse manure.

author: {'steamid': '76561198001938023', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 1649, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1649, 'last_played': 1418805619}
review: As a Twin Peaks fan I found the setting interesting enough to keep playing, but the pacing is an absolute mess. During the campaign you get nothing to challenge you except wave after wave of zombies, and then you get socked with FIVE boss fights at the end. I finished only three of those fights, because in keyboard mode the fourth one has quicktime events that, as far as I can tell, require you to mash two randomly chosen keys from the ENTIRE keyboard to avoid dying. This is not fair play, it's not good storytelling, and it's not fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994098997', 'num_games_owned': 345, 'num_reviews': 95, 'playtime_forever': 2142, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2142, 'last_played': 1704164803}
review:
This is my favourite game of all time.

Port blows, got a crash at hospital that would crash my game every time i tried playing it, one day 6 - 7 months later and dozens of crashes inbetween i missed the game and tried playing again and it did not crash. Got to get back into it soon but all the fixes and shortcuts really hinder my progress. With community patches and edits the game is fine for about an hour or so and eventually the game chugs to about 10 fps and you need to save and restart frequently along side random save corrupting crashes which i have not had yet but alot of crashes none the less. Hopefully with the new dp game coming they will take a look at the steam release and fix it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198061474696', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1464, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1464, 'last_played': 1586042737}
review: In order to even start playing this game you need to have a patch for all the bugs. Even then, it still crashes on average 3 times an hour and the combat can be incredibly frustrating. But even so, I am certain that this is the greatest game that I have ever played. It will always have a special place in my heart for it has done what no other game could. Every gamer should play this once in their lives. (10/10)

author: {'steamid': '76561197968468189', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 2489, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2489, 'last_played': 1585423800}
review: Yes there is a lot of respectful stuff the developers did in terms of the story and its presentation (mostly). This could have been a good mystery novel or a tv show. But sadly from the gameplay perspective this is one of the most boring and annoying games I remember playing. It is the prime opposite of enjoyment. Unimaginative or downright consumer unfriendly design galore. It was painful to finish and my experience of the story suffered because of it. I even tried to do the side quests for a while but thankfully let it go. If you treasure your time steer clear and watch the story on youtube or something.
