author: {'steamid': '76561198010386589', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1560, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1560, 'last_played': 1584536168}
review:
If you liked Twin Peaks... better rewatch Twin Peaks, don't lose your time.

But...

If you want to impregnate yourself of a frustrating cult game experience with wonderful weird story (maybe one of the coolests) and a vomitive gameplay, subtly inspired in Twin Peaks, this is your game.

At first time was cool but I think the devolopers just wanted to make a long game throwing us in a big as **** repetitive map (you know, GTA is cool for that right? lol), with annoying secundary characters that bothers a lot, stupid repetitive enemies with no variety (copy of Silent Hill metaphors, maybe... and the "other world".. yeah), interactive secuences (like R.E.... well, that was cool but maybe too unexpected and frenetic), and sometimes the mission consists in literally runing in circles... cmon... GOD.

It worth it? Yes, maybe, but for 3$ or less. Is a gold nugget inside a toilet plenty of sh*t and you only have your tongue to reach it. Or maybe we can go to Youtube and see the video scenes... that will be... intelligent.

author: {'steamid': '76561198427374354', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 244, 'playtime_forever': 418, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 418, 'last_played': 1584718121}
review: Oh, boy! Where to begin? Deadly Premonition easily fits the bill of crappiest good game I've ever played, or maybe best crappy game, take your pick. This survival horror Resident Evil meets Twin Peaks game certainly has ambition and is complete with an open world "sandbox", but gets so many things wrong, I won't bother listing them all. It's a 2013 "enhanced" version of a 2010 game, which somehow has the look and feel of a 2005 release. Graphics, controls, world interaction, driving and action are so outdated, it's almost funny at times. The story is the one thing which I found to have some merit and I was somewhat curious to see how it will turn out, which is what kept me going for a while. But the dialogue is so laughable and the cut-scenes laborious, that it lost its shine too. And forget about motivation to go out and explore the open world. Even just playing through the main story took every bit of my patience and turned out to be too much for me. I lasted 7 hours before giving up on this exercise in futility and I doubt I completed even 25% of the story. Really, couldn't care less.

author: {'steamid': '76561198060603465', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1534, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1494, 'last_played': 1704337222}
review: YO KIDS, YOU LIKE CRASHIN'? YOU LIKE INVESTING HOURS OF THE ONLY TIME YOU HAVE LEFT ON EARTH ON A GAME ONLY FOR IT TO PUT YOU IN AN INFINITE DEATH LOOP OF CRASHES!? YEAH!?!? THEN DO I HAVE THE GAME FOR YOU!!! PREPARE TO PLAY A JANKY, OKAY-AT-BEST, SURVIVAL HORROR FORENSIC LIFE SIM GAME, WITH A GENUINELY CHARMING BACKGROUND, SOUNDTRACK AND CAST OF CHARACTERS, ONLY FOR IT TO END IN TEARS BECAUSE THE GAME IS CRASHING. PREPARE FOR THE ULTIMATE INVESTMENT IN TIME AND PERSONAL SANITY, BECAUSE THIS GAME WILL PUSH YOU TO YOUR LIMITS. IT WILL FIGHT YOU THE FURTHER YOU GO IN WITH ITS CONSTANT CRASHES AND GLITCHES. YOU AINT EVEN READY FOR THE PURE RIVER OF FECAL MATTER COMING YOUR WAY SHOULD YOU CHOOSE THE ILL FATED PATH OF PLAYING DEADLY PREMONITIONS. Have fun, would recommend.

author: {'steamid': '76561198019173382', 'num_games_owned': 514, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 120, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 120, 'last_played': 1584359971}
review:
Absoloutely terrible from the initial story to the controls and set up.  I cant go too deep into this as i was only able to get 2 horus out of it before the controls broke so much i couldnt move the character.  for some games ill persevere but this piece of turd is just not worth it.

Even the story is strange, it gives very little idea as to what is happening, why we are there or moving ahead and York is incredibly irritating talking to *Zach* who is supposed to be part of his persona and the random profiling parts which serve no purpose other than to throw a time sync in which he then recaps in a sentence that should have been done originally.

Terrible controls, not the best graphics and a non engaging story which may draw you in if you can get by the other problems.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008151793', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 265, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 265, 'last_played': 1583940114}
review:
"the bugs make it authentic."

welcome to the realest shit in the neighborhood, then. if this were any other dev, thered be a platoon of hyper-jowled youtubers calling deadly prem on the carpet for this dysfunctional spooge but since it's Swery65, the License to Auteur grants him a criticism-proof vest on this case for whatever reason. well after 4+ hours of wrestling with nonresponsive controls, non-reproducable random crashes and a host of other tech-related fartwork, here's a criticism his vaunted geniushood can take at his leisure: Do the Job or Don't, Zach.

[borken game]
[donut buy]

author: {'steamid': '76561198106114186', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 2732, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2732, 'last_played': 1576978360}
review: This game is full of creativity and great Ideas: an interesting murdercase, weird characters, great humor. but at the same time the execution of those great ideas is lackluster: the combat is tedious and unnecessary and sadly, the last few hours of the plot are completely dumb. but still, everyone should take at least a look at this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198075061111', 'num_games_owned': 1156, 'num_reviews': 211, 'playtime_forever': 717, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 717, 'last_played': 1582992163}
review:
Game #88										1.3.2020.

[h1] There can be no disagreements about this game [/h1]

So, you know how you can get into an argument with another game-enthusiast about which game is best/worst? It seems that no matter which game you love, there will always be a person who will hate it with a passion and you will undoubtedly end up in a discussion with them, and vice-versa.

Not with Deadly Premonition. You can't do that with this game.

Observe:
â€œDeadly Premonition is a bad gameâ€, â€œYes, it isâ€, 
â€œDeadly Premonition is the best game ever madeâ€, â€œYes, it isâ€, 
â€œDeadly Premonition has the worst writing everâ€, â€œYes, it doesâ€
â€œDeadly Premonition has the best writing everâ€, â€œYes, it doesâ€.
Even as Iâ€™m wiring this, Iâ€™m surprised that all of these are actually true.

[h1] A horrible game that everyone loves? [/h1]

What is Deadly Premonition? In short: Deadly Premonition is a horrible game. It is also one of my favorite games of all time and many people share my opinion.

So whatâ€™s so good about Deadly Premonition? The story and the characters. But didnâ€™t I just say that the story was bad? Yes, I did. Itâ€™s a bad story thatâ€™s extremely enjoyable filled with bad characters that are also extremely enjoyable.
So letâ€™s start at the beginning: The game stars FBI Agent Francis York Morgan. York, as he likes to be called, is sent out to investigate a series of murders that occurred in a quiet little town surrounded by woods. 

[h1] The gameplay is a mess [/h1]

The first time you actually get control of the game, you realize that the game tries to replicate Resident Evil 4
https://store.steampowered.com/app/254700/resident_evil_4__
 or Dead Space
https://store.steampowered.com/app/17470/Dead_Space/

 with its controls, but it does so in the worst possible way. Everything thatâ€™s supposed to work, works in the worst possible way. The movement feels awkward, drawing your weapon feels awkward, aiming feels really awkward and even locking-on enemiesâ€™ feels awkward. Itâ€™s barely playable and itâ€™s hilariously bad game design. Not to mention that the graphics look like crap. So once you get past the first â€œgameâ€ session you are thrown into this open-world forest town and thatâ€™s where the game actually begins (the good parts).

[h1] You want the story! Not the gameplay! The story sucks too! [/h1]

The cutscenes. Thatâ€™s the reason most people adore this game. They arenâ€™t well acted, well written nor do they make any sense most of the time but you get to watch all these characters speak and do their stuff which is where this game shines.
Take the main character, Agent York, for example. While he is generally an arrogant and rude person he is also particularly picky about his biscuits and coffee. Often during dialogue, he will pop a random smile thatâ€™s nothing short of creepy. He is also schizophrenic and will talk to his â€œimaginary friendâ€ Zack. Since you get to answer the questions he asks Zack, that kinda makes you his alter egoâ€¦ I guess. Surprisingly this is a very good way to get you engaged with the character. 

The other characters are a bunch of weirdos as well. Youâ€™ve got a millionaire tycoon who refuses to speak and wars a gas mask only talking through his butler in rhyme, a police officer who runs like a ballerina and bakes biscuits, an artist who is a nymphomaniac, an overweight gardener with a dark secret, the list just goes on and on. Itâ€™s the kind of weirdness you simply canâ€™t predict. Itâ€™s like watching a murder mystery TV show where the detectives and the suspects are clowns. You laugh at how bad everything is but are also weirdly intrigued.

[h1] Lots of things to do in this game and most of them are poorly made [/h1]

While all thatâ€™s nice and good, whatâ€™s the gameplay like. The gameplay of this game is just bad. Everything about it is bad and I mean everything. I already mentioned how the controls are lousy and how the graphics look like they are from the 2000s but it just keeps getting worse. Since this is an open world game, you also have driving vehicles. The driving sucks. You also have free roaming where you do side quests and collect trading cards. All of these suck too. Then you have your stamina bar and your health that are mostly pointless because you rarely run out of health or stamina. You also have a sleep and eat meter which you have to replenish and by that I mean, do it once or twice during your entire playthrough. You also need to change your clothes and shave, otherwise flies start flying around you and you grow a beard and no, there isnâ€™t really a penalty for not doing either of those.

[h1] We have to have zombies, right? [/h1]

While going through the investigation is fun and all, before every major location you will be forced to go through â€¦ uhhhâ€¦. A shooting section I guess. Basically, thatâ€™s where most of the gameplay is. While driving around, collecting cards and doing side quests is mostly optional, you have to go through shooting sections and they are easily the worst part of this game.

What happens is that every time York is alone, the atmosphere turns dark and weird zombie-like creatures start attacking him as he makes his way through the level. I use the term â€œattackâ€ very loosely because these, while scary, are some of the worst enemies I have ever encountered. They are really slow, they can be ran past without any problems and when they do actually notice you and attack you, they bend backwards and do a crabwalk in order to get to you and even when they hit you itâ€™s not a big deal. Needless to say, whenever I replay these sections, I always just want to get through them as quickly as possible so that I can enjoy the rest of the story. And YES, these have absolutely nothing to do with the game.

Sometimes, York will also encounter the raincoat killer (the main antagonist) of the game. During these sections, York will have to hide or run away from the killer. These again are really badly done and are laughable at best.

[h1] You must endure all the bad parts in order to get to the good parts [/h1]

Now, many people will tell you that this PC port is really bad and that you should avoid it at all costs unless you patch it heavily and even then itâ€™s not worth it. This is all true. The game is locked at 30 fps, the resolution is locked, the graphics are far from perfect, the controls suckâ€¦ basicallyâ€¦ the game barely worksâ€¦ and, if you ask me, thatâ€™s just the way how this game should be played.

You donâ€™t really want to play the zombie sections or the driving or anything, you want to watch the cutscenes and the story BUT in order to watch this hilariously bad story, you have to ENDURE the game. YES, I honestly think that you should play this PC port as it is just so you can pay an imaginary toll in order to get to the next cutscene. Why? Well, the Xbox 360 version (the original one) barely worked too, so itâ€™s the way how the game was supposed to be played. 

So, yes, the game barely works and it will probably crash and stutter and run poorly, but if you are determined, you will get to those beautiful cutsences. Sure, you can patch the game and make it all nice and more playable but, honestly, it will still be a bad game just slightly more playable. So I donâ€™t think these is much point.

[h1] Even though it makes no sense, I absolutely adore this game [/h1]

In conclusion, Deadly Premonition is a cluster-f***. Itâ€™s a horrible game where everything is horrible but itâ€™s also horribly enjoyable and I wouldnâ€™t have it any other way. The Xbox 360 disk of Deadly Premonition will forever sit proudly on my shelf and so will this Steam version.

Next game: Deadly Sins 2
https://steamcommunity.com/profiles/76561198075061111/recommended/285420/

[h3]If you liked my review, feel free to follow my curator group. Iâ€™m trying to review every single game in my library. Seeing and interacting with fine folks, like you, keeps my motivation up. 
https://steamcommunity.com/groups/RevAMG [/h3]

author: {'steamid': '76561198031273676', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 4044, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4033, 'last_played': 1582062432}
review:
Bad graphics, terrible level design, boring combat, awful driving, annoying QTE, schizophrenic sound mixing. A console port so horrible that made me curse out loud with it's constant crashes and required custom patches to fix everything.
Still one of the best games I've ever played with one of the greatest stories in videogame history. 
10/10 gonna buy the sequel at day one. Dead fucking serious.

author: {'steamid': '76561197974936987', 'num_games_owned': 1401, 'num_reviews': 138, 'playtime_forever': 1454, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 879, 'last_played': 1582256506}
review:
*Update since finishing the game*

Holy smokes, this was amazing! The entire game and story and everything felt so well done, besiiiiiiiiides the combat, BUT the elephant in the room is the crashes. If you're willing to put up with a LOT of crashes, scouring the internet for fixes, this is worth checking out, but it's a huge headache. There's a reason there's like... 12% people that have the chapter 2 complete achievement. If you're extremely patient, this version is worth a try, but I'd recommend any other port over this one. Even with DPFIX and compatibility modes, you're going to get crashes and lose progress and need other saves or backup saves. You've been warned.

**Original Review**

This has been a great game so far. The combat is lacking, but exploring and getting to know the town, soundtrack, the intrigue, dialogue, everything is great. But then it crashes. A lot. For no clear reason. And there are definitely fixes online for different issues, but that kind of postpones things until the next crash. Changing compatibility mode helps a bit, but its kind of a shot in the dark with how long it will help. I'm thankful the community is on this to try to get things working and people have save files to get past troublesome moments, but it's a bummer that the developer didn't fix these issues themselves after all these years. 

I do advise checking it out, but probably on any other version besides the PC unless you're will to put up with a lot of stuff. I plan on finishing it, but I know the game is going to fight me every step of the way :(

author: {'steamid': '76561197995200857', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 121, 'playtime_forever': 1033, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1033, 'last_played': 1470355804}
review:
So my introduction to this game was a little weird. You see my first name is Zach, and one day it showed up on the Steam front page and I had had no previous introduction to it, but a trailer started autoplaying where the main character starts talking to his other personality in such a way that it seems as though he's talking to the player, and he keeps calling him Zach.
I was shook. I thought for a second that the game had somehow figured out my name and automatically edited it into the trailer. It felt weird as fuck. And for the entire time I played this game, I felt like I was getting another layer of experience that regular players wouldn't because all of the dialogue directed at Zach really felt like the game was communicating with me directly.
I googled the game and realized how stupid that was, but everything I saw online about the game made it seem divisive.
This game has a definite cult following, but there's also a lot of people who just straight up hate it, and with good reason.
The game is unfinished, or maybe overly ambitious. It's too long with too many pointless systems, and the systems it does have aren't really executed that well.
That said though, this game is impressive in the scope of what it's trying to do.
It combines detective style gameplay reminiscent of LA Noire with the survival horror elements and gunplay from Resident Evil, all the while taking place in a persistent open world that you can explore and with a storyline that's a little too closely ripping off of Twin Peaks, but still manages to hold up on it's own.
Now, although all of that is incredibly ambitious and impressive, I'm sorry to say it doesn't really do any of those things very well. All the gameplay mechanics are at least a little bit clunky, and although it was the game director's ambition to have this open world, the driving and the shooting mechanics of the game could've been reduced or eliminated entirely and I wouldn't have felt that the game was missing out on much. Also, using the map or the overall UI in general is just such a needless hassle.
The real thing here is the story which is surprisingly deep and complex despite the surface similarities to Twin Peaks. Now, be warned though, the dialogue and voice acting is pretty bad (with the exception of York's voice actor who sounds amazing). I'm not sure if this is just a problem of a Japanese game being poorly translated to English, or if the dialogue was just meant to sound this hokey and weird, but regardless, if you can muscle past that, you might actually find yourself enjoying the characters here much more than expected.
Now, as I've said, this game has a lot of similarities to Twin Peaks, enough so, in fact, that I think they got sued over it. Regardless, I actually feel like these are mostly surface or purely aesthetic similarities. The themes the game deals with in it's story are different and the overall vibe is actually pretty different too. Everything feels a little surreal, and you're never quite sure if it's intentional on the part of the developer or just something wacky and stupid. The music often seems weirdly out of place too, but is still really nice to listen to.

Overall, I can't help but recommend this game, although I fully admit it can feel like a bit of a slog at times. I feel like if this game had been given a AAA budget and maybe come out a few years later we would be talking about it nowadays as one of the greatest games of all time. But as it is now it's a fun, but weird, attempt at something bigger and grander.

AND THE SEQUEL IS ABOUT TO COME OUT,SO I REALLY WANT TO BEGGING ALL OF THOSE WHO ARE "NOT RECOMMENDED" THIS GAME TO COMEBACK AND CHANGE THAT,SINCE THAT COULD BE THE ONLY HOPE THAT LET DP2 COME TO PC (STEAM).

author: {'steamid': '76561198149336069', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 745, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 19, 'last_played': 1664306923}
review:
you can get it running at 1080p 60fps with very few glitches

all it takes is
- installing dpfix
- configuring dpfix
- configuring the launcher to work with dpfix
- installing the 4gb patch
- disabling the steam overlay
- using the .exe file to launch instead of steam
- running it in compatibility mode
- uninstalling lav from your computer
- realizing the previous step is harder than it sounds
- finally uninstalling lav after like an hour
- editing the game with a hex editor
- installing a bunch of hd ui mods
- installing your appropriate controller prompts
- creating a savedata folder because the game doesn't create it itself and it needs it to save
- installing a bunch of fixes I didn't mention because it'll still crash anyway
- making a deal with the devil
- downloading five fresh installs because you'll mess up this process alot

and just like that, you have a working video game that you spent money on and you're also a licensed surgeon

10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198034710997', 'num_games_owned': 289, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 1736, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1736, 'last_played': 1390769029}
review: Deadly Premonition ist ein sehr bizarres Spiel. Einige wÃ¼rden es vielleicht auch als trashig bezeichnen, aber es hat einen unglaublichen Charme. Es besitzt nicht die schÃ¶nsten Texturen und ist auch relativ durchschnittlich bei der Steuerung, aber die Dinge um dieses Spiel herum, wie es aufgebaut ist und wie die Geschichte erzÃ¤hlt wird sind besonders und ganz anders, wie man es von anderen Spielen gewohnt ist. Mir gefÃ¤llt die Story rund um York und seiner Detektivarbeit und wer Abseits der Norm nach etwas Abwechslung sucht, kann mit dem Spiel nicht viel falsch machen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028560051', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 433, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 326, 'last_played': 1682976875}
review:
I love DP on 360. Therefore, I've spent hours trying to get this port to work (to check out the DC version) with no avail. 

I'm no stranger to mods, patches, altering files and such, but after about ten hours with DP I'm giving up.  I have around 1400 games on Steam and DP is one of less than 10 Steam games which refuse to function. 

That said, there are good guides from the community to get this working. Expect that it will need some work on your part to make it playable.

I recommend DP but not this port.

author: {'steamid': '76561198068527084', 'num_games_owned': 54, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 226, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 226, 'last_played': 1493597547}
review:
oh my god, I want so much to love this game, it is so cool and has a hell of a lot of content. . . .content that i can not get to, because it is trapped behind a game braking glitch. 

I have tried for several hours to fix this glitch, but tragically there is no way past the glitch. I would suggest a ROM, or if a new edition of this game comes out, then i would suggest that. but as for this copy, i would not want any one to loose their money to it as i did.

author: {'steamid': '76561198313839700', 'num_games_owned': 252, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 106, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 106, 'last_played': 1579000284}
review:
Esperaba poder disfrutar mÃ­nimamente de este "juego". 

Me he armado de paciencia para descargar, instalar y configurar el archivo DPfix que ayuda (mÃ¡s bien habilita) a jugar, haciendo posible una configuraciÃ³n grÃ¡fica. Cabe destacar, que, por defecto, el juego se ve en 720 y estÃ¡ limitado a 30fps y sin este archivo creado por la comunidad, no hay ningÃºn tipo de opciÃ³n grÃ¡fica. Aun tomando estas medidas, al monitorear los recursos consumidos por la grÃ¡fica me he encontrado con la sorpresa de que estos oscilan brutalmente. A veces no consumÃ­a mÃ¡s que 25W para llegar a los 75fps (el refresco de mi pantalla), pero aleatoriamente empezaba a consumir 180w, el mÃ¡ximo de mi GPU para darme mÃ¡s de 300 fps, innecesarios.

Configurar el mando me ha sido imposible, la sensibilidad del ratÃ³n no funciona nada bien y los controles son horribles, es muy incÃ³modo de jugar. AdemÃ¡s, tiene unas teclas asignadas muy raras(apuntar con espacio?), los menÃºs no estÃ¡n nada claros y mucho menos accesibles. Son muchas las ocasiones en las que estÃ¡s en espacios oscuros con poca luz y lo Ãºnico que acabas viendo es lo que estÃ¡ frente al personaje, por la linterna que lleva (una luz que le sale del pecho sin ningÃºn sentido). Es importante puntualizar que lo que estÃ¡ enfrente del personaje no es aquello a lo que estÃ¡s apuntando con la cÃ¡mara, sino lo que tiene literalmente delente, teniendo que hacer que gire sobre sÃ­ mismo para poder enfocar luz allÃ¡ a donde se quiera ver (Â¿he dicho ya que los controles son malos?, porque hacer esta cosa tan simple resulta muchas veces una azaÃ±a).
El sonido se supone que es estÃ©reo, y realmente lo es. Independientemente de donde se suponga que viene el sonido, puede salir por cualquiera de los dos altavoces. Es una locura, solo sirve para confundir y no tiene tÃ©rmino medio: sale por el izquierdo, por el derecho o por los dos con la misma intensidad, no hay una progresiÃ³n que de sensaciÃ³n de entorno. 
El combo de la muerte ha sido el coche, en el que se han juntado una especie de bug de sonido estridente que no dejaba de sonar (evidentemente por encima de cualquier otro sonido del juego, como pueden ser conversaciones importante) y los pÃ©simos controles (a mayor velocidad mÃ¡s rÃ¡pido giraba el coche, haciÃ©ndose imposible su conducciÃ³n). AdemÃ¡s de parecer que carretera y vehÃ­culo no tenÃ­an ningÃºn tipo de contacto.
Luego la narrativa... SÃ­ que lo envuelve cierto halo de misterio y mal rollo del que quieres saber mÃ¡s. Pero no es nada que se desarrolle mientras haces misiones, si no con cinemÃ¡ticas que solo generan mÃ¡s preguntas que respuestas. En mÃ¡s de una hora de juego he caminado por el bosque despuÃ©s de tener un accidente de coche, he llegado a un pueblo en el que me han dado cafÃ© para desayunar y he buscado unas llaves perdidas en una comisarÃ­a que tan siquiera eran mÃ­as. Encima, buscando la llave me he tirado un buen rato por el simple hecho del tiempo que tarda la propia cinemÃ¡tica de abrir puertas para acceder a otra habitaciÃ³n (en la comisarÃ­a hay muchas puertas). Las conversaciones tambiÃ©n tienen un ritmo muy muy pausado y no parecen tener ninguna relevancia.

Es un juego muy mal programado, grÃ¡ficamente horroroso, no tiene jugabilidad y la poca que tiene se hace insufriblemente ortopÃ©dica y encima la narrativa es demasiado pausada, no he visto un juego con tan mal ritmo nunca. Todos estos factores han podido con la paciencia de la que disponÃ­a y que me habÃ­a preparado a sabiendas de lo que se me venÃ­a encima, pero ha sido mucho mÃ¡s de lo esperado. No creo que nadie debiera jugar esta cosa.

author: {'steamid': '76561198022987140', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 805, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 805, 'last_played': 1578244771}
review:
As a game, I would recommend Deadly Premonition--but not this PC port.

The port requires a collection of community fixes to really pass as a game you can get very far in, and it will still crash quite often, as if resource leaks or asserts fail after a while (especially with the map/driving). You can also get corrupted saves or points of instant-crash even with the community fixes in place.

I would like to believe the original Xbox 360 version in backwards compatibility on an Xbox One is a far more stable way to play than the PC release. Or even the recent Switch port.


The game itself is worth playing. The characters are curious, and if the idea of wondering around town as a rather odd FBI agent, and trying to solve a murder mystery between supernatural shootouts is your idea of RPG fun--you'll probably enjoy it. It's a bit slow paced compared to modern games, and the a lot of cut scenes. But it's fun, curious, and a little unique. You'll either love it or get bored within a few hours.

The only thing I really dislike is the PC port's lack of stability. There's only so much that users can fix without being able to recompile the game, or getting really jiggy with a hex editor. Get the console versions on sale or used.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994391496', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 441, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 441, 'last_played': 1576437932}
review:
Good game TRASH port.

Despite the clunky controls, subpar graphics, bland voiceacting and awful driving mechanics, Deadly Premonition is actually pretty good! It's a mix of Japanese horror like Silent Hill and open world games like Shenmue and GTA with weird characters, weird story and humor. This game proves that games don't need to be AAA high budget to be fun as long as it has an interesting premise and decent controls. The humor adds to the fun and the game's atmosphere and music are charming.

However the PC port is unplayable even with DSPfix the game has lots of bugs, clipping, sound issues and crashes whenever it feels like it. I tried to keep playing the game but the crashing really made me lose my patience which is a shame cause again the game is actually pretty good.

Don't buy this on Steam or any PC port, buy it on console if you can.

GrundsÃ¤tzlich ein Spiel das etwas aus der Zeit gefallen scheint, ich hatte zuerst stark vermutet hier ein deutlich Ã¤lteres Spiel vor mir zu haben: Spielerisch mit engen Level, eher montonen Kampf und Gegner und in der Story abstrus und mit aller Gewalt auf FBI-Mystery getrimmt erschien es mir als Ausgeburt der Akte-X und Resident Evil - Ã„ra um 2000. Da sieht man wieder wie teilweise unglÃ¼cklich 3D Spiele altern kÃ¶nnen, zumal hier auch noch eine ohnehin schwache Konsole Engine zugrunde liegt. Auch wenn das Spiel sicherlich bei einigen Fans von diesen alten Mystery-Horror-Actionspielen gefÃ¤llt, vor allem mit der Nostalgiebrille betrachtet, objektiv betrachtet haben wir hier ein schlecht gealtertes 3D-Actionspiel mit abstrusem Storytelling und katastrophaler Portierung (Steuerung und instabil also crashanfÃ¤llig). review:
The story is on point, but the survival horror is not as you would expect.
A game I would play in 2019 regardless it's launch date.
Played without Radio and had fun driving and getting lost.
10/10
But if you want to play this game in win10, search for the DPfix AND play with compatibility mode with either win7 or XPSP3.
Played the whole game with my aim drawing a rectangle and the final boss wants you to aim past the rectangle.
Only discovered that my aim was bugged in the last boss. The guides help getting DPfix, but I couldn't find the fix for aim. Keep trying the compatibility mode and see if you can aim all the way up to the sky, if you can, your game is fixed!

author: {'steamid': '76561198114163743', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 1273, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1273, 'last_played': 1465672094}
review: This game is very fun and has a lot of charm but the PC port of deadly premonition sucks, expect game breaking bugs to completely stop you from enjoying the game. I understand there are patches to help with some of the issues but there are still plenty of problems that slip through the cracks. Play at your own risk.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014901411', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 118, 'playtime_forever': 147, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 147, 'last_played': 1574464665}
review:
An amazing game... On console. On PC, it litterally doesn't work: It's impossible to play with a controller, you can't navigate the menus without crashing the whole game, and it freezes during some specific cinematics, preventing any progression.

It's one of these rare cases where Valve should remove a game from Steam. And keep in mind I'm otherwise a huge fan of this game... When it works.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042653853', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1599, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 884, 'last_played': 1576110437}
review:
Let me explain Deadly Premonition. A game, not about the graphics or mechanics, not even about the story. This game, is about immersion. You investigate the murder with York, while learning about his past as he learns about it, himself; you are a part of this story, even if you're not. 
The PC version, it has its problems. Make sure you research crashes and stability fixes before playing; even though the data is from 2013, it's still valid and fixes problems.

 Swery and his dev followers, though you've changed over the years, I still find you extremely compelling.

author: {'steamid': '76561198024442871', 'num_games_owned': 145, 'num_reviews': 75, 'playtime_forever': 1547, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1547, 'last_played': 1568929445}
review:
DO NOT WASTE YOUR PRECIOUS MONEY!

When you get in any car, you hear a extremely loud drifting sound. It will always play until you get out of the car and it's really annoying.

LOTS OF CRASHING! So many F^%$# times I crashed at random areas. THERE IS NO AUTO SAVE! If you play halfway of the game and not save, CRASH, you start from the very beginning. Must save frequently which slows down computer and uses up too much memory.

INVENTORY BUGS! If you go to inventory, click the map, the game is running but your mouse pointer and keyboard is FROZEN! ALL YOU CAN DO IS WATCH AND HEAR THE PLEASANT BACKGROUND MUSIC. Forces you to Control Alt Delete and force close the game. and btw, I had to do this over 10 times! 

CUTSCENE BUGS! I found 3 or 4 different cutscenes where you watch it. After the cutscene, the game either CRASH or goes into a BLACK SCREEN OF DEATH!

DO NOT BUY! BUY IT FOR SWITCH, PS4, OR XBOX ONLY! 

THIS GAME NEEDS TO SERIOUSLY F&*&%# BE REMOVED FROM STEAM! F(*&^%$# STEALING PEOPLE'S MONEY ON A GAME THAT BARELY WORKS! 

I SPENT 30 MORE DOLLARS ON THE SWITCH VERSION BECAUSE THE PC VERSION FAILS. DO NOT BUY!
___________________________________________

05/18/2021 REVIEW
So many cruel people in this world giving false fake lying good reviews. The reviews make this game look mostly good but they are all lies. They just feel bad for the developer making a broken game so they convince new players to continue to fund them out of false donation. That's not right at all. Shame on the most good reviews seriously shame on most of ya, all teaming up so the people who want to try this or don't believe the bad reviews are the actual truth will end up buying the game and find out the hard way. They will doubt and say this is a good game based on the majority good reviews. They will try the game out themselves and see the bugs errors and crashes themselves (seeing is believing, sadly) and will deeply regret it. It's not too late. Listen to the bad reviews, the game is indeed broken or has a lot of problems. If you wanna doubt us and waste your precious hard earned money, be my guest. Just letting you know, the bad reviews warned you.

review: Can't even play the game as it crashes no matter what. Tried every solution. Hot trash of a port, shame as the game itself is charming.

author: {'steamid': '76561198038861259', 'num_games_owned': 444, 'num_reviews': 103, 'playtime_forever': 1720, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1720, 'last_played': 1573558025}
review:
Warning this game might not work on your PC. It worked on my second PC.
Once you get it to work, you will expierience one of the best games I have ever played. The Characters are all memorable and weird. The shooting is a little bit clunky but bearable. Overall the game crashed for me three times, fortunately after I saved. I can only recommend it, if you know it will run on your PC.

author: {'steamid': '76561198145828540', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 1626, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1511, 'last_played': 1628150120}
review: Deadly Premonition has an interesting plot and fun characters to fill it. The game itself is buggy, there are certain cutscenes that will crash the game, but I was able to solve every problem I had by running the crash-prone sections in Windows 98 Compatibility Mode. If you're willing to take a little extra time and care to play a buggy game, Deadly Premonition is a rewarding one to play. I really enjoyed this game.

review:
Just don't, look for a better game.
A better PC port anyways.
Crashing in between saves is actually really demoralizing, I can't imagine getting to the point where my saves corrupt like other people have reported.

author: {'steamid': '76561198069060604', 'num_games_owned': 1111, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 222, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 222, 'last_played': 1559854951}

author: {'steamid': '76561198129076118', 'num_games_owned': 1501, 'num_reviews': 114, 'playtime_forever': 1568, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1568, 'last_played': 1571977111}
review:
[h1][b] UN VIAJE IRREPETIBLE [/b][/h1]

Cualquier videojugador que haya estado un tiempo en internet habra oido hablar de este titulo en mas de una ocasion, un juego cuyo apartado tecnico siendo un completo desastre ayudo a que se convirtiera en un titulo de culto y principalmente su gran historia y personajes.
Jugar Deadly Premonition sin duda es una experiencia que a muchos resultara extraÃ±a e incomodo muchas veces debido a lo ya mencionado pobre de su apartado tecnico que llega a tal punto de pensar que los enemigos y los "bosses" solo estan ahi como excusa de hacer algo entre cada mision. Llegado el momento de jugarlo donde realmente logra brillar es en su gran historia y personajes, los cuales no tiene miedo en tomarse un tiempo en presentarnos toda su ambientacion y desarrollo cargado de guiÃ±os y simbolismos que incluso llegan a romper la cuarta pared. Este mismo desarrollo tambien lo podes ver en casi todos sus personajes desde los principales hasta los secundarios llevados de manera excelente a la par con su historia, la cual increiblemente nos dara momentos de todo tipo incluso llegando a lo mas bizarro.

La historia nos pondra en la papel del agente del FBI Francis York Morgan el cual es enviado al pueblo de Greenville a investigar el asesinato de una joven la cual se aparentemente se encuentra relacionado con casos previos de su investigacion y que guarda relacion con el mito cultural del pueblo acerca del asesino del impermeable rojo.

[b] [u] PROS:[/u] [/b]

[list]

[*]Posee una historia realmente intrigante, llena de idas y vueltas que a pesar que en algunos momentos sea predecible, hay momentos que realmente logran sorprenderte.
[*]Esta lleno de grandes personajes y trasfondos, sobretodo el protagonista lo cual me hace pensar que nunca he visto un protagonista tan elocuente y con un gran carisma.
[*]La banda sonora a pesar de lo incansable y repetitivo que es, al final realmente termine disfrutandola.

[/list]

[b] [u] CONT:[/u] [/b]

[list]

[*]El port de pc es simplemente un desastre que aun con parches en algun momento se bugea.
[*]Aunque muchos digan que su apartado tecnico es parte de su encanto, eso no quita el echo de que sea una completa basura.
[*]Se siente como si los enemigos del juego estan ahi para alargar innecesariamente el juego.

[/list]

Deadly Premonition es una obra como pocas que ahora que lo he jugado he podido comprobar el porque de su renombre, una experencia tan rara pero a la vez muy gratificante e interesante que sin duda si eres amante de los videojuegos deberias probarlo aunque sea una vez a pesar de lo molesto de su port en esta plataforma.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=PlgjtKPtpT8

author: {'steamid': '76561197991465063', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 241, 'playtime_forever': 1366, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1366, 'last_played': 1399019921}
review:
This is a unique game with heavy inspiration from Twin Peaks. I know the game have a fanbase, i can say i understand why they are fans of the game. It's a story driven game with kinda free roaming gameplay.

It's very focused on the main protagonist and the characters around him. The story is a bit weird but it works to some degree. The gameplay is nothing to brag about but it does it's job.

Overall i liked the game and completed the game after 22 hours. 

Buyer beware wired game not for everyone   

7/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198138364062', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 1266, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1261, 'last_played': 1593976015}
review: If you're gonna play this game, play it on a console. I first played this game on my Xbox years ago and fell in love. It was pretty dodgy but still playable and enjoyable. I can't recommend it on PC because it crashes a lot and whatnot, but definitely play it elsewhere because it's worth checking out.

author: {'steamid': '76561198137097703', 'num_games_owned': 152, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 783, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 744, 'last_played': 1571657223}
review: I found out about this game when it was on the Playstation Plus free games sometime ago. I downloaded it and had a great experience. My PS3 broke and was getting into PC gaming. The game was on sale so I brought it. The game didnt run on my PC at the time (it was a crappy Acer), so I had to wait to get a new one to play the game. Fast forward to a couple of months ago. This game runs horribly on Windows 10. The game crashes at almost every cutscene and I am now unable to complete the game because of this. I might have to go back to PS3 to play it (and lose all my progress). I have tried lots of fixes to try to complete the game to get it running stable, but nothing has worked. I might have to downgrade my PC to Windows 7 or XP or Vista to complete the game. If you can get it running properly or get it on console the game is amazing and anyone would enjoy it. There is also a problem on PC where controller controlls are a but messed up but a quick configuration download can fix that problem.

author: {'steamid': '76561197965728621', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 23, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 23, 'last_played': 1571490191}
review: Doesn't work with the newest Win 10 service patch. Compatibility modes, 4gb patches, dsfixes dont help. Crashes when you press play on the menu after the intro logos.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028993615', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 133, 'playtime_forever': 257, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 257, 'last_played': 1440875678}
review: Abysmal port. Don't start playing if you have a modern PC, unless you are ok with wasting a lot of time getting it to run.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998781766', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 139, 'playtime_forever': 626, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 440, 'last_played': 1571183252}
review:
Buggy port is buggy.

I am enjoying the game, despite that. But I REALLY can not recommend this port. I'm honestly shocked that the publisher is still selling this despite giving up on it shortly after launch. You need like 3-4 Community Fixes just to play it "satisfactorily" and even then the game will crash randomly/often.

You're better off getting one of the console versions (which will be just as buggy, but won't crash) or watching the game off Youtube from someone suffering through the port jobs for the sake of having a "Twin Peaks" game.

Hopefully the eventual Premonition 2 PC port is better done/done by Swery himself. But I'm not going to hold my breath on that.

Edit: Ok, I give up. The game now no longer will load the save where I am and I'm just in the FIRST CHAPTER. I flat out refuse to reload a previous area/chapter within that chapter for the hope of finally getting into the Community Center and continuing the story.

Fuck Rising Star Games for this shit port job and fuck them for not bothering to try to get it to a tolerable/playable from start-to-finish level. Avoid them and any game they publish on Steam.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027613946', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 3195, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3151, 'last_played': 1570742493}
review:
Deadly Premonition is fabled to have different combination of bugs for each player. Yet this crashy-freezy mesh is one of the extremely few 'whodunnit' that make your jaw drop again and again. 

- Run in Windows 98 compatibility
- Try changing from fullscreen to windowed
- Most importantly, RESTART YOUR COMPUTER OFTEN. It always helps. Go figure.
- Drink coffee in-game
- Listen to the coffee in game
- Drink coffee in real life 
- Listen to the coffe in real life to endure the bugs
- Wander off the main path if you have a hunch.
- Stick with this and you 'll be rewarded with one of the best murder mysteries ever

author: {'steamid': '76561197984007528', 'num_games_owned': 1243, 'num_reviews': 70, 'playtime_forever': 341, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 341, 'last_played': 1546481736}

author: {'steamid': '76561198056060873', 'num_games_owned': 814, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 796, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 654, 'last_played': 1570226479}
review:
Ein Spiel der gemischten GefÃ¼hle. Auf der einen Seite mag ich solche etwas chaotischen und durchgedrehten Spiele wie u.a. "Killer is Dead" oder "Shadows of the Damned", aber hier nerven mich Kleinigkeiten weitaus mehr als bei all anderen Spielen. Fangen wir mal bei der Grafik an. Diese ist, bescheiden gesagt, einfach nur beschissen. Die Texturen sind auf miesem PS3-Niveau, die Charaktere wirken auch etwas steif und die Gesichtsanimationen sind auch nicht grade ausdrucksstark. Trotz erzwungener KantenglÃ¤ttung flimmert grade der Wald enorm. Auch die Weitsicht ist kaum gegeben. Es ploppen grade wÃ¤hrend der Fahrt gerne mal GegenstÃ¤nde, Autos oder auch Tiere in unmittelbarer NÃ¤he auf. Grade wÃ¤hrend der Fahrt muss man aufpassen, dass man niemandem rammt. 

Kommen wir jetzt mal zu Steuerung. Diese ist auch nicht so gut. Grade das Autofahren ist da manchmal echt ne Qual. Dies ist auch der etwas hakeligen Kamera und den lahmen Karosserien geschuldet. Apropos Autofahren. Die Karte ist hier der grÃ¶sste Krampf. Diese dreht sich auch im MenÃ¼ mit, was dank nicht vorhandener Navigationspunkte noch frickeliger ist. Man muss sich also immer die Strecke genau einprÃ¤gen, wenn man dringend (also unter Zeitdruck) mal wohin muss. Die Minimap ist da keinen Deut besser. Zwar lÃ¤sst sich ein grÃ¶sserer Abschnitt per Tastendruck wÃ¤hrend der Fahrt einblenden, aber dieser ist eben dank fehlender Navigationspunkte nicht viel hilfreicher. Hinzu kam auch mal ein Bug, der die Karte verschwinden lies und dies lies sich nur durch einen Neustart beseitigen. 

Nun nochmal zurÃ¼ck zur Technik. Da das Spiel schon nicht gut aussieht, sollte es zumindest problemlos (auf einem fÃ¼r das Spiel mehr als starken PC) gut laufen, oder? Leider nein! Grade wÃ¤hrend der Fahrt bricht die Framerate gerne mal ein. Kommt dann noch ein Gewitter hinzu, geht sie noch mehr in die Knie. Und das trotz geringer Auslastung der Hardware. Und ja, ich hab den DPFix verwendet, der das Spiel, nicht wie ursprÃ¼nglich nur in 720p und 30Fps, sondern in Full HD und 60Fps laufen lÃ¤sst. Aber allzu viel kann hier auch die Modding-Community nicht retten. Der Port ist einfach nur eine Frechheit. Hier wÃ¼rde ich auf jeden Fall auf nen Sale warten und das Spiel nicht fÃ¼r 25â‚¬ kaufen. FÃ¼r das Geld gibt es echt bessere Spiele. 

Hinzu kamen bislang auch ein paar AbstÃ¼rze, welche entweder bereits im HauptmenÃ¼ passierten oder erst vollkommen zufÃ¤llig mitten im Spiel. Dies kÃ¶nnte aber natÃ¼rlich auch den beiden Mods geschuldet sein, die ich installiert habe. 

Kommen wir noch zu guter Letzt zur Musik. Diese ist zwar nicht schlecht, aber sie passt in manchen Augenblicken so gar nicht. Mir ist es nÃ¤mlich passiert, dass wÃ¤hrend dem Besuch des Tatorts plÃ¶tzlich diese frÃ¶hliche Musik wieder einsetzte, was echt die schÃ¶n dÃ¼stere Stimmung zunichte machte. Und wÃ¤hrend der teilweise langen Fahrt von mehreren Minuten von A nach B dÃ¼delt auch immer die gleiche Mukke. Da hÃ¤tte ich mir echt ein Radio gewÃ¼nscht. 

So, und nun zum Schluss noch die Dinge, die mir an dem Spiel durchaus gefallen. Da wÃ¤re zum einen der schrullige Agent York Morgan, der sich auch gut mit Filmen auskennt, was mich als kleiner Cineast durchaus erfreut. Auch die anderen Charaktere sind durchaus interessant. Das Gleiche gilt auch fÃ¼r die Story. 

Fazit: Das hier ist echt ein Spiel, das man schon wirklich mÃ¶gen muss, um Spass zu haben. Es ist somit nicht fÃ¼r jeden geeignet.

author: {'steamid': '76561198037631487', 'num_games_owned': 612, 'num_reviews': 96, 'playtime_forever': 544, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 488, 'last_played': 1603933407}
review:
If this works for you and you can play from start to finish, this is one of the best games of all time in my opinion. HOWEVER, this port is trash to such an extent that I'd never touch anything from Rising Star Games (the publisher whos responsibility it would be to fix it)  again. It has never received a patch since launch and refuses to run on a lot of hardware. On my machine it runs but crashes after act 1, on my old machine it never ran at all even though that machine was of sufficient spec.

Shame on Rising Star Games.

review:
En serio es de 2013? Hay juegos de PS2 con un mejor apartado tÃ©cnico que esto. Los pantallazos en blanco, los temblores de cÃ¡mara, los polÃ­gonos sin suavizar, la gama de colores... es todo un dolor de cabeza. El control del personaje y del coche es lo siguiente a tosco. La mÃºsica, algunas canciones son ridÃ­culas. El sonido de las pisadas al correr es de risa. Los diÃ¡logos vacÃ­os, absurdos y anodinos. 

El prota se enciende un cigarro cada 5 minutos, incluso lloviÃ©ndole a mares encima. Se hace pesadÃ­simo con pantallas de una larga animaciÃ³n de un objeto cada vez que coges uno, sin poder evitarlo. El precio, si no estÃ¡ en oferta, es excesivo para lo que es el juego. Mucha gente lo defiende por la historia, bueno, para eso te miras un gameplay en youtube, largo y tedioso de muchas horas y te ahorras el sufrimiento de jugarlo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198071328359', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 65, 'playtime_forever': 82, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 82, 'last_played': 1569180933}
review:
He completado el juego en Nintendo Switch, por eso tengo tan pocas horas en Steam, aÃºn asÃ­ quiero publicar mi reseÃ±a.

La historia de este juego es su punto fuerte que compensa otras carencias como los grÃ¡ficos y el gameplay. La historia se desarrolla en un pequeÃ±o pueblo ficticio del Norte de Estados Unidos que tiene fama de ser tranquilo. Debido al asesinato de una mujer, el agente York, el protagonista y agente del FBI, es enviado al pueblo a investigar. Durante el transcurso de la historia, tendrÃ¡s la compaÃ±Ã­a de Emily y George, dos policÃ­as de dicho pueblo que te ayudarÃ¡n en la investigaciÃ³n del asesinato y tambiÃ©n establecerÃ¡s vÃ­nculos con ellos. 
AdemÃ¡s de eso, conocerÃ¡s a todos los habitantes del pueblo y de paso, visitarÃ¡s bastantes lugares del mismo, todo ello con un ambiente de misterio bien conseguido. Sin lugar a dudas, cogerÃ¡s simpatÃ­a con varios personaje del juego que son el punto fuerte de la historia. AdemÃ¡s de eso, la investigaciÃ³n provoca bastante interÃ©s debido a la rareza del asesinato y los personajes poseen un aura de misterio con el que desearÃ¡s saber mÃ¡s de cada uno de ellos. 
Los enemigos casi siempre suelen ser bestias paranormales de aspecto humano. El juego no explica nada de su existencia, no sÃ© ni por quÃ© aparecen. Da la sensaciÃ³n de que estÃ¡n hechos para forzar la acciÃ³n. Literalmente, no hay ningÃºn diÃ¡logo en el juego que hable sobre estas bestias. 
Inesperadamente, el juego tiene algunas situaciones "cÃ³micas" muy bien conseguidas. 

El juego grÃ¡ficamente es pobre pero tiene su encanto, consigue crear esa ambientaciÃ³n de pueblo "pequeÃ±o" y crear escenarios frios. El juego en principio iba a salir para PS2, pero en mitad del desarrollo decidieron sacarlo para consolas de la siguiente generaciÃ³n, por eso tiene grÃ¡ficos mejores que PS2, pero que no llegan al nivel de PS3. Algunas animaciones faciales resultan bastante robÃ³ticas, pero una vez que te acostumbras lo ignoras. El juego tiene algunas piezas musicales bastante buenas asÃ­ como algunas canciones, sin dudas, el soundtrack estÃ¡ muy bien conseguido y es digno de recordar.

Respecto al gameplay, los movimientos son algo robÃ³ticos y rÃ­gidos debido a la lentitud de los personajes. En escenas de acciÃ³n en el que hay que disparar o esquivar objetos es fÃ¡cil cometer algÃºn error. La dificultad de este videojuego no es elevada, solo he muerto unas 10 veces antes de completar el juego, 7 de ellas debido a fallar en Quick Time Event. Hay pocos puzzles que no son difÃ­ciles de superar. Gran parte el juego la pasarÃ¡s en coches de policÃ­as conduciendo por el gran mapa que tiene. La conducciÃ³n se hace algo molesta, no sÃ© el quÃ© es precisamente pero es muy fÃ¡cil chocarse a pesar del poco trÃ¡fico. El mapa es muy grande y poco denso. Las misiones se resumen en ve a X lugar a hablar con algÃºn personaje o a investigar. Parecen simple, pero el misterio del juego y el interÃ©s que provoca la historia hace que completar estas misiones sean todo lo contrario a una molestia. El juego tiene un sistema de dia/noche, de sueÃ±o y comida. Aunque tampoco influye mucho debido a que en cualquier lugar hay una cama o algo para comer. Eso sÃ­, hay misiones que son exclusivas de X hora, por lo que tendrÃ¡s que estar atento al tiempo.
Una vez completado el juego, hay bastantes cosas que hacer como hacer, coleccionar cromos, otros coleccionables e investigar sobre algunos habitantes y lugares del pueblo.

En general me esperaba un juego bastante mediocre pero me ha sorprendido demasiado para bien. La historia y los personajes son sobresaliente. Estoy esperando con ansias la segunda parte de este juego que saldrÃ¡ en Switch.

author: {'steamid': '76561197990021465', 'num_games_owned': 1152, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 2865, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2413, 'last_played': 1569939085}
review:
The most terrifying thing about this horror game is itâ€™s stability. 

If you have some time, let me tell you the story about what I had to endure in order to finish this broken mess of a PC port.

It all started 3 years ago when I was gifted the game. It was instantly intriguing to me, and rightly so! It is a really weird but all in all very fun game...when it works. Well for me the fun stopped quite quickly back then, when I encountered a game breaking bug in chapter 3. This of course led me to search for solutions online. What I found were mostly reports of more and more bugs that could occur later in the game. I didnâ€™t want to take the risk of putting a lot of time into playing it only to get stuck somewhere in the middle or even the end. So I decided not to keep playing even if there was a fix for my bug.

Fast forward to about 2 weeks ago when I somehow really felt like playing some more Deadly Premonition. I have absolutely no idea what drove me that day. So I did some research first and found this great community guide that really sparked some hope within me that, with the right precautions, the game could be finished without to much of a hassle.

So I installed it, installed what is known as DPfix and did some other minor stuff that was recommended to me. And it worked like a charm. Chapter 3? No problem there at all, buddy! The next 2 chapters? Some wonky bugs and a few crashes. Annoying but nothing serious.

Then came chapter 6. In chapter 6 you have to enter a specific building in order to progress the story. The game crashed EVERY SINGLE TIME I tried to open the f****** door. And of course none of the potential solutions I found online worked for me.
Well lucky me I thought, I own a PC and an old laptop. So I installed the game on my laptop copied over my savefile and voilÃ ; it would barely run the game but it was good enough to enter the building, progress a little and save. I copied the savefile back to my PC and continued playing. For a while. Because this kind of bug started to become more and more frequent.

Do this: Crash!
Go there: Crash!

And every single time I had to copy the savefile over to my laptop, play with sub 20 FPS until it let me save again and copy the file back. Absolutely ridiculous! So I said f*** it, letâ€™s just get this over with and keep playing on my laptop. It would probably be the end of it, as death of overheating was imminent but I had come quite far by now. I couldnâ€™t accept defeat and I certainly wasnâ€™t going to constantly copy my savefile back and forth another million times. So I play the game on my laptop and itâ€™s not really fun with this framerate but at least itâ€™s mostly stable.

Enter chapter 14. Another building, another f****** glitchy door that this time also manages to defeat my laptop. So I go back to my PC. There is a slim chance it might work over there, right? No. Wrong. It didnâ€™t. And again neither did any of the solutions I found online. 

After crying a little I decided that this still would not be my defeat. So I looked for help on a forum and found a really nice person who was willing to load up my save, go through that stupid a** door for me, save again as soon as possible and send the file back to me. Awesome. 

So Iâ€™m inside the building and the first story related thing I have to interact with crashes the game. On both systems. Every time. So I asked my new friend if he would be willing to simply play that entire chapter for me. And he did. Very awesome!

Chapter 15. The horror continues. So Iâ€™m finally away from this f****** unstable mansion, play a little bit and then I hear the words: â€œGo back to the mansionâ€ No. Please lord make it stop.

Same door, same crash. So at this point I have fully gone from exchanging a savefile between my 2 computers to exchanging a savefile with some poor dude I met on a forum. Basically he was now playing the game for me. As far as I know thatâ€™s not how it should be, right?

Well after the mansion there came 2 stable chapters at some other locations. But you see by that time I had searched a walkthrough for the word â€œmansionâ€. It came up 6 more times. 6!!! This is where Iâ€™m at now. I know the next level will be a mansion level. Iâ€™m scared. I donâ€™t want to go there :â€™(

I will update this once the game, or me, is defeated. Pray for me.

Update: Of course it crashes. What did you think? Im done with this game for now. Maybe I can get my hands on a third computer somehow and maybe it will work there. Until then I can't be bothered anymore by this a**-backwards s***.

Anyway...I am absolutely certain that, would I have gone to work in the time I tried to fix this crappy portjob, I could have bought a PS3 and the game and I could play it without an issue. So thatâ€™s what you should do. Donâ€™t buy this here. Iâ€™m dead f****** serious. If you buy this game on/for steam after reading this you are officially a masochist and you deserve it.

Update 2: I just beat the game. My buddy from the forum finished one last chapter for me and I was able to do the rest by myself. Lots of crashes of course but more random than before and not at specific points. 
I really liked the final chapters and the bad taste this port left in my mouth really is a shame. If you are curious about the game I'd say go for it and get it...just not the PC version.

author: {'steamid': '76561198021363778', 'num_games_owned': 494, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 997, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 944, 'last_played': 1678993142}
review:
The game is great, but the PC version runs pretty bad, The framerate is pretty unstable, the game itself is pretty unstable and may break on you, and sometimes the game won't even boot. But the game itself was strangely enjoyable, and there is very little out there that matches the feel of this game. 

That's why I still gotta recommend it to anyone with an open mind about performance and storytelling.

As for fixing the game, DPFix is recommended for tuning up the game if it even wants to boot, and try making the game run as admin. Ultrawide is not supported, even with mods, as the fov gets zoomed in and cutscenes gets cropped. Letterboxing doesn't seem like an option either, so you will have to set your monitors resolution to its 16:9 equivalent.

author: {'steamid': '76561198003362857', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 324, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 290, 'last_played': 1568078721}
review: Wish I could recommend this game, but the port job is a mess. Needs some serious work to be playable. Best bet would be if you wanna try it, get it on console if you can.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042654015', 'num_games_owned': 257, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1533, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1533, 'last_played': 1567993988}
review:
I absolutely adored this game, it's become one of my favourites if only for the sheer amount of heart put into it. If you like campy games chances are you'll like this too.
With that said, I cannot recommend playing this version of it. It crashes constantly for seemingly no reason and that kills some of the enjoyment. You didn't hear it from me, but this game is supposed to play really well on a pretend PS3, if you catch my drift.

author: {'steamid': '76561198001258363', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 109, 'playtime_forever': 16, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 16, 'last_played': 1567952437}
review:
Literally the prime example of "playing for the plot". This game gained a strong reputation and cult following over the years just due how presents its story. Unfortunately everything else is debatable.

The elephant in the room is the fact the PC port is terrible in more than one aspect, requiring a fanmade patch to fix most or few of the issues, so if anything you could try to play it on 360 or Switch instead. Once that's solved comes the rest of problems for some players such as wonky action segments (Which to be fair they were forced to be in it) and aged graphics that were already not that mesmerizing on its debut. On the other hand, such flaws were also the reason why the game gradually became more popular as time passed.

This game is in a very odd spot when comes to being a full recommendation. It's plot is undoubtly one of the most unique you can find in any media, ranging from odd characters and awkward situations to the UI and graphics further flavoring the experience. On the other hand, the nefarious PC port that is barely functional even with fan patches, and some obvious negatives that made it gain bad reviews on its launch, makes it a very complicated game to offer at the average player. You could watch a playthrough (not necessarily fully), and if really interests you then play it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198119455133', 'num_games_owned': 398, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 28, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13, 'last_played': 1567952568}
review: Supposed to be a great game ... but it's a shame that it's a broken mess which the fans had to fix themselves .... at this prize a complete joke just emulate it or buy a key so you don't regret wasting your money, for this is another one of those garbage PC ports

author: {'steamid': '76561198021393286', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 112, 'playtime_forever': 373, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 373, 'last_played': 1502555135}
review: It's brokenâ„¢.

author: {'steamid': '76561198125235157', 'num_games_owned': 449, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 446, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 446, 'last_played': 1431387465}
review:
This is mostly a Switch port review: plays a bit better than Steam, no game breaking glitches or crashes. The hair effects kind of get lit weird but its not a deal breaker. The only major difference otherwise between "Origins" and "Director's Cut" is that it loses some added cutscenes this version has. Gonna be honest though? The Director's Cut scenes are pretty worthless and don't add much to the story.

Please play the wacky Deadly Premonition ride.

Edit: OH NEVER MIND BIG BIG CRASHES but just remember to save every chance you get and let your system breath instead of leaving it on the Switch home screen like I did.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002077775', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 686, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 686, 'last_played': 1567902055}
review: The game is great fun, imagine twin peaks as a video game and add some anime to it. The problem is that it crashes so much. You shouldn't have to go through hours of fixes just to try and get through a part of the game that keeps crashing during a cutscene. If you want to play the game buy it on another system the pc version is known for having game breaking bugs.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013837013', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 107, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 70, 'last_played': 1688940099}
review: Game runs like crap. I've barely been able to play it because of the variety of technical issues. First off when i started playing with a controller the right x y was reversed ,meaning up and down moves the camera left and right, and vice versa. after i was able to fix that for some reason the frame rate took a complete nosedive. I have a gaming laptop that can run Doom 2016 on High settings but this game gives me 15 fps at the highest. Just dont play this on steam get it on the switch or something.

author: {'steamid': '76561198068790239', 'num_games_owned': 3830, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 793, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 793, 'last_played': 1532540656}
review: I sadly cannot recommend this to anybody, first off I had to download a fan made patch in order for this game to even start, it wouldn't even start up until I downloaded this. So everything is fine until I get to chapter 9, apparently there is a game breaking bug at the start of this chapter, and the cutscene that plays at the beginning will always crash the game leaving you unable to play the rest of the game, so then I watched chapter 9 on youtube and downloaded a chapter 10 save to try and continue the game. WELL... there's also a chance your game will crash everytime you try to get into a car at the beginning of chapter 10, and that happened to me also. So yeah, that's kind of a big deal, and there is no known workaround for these issues, and after 2 game breaking bugs i'm not going to bother to even attempt continuing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198101446092', 'num_games_owned': 51, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 2670, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1721, 'last_played': 1590421792}
review: Anyone who dislikes this game is just a wuss. No, it doesnt always work perfectly but the technical problems are far outweighed by the story. This is probably the strangest game in the world. I enjoyed every minute of it. If you want a taste of how bizarre this game is, search "sinners sandwich" on youtube

I become so frustrated towards ending that i just watched cutscenes compilation on yt. Story is ok i guess. I liked it before it got too paranormal towards last 10% of game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198120079272', 'num_games_owned': 423, 'num_reviews': 202, 'playtime_forever': 1997, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1997, 'last_played': 1566406408}
review: Clunkiness + Absolute Masterpiece = Deadly Premonition

author: {'steamid': '76561197964110414', 'num_games_owned': 634, 'num_reviews': 230, 'playtime_forever': 123, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 123, 'last_played': 1566364400}
review: Don't know how many times I heard this game was "soooo bad it was so good".... Well no... those people just have garbage opinions. HOOOOLY F###!!! This game is so bad that it is fkn terrible!!! First of all it was a pain in the ass to get started. Once I did via 3rd party patchs I start the game. This game is hard to look at. Sort of like that ex you bump into at the club/grocery store/craft night at the community center... blah blah blah. Anyways... The first episode involves you running down some provincial park turning on power generators & shooting handicapped ghosts with the worst shooting/aiming I have ever experienced in a 3rd person game. People will talk s### about Resident Evil 4's tank controls... ya they werent the best but whatever you get used to it after an hour. This game is a fricken nightmare. Your character basically try's to aim but they have parkinson's disease it seems like... it's a big fricken mess. Plus there is no reward or payoff after you kill the same looking b#### that had her ribs removed for the 18th time. Anyways... 2 hrs later I decided to uninstall this crap and move on. This is not worth your time. And anybody that claims it's worth it clearly has trash taste in games or just really does like trash. Im sure for it's time....MAAAAAYBE it might have been worth it because you blew $60 damn dollars on this when it came out and felt like you had to get some of your moneys worth. But these days when there are sooo many great games to choose from/ Sales like every damn day where you can buy a decent game for just a few bucks... THIS IS NOT WORTH YOUR TIME OR MONEY!!! Honestly games like these that don't even work and require 3rd party patches and modifiing of the .ini file shouldn't even be on steam. This should be freeware... right beside all the damn AOL trial cds you collected over the years. Give this piece of s### a pass and buy something like Mass Effect 2 or a Family Mega Meal from KFC

review: This is wonderfully trashy. It is cumbersome, but it has a lot to do and a lot of charme. author: {'steamid': '76561198059833388', 'num_games_owned': 1263, 'num_reviews': 135, 'playtime_forever': 3100, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3066, 'last_played': 1593633862}
review:
Cult classic. Art. The best game ever. The worst game ever. 

What ever you want to call Deadly Premonition, it is an experience that no other game offers.

Come for the laughs, stay for the characters, the story, the writing and the music.

It's a rough PC Port that can be fixed with the amazing guides on Steam and installing DPfix. You will not regret tinkering with files for a few minutes after you watched the credits roll.

A charming experience that will stick with you long after you finished it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028244437', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 194, 'playtime_forever': 90, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 90, 'last_played': 1546250338}
review:
[i](jeu fini sur Xbox 360 via la rÃ©trocompatibilitÃ© Xbox One - recommencÃ© sur Steam)[/i]

Il m'en a fallu du temps pour me mettre Ã  Deadly Premonition! J'ai toujours Ã©tÃ© repoussÃ© par la rÃ©putation sulfureuse du titre, tant au niveau du gameplay que la technique.

Quand je l'ai enfin commencÃ©, je m'en suis voulu de ne pas avoir dÃ©couvert ce bijou bien plus tÃ´t.

Oui, Deadly Premonition est devenu instantanÃ©ment l'un de mes jeux cultes.

Dire pourquoi au dÃ©tour de quelques lignes est pratiquement impossible, tant le titre de Swery se vit plutÃ´t qu'il ne se raconte.

Alors si je devais mettre en avant des qualitÃ©s, je parlerais de sa bande-son, exceptionnelle. Certaines pistes restent en tÃªte et entÃªtent, comme "The Woods and The Goddess" ou "Life is Beautiful".

D'une maniÃ¨re gÃ©nÃ©rale, toute la partie sonore est une brillante rÃ©ussite, de la B.O. aux dialogues.

Je parlerai Ã©galement du scÃ©nario, Ã  mi-chemin entre Twin Peaks et Silent Hill, dÃ©coupÃ© en chapitres faÃ§on sÃ©rie tÃ©lÃ© et ici aussi, d'une maÃ®trise rarement vue dans un jeu vidÃ©o. Tous les personnages sont haut en couleurs, et avec un background qui accompagne l'immersion.

Je ne compte mÃªme plus les scÃ¨nes cultes, dont la trÃ¨s Ã©nervante pÃªche Ã  l'attachÃ©-case, la trop longue scierie, les Crawling Shadows (trÃ¨s Silent Hill-esque pour le coup), les bossfight (oui, tous), la rÃ©vÃ©lation du tueur et bien sÃ»r les courses poursuite (pour le coup pas frustrantes) avec le tueur Ã  l'imper.

Vrai-faux open world avec une conduite atroce et quelques allers-retours laborieux, Deadly Premonition testait tout un tas de mÃ©caniques assez inhabituelles pour l'Ã©poque (s'alimenter, la gestion du temps bien que dÃ©jÃ  vue dans Shenmue).

La partie "action" du jeu (que Swery ne voulait pas, il voulait au contraire un jeu 100% narratif) emprunte ici aussi Ã©normÃ©ment Ã  Silent Hill, jusque dans la gestion de l'inventaire voire mÃªme des bruitages. Armes de mÃªlÃ©e cassables, armes Ã  feu Ã  munitions limitÃ©es, crÃ©atures flippantes et c'est Ã  peu prÃ¨s tout. Encore une fois, l'intÃ©rÃªt du jeu se trouve dans toute la partie exploration et enquÃªte, facilement 70% du jeu.

Alors oui, il n'est vraiment pas trÃ¨s beau  (mais la direction artistique est Ã  tomber), la maniabilitÃ© donne envie de se mettre les doigts dans la prise et la scÃ¨ne QTE prÃ©cÃ©dant le boss final est atroce, mais en s'arrÃªtant Ã  Ã§a, vous passeriez, comme moi, Ã  cÃ´tÃ© d'une vraie pÃ©pite mÃ©connue. Il faut Ã©galement ne pas Ãªtre insensible au WTF.

Je n'ai pas jouÃ© Ã  Deadly Premonition, j'ai littÃ©ralement fait partie de Greenvale et du quotidien de ses habitants durant une vingtaine d'heures, heures qui me marqueront Ã  jamais. C'est un jeu que j'aime d'amour.

Attention toutefois Ã  la version Steam, jamais patchÃ©e, qui ne reconnaÃ®t pas, officiellement, les pads. Et autant dire que c'est pratiquement injouable au clavier-souris. Attention Ã©galement Ã  quelques bugs plus ou moins dÃ©rangeants vers la fin du jeu (mais rien qui ne rÃ©siste au backup de sauvegarde).

author: {'steamid': '76561198041548945', 'num_games_owned': 207, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 4762, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3198, 'last_played': 1570427093}
review:
I'm torn on this game. It has the highest quality so bad its good cheese but it also crashes repeatedly particularly later in the game.

TLDR
-The meme story makes this game a classic worth all the shit you go through to experience it
-You will have to screw around to get your game and controller working properly
-Run an external save backup script and save religiously
-Run the game in compatibility mode a handful of times for unavoidable crashes
-Don't buy this at full price, garbage ports shouldn't be supported

I spent about 4 hours fucking with this game trying to get it to run properly until I realised that everything I read about running compatibility mode was bs and the only way you will get more that 15 fps is to run standard win 10.

I had to set controllers as the priority usb device by pressing the windows key and searching controllers. 
Dpfix stopped my controller working so ended up not using it which wasn't so bad since my 2nd 'monitor' (old tv) is 720 the default resolution of the game.

Aside from this initial screw around I had a stable 60fps the whole time

Crashes were: 
Twice In the generals junk yard after starting a quest
After a cutscene when entering the art gallery through the back <- this one is really bad because you have to sit through a 10 minute 'chase' at 15km per hour
Cutscene after going to harry's mansion the first time
Randomly at the end of a chapter when the game tries to auto save
After I got 100% and finished watching the last cutscene it save failed and crashed lol

Crash solution is to run the game in compatibility for xp or vista, it will run like shit but get you past the crash, every crash I had there was a save nearby so you can take it out of compatibility 

I highly recommend running a backup script, my save did corrupt but because I had backups I only lost 2 minutes of game time. I'll link you the one I used if you want, or just search backup on the 'discussions' tab

review: If you enjoy shows like Twin Peaks or The X Files and love games like Alan Wake, this one will be something that you'll love. author: {'steamid': '76561198041163223', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 785, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 785, 'last_played': 1561268299}
review:
Deadly Premonition is a memorable murder mystery game. It is also a very polarizing game. The combat is lack luster there is far too much traveling and waiting for things to occur. The game is carried due to its quirkiness and story. I cannot recommend the game though due to how bad of port. This game will crash on cutscenes, leaving buildings, talking to people, loading the game and so on. 

There is no way I can recomend to a stranger to play something so buggy.

author: {'steamid': '76561198079978257', 'num_games_owned': 96, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1866, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1866, 'last_played': 1458405615}
review:
There is a lot good about this game:
[+] supernatural detective story
[+] survival horror fun
[+] quirky humour
[+] clearly made by fans of Twin Peaks (honestly the game goes beyond an homage; it borders on copyright infringement)

There are however some things which stopped me from completing the game:
[-] the game can get pretty tedious at times (as explained in this article: https://www.cracked.com/article_21031_5-hilariously-failed-attempts-at-video-game-realism-pt.-2.html)

[-] But the worst thing for me is the reliance of the Creepy Crossdresser trope at a key plot point. The game has not aged well in that regard.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008839552', 'num_games_owned': 1171, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 1481, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1366, 'last_played': 1704039525}
review:
A classic, silly, yet fun shooter. Sure, it's campy as hell, full of bugs to the point your PC might just, not run the game... But, but... when you get it to work, and work well... You get such a fun and crazy adventure. Your MC talks to himself and congrats himself every headshot. A MC who constantly gives interesting random movie trivia every solo car ride. Monsters who walk bent over backwards... So, so many campy and weird side charecters. 

I loved every moment of this game. The shooting, exploration, many collectables, random fishing mini-game just gets so addicting. And, icing on the cake, smashing monsters down with a un-distructable guitar.

So yeah, all in all, if you want a fun, slightly converloted yet rewarding shooter. Then I HIGHLY recomend this gem.
