author: {'steamid': '76561198063395444', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 2179, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1827, 'last_played': 1652933723}
review:
Do you like receiving prophetic visions from your coffee? Do you like following random people around to learn every minute detail of their daily lives? Are you a stinky agent? Do you like to limbo with some zombies in the moonlight? Do you like putting your hands on your hips while sitting to express that you're irritated and sassy? Do you like to talk to your split personality about Jaws and biscuits? Do you like organizing the storeroom of your local supermarket to receive tiny discounts? Do you like paying $32 for a single saltine cracker? Do you only talk in rhyme? Do you like FISHING? 

Then I cannot recommend this game highly enough.

author: {'steamid': '76561197988300000', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 2139, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2139, 'last_played': 1561668996}
review: This quirky Twin Peaks-like game is an absolute gem, IF you can get it to work and get past the janky combat. It is kinda bad, but that's part of the appeal. I adore this game and its weird little town. You can just sit back and drive around talking to characters and helping them out, all while solving this surreal murder mystery. I love the soundtrack and just the general weirdness of the game. If you are a fan of Twin Peaks, David Lynch or the X-files, then I totally recommend this game.

review:
Don't get me wrong, Deadly Premonition is a classic. However this port is an absolute mess. Even after applying the community fixes, the game still crashes constantly. Moreover my save file got corrupted mid-game, making me search for another person's save file online.

While I can recommend the game itself, avoid this port like the plague. If it's an option, try the X360 version instead (which also plays on X1). Such a shame...

author: {'steamid': '76561197967038647', 'num_games_owned': 1761, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 331, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 331, 'last_played': 1419026000}
review:
Do you remember this game, Zach? It came out in 2010 on the Xbox 360, with a Director's Cut released on PC in 2013.

The reviews were quite...divided. Some called it one of the worst games of the generation, with clunky combat, incomprehensible story, dated graphics, poor audio mixing, and so on. While others hailed it as one of the most original and interesting experience they've had with a video game, in part because its clunkiness actually made it charming. IGN US gave it a 2/10, while Destructoid awarded it a 10/10.

It certainly is...an experience, isn't it, Zach? You've got a mysterious protagonist constantly talking to someone who seemingly isn't there, fighting zombies that may or may not only exist in his head. The rest of the cast isn't much better, each of them having their own bizarre quirks. But that's what makes them so likable, and what pushes you to continue playing despite the annoying and bland combat, don't you think?

It's probably fair to say it's not a game for everyone, but I personally enjoyed it due to how bizarre it is from start to finish. What about you, Zach?

review:
Please, play this game. It's a masterpiece. But not on PC. it's plagued by the worst glitches ever seen, it WILL crash, it WILL freeze, you WILL get stuck. Often you'll need multiple system reboots to advance from a loading screen. You'll need patches. A lot of third party patches. That often won't work. You'll spend more time in the game's folder than playing.
Play this masterpiece on Switch, its best version.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044804757', 'num_games_owned': 822, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 307, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 296, 'last_played': 1667688796}
review:
The game on pc is borderline broken, the graphics were awful even back then and the shooting is a very very bad copy of RE4, still I loved this game and I have to recommend it, but only if you are willing to ignore the mediocrity of the gameplay to experience a great story with awesome characters and crazy humor.

PS Just buy it on console if you can, that's where I finished it

author: {'steamid': '76561198019242220', 'num_games_owned': 1817, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 750, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 750, 'last_played': 1559394646}
review:
I can't recommend this because it's been coded with todd howard offspring gooks, which results in crashing on A LOT of occasions. I got 12 hours on record and I only beat about 1/6 of the game because of how much I tried to troubleshoot this s hit.
But what I can recommend is for you to watch twin peaks season 1 and 2 and then watch two best friends play deadly premonition on youtube. The game and the let's play is a masterclass of comedy and absurdity, making it VERY RECOMMENDED. You won't find SWERY kind of games anywhere else tbh.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997075802', 'num_games_owned': 681, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1674, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1674, 'last_played': 1558865139}
review:
OK Zach, I've been thinking about what game I'd like to play next. And finally, I've made a decision. It's always hard to narrow it down just to one game, but I've put a lot of thought into this! and I'm sure you'll agree with me. 2013, directed by Hidetaka Suehiro himself. The best of horror games, set in a small town in Washington. That game made me stay away from the woods for years. I was always afraid that a murderer might be showing up. You know what I'm talking about right? Yes, it's Deadly Premonition.

...That reminds me, Zach. Did you know this one? "Forrest Kaysen" also appears in another game that was directed by Hidetaka Suehiro. "Spy Fiction". That's also a masterpiece but we'll discuss that another time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043306053', 'num_games_owned': 1862, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 1798, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1607, 'last_played': 1606396052}
review:
If you like Twin Peaks.
If you like quirky, idiosyncratic and unique Japanese stories.
If you prefer for a game to have great story and atmosphere over deep gameplay.
If you don't mind installing mods and modifying .ini files to make a game run properly.

Then you will have a blast with Deadly Premonition.

author: {'steamid': '76561198033929766', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 1548, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1541, 'last_played': 1578964029}
review:

Oh I guess I had to install someone else's save at some point too when mine became corrupted. So buyer beware?

York might be one of my favourite characters in a game ever

author: {'steamid': '76561198045655521', 'num_games_owned': 406, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 3208, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3208, 'last_played': 1556160423}
review:
Easily one of my favorite videogames ever. I've beaten it over a dozen times in my lifetime.

With that said though, this port is ABYSMAL. It almost shouldn't be allowed to be for sale. At best it legally gives us the game with steamworks features, but it barely even runs properly without a community made fix and various compatibility modes not to mention some other possible unforseen random issues you may have to troubleshoot depending on if it likes your system or not. Oh and It also has random bugs that corrupt your save file, hurray. Shoutout for only being able to have 1 save file. Backup your save frequently!

The best place to optimally play Deadly Premonition is on Xbox 360, If you're feeling particularly ballsy and don't care though or just love the game enough (like me), you can try your luck at the PC port and hope for the best. I managed to 100% it on PC through the myriad of issues, If you're determined to play this on Steam then I have a few tips from my own experiences:

- Use this guide. It saved my bacon many times. DPfix and the 4 GB patch were sufficient enough for me to get the game playable
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=594875543

- Absolutely use Windows compatibility mode on DP.exe I found that Windows 98 compatibility mode worked best for me, but results may vary. Other compatibility modes gave me a bug where I couldn't aim around, if you get this on every compatibility mode, I don't think you'll have a very enjoyable experience since the only work around is to spam the auto lock-on key in combat, thankfully that wasn't the case for me...

- At the Art Gallery when you first meet a character named Diane (after entering a keypad), skip every cutscene until you're back outside with Emily. The chapter transition here WILL 100% corrupt your save if you don't skip it. I learned the hard way. (The guide I linked above supplies a save file in case). Just look up a YouTube video to see the cutscene you missed.

- If you're ever crashing constantly during any cutscenes, the solution is generally to skip them unfortunately then look them up.

- Save ONLY at phones, never after chapters when it prompts you to. There's a random chance of it crashing if you do so and likely corrupting the save in the process.


[h1]So in conclusion, absolutely god-tier game, but god-awful PC port. Buy at your own risk...[/h1]

author: {'steamid': '76561198027862625', 'num_games_owned': 718, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 4518, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2901, 'last_played': 1558806419}
review:
Fantastic game, complete fucking dog-shit port.

Even after spending hours trying every supposed "fix" on different forums, it's a complete mess. The game will constantly crash both at random points, and specific ones in the case of the infamous chapter 9 glitch. Saves get corrupted often which has led me to  importing saves with different progress for each chapter, and using S.A.M to unlock achievements because the triggers break as well. Even better is if you use a save with further progress the you, and use the replay chapter function you CANT save at all, and need to finish it all in one sitting, which also  means you need to hope the game doesn't crash, which is highly unlikely. Other than constant crashing the game has massive performance issues, textures will stop working in the middle of cutscenes leaving you nothing to stare at other than the color black. The game does not even include a proper settings menu, so you're forced to use a community patch just for that, and even then it barely fixes any of the game's issues. 
This version is  worth it literally [i]only[/i] if it's free, and even then it's still up to debate. Play/emulate it on PS3/360 or watch it online.

All the gameplay systems are clunky,and music plays in points where it doesn't really make sense however, that adds a certain quirky charm to the game alongside the characters & writing. Excluding this port Deadly Premonition is pure kino, and I wholly recommend it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000162778', 'num_games_owned': 880, 'num_reviews': 150, 'playtime_forever': 53, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 45, 'last_played': 1626736928}
review: Tried to play this fucking crap numerous times but ran into a whole new set of problems with each attempt. Performance issues, graphics issues, controller issues... Don't bother with the PC version, it's unplayable and selling this shit should be illegal.

author: {'steamid': '76561198316415231', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 158, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 158, 'last_played': 1557577983}
review: This is a terrible port. The controller support is totally messed up. Every time I get in a car it makes a non stop screeching noise that won't go away. I had to patch the game with a user made mod to make it run in 1080 like the ps3 version. Such a shame. The people that ported this and never bothered to fix it should be ashamed. Now it looks like I will have to buy a ps3 just to play the directors cut of this game without being annoyed with a huge amount of annoying issues. Thank's for nothing. DON'T BUY THIS GAME ON STEAM. It's a classic. Play it on 360 or ps3.

author: {'steamid': '76561198003762573', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1485, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1485, 'last_played': 1555292809}
review:
Deadly Premonition is one of a kind, that's for sure. Should you play, let alone buy it on Steam? Depends largely on what you're expecting. It has become somewhat of a cult classic, as far as I understand, and, like many of those, it is not everyone's cup of tea.

Let me get this out of the way: if you choose to play this, downloading the user made patches is mandatory. Even then, expect to wrestle with a few gamebreaking bugs along the way. I had to download a save file from the internet because mine became corrupted and no way in hell I was going to play it all the way again. Consider youself warned.

The game is largely a homage to Twin Peaks that plays more as interactive fiction than a true detective game. You assume the role of Francis York Morgan, a FBI agent sent to small town to investigate the brutal murder of a young girl by the so called Rain Coat Killer. The gameplay is basically divided into two sections: driving around the town of Greenvale and interacting with the locals, completing sidequests or following the main storyline, and action segments which play out as a poor man's Resident Evil 4. 

The first aspect of gameplay is the bread and butter of the game and can be compared to a GTA type of affair with less vehicular homicide. Main quests consist of being at X place at Y time to watch a cutscene that moves the plot forward. Between these, you're free to roam around Greenvale to find sidequests (identified by the notebook marker next to the NPC's name in the map screen), which are mostly fetch quests rewarded with itens, such as weapons or a fast-travel walkie-talkie (do yourself a favor and get this one as soon as possible), improvements for your car or simply a closer look at the local lore of Greenvale. The map layout is quite realistic for a small town, which is a plus, but after a while you'll get tired of driving the long distances that separates your points of interest. The game is divided in chapters, each representing a day of the investigation, and each chapter is subdivided into episodes, true to the TV show that inspired it. Certain sidequests can only be completed on a certain period of time, so you can easily miss a lot of them the first time around. That gives the game a bit of replay value, I guess.

The action segments, which are part of the main story, take place in some sort of dark, twisted shadow version of Greenvale where York has to defend himself against ghost/zombies, reminiscent of japanese horror tropes (think of movies like Ju-On and Ringu), and find "clues" to make sense of York's profiling efforts. In terms of pure gameplay, you simply navigate through a linear map, shooting enemies, collecting itens and watching cutscenes, much like Resident Evil 4, as mentioned above. The game makes no effort to explain why it abruptly goes Silent Hill on you and why is there a shadow version of Greenvale  that only York seems to be able to interact or take notice of. That's not a bad thing per se, because it leaves the interpretation of what the hell is going on to the player. There's actually some debate among the fans on whether there is anything truly supernatural going on or not. Personally, I believe that York is feeling the killer's psychosphere, physically represented in this shadow version of Greenvale.  If you think that these action parts seem out of place, that's because they were kind of shoehorned in because the japanese developers assumed the western audience would be more interested in the game if they could shoot stuff.

The story, as interesting as it is, has that distinct japanese flavor to it. The mood oscilates between goofy humour and macabre horror, and by the end, you'll be wondering if you're playing a Resident Evil title. Since it's so linear, there is very little thinking required to complete the game, so if you're looking that a game that really forces you to think like a detective in order to move the investigation forward, look elsewhere. The newer Sherlock Holmes games have neat little investigation system that have you connect the dots by yourself, meaning you can fuck up the case if you're not paying attention. Deadly Premonition is the complete opposite of that; that's why I said it plays more like an interactive fiction story than anything else.

If you really want to try it by yourself, buy it at a sale. Watching the game on youtube will probably be just as satisfying, really, due to it's unapologetically linear nature. Still, I recommend it because the narrative, which is the core of the game, left a good taste afterwards. Thumbs up.

review:
If you love Twin Peaks, Life is Strange or any kind of detective games, you should give it a try.
One of the best mystery adventure games there is. 
You will encounter lots of crashes and bugs though.
Still woth it in my opinion, but make sure to buy it while it's on sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044965084', 'num_games_owned': 293, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 154, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 88, 'last_played': 1594235946}
review:
First off all, I do not recommend the PC port of this game. You should really get a cheap Xbox360 or something. That said, even the console version is, from a technological standpoint, hot garbage. 
But beneath the performance issues and the horrible graphic quality is a genuinely interesting and enjoyable game with a great soundtrack, good atmosphere and an interesting story accompanied by memorable characters. You just need a high tolerance for very janky gameplay. 

Just remember to get the console version, because the PC port is barely playable. I can't even get past the tutorial without crashes.

author: {'steamid': '76561198079546674', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 281, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 168, 'last_played': 1616362858}
review:
I remember the first time I laid eyes on this game. Imagine if you will, a hot summers day. You and you friend walk into one of the second hand DVD/game stores in your small home town. Nothing ever really happens there so you bide your time with video games. When all of a sudden you spot it, ''Deadly Premonition'' on the Xbox 360. ''Whats this?'' you ask yourself, confused by the box art and picture of a man in a suit fishing at the edge of a lake on the back. You buy it, its only Â£4 and it looks ok. You and your friend take the game back to your house and boot it up. Little do you know how much this game would change your life.....

The game starts. Your presented with a rainy highway on a dark stormy night. The man driving the rip-off Mustang appears to be a detective of some sorts. He's on the phone, talking about an important case? Wrong, its Tom and Jerry. Yep, Tom and fucking Jerry. 

The games great. It looks really outdated but honestly the story and characters are what make it worth playing. This game honestly kept me up a night trying to figure out who the killer was.

author: {'steamid': '76561198015060101', 'num_games_owned': 1648, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 1852, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 957, 'last_played': 1555088120}
review:
Although this game would would be a contender for the award for garbage-looking graphics of the seventh game console generation (i.e. the 360 and PS3 era), the remaining aesthetics compensates enough in my mind to consider it a masterpiece. 

Lending much of the mysterious elements and small-town charm from Twin Peaks, Deadly Premonition manages to stand on its own peculiarities, particularly those of the playable character, Francis York Morgan who among other things divines in his coffee and shares B-movie trivia with the other his of multiple personality, Zach.

When it comes to action-related gameplay, Deadly Premonotion uses the stop-and-gun movement not too much unlike the fourth and fifth Resident Evil that were out around the same time.

What unfortunately breaks this game is that it is close to unplayable on modern computer system. Although there are temporary solutions that can be made, they are as mentioned [i]temporary[/i]. A quick solution to even get the game playable at first is to run the game in Windows 98 compatibility mode. When the game eventually crashes because of this, the game can be run in a windowed Windows XP compatibility mode. Switching back and forth usually compensates for the various crashes at different points in the game, until it does not anymore. It also adds unique gameplay elements, such as laggy and slow or super fast cars, depending on which edition of Windows compatibility you run.

Steam should feel ashamed for allowing such a broken game yet fantastic game to be sold and paid for in the state that it is currently in.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046069617', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1269, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 955, 'last_played': 1607982991}
review:
I love this game, but I can't recommend this port. The PC version of Deadly Premonition is for people who can tolerate plenty of crashes and graphical glitches. I know the original Xbox 360 version was fine, but how did they screw up this version so badly? 

I literally ran this game just fine until I got to Episode 2 - Chapter 08. When I left the museum, the cut scene would play and then the game crashed. I tried many solutions I found on the internet and none of them worked. So, instead, I found some Deadly Premonition saves online and used them to get pass the crash. This method resulted in me losing all of my side quest progress, but at least I can continue to play the game. 

I would love to say that these problems will get patched out; however, it's been four years since Rising Star Games patched the game. The PC version of Deadly Premonition will probably always be the broken mess that we see today - and that saddens me....

author: {'steamid': '76561198058408884', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1502, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1502, 'last_played': 1516375322}
review:
This game, especially this port, is an absolute mess... but it might be the best mess ever created. 
There is no other piece of media as weird and jank as this game, that I've become so fond of. It may not have the best gameplay or look stunning (even for its time), but i can't help but love this game for it's lovable cast of characters, its weird story and wonderful ost.

author: {'steamid': '76561198039769326', 'num_games_owned': 924, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 2281, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2281, 'last_played': 1472345521}
review:
I'm in love with Swery65. If you're a fan of Twin Peaks, this is Twin Peaks incarnate in the best way possible.
In my top list of games.
...
...
Unfortunately, the same can't be said about this port. This definitely takes work to play. It would launch at 60fps and I would lose a fps every few minutes until after half an hour of playing, it would be barely getting 5fps. Then I'd have to restart and do it again.

Aiming bug on PC where you can't aim up or down beyond a few degrees making some items impossible to get and some bosses almost unbeatable since you can't aim at them.

Crashes. They will happen. A lot.

This was definitely from an era when Japanese console games got lazy nigh unplayable PC ports. 

If you have a PS3/Xbox360, you're better off playing it on that. Otherwise if you can get this on the cheap on sale and want to experience an incredible world -- for me, it was worth it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198930234476', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 499, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 499, 'last_played': 1553645543}
review: I've heard so many positive things about this game. Not only was is supposed to be quirky and funny, but also contain an interesting story and characters. However, what l completely failed to see was how flawed this game was/is on PC (which to be fair is something that is pretty well known at this point in the community). The game ran poorly the first time l tried it, but it fixed itself after l restarted my PC. But then part 6 of episode 1 happened. Every time after 1.00 PM (specifically after lunch at the policehouse) the game would always crash or just simply go dark (so that l could only get my PC working again after having to restart it by pressing the power button). I guess it's not a good sign when the director himself issues an apology on Twitter for this poor excuse of a port. Anyway, l learned my lesson for the future, so please, anyone, READ UP on games before buying them and make sure to check A LOT of user reviews. When l did it, l saw a lot of people complaining about the same things as l just did. I admit l was dumb not to check up on these issues before buying the game (and even with patches this game wouldn't run properly), so please don't be an idiot like me and do your homework properly before thinking about buying this game. I guess you could make this game run properly with a lot of patches for the internet, but from what l saw, there's no guarantee it will work properly (and if it will you have to spend more time patching it then playing the game itself). So please, if you're not a hardcore fan of weird games, please just watch the cutscenes or a playthrough on Youtube. It's cheaper too.

author: {'steamid': '76561198140442560', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 156, 'playtime_forever': 1497, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1497, 'last_played': 1553216440}
review:
Deadly Premonition is ostensibly a mixture of RE4, Silent Hill, and GTA, with the tone and atmosphere of Twin Peaks. As FBI Detective Francis York Morgan, you are sent to Greenvale to investigate the murder of Anna Graham, a young and beloved teenager who met her end at the hands of someone known only as The Raincoat Killer. To say it borrows from Twin Peaks is an understatement- it has the same quirky tone, a large and likable/ interesting cast of characters that really grow on you, and more than several elements that border on plagerism, such as the fact that York (everyone calls him that, so you should call him that, too) speaks to someone the audience doesn't see named Zach and a mysterious room that seems to exist outside reality that york returns to regularly. You explore the town, interacting with the townsfolk, and can take the time to tread off the beaten path. There's an in game clock, and missions are only available during certain times, but the time frames are almost always generous enough to allow for exploration.

And here's the thing about this game. Or, rather,many things. The graphics are, speaking generously, dated as all hell. Animations, particularly facial ones, are laughable at best and leads to more than a few scenes of unintentional hilarity. The music, while actually really good in and of itself, is often used at horribly inappropriate times, particularly a very well known theme involving someone whistling. The "open world," such as it is, while containing a few places of interest throughout and packed with short side quests, still feels lifeless and barren. Almost no cars on the road, no one to just bump in to. The hunger and tiredness meters feel superfluous at best- they affect the game so little since finding food and sleep is easy as hell that I wonder why they were even put in the game at all. The driving is incredibly wonky. More often than not, you'll flip your car hilariously over on its roof by bumping into absolutely nothing. Or you might just flip it turning a bend. In one instance, I glitched through the ground a millimeter and this resulted in all of my car's health instantly falling to 0. The combat is RE4 if RE4 fell down some stairs. Extremely basic and imprecise over the shoulder angle that is only challenging because aiming feels so floaty and tough to nail down. The overall sound design outside of the music and voice acting (which is for the most part rock solid, particularly York) is incredibly weak, with guns sounding like someone shooting a spitball and enemies making moans like they just woke up from a nap. And, to top all of this off, the most challenging part of the game is getting around its myriad game crashing bugs. The game itself is extremely easy, but throughout my play time, I experience several hard crashes that resulted in me having to run the game in Windows 98 compatibility and more often than not still required me to restart my laptop. Mind you, this is something almost everyone with this edition has experienced. 

And yet.

Despite all of those problems.

I still recommend this game. Not just recommend. But heartily recommend it. Glowingly. Enthusiastically. Elatedly. 

See, this game defines more than the sum of its parts. Despite how weak most of the individual elements are, this is still a thoroughly engaging mystery that is, yes, fun to play. And this is thanks in large part to the script. This game would be barely playable if the writing in it wasn't so damn strong. The mystery starts off exactly like Twin Peaks, and yes, while this game does owe a great deal to that show, and there are elements that border on plagirism, it eventually reveals itself to be a separate beast entirely from the beloved cult TV show. It has a knack for building its central mystery expertly, and unlike Twin Peaks, every facet of it pays off wonderfully. Don't get me wrong, I LOVE Twin Peaks and its ambiguity (even the batshit insane Season 3). And that's where the brilliance of this game's story lies- it uses the very familiar setup to tell its own, stand alone, cohesive story where everything ties together in an emotionally resonant and immensely satisfying way. It cannot be understated what a huge impact the script has on this game. The fact that every character is quirky and interesting makes you want to explore the world just to see what kind of strange situation you'll be thrown into next. It almost reaches a Majora's Mask level of marrying its gameplay and story together, and that is something I almost never say. Exploring its world enhances the main story in that you come to know and care for the residents, which only bring the stakes higher and higher. It all leads to one of the most emotional finales I've ever seen in a game, and it's sure to be one that resonates with anyone that sees it through to the end.

And the thing is that, even though elements like the combat aren't amazing, the game is paced in a way that really helps break things up. Just as you might be getting tired of wandering around town, you can go into the game's otherworldly combat sections and spend an hour or so shooting dumb ghosts. And just as those get tiring, you're back to exploring the world, where you can do a few side missions, buy new suits, chat it up with the locals, or partake in one of a few mini games. The ambition on display here is rather astounding, and even though it doesn't always reach what it sets out to do, it's still admirable and interesting.

This game is, in every sense of the word, a deeply flawed masterpiece. It's not always necessarily enjoyable, the production values are all over the place, and crashes are never not annoying. But the story is so strong and interwoven into the very fabric of its mediocre gameplay that it transcends its individual elements and becomes something wholly unique and unlike anything else in gaming. It would be interesting to see what could have been done with a bigger budget, but as it is, many of its flaws only add to the offbeat charm of its cast and atmosphere (including those godawful facial animations). Yes, there are many annoying parts that drag, and it sometimes feels undercooked.

But at the end of the day, if you told me you were forced to choose between something like this and, let's say, Just Cause 3 (a very fun and enjoyable open world game) I would pick this game. In fact, I would pick this as an open world game above most others. There's nothing else like it and it's absolutely worth experiencing, warts and all.

review:

Hands down the worst PC port I've ever had the displeasure of experiencing. 90% of my play time was spent troubleshooting, relaunching the game, and watching the same unskippable splash screens over and over and over and over... The game is a quirky, interesting romp on Xbox 360, but don't bother with this version. It's a disgrace that this can be sold when it's in such a state - absolute daylight robbery.

review:

Trailer announces "enhanced graphics and controls." I can't imagine how they were before. Store page keywoards include Open World and Exploration. My foot !

author: {'steamid': '76561198082879841', 'num_games_owned': 282, 'num_reviews': 100, 'playtime_forever': 4780, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2719, 'last_played': 1703961206}
review:
[b]Update: 12/17/2019[/b] - I've been playing the Switch version and I must say they did a pretty good job with it. The framerate drops while driving in town but aside from that it is very well done. I would recommend the Switch version over this.. unless you like suffering.

[h1]Review:[/h1]
Deadly Premonition is a genuinely bizarre game. From a technical standpoint it is a mess. Constant crashing, controls not working, audio bugs, you name it - it will probably break at some point. That being said, [b]this is truly one of the best games I have ever played.[/b]

The graphics are nothing to look at, and the controls are less than optimal, but the story is gripping - and the characters are some of the strangest & most interesting you can find in a game. The game just [b]oozes[/b] weirdness. Inappropriately timed jazz, awkward dialogue reactions, a plethora of cheesy lines (especially near the end), as well as weird in-game mechanics and visual bugs. (You will come to love the unexpected weirdness). Initially you WILL have problems getting it to run properly. However, once you do get it up and running, you won't want to stop playing. It's just such an incredibly interesting game that nothing you do in the game feels like a chore. Everything you do in the game is so unique and otherwordly that you will never say "oh boy this again?" Even if you don't play it - watch a playthrough of it just to [b][i]experience[/i][/b] it. No, really, it's [b]THAT[/b] good. [b]It also goes on sale relatively often for less than 4$.[/b]

I've included a quick summary:
[list]
[*]Graphics  ---  Looks like a mud puddle
[*]Sound --- You play it in stereo or you go deaf
[*]Difficulty  ---  Easy
[*]Price/Quality  ---  Get it on sale
[*]Length  ---  30-40 hours
[*]Glitches/bugs  ---  The game is one big bug
[*]Story  ---  [b]Masterpiece[/b]
[/list]

[i]Literally so bad that it's great.[/i]

author: {'steamid': '76561198068613621', 'num_games_owned': 592, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 311, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 128, 'last_played': 1569098836}
review: Una obra mastra, uno de los juegos que mas me han marcado. Si consigues superar afrenta visual y su manejo de tanque te sumergiras en una aventura que capta la ensencia de Twin peaks a la perfeccion. El juego que me volvio a dar esperanza al medio. Me lo he pasado en 360 y en ps3 ahora falta esta version de PC. No me jodas Zhack

author: {'steamid': '76561198032373366', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 3352, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3131, 'last_played': 1595356265}
review:
Al netto dei diversi bug che affliggono questa versione su Pc, mi sento di consigliare Deadly Premonition per via della sua trama ricca di colpi di scena e che riesce a tenere alta la curiositÃ  del giocatore fin dai primi istanti. Il titolo Ã¨ ispirato in molti aspetti alla serie cult Twin Peaks, con numerosi rimandi sparsi per il gioco in cui si alternano fasi esplorative/investigative ad altre piÃ¹ votate all'azione, dove la realtÃ  lascia il posto al paranormale. Graficamente il gioco lascia alquanto a desiderare e sente tutto il peso degli anni; il doppiaggio in inglese Ã¨ buono con un discreto accompagnamento in fatto di colonna sonora. Deadly Premonition offre un buon numero di ore di gioco (15-20 circa per la storia principale, piÃ¹ le altre missioni secondarie).
Se necessario si trovano numerose guide per risolvere i problemi di funzionamento piÃ¹ comuni, fino ai salvataggi per superare alcuni momenti critici nel gioco. Se lo trovate in vendita con un forte sconto (50% o piÃ¹) vi consiglio caldamente l'acquisto.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010155821', 'num_games_owned': 790, 'num_reviews': 99, 'playtime_forever': 2365, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2310, 'last_played': 1547112028}
review:
[h1] Twin Peaks meets Silent Hill [/h1]
Deadly Premonition is a third-person action game with horror elements.  Personae dramatis of this story is an FBI agent by the name of Francis York Morgan, a gentleman in his 30s, who quickly turns out to be a rather eccentric individual in the most charitable of terms. The player takes control of the character as he travels to the remote city of Greenvale to investigate a possible lead in a case involving a mysterious series of murders. Deadly Premonition is a unique criminal story-driven game. The pacing of the intrigue is slow, it gradually grows on the player over time along with an introduction of the diverse cast of characters that are Greenvaleâ€™s denizens. Be it Miss Polly, an old lady who runs a hotel that could fit an army, all on her own, or Mr. Stewart, a crippled mysterious millionaire who goes around the town always wearing a gas mask, having a servant by his side to speak for him. York is by no means the odd one out, bizarre at first, interactions of the player with the others in the city succeed in creating awkward chemistry that encourages the player to get to know them all better. Everything about Greenvale is somehow odd yet in spite of its, often self-conscious, absurdity it puzzlingly manages to fit the pieces into a coherent whole.  Deadly Premonition requires certain patience to fully appreciate. To me the payoff was a sensation of playing through a crime novel. Not an interactive movie experience of a Telltale Studios game, but a proper book somehow molded to fit into the video game medium.

[i] An unexpected error occurred: the review will resume shortly after a technical break, please standby [/i]

No matter how fond of the game you might become, it cannot be omitted that it is an absolute mess from a technical standpoint. Deadly Premonition is a slightly extended version of the game that was initially released on Xbox 360 and only later ported to the PC. Sadly it was [i] that [/i] kind of port which I can only speculate mustâ€™ve involved the use of blunt objects first and programming second. Frequent crashes, randomly extending loading times and graphics glitches only open the list. There are numerous threads regarding issues with the PC version of the game often divided into Deadly Premonition not running at all or crashing at a certain point never to load past a cutscene. In my case, it was the latter, after running smoothly all the way up a whopping quarter of the game it simply died on me. Given that DP runs only on a single save via checkpoints there are no means to work around it within the game itself. Luckily the community came to the rescue with fan-made fixes available on the internet. â€œPatchingâ€ did allow me to complete the game, though even then the crash counter went well past 30. While problems with running the game are not a given, it is more likely to misbehave than not. Honest warning. Donâ€™t buy the game unless you are willing to run the risk of putting up with aforementioned hiccups.

[b] Low settings, cutscenes, and driving lessons [/b]
In the end, I resolved to judge the game by its own merits rather than its instability. Thus here we are, at the launcher of the game which offers â€œsettingsâ€, a grandiose term considering it essentially consists of keybindings. Furthermore Deadly Premonitionâ€™s initial release took place in 2010 and it wasnâ€™t an eye candy the day it came out. Graphics seem blurry and light is almost blinding on sunny days. What is more every change of the location requires a quite lengthy loading screen.  Mediocre graphics are relevant, as they constitute one of 3 core elements of the game - cutscenes, the others being driving and combat. Deadly Premonition makes heavy use of cutscenes in both action heavy and more leisurely paced sections of the game. Despite action elements being heavily interrupted by cinematics, it doesnâ€™t disrupt the general flow of the game too much. Regardless the gameâ€™s overall looks, lengthy clips are enjoyable to watch, as they often present the full scope of oddity that is character interaction. As for open world gameplay,  you might as well end up completing a side quest just to see one.

Ah yes, Deadly Premonition features a fairly vast open world for such a game and mundane driving from place to place will be a vast part of the playtime. There is no quick travel feature and many key locations tend to be in rather secluded places. Several main story sections consist simply of driving around talking to characters accompanying you on the way. Driving around everywhere is a relevant element of establishing the pace of the game and is made fairly entertaining by agent Yorkâ€™s remarkable knowledge of B-class cinematography he eagerly shares with the player. Too bad that driving model is quite terrible, though you better get used to it, especially if you get hooked into the game enough to start doing side quests. There is quite a lot of them and you gradually unlock more as you progress through the game. Some provide little but further insight into the city of Greenvale, while others can get you a better car or a weapon. Donâ€™t take too much time before you start exploring though, with a serial killer on the loose some quest givers might not make it to the epilogue.

[b] Resident Evil wants its camera back [/b]
Combat is probably the most prominent part of the game, though like everything else it has a few quirks of its own. Majority of the time we view York from a third-person camera placed over the agentâ€™s right shoulder. From the very beginning, the player is being assaulted by eerie zombie-like creatures that shamble erratically towards the protagonist. You can either shoot them or run, though you canâ€™t move while aiming. Luckily, Yorkâ€™s trusty pistol is enough to dispatch them and there are better weapons available further down the line. 

Paranormal themes are heavily present throughout the game and Francis York Morgan shifts to a haunted dimension at numerous times throughout the game, having to battle his way through to the evidence at each respective crime site. Itâ€™s easy to forget it at times but Deadly Premonition is considered a survival horror for a reason. Enemies are twitching backwards with their backs broken, trying to shove their arms down playerâ€™s throat, this combined with distorted music and interiors reminiscent of Silent Hill series, create a genuinely dreadful atmosphere. Unfortunately, combat sections also feature the quick time events rather frequently. While not all of them lead to an instant death, you are likely to load quite a few times within starting chapters of the game alone. Even if the player does survive a QTE, they definitely butcher any sense of unease the game mightâ€™ve set beforehand.

[b] "Donâ€™t ask me about Zach, itâ€™s personal" [/b]
Deadly Premonitionâ€™s approach to the 4th wall is a thing deserving its own separate mention. Itâ€™s hardly a wall but more of a door kept wide open. Agent York himself considers the player his partner, naming you â€œZachâ€ and frequently addressing player throughout the game. Examples of which is telling stories addressed directly to Zach or complementing the player on landing a headshot.

In the end, Deadly Premonition truly is an experience filled with mixed feelings. In its insanity, it delivers charmingly absurd characters and tells a thrilling criminal story. At the same time, the plot just might be its only strength with essentially every other part of the game being mediocre or plain bad. Its conflicting nature seems to have developed into something of a defining trait as Deadly Premonition holds Guinness World Record for oddly specific â€œmost critically polarizing survival horror gameâ€. For me, the good outweighed the bad, even with the extra weight of technical difficulties. Frankly, there isnâ€™t quite any other game like this, beside other works of SWERY, and thus I can only recommend experiencing the game first-hand. Make your own opinion, right Zach?

The only solution that I found for this online that I haven't tried was playing the game on a VM which is simply not worth the effort, I give up.

author: {'steamid': '76561198017601480', 'num_games_owned': 64, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 226, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 155, 'last_played': 1615690659}
review:
Este juego es muy bueno, entretenido e interesante pero no lo compren para PC. 
La dificultad para apuntar el arma y conducir el auto se pueden dejar de lado, pero tiene varios problemas serios y simplemente no hay una forma concreta de arreglarlos. Desde el tercer capitulo me comenzaron los problemas, para el capitulo 7 estos se pusieron serios. Probe todo lo que encontre en linea y nada sirvio pero con una ocurrencia consegui hacerlo funcionar ya para el capitulo 9 nada funciono y el juego acabo "bugueandose" mucho. Lo descargare de nuevo esperando que al menos pueda volver a jugar los primeros 8 capitulos sin que el juego se congele. Aunque ya estoy cansado de intentar que funcione.

author: {'steamid': '76561198155137468', 'num_games_owned': 2931, 'num_reviews': 85, 'playtime_forever': 3227, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1599, 'last_played': 1643507249}
review:
I first played this game on XBOX 360, the first version was more challenging than the Director's Cut. The game graphics aren't that amazing, but if you use DP fix it gets better. The game was intended to launch on PlayStation 2 and XBOX in 2006, that's why the graphics are this way. This version have better gameplay than the first version, that's a plus.

The problem with this game are crashes, that's the worst part. You need a lot of patience with the game.

I like the story of the game, it can be a bit crazy on the end. This game reaaly needs a sequel, on the red room you will se a map of U.S.A. with a lot of marks and some dolls of Forrest Kaysen, meaning that there are other places with red tree.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053423634', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1369, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1369, 'last_played': 1547288257}
review:
Wow! This game is not for everyone you either love it or you hate it. Very unique game with great story full of bizarre humor and scenes. 

Game is nightmare to run, I am not sure if there is worse port then this. Graphics are more closer to ps2 then ps3, controls are totally scrawed, I wasn't able to make it work with generic controller maybe there is way but I couldn't map controls properly with generic ps2 styled controller on the other hand xbox360 controller worked flawlessly. Worst part about this game is getting it to run stable, this game will crash on you every 30mins untill you find fix that works for your pc even then it will occasionally crash. Best alternative is to play it on ps3 or xbox360.

author: {'steamid': '76561198093355413', 'num_games_owned': 287, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 2994, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2938, 'last_played': 1561781792}
review:
Definitivamente vale la pena jugar y sobretodo pasar este juego. Es cierto que tiene ciertos bugs, crasheos, etc . Problemas basicos que un juego de hoy en dia no deberia de tener.Pero Â¿saben algo?, nada que no pueda solucionarse. Y mas allÃ¡ del aspecto tÃ©cnico y jugable, el punto a favor de este gran juego es por un lado su fantastica banda sonora y sobretodo su grandiosa historia. Acabo de terminar el juego por completo y sinceramente vale la pena vivir la experiencia que significa superar este juego.
Misterios, dilemas existenciales, asesinatos, la muerte,  mujeres bellas, casi diosas, destinos inexorables, son solo algunas de las tematicas que encontraran en este titulo

Debo destacar que el guion de este juego es sencillamente sublime, es de esas historias poco predecibles, en donde lo mas remotamente inimaginable sucede, sorprendiendote a medida que progresas en el juego. La trama de este juego es casi como Poesia. Deadly Premonition: The Director's Cut sin duda te deja huella como gamer y espectador.

PD: Recalco que posiblemente a muchos de los gamers de hoy en dia les parezca tedioso este juego y con mecanicas casi primitivas en comparativa con otros titulos moderno, sin embargo los animo a jugar esta fantastica obra, realmente es toda una  grata experiencia. Un joya incomprendida. Ojala algun dia sacasen un remake de este clasico.

author: {'steamid': '76561198024793915', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1722, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1722, 'last_played': 1420412194}
review:
So this is one of the most polarized games in modern history. People find that the graphics, occasional crashing of the game and awkward sound design is too big off a turn-off for them to continue playing, which is fair enough.  However,  the player who stays with the game for a while seems unable to put it down.  The player who wanted something more  than the ordinary AAA gameplay and story will becomes more and more immersed, while constantly trying to remind him/herself of the games faults. 
After about 17 hours you sit there with an weird smile and feeling like for the first time in a very long time, you got a new positive gaming experience (inspired by Twin Peaks no doubt) that you probably will not experience again, ever. Reccomended for the player who seeks to discover a artistic and intense story in a very unique game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198118573687', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 113, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 113, 'last_played': 1421536194}
review:
Ignore my playtime, as I previously owned this game on console. That I bought it again on Steam should say something. I can't help but love this game.

Let's get the bad out of the way. As a game, it's terrible. Clunky controls, boring combat, dated graphics, and from what I hear the port isn't great, but can be fixed with mods. If you're here for great gameplay, you're probably best off looking elsewhere.

So why am I recommending it? 

Because this game is BONKERS. If you can get past the rough technical aspects of the game, you'll be rewarded with an absurd, surreal experience with lovably odd characters and a campy murder mystery that you won't soon forget. I'd almost call this "The Room" of videogames, only it's not written nearly as bad. Fans of horror or bizarre stories should definitely consider picking this up, but I'd wait for a sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067783657', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 80, 'playtime_forever': 1755, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 322, 'last_played': 1604827411}
review:
I first heard about Deadly Premonition via Guinness World Records, where it was ranked as the most critically polarized game of all time. How do you NOT play that game? Well, after starting and aborting it four times over the last six years before ultimately completing it...my personal verdict is that it's well deserving of that record.

Don't get me wrong, I love this game. And I usually fucking hate pros and cons lists, but this game is a rare exception. 

PROS: 

The protagonist is one of the best in all of video game-dom. My personal favorite, actually. He's a chain-smoking FBI agent who has developed an alter ego with whom he openly converses. When the "two" of them are alone, they mostly talk about movie trivia. He congratulates and compliments himself when he hits his targets. Just a fun goddamn character on all levels. 

The side characters are no less interesting. They all have distinct personalities and quirks.

The town of Greenvale is one of the more realistic maps out there. It's sparsely populated by NPC's who keep actual schedules; they could be at home, work, or elsewhere depending on the time of day. There is no fast-travel, and you can't set waypoint markers, so unless you want to pause to check the map every fifteen seconds, it's just in your best interest to memorize the roads. 

The story is fun. 

CONS: 

I've really just got one gripe, but it was the deal-breaker all three times I quit playing: the combat sequences just suck. I have nothing good to say about them. They're repetitive, dull, simplistic, tiresome, and the mechanics suck. They're completely out of tune with the feel of the rest of the game, which is otherwise very lighthearted. Initially, they're somewhat stressful, as your standard-issue pistol is incredibly weak and ineffective. But once you upgrade to literally any other weapon, the sequences become over-the-top easy and just an overall waste of time. Most enemies just come at you at an unmenacingly slow pace. Certain enemies and bosses have patterns that you have to follow in order to kill them. But those patterns are comically simple, and ultimately just time consuming. Busy work.

Every time there's an interesting development in the plot, it's accompanied by a pointless action sequence. Each time I sigh heavily and remind myself that it doesn't matter. Just power through it. Once I got in the mode of just thinking of the combat sequences as commercial breaks, it made them more bearable. 

***

The game also has a few elements that are either really annoying if you're not feeling them, or lovably quirky if you are. Best example is the music. There are only like four music cues in the whole game. I personally found them effective, and kind of thought of the limited playlist as being a nod to Twin Peaks (from which this game draws heavy influences), which also only has a handful of music cues.

Similarly, there are only like five or six stock animations that any given character model draws from. So their mannerisms and expressivity are pretty limited. Similar to the music, though, I personally found this endearing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198079694849', 'num_games_owned': 345, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 1728, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1728, 'last_played': 1544345308}
review:
Deadly Premonition is an open world survival horror that has clunky controls, outdated graphics, awkward sound design, meh gameplay, with a good enough plot to keep you interested. And you know what? It all just works! At face value you would look at this game and think that it's just a survival horror that doesnt take itself seriously and part of that thinking is right. But there is something more to this game, something charming that made me love it.

[h1]GRAPHICS[/h1]
Graphics-wise it is outdated, textures look like it came from the PS2 era with the mouth movement-dialogue not synching, low res textures, and pretty funny animations and special effects similar to a 1950's movie special effects. Yes it is that bad, compared to anything else released during the 2010s.

[h1] GAMEPLAY[/h1] 
Gameplay is pretty much the same as any other survival horror with an overworld-realworld to traverse in to: The MC adventures in the real world and the MC deals with enemies in the overworld when York is in profiling mode. In Deadly Premonition you can play with the open-world feature when youre in the real world; You can do side quests, explore the country-side, drive a couple of cop car models, or pretty much partake in whichever activity you like concerning some of the townsfolk like drink in a bar / buy guns / play darts and much more. I'm warning you though before buying this game that the driving in this game is a chore and is one (if not only) of the more tedious aspects of the game. Cars doesnt have the feeling of weight to them, and cop cars (which are the only cars you can drive) are limited to a speed of 60 mph. And what is an open world game without a shadowing mission where you follow a target not too close or not too far or else you get gameover? 

Combat is pretty basic, it reminds me of RE4 combat without movement when aiming with a firearm. You can press Ctrl to lock on the nearest enemy and it helps out when you're surrounded by a horde of enemies. Melee weapons degrade after a bunch of uses from it. That's about it for DP's combat: nothing new added to the survival horror genre and nothing taken away either. You know what they say; if it's not broken, don't fix it! 

[h1] SOUND DESIGN [/h1] 
This is one of the charms of the game. A lot of the dialogue pokes fun on B movies but a lot of the sound effects all came from generic B movies (from the characters' shook sound to explosion sounds) that is what makes the game hilariously good. Let me tell you though that the music made for this game is one of the absolute best. The whistle theme is one of the comfiest soundtracks ive ever heard in a survival horror. It is so out of place that it actually blends so good with a segment of the game when it comes up.

Story and plot is what made this game. From the quirky characters and funny dialogues, the game has some deep dark undertones accompanying it. There wasn't a lot but a couple of segments really cemented this game as an actual horror game and those few segments alone is so good that it puts the silent hill and resident evil franchise to shame.

[h1] FINAL VERDICT [/h1] 
Past the random crashes, clunky controls, bad graphics, there is a hidden gem shining brightly in Deadly Premonition. I don't want to spoil anything and i suggest you experience one of the best games in history for yourself. "Isn't that right, Zach?"

author: {'steamid': '76561198129138990', 'num_games_owned': 102, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 685, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 685, 'last_played': 1544273211}
review:
This game fails horiibly as a product. For me, like many others, the game doesn't even launch to begin with. The only reason this game is remotely playable is due to fan-made mods. It is pointless to gush about the story and the themes and the music if the game fails to run at an achievably respectable threshold. The controls are horrible. If you modify them you get input lag in many cases. The camera is wobbly and at an exceedingly awkward angle. It crashes willy-nilly. I have not been able to complete the game because of a recurring crash. 

Put simply, this product does not deserve to be paid for. If you get it for free or obtain it though other means, feel free to sink your time for the experience some users seem to have been blessed with. Otherwise, don't pay and encourage people to push [almost literally] broken products into the store. If you should pay anyone, it's the people who made the mods.

author: {'steamid': '76561198226843724', 'num_games_owned': 417, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 3119, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3114, 'last_played': 1544189590}
review:
Coffee warned me that many people never managed to finish this wonderful game, but I was most likely 'The Chosen One' and got 100% without a single crash.

[b]Cons:[/b]

1) You can suddenly fall through the textures(I met this bug only once at the beginning of the game)
2) The map resolution is very limited. You're not able to see the whole way and put your markers or remove the old (Spiritual map, for example).
3) Soundtrack. Music is often picked up strangely and because of this you never take what is happening on the screen seriously. Maybe it was intentional. At the end of the game, I started to hate 'Miss stiletto heels'.  
4)  All events are available at a certain time. It's not annoying, but I had some trouble completing the quests for Emily and Michael. 
6)Shooting part. I didn't notice anything off-putting, but for other players it was an obvious minus.
7)  Animation. It's broken and it looks funny, but I didn't pay much attention to it. 
8)  A small number of enemy types. 
9)  Fishing. It's pure random.
10)  Final fight with a dude who had sex with two hot chicks [spoiler]and you hadn't, lol[/spoiler]. The quick time event is not so important for the game, and the creators could just make some epic scene in the best traditions of Devil May Cry 3. But no. Run, Forrest, run.
11)  You'll never figure out  what's in Sigourney's pot. 

[b]Pros:[/b]

1)  York. He is gorgeous, I somehow fell in love with him at the end of the game.
2) Self-Irony and humor. Not every game creators could make fun of their own shortcomings. 
3) Plot. He is very unpredictable and interesting. It's like you're watching a good detective series. The strongest part of the game.
4) Hints in dialogues and objects about the real murderer. You might feel like a real detective, eh, Zach?
5) Cute dogs, sent from heaven by Sheogorath.
6) Driving. It's epic. The creators of Fast & Furious should take note.  
7) Breaking the fourth wall, which was brilliantly explained.

[i]Mr. Francis York Morgan.
It's time to make a conclusion,
No, it's not an illusion,
The port was awful, but we found solution.
Enjoyed the game from the start to the end,
I'll miss you, my coffee maniac friend. 
I'll contend, the game deserves 10 Sigourney's pots out of 10.[/i]

So says Mr. Stewart.

author: {'steamid': '76561198452910860', 'num_games_owned': 130, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 1753, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1753, 'last_played': 1543810974}
review: Al que le guste minimamente Twin Peaks, le va a gustar este juego. Tiene mil problemas: El combate estÃ¡ metido un poco con calzador, algunos menÃºes muy ortopedicos, archivos que se corrompen (ojo con eso), etc. pero asi y todo, la historia es genial, muy lisÃ©rgica y la resolucion del misterio tambien. Consejo: Ir haciendo las misiones secundarias siempre que se pueda, porque tienen plazos muy limitados y despues de terminar el juego una vez, no hay mucho incentivo para volver inmediatamente (para mi por lo menos). Es raro y no es para cualquiera, pero tiene una trama excelente y un par de situaciones de investigacion muy interesantes.

author: {'steamid': '76561198284347467', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 79, 'playtime_forever': 1691, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1691, 'last_played': 1542661942}
review:

review:
AgrÃ©able surprise, contrairement aux commentaires le jeu passe nikel sous W10 et avec un joypad XBox 360.
Beaucoup mieux qu'un merdique et incomprÃ©hensible et trop sombre The Evil Within.

ASTUCE :
Si le jeu freeze lors de l'ouverture des missions secondaires quand on regarde la map, pas de panique.

Aller dans le dossier du jeu puis aller sur le DPLauncher.exe et le lancer en mode compatibilitÃ© Windows XP SP3.

Le jeu ne freezera plus, mais les fps auront chutÃ©s Ã  15fps au lieu de 60fps.

Pour y remedier pour ceux qui une une Nvidia il faut ouvrir le panneau de configuration Nvidia et forcer la Vysnc (synchronisation verticale) sur le laucnher deu jeu ( ATI doit pouvoir le faire Ã©galement avec son panel center).

Et miracle le jeu est repassÃ© Ã  60fps et ne freeze plus du tout.

author: {'steamid': '76561198138315443', 'num_games_owned': 101, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 15, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13, 'last_played': 1578704147}
review: Twin peaks no debio terminar asi

author: {'steamid': '76561198047509336', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1260, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1260, 'last_played': 1543046836}
review:
-The PC port is terrible
Game crashes a lot
If you want to play with a controller its a pain just to make it work.
And loadings sometimes take an eternity.

-Gameplay is realy, REALY clunky
You feel almost no impact from any attack with any weapon
QTEs give you very little time to react
Game has poor enemy variation, and most of them are pretty easy to deal with, so there is not much of a challenge
There is quite a few things to do in the open world, but not many of the side quests are interesting to do

-Driving is a problem on its own
It is terrible in every aspect, it takes some time for you to learn how to make turns without flipping your car, the game gives no directions to objectives besides an marker on the horizon with the distance to get there, you pretty much cant zoom out of the map, so you have to trace the routes manualy, and with the amount of dead end streets this game has, its terrible to navigate.

-Graphics are far from good, but I have to say, it has its charm

-The soundtrack is actualy realy good

-And finaly, the story is where the game shines
Characters are realy interesting, knowing more about them is one of the only things that makes side quests worth it.
The mistery is very well made, and it develops in a good pacing.
If you have watched twin peaks, know that deadly premonition takes a lot of inspiration from it. If you like the series you will probably like the story of DP.

I have to say, believe it or not, the pros of the game outweight the cons, if you are into mistery stories with a bit of supernatural. 
With that in mind, I have to say, this game realy deserves a remake, it has material to be among the best, but it just has too many problems.

author: {'steamid': '76561198106324168', 'num_games_owned': 363, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 427, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 424, 'last_played': 1599007139}
review:
Steam allows any game to be sold on here, even if they don't work! This game is very interesting even though the actual gameplay is horrendous, with the shooting being painfully boring and extremely uninteresting at all. There is not any joy in the shooting combat, it just feels so empty. I would rather this game not have any of the dumb shooting and just make it a mystery talking game. The shooting is very bad, I cannot stress how bad and boring it is.

The characters are the highlight, and meeting the folks in this weird town is awesome, too bad you cannot beat this game because it will freeze. I got about 60% of the way through and it just froze after a cutscene. Force restart, tried again, and same thing, just freezes. The story is very interesting, but jesus, this game is a huge broken mess on PC. I am thinking of buying this for the PS3 and playing it on there because the PC version freezes. STEAM ALLOWS ANY GAME TO BE SOLD ON HERE, EVEN IF THEY DO NOT WORK!

author: {'steamid': '76561197992334290', 'num_games_owned': 518, 'num_reviews': 101, 'playtime_forever': 302, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 302, 'last_played': 1541805211}
review:
I wanted to like this game, given the great atmosphere, interesting characters, and setting that comes from it's surreal horror environment, but the gameplay part of Deadly Premonition is an exhausting chore. Not to mention that the beginning is painfully slow (what amounts to a long cutscene, interrupted by brief moments of gameplay and quick-time events). It's a buggy port, so it requires a handful of fixes (of which are fortunately readily available and easy to install). The combat is a slog, which I think is something the publisher forced onto the devs when this was originally published. Thankfully, they made the enemies much weaker in the Director's Cut, so you can bypass most of them pretty easily. The gunplay is your typical third-person action shooter, with a lock-on system for faster aiming. The lighting in this game seems to be having problems frequently, and there still seem to be issues where the game can crash at certain chapters and corrupt your save (you'll have to download a backup save for that, which is in the included game fixes collection). The driving part of this game is also a chore. You're given a large map (admittedly nice looking, when the draw distance isn't freaking out). However, it can be hard to navigate because your map ROTATES with you, and you can't really view the entire map at once without slowly scrolling through it. What's more, you have to keep an eye on your gas while driving, but the police car you're going to be driving for a while chugs gas like a frat boy on a Saturday night. Nothing like having to stop what you're doing to try and find the nearest gas station. There seem to be a lot of sidequests, so there's that.

Overall, this game definitely earned its "so bad it's good" reputation, but I just didn't feel like finishing past the first chapter. If you have the patience for a slow and janky game that might make up for it with its storyline, this game could serve you (when it's on sale for $3 like it frequently is).

author: {'steamid': '76561198043938050', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 684, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 269, 'last_played': 1628828988}
review:
Well I have to go on record and say I absolutley love this game. The wife and I rocked this game on the ps3 and we were excited when we found out the PC version was a thing. We wanted to have another fun play through of this game whilst also doing a few youtube vids about it for our channel. However those hopes were dashed shortly after I downloaded the game.

We played up to the hospital segment of the game and it crashed, we tried multiple times but it would not continue on from that point without crashing. So I decided to do a complete reinstall of the game but that only made matters worse. controller input stopped working, the frame rate droped to 5 frames per second if we were lucky enough to get pass the opening menu of the game before it crashed. I tried multiple fixes like DPfix. Now DPfix did stop the crashing from happening however the game still had a massive framerate drop that would not improve, making this game impossible to play.  I do not reccomend people buy this game at all on PC. its a complete waste and Rising Star looks like they couldn't care less about some form of optimization in order to make it playable.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035555903', 'num_games_owned': 432, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 1523, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1523, 'last_played': 1541491178}
review:
loved this game. many will tell you it's so bad, it's good, but it's not. it's just good. it's rough around the edges, but it's got it where it counts. the story and dialogue are all pretty impressive and the game itself is incredibly immersive. there's new dialogue for characters constantly. it all feels very realistic, leaving you feeling a part of greenvale. just don't buy it for pc. glitches make this game not quite unplayable (at least for me) but they can be a real pain in the ass.

if you do decide to buy this game on steam, here's the glitches i found and how i overcame them (may not work for you). it should be noted i played the entirety of the game in windowed mode and used the dpfix for most of it.

- launcher doesn't work
open the game with the .exe file

- crash on chapter 9, 14, etc 
set compatibility for both the .exe and launcher to windows 98. windows 98 makes the game framey so 
you can save and reopen it normally once you get through the chapter.

- aiming is heavily restricted 
windows 98 mode also fixes this, but you can get around it by pressing ctrl, releasing it while still aiming, then moving the cursor to hit what you need to. it's only reallynecessary in some boss fights and notoriously the very final boss. you can hit the last boss even with the restricted aiming, you just have to spam the ctrl method and get a little lucky.

imo, this game deserves to be played in spite of the glitches. nothing i love more than a good steam game except having to fix it myself :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198290790821', 'num_games_owned': 349, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 4040, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3768, 'last_played': 1546456159}
review: Tenia el juego visto de algun lado, por lo poco que habia visto pense que era mas un juego tipo survival old school y nada similar, la historia te mete de cabeza en querer jugarlo hasta el final, aunque la jugabilidad es por ratos tediosa y algun que otro bug molesto, es un juego que podes amar u odiar a los pocos minutos de jugarlo, en mi caso me encanto mas alla de los errores, es un juego y una experiencia unica.

author: {'steamid': '76561198034626309', 'num_games_owned': 630, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 3916, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2421, 'last_played': 1669754509}
review:
If you can get this game (mostly) working, it's a treat of a story to go through. Once you get it all patched and ready to go, you'll spend much more time having fun with the game.

Edit 7/11/2022: Still tedious to get working well, but still 100% worth it to do so. With enough troubleshooting and usage of various guides (and also most frustratingly, a nebulous combination of both hardware and software components,) you can have this game running pretty stable (only crashes once in a blue moon) at any resolution with uncapped framerate, though I'd recommend capping it at 60 specifically for vehicle physics.

author: {'steamid': '76561198092758274', 'num_games_owned': 469, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 1570, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1564, 'last_played': 1547843642}
review:
[h1]A Wonderful Mess[/h1]
Characters and Story are brilliant and they make it up to all the glitches, bugs, awful controls, terrible graphics and performance issues which can be fixed with mods. 
There's so much love poured into it that somehow it becomes this memorable, fun, even somewhat touching experience. It's a Cult Classic for weirdos and Twin Peaks fans.
[i]I'll never forget this game.[/i]

author: {'steamid': '76561198048983815', 'num_games_owned': 888, 'num_reviews': 69, 'playtime_forever': 167, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 161, 'last_played': 1588985383}
review: Been trying to get the game to work properly for a few hours. Finally I get it going pretty nicely and then it starts switching the inputs on my right stick on my controller. Googling shows that this is common. Despite supposedly being a good game, I can't really recommend this hot mess of a port. The game is also way too expensive for being this broken. Save your money and watch a let's play of it

author: {'steamid': '76561198027645763', 'num_games_owned': 1724, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 998, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 80, 'last_played': 1545681993}
review:
Yeah... it is strange. I knew that back when I bought it (can't remember where though), but I didn't expect such an abomination.
The controls are horrendous. Playing with the controller is only impossible because the camera does what it wants, It is near impossible to look around to see where you are heading to or that there are items or whatever.
Playing with mouse and keyboard is even more akward, besides you can look around normally you have the worst settings for a shooter you could imagine. Even Resident Evil 4 has better mouse and keyboard implementation.
I can't say much about the story, although it starts quite interesting, but I can't play on, it is getting on my nerves too much.
Unfortunately.

Oh and the game looks awful. I don't need the best graphics, expecially for 2013, I just need something I can look at without getting fuzzy. Console resolution, bad Framerate, bad and lazy effects, textures from hell, it is just ugly. Games like Resident Evil 4 from 2004 (!) look and feel better. Even the PS2 version.
And the last thing: There are no settings beyond Autosave (which cant be turned on), Camera (haha) and Aim settings and the other I already forgot. No Audio (this game is awfully loud), graphics, resolution and so on setting. This is by far the worst PC Port I have ever seen. But I don't think the console version is any better (because of the reasons I mentioned.)

author: {'steamid': '76561197967798229', 'num_games_owned': 603, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 2771, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1780, 'last_played': 1589553929}
review:
Love the game but I cannot recommend it unfortunately on PC, maybe on PS3 if you can find it. The port is one of the worst I've seen. Manhunt took me a while to get running on a modern machine but it worked through the whole game when I was done modifying it. 

I've done no less than half a dozen fixes based on Steam community recommendations, Google searches, and PC Gaming Wiki's page on the game and at best can get a couple hours out of the game before it completely crashes with a runtime error message even with the fixes in place. Saving often is recommended but if you are doing chapter replays you cannot save so I have lost 3 hours of gameplay before on a replay. 

That being said, the story is fun, the characters are great, and everything you've heard about it being "so bad it's good" is correct, if you can ignore the crashes (those are so bad they are bad). If you are willing to fight through the bugs there is a solid game there, just be prepared for some tweaking and be a patient person.

author: {'steamid': '76561198154897368', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 117, 'playtime_forever': 141, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 141, 'last_played': 1527451259}
review: spooky game nice graphics good story and a creepy guy who stalks you with an axe interesting game for what it is and at a good price and comes with cards which give you some nice wallpaper to boot.

author: {'steamid': '76561198154190604', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 59, 'playtime_forever': 178, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 178, 'last_played': 1539612813}
review: Even when this game isn't crashing on you, it's arguably one of the worst games I've played. Save the money even when on a sale, because chances are the crashes will ruin the game for you and there is no autosave. Otherwise, the game has terrible graphics, the voice acting is hilarious, the character animations are pretty bizarre and the story is sub-par. Game also far too linear for what it tries to come across - a sandbox, open world game.
