author: {'steamid': '76561198081780579', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 78, 'playtime_forever': 676, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 672, 'last_played': 1539460053}
review:
Porting pressochÃ© ingiocabile per via dei troppi crash. Sono riuscito a finirlo, ma le imprecazioni non sono mancate.

Per quanto riguarda il gioco in sÃ¨: magnifico. 
Ãˆ vero: il comparto tecnico Ã¨ quello che Ã¨, tuttavia il gioco offre un'esperienza unica. Una storia - seppur ereditata da clichÃ© cinematografici anni 90 - davvero bella e toccante, con un epilogo profondo, tuttavia non priva di un umorismo spiccatamente giapponese che non guasta mai. La narrazione segue magistralmente la parte interattiva, la quale Ã¨ fatta di tanti piccoli accorgimenti che rendono l'esperienza coerente e immersiva, sviluppando al massimo le potenzialitÃ  del medium. 

Insomma: non Ã¨ un giochetto per intrattenere e basta, Ã¨ una vera Ã¨ propria esperienza (a tratti psichedelica), un magistrale esempio di come dovrebbe essere fatto un videogioco, nonostante i limiti tecnici che si porta sul groppone.
Si tratta di un cult? SÃ¬, va assolutamente giocato.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035868066', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 63, 'playtime_forever': 1553, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1391, 'last_played': 1539562827}
review: Deadly Premonition is a very good crime investigation game. Although it often appears old, clunky and unwillingly funny, it succeeds in presenting an interesting murder mystery. The game feels like an interactive movie and its strenghts are the well structured plot, the pacing of the story and the dialogues. Btw: The action parts of the game are boring BS, so don't buy this if you're much into "action" adventures.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006000433', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 76, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 75, 'last_played': 1580610746}
review: An amazing game that has to be experienced. Just make sure you download the mods for the game before you play it, it fixes everything and makes the game look as good as it can look. I played the game a bunch of time on the X360 and loved it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197989930228', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 96, 'playtime_forever': 177, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 177, 'last_played': 1539092242}
review:
This game is like Resident Evil 1 and Silent Hill 2 had a baby. Name it Alan Cheeseballs. This game is hard to explain. It's like a B-Game. But Bob I don't know what a b-game is. B-Game description: a low-budget game, entertaining values, with an ok gameplay mechanics and cheesy actors. Huh? This game is swimming in 7's. I give it a 7 out of 10.
Side note: I was afraid to buy this game. Because I thought it was going to give me issues running the game. But Its running great. Here is what I did. I have windows 10 up to date. Amd Graphics card RX580. I made this game DPLauncher.exe properties run compatibility "windows XP Pack 3".

author: {'steamid': '76561198314257289', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 2952, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1760, 'last_played': 1614887038}
review:
This game grew on me big time. With nearly 30 hours of experience with the game, I finished the game feeling happy and satisfied with my experience. 

I will start off with the one thing people HAVE to know about before considering purchasing this game, the PC port is horrendous, if you have a PS3 or a Xbox 360 I recommend that you play the game on those platforms. The game without any mods installed will automatically runs at 720p with the lowest graphical settings possible, luckily there are mods to fix all of those issues, but this ultimately leads to another serious issue, the crashes. This is the one game I've played where I felt that I had to save every chance I was allowed, because the frequent crashes are unpredictable and can ruin your experience severely. In my first ever playthrough, my game crashed at a specific point in the game, and this caused my save file to corrupt and I couldn't find a fix for it. This game, from a technical standpoint, is a piece of shit in these regards, if any of this stuff is bothersome I would recommend staying away from the game.

Onto the good part, due to the unfortunate crashes I experienced, I had to restart my progress 3 times, and on the third time I was finally given the opportuity to complete the game, and I did just that. The game itself is far from spectacular, the combat is, in simple terms, bad. Why is it bad? Spacebar is the aim button, that's really all I have to say to explain why it's bad, but it doesn't take away from the game too much. What really made me engrossed with this game was the story, the town of Greenvale, and it's various characters. Honestly, the main protagonist of the story, that being Agent Francis York Morgan, ends up being one of my favorite characters in a video game in recent memory. There have been a couple of scenes in the game, especially the "Sinner Sandwich" cutscene which have had me laughing quite a lot, and it's primary because of how interesting of a character York is, and his relationship with Zach being unique and intriguing to follow.

But what's also great about this game is that it's an absurd game. It takes the small town murder investigation trope and adds this weird vibe to the game that makes you want to keep playing. I thought the opening hours of the game were a bit boring for me, but as I kept playing, I grew fond of the game and I became invested in the story. Before I beat the game, I would listen to the soundtrack of the game from time to time, and at the time I thought it was pretty bad. After I beat the game however, I had a greater appreciation for the music as I understood how it was supposed to be taken in and enjoyed, like for instance, there's a song called "Miss Stiletto Heels" which I didn't like in the beginning, but when it was finally introduced into the game, I started to like the song more because I understood the song's purpose. 

Before writing this review, I saw another review that claimed this game to be "The Room" or video games, and I honestly couldn't agree more. 

I wouldn't buy the game at it's current pricepoint of $25, wait for it to go on sale, I think I got my copy for $4 while it was on sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198273011256', 'num_games_owned': 3038, 'num_reviews': 707, 'playtime_forever': 250, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 250, 'last_played': 1538801545}
review:
[h1]Es tan malo, que es bueno; o tan bueno, que es malo(?)[/h1]

Dependiendo de que lado estes... este jueguito o lo amas o lo odias, no tiene un punto medio (en mi particular caso, es de mis favoritos~â™¥ lo jugue hace como 4 aÃ±os en ps3 y hoy en dia lo ando revisitando, porque es hermoso xD)

>A grandes rasgos: pues este jueguito es un "survival horror" que no tiene mucho de survival, ni de horror, pero hermosamente guionado donde manejamos a York un agente del FBI que se le encarga la busqueda de un asesino en serie en un pueblito. Llegando a este se encuentra con fenomenos paranormales que le estan advirtiendo algo.

>Lo bueno:
-Pues es un buen thriller de juego
-el gameplay es decente (no es un resident 4 pero se acerca bastante a los survival horrors viejitos)
-el desarrollo y plot twist son un win en este juego.
-es como si jugaras a ser sherlock

>Lo malo:
-No muchos entenderan la grandiosidad de este jueguito xD
-tienes que jugar mucho con tu mando; para configurarlo bien.
-no es de los mejores ports (la version de ps3 le gana por mucho)

[h1]Resumiendo:[/h1]
Pues... no es un jueguito para cualquiera; pero por algo es de culto. Si te fijas mucho en los fallos tecnicos, de movilidad o argumentales en un juego, no lo compres, no es un juego bien hecho... es un juego hecho con las patas, feo cuadrado y apenas jugable pero con todo eso logra tener una historia muy buena y un gameplay decente a la vieja escuela. Ojo igual la historia no es para cualquiera... si creciste jugando silent hill/ fatal frame y leyendo sherlock holmes y demas cosas del estilo psicologico(King) asi como viendo toda la m1erda que Tarantino sacaba...estara aceptable, de lo contrario es un ascote y no le entenderas, como juego es mediocre 5/10 y solo sube su calidad dependiendo  tu grado de cultura. Mi nota personal es un 8/10 porque me recordo muchisimo a sherlock, y tiene esos giros argumentales que solo los orientales saben dar... lo cual es una mezcla retorcidamente buena.

author: {'steamid': '76561198015715856', 'num_games_owned': 270, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 3353, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2327, 'last_played': 1593294353}
review:
The Graphics are terrible.
The Gameplay is horrible in every aspect and every section.
The animations are clunky and repetitive. 
The dialog and acting are cheesy.
The controls, especially with the cars, feel floaty and will take you forever to figure out.

I love this game.

Ok, serious note here: This is the best example of a "So bad its good" type of game. The negative faults it has adds to the charm and you fall in love with the characters, gettting engrossed in the story. If you love wierd games, its definetly one you will need to check out.

However if you are going to get this version: PLEASE GET THE UNOFFICIAL PATCH! Its one of the only ways to get pass a bug that crashes the game after the hospital level.

EDIT: IM GOING TO SAY THIS RIGHT NOW, DO NOT BUY THIS VERSION!  The game is now on Switch, and that is the most stable and widely available version. The PC port is completely fucked and the extra content is not worth all the headaches youll get from it.

review: It's a shame that you have to jump through so many hoops to actually make this game playable on Steam but once you do, it is SO worth it. The characters and wacky/zany cutscenes and side quests just make for such a unique and silly game. Not to mention the soundtrack. I thought the songs were so cheesy when I first heard them while playing but then again, it just goes back to how weird and unique this game is, and it all just fits in so perfectly in the end. I'd say, give this one a chance. You'll be pleasantly surprised.

author: {'steamid': '76561198111525755', 'num_games_owned': 117, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 54554, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 34884, 'last_played': 1687500593}
review:
[h1]TLDR Review:[/h1] I recommed this game for it's wonderful story and characters [b]BUT ONLY[/b] buy this game when it's on sale. This PC port is [b]EXTREMELY[/b] buggy even with patches applied and depending on your PC your experience may vary from only experiencing minor crashes now and then to being completely unplayable right from the get go. The hassle to get the game to properly run is not worth the $30 price tag.

[h1]Review:[/h1]
Deadly Premonition: The Directorâ€™s Cut is a 2013 HD upgrade of the â€œ[url=http://shshatteredmemories.com/greenvale/hey-deadly-premonition-is-inguiness-world/]Most Critically Polarizing survival horror game ever made[/url]â€ Deadly Premonition.

The game follows the eccentric FBI Agent [strike]Coop[/strike] Francis York Morgan with his imaginary friend â€œZachâ€ as he investigates the grisly murder of the popular [strike]Laur[/strike] Anna Graham in the small town logging town of [strike]Twin P[/strike] Greenvale.  Annaâ€™s death appears to have a connection to the â€œRed Seedsâ€ killer York has been tracking across the country, will his search finally come to an end in this small town?

To say [url=http://fkinthecoffee.com]I love this game would be an understament.[/url] Yes, the game has outdated controls and PS2-era graphics but what Deadly Premonition lacks in the technical department it more than makes up for with its endearing characters, charming dialogue, and an engaging yet strange story thatâ€™s a bizarre mix of drama, horror, and comedy wrapped in an [url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qZV_ijKaPN8]earworm of a tune[/url] youâ€™ll find yourself humming days on end.

It's actually kind of mind boggling how much detail has been packed into this little game... once you take a closer look that is. Part of why I love this game so much is the amount of work that went into making Greenvale a living breathing town. Each resident has their own schedules and character interactions independent of the main story and can even change depending on the current weather.

If you just stick to the main missions you are going to miss a lot of the small details that make this game great. I've been playing the game since the original 360 game release 8 years ago and I'm still surprised by "new" conversations I never encountered before before because I neglected to speak to a certain character at a certain time, place, and weather condition! You can actually learn a lot about the townfolk during these optional conversations, not revealed during the main mission stuff, so taking your time to explore the town really adds to the game experience in my opinion. This is a mystery game afterall so it's actually possible to even catch a few of the characters acting quite suspciously when they think they aren't being watched! 

With all this said I caution anyone interested in visiting Greenvale to [b]PLEASE WAIT FOR THIS GAME TO GO ON SALE AND DO NOT PAY $30 for this PC port.[/b] It's [b]EXTREMELY[/b] buggy even with all the fan patches available and depending on your PC your experience may vary from only experiencing minor crashes now and then to being completely unplayable right from the get go. 

This game will most likely be a nightmare for you to get to run properly. I've owned this PC port since it's 2013 release and have played it on both Windows 7 and Windows 10 operating systems. It wasn't until a just a few months ago that it [i]wasn't[/i] a struggle for me to get the game to run sans crashes for hours at a time. I don't quite understand why but it's been running decently for me the last few months with little to no crashes at 60fps...but I know that this could quickly change in a Windows Update lol. Just know going in that you are going to have to put in some work to get the game to run and keep this guide handy to help solve a majority of game breaking issues you will most likely encounter: [url=https://pcgamingwiki.com/wiki/Deadly_Premonition:_The_Director%27s_Cut]PC Gaming Wiki: Deadly Premonition: The Director's Cut[/url]

Here's a small list of problems and work arounds I've run into over the years though your milage may vary with your PC. Stuff that worked for me in the past hasn't always worked for others :(

[list]
    [*] [b]Problem[/b]: Toolbox unusable, I can't properly select items in the game inventory, or general framerate lag 

[b]Solution[/b]: Restart your PC. Really. Restarting you PC and the the game actually will solve a lot of weird play issues.

    [*] [b]Problem[/b]: Game crashes after an hour of gameplay due to memory leakage.

        [b]Solution[/b]: install the 4GB patch available [url=https://ntcore.com/?page_id=371]HERE[/url] to make dp.exe aware of large addresses. Run the game through dp.exe only and disable Steam overlay as well.

    [*] [b]Problem[/b]: York can't aim up with his gun!

[b]Solution[/b]: Set DP.exe to run in compatibility mode for Windows 98. Play the game then restart again without compatibility mode.
 
    [*] [b]Problem[/b]: Windows 10 PC and the controller analog sticks refuse to work unless I'm in Window 98 compatibility mode and the lag is atrocious. 

[b]Solution[/b]: Disable DPFix. This happened to me after the 2018 May Windows 10 Feature Update. Once I disabled DP fix my controller worked like normal and I haven't experienced a major game crash in months. I'm actually wondering if there's some sort of conflict with Windows 10 and DPFix right now because I had also be experiencing awful cutscene game crashes for weeks with it DPFix enabled as well. 
[/list]

If you want a more reliable way to experience Greenvale I recommend the original 360 release (it's even a backwards compatible title with XBOX ONE!). The drawbacks? Worse controls, lower resolution graphics, and lack of additional cutscenes and DLC.

If you are really keen to experience the DLC, extra cutscenes, and improved graphic and controls offered in the Director's Cut the PS3 Director's Cut may be the way to go if you don't want to deal with getting this to run on the PC. The drawbacks? Unlike this PC port all the DLC has to be purchased individually from the Playstation store and you will have to deal with some wonky framerates. But hey, at least you know it won't crash on you 9 times out of 10!

Side note! It pains me to see that people have gone through this game with out realizing these very usual game mechanics:

[list]
    [*] [b]You can fast forward time[/b]: You can move forward time any amount just by smoking a cigarette. You need to talk to a character at 18:00 and it's 13:00? Just smoke for 5 hours. You don't have to sit around and wait for the in game clock or constantly take naps. Please note the amount of time you can move forward at any given moment depends on how tired or hungry York is. If he's full and well rested he can easily move the game 12 hours ahead. If you are outside however your smoke break will always upruptly end at 00:00 and 06:00 so you can view Greenvale's...er... Nightlife begin and end.

    [*] [b]There is fast travel in the game![/b]: The radio allows York to instantly travel to locations heâ€™s visited once before. To get this item you need to first complete Side Mission #4 Lost Arnold while you make you first visit to the Sheriff Department. On the way to Annaâ€™s autopsy, on Muffler Road, be sure to pull over and grab a flower that only appears when itâ€™s raining so you can complete Side Mission #5 Nameless Flower and receive the radio from George when he's home in the evening (usually after 21:00).

    [*] [b]There are no consequences for missing a main story mission time limit[/b]: The game may tell you that you need to go see Anna's autopsy before the hospital closes but you can put that mission off for days and talk to people or complete side missions instead if you want. The days events will reset every new day so whenever you decide to start a main story mission the at the appropriate time it will resume as if you made it there on time in the first place.
[/list]

author: {'steamid': '76561198116136911', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 111, 'playtime_forever': 846, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 730, 'last_played': 1480295050}
review: I hate giving this a negative review, but people should know it just doesn't work so don't waste your money. I Would have loved to be able to play more, but after so many crashes and too many attempts replaying the same areas over and over again to try to progress I gave up. I picked this up after playing through the silent hill series and it didn't dissapoint. It has a similar look and style. I liked the twin peaks take on the main character, a bit corny at times, but fun. Really wished it was a functiong game I still want to know what happens.

author: {'steamid': '76561198150856146', 'num_games_owned': 434, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 1783, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1722, 'last_played': 1532989144}
review:
Ein Horror-Action Spiel der anderen Art.
Deadly Premonition ist sehr stark durch die Horrorfilme aus dem 20. Jahrhundert inspiriert, wie zum Beispiel "Der weiÃŸe Hai". Zudem ist es sehr lustig gestaltet, durch dramatische und Ã¼bertriebene Momente oder lustige Kommentare vom Hauptcharakter. Zur Hauptstory: Man spielt den FBI-Agenten Francis York Morgan, der in die Kleinstadt Greenvale geschickt wird, um herauszufinden, wer fÃ¼r eine Mordserie, die mit roten Samen in verbindung steht, ist und bekommt es bald mit dem ÃœbernatÃ¼rlichen zu tun. Dabei steht ihm Zach zur Seite, ein Freund, den er seit der Kindheit kennt. AuÃŸerdem helfen im George, der Sheriff von Greenvale, sowie sein Hilfssheriff Emily. Neben der interessanten Hauptstory gibt es auÃŸerdem 50 Nebenquests, die Abwechselung bieten und in denen York die BevÃ¶lkerung besser kennenlernt. Diese unterscheiden sich teilweise stark voneinander und machen dieses Spiel sehr interessant.

Einen Haken hat dieses geniale Spiel jedoch: Die Optimierung. Das Spiel stÃ¼rzt teilweise ohne Grund ab. Das ist sehr nervig, besonders wenn man viel geschafft hat, da Autosaves nur nach Beenden von Episoden und nicht nach jeder Nebenmission aktiviert werden. NatÃ¼rlich kann man auch manuell speichern.

Trotzdem kann ich dieses Spiel nur empfehlen.

author: {'steamid': '76561197989815883', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1321, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1237, 'last_played': 1532345173}
review:
Several mixed feelings here. The game is a B class one, so I didn't expect spectacular graphics nor the best gameplay additions that a AAA game could have them. With those standards in mind.

PROS:
- The main character is mysterious and charismatic, also adds a touch of fun for his invisible friend.
- The story is also nice, researching brutal murders around the town. Something bizarre indeed (quite a Japaneese touch). 
- The ambience, despite their low graphics, is enjoyable to explore the red nightmare worlds. (Alternative version of the reality full of monsters and red tree roots).

CONS:
Tons of bugs and crashes that can literally stops the game. It's not due a poor PC requirement, but the opossite, the game show more problems in modern computers. (Is a shabby port from the console game). And are not isolated issues, are things that happened many times through the game.
- Unabilty to aim vertically, this made impossible to defeat the final boss as the last shot, you have to strictly aim down. The way to solve this, is executing the .exe in compatibility with Windows 98.
- Loose of textures playing in compatibility mode. If you play sessions with a lot of progress and in compatibility mode, there are moments when the textures memory get full, and characters and graphics starts to appear as black squares. (Cinematics are rendered with game engine, so this problem happens there too). The way to fix it, quit the game and run it again.
- Stuck on loading screens, difficult to unforsee, the game risks to stuck on loading screens after some cinematics, forcing to exit the game and run again loading the last game saved. Theres no way avoid these problems, but they can be reduced with a mod made by fans "DPfix", as well as trying to play the game in compatibility mode.

Those bugs, broke the game experience a lot (are problems that hapenned very frequently) and if you were not aware of them at the begginig, even worst, (because when you know them you can prepare for them but on the other case...).

Leaving bugs on a side, there are other lesser things I dislike of the game.

- The awful use of the Quick Time Events (QTE), many of them appearing suddently during the gamepley and leading to instant kill. (The player hasn't got many skills, so to dodge attacks he depends of those QTE).  Also, there are some QTE where you have to smash A and D many times during long time to make the character run away from an enemy, I found those scenes too tedious.  (and you have to push more different QTEs in the middle).  Indeed, this is my best BAD example of how to do QTEs.
- The Slow pacing of the game. Not a very exciting one.  Its pros is the mystery and humour, but it lacks of "emotion" in most part of it.
- The ending... with the director's cut version, they tried to fix it a bit, but... meh... 

Conclusion:
It is not the best of its type, and it is neither a great missed experience if you avoid it. But if you decide to play it, Deadly Premonition can be an entertaining experience if you like these kind of games, (survival horror and sandbox games travelling A to B to complete secondary missions and collecting objects). 

But due to its multiples bugs and bad game design choices, I generally do NOT recomend this game. If you are doubting, don't buy it. This game has so many problems that only could be enjoyed for those who really has the will of play it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996859750', 'num_games_owned': 821, 'num_reviews': 392, 'playtime_forever': 2561, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2537, 'last_played': 1532142129}
review:
THIS GAME IS JUST SIMPLY AMAZING, unique, bizarre, charming, funny, BUT the PC port is totally BROKEN, an unplayable mess. That's the first thing you need to know, and that's why I don't particularly recommend THE PC PORT. But the game is PERFECT.

If you play this on a console, just be prepared for one of the most uniquely crazy horror/comedy games in history and to have one hell of a good time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198355541355', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 102, 'playtime_forever': 1588, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1588, 'last_played': 1531175735}
review:
No, non lo consiglierei nemmeno al mio peggior nemico... perchÃ©?

Ho comprato questo gioco perchÃ© ho letto delle recensioni che gridavano al miracolo della trama... alla genialitÃ  assoluta. Ho iniziato a giocarci e dopo nemmeno 10 minuti mi sono chiesto se davvero fossi sicuro di voler smadonnare con un gioco del genere, il gameplay Ã¨ qualcosa di angosciante, le meccaniche sono vergognose ma non avevo visto nulla, ancora non ero salito in auto...

ebbene si miei signori: l'auto

ore ed ore a girare come dei co****ni dentro quest'auto chiedendo pietÃ , chiedendo di arrivare il prima possibile al punto di arrivo e sperando di non incorrere in un crash!!!

Voi vi chiederete perchÃ© ho continuato... bhe perchÃ© qualcuno aveva gridato al miracolo della trama e alla genialitÃ  assoluta. Ho detto: vediamo come va a finire.

Armato di buona volontÃ  ho proseguito faticando, schiacciando ogni pulsante nelle scandalose sessioni in cui scappiamo dal boss e dobbiamo agitare la levetta e premere i pulsanti indicati, pazientando ad ogni ridicola scena... oramai mi ero affezionato ai personaggi, volevo sapere come finiva...

Il finale NO SPOILER Ã¨ qualcosa di AGGHIACCIANTE... geniale? miracolo di trama? capolavoro?
MA VOI SIETE FUORI DI TESTA???!!! ma lo avete mai mollato quel maledetto joypad per aprire un libro??!! il peggiore degli scrittori al mondo Ã¨ capace di far qualcosa di meno raccapriocciante di Deadly Premonition!

Quando vorrÃ² del male a qualcuno glielo regalerÃ² dicendogli di tenere duro e stringere i denti fino al fine... per il capolavoro di finale.

Ridatemi le mie 26 ore di vita maledetti...

author: {'steamid': '76561197967719185', 'num_games_owned': 635, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 1680, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1680, 'last_played': 1531077991}
review:
Heres the deal- 

I got this game on sale, it was 2 dollars for me. For this price I would reccomend it- no problem Its worth more in my mind. 
However, I would never pay anything more than 20$ for this port. The game itself is wonderful, but this PC version has some major flaws.  Most significantly, the aiming system is reworked *broken?* and makes some parts of the game needlessly hard and almost impossible.

I also had a few soft crashes (to desktop), causing me to lose progress. Setting compatibility to win98/me
 fixed the crashes, but harmed frames during play. 

This is a awesome game, hindered by a horrendous port and some of the worst boss fights the modern age has known.
If you like a really strange story, with awkward humorous flare- then I would say buy this title on sale. 
I got roughly 30hrs, and I did not do all of the side events available. Do not buy this port for anything less than 20$.
I would feel like its good money spent at the 5-10$ range. I just got really lucky and scooped it up for 2$. 

If they ever fix the aiming, and make it behave more like the console version, id say 35-40$ is a decent buy- but not this specific port. The game itself however was fun enough to slog through the issues.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992329701', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 122, 'playtime_forever': 2441, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2441, 'last_played': 1531010165}
review:
I adore this game. It has this very surreal atmosphere and it's weird and it's goofy and the mystery story is really engaging despite devolving into complete gobbledygook towards the end and it all makes up for a unique and fun experience.  There's no game quite like it.  

But sheesh, is it a broken piece of garbage on the technical side of things. The game crashes even if you look at it funny and when it doesn't crash it bugs out and if you don't restart the PC every few hours the bugs only get worse. That's not even mentioning the bad QTEs and the awful controls in general.  The PC version is absolutely and utterly abysmal, even with Demonto's fix.  
As much as it pains me I just can't recommend the PC version to anyone in good conscience. If you do feel brave enough to take it on the compatibility mode for Windows 98 does fix most of the crashes, but it also makes the cutscenes take ten minutes to load. It's a real tragedy.  

Get it on the XBox if you can, apparently that's the most stable version of the game. Or just rewatch Twin Peaks instead.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027471979', 'num_games_owned': 423, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 1029, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1029, 'last_played': 1531018425}
review:
GAME BREAKING GLITCH: Chapter 9 - 6 Hours into the game. No fix by developer or fans. Looked for work-around. Still trash. Waste of my time.
Game was actually pretty boring. Controls were broken for controller but I still played through it. Driving vehicles was terrible. Random QTE.

author: {'steamid': '76561197978943561', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 121, 'playtime_forever': 231, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 27, 'last_played': 1600062481}
review:
Got it for like $3.00 on sale.

I've tried playing this game on two different laptops. A low tier one that can play any old pre-2012 game that uses DX9 at a decent framerate - which this game does use DX9, and another laptop clocked at 2.6ghz with DX11 which ran newer games at the time I was using it for gaming like "Splinter Cell: Blacklist" to a satisfactory degree. The cutscenes lagged using both. In-game, it ran smoothly so I ended up skipping cutscenes. There's really no reason for a DX9 game with dated Dreamcast-like graphics like these to run so horribly. There are no graphics options and the game is stuck in windowed mode. There's a fan-created patch, but even that won't work.

If you want to play this game, play it on console. The PC port is bad.

author: {'steamid': '76561198051362968', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 83, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 66, 'last_played': 1688939923}
review:
I haven't had any issues playing the game, I read through some of the files on it and ta-da... no problems. With that said...

This game is bizzarre and weird. But it's honestly amazing. Has a Twin Peaks/Silent Hill/Resident Evil feel to it, which I love. I originally played this through a couple of times on Xbox but I got a good deal on it, on Steam and thought, I better get it xD

The story itself, is really great. Sooo many twists. They did a great job, in my opinon. Gameplay is a bit clunky. Graphics aren't amazing, obviously. A bit of open world. And like I said, very bizzarre and has a small cult following to the game. Definitely get it!

author: {'steamid': '76561198109373053', 'num_games_owned': 611, 'num_reviews': 177, 'playtime_forever': 1485, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 564, 'last_played': 1535920197}
review: Este juego es muy peculiar, es bastante llamativo a pesar de los bugs que tiene pero que con esta guia en espaÃ±ol se pueden "controlar" si tienen dudas en comprarlo consiganlo en rebaja que esta a un 90% de descuento https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=218647912

author: {'steamid': '76561198055390005', 'num_games_owned': 663, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 3806, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2402, 'last_played': 1589762530}
review:
I would recommend this game with a very strong stipulation: do not get this if you expect fluid and easy gameplay.

Then what else is there? Why would I recommend this? The story.
This is the quirkiest story with the weirdest characters and everything about it just has that aura of Japanese developers trying to make an American game.

The combat mechanics are stiff and clunky, kinda remind me of resident evil, if it was too baked to aim properly. Even has the same mechanic of either aiming and shooting, or being able to walk. In defense, from what I understood about this game, the developers didn't actually want to add combat mechanics but did so for the publishers as it was heavily advised to do so, and hence we can all agree: the developers were right.

Driving: it exists. But I think I spend about 75% driving normally and 25% either on the side or upside down because the "DLC" car is too fast and turns too sharp (and yet still a better experience than big rigs). Though my favourite part of the road trips are listening to York talk about movies, which are all real and seem to have actual facts about them, though this was pretty cool.

Main Story: Twin Peaks, but like you are trying to circumvent a copyright. I actually played this first and then watched the series... and boy are the resemblances uncanny. 
- Pretty white girl dies and sends big city agent to middle of nowhere: check.
- Agent that uses unorthodox techniques to solve the case: check.
- Red room: check.
- Crazy log lady: somehow check.

If you have no idea what I am on about, then watch at least season one. Then get the game if you liked it.
Replay-ability: yes and no. There are plenty of sidequests that are done in certain chapters and not others so there's that, but I replayed it a lot because I just love the main story. So it's pretty linear with a proper ending hence most players may not find it as enjoyable so hence it's a bit iffy on that.

So all-in-all: it's amazing if you ignore the physical gameplay.

author: {'steamid': '76561198244664348', 'num_games_owned': 956, 'num_reviews': 124, 'playtime_forever': 2548, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2223, 'last_played': 1530463656}
review:
This is one difficult game to recommend. Technically this game is so broken that I would instantly reject this game but the story and characters of this game are so amazing that I want to recommend this game to anyone for that. So to come to a conclusion I'll recommend the game to those who have enough patience to tolerate the crashes and go through some manual fixes through hit and trial to make the game stable enough. Developer support had been abandoned long time ago so if you are planning to play it I'll definitely recommend going through this link  [url=https://pcgamingwiki.com/wiki/Deadly_Premonition:_The_Director%27s_Cut]Deadly Premonition: The Director's Cut - PC Gaming Wiki[/url] to fix your game so that you can have maximum enjoyable experience.

Personally I don't like horror games but this one was an exception. Difficulty-wise its quite easy and this is coming from a person who dislikes difficult games. To say that its a horror game is a little misguiding. Its more like mystery/thriller and really weird one. People say that its Twin Peaks inspired game. I haven't watched that show so I can't comment on that but I believe this is true since a lot of people say the same thing.

Coming to the topic, get this game if you want to enjoy multiple twists in the story, interesting environment and whacky characters. Its strange combination of horror and comedy. You'll love it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198026049903', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 790, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 650, 'last_played': 1634266636}
review:
I will recommend this game with caution as you need to make quite a few fixes for everything to run smoothly. As others have said, read through pcgamingwiki.com and it should be relatively simple but dear lord, I really hope the devs one day release as update for all the crashes. It would defintely be worth all the trouble in my opinion for the story alone. Gameplay.... well it's pretty meh but I loved growing a beard and that sandwich.... But the coffee? What's it trying to tell me?

Edited: After my time with too many crashes, I had to uninstall and revert back to this game in my memory when I played it on 360 back in the day. Still a fantastic story but super unplayable on PC which is a real shame. Really hoping this game can be fixed or re-released one day.

author: {'steamid': '76561198131915075', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 82, 'playtime_forever': 714, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 480, 'last_played': 1531351929}
review: *click* Diane.

author: {'steamid': '76561198020385353', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 143, 'playtime_forever': 591, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 591, 'last_played': 1530449585}
review:
I tried, I really did, but I have to throw in the towel.

Terrible controls, broken controller support, terrible graphics that have to be fixed by a fan mod, crashes galore, horrendous voice acting and audio work overall... I tried to ignore it all because of how unique the game is if you manage to look past the garbage but, after one final crash that happened right after a 15 minutes long, excruciatingly slow, dialogue-less, suicidal thoughts-inducing driving segment with no save point, I have to say "Enough".

I can't even recommend it on 90% sale because of how broken it is. Sure, 'some' people were lucky enough to play the whole thing with no issues, but this isn't the kind of standard we should look to uphold.

Just watch a playthrough on Youtube.

author: {'steamid': '76561198036169786', 'num_games_owned': 216, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 42, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 37, 'last_played': 1530366945}

author: {'steamid': '76561197970864200', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 100, 'playtime_forever': 2421, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2421, 'last_played': 1440802587}
review:
A very flawed game that will not run unless you get a Mod (DPfix), It's a tribute to Twin Peaks which is why I played it, You wont believe how hard it is to aim with a gun and drive with a car, I got nearly to the end and was halted by some bug so I could never finish it, I had to watch it on you tube, In fact I say don't buy it, as it's a mess and just watch a playthrough done on another platform.
ps the story is great!
If David Lynch's Wife had an abortion this would be it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198230033476', 'num_games_owned': 1712, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 3283, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3274, 'last_played': 1530036452}
review:
Desde el inicio el juego se empeÃ±a en quitarte las pocas ganas de probarlo (y te insta a alejarte bien lejos sin mirar atrÃ¡s), gracias a un pÃ©simo port y una cantidad de crashes insoportables que te harÃ¡n gritar al cielo e implorar por piedad a tu deidad favorita. Y todo eso para luego encontrarte con grÃ¡ficos que atrasan una dÃ©cada, un control pÃ©simo, una de las peores conducciones de vehÃ­culos y varias escenas que te hacen dudar de la salud mental del creador. Pero si eres masoquista y para ese entonces aÃºn sigues frente a la pantalla empeÃ±ado en jugar a esta cosa por la que pagaste $1.5 en oferta, al final valdrÃ¡ la pena... y con creces.

Y es que, sorprendentemente, la trama de Deadly Premonition hace que te termines acostumbrando a la desastrosa jugabilidad y te mantiene pegado a tu asiento con ganas de ver quÃ© pasarÃ¡ a continuaciÃ³n, quiÃ©n serÃ¡ el prÃ³ximo en terminar en un charco de sangre, quiÃ©n serÃ¡ el asesino serial, quÃ© relaciÃ³n tiene la lluvia y cÃ³mo el cafÃ© de la maÃ±ana le darÃ¡ las respuestas a nuestro protagonista, porque todos sabemos que no hay mejor detective que el cafÃ©. 

A todo eso hay que sumarle un elenco de personajes tan extraÃ±os como chiflados, pero que aportan a la historia y al pueblo de Greenvale su toque de personalidad, y un protagonista bastante carismÃ¡tico que te sacarÃ¡ mÃ¡s de una sonrisa con su alocada forma de ver el mundo.

En conclusiÃ³n, si sobrevives a los problemas iniciales y no te joden los plot twist continuos de las historias hechas por japos drogados hasta las cejas, te recomiendo esta experiencia, Zach, no la olvidarÃ¡s.

author: {'steamid': '76561198123458102', 'num_games_owned': 279, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1514, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1091, 'last_played': 1568151798}
review:
Die Story finde ich sehr spannend und die Charaktere sind alle anders gemacht. Ich erinnere mich an kein Charakter, der die selben Eigenschaften hatte wie ein anderer ( auÃŸer die Twins). 
Ich finde es auch sehr schÃ¶n, dass so vieles mÃ¶glich in dem Spiel ist: Man kann angeln oder mit dem Auto durch die Gegend fahren und natÃ¼rlich gibt es auch viele Sachen zum Sammeln. Auch sehr cool ist, dass man selbst entscheiden kann wann man mit der Story weiter macht. Es ist zwar eine Zeit angegeben an der man dort sein sollte. Diese kann man jedoch ignorieren und stattdessen Nebenmissionen machen und am nÃ¤chsten Tag hinfahren. 

Die Steuerung ist leider etwas komisch. Nach einiger Zeit kann man sich aber gewÃ¶hnen

author: {'steamid': '76561197994606674', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 1772, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 786, 'last_played': 1634847885}
review:
I doubt I could find another game that I want to see remade more than this one. Get rid of the useless combat (we have enough creepy TPS games) and just give us a fresh take on that Twin Peaksy goodness.
All the reviews on this are right on the money here - the combat is clunky and awful but alot of the time can be easily avoided. The driving is god awful. the game is buggy - some containers won't open, using any item you have in your inventory is a gigantic hassle because the things you highlight isn't necessarily the thing you'll use, good luck storing things directly into the toolbox (still seems to work if you press the 'toolbox' key instead of picking up an item you find on the ground,) the game WILL crash on you, and I'm only a few hours in right now. I plan on patching this thing as suggested and continuing my journey, but at this point I don't want to deal with any more crashes.
With all that being said, good lord is this game worth a playthrough. Just get it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198139300266', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 2449, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 587, 'last_played': 1532039447}
review:
Imbarazzante... 
Ci sono talmente tanti bug che, per quanto riguarda la mia esperienza, Ã¨ praticamente impossibile avanzare nel gioco.
Sono fermo al capitolo 1 (al momento di uscire dall'ospedale): appena parte la cutscene, il gioco va in crash. Ho ripetuto la sequenza svariate volte tentando differenti configurazioni (far partire il gioco come amministratore, compatibilitÃ  con Windows 98 (?), dpfix disabilitato e abilitato) ma il risultato Ã¨ sempre lo stesso.

Tra l'altro pure il menÃ¹ Ã¨ buggato. La selezione degli oggetti funziona in maniera casuale: spesso l'oggetto apparentemente selezionato non corrisponde a quello effettivamente selezionato. Ovvero, per capire quale oggetto Ã¨ realmente selezionato, bisogna controllare il nome in descrizione e mai affidarsi all'immagine relativa... Davvero complimenti.

Anche il gameplay presenta alcune deficienze: il movimento del mirino tutt'altro che fluido e comodo da gestire, i nemici che, oltre ad essere lentissimi, talvolta scompaiono, la guida dell'auto che definire "arcade" Ã¨ un eufemismo...
Ma almeno alcune di queste" caratteristiche" bilanciano una difficoltÃ  che altrimenti sarebbe fin troppo tarata verso il basso.

Il comparto tecnico Ã¨ abbastanza scadente se si considera che dovrebbe essere un gioco della PS3, mentre ricoda un prodotto di inzio generazione precedente. Per me comunque questo non Ã¨ un grosso problema, cosÃ¬ come non lo Ã¨, la risoluzione fissa a 720p. Fossero solo questi i problemi di questa "produzione"...

Si salva solo l'atmosfera del gioco (fortemente debitrice a Twin Peaks) e forse la trama (dico forse perchÃ¨, non riuscendo a giocarci, posso solo immaginarlo da quel poco che ho visto).

A mio avviso non vale i 3 euro spesi grazie allo sconto Steam del 90% (cioÃ¨ senza sconto costerebbe sui 25-30 euro...).

author: {'steamid': '76561197994833498', 'num_games_owned': 1751, 'num_reviews': 101, 'playtime_forever': 745, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 631, 'last_played': 1540924391}
review:

Buy this game.  Buy it and enjoy it.  You will not have an experience quite like it.  The game is spooky and random at times, but damn if it doesn't pull you in.  A bit of advice. review:
Klasse Spiel mit einem Makel

Deadly Premonition hat fast alles, tiegrÃ¼ndige Handlung, dÃ¼stere AtmosphÃ¤re, Minispiele, interessante Charactere und einige MÃ¶glichkeiten zum Erkunden. 

Was fehlt denn? Eine gescheihte Steuerung, die ist einfach GrÃ¼tze da schwamming und unpraktisch!

DP: TDC generell empfehlenswert? Ja definitiv, nur bei Personen mit geringer Frustrationstoleranz (Choleriker) nicht, da dies sonst kostspielig werden kÃ¶nnte!

author: {'steamid': '76561198009611882', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 1422, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1422, 'last_played': 1396113676}
review:
Get it on a sale, but rather watch a playthrough online. Deadly Premonition is one of those honest and appreciable but quirky mates you're happy to root for but wary of calling a friend. They'll crash at your place uninvited, make you laugh and cry and shake your head. The game's an eccentric mystery thriller with heart.

Technical issues and quite a bit of Lynch factor make this one a hard thing to recommend. There's actually some smart storytelling under the surface: namely having an unreliable narrator viewpoint is refreshing in this genre and style.

Personally getting over the initial technical hurdles, the inane prologue and entering the first wacko coffee scene I instinctively knew I'd cherish this brilliant gem, its faults notwithstanding. It's an acquired taste.

author: {'steamid': '76561198205519640', 'num_games_owned': 204, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 1173, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1173, 'last_played': 1529551951}
review: Fantastic game, terrible pc port. If you dont mind figuring out how to get around game crashes this is a must play, this game is a cult classic theres nothing else like it. The story and characters are amazing but the gameplay and graphics are really dated. If you have a xbox 360 or xbox one id recommend you pick the game up for that platform because you wont have to deal with all the crashes and problems of the pc port, but if you decide you buy the pc version here is a link to a website which will help you get around all the issues you encounter http://pcgamingwiki.com/wiki/Deadly_Premonition, trust me you will need it, isnt that right Zach?.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028277041', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 1443, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1443, 'last_played': 1458755373}
review:
- Comparto tecnico a dir poco orrendo, che farebbe brutta figura anche ai tempi della ps2.
- Bug. Tanti bug. Troppi bug.
- Personaggi che sono lo stereotipo dello stereotipo.
- Comandi macchinosi e animazioni ridicole.
- Sistema di shooting che definire macchinoso sarebbe un eufemismo.
- Trama carina ma che stenta inizialmente a decollare.
- Fattore tempo che ti costringe a inziare determinate missioni quando arriva l'orario giusto. Se nel frattempo non hai nulla da fare non ti rimane che aspettare, magari guidando in giro a caso, accompagnato da un sistema di guida che definire arcade sarebbe un'offesa per i giochi arcade.
- Audio di gioco, dagli effetti sonori alle voci dei personaggi, orribile.
- Doppiaggio in inglese sottotono.

Non sono un sostenitore del "so bad it's so good" eppure questo gioco mi Ã¨ piaciuto. Anche tanto. Non so nemmeno io il perchÃ¨.. 
Se lo trovate ad un prezzo piÃ¹ che ragionevole, prendetelo e nel caso in cui dovesse piacere anche a voi, spiegatemi perchÃ¨ mi Ã¨ piaciuto.

author: {'steamid': '76561198079478931', 'num_games_owned': 202, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 2625, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2625, 'last_played': 1501124953}

author: {'steamid': '76561198046868175', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 219, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 219, 'last_played': 1528900561}
review:
Buyer beware:
Yes, this game is wonderfully weird in a way that only a Japanese product trying to emulate American fiction can be.
I thoroughly enjoyed the characters and their interactions, and the story is gripping and interesting.

HOWEVER:
Rarely have I come across a game that has shown it's age as harshly as this. There are "action" sequences, where you get to freeze in place like a turret if you want to take a shot at enemies that take 6 shots each to take down. Soon, you begin sprinting past any encounter just to save yourself time and boredom. However, since the enemies have giant hitboxes, they often end up blocking your path so you need to hammer away at the mouse and keyboard with no enjoyment whatsoever.

Puzzles are simple fetchquests most of the time, with their solutions being so easy that you feel no sense of accomplishment whatsoever. It feels like something that was simply put there to slow down your progress, not challenge you.

Story pieces are connected by driving. I would love to put in words how horrendous the driving is, but it is something that cannot be related by speech. Trust me, it's bad. And don't get me started on navigation.

After playing it for a few hours and really getting into the story, I sadly have to put this down. I just can't bring myself to slog through all of the horrible sections just to enjoy the wonderful parts inbetween. Seeing as this is "The Director's Cut", I feel as if the Director could have done a lot more cutting. 

Save yourself the money and watch the game on youtube.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040425339', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 1479, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1479, 'last_played': 1528090237}
review:
Really good game. Story was decent murder mystery, characters were enjoyable and the goofy personalities and conversations added a nice asthetic to the game. [spoiler]story resolution could be better. The ending was a bit too wierd per say, seemingly more like they didn't know how to really write a strong ending and deciding to just go with something absurd instead.[\spoiler]

so why the not recommened?
This port is terrible; random crashes (C++ runtime errors are rampant) and game breaking bugs that can only really be circumvented by running in compatability mode. While normally, I would happily accept such an solution, I decided to stream the game, and compat mode revets me back to full screen which isn't as feasible. Controller kept partically disconneting as well which was very fustrating, forcing me to play with mouse and keyboard.

So yeah, if you just want to playthrough the game, maybe buy it on sale and do it when you're in a decent mood to debug and constantly reopen the game after constant crashing. But for the average player who is looking for a plug and play experience, i think constant performance issues may just skewer the experience too much to the point of even bothering

This is the best mockbuster of a horror game ever.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999279603', 'num_games_owned': 1639, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 455, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 455, 'last_played': 1526676664}
review:
I never had any of the technical issues other people have talked about here. I started it, played the entire playtime I have in the game in one sitting. It never crashed, no bugs, no technical issues at all.

However...

This is just not a very fun game. 
You spend much of the game driving. The driving controls are overly sensitive, the car is easy to flip (I managed to flip it going 20 mph), and the car is terribly slow moving. Add to it that every location is huge distances away from each other, you can spend upwards of 10 minutes driving from one forced location to the next, taking the fastest route.

The gameplay, other than driving there really isn't much. There are some pretty minor shooting sections that are super linear. The enemies are easy to kill, they don't do much damage to you (if you ever even manage to get hit) and only take 2-3 hits from your gun with infinite ammo.

Now, to the actual detective parts, these play mostly without player interaction. There's a part where your at the community center and even if you can't find each town person to talk to (that's all you have to do in this section), the game automatically proceeds you to each of the events without you. Much of the other parts of the game are exactly the same. It's an automatic event that doesn't involve the player.

Audio. Oh boy, audio. The music, great stuff. I really liked the music. It had good and memorable tunes. However the voice acting... The voice acting is pretty terrible. The acting in general is pretty sub-par, but then the balance is way off. Some lines are loud, some quiet. Some lines have better audio quality then other lines. It's just everywhere and all bad. A complete mess.

Overall, this is a rather boring experience where you spend very little time actually playing. I was expecting a corny, but quirky and fun, survival horror. I just got bored instead.

author: {'steamid': '76561198058259993', 'num_games_owned': 1426, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 1720, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1720, 'last_played': 1410430017}
review:
I think this was the game that completely changed my perspective on how I qualified a good game versus a bad one. It's also the game I've probably jumped through the most hoops to simply play. I think there are two camps when they think about the quality of the games they play. They either don't think about it too much and just play what's currently trending or they dig deep into the level design, mechanics, controls and the technicals like stability, graphics and performance. 

Deadly Premonition is sort of a failure on all fronts, but manages to be one of the most memorable games I've ever played. This port specifically is a mess, and near unplayable without Durante's DPfix. Even with the fix you'll likely experience irregular crashing, and will likely have to play through one or two segments twice because you lost all progress to a crash. This is setting aside the plethora of bugs the game is plagued with.

The gameplay is sort of a mishmash of Grand Theft Auto and Resident Evil 4. Where you explore a town and talk to its peculiar inhabitants to discover the mystery behind a small town murder. The plot, setting and characters are straight out of Twin Peaks. The combat is horribly clunky, stupidly easy, and according to interviews with the game's director, Swery, was only included because the publisher wouldn't let them release the game with no combat. Most players do the side mission to obtain the unbreakable wrench, which defeats almost all enemies in one hit, and abuse it through the entirety of the game. The pause menu's map rotates, making navigation as confusing as possible.

The side missions are an utter nightmare, and only can be started during particular hours of the day, fitting a particular characters daily schedule. It often involves tracking a specific character throughout their day to find the point in time where their side mission begins. The side mission is usually something completely asinine and inconsequential. The intended effect from the director was to have the player immerse themselves in the town by familiarizing the player with the daily routine of its inhabitants much like Majora's Mask. Some side missions are reliant on others being completed, so navigating the intricate web of side missions will only lead to loss of sanity.

As terribly designed and programmed as Deadly Premonition is, it is also a game filled with unmatched character, pointless detail, and charm. The voice acting is so incredibly and hilariously amateurish, but also has very deliberate delivery, clearly communicating the personalities of the characters. The voice of the main character, Francis York Morgan should be commended for breathing life into one my favorite game protagonists. The soundtrack is so scarce, featuring maybe 10 tracks that get more mileage than should be legal, yet you'll happily whistle Life is Beautiful months after you've completed the game. The pointless feature of York's facial hair management, keeping your clothes clean, the hands-down best driving dialogue in any game, the attention to setting atmosphere, the serene, yet poorly rendered small town, one of the most quotable game scripts ever, the hunger and tired meter all add so much personality to such a poorly made game, that you can't put it down.

The plot is an amalgamation of striking bizarre imagery and eccentric characters, where every line is an ingeniusly crafted head-scratcher. I don't think I've ever laughed at a game more than this one. It even has an out-of-nowhere, unironically well thought out final act. The good qualities of Deadly Premonition can't be deliberately manufactured or reproduced, they have to come from an extremely untalented (or talented depending on your perspective) creator's passion, honest effort and creativity resulting in game that completely defies the standards of what most consider a good game. Deadly Premonition will quite possibly be one of your new favorites if you give it a shot.

review:
Bon ... Dure de faire une Ã©valuation Ã  ce jeu . Le jeu est bien mais trop de problemes existent .

Pour :
- ScÃ©nario , trÃ¨s bien , du style Twin Peaks .
- Le monde ouvert , il y a toujours quelques chose Ã  faire .
- Le prix du jeu .
- Les personnages , ils sont attachants , tous differents .
- L'activitÃ© du village , les rÃ©sidents ont une vie , aller au boulot , boire un verre , rentrer chez eux etc , bref , c'est vivant .
- Differentes activitÃ©s , pecher , faire des courses de voitures , des chasses aux zombies etc .

Contre :
- Les animations d'un autre temps .
- Les graphiques de fin PS1 , dÃ©but PS2 .
- Le jeu est instable , crash trÃ¨s souvent etc , il Ã©tait prÃ©vu pour windows 98 et un vieux DX 9 , aucun patch de mise Ã  jour Ã©tant fait , il tourne trÃ¨s mal sur les PC de nos jours , il faut tout le bidouller les fichiers .
- Les sÃ©quences d'action et QTE , cela va pas dans le contexte du jeu , surtout avec la rigiditÃ© de dÃ©placement .
- La conduire , je sais pas si il faut plus en rire qu'autre chose ..... J'avais l'impression de retourner sur mon vieux CPC 6128 Amstrad ... Tu tournes a angle droit dÃ©s que tu touches une direction , la voiture fait des tonneaux sans raisons en pleine ligne droite , tu n'importe quoi ...

author: {'steamid': '76561198141417344', 'num_games_owned': 188, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 2973, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2973, 'last_played': 1527275087}
review:
Nun ich denke das ist so ziemlich das merkwÃ¼rdigste Spiel das ich kenne. Das soll nicht heiÃŸen das es schlecht ist. Nein, im Gegenteil. Das Spiel ist klasse. Alles ist so "Twin Peaks" hier. :)
Aber das Spiel hat wirklich einige Macken:
- die Steuerung / die Bewegungen sind zum Teil recht umstÃ¤ndlich und gewÃ¶hnungsbedÃ¼rftig
- die Grafik ist nicht berauschend ( Okay, das Spiel ist ja auch nicht eben neu)
- das Spiel neigt dazu gern mal unvermittelt abzustÃ¼rzen ( daher empfehle ich so oft wie mÃ¶glich zu speichern)

Und dennoch ist es ein gutes Spiel. 
Und obwohl es mich hier und da auch schon mal genervt hat, das Spiel hat einen gewissen Charme.
- Die Charaktere sind super.
- Die Story ist spannend.

Also entweder man liebt es oder man hasst es.
Ich fÃ¼r meinen Teil, liebe es!

Ach und eins noch, Zach: "Now that is a damn fine cup of coffee!" ;)

author: {'steamid': '76561198052599101', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 69, 'playtime_forever': 2638, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2610, 'last_played': 1523893290}
review:
I WISH I could recommend this game!

This is a truly special and magical game. The characters are bizarre, wonderful and charming. The music is dissonant and amusing.

It breaks my heart to say so, but: 

Do NOT buy it, EVEN on a 90% discount sale.

This is one of *the* worst ports I've ever played, and I've played all of the FF13 games. Even with the fixes by Durante, the game will crash a lot. Get it on console.

author: {'steamid': '76561197991225117', 'num_games_owned': 1937, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 2229, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2198, 'last_played': 1523260760}
review:
I highly recommend this game, especially if you love Twin Peaks, but the port is total garbage. But it can be fixed! Head to Pcgamingwiki.com and search for this game, because at the bare minimum you'll want DPfix for 1080p+, AA and SSAO. If you follow that list and

You get a black box that then crashes: Uninstall PhysX through control panel, then reinstall it using the PhysX installer in the "Redist" folder in the game's folder. Move the two files "cudart32_41_22.dll" and "PhysXLoader.dll" from "Program Files(x86)\Nvidia Corporation\PhysX\Common" to the game's folder.

You start to play the intro videos, but then it crashes: Uninstall LAV filters through control panel, or enter the registry changes mentioned on the Pcgamingwiki.

This got me through the game, with the crash at chapter 9 where I had to smoke a cigarette in game to fast forward a couple hours so it wouldn't crash. This was using the WIndows 7 compatibility mode, I don't recommend Windows 98 like most people because it messes with controller detection and causes framerate problems. Oh, and run DP.exe as administrator.

Does all that bullshit sound not worth it? I don't blame you! But this game does often go on sale for like 2 bucks, and there's nothing in the world like it and I say it's worth the trouble. If you don't want to jump through PC hoops for it, don't get the PS3 version, you want the 360 version. The PS3 version has totally fucked colors and filters, screwed up difficulty balancing, and often chills below 25 fps with horrendous input lag. Hope I helped at least one person experience this glorious masterwork of a trainwreck. Also signalboosting SWERY's mad looking game that's currently on Kickstarter, The Good Life, co-developed with the creator of Panzer Dragoon: https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/476090608/the-good-life?ref=456691&token=016e4490

author: {'steamid': '76561197979704918', 'num_games_owned': 515, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 3252, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2468, 'last_played': 1523496871}
review:
This game is broken as hell. It crashes frequently, the controls are terrible, and it looks like crap. But I love it.

The story is great and it seems like it has the groundwork for an awesome game that was never finished.

If you do play this game I highly recommend using DPFix and SweetFX to at least make it easier to look at.

author: {'steamid': '76561198090741399', 'num_games_owned': 1067, 'num_reviews': 63, 'playtime_forever': 2172, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2172, 'last_played': 1521759293}
review:
[h1]"Deadly Premonition - bad PC port I predict"[/h1]

Usually we get well-made games with good graphics. But they were like books with good covers but without a storyline. In this particular time we have a book with well-written story but with bad clumsy cover. Because the story here is really good. But the rest of the game...

Let's start with advantages: a lot of Twin Peaks references (the beggining; York is the copy of Agent Dale Cooper; coffee method of predicting; unusual characters like Sigourney with a bloody  pot (another Twin Peaks reference)); the plot containes couple of plot twists and thrill; features like  eating, sleep, shaving, suit changing, Phantom cigarettes (before they've been invented by Kojimba-san); well-develeped and memorable characters with their own charisma and jobes; good directing; soundtrack is good but poor; and easy achievements (I got them all).

Unfortunately, there are a lot of disadvanteges: really awfull optimization, graphics, shadows, animation (especially faces are the worst) and really bad FPS (considering that it's already 20!8, they haven't fixed them at all since 2013. I had to install Durante's fix but it didn't save me from f*ckin crashes every f*ckin 30 minutes); plot holes tied with Red coat Killer; AN ENORMOUS OPEN WORLD but it's been made without a solid reason; and we have to cross it with so called "cars" but trully it's an irons with wheels; quests with their own rules (for example, in particular part, in the evening while rain from 6 pm till 8 pm drive to Emily's house, take the quest, go to groccery store, buy the thing she needs, drive back and give it to her, but rain goes not othen and the store only opens at 8 am to 6 pm, u can't do the rest of her quests in the same part, so u have to have this thing before starting her quest BUT GAME CAN CHEAT AND NOT LET YOU TAKE THE FREAKIN QUEST OR CRASH WHILE DOING IT, AND YOU HAVE TO GET THROUGH THIS F*CKING HELL AGAIN!); game is really long (if u do quests); major part of the quest and the rewards are strange; controls are bad, especially aim (you can aim with your mouse only on 30 degree vertically); zero replayability because if you play the first time game would impress you but the second would be bad, really bad; and zero difficulty.

So we have a very controversial game. Those who programmed it should play it themselves or be sticked on a low designed icepick. But it deserves a single walkthrough. Not quite othen appeares the game which combines detective, survival horror and Sims genres.

The final verdict is:
6,5 Thomas's biscuits/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198056623099', 'num_games_owned': 867, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 3207, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3207, 'last_played': 1521415500}
review:
Deadly premonition is propably one of the weirdest games i have ever played.
Its a twin peaks inspired murder mystery story that holds up suprisingly well and combines it with weird humor and animations and voice lines that reach "the room" quality of its so bad its good. In short I highly recommend picking the game up especially when it goes on one of its frequent 90% off sales and aplying everyones favorite community modders duranteÂ´s latest fix of the game ^_^.

author: {'steamid': '76561198015035258', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 133, 'playtime_forever': 1773, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1773, 'last_played': 1518854526}
review:
A young woman is found murdered in a small Washington town full of quirky individuals, so an FBI agent with a thing for coffee and the supernatural who has been following similar cases arrives to investigate alongside the local police force.

Oh, wait. Sorry. That's the synopsis for Twin Peaks.

Ahem.

A young woman is found murdered in a small Washington town full of quirky individuals, so an FBI agent with a thing for coffee and the supernatural who has been following similar cases arrives to investigate alongside the local police force.

Jokes aside, this game was definitely inspired by Twin Peaks, but it does have its own thing going on.

Anything you've heard about this game? It's true.

Bad graphics even considering when it was released? Yes.
Music playing during cutscenes that doesn't necessarily fit what's going on? Yes.
Awkward shooting sections that make some parts frustrating to get through? Yes.
Random crashes and bugs? YES.

I actually encountered a potentially game-breaking bug when I needed to follow someone in a car, and he just drove in circles. No, I don't mean he was driving around the block over and over; he literally drove in a circle in the same spot. Thankfully it eventually fixed itself somehow.

So, why does my review have a big thumbs-up next to it?
Personally, I felt that the experience as a whole made all the frustrations that came with trying to get it to run properly worth it. It's really something you need to experience to believe. The bad graphics and questionable music? For me, they added to the B-movie feel of said experience.

Plus, that big thumbs-up comes with a big "but" after it (come on, Steam; let us write "mixed" reviews).
I recommend this game, BUT either get it for a console OR if it's on sale for very cheap.

review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198057705924', 'num_games_owned': 151, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 2012, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 285, 'last_played': 1682780941}
review:
[b]Best game that I have ever played[/b] 

[h1]CONS[/h1]
- Not the best graphics
- Not the best gameplay
- Very bad PC port (get it for another device if you can. This port is really broken.)
- Has bugs and crashes
- The story starts slowly

[h1]PROS[/h1]
+ There is still nothing else like it
+ Great but somehow strange characters
+ Super awesome story
+ The experience is worth it
+ Has some funny moments
+ Has a lot of side-quests
+ Highly memorable
+ Lots of coffee

This game is a must play in my opinion and I really recommend it. I am a huge fan of the game and a little tip [i]this game is often in sale[/i]. It is odd, unique and yet has a strong story to offer. Similar to the Yakuza games in a way.

author: {'steamid': '76561198294413150', 'num_games_owned': 630, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1564, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1564, 'last_played': 1518549000}
review:
Welcome to Greenvale.

A FBI agent goes to the countryside to investigate the murder of a young lady (It ain't Agent Cooper, but it could be) then, he finds out that the case in question has more to do with his previous ones and even his personal life. 

The story is just beautiful. The construction of characters psyche and side-stories are wonderful and you just can feel the personality of each one of them (and there are many). If you like psychology, it's just for you.

Nothing like go out on a ride talking to your "imaginary" friend (who is, on the most part, you, the player) about punk rock and 80's b-movies, while you laugh at each reference ("There's a friend of mine whose hair turned out white from night to day 'cause of stress.").

Each plot-twist, each victim, each new discovery just makes you go deeper into the story, making the game grow inside of you.

There's the outdated graphics, the poor gameplay (on most part), the annoying fatal crashs and bad animation but, the game's got so much style and the story is just so fu**ing great that you just really don't mind the problems... (and there's so many, oh boy...) and you just wanna keep playing, curious about what's going to happen next...

Just a tip: install dpfix, backup your savegames, if there's a crash on some scene, put the game on compatibility with Windows XP and please...
Don't let these problems ruin your experience 'cause, it's worth it

author: {'steamid': '76561198133625991', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 4803, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2640, 'last_played': 1646645695}
review:
Do you enjoy B-movies?
LOL-worthy plot?
Knock-offs?
"So-bad-it's-good"?
[spoiler]Hyphens?[/spoiler]

This game is for you.

This port is in NO WAY worth the full price, you should wait until it goes on sale for 90% off (fairly often). You're going to have difficulty getting it to run for the first time so don't expect to be able to refund it... and it's going to crash often. I highly recommend getting one of the other versions instead.

EDIT: Just an FYI, here are the differences for the other versions, should you decide to pick it up elsewhere:

Xbox 360
-Stable driving
-No crashes
-Some weird tank control sections for no reason

PS3 Director's Cut
-Stable driving
-No crashes
-Extra cutscenes

Origins Switch version
-Minor crashes
-Fastest driving, can be a little wacky, but I enjoy this version's driving the most
-Fastest version to speedrun (WR is a literal 40 mins faster)

PC Port
-Needs DPfix by Durante to play
-Crashes!
-Crash during Chapter 9, most people need to skip this cutscene and/or smoke before this chapter to progress
-Extra cutscenes
-Driving is wacky, as driving speed is tied to FPS. Anything over 60 FPS will make your driving unbearable.

author: {'steamid': '76561197968560421', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 255, 'playtime_forever': 732, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 672, 'last_played': 1673636656}
review:
Despite the negative reviews saying its broken i played for many hours getting all the way to chapter 6, Pushing myself to get that far was rough but the game was interesting

I went to continue the game today and now everytime i click continue it says "Loading" and then it just says DP.EXE has stopped responding

So i went to "Chapter select" and selected chapter5 and replayed the longest most boring chapter in the entire game (The lumbermill) and i didnt realize till i got 75% of the way through that all the save stations are grayed out. They dont let you save if replaying the chapter. So there is no way to load an older save in an attempt to fix the game.

So i guess i have no other choice but to uninstall? This sucks. I have no desire to stop playing this game.

I have a very good stable and solid pc that i have been running hundreds of games on without issue for the last 3 years (i5 6600k, gtx1080, 16gb ddr4@3000mhz, evo 850 SSD) and games never crash

The fact that it is crashing on my makes me wonder if the PC version is simply unplayable. This needs to be taken to court

review:

The controls atre cunkly, the voice acting pasable, it's filled with bugs that will crash the game, the graphics are from the ps2 era...
But, despite of all of it, I considered Deaddly Premonition a unpolidh masterpiece, a game that is incrediblely unique and no game will probaly come close to be like it in the near future.

review:
Yes, the PC port is beyond awful.
Yes, the acting is terrible.
Yes, the combat is monotonous and way to easy.
Yes, the cars handle like dogs on ice.
Yes, the graphics are bad even taking into account when it was released

But still, this game promises "Silent Hill meets Twin Peaks" and it delivers. Truly a unique and bizarre experienc!

author: {'steamid': '76561198027409026', 'num_games_owned': 850, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 1687, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1351, 'last_played': 1708403791}
review:
Do you like shoddy ports and random crashes? Of course you don't, no one does.

But if you don't mind getting through a technical blunder too much, then this game is definitely worth checking out.

If you immerse yourself into this intriguing and surreal police investigation, then it's an absolute gem. Don't forget to save often, except during that one part at the art gallery, don't say "Yes" when the game prompts you to save there. That's it, biggest trap avoided.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993313814', 'num_games_owned': 1074, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 5306, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3892, 'last_played': 1643709653}
review: One of the most unusual and greatest games of all time. Sure it is kinda broken, janky, rough around the edges and budget feeling. But the writing and game design is brilliant enough for none of that to matter. A true gem of a game that is let down by technical issues, however if you are willing to overcome those issues (read the discussion board) and accept the rough edges then you will find a truly wonderful game underneath. One that is far more memorable and endearing than most AAA titles with multi-million dollar budgets.

The game is pretty cool but it shouldn't be the fan's job to fix this shitty port while the game's company just profits.

author: {'steamid': '76561198254661797', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 109, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 109, 'last_played': 1515780848}

author: {'steamid': '76561198128607641', 'num_games_owned': 859, 'num_reviews': 82, 'playtime_forever': 449, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 376, 'last_played': 1568505938}
review:
I want to recommend this game because I enjoy it but god damn, the crashes leave me no choice but to downnvote this game. It's a console game thrown onto the PC, which isn't a bad thing but it surely shows as the game barely wants to run half the time. 

At the hospital, after killing zombies: *crash*
Runs it in compatibility mode: seems fine.
Gets to the mill: *crash*
Downloads the patch: launcher no longer works. So, because of this, the resolution wouldn't change and I had to use Borderless Gaming just to get fullscreen. Which made the game look even worse.
Uses map: the background changes to the key and crashes after a bit of driving.

Sad thing is, I like the game despite the flaws but these crashes are irritating. Don't buy it unless you can get it on sale or fix the crashes. Fixing the crashing takes a shitload of time that could be used for enjoying this damn game.

Also, another compliant I have is the fact York runs like a fucking snail/doesn't run [spoiler] in the chase scene with the Red Raincoat Killer [/spoiler] despite me hammering down on the A and D buttons like they are drums. 

If anyone can offer suggestions to fix my crashes, that would be lovely but my review still stands. They should have this crap sorted out if the PC port was released in 2013! 

Besides all the frusturation, the story is meh, York is a goofball, and everything seems too silly to be a horror game but I like it, nonetheless.

Also, monkey squirrels. That's all.

Rating: 4/10.
