author: {'steamid': '76561198137787324', 'num_games_owned': 350, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 23, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 23, 'last_played': 1460433545}
review: After trying everything, I still can't get the game to work, which is a shame. I'd recommend buying the console game, as the PC Port is beyond broken and a patch to fix the issues seems out of reach. My only consolation is the soundtrack, that alone was worth the couple dollars I paid during the sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198080349814', 'num_games_owned': 1948, 'num_reviews': 267, 'playtime_forever': 2377, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 518, 'last_played': 1465492987}
review:
Das ist der beschissenste Port, den ich jeh erlabt habe! (Kein Wunder, die Konsolen Fassung war ja auch nicht die Beste)
Selbst HEUTE nach verdammten 2 1/2 Jahren haben die Entwickler es NICHT auf die Reihe gebracht das Spiel zu optimieren. LÃ¤cherliche 720p & keine Grafikeinstellungen.
Dies kann man mit DPfix ausbessern. Aber das kommt nicht von den Entwicklern, haben es aber im HUB angeheftet...
Vllt sind sie zu blÃ¶d / faul es selber auf die Reihe zu bekommen.

Nun gut... ich gab das Spiel Ca. 7 Std eine Chance.
Ich werde nicht auf die Geschichte oder Charaktere eingehen, ich komme gleich auf die paar Negativen Aspekte.

1. Der SCHLIMMSTE Punkt vom ganzen Spiel ---> Die "immer-weiter-sinkenden" Frames
- Was ich damit sagen will ist, dass bei mir die Frames von Minute zu Minute in den Keller rutschen bis Max. runter auf 20 Fps... warum? WeiÃŸ ich selber nicht.
Das Game startet konstant ohne EinbrÃ¼che mit 60 Fps. Aber wie gesagt von Minute zu Minute gehen sie runter.
Ich kann so Max. 15-20 Minuten flÃ¼ssig spielen. 
Selbst NUR im MenÃ¼ kann man sehen, wie die Frames langsam sinken. Und bis heute wurde nichts gepatcht -.-

Ich habe einen Abend, mehrere Stunden lang im Internet oder hier im Hub nach LÃ¶sungen gesucht - Nix.
Bin aber nicht der einzige, mit diesem Problem. Bei vielen scheint es zu funktionieren - bei mir und tausend anderen nicht.

DA kommen wir gleich zu Folgenden Dingen, die ich getan habe aber es nichts gebracht hat:
- Restart PC
- De- und Neuinstallation des Games
- PhysX Deinstalliert und den vom Spiel installiert
- KompatibilitÃ¤t alle Betriebssysteme durchprobiert
- Als Admin ausfÃ¼hren
- Den Launcher im ordner starten, nicht in Steam
- DPfix installiert (Dadurch hat man AuflÃ¶sung 1920 x 1080, und kann Grafikeinstellen per Nummern Ã¤ndern)
- GefÃ¼hlte hundert verschiedene Einstellung in der DPfix . ini Datei ausprobiert
- Vsync an / aus
- Mit und Ohne Controller
- Treiber sind alle aktuell! Bin ja nicht doof, falls jmd heute noch mit solch einer Aussage antanzt
uvm.

Ich habe sogut wie alles probiert, was im Internet oder Hub steht. Mich regt das auf -.-
Naja, damit ist das Game fÃ¼r mich aus. Zum GlÃ¼ck nur fÃ¼r Ca. 3 Euro im Sale gekauft.

2. Die Steuerung
- Ich sag nur eins "KATASTROPHAL". Egal ob zu FuÃŸ oder beim Auto fahren.
Ich verstehe nicht, warum die Kamera nach Links zeigt, wenn ich im Auto nach RECHTS abbiege? 
Allgemein dreht die kamera in die andere Richtugn, wenn man auch nur kurz lenkt.
Dazu kommt, dass das Auto manchmal gar nicht aus dem Arsch kommt. Und gelegentlich lenkt er einfach viel zu viel und schwupp - Baum geknutscht, was unsichtbare getroffen oder die Spielgrenze.

Mit controller ist es noch schlimmer. Der Fix wegen dem Controller kam spÃ¤ter - das merkt man.
Im Kampf *Facepalm* ... sobald man mit einer Waffe zielt, kann man sich nicht bewegen. Ich glaube sowas wie Ausweichen gibt es nicht, oder? Hab nix gemerkt.
Das schwenken mit der Waffe auf den Feind erwies sich Anfangs extrem nervig. Aber mit vielen Stunden und Ãœbung gewÃ¶hnt man sich dran.

3. Die "Stadt" 
- Das Spiel hat den Tag "OpenWorld". Ist es auch, aber die Stadt + Umland ist tot. Es fahren nur paar Autos rum. Gibt kein Gras. Die "Wiese" ist einfach nur glatt & GrÃ¼n. Die BÃ¤ume sind alle gleich. Gibt anscheinend nur 1 Modell.
Das Game hat viele Nebenmissionen, die ab Bestimmten Kapiteln und Tageszeit gemacht werden kÃ¶nnen. 
Auf der Karte gibt es desweiteren noch Fischsymbole. vllt kann man Angeln... wozu? Keine ahnung.
Vllt dachten die sich das, als eine Art "NebenbeschÃ¤ftigung" - hÃ¶hÃ¶hÃ¶.
Es gibt mehr als 60 Sammelkarten, die in der Welt gefunden werden kÃ¶nnen. 


Wie gesagt, ich wÃ¼rde das Game sehr gerne zocken und die Grafik wÃ¤re mir scheiÃŸegal, wenn nur die beschissenen FPS konstant auf 60 bleiben wÃ¼rden. Ich habe keine Ahnugn, was ich noch tun kÃ¶nnte :( 

Solltet ihr keine Probleme haben, dann beneide ich euch :D
Falls ihr noch meine PC Daten wissen wollt ---> Schaut in mein Profil.


PS: Es ist mir egal, ob hier viele das Review hier mit einen "Nicht Hilfreich" betÃ¤tigen. Mir geht es hier nicht um Top Review, sondern um MEIN REVIEW! Es kann nicht sein, dass man nach sooovielen Jahren und Monaten es immer noch nichts gefixxt hat.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007058921', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 1258, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1257, 'last_played': 1460678931}
review: Honestly, I was surprised at how much I liked this game. I knew people had mixed views on it before playing, but I was not expecting the amazingly original storyline and surprise ending. If you think you're going to like this game even a little bit, it will probably surpass your expectations. Once you get it working, the awful port becomes just another quirk of this oddly satisfying game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007434846', 'num_games_owned': 546, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 307, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 226, 'last_played': 1464382024}
review: This game is so goddamn broken, but once you get past it, corny and fun!

author: {'steamid': '76561198046791361', 'num_games_owned': 564, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 386, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 386, 'last_played': 1557709968}
review:
Great game but don't play it on PC, even with the fan patches it still feels like its held together by thin string and glue. Play it on Switch instead, its the best of both worlds, it isn't buggy and unstable like the PC version and not as laggy as the PS3 version.


The PS3 version is an alright option too if you don't have a Switch, just expect god awful frame rates but it functions at least.

author: {'steamid': '76561198219275860', 'num_games_owned': 74, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 478, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 428, 'last_played': 1467369903}

author: {'steamid': '76561198059539509', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 52, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 52, 'last_played': 1459924698}
review:
I played this game with a friend on PS3 and while he hated it I honestly loved it. It's hard to say why with all it's flaws and rough edges, but I found it really enjoyable. It could be "it's so bad it's good" sorta thing but I found the game compelling. In any case it's not for everyone, but if you enjoy quirky rough around the edges games or movies, it's certainly for you. 

Also just call him York â€“ everyone else does.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025922493', 'num_games_owned': 436, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 325, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 83, 'last_played': 1486942951}
review:
Ci sono casi positivi e casi negativi, casi nel quale c'Ã¨ bisogno di grosse quantitÃ  d'impegno per avviare un gioco e mantenerlo stabile.

Questo Ã¨ ciÃ² che riguarda Deadly Premonition: Director's Cut. Il gioco va in crash continuamente, non importa la quantitÃ  di Fix che vengono inserite, e bisogna tener conto di salvataggi continui e dita incrociate cosÃ¬ tanto da far venire i crampi.

Il port Ã¨ pessimo. E qui sto parlando esclusivamente della versione PC, visto che la versione originale che disgraziatamente ho avuto per Xbox 360 l'ho posseduta e finita (anche se non fino a prendere ogni oggetto e collezione presente) e posso dire che anche se il gioco fa schifo ed Ã¨ incredibilmente terra-terra in molti dei campi qualitativi, Ã¨ un esperienza da provare. 

Dopo questo gioco il caffÃ¨ non lo guardate piÃ¹ allo stesso modo.
O le pentole.

Ma tralasciando tutto questo discorso: Il gioco? Lo consiglierei per l'ammontare assurdo di "Mio dio perchÃ©". Il Port? Nel cestino diecimila volte. Non sono mai rilasciate patch ufficiali e dubito che ne vedremo, e per giocarci bisogna modificarlo a fondo tenendo conto anche di premunirsi di salvataggi in avanzo (PerchÃ© il gioco comunque crasha soprattutto alla fine di due capitoli, a prescindere) e quindi di gettare qualsiasi idea di run personali dalla finestra. 

C'Ã¨ chi ha potuto fare un run perfetto da 0-100 del gioco senza crash, ma Ã¨ generalmente un terno al lotto.

Mi spiace, ma ciÃ² che va meritato Ã¨ meritato.  Non consiglio questa specifica versione del gioco.

author: {'steamid': '76561198168656005', 'num_games_owned': 381, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 234, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 205, 'last_played': 1699367932}
review:
I spent more time trying to get DP to run than playing it, and what I did get to play was a mixed bag.
In particular, the music, writing, and atmosphere are pretty good, insomuch as they are Twin Peaks: the game
but the shooting segments are absolute garbage
most of the town, and most of the spaces within the buildings in town are empty space
and the cars turn like bricks

author: {'steamid': '76561198022923849', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 61, 'playtime_forever': 527, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 523, 'last_played': 1640885319}
review:
The game itself is great! Aside from the weird control layout, and sluggish aiming, which is fine. Because the game is very generous in giving you time in battle. 

However the reason I can't recommend it is the port. It crashes! A lot! I'm only a few hours in and I've had to replay entire sections 3x so far. There's also no hope of it being fixed. Get the 360/PS3 version. Avoid this on steam.

author: {'steamid': '76561198074187371', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1747, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1660, 'last_played': 1459283820}
review:
Deadly Premonition, um game de difÃ­cil classificaÃ§Ã£o, eu ariscaria chamÃ¡-lo de "survival/horror de investigaÃ§Ã£o".
O game foi desenvolvido pela Rising Star Games e Access Games, lanÃ§ado em 2010 para PS3 e X360, e trÃªs anos mais tarde, relanÃ§ado para PS3 e PC na ediÃ§Ã£o "Director's Cut", uma versÃ£o com melhorias grÃ¡ficas e alguns extras em relaÃ§Ã£o ao original.

Falar de Deadly Premonition com um olhar extremamente crÃ­tico Ã© um tanto incoerente, o game estava em desenvolvimento desde 2004, e foi pensado para ser lanÃ§ado no PS2 com o nome de "Rainy Woods", mas em 2007 fora cancelado, e anos mais tarde, o projeto foi retomado. O orÃ§amento foi baixÃ­ssimo, e os devs se esforÃ§aram muito para que o game pudesse ser possÃ­vel.

Enfim, vamos comeÃ§ar pelos pontos negativos: Os grÃ¡ficos e a jogabilidade.

Que DP foi projetado para o PS2 nÃ£o Ã© nada difÃ­cil de se deduzir, os grÃ¡ficos sÃ£o feios, pouco polidos, as expressÃµes faciais dos personagens sÃ£o de dar dÃ³ e os efeitos de tiro sÃ£o a coisa mais podre que eu jÃ¡ vi em um game, parece que vocÃª estÃ¡ atirando com uma arma de chumbinho, nada tem impacto no jogo (carros, tiros, golpes, NADA TE PASSA A SENSAÃ‡ÃƒO DE IMPACTO), a fÃ­sica Ã© tosca a ponto de vocÃª rir de desgosto.
E isso nos leva a outro ponto muito negativo, a jogabilidade. NÃ£o me refiro Ã s partes de investigaÃ§Ã£o, nessas Ã© sÃ³ andar e interagir com o cenÃ¡rio, mas Ã© nas partes de survival horror que o jogo te bate com uma cadeira de metal nas costas. Tudo Ã© muito repetitivo e nÃ£o existe desafio, a "dificuldade" Ã© sÃ³ o numero de tiros que os zumbis precisam para morrer, ou seja, no inicio, vocÃª mata um zumbi com 3 tiros, e no final, esse mesmo zumbi precisa de 9 tiros para morrer. AlÃ©m disso, os momentos que o "Raincoat Killer" (basicamente, ele exerce o mesmo papel do Nemesis de RE3, te persegue e Ã© invencÃ­vel) aparece sÃ£o IRRITANTES, pelo simples fato de ele ser invencÃ­vel e seus encontros com ele sempre vÃ£o terminar nos quick time events mais sem sentido e confusos possÃ­veis (por exemplo, vocÃª fugir dele e PARAR PARA EMPURRAR UMA CAIXA QUE VOCÃŠ PODE SIMPLESMENTE DAR A VOLTA POR ELA), sempre te obrigando a memorizÃ¡-los a cada game over, realmente algo muito maÃ§ante e desmotivante.
E a pior parte de tudo, os carros, dirigir em DP (e vocÃª vai dirigir MUITO) Ã© uma verdadeira sessÃ£o de tortura, o carro parece ser feito de papel, qualquer virada brusca faz ele tombar e fazer uma simples curva Ã© uma tarefa muito difÃ­cil.

Mas aÃ­ vocÃª pensa: "Esse jogo Ã© uma merda"

Pode ser, mas Ã© uma merda MUITO LEGAL, e por quÃª?

Apesar de seus defeitos, DP me conquistou pela histÃ³ria, o game comeÃ§a com o agente especial do FBI Francis York Morgan (chame-o de York, todos fazem isso) e seu amigo Zach (aparentemente um amigo imaginÃ¡rio, com quem York fala alto e na frente das pessoas, sem se importar se vÃ£o julgÃ¡-lo) analisando casos de assassinato de jovens moÃ§as, os quais ele tem um interesse particular, York estÃ¡ Ã  caminho de Greenvale, uma cidadezinha pacata no interior de Washington, que recentemente fora abalada pelo brutal assassinato de Anna Graham, uma linda jovem queridinha de toda a comunidade local. Ao chegar Ã  cidade, York se depara com todo o tipo de bizarrice, seja momentos onde tudo muda de figura, o cÃ©u fica escuro e zumbis comeÃ§am a caminhar, ou atÃ© mesmo a peculiar populaÃ§Ã£o local, tudo Ã© muito estranho de inÃ­cio e cabe ao jogador explorar a cidade para procurar pistas e solucionar o grande mistÃ©rio. De inÃ­cio, nada vai fazer sentido e vocÃª sentirÃ¡ que estÃ¡ sempre muito longe da soluÃ§Ã£o do mistÃ©rio, mas tudo se desenrola bem, e o final Ã© triste, porÃ©m, muito satisfatÃ³rio.
AlÃ©m da missÃ£o principal, existem muitas sidemissions, que completadas, garantem vantagens ao jogador, como melhor desempenho nos carros (tornando-os menos horrÃ­veis de se pilotar), um Wakie Talkie que te dÃ¡ a capacidade de dar fast travel, entre outras coisas que nÃ£o sÃ£o necessÃ¡rias para a trama, mas sÃ£o uma mÃ£o na roda.
O que realmente conquista sÃ£o os diÃ¡logos que, apesar de serem de um jogo de terror/suspense, sÃ£o carregados de humor escrachado e toneladas de referÃªncias Ã  cultura pop dos 80's.

DP possui fortes inspiraÃ§Ãµes em survival horrors old school, e tem atÃ© os mesmos problemas que eles, muitas referencias ao cinema e mÃºsica oitentistas sÃ£o feitas e atÃ© inspiraÃ§Ãµes em Junji Ito podem ser notadas, alÃ©m disso, o enredo do game Ã© fortemente baseado em Twin Peaks, portanto, quem Ã© fÃ£ da sÃ©rie deve muito dar uma conferida.

A trilha sonora do game Ã© autoral, e se encaixa sempre muito bem com as situaÃ§Ãµes, o tema principal do game ficarÃ¡ na sua cabeÃ§a e vocÃª provavelmente vai pensar em toca-lo no violÃ£o.

E por fim, a ambientaÃ§Ã£o do game Ã© Ã³tima, apesar de seus grÃ¡ficos serem pobres, a experiÃªncia de explorar o mundo aberto de Greenvale Ã© Ã³tima, vocÃª pode ir pescar no lago da cidade, ir Ã  lanchonete, ao bar, ou atÃ© mesmo visitar residentes da cidade, que possuem seus itinerÃ¡rios, cada NPC tem suas tarefas diÃ¡rias e podem ser interrogados ou nÃ£o, dependendo da atividade que estÃ£o realizando no momento. AlÃ©m disso, existem inÃºmeras atividades que podem ser feitas para passar o tempo, alÃ©m da pescaria vocÃª pode ir ao bar e jogar dardos, ou pode ajudar a dona da mercearia a organizar as caixas no estoque num minigame semelhante Ã  um game de caixas. VocÃª realmente sente que estÃ¡ em uma cidadezinha rural dos EUA e que precisa devolver a paz aos cidadÃ£os que nela vivem.

Enfim, Deadly Premonition Ã© um jogo problemÃ¡tico, que se analisado friamente, ponto a ponto, tiraria uma nota digna de Rambo (o game), mas se vocÃª colocar na balanÃ§a seus pontos positivos e conseguir ignorar a jogabilidade porca com grÃ¡ficos feios, vocÃª com certeza aproveitarÃ¡ o que o game tem a oferecer. Um mistÃ©rio aparentemente insolÃºvel e um senso de humor simples sÃ£o o que marcam DP, e se pudesse descrever esse jogo de forma simples, eu o chamaria de "belo desastre", que ao mesmo tempo que lhe farÃ¡ rir de piadas descompromissadas, lhe farÃ¡ coÃ§ar a cabeÃ§a em perplexidade com as complexidades e mistÃ©rios muito presentes em seu enredo.

Deadly Premonition para mim, Ã© sem dÃºvida uma masterpiece incompreendida, e facilmente um dos meus games favoritos.

Nota: 9/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198027887433', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 63, 'playtime_forever': 40, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 40, 'last_played': 1457396653}
review:
This is a fun, quirky, game that unfortunately got a miserable PC port. When I start it up, I'm greeted by a black screen - I can hear the intro playing but I can't see anything. Through trial and error, I discovered that it was due to having my gamepad connected. Unplugging my gamepad allows me to play the game but I'm stuck with keyboard controls in a game that was clearly designed for controllers.

You have to download a fan-made patch to raise the resolution beyond 720p and there's just a whole host of other technical problems. Play this one on a console if you can.

author: {'steamid': '76561198061679531', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 62, 'playtime_forever': 1199, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 936, 'last_played': 1458170091}
review:
Deadly Premonition: The Director's Cut es un caso especial, nos encontramos ante la clara prueba de que no hacen falta unos increÃ­bles grÃ¡ficos, ni si quiera una gran jugabilidad para poder disfrutar de un videojuego, queda claramente demostrado que el mundo de los videojuegos es capaz de crear autÃ©nticas bellezas, verdaderas obras de arte, se podrÃ­a decir que hay juegos que directamente entran dentro del Ã¡mbito de lo que es la cultura, Deadly Premonition es una joya muy crÃ­ticada, pero que gracias a una buena comunidad de jugadores y seguidores, hoy en dÃ­a es un juego de culto que todo jugador debe de pasarse una vez en su vida.

Estoy muy satisfecho y muy orgulloso de haber acabado este juego a pesar de sus defectos tan crÃ­ticados, DP es una experiencia que no puedes dejar escapar, sobretodo si eres de esos que buscan un gran argumento y un buen desarrollo de los personajes. Para mi, uno de los mejores juegos de la pasada generaciÃ³n.


LO MEJOR:

- El protagonista, derrocha carisma y personalidad por todos lados.
- La evoluciÃ³n y desarrollo de los personajes, la relaciÃ³n entre Emily y York simplemente es de cine.
- El argumento es excelente, profundo e inmersivo, con giros de guiÃ³n inesperados.
- Muchas actividades y misiones secundarias.
- La banda sonora es muy buena (aunque puede resultar algo repetitiva), el trabajo de doblaje tambiÃ©n me parecio muy bueno.
- Es un juego largo, la historia principal nos llevara cerca de 20 horas, a eso le podemos sumar las misiones secundarias, el conseguir los distintos trajes, los cromos... lo que nos da mas de 30 horas de juego.
- El humor presente a lo largo de todo el juego.
- Survival Horror en un mundo abierto con muchas cosas para hacer. (ir de pesca, comer con los compaÃ±eros, ir de copas, carreras...)
- Es posible que se este desarrollando una secuela.

LO PEOR:

- Apartado tÃ©cnico de PS2, mejorable y nada sorprendente.
- Jugabilidad poco pulida, la conducciÃ³n es pÃ©sima.
- Bugs y crasheos en la versiÃ³n de PC, aunque pueden solucionarse muy fÃ¡cilmente (si os da crasheo en alguna zona simplemente teneis que hacer que York fume para que pase el tiempo, si se os cuelga en alguna cinemÃ¡tica o fase teneis que poner el juego en compatibilidad Windows 7)
- Poca variedad de enemigos.
- Huecos argumentales.
- En mi caso, tuve un bug en el que una llave se me metio detras de una pared y no podÃ­a cogerla, mi Ãºnica opciÃ³n era empezar el juego de cero... por suerte logre conseguir una partida guardada de Internet para poder seguir. Cuidado cuando mateis a un enemigo, alejarlo de las paredes.
- Los bugs anteriormente mencionados pueden hacer que mas de un jugador pierda el interes.


A pesar de sus importantes defectos os pido que le deis paciencia y que lo jugueis hasta pasar el capÃ­tulo 1, aunque sus grÃ¡ficos esten anticuados y su jugabilidad sea tosca no es un impedimento para disfrutarlo, la historia compensa todos sus errores, os lo puedo asegurar. El estilo de juego se acerca a los survival horror antiguos, recordando a los viejos SH y RE, que aunque estan anticuados es muy fÃ¡cil acostumbrarse a su sistema, por eso os animo a que os lo paseis hasta el final.
Lo que esta claro, es que si no llega a ser por el argumento, este juego habrÃ­a pasado sin pena ni gloria y se habrÃ­a convertido en un autÃ©ntico juego prescindible y para olvidar, sin embargo no ha sido asi. Para los amantes de las buenas historias, recomendado 100%.



NOTA FINAL: 7 (si no fuese por sus importantes fallos tÃ©cnicos serÃ­a un juego de 8 - 9)

author: {'steamid': '76561198021563753', 'num_games_owned': 133, 'num_reviews': 80, 'playtime_forever': 2299, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2262, 'last_played': 1456076548}
review:
Whatâ€™s that, Zach â€“ youâ€™re at your witâ€™s end?

Honestly, I donâ€™t know where to start. DEADLY PREMONITION is one of the most memorable games I have ever played, but sadly not always for the right reasons. There is so much wrong with this game itâ€™s not possible to list all its flaws in a brief review like this. Suffice it to say, it runs terribly on the PC with the longest load times I have ever encountered and more glitches than I could shake a stick at. The graphics are pretty awful (I used the DP patch which supposedly improves performance and graphics but it still looks like something from the early 90s). The controls are awful and if I hadnâ€™t discovered a tweak that fixes a ridiculous aiming problem I would probably have given up on the game. The combat is hideous too, with the aforementioned dreadful aiming system and poor mechanics. Even the UI is an irritating mess. And yet despite all this Iâ€™m glad I stuck it out until the end (incidentally, despite having completed the game I only found a handful of the many side quests, as they are often time-sensitive and way off the main story track). So whatâ€™s good about DP? Well it certainly is quirky, and itâ€™s easy to see why itâ€™s gained such a devoted cult following. At its core DP has a very strong story backed up by solid voice acting. It has many weird and interesting characters and some crazy dialogue. Although it is derivative (Twin Peaks and Silent Hill are often-used comparators, and rightly so) it still has a unique personality. Thereâ€™s no doubt that if DP had been produced to the same standard as a AAA game it would be outstanding. But unfortunately I can only recommend it if you have a slight masochistic streak, as, it appears, do I. Thereâ€™s a five-star game in here struggling to get out but due to all its faults I can only give it 3.5/5.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042288220', 'num_games_owned': 1196, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 218, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 218, 'last_played': 1455834756}
review:
There's broken games, like Bioshock and dark souls 1, all fixable with tweaking and fixes

Then there's Deadly Premonition, a cancerous mass that even mods and tweaks can't save. They can only spruce it up, but now we just have a spruced up corpse on our hands. A zany, goofy, unique spruced up corpse on our hands.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044392519', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 356, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 356, 'last_played': 1451749532}
review:
The game is very enjoyable and it's design is unique. It has flaws, but those flaws bring a type of charm to the game that is very addicting.
But the port is so fucking bad that it's unplayable. The fps shits in it's pants in some areas. The controls are bad and have technical difficulties. But the nail in the coffin is the random and sometimes guaranteed crashing. The problem is that working around these crashes are boring and can take a long time. Since there are so many issues with the port it's never clear what causes your game to crash, so you spend a lot of time trying to find the solution on the internet, but I just got tired of it. It's a great game, but I don't think any game is worth this much.
You're buying a pig in a poke with this, and I can't recommend that to anyone.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042844661', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1275, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1275, 'last_played': 1454789821}
review:
What an Experience I must say. I love story driven games and this one is nothing less than a Gem. If you are familiar with Twin Peaks you could pretty much relate to this story. You are set out to investigate a series of brutal murders that took place in a small hamlet called GreenVale. Be aware that this game is heavily story driven and loaded with Quick Time events while progressing to it. So if you are not fond of that style of gameplay then this game is not for you. 
This game has an open-world free roaming approach to it that gives us some freedom of exploration  although it fails miserably in rewarding you for doing so. The fact that you have to drive from A to B all the time is dreadful in my opinion and it breaks the momentum. 
The game mechanics alternate from Quick time events to a third person shooter and action game which is appreciated actually. The controls are actually poor and most of the time you can't get your aiming straight however it does not punish you for it as it introduces an auto-aim button anyway. The graphics are substandard - I could not care less tough.

Had hours of fun and good laughs with it. It is funny, however it is not cheesy at all. There are a few twists in the plot towards the end. Bottom line is: This is great value for your money.

author: {'steamid': '76561198083781290', 'num_games_owned': 570, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 380, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 380, 'last_played': 1457584853}
review: Terrible port of a game that I might've been able to enjoy but couldn't due to crashing, get it when it's on sale or something if you really are looking to buy it otherwise I'd avoid it if I were you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198144620574', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1554, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1308, 'last_played': 1457463897}
review: As an open world detective game my thought is, what's not to like? There's going to be a murder to solve, you're free to roam and take on side missions, and there's something creepy and supernatural going on. Unfortunately, this is the definition of a bad port, and probably shouldnt be on steam at all. The game just isn't stable, and it looks horrible. The controls also leave a lot to be desired, at least if you're using a controller. Fortunately, the community of gamers have done a lot to support the game and fix what they can. My version looks a whole lot better, and is a bit more stable as a result. My confusion however, is why steam, and the original developer would want to be affiliated with all these known problems with no attempt to correct for it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042782250', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 1358, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1358, 'last_played': 1457112266}

So nach 22 std "Spiel zeit" wovon vielleicht 19 std wirklich spielzeit sind und der rest sich mit bugs und "brings zum laufen" zeit beschÃ¤ftigte^^ , muss ich sagen das spiel ist von der story, der machart den characteren und der inszinierung wunderbar.
Bis zu letzt gibts wendungen und Ã¼berraschungen.

Dennoch ein Computer spiel sollte in der lage sein full hd und andere auflÃ¶sung ohne ein comunity patch darzustellen, auch ein framelock von 30 fps is nicht das gelbe vom ei.
Danke da an den Fan patch da der die probleme lÃ¶st und sogar downsampling zulÃ¤sst.
Wer sich vor den Technischen problemen nicht entmutigen lÃ¤sst bekommt ein wunderbares game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198068412068', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 1721, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1721, 'last_played': 1423979261}
review: Este juego es una verdadera genialidad!, su historia, el protagonista, sus personajes, etc... Aunque grÃ¡ficamente no es de lo mejor, la historia compensa y supera todo lo demÃ¡s. La jugabilidad es tosca por momentos pero no irritante, las escenas de humor estÃ¡n buenas, las animaciones se repiten muchas veces pero son agradables, esta muy bueno poder explorar todo el pueblo y descubrir secretos, las escenas de terror no dan mucho miedo que digamos pero cumplen su funciÃ³n, en fin la trama del juego es impecable y muy entretenida, esta muy bueno tratar de conocer a todos los personajes ya que cada uno esconde una historia distinta. Si lo ven en oferta cÃ³mprenlo! Les va a ofrecer muchas horas de entretenimiento.

review:
This game is broken, during first cutscene it just crashes... time and time again. There are fixes to solve this issue, but I'm not going to bother with it. Developers, fix your own shit please, or have to descency to no longer sell this.


Do not mind the long gametime, I just gave up after 10 minutes of 'gametime'. After that I grinded out the steam trading cards. Nothing more.

author: {'steamid': '76561198026036911', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 385, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 334, 'last_played': 1456611940}
review:
Fromw hat little I played, I loved this game. The charecters and the story are promising and reminiscent to the likes of twin peaks, the gameplay, while clunky seems to work within this context, the graphics and sound are not great but again, they seem to blend well with this game.

My issue witht he game however is that, as much as I want to enjoy and complete this game, the constant game crashes, bugs, freezes and sound glitches have tested and brought my willpower to the brink. I am sad to say that I have finally given in, I haven't even finished chapter 1 yet just because of how unbearable it has become. I've tried the durante patch, I have changed my sound from 5.1 to stereo to fix sound issues yet the random crashes still occur, at times making me lose quiet a bit of progression.


In short, I really love and do wanted to complete this game, but the constant crashes have prevented me from doing so.

author: {'steamid': '76561198202989696', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 5040, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4086, 'last_played': 1639057293}
review: It's a nice mix of tragedy and comedy, has beautiful music and a charming atmosphere. The story is intriguing and very dark at certain times, weird and amusing at others. Overall if you want an amazing story with a good mix of horror and comedy, this is your pick. Glitches aren't really that common, and the only glitch or frustration i found was during the final boss.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043168588', 'num_games_owned': 419, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 868, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 868, 'last_played': 1418133677}
review: A clut classic in every sense of the word. Clunky, messy and confusing from a gameplay standpoint but utterly captivating both terms of it's narrative and it's outlandish presentation. With endless moments that make you you cringe, smile and gasp. And sometimes all at once. It's not for everyone but it proves that one man's bargain bin trash is another man's game of the year.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025028631', 'num_games_owned': 343, 'num_reviews': 59, 'playtime_forever': 3348, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3280, 'last_played': 1449152563}

author: {'steamid': '76561198020141438', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 2001, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1880, 'last_played': 1456259737}
review:
Zu diesem Spiel kann man sehr unterschiedlicher Meinung sein. Als Ich es kaufte lief es sehr schlecht auf meinem Rechner. Von der zu niedrigen Framerate bis zu plÃ¶tzlichen AbstÃ¼rzen war alles dabei. Ich kam kaum Ã¼ber den Prolog hinaus. Aus einer Laune heraus installierte Ich es nochmal und es funktionierte einwandfrei (Keine Ahnung warum). 


Geschichte

In einer amerikanschen Kleinstadt wird eine junge Frau ermordet aufgefunden. Der FBI Agent Francis York Morgan wird mit dem Fall betraut. War das nur der Anfang einer Mordserie?

Das Spiel kann man auch als "Twin Peaks - The Game" bezeichnen. Es nimmt sehr viele Elemte der 90 jahre Serie und vermengt diese zu etwas Neuem. Manche der Charaktere sind beinah 1:1 aus der Serie Ã¼bernommen. 

Gameplay

Es spielt sich wie Residet evil 4 in einer Open Wolrd. Nur wird der Fokus mehr auf die AufklÃ¤rung des Verbrechens gesetzt als auf den Kampf. Die Spielwelt ist groÃŸ und des gibt unzÃ¤hlige NebenauftrÃ¤ge zu erledigen, die einem die Bewohner von der Stadt etwas nÃ¤her bringen.

Grafik

Die Grafik ist nicht auf dem neusten Stand. Ich hatte allerdings kein Problem damit. FÃ¼r jeden der sich daran stÃ¶rt, es gibt Mods um das Spiel besser aussehen zu lassen.

Fazit

Deadly Premonition ist ein Game, dass seine Ecken und Kanten hat. Die technischen MÃ¤ngel kann man schlecht Ã¼bersehen und die Handlung balanziert gekonnt zwischen Trash- und Arthousefilm. Das ist nichts fÃ¼r jedermann. Ich habe es gemocht und empfehle es jedem weiter der mal etwas abseits von Triple A Titeln spielen will.

review:
A fuir... 
Je n'ai jouÃ© que 20 minutes, et il y a tellement de dÃ©fauts Ã©normes que je n'ai pas le courage de lui donner sa chance...

- le jeu rame avec ma GTX980
- c'est ULTRA moche, techniquement et artistiquement, alors que le jeu date de 2010... une honte... et pourtant je ne suis pas trop regardant envers les graphismes
- les cinÃ©matiques, que l'on doit se farcir un quart d'heure en dÃ©but de jeu, qui sont horribles... mal rÃ©alisÃ©es, mal jouÃ©es, moches (mÃªme moteur que le jeu, ils ne se font pas chiÃ©s). On vous offrira de beaux gros plans d'une manche, des plans de visages Ã  rallonge sans que rien ne se passe, des dialogues complÃ¨tement barrÃ©s, ... on dirait un beau trip Ã  l'acide.
- un personnage principal incroyablement gÃ©nÃ©rique et dignÃ© des plus gros clichÃ©s de l'inspecteur de police tÃ©nÃ©breux aux dons surnaturels.
- une bande son insipide avec une qualitÃ© d'enregistrement Ã©xÃ©crable (vos yeux ne seront pas les seuls Ã  pleurer)..
- la camÃ©ra est horrible, on ne peut mÃªme pas regarder autour de soi (enfin, tant mieux, vu les dÃ©cors...)
- les dÃ©placements, la jouabilitÃ© infame
- les menus peu pratiques

Bref je pourrais continuer longtemps mais j'ai rarement vu autant d'amateurisme et de mÃ©diocritÃ© dans un jeu vidÃ©o.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999500566', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1228, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1228, 'last_played': 1456069990}
review: Well this is the best experience i have ever got from a video game, mixed with some really annoying designer choices. It is absolutely not a game for everyone, but if you can look past the problem on the surface you will find a very interesting and touching story with great characters. Personally, i am not going to forget this game ever.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971970073', 'num_games_owned': 1483, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 2267, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2212, 'last_played': 1455284073}
review:
Anno 2010, esce Deadly Premonition (DP) su Xbox360. Le review sono abbastanza altalenanti nei giudizi, famose testate si danno battaglia a colpi di voti bassissimi o altissimi, lasciando quindi eventuali giocatori ancora piÃ¹ confusi. Non riuscendo a capire esattamente a cosa mi trovassi davanti, e visto anche il prezzo accessibile, decisi di acquistare una copia per la console Microsoft...


[b]Non lo avessi mai fatto.[/b]

Diciamo che il plot mi interessava parecchio, visto che l'intenzione del suo creative director Hidetaka Suehiro, conosciuto come Swery65 era di creare un titolo che omaggiasse la serie cult primi anni novanta Twin Peaks.
E posso dirlo tranquillamente: ci Ã¨ riuscito in pieno. Non Ã¨ una scopiazzatura del serial di David Lynch, ma un'opera che brilla di luce propria, mettendo in campo un protagonista estremamente carismatico, personaggi memorabili, e una cittadina del northwest americano dove Ã¨ accaduto un misterioso delitto..

La trama Ã¨ assolutamente MAGNIFICA e durante il corso del gioco ci si imbatte in piÃ¹ di qualche colpo di scena. Non bisogna mai dare nulla per scontato a Greenvale. Ed Ã¨ uno dei motivi che spinge il giocatore a proseguire nell'avventura dell'agente Francis York Morgan, perchÃ© purtroppo la grafica, cosÃ¬ come il gameplay, sono veramente datati. La prima proviene direttamente dall'era PS2, mentre il gameplay assomiglia grossomodo a quello visto il Resident Evil 4.
Il sonoro, inteso come effetti sonori Ã¨ tremendo, con dei suoni davvero fuori luogo (la camminata ad esempio sembra un battere con le mani su una tavola di legno), le musiche sono invece particolari, con brani davvero surreali alle volte.

A rincarare la dose ci si mette pure la versione PC: Ã¨ praticamente impossibile terminare il gioco senza incorrere in uno dei molteplici bug, glitch, crash che affliggono il gioco. In 38 ore di gioco, credo sia crashato almeno un centinaio di volte, e non sto scherzando. Senza contare che dopo tot tempo il framerate crolla, costringendo a salvare/riavviare il gioco.
Fortunatamente ad alcune limitazioni e errori Ã¨ corso in soccorso Durante e il suo [url=http://blog.metaclassofnil.com/?tag=dpfix]DPFix[/url]. per completezza [url=http://zombievil.altervista.org/deadly-premonition-savegame.html]allego[/url] anche un archivio contenente la maggior parte di save che ho realizzato per ogni livello o situazione particolare che si presentava (crashava spesso e cosÃ¬ ad ogni giro facevo backup del save).

Tutti i difetti comunque passano in secondo piano, perchÃ© semplicemente non si puÃ² rinunciare a giocare un titolo simile. All'estero ho letto spesso associato a Deadly Premonition la famosa [i]"So bad it's good"[/i], cosa assolutamente falsa, perchÃ© DP Ã¨ veramente un gioco memorabile, bizzarro magari, ma non assolutamente brutto.

Dopo anni ricordo con piacere ogni missione principale o secondaria, i dialoghi surreali con i vari abitanti di Greenvale, il bonus dell'agenzia per essermi fatto la barba o le mosche che girano attorno ad un vestito ormai sporco. Ah e i monologhi sui film anni '80. Buon Dio.
Se questo era l'obiettivo di SWERY, beh, complimenti. DP Ã¨ uno dei miei giochi preferiti di tutti i tempi, c'Ã¨ poco da fare.

[i]"Cosa ne pensi Zach? siamo davanti a cinque stelle su cinque?"[/i]

author: {'steamid': '76561198070967169', 'num_games_owned': 204, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 877, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 753, 'last_played': 1562434207}
review:
Wow, all i can say is what a game, i am astonished to find that this game was panned by the so called "gaming media", but i am glad the game is now considered a cult classic in the eyes of gamers with taste, very trippy game, and i still have no clue what's going on while playing this game, utter utter confusion, you cannot really explain this game to people on the fence about buying this game but all i will say is if you enjoyed Twin Peaks you will love Deadly Premonition.

I know, a lot of game right there :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198013588063', 'num_games_owned': 721, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 1819, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1251, 'last_played': 1455665623}
review: Deadly Premonition. O que falar deste jogo? Jogo este que platinei no Xbox 360 e agora estou platinando no PC. Ã‰ o tipico jogo da mÃ¡xima ou voce o AMA de paixÃ£o ou ODEIA com todas as suas forÃ§as. No meu caso Ã© amor de paixÃ£o mesmo! VocÃª talvez possa odiÃ¡-lo por ser um jogo extremamente bugado, atÃ© mesmo injogÃ¡vel se nao instalar certos patches fixes de terceiros, por que a produtora do game jÃ¡ atÃ© o esqueceu. Pode odiÃ¡-lo tambÃ©m por ter grÃ¡ficos da geraÃ§Ã£o do Playstation 2, algo que pode ser melhorado um pouco com patches de terceiros tambem. Pode odiÃ¡-lo inclusive pela jogabilidade, no quesito da dirigibilidade dos veÃ­culos que Ã© uma verdadeira m*rd*, esse nem com patche resolve. Mas do outro lado da moeda voce pode amÃ¡-lo por ser um jogo com uma histÃ³ria fantÃ¡stica, que te prende do inÃ­cio ao fim, aliÃ¡s um dos melhores enredos de jogos que jÃ¡ vi. Pode amÃ¡-lo tambem por ser um jogo que possui diversos diÃ¡logos estranhos e ao mesmo tempo engraÃ§ados, o que deixa o jogo com uma maior imersibilidade, fazendo com que cada npc tenha sua prÃ³pria histÃ³ria dentro do universo do jogo e que faz com que voce se familiarize com todos. Pode amÃ¡-lo inclusive por ser um dos Ãºnicos, ou talvez o Ãºnico, jogo de terror em mundo aberto, onde voce pode visitar vÃ¡rios lugares e ainda cumprir vÃ¡rias side-quests que nÃ£o estÃ£o ligadas com as quests pra finalizar o jogo, com isso aumentando o fator replay. Mas entÃ£o depois disso tudo exposto qual o meu veredito? Pois entÃ£o apesar de tantos prÃ³s e tantos contras eu aconselho e MUITO jogÃ¡-lo, ainda mais se pegÃ¡-lo nas promoÃ§oes da Steam, pois ele fica muito barato, em torno de R$6,00. Quem Ã© fÃ£ de jogos estilo survival horror em terceira pessoa como Resident Evil, The Evil Within, Silent Hill entre outros deve dar uma chance pra esse tesouro escondido. Me sinto muito feliz em poder ter conhecido e jogado esta obra prima cult. E espero que algum dia venha Deadly Premonition 2, serÃ¡ muito bem vindo! :D

author: {'steamid': '76561198041983569', 'num_games_owned': 177, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 769, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 567, 'last_played': 1666504796}
review:
tl;dr Don't buy the PC version under penalty of water boarding.



I'm sure this game is great.  From what I've played of it, it seems brilliant.
Not that I have much to go on, because after a week of working like it should, if randomly decided that I am indeed *not* allowed to use my gamepad.  That leaves me with either using they're half-assed keyboard and mouse controls, which would be torturous enough without the added complication of the fact that I'm on a laptop that this game will overheat when set up in a way that allows for comfortable keyboard and mouse controls.  The other option is third party software to map the keyboard controls to a gamepad, but good luck with that; I thought they were working until I made the ill advised decision of entering a car.  If there exists an arcane enchantment that makes a fine-tuned JoyToKey mapping harmonize perfectly with their crappy launcher's controls that makes the already horrendous cars even slightly drivable, I'm all ears.
But as it stands, I've essentially wasted three hours of my life trying to make someone else's game work.  I'm too dusgusted by the deplorable lack of any sort of quality control here to really care about any workarounds.  Getting the game to even start was already a workaround.  I've already put more time and effort into writing this stupid review than any "developer" put into making sure their controller support doesn't just decide to vanish.  I was lucky enough to get this game for free, so I can only give my deepest sympathies to anyone who was suckered into buy it.

Even if you have no way of playing any other version, all this so-called  port will do is give you a taste of what is in all likelyhood a great game, before throwing some inconvenience, crash, or game-break at you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198144121955', 'num_games_owned': 603, 'num_reviews': 89, 'playtime_forever': 1840, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1840, 'last_played': 1454962889}
review:
Let me preface this review by saying the following: THIS GAME IS BAD! Yet I do recommend everyone to play the game at least once. This game must be experienced!

Here are just some examples as to why the game is so bad-

1. It's glitchy, it crashes a lot, and has lengthy loading screens
2. Animations are silly
3. Action is bad
4. Voice acting is meh
5. Gameplay is wonky
6. Too many useless, lengthy driving sections (Driving was a horrible forray!)
7. The map was frustrating to use for any sort of direction
8. The ending after the climax and when everything was said and done really dragged on.

Throughout the game there were multiple annoying, odd, or awkardly hilarious things. For example -

1. I know the game is supposed to be "open world" but the world was downright boring.
2. You have frequent conversations with your apparent imaginary friend which range from  hilarious to downright ridiculous.
3. The soundtrack is always oh so appropriate. Especially the whistling song: that one's my favorite. (Sense the sarcasm)
4. There are random big ass flies everywhere!
5. If you use the siren in a police car for too long you get fatigued according to that indicator bar and you cant use the siren again until the bar goes back down. Also, if you leave the car after the bar has been maxed out, you yourself will be fatigued causing you to limp until the bar goes all the way down. I didn't realize it took so much effort to have a siren running in a police car.
6. The dialogue! 

Examples of the aforementioned dialogue. And these are just a few of MANY -

1. "My coffee warned me about it"
2. "Who is that one Hollywood writer? Oh yeah, Joel."
3. Quote from the fat guy in the game, "Chickening out now would be like leaving after appetizers."

So much to love here! Now go buy the game and load it up. Here are some tips for when you do -
1. Always run through doors. It takes less time
2. Running the game in compatability mode for windows 98 made the game crash less and it seemed to load faster in-game. Some of the cutscenes became laggy, although.
3. About halfway through the game there's a mission where you follow a suspect in your car. It's super frustrating because driving is horrible. On top of that, the guy you're pursuing fluctuates between going 15-25 mph aka the slowest driver of all time. There is no good way to regulate your speed so you end up in "stop-and-go" traffic without any traffic. And here comes the tip... Don't accidentally bump the siren. You'll immediately have to start the mission over after what feels like 20 minutes of following the stupid fuck! GAH!

In a nutshell: This game is so bad it's good.
Overall the story interested me: it kept me playing and wondering who done it... that and all the beautifully horrendous presentation! Truth be told, the game did wrap up nicely and there were a few unexpected things that made it at least sort of satisfying to complete. I recommend people to at least attempt a playthrough and one playthrough should be enough. I probably will never play this game again but, it sure did leave me with some fond memories! (And really great screenshots.)

author: {'steamid': '76561198070992780', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 6, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6, 'last_played': 1454520829}
review:
I sure would love to give a review on the product, but the game cannot be played.
 
Upen launching the game you are faced with and ugly, if simple, launcher. Settings are found here, and a play button. I opted to play at max, fullscreen. When the game started up, it was windowed. I could not make the game fullscreen, even though the option had been present and selected. I noticed the beginning cutscene rendered at 31 fps, which is fine. Many games render the cutscenes at 30, so no issue. The problem was the first gameplay. It is atrocious. Unplayable. Unforgivable. Even though the game ran at what I assume is a capped 60 fps, because honestly I could have been getting 200+ with my rig, the game ran choppy, slow, awful. It looked like about 5 fps. Ridiculous. I tried to run around to see if it would buffer out. But no. Consistantly laughable performance, with no hope at all of ever being played by me again. 
 
So I paused the game, and what? Actual 60 fps performance? The only the thing runs well in this game is the pause menu. That is absolutely the worst. I didn't believe a PC port could be so bad, but this game has shown me that if little enough effort is put into the work, you can truly release a product not worth the title beta.
 
Do not buy this game. I don't know why there are mixed reviews, when they should be Overwhelmingly Negative.

review:
Jeu (volontairement ?) complÃ¨tement ringuard, gameplay infect et pas du tout adaptÃ© au PC, entre la souris et le pad, y'a rien de franchement convainquant et je le redis, complÃ¨tement ringuard, on dirait plus un hommage au cinÃ©ma fait par une bande de gosses, Ã§a fait vraiment pitiÃ©...

AprÃ¨s quelques heures, je vais passer la main je crois bien. Donc au niveau technique, c'est pas du tout adaptÃ© au PC, la manette est mal reconnue et l'on a pour ainsi dire rien au niveau des options du jeu donc le dÃ©filement trop rapide de la souris : faudra faire avec jusqu'Ã  la fin du jeu. Le graphisme est assez dÃ©gueux et fait vraiment portage console avec un gros filtre flou pendant les cinÃ©matiques qui sont Ã©galement dÃ©synchros. Le jeu demande une grosse config mais on se demande bien oÃ¹ Ã§a passe, bref : la rÃ©alisation est Ã  chier.

Le jeu Ã  proprement parlÃ© alors ? Sorte de salade niÃ§oise avec du david lynch, du gros WTF, un perso principal imbue de sa personne, schkyzo et pour lequel il est difficile d'avoir la moindre sympathie, c'est mal Ã©crit, la psychologie est Ã  pleurer, c'est caca.

A l'arrivÃ©e, je vois l'idÃ©e sous jacente, un gros jeu WTF qui pioche Ã  gauche et Ã  droite et balance sa pop culture mal digÃ©rÃ©e aux joueurs en recherche de quelque chose de palpable mais encore si la rÃ©alisation Ã©tait lÃ  et si le jeu Ã©tait pas aussi chiant, je veux bien mais on s'ennuie terriblement, tout est chiant. Si vous voulez faire tout et n'importe quoi, il y a Shemnue ou Saints Row, lÃ  au moins on tourne parfois en rond mais c'est bien fait et on assiste Ã  des moments cools mais lÃ  mÃªme pas et de toute faÃ§on, j'ai jamais aimÃ© le travail de Lynch, ceci explique peut-Ãªtre cela...

review:
[h1] This port is SHlT!!! [/h1]

You wanted it, now you've got it â€“ the award-winning cult sensation Deadly Premonition is arriving on PC in an enhanced Directorâ€™s Cut package! 

Playing as special agent Francis York Morgan (call him York â€“ everyone else does), itâ€™s your job to investigate the brutal murder of a young local beauty in the town of Greenvale. Amidst the backdrop of soaring mountains and a small American suburb, York must solve the mystery of the Red Seed Murders and stay alive in a place where supernatural creatures and a mysterious raincoat-clad, axe-wielding killer seek to end his investigation for good. 

Part suspense-filled horror, part action-adventure game, Deadly Premonition offers an open-world experience packed with locals to meet and places to discover, as well as numerous side quests and mini-games that will help you solve the murders and uncover Greenvaleâ€™s deepest, darkest secrets. 

Deadly Premonition: The Directorâ€™s Cut includes new features over and above the original Xbox 360 game:

author: {'steamid': '76561198012934956', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 195, 'playtime_forever': 270, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 270, 'last_played': 1453536150}
review:
This isn't a full review since I haven't finished the game yet.  This is just my current impressions thus far.

This port is terrible.  Even with DPfix installed it's still pretty bad.  Controls are clunky & driving is nearly impossible with a joystick.  I have to swap movement with the D-Pad & lightly press it for turns because it's so sensitive.  I don't know if I'll ever really finish this game because of the terrible controls.

author: {'steamid': '76561198202031650', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 256, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 256, 'last_played': 1453515221}
review:
It is difficult to discern if this game is brilliantly bizarre or bizzarely brilliant. One thing is certain is that this game is not worth full price. There are no options to adjust the graphics; and the graphics suggest that is game has been poorly ported or created. 

The controls are fine, but employ tank controls for shooting. That is to say, movement is not allowed whilst aiming. The game does not have the horror vibe that the tags indicate. 

One last thing to note is the amount of loading screens and unnecessary sequences. If you pause the game you get an unnecessary sequence of bushes moving aside. Or when you pick up an item, it presents a slowly rotating image of the item. 

For buyers considering the game, wait for sale.

review:
[h1]Resident Evil de bajo presupuesto[/h1]

Somos un agente del FBI, adicto al cafÃ©, que llega a un pequeÃ±o pueblo para investigar el asesinato de una joven... Suena a una perfecta imitaciÃ³n de la serie de TV [u]Twin Peaks[/u].. y LO ES...

[b]Positivos:[/b]
+ La historia y los personajes parecen muy interesantes (por supuesto, si estÃ¡ todo copiado de [b]David Lynch[/b]) :)
+ El protagonista sabe mucho de cine.. Lo deja notar en sus comentarios
+ Muchos logros para desbloquear y muchos coleccionables (cromos, insignias de honor, etc)
+ Se puede jugar hablado en inglÃ©s y con subtÃ­tulos en espaÃ±ol

[b]Negativos:[/b]
- Quicktime events, sÃ­... y peores que los de [b]Resident Evil 4[/b] ... SI, PEORES!
- Animaciones asquerosamente mal realizadas
- Algunos diÃ¡logos tienen voces, otros sÃ³lo son textos mientras los personajes mueven los labios.. DAFUQ?
- El PORT es HORROROSO! ... Al igual que pasa con [b]Dark Souls[/b], es necesario instalar un mod para poder jugarlo en "buenas condiciones"
- No son muy frecuentes, pero tiene crashes... incluso puede crashear estando delante del telÃ©fono para salvar la partida
- La navegaciÃ³n por los menu, para utilizar items, cambiar de arma, todo eso... es demasiado consolero... no han sabido adaptarlo a los controles de una PC
- En los momentos en los que hay que conducir, se puede abrir un mapa, pero es muy difÃ­cil seguir un camino directo hacia el destino de la misiÃ³n. Muchas veces uno termina en un camino sin salida y debe retroceder
- Jugando con mouse, puede ser complicado apuntar a los enemigos con armas de fuego... Repito.. el juego es MUY consolero, y eso no me agrada
- Yo lo comprÃ© en oferta, muy barato, pero.. el precio normal de esta basura es de 25 dÃ³lares! ... ENSERIO???

[b]Neutrales:[/b]
* La pistola 9mm tiene balas infinitas.. a algunos les puede gustar, a otros no..


Yo creo que este juego, al igual que [b]The Evil Within[/b], es una prueba de PACIENCIA
La diferencia es que [b]The Evil Within[/b] es un juego de [u]CALIDAD #PCMasterRace[/u], y vale cada centavo (MUY recomendable comprarlo con el Season pass y jugarlo en mÃ¡xima dificultad)

Recomiendo jugar [b]Resident Evil 4 HD[/b], y por favor NO COMPREN este juego, salvo que estÃ© muy barato

author: {'steamid': '76561198006064887', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 96, 'playtime_forever': 1480, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1480, 'last_played': 1453120779}
review:
If you can get it on sale or cheap, this might be ok. However, charging 30 Euro for this is overpriced.

Technical problems:
- Crashes and bugs here and there
- Clunky controls
- A fixed 720p 16:9 resolution; there is a mod that changes that, but that will give you more chrashes

While I am accustomed to clunky controls for console ports, the fixed resolution and the crashes are not acceptable.

This game tries to be so much at once, it ends up being not good at anything particular:

- It tries to tell a story, but that story is weird and has too many turnarounds and arbitrary events. Even after the story is finished, you could still turn it around again and no one would mind.
- It tries to be a detective game, but it fails, most detective work is embedded into the story and there is not that much you can do wrong. Lots of suspects, but you don't choose the trail you want to follow, the main mission just guards you through
- It tries to be open world GTA driving around, but fails due to extremely clunky driving, unusable map, and chrashes if you go somewhere where the game didn't expect you to go.
- It tries to simulate real world needs: You have to eat and to sleep and to shave from time to time. But it fails: You cannot to go to the toilet, you cannot wash yourself (just the clothes), etc.
- It tries to be Resident Evil, but it fails in its mediocre clunkiness and boring repetitions, including stupid quick time events
- It tries to be episodic, but doesn't make sense there at all. Episodes 1 to 3 take forever, eposides 4-7 are rather short and should just have been episode 4 if it was ment to be comparable
- It tries to incorporate psychological elements into the game, but fails miserably. Nearly all characters have psychological problems galore, they just stacked probably everything they thought they heard about psychosis and mutiple personalities. You will meet more psychopaths laden with stories from their childhoods in the small town of this game than in an average psychiatry of a very big city. 
- On top of that all: It unnessessary slows down action and progress by long loading times, unskippable intro (which is a problem due to the many chrashes), opening doors very slowly, etc.

The store page tells "Part suspense-filled horror, part action-adventure game, Deadly Premonition offers an open-world experience packed with locals to meet and places to discover, as well as numerous side quests and mini-games (...)". Describes the game well: They threw together lots of things, all of them at mediocre quality and rather early-access-like than finished. So the customer ends up holding a mixed bag of everything a little bit in his hands, but nothing really usable. Just like someone added every spice available in his kitchen to some food, hoping for it to become tasty. Most times, it won't.

To sum it up, and to cite the main characters himself: "Zach, this is a waste of time!". Yes, it is, it kills quite some time playing it, always at the border between quitting due to all it's clunkiness but still providing something that makes you want to continue in the hope of it becoming more enjoyable, which sadly does not happen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014662640', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 1917, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1917, 'last_played': 1453398250}
review:
A quel point les qualitÃ©s peuvent-elles sublimer les dÃ©fauts?
Telle est la problÃ©matique qu'il vous faudra rÃ©soudre avant de jouer Ã  ce jeu.

Tout ce que fait DP, il le fait Ã  cotÃ© de la plaque. La liste de dÃ©fauts de ce jeu est longue, trop longue... bien trop longue Ã  Ã©numerer ici.
La premiÃ¨re heure pourra par exemple vous dÃ©courager de continuer. 

Mais ne vous y fiez pas: Deadly Premonition est un GRAND JEU, une oeuvre CULTE.

Car malgrÃ© les moyens dÃ©risoires allouÃ©s et les dÃ©boires qu'il a subit pendant son dÃ©veloppement, DP respire la passion, le dÃ©vouement et la gÃ©nÃ©rositÃ© de bout en bout du crÃ©ateur (SWERY) et son Ã©quipe envers leur oeuvre. 

Ce qui nous absorbe, malgrÃ© ses innombrables dÃ©fauts, c'est avant tout son personnage principal: l'agent spÃ©cial Francis York Morgan, agent du FBI, limite schizophrÃ¨ne, dÃ©barque dans cette petite ville "open-world" perdue de Greenvale afin de rÃ©soudre une affaire sordide de meurtres perpetrÃ©s par le Raincoat Killer, personnage Ã©nigmatique dont il faudra dÃ©couvrir l'identitÃ©.
Pour cela, vous serez Ã©paulez par des personnages tous plus Ã©tranges les uns que les autres, vous partagerez leurs vies et leurs emplois du temps afin de rÃ©soudre cette enquÃªte dans un univers qui n'est pas sans rappeler X-Files ou Twin Peaks de David Lynch dont il s'inspire grandement.

Mais DP a sa propre personnalitÃ©, son charme envoutant indescriptible, une des histoires les plus passionnantes et un des meilleurs twist de fin qu'il m'a Ã©tÃ© de suivre ces derniÃ¨res annÃ©es.

Par contre, il faudra consentir Ã  tripatouiller les fichiers du jeu si vous voulez quelque chose de visuellement un peu plus "potable" (la rÃ©solution d'une part mais aussi ce filtre et cette colorimÃ©trie dont les choix peuvent laisser perplexe) et Ã©viter certains crashes. 
Mais pas de panique, rien d'insurmontable, le premier post du forum Steam rÃ©pondra Ã  toutes vos attentes.

En esperant qu'un jour, Deadly Premonition puissent jouir un jour d'un remake aux moyens suffisamment importants pour que sa plastique attire enfin le plus grand nombre dans cette univers qui vous retournera le cerveau.

J'ai vu la lumiÃ¨re en tombant amoureux d'un boudin.

author: {'steamid': '76561198108016010', 'num_games_owned': 496, 'num_reviews': 69, 'playtime_forever': 4702, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4702, 'last_played': 1614194579}
review:
â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•
PLEASE READ THIS FIRST: Deadly Premonition's structure and tone are FIFTY-FIFTY. This is two games in one! The first half plays out like a strangely ambitious and in-depth open-world exploration game with personality ridden side quests TO lull the player in. Before it unleashes the linear, sometimes questionable sometimes crazy second half. You will feel INTENSE whiplash and maybe disappointment depending on who you are by hoping for a natural progression of the story. (I have.) This is why I urge you to split it in two to appreciate each halves strengths to the fullest. There are things to love in both halves, that I wouldn't have placed in the same game were it my decision.

It doesn't matter who you are, the tonal whiplash is there for all to behold.
â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•

Full transparency and boldness ahead. 

This is my favorite SWERY game. It is the pure definition of lightning caught in a bottle. Nothing will ever replicate the mishmash of unintentionally confusing/bizarre pseudo survival horror mystery that is this game. It's a parody to so many things with so many questions raised, which we may never get concrete answers to. 

To my knowledge Twin Peaks comparisons are surface level observations at best and a disservice at worst, as this is tonally 95% it's own thing. Even within just the first half alone. I watched Twin Peaks and I did not feel the atmospheres present in this. This just has to be experienced first hand to be properly understood. And you should probably purchase a console version because this port, fought me. Oh it fought me and did not want me to beat it. That this struggle lasted multiple years! Yes! Across multiple pcs and configurations and patches. This was hell. (But when it worked as intended...it was brilliant.) 

I also do not understand the "jank" comments people kept making. Maybe I am bias... since I trudge through the indie scene, but it honestly controlled fair and it was never not responsive. Every issue I could think of can be blamed on the porting process itself and not the design decisions made by the dev team. The gameplay choices that were made however contributed to it's quirky factor. Never detracting, always appetizing. 

I rather not make descriptions beyond this, because I want to keep this thing I wrote up people call a "review" minimal on spoilers. And to act as purposefully vague imagination fuel while at it.

[b]Game recommendation:[/b]

https://store.steampowered.com/app/1452500/The_Good_Life/

Same dev. Good for capitalizing on during a future mid-life crisis I could end up in when I need to drown my business failures in delusions of a gardening and shopping simulation.

author: {'steamid': '76561198226942440', 'num_games_owned': 83, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 1059, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 96, 'last_played': 1709562413}
review: An hilarious game, played it about 10 times on the PS3, but now I don't have that, I bought it on PC. Really random game but good story and gameplay. Personally I think its better for PC. There is one bug, but its only when you boot it up it doesn't load, but this can be fixed by going into the game folder and reinstalling DirectX. A must! Once you've enjoyed the game (and if you haven't already), make sure to watch the incredible Twin Peaks show which it is based off of.

author: {'steamid': '76561197990102973', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 3251, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3251, 'last_played': 1453144245}
review:
I know it isn't fair to judge a game for only 9 hr playtime...
But driving from forestpark to police office, picking every cards and bones
only end to crash without saving anywhere between is just painful.
All these beautiful soundtracks, almost open world discoverable and rich collection
ruined by the long distance between phones and a single crash.
And that car bug too, almost give up then.
Fast travel should be a default function, srsly.
This driving is killing me.

  Side missions are sucks and chore, crashing all the time(especially in cleared chapter), silly bugs for vehicles, aimming and all that. Deadly Premonition is destroyed by its game machanics but still, once you get over all of the annoying stuff, the main plot is awosome. 
  It's like squashing a great movie in a group of terrible actors and actresses, lame stages and poor sound tracks(except The Wood and The Goddess). Besides The DLC for Emily really ruins the whole experience.
If you can survive all this, brace youself for a GTA+RE4 feat. regression FBI agent, twisted storyline and a damsel in distress that saves herself.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006377646', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 2084, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2084, 'last_played': 1452104476}
review:
You really have to work through A LOT to get to the really good stuff. The game looks and runs like hot garbage. Framerate is atrocious, freezes and drops are extremely frequent and completely random. I had to play the game on two separate machines and swap different save files between them in order to get past certain points. Driving is the worst you've ever seen, shooting is clunky and shooting sections are tedious.

BUT - the cast of characters, story, atmosphere, and the central mystery will make you happily chew through the issues if you're into Twin Peaks and if you enjoy Lynchian, as well as general Japanese weirdness. It's almost like this game has no right to be any good, but it has so much charm and soul and it leaves you with such a heartfelt goodbye that you won't be able to anything but recommend it. Plus, it deals with some really heavy themes like child abuse, rape, transsexualism, and it can get very rough, creative or straight up shocking when it comes to violence. It really goes beyond what most games try.

The great moments in this game shine so brightly that you'll wave off the jank.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006909240', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 684, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 576, 'last_played': 1603026391}
review: Sinteticamente, il gioco di tanto in tanto crasha ma l'ultimo salvataggio che ho fatto mi impedisce di riprendere la mia partita. Non avendo alcuna voglia di ricominciarlo da capo sono costretto ad abbandonarlo, grandissima delusione. Inoltre il video iniziale Ã¨ stato trasformato utilizzando un programma free che lascia la sua firma alla fine di ogni filmato, roba da amatori che si divertono a casa nel tempo libero.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028746344', 'num_games_owned': 210, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 2111, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2111, 'last_played': 1451679095}
review:
"Mr. Francis York Morgan, you are the protagonist of the generation. So says Mr. Stewart"

To summarize Deadly Premonition, the graphics suck balls. The driving sucks balls. The combat sucks balls. The animations suck balls. In fact the entire control scheme sucks monkey balls. But underneath all this ball sucking lies an absolute gem of a game. 

The plot is great and the script is actually extremely well-written. I dare say these two factors were probably the only driving force behind my decision to see this game to the end. A higher budget and better production values might've done wonders with the game.

This game is one huge package of silliness. A lot of the time it will make you laugh but mostly you will be laughing at the game itself. Deadly Premonition is a game where you see your fortune in the morning cup of coffee. And there's an hour-long level where you're running after a dog. Did I mention that dog had its own rap theme song? 

And just when you think this game couldn't get any stranger, the final two chapters take retardedness to a whole new level. Lovely!

Deadly Premonition is not a game you recommend to anybody. But it most definitely is a game that should be played at least once.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032002142', 'num_games_owned': 403, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 1362, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1362, 'last_played': 1451477048}
review:
Yeah, this game has its share of problems. The PC port of the game is terrible, and I am glad I got to experience it on a console. It was only recently I decided to revisit the game on PC, and the amount of times it just crashes for no reason at all is just silly.

If you are a person that require decent graphics (you know, the visuals), then this game is not for you. In fact, the graphics are so poor for its time in this game that it looks more like it was released during the PS2 era, when it was in fact released during the PS3 era (I am using the PlayStation as a reference because it was on a PS3 I played this game the first time). They aren't particularly good, but if you can overlook this, then you're in for the next challenge.

The controls. Geezus. Who sat down with the driving part of this game and thought "Yeah, yeah this is perfectly acceptable."? Regardless of what platform you are playing this game on, the driving itself is way to challenging for its own good. Sure, it makes you laugh a bit the first time your car is suddenly on two wheels and spinning out of the road and into a ditch, or a house, or another car. But the fifth? Tenth? Twentyeth? Not so funny anymore.
And the combat. Ugh. It can't require that much more polishing to actually get the combat controls improved, can it? Because the most challenging part about combat are the controls, rather than the enemies. And that's not the reason you want your game to be a challenge.

But, this aside, I still enjoy this game, and I still recommend this game. Why? Because of the story and the atmosphere. It is so rare to see a game where each and every character you meet feels well thought out and unique. Where the story of the game may not be super original, yet still manages to suck you in and surprise you with its many plot twists. It was my second playthrough recently (though it had been a few years), and I was still surprised by a few of the plot twists. And that's something special. This game is special. And if you like a good story, then this is something you cannot afford to miss.

Edit November 2016: Just nominated this game for The â€œTest of Timeâ€ Award. It truly is a gem that should be experienced.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960739818', 'num_games_owned': 721, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 3136, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3136, 'last_played': 1451661111}
review:
Interesting game. Graphically, it's really poor with a horrible mixture of low and hi rez textures. Gameplay wise, it starts off awful, and has the worst driving phyiscs of any game I have ever played. And the crashes, god the crashes. This game crashes, crashes and then crashes some more. I have never had a peice of software ever crash so much as this.

And yet... something oddly compelling about it, I would just grit my teeth, restart, and continue.

Finished the game and the ending was just as odd as the beginning. Still, it was worth playing, at least once - I doubt I'll ever install and play it again though.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028197287', 'num_games_owned': 233, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 340, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 328, 'last_played': 1508307973}
review:
It's last day of year 2015 and it's still impossible to make this game work. My whole gameplay time counted by Steam is accumulated from unsuccessful launch attempts. Yes. I tried to launch this game for more than 5 hours. I tried unofficial fix, every goddamn tip, every goddamn guide. I followed every solution I could google, and boy, I reached end of internet thanks to that. At this point it would be easier for me to write this game from scratch. Happy New Year to you scrublords from Access Games and ToyBox Inc. Happy New Year to you, Hidetaka Suehiro, you hack and fraud. 
Rot in hell.

I'll not recommend this game, even nthough I love it.
Yep, that's it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010640985', 'num_games_owned': 728, 'num_reviews': 56, 'playtime_forever': 261, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 261, 'last_played': 1451665244}
review:
I played the GoG version of this game first. (So, don't be fooled by the time Steam is displaying :D)

tl;dr at the bottom

Let me say that this is one of the best games I [i]ever[/i] played.

It is hard to compare this game to any other title... it has some sort of open world, a bit of RPG, a whole lot of an adventure.... 

It starts very strange and you don't have any clue what awaits you.
But if you aren't afraid of that, you'll find yourself in a great adventure-thriller-detective-horror.... thingy.... o.O
It's really hard to describe, [i]what[/i] this game actually is. 

The game has all sorts of moments. It is sometimes very creepy, sometimes ridiculus, exciting, surprising....

I really enjoied it and played the whole game within some days.

[h1]tl;dr[/h1]

[b]Pros[/b]
[list]
[*] thrilling story
[*] great humor
[*] great characters
[*] sometimes very creepy
[*] York
[*] coffee
[/list]
[b]Cons[/b]
[list]
[*] controls needs getting used to
[*] QTEs are mean (but rare)
[/list]
11/10 Would see my future in the coffee again Â°uÂ°d

author: {'steamid': '76561198133339498', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 1293, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1293, 'last_played': 1451142527}
review:
Achja Deadly Premonition...damals nur als Let's Play gesehen und direkt zugegriffen, als ich es auf Steam sah.
Das Spiel spaltet die GemÃ¼ter aber man darf sich definitiv nicht vom ersten Eindruck abschrecken lassen.
Die Steuerung ist nicht die Beste, die Grafik ist nicht gut gelungen und trotzdem ist das Spiel ein Meisterwerk.
Die Geschichte ist spannend und mysteriÃ¶s, die einzelnen Charaktere wirken zumeist etwas merkwÃ¼rdig, haben aber alle eine passende Hintergrundgeschichte.
FÃ¼r Spieler die etwas auf Handlung und Tiefe in einem Spiel geben sehr zu empfehlen.
Spieler die nur aufs optische und sonstige OberflÃ¤chlichkeiten wert legen sollten die Finger von dem Ding lassen.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971475196', 'num_games_owned': 1270, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 1569, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1569, 'last_played': 1451453161}
review:
It pains me to not recommend this game but you can't look past the technical issues. Even if you get Durante's excellent DPFix mod it's hit and miss whether the game will actually run decently for you, if at all. After much trial and error I managed to get it running but after 30-40 mins of playtime the FPS grinds to a halt and needs a game restart to get it smooth again.

What a shame, the game deserves better.

Leider habe ich das Spiel nicht geschafft, da ich bei einer dieser Verfolgungen durch diesen HackebeilschnÃ¶sel bei einer endlos langen TastendrÃ¼ckerei irgendwie immer gestorben bin.
Ich kann so etwas halt einfach nicht, wenn man viel zu schnell immer irgendwo auf der Tastatur welche Tasten punktgenau treffen soll.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025413056', 'num_games_owned': 352, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 159, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 159, 'last_played': 1442804660}
review:
An outstanding cult classic of a game, but the worst port of any video game I have ever played. This absolutely puts Dark Souls PC to fucking shame.
On top of the anecdotal reports of freezing, I can personally attest to crashes on inital startup, poor keyboard support (a broken item storage mechanic because of it), and HORRENDOUS sub-15 FPS areas on my 2015 gaming rig.

This will not be patched - the community efforts are valliant, but futile. 
Unconditionally avoid. Watch a let's play instead.
