author: {'steamid': '76561197997661118', 'num_games_owned': 664, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1394, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1390, 'last_played': 1477758336}
review:
Deadly Premonition is a very polarizing game. Yes, the gameplay can feel like absolute shit (the driving controls still kill me even to this day) and the PC port itself is pretty catastrophic (random crashes, ahoy!), but this game has a lot of heart with a pretty thrilling story and interesting characters to boot.

Definitely recommended for those who love the following:

1) coffee
2) Twin Peaks
3) japanese wackiness
4) who just want to play something that offers something unique, despite having a lot of flaws

I don't like open-world games in general and while Deadly Premonition has a lot of OPTIONAL stuff, I recommend you to do some of those to get to know the local population of Greenvale better. You will thank me later.

author: {'steamid': '76561198158149244', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 199, 'playtime_forever': 583, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 386, 'last_played': 1451257205}
review:
I hate almost every mechanic you will find here.

Quick Time Events - Terrible in general and horribly executed here
Open World - With Mostly Empty Space is what I automatically read after I see this description and it absolutely appies here
Survival Horror - Resource managment that amounts to making sure you have enough food to last the day, the timeless and endless searching for keys to open doors, and being forced to hide from an assailiant in a locker despite the fact that you have 160 rounds in your submachine gun ready to be unloaded.

The combat is TERRIBLE and I was not suprised at all to find out it was tacked on at the last minute to try and appeal to "western gamers" at the publishers request.

To top it all the optimization is exceptionally poor and will likely require you to download some quickfixes via mods (check forums) to run.

Yet I love this game. It's strange beyond reason and the completely broken parts of the game (almost everything) somehow manage to accentuate the one thing that works with this game. The off-center, campy, almost familiar, touching, and beyond words oddball yet enchancting atmosphere.

Agent York is stranger still than the atmosphere and he's one of the most memorable characters in video games. 

This might not be for you but on discount you really need to find out if it might be.

9/10 if it is....

author: {'steamid': '76561198004435994', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1570, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1570, 'last_played': 1441879085}
review:
The game itself is great, but playing the PC port was one of the worst gaming experiences I've my life. THIS GAME IS BROKEN DO NOT BUY IT.

Right off the bat the game had problems. It would crash upon starting, and had to be trouble shooted to even work. Once I got the game working, it would periodically crash. At its worst point, I had to download a save file from someone else that was past a crash point just to continue the game.

Here are some of the fun things I did during the course of this game
-download a fan made patch to "fix" things
-Run the game in older windows compatability modes to get past crashes
-switch the game to windowed mode to get past crashes
-lower the resolution to get past crashes
-download save files that are past crash points
-dig through the game files and repair files in hopes it stops crashes
-turn off steam overlay to stop crashes
-ask on forums how to get past crashes at specific points

I couldn't even finish the game.  I someone made it all the way to the epilogue and hit another crash wall. At this point I couldn't take it anymore and just watched the ending on Youtube.

I tweeted the creator of the game, and he replied that he had nothing to do with the PC port and that its the PC development company's fault. I tweeted the development company and they told me there is nothing they can do because they don't have a development team for Deadly Premonition anymore.

It sucks because the actual game itself is great & unique. Do yourself a favor and get the Xbox 360 or PS3 version instead.

author: {'steamid': '76561198078295602', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 809, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 809, 'last_played': 1451127615}

author: {'steamid': '76561198014507805', 'num_games_owned': 1521, 'num_reviews': 84, 'playtime_forever': 2108, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2105, 'last_played': 1540330602}
review:
How much to like this game is determined by one question: How much do you like Twin Peaks?

Because if you love David Lynch's show, then you will love everything about Deadly Premontion: Memorable and abstract characters, set in a small town in Washington with gameplay that feels like it was conceived in the Resident Evil 4 era. If you like a good weird experience, you will find it with York and Zach.  

HOWEVER...!

Be warned that this is HORRIBLE PC port of an already pretty technically flawed game and it tends to crash. A lot. Your experience might be even worse than mine because I almost completed the main game, but got stuck when the last patch made it pretty much unplayable for me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198038572496', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 762, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 171, 'last_played': 1519836135}
review:
Such a strange game. Recommended if you like games that quickly change the tone from horrifying, to hilarious in just a few moments.

Top soundtrack, easily one of the more memorable ones: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rzvXBFwcyek

Atmosphere is easily the strongest point in the game, but atmosphere is a bit of a dumb word to use, since it doesn't really mean anything tangible. The game does poorly in some aspects of the game, such as graphics and the incredibly stiff controls, but the result is something that's much, much more than the sum of its parts.

author: {'steamid': '76561197986113015', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1460, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1460, 'last_played': 1449927449}
review:
De Deadly Premonition se ha escrito que es un juego tan malo que es bueno. DespuÃ©s de haber perdido demasiadas horas con Ã©l hasta llegar al final me gustarÃ­a poder decir que estoy de acuerdo, pero no. Deadly Premonition es simplemente un juego muy malo y ahora preferirÃ­a no haber perdido todo este tiempo en Ã©l.

En el juego llevas a un agente federal que llega a un pintoresco pueblo del interior de Estados Unidos poblado de extraÃ±os habitantes para investigar un asesinato ritual. Si la premisa te suena a Twin Peaks estÃ¡s completamente en lo cierto, de hecho, mÃ¡s que una inspiraciÃ³n, el autor del juego plagia una y otra vez a Lynch en el guion y la mayorÃ­a de las escenas. Lo hace con muy poco talento y el resultado final es un pastiche grotesco sin ningÃºn sentido y que se hace muy pesado. AsÃ­ que, si lo que te interesaba era la historia, no merece en absoluto la pena.

Lo que queda es aÃºn peor: las escenas de acciÃ³n, en las que te trasladas a un versiÃ³n oscura del mundo poblada de zombis, son torpes y repetitivas hasta decir basta. AdemÃ¡s de esto, la versiÃ³n para PC estÃ¡ plagada de problemas que en algunos casos no te dejan jugar, algunos los solucionarÃ¡s activando el modo de compatibilidad con algÃºn Windows antiguo, otros tendrÃ¡s que buscar en los foros de Steam hasta hallar alguna soluciÃ³n.

El juego podrÃ­a haber tenido algÃºn interÃ©s de contar con una buena historia y con mecÃ¡nicas interesantes, sin embargo nada de esto encontrarÃ¡s en Deadly Premonition.

author: {'steamid': '76561198019770041', 'num_games_owned': 3035, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 3401, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3398, 'last_played': 1449369223}
review:
This is one of the most memorable and unique videogames I've played in my life...and believe me, I've played A LOT!

It's really hard to describe what makes this experience work but it does. Is it the atmosphere? Is it the narrative? Is it the characters?

This game is a hit or miss. You either like it or not. As for me, well, I became obsessed with this game while I played it and while I didn't...so much that I went for the 100% completion.

author: {'steamid': '76561198029738466', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 4032, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 1, 'playtime_at_review': 1411, 'last_played': 1710704928}
review:
This game is the perfect mix of terrible and worse; it's the expired milk in the fridge you know is bad, but that you know you're gonna smell anyway .  It's polarizing because everything from the voice acting, to the mechanics, to the graphics are mediocre, if not downright terrible, YET, the absolutely addicting story and the kooky, surrealist overtones make this game well worth the money (pro tip: play this game with a controller or not at all; it was never meant to be a PC game).  I don't care how pretentious it sounds, most people just don't understand this game.  It's meant to be a joke on itself in a sense because of how silly and cartoony everything seems to be, but don't let that fool you.  This game has a story of unparalleled depth in terms of video games, 

If you like surrealist art, if you enjoy the Monty Python films and the Flying Circus; if you like getting wasted and listening to The Bends while watching every Wallace and Grommit movie ever made with the volume off so the claymation sheep sound like Thom Yorke, I promise you will love this game more than most members of your family.  

The reason it was never commercially successful was because it is meant for a certain kind of player who's in a certain kind of mood for 8-12 hours every so often.  This game can be fun multiple times through because the combat, while admittedly pretty clumsy mixes things up enough to keep you on your toes, and the various things you can buy and the mini-games make sure the experience doesn't become too heavy.  

To sum things up, don't buy this game if you're looking for a typical shooter or a typical survival horror game, or a typical anything.  This game is truly one of a kind, and if you can learn to appreciate is flaws, you will understand where I'm coming from.  I've never played a game this truly original in my whole 15-odd years as a gamer.  If it weren't for the original KOTOR, this would be my favorite game ever.  10/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960482199', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 62, 'playtime_forever': 1517, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1497, 'last_played': 1448897019}
review: A very flawed masterpiece. Frequent crashing and inability to play full-screen almost put me off playing through but I'm glad I did. It takes a while to get going but this is a brilliant game worthy of your time, with memorable characters, great music and a storyline straight out of Twin Peaks.

author: {'steamid': '76561198166114582', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 8, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8, 'last_played': 1448875835}
review:
It's a shame, I wanted to like this game as I enjoyed the limited time I spent with it on the PS3, but it was so laggy I found it unplayable after an hour.

 I was hoping the PC version would give me a better time because the game looks legitimately fun and unique. The result was even worse the the PS3 version. Sure framerate was more bearable but the 2002-grade graphics should not take me down to 20FPS on a rig that can run much more demanding games such as New Vegas without many issues. Other than framerate I fould an unbearable amount of stuttering, (I don't mean that the game froze, the character was acting like when you get rubberbanded in Battlefield on a bad server). 

Going to get a refund. This is a great game ruined by the atrocious performance.

author: {'steamid': '76561197975768592', 'num_games_owned': 842, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 270, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 270, 'last_played': 1449262866}
review: If you release a pc game and you don't have, at the very least, a way to rebind keys, I'm not going to be either impressed or interested in your game. This game has been released in 2013 and keys rebinding has been available since the early 1990. Make a bloody effort or don't bother, I don't want to have to fiddle with .ini files to have a decent experience in your game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198039038404', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 80, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 80, 'last_played': 1417608913}
review:
I played through this game on the Xbox 360 years ago, the play time listed for this version doesn't reflect that.  Bought this a second time on sale because it's good and I like the developers.

When Deadly Premonition released years back, it was slammed by mainstream sites such as IGN for its subpar graphics and archaic controls.  Technically these reviewers pointed out the flaws this game has as a reviewer should, but they missed the magic this game seems to have for the players that love it.

For everything this game seems to get passable or "middling", there's something that makes you smile.  Driving is boring, but the conversations York has with himself make the long trips you have to take early in the game worth it.  You also do unlock and find better weapons and even some helpful abilities that make going around town easier later in the game.

Fans of Twin Peaks will get a more out of Deadly Premonition than other players.  I'll even go so far as to say that this is a must play if you like Twin Peaks.  There are plenty of subtle and not so subtle nods to that short lived television series.  The protagonist loves his coffee.  The town this game is based in feels quite similar to Twin Peaks and has quirky, memorable characters.  

This was one of my favorite games of 2010.  If it's on sale I strongly recommend giving it a try.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045334429', 'num_games_owned': 241, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 367, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 167, 'last_played': 1565196933}
review:
Is the voice acting bad? 
Yes.
Is the gameplay bad?
Yes (for the pc port).
Are the graphics bad?
Equal to a 2006 game.
Does it have replay value?
Yes.
Is the story great?
Yes.
Will this leave lasting memories?
Yes.
Is this one of my favorite games?
Definitely.


Verdict:

Best crime/survivor/horror ever/10

(Plays like the old Resident Evils or Silent Hills)

author: {'steamid': '76561198013247861', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 1873, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1303, 'last_played': 1594968948}
review:
A superb game for people who enjoy Twin Peaks, murder mysteries and unique game design, not to mention charm, ambition, complexity and creativity that most modern games simply lack. 

The PC port has some issues, but generally runs well for me and the issues it does have can be fixed with a few forum/google searches.

It's a unique game, one that any player who enjoys great games should experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041107679', 'num_games_owned': 1240, 'num_reviews': 111, 'playtime_forever': 180, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 180, 'last_played': 1422671620}

author: {'steamid': '76561198020474979', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 182, 'playtime_forever': 23, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10, 'last_played': 1514826280}
review:
Game would not start. I would press play and it would crash. I have windows 7 and a high end computer. 
Below is what I found that worked. Anytime I have to go through this much to get it to work it will get a thumbs down. congrats Dp you get my first thumbs down on steam.


-Go to where Deadly Premonition is installed, easily accessible by right-clicking the game in your Steam library > Properties > Local Files > Browse Local Files
-Open the folder named 'redist'
-Scroll until you find the file "PhyX_SystemSoftware.msi
-Double click
-Run the 'Repair' option
-Now run Deadly Premonition via Steam as usual

Dirigir Ã© simplesmente a tarefa mais tediosa e insatisfatÃ³ria do jogo, e olha que ele exige que vocÃª dirija bastante. NÃ£o existe fast travel, nÃ£o existe seta indicando o caminho, e boa sorte tentando verificar um mapa que nÃ£o te permite dar zoom out o bastante pra ver vocÃª e seu objetivo na mesma tela. Se vocÃª decidir fazer as vÃ¡rias sidequests - Ãºnica forma de conhecer melhor os vÃ¡rios personagens absurdos da cidade - vai precisar ter paciÃªncia. NÃ£o basta tudo isso acima, os carros tambÃ©m tem gasolina e podem estragar se vocÃª bater muito. Ah, e seu personagem nÃ£o comete crimes, entÃ£o vocÃª nÃ£o pode ultrapassar o limite de velocidade. Seu personagem tambÃ©m sente fome e sono, e vocÃª precisa colecionar comida em um inventÃ¡rio limitado, e arranjar um lugar pra dormir quando estiver cansado. Se ficar muito tempo com a mesma roupa, vocÃª vai ficar sujo, feder, e moscas comeÃ§arÃ£o a circular em sua volta. NÃ£o faÃ§a a barba todo dia, e ela vai crescer, coisa inaceitÃ¡vel para um agente do FBI. 
Ainda assim, a grande maioria dessas coisas Ã© opcional. Se vocÃª sÃ³ fizer a main quest, raramente vai jogar tempo o bastante entre um capÃ­tulo e outro pra precisar comer ou dormir (mas ainda precisa fazer a barba), e sÃ³ vai precisar se preocupar com sua muniÃ§Ã£o e que armas carregar. Nem itens de cura precisa se preocupar muito, pois somente lÃ¡ pelos Ãºltimos capÃ­tulos a dificuldade do jogo vai ser boa o bastante pra te fazer perder vida.
O que me leva a outro tÃ³pico: combate. Pra um jogo bobo de investigaÃ§Ã£o em uma cidade pequena, a ideia de combate parece ser difÃ­cil de encaixar, certo? Ã‰ aÃ­ que entra o conceito mais bizarro do jogo. Seus inimigos sÃ£o uma espÃ©cie de apariÃ§Ãµes zumbis de pessoas que parecem ter saÃ­do de uma vila do sÃ©culo XVIII, que variam entre o ficar parados esperando que vocÃª as mate, e se teleportar do outro lado do cenÃ¡rio para a sua frente para te dar um susto. Alguns carregam armas, mas a animaÃ§Ã£o de ataque leva quase 10 segundos, tempo mais que o suficiente pra vocÃª atacar. As poucas vezes que fui pego por um dos inimigos sem armas, confesso que foram assustadoras, porque o ataque deles Ã© perturbador. Mas foram duas ou trÃªs vezes. A questÃ£o Ã©: onde esses inimigos se encaixam na histÃ³ria?
Em lugar nenhum.
Ã‰ bastante explÃ­cito que os combates do jogo, tirando aqueles com bosses, se passam todos dentro da cabeÃ§a do personagem, e sÃ³ estÃ£o lÃ¡ pra acrescentar aÃ§Ã£o no jogo. Isso ao mesmo tempo Ã© terrÃ­vel e brilhante, e nÃ£o faria sentido em nenhum outro jogo. TambÃ©m nÃ£o faz sentido nenhum nesse, mas acho que nesse caso isso Ã© um ponto positivo.
O grÃ¡fico Ã©, em quase todos os aspectos, atroz. A animaÃ§Ã£o de expressÃ£o facial Ã© cruelmente mais assustadora que todos os monstros juntos. O sorriso do personagem principal pode te dar pesadelos. DÃ¡ pra baixar o DPfix e mexer no arquivo .ini pra melhorar sombras e outros efeitos. Eu altamente recomendo, nÃ£o sÃ³ pela melhoria grÃ¡fica, mas tambÃ©m pelo prÃ³ximo ponto.
O jogo Ã© bugado. NÃ£o estou falando de bugs dentro do prÃ³prio jogo, nÃ£o encontrei nenhum. Estou falando de crash e travamentos constantes. Meu save dentro do jogo tem 4 horas a menos do que a Steam diz que eu joguei, porque o restante foram horas perdidas pra crash to desktop. De longe, esse Ã© o Ãºnico verdadeiro defeito do jogo.
Pera, como assim?
PoisÃ©. Porque Ã© o Ãºnico defeito que realmente incomoda. Todos os outros, e eu nÃ£o estou sendo fanboy aqui, eu posso tranquilamente dizer que sÃ£o "charme". GrÃ¡ficos ruins? Combinam. Gameplay ruim? Combina. DiÃ¡logos sem sentido? Combinam. Praticamente todos os defeitos que fariam de qualquer jogo uma completa perda de tempo fazem deste uma experiÃªncia Ãºnica. Eu amei odiar uma missÃ£o onde eu tinha que pescar minha prÃ³xima pista porque meu personagem viu isso numa xÃ­cara de cafÃ©, e se eu conseguia ou nÃ£o a pista dependia quase exclusivamente de sorte. A falha me levava a uns bons minutos tendo de rever a animaÃ§Ã£o do detetive se sentindo desapontado e entÃ£o tentando pescar novamente. E eu sentia raiva e vontade de rir ao mesmo tempo.
Resumindo: pra compensar seus defeitos mais lamentÃ¡veis, esse jogo me proporcionou momentos verdadeiramente Ã©picos, e o que eu posso considerar um substituto virtual pro final de Twin Peaks. Isso por si sÃ³ jÃ¡ Ã© impagÃ¡vel.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025584089', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 60, 'playtime_forever': 348, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 348, 'last_played': 1447707372}
review:
I was interested in this game because it has many fans and was supposedly good. What I expected is a detective game with paranormal twist, like Murdered: Soul Suspect. Long story short, it is not even close and fails in almost every aspect. Usually I leae positive reviews, but this game is really poor.

The gameplay is really boring, almost every part of it feels like a filler, leaving nothing interesting or captivating in the end. The game consists of several 'activities':

1) Zombie shooter. It's very consolish (no wonder here), you walk around, shoot zombies in the head, collect weapons they sometimes drop and other items like coffee (any item is highlighted by bubbles visible a mile away). In certain rooms you can access your toolbox (an extra inventory, very gamey), save, sleep or change your suit (what for??? it's completely pointless).

2) QTE sequences. They are brutal. You have less than a second to press a needed button, and there are several in a row. How about mash A and D - Q - R - mouse left click - E? The only way to succed is to die several times before you learn the entire sequence beforehand.

3) Roaming around the town to get some quests that should earn you better weapons or some other stuff. Thankfully its optional because this is one of the most boring things I've ever saw in a game - bland town, bland streets, bland graphics. It's like a very poor attempt of a GTA clone. Another filler to extend the gameplay time IMHO. A side quest I completed consisted of finding a sports equipment lost in a police station for a police boss... fascinating!!! :)

4) Watch long cutscenes with conversations. They are really weird. All characters lines, models and animations are so bland I couldn't believe it. You get a cop which is like a dumbest cops from all police movies combined. You get a police chick obviously interested in protagonist. You get a farmer which is ye olde standard farmer, salt of the earth. There are two kawai small boys who are like angels. And there is a main protagonist - yep, he is FBI agent with paranormal abilities! This is so new, wow, how could they invented that???! The entire game is like they took a standard B movie characters from 100 poorest movies of all time and made them even simpler than they were. It's hard to explain, but the entire story and characters feels like a caricature.

So a typical story mission consists of speaking with your police buddies (with long pauses and poor animations), driving a car for 10 minutes through incredibly bland looking landscape, watching another conversation where you act like a cop from B movie (or maybe Z movie?) and your buddies act like actors from 4th grade school theatre, then going in alone (of course), navigating a dozen rooms shooting zombies and collecting pointless stuff, then facing a boss and dying multiple times in a row before you learn that QTE sequence (good dog!). After that, if you are lucky and the game didn't crash (happens with a fix as well sometimes) you watch another conversation and the day thankfully ends.

Incredibly bad and unfitting music adds the fun.

This is it. If there is a brilliant story, it is hidden too well under all this filler. I would think I don't like this game because I don't like Japanese games overall (they are too weird for me), but I enjoyed Murdered: Soul Suspect which is also a console Japanese game. This one is simply a poor game with no detective gameplay. Heck, there is hardly any gameplay at all.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044057988', 'num_games_owned': 1939, 'num_reviews': 81, 'playtime_forever': 160, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 160, 'last_played': 1447642672}
review:
1 hour into the game, will update the review as I go on/finish the game. So far so good. Exceptionally good soundtrack I must note. Can't say much about the story yet, other than it starts off intriguing. Main character animations are cringe-worthy. The game obviously lacks the AAA (or AA) shine, and sometimes feels very amateurish, as far as gameplay goes. In a B-movie kind of way. Other than that the game looks promising so far, honestly.

True state of the allegedly insufferably horrible port quality - it's definitely not good, but I don't think it's something overly serious or gamebreaking. Game lacks [u]any[/u] kind of video settings (not even a resolution), controls are a bit clunky (until you get used to them) and are very obviously designed for consoles and feel kind of forced on PC. Other than that it runs fine so far, no crashes, no compatibility issues, no FPS drops, steady 60FPS here on a mid-range laptop (850M, i7-4710HQ, 8GB RAM, Win 10 64-bit). Meh, maybe I just got lucky.

Once I realized and accepted that this is no AAA game, it's pretty good so far. Looking forward for finishing it. Probably not worth its full price though.

author: {'steamid': '76561197989179135', 'num_games_owned': 785, 'num_reviews': 161, 'playtime_forever': 468, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 406, 'last_played': 1687117182}
review:
nope, dont buy it til they fix the crashing issues, and fix the fact that this game is a pain in the a** to get working in the first place.

booting the game you get an endless intro loop. gotta do a bunch of stuff to get it to work. during the endless loop you cant skip, you cant get to the main menu. you can only close the game. the loop just plays over and over and over.

if you get passed the intro loop..... the start of the game runs fine, but once you get into town and out of the first building, NOTHING BUT CRASHES!

very irritating. drive around crash, walk around, crash, get in car, crash, get out of car, crash....start up game and just barely start, crash.

this needs a patch.

a great game though, but unplayable. the crashes are random and often.

dont buy this til they patch it which doesn't seem likely.

author: {'steamid': '76561198029213470', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 2318, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2205, 'last_played': 1476485227}
review:
Deadly Premonition es uno de esos juegos que o lo amas, o lo odias. No hay tÃ©rmino medio.

Si te dejas llevar por los grÃ¡ficos, acabarÃ¡s decepcionado puesto que dejan mucho que desear, tanto los modelos de los personajes y enemigos como del resto de elementos que nos encontramos a lo largo de la aventura . Cierto que es un juego de 2010, pero por aquella Ã©poca el aspecto grÃ¡fico era igual de flojo que ahora, sÃ³lo que algunas texturas y modelos actuales son en HD. Aunque a pesar de todo esto, hay algunas zonas del pueblo realmente maravillosas.
La optimizaciÃ³n a PC es casi inexistente. No hay opciones grÃ¡ficas, estÃ¡ capado a 720p y hay crasheos durante toda la aventura, por lo que siempre es bueno guardar la partida siempre que se pueda. Sin embargo existen guÃ­as para optimizar el rendimiento, mejorar algunas texturas o la resoluciÃ³n de pantalla.

Sobre la jugabilidad decir que es otro de los puntos negativos del juego. Realmente es frustrante hasta que te acostumbras. Su sistema de apuntado es simple ya que nuestro personaje no sabe moverse y disparar al mismo tiempo. El control de York es tosco y la conducciÃ³n de vehÃ­culos roza lo absurdo.

En cuanto al sonido tengo sentimientos encontrados. Por un lado el sonido de los vehÃ­culos es horrible, los lamentos de los enemigos dan mÃ¡s risa que miedo y algunos efectos sonoros burdos y fuera del lugar donde nos encontramos. Aunque otros efectos naturales como la tormenta o el curso del rÃ­o rozan a buen nivel. 
Por otro lado la B.S.O es maravillosa, destacar el tema principal "The Woods and the Goddess". Y aunque algunos temas se repiten, siguen bien el hilo de la historia con sus momentos de tensiÃ³n o alegrÃ­a.

Y llegamos a lo mÃ¡s destacable del juego. Su historia es la principal razÃ³n por la que recomiendo el juego. Simplemente derrocha genialidad por todos lados, con giros argumentales, diÃ¡logos tronchantes, otros mÃ¡s serios y que te atrapa de principio a fin. 
Destacar tambiÃ©n el trabajo de los actores de doblaje, que hacen una labor espectacular, sobre todo con Francis York Morgan, quizÃ¡s uno de los mejores "personajes principales" que te puedes encontrar.
MenciÃ³n especial a las referencias sobre Twin Peaks, Resident Evil, Silent Hill, etc y los guiÃ±os sobre cine y cultura pop que comparte con su "compaÃ±ero" cuÃ¡ndo viaja en coche, realmente geniales.

La duraciÃ³n de la historia principal es mÃ¡s que aceptable, aÃ±adiendo la cantidad de misiones secundarias, cromos, trajes, coches, minijuegos, armas..

AsÃ­ que, ya sea porque te gusta que te cuenten una buena historia, o te consideres fan de los "Survival Horror" con ciertos toques de humor y eres capaz de pasar por alto sus (grandes) defectos, este es tu juego.

author: {'steamid': '76561198145394240', 'num_games_owned': 165, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 2368, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2368, 'last_played': 1421710686}
review:
One of the most enjoyable games i've every played. A little clunkly, but the whole thing is written with a lot of heart which is something you don't see enough of.  Technically a horror game i guess, but overall has a really nice laid-back atmosphere which isn't something you might expect from this sorta game. Comparisons to Twin Peaks and Resident Evil are inevitable, but it has a real unique flavor of its own which is where the game really shines.

(plus this game seems to go on sale often for just a few dollars so it's a great cheap buy if want to wait)

author: {'steamid': '76561197993716344', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1995, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1739, 'last_played': 1445088747}
review:
[b]This game is truly one-of-a-kind and one of the few games I would encourage everyone to play.[/b]

I will get this out of the way first - this game is a horrible PC port. It can require a lot of messing around to even get it to run, and if you want it to run higher than 720p then you will have to install mods to achieve that. I would personally experience drops in frame-rate followed by the game crashing approximately every 2 hours on my setup but your problems may vary! (The directorâ€™s cut does have some pro's compared to the original even though it is a bad port - the controls are improved and the combat is easier - in a good way)

It's a testament to the compelling nature and uniqueness of this game that I would gladly put up with such an experience.

You play as FBI Agent Francis York Morgan who is called to a remote town called Greenvale to investigate a murder of a young woman - and it doesn't take long to become clear that there is something very strange indeed going on. The game has been compared a lot to the TV Show 'Twin Peaks' and it is a clear influence - for anyone unfamiliar with the show, it combines mystery with quirky characters and absurd happenings and this game is no different.

It is full of weird, clichÃ© (in comedic fashion) and intriguing people - everyone has their own odd quips and interactions that make the game interesting and fun. It can be confusing at first as you try to decide if the game you are playing and the dialogue you are hearing is serious or not - but soon you will lose yourself in the combination of mystery and absurdity and want to experience all that Greenvale has to offer.

The game is all about the experience and storyline - you will drive around town and engage in combat throughout much of the game - neither of them are anything special. They are both very archaic and along with the graphics are not what you would expect in a relatively modern game. For my experience though I never had any particular [i]problem[/i] with either of them, they are just not what make the game enjoyable. However, although the driving itself isn't great, there is something very pleasureable about travelling around the town and engaging in your day to day tasks like going to lunch with your police colleagues or going to a bar in the evenings to play darts and talk with the townsfolk.

It is the mad characters, the crazy music, the twists, the absurd and even genuinely touching moments that shine in this game and keep you coming back. I have never really ever experienced a game quite like it and (although I would love one) I will perhaps not play another like it again.

A very unique game - one with plenty of flaws but also so much to love. I would recommend all people with an interest in story-driven games to try it out.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014228462', 'num_games_owned': 376, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 1655, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1655, 'last_played': 1446494910}
review:
Deadly Premonition is a one of a kind game. I've never seen anything anything like it and I probably never will again. It's unique in many aspects, but the most important ones are: setting and pacing.

It's set in Greenvale, a fictional small town in USA, which has become the scene of a brutal, ritual murder. The player controls an FBI agent sent to carry out the investigation. There are many similarities to Twin Peaks as the game generally tried to capture the "feel" of that TV show and referenced it many times. This is why I consider this game unique - you're not shooting up gangs, terrorists or whatever, you're slowly getting to know inhabitants of Greenvale and drive from one place to other talking to people and trying to make sense of the case. While the game has quite a few action sequences, they're not what's most important, in fact they are very easy and poorly done.

What's bad about this game? A LOT. While it's an open world "detective" game, it's very linear and doesn't have many opportunities for the player to show off his cleverness. The controls for both the character and cars are clunky. The game generally, from player animations, to map design, lacks polish. The PC port is atrocious, probably the worst I've ever seen. Graphics are PS2 tier, don't even try to play without DPfix and SweetFX. The game regularly crashes, always loads slowly, doesn't allow alt-tabbing in fullscreen mode, has broken sound on non-stereo audio configurations, etc etc...

Deadly Premonition is completely broken, there's no point in listing all its technical flaws, because there are just too many of them, Yet I'm still recommending it. Why? Because it's one of those "love it or hate it" kind of games. I don't even know why I loved it, but when it crashed on me, I always just restarted it and kept playing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198072105823', 'num_games_owned': 345, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 1648, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1583, 'last_played': 1446652653}
review:
This game is a confusing one. Through its many flaws, terrible vehicle controls, Bad Port, awful and stagnant level design and PS2 graphics, I really love this game. Its dark humor fantastic and sometimes hilarious soundtrack and its over the top ridiculousness make it amazingly addictive. I had no trouble in playing this for 2-3 hours straight, Except for the Driving control,it's making me crazy,just a little turn and the vehicle twist around lol but i'll get used to it. It has its moments of absolute brilliance for instance the opening sequence will astound you in how well it is put together.  The dialogue is incredibly silly but it adds to the overall experience. Imagine every silly and funny line in every video game ever and condense it down into one pot, That's what deadly premonition is. It will leave you thinking 'was this all a joke or were they serious when they made this?' If it was a joke they are geniuses, if they are serious they are geniuses. To sum up, one of the most special video-gaming experiences of the year.  I got carried away by the story of this game.
Don't forget to drink a coffee to see the today fortune...

author: {'steamid': '76561197980633237', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 69, 'playtime_forever': 360, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 360, 'last_played': 1420406594}
review:
Even with numerous fixes and unofficial patches it still crashes very frequently, leaving you frustrated over the fact that the previous checkpoint was 30 minutes ago.

If you are willing to suffer through that, you're probably going to like the game, which is quite original.

author: {'steamid': '76561198054173206', 'num_games_owned': 442, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 860, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 743, 'last_played': 1506457275}

author: {'steamid': '76561198018021388', 'num_games_owned': 350, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 3358, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2290, 'last_played': 1580607470}
review:
You play as FBI agent Fancis York Morgan, a delusional man that gets crime clues from his coffee, and talks to his "imaginary" friend Zach, more than he talks to real people, in front of real people. He's sent to Twin Peaks (can't remember the name of the town, and its twin peaks anyways) to investigate a murder case that seems relate to a killer he's been investigating for some time.

The game is a collision of genres and elements that tries to be so many things at the same times, but really doesnt have the budget or technical prowess to truly be the game it could be...That being said, I enjoyed this game a lot, from its strange characters, that by the end make York look like a normal guy, to the sandbox exploration elements in a nearly lifeless massive town that brings to the table, for no good reason, like everything else in this game, and still works. 

This game is a...Sandbox Survival Horror Simulator Adventure Third Person Shooter Fishing Exploration Game with day and night cycles where all characters have their daily routine...What the hell did I just say? And the game totally half asses most of those genres.

A technical disaster that manages to be one of the most unique, funny, weird and all around insane games, Isn't that right, Zach?

I Love it

author: {'steamid': '76561197972833520', 'num_games_owned': 896, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 49, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 49, 'last_played': 1424270148}
review:
I stopped playing after reaching a very annoying QT event. I'm used to those kinds of events, but I really had a hard time timing it here, like it wouldn't always respond. The story up to that point did not seem interesting at all, neither did the main character.

All in all, in just about 1-2 hours, all my interest in the game had faded and replaced with boredom and frustration. If you have played and enjoyed it before, it's probably a must have. Otherwise, I can't recommend it, but it might get better beyond the point I reached, the game just didn't give me any reason to keep trying but plenty to stop.

author: {'steamid': '76561198140671443', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 2076, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2076, 'last_played': 1427124252}
review: I finished the game but the final cutscenes were so unwatchable due to the fact they were each seperate pieces which took more than an hour to load. I had to just close the game and watch the ending on youtube. Wont bother with all the extra stuff because it's such a pain going through any loading screen. I am aware this is the main complaint for the PC version of this game but I didn't expect it to be as troublesome as it was...Yolo

author: {'steamid': '76561197970422637', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 887, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 514, 'last_played': 1547424251}
review: Despite having no right to be, this is one of my favourite games. It's utterly bizarre but I love it to bits. Please play it. It's a weird gem with some utterly horrible gameplay but it is somehow special.

author: {'steamid': '76561197991353371', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 435, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 300, 'last_played': 1446912137}
review:
Game is very very... well  it is INSANELY buggy. You will spend a lot of time fixing it. BUT intro will pay you off. Soundtrack is marvelous. 

Read sticked thread in community hub to find fixes and mods improving resolution and framerate. Now I got 60fps all time.

It is worth to buy it even only for this soundtrack.

About plot:

You are working for FBI and they pay you salary. And they also pay you extra for eating, shaving etc.
They paid me 14 $ extra for shaving my face. 
I spend most time drinking in bar, flirting with cute Sheriff deputy, talking with my imaginary friend drinking coffee in hotel, sleeping, driving car like maniac (I already crashed my Ford Mustang) and smoking 20 cigarettes per hour.

Ah I almost forgot, there is some serial killer in town and some zombies.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006181223', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 223, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 223, 'last_played': 1441780936}
review: Just do yourself a favor and watch an LP of the game if it interests you, even after trying out DSFix the game crashes at the start of a cutscene in the hospital, making progress impossible. I only paid 3 dollars for the game and I still feel cheated.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972526661', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 1605, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1605, 'last_played': 1587681600}
review: The game is fun, but very buggy!  I was able to finish it by restarting my PC every time it crashed and it would crash probably once an hour or so.  There are a variety of crash bugs.  Sometimes the textures get all wonky on the map view and it crashes.  Sometimes it crashes when loading.  Sometimes it crashes when it tries to play a movie.  So the moral is only play if you are willing to restart your PC a lot and save your game as much as possible.  I would recommend checking out the DPFix unofficial patch to make the port a bit smoother, but unfortunately it won't solve the crashing bugs.

author: {'steamid': '76561198064284846', 'num_games_owned': 414, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 1653, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1494, 'last_played': 1462337161}
review:
Want to play a game with quirky, rememberable characters?
With a crazy mystery that never seems to stop twisting?
How about plots that take a second playthrough to REALLY get?
Hours of roaming time?
Countless collectables?
More Collectables?
Did I mention too many Collectables?
Is there such a thing as "too many" collectables?
Do you like commentary on 80's horror movies?
Do you often have suspicions than NPCs are up to no good, but are often unfonded? 
Would you like to reveal the dark secrets of those "innocent" NPCs through tons of side-quests?
Even if it ruins their otherwise perfect marriages and lives?
And finally ...
Are you willing to put up with the games wonky combat controls to enjoy an otherwise great story and game?
Then this, my friends, is the game for you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009598254', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 338, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 224, 'last_played': 1429357657}
review: Despite what the hours say, I have finished this game, twice. And my god, this game may be the one to rule them all. Shoddy PC port aside, Deadly Premonition is an experience that all should witness and admire. You may think I'm crazy for liking this game, and if I am, so be it. The world would be better off if more people were this crazy.

Bad controls including mouse lag and other stupid things.

author: {'steamid': '76561198088625739', 'num_games_owned': 205, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 460, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 269, 'last_played': 1513980977}
review: Amazing game, but probably the worst PC port ever. You're lucky if you can even get it to run. Save yourself the bother and just buy it on a console instead.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992340940', 'num_games_owned': 1807, 'num_reviews': 94, 'playtime_forever': 2589, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2277, 'last_played': 1445795513}
review:
I love this game. I've waited a long time to play, and had my prejudices, but I was quickly drawn into the story, it kept me interested all the way to the end. The graphics are sub-par, but that can be partially amended with a tool called dpfix. Acting and writing are hilarious at some points, I have to admit this game isn't really scary - but it delivers a few scares in the combat sections. 

Overall, I had a very pleasant experience, I played the game with a walkthrough as I didn't want to miss useful items (or get them too late in the game). Maybe due to that the game hasn't been too difficult, but I don't see that as an issue - it was a very pleasant ride. Side quests are optional, and they do add a bit of game time, but, as mentioned, some yield quite useful items.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992436529', 'num_games_owned': 735, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 284, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8, 'last_played': 1448970492}
review: I have nothing but complete adoration for this game. It gives off a hilariously off putting first impression, but when you put time into it the game gives you an incredibly enjoyable experience. My only regret is that I played it on the PS3 version with the Move controller so you can guess how well that went.

author: {'steamid': '76561198038551862', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 2555, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1690, 'last_played': 1678885623}
review: Some things are like trainwrecks, with a million small  errors coming together to form a cluster of failure. Deadly Premonition is not like that however; with this game a million errors create something great. Goofy and bizarre, but with a lot of heart, this game probably has something everyone can laugh at.

author: {'steamid': '76561197988820418', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 1059, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1047, 'last_played': 1446989009}
review:
GrundsÃ¤tzlich ist Deadly Premonition ein Spiel, das die GemÃ¼ter spalten wird. Zum einen bietet das Spiel veraltete Grafik und veraltetes Gameplay. Auf der anderen Seite empfindet man fast Ã¼berall die Liebe der Entwickler zu Filmen, TV Serien (wie die fÃ¼r das Spiel prÃ¤gende Serie "Twin Peaks") und Games. Auch die Story strotz nur so von Kuriosem ala Twin Peaks. 

Was das Spiel jedoch zu nicht macht, ist das wohl schlimmste Ãœbel, welches kÃ¼rzlich auch schon Warner Bros. passiert: eine schluderhafte PC Konvertierung! Freezes in der Haupthandlung, HÃ¤nger bei Zwischensequenzen, AbstÃ¼rze und und und.... Und das obwohl das Spiel fÃ¼r die XBox exklusiv anfangs programmiert wurde !

Die Facebook Seite postet immer wieder Merchandise Artikel von DP, warum nehmt ihr nicht die ErlÃ¶se und macht mal einen groÃŸen Patch ? Eine Frechheit, da das Spiel generell ja noch zwischen 20 - 30 Euro kostet und nicht mal Steam einen Hinweis darauf gibt ! Schlussendlich hÃ¤nge ich jetzt im 3. Kapitel fest, schade !

author: {'steamid': '76561197985969658', 'num_games_owned': 999, 'num_reviews': 685, 'playtime_forever': 731, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 631, 'last_played': 1445575095}
review:
2.5/10

What an utter waste of time. After having dealt with constant crashes, stuttering, framerate issues, restarting my computer, etc, I'm finally done. This game wasn't worth the dollar I paid for it. And it seems EVERYONE is having the same problems. How they can call this game released as a "director's cut" where they fix things, but its actually more unplayable than the original. Also, its been out over 2 years and nothing has been done to fix it by the devs. There are workarounds but I shouldn't have to start installing and deleting files on my brand new high end comp to run this turd. And what all for? The animations are stiff and terrible, graphics suck, the pace is super slow, the characters are weird and unrealistic, the story is mildly interesting but 2/3 of it doesn't make sense. The combat, controls, and UI are terrible. Limited controller support. Map sucks. Long boring forced driving sections with terrible controls. Positives are waiting the 20 hours for the story to finally finish, which who cares. Avoid it and thank me later.

author: {'steamid': '76561197961825286', 'num_games_owned': 1826, 'num_reviews': 75, 'playtime_forever': 296, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 173, 'last_played': 1525994237}
review:
This game seems so promising. I mean, it's based on Twin Peaks, and amazing TV show, that still to this day is relevant, and enjoyable. Unfortunately, there are so many bugs, crashes, and errors that this game is hard to recommend. Hard, because I WANT to recommend it, but when a game is as faulty as this one, I simply cannot endorse it.

These Japanese developers cannot hide behind the quality of their games anymore, when offered on consoles. They need to put forth the effort to make them playable on PCs as well, something they seem reluctant to do. It's unfortunate, because I love a lot of the games Japan offers, but I cannot in good conscience stand behind something that is so obviously  flawed in the PC market.

Even the much maligned Konami(boy is that a change given how much they were loved through the 80s and 90s) offers ports that are better performing than much of the Japanese games in the PC games market. It's really unfortunate, since I don't think PCs are beyond Japan's understanding. They seem to be people with a great understanding of electronics, yet play by the rules of consoles, and not the openended way of PCs. I hate to break it to Japan, but choice is a way of life, and rigidity enforced by consoles is simply a way of the past. The PS4 and XBone are proving that. They came out recently, and yet are far behind the PC market. People who want more power, and are willing to put in the work to access that, will always be far ahead of the console market. Many developers recognize that, and make games catering to the PC market. Even guys like Totalbiscuit will recognise that in the beginning of his reviews, highlighting what the options portion of the game allow a player to customize.
The old ways of the console have become antiquated. The personal computer, while being around since the 80s, if not farther back than that, offers more choice and customization, and the offerings of hardware allow multiple different price points of entry. That is the way of the future, rather than a one size fits all console offering.

Most of the world has accepted this. Japan would do well to join the trend. Now I realize I am singling out this developer, who may have felt backed into a corner, with consoles the best chance of success. However, I realize that in today's times, 2015, consoles are NOT your best choice, regardless of the market. You adapt, or fall behind.

author: {'steamid': '76561198062969105', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 1991, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 808, 'last_played': 1460913810}
review:
Trying to open a door : game crash.
Trying to drive my car : game crash.
Trying to talk to people : game crash.
Trying to launch the game : game crash.
Trying to crash the game : game crash.
Not doing anything at all : game crash.

10/10

Would crash again.
And again.
And again.

author: {'steamid': '76561197963934876', 'num_games_owned': 816, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1242, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1242, 'last_played': 1444980296}
review:
Getting pass a few bugs here and there with the game sometimes crashing after a "cutscene", the game runs fine. 
Graphics aren't the greatest but the story line is where this game really shines. Did not expect the game to last over 10 hours as I did do a few sidequests. The gameplay is pretty generic with a bit of quick time action buttons and inventory management of sorts resident evil style.
For achievement hunters, most of the achievements will be from doing the side quests or looking for items scattered around the map so expect to spend over 30 or more hours if you plan on getting 100% in the game. There will be a lot of driving around and there is no GPS guidance other than a huge arrow pointing main quest location, so you will need to use the map occassionally to find yourself around to the next point. 
Got the game for free during a bundle promotion, but I would say the game is worth it at a discounted price of atleast 50%. Rating the game 7.1/10 mainly due to the story line being so good, but driving to each point is a hassel.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000694041', 'num_games_owned': 58, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 3370, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 727, 'last_played': 1473387707}
review: I had a wired xbox 360 controller and low expectations. I enjoyed a few hours playing as Agent York. I even learned how to drive the police car. But, unfortunately, not even dpfix can prevent frequent crashing and I've decided this game is not worth playing on my PC.

author: {'steamid': '76561198059003170', 'num_games_owned': 201, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1497, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1418, 'last_played': 1430114529}
review: El juego es un sufrimiento de bugs tras bugs y controles horribles. Hasta donde lo jugue: la historia, los personajes y la manera de contar enganchan pero eso de avanzar un poco, que se cuelgue el juego y volver a empezar como que tienes que tener bastante paciencia. No lo recomiendo, mientras que no saquen un super parche que solucione por lo menos los crash bugs (puedo aguantarme los graficos y controles malos, pero eso de que el juego se cierre no).

author: {'steamid': '76561198121520825', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 3890, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2752, 'last_played': 1655950964}
review:
Oh yeah, Deadly Premonition. There is so much you can say about this game.
First of all: Yes... yes I know the graphics may not be so gentle to the eye sometimes and yes it might be a little glitchy here and there, but to be honest, I dont really pay much attention to that.
I would describe DP as a rare species. Why you ask?

Graphic:
Eventhough the graphic may not be so 21st century and wont kill any big product such as action movie-game 
Resident Evil 6 (which is very bad in its own way), it just wont take that long to get used to it. You only really see that problem during forest scenes when the grass textures are flickering a little. But despite that, come on guys, is graphic really that great? Look at Call of Duty. Great HD graphic, but always the same crap in it. Shoot shoot shoot.

Glitches:
To be honest, the only real glitches I have noticed were spinning cars or my tie running through my body lol. 
The tie get unstuck fast thought and it only happened once. That thing with the car, well, it does weird things sometimes, for example spinning around itself for a splitt second and... yeah. Hehe but these gliches are not game breaking or frustrating, in fact they are really funny to watch and add up to the games humor a little, even if unintentionally. Sometimes they can even work for you.

Gameplay:
Having the two issues out of the way, we only have the major reasons to buy the game left. The gameplay is easy to understand and a ot of fun. Like in Resident Evil 4, you play York in a third person (over-the-shoulder) perspective, when aiming with the weapon you have you have to aim yourself or use the auto aim. Killing ghosties in this game is super fun due to the awesome atmosphere, the creepy enemies, the huge variety of weapons and the amzingly high amount of side quests like investigating old abandoned haunted places. Good thing is, I dont even spoil you things becuase there is so much to do and see in this game that I only scratched the surface. So to sum it all up:

-Easy handling (except for the cars)
-Very atmospheric
-Big town to explore freely
-A lot of side quests
-Very fun battle system
-A lot of very funny and extremly awesome weapons
-A lot of stuff to unlock
-Very well made creepy creatures

Sound:
The music in this game is amazing! Yes it maybe repeat itself a little to often, but hey, its always very fitting and it never gets old hearing these tunes. Especially during action sequences it can really bring you onto your toes, and while exploring something creepy or eary it will please you with a very ambient and... more eary track. To be honest here, it doesnt happen that often that music really melts into the game, at least not in my opinion.

Story:
And now we got to the cherry on top of this very strange cake that is Deadly Premonition.
If you are like me and graphic isnt everything, then you came to the right place. Remember when I said this game is a rare species? Well it surely is. I never saw a game that is a mixture of many things. 
Resident Evil 4, Silent Hill and even a little bit of GTA is in there. Its funny and cheesy, its creepy and serious.
You have to eat and sleep to survive, you earn money, you can do this and that and wow...
But... NOTHING can be compared to the story. This real, at the beginning seemingly slowly starting story, will turn into a big and complicated, and at the end really mindblowing masterpiece! The combination with the music, the way the story tells itself, the whole atmoshpere the world builds around the character Francise York Morgan, the dark and creepy environments and an ending that stays stuck in your throat even days after. Not in a bad but more in a bittersweet way. Heck even if I would try to explain the ending here I couldnt even do it justice, neither would you understand it.
Long story short, the story is one of a kind and frankly said, I never ever witnessed a story like this before... just amazing!

So yeah, if you love very good stories and gameplay such as the good old Silent Hill or Resident Evil games,
you are not so interested in graphics and you dont mind the slightly cheesy dialogues sometimes, you should really give it a try. If the price is too high for you wait for the next sale but, still, people dont really give the game as much credit as it deserves. Out of all the games out there these days, this one is a hidden gem and should at least be played once.
I promise you wont regret it. I already played it on the XBox 360 two years ago and downloaded it again as directors cut a few days ago, and it still give me the chills when I hear the story. It also extended story wise, which makes it even more awesome! 

Sometimes great things come in little packages, keep that in mind.
Deadly Premonition will forever be one of my all time favourites. 

-Blitzz

author: {'steamid': '76561198098558050', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1468, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1453, 'last_played': 1594696782}
review:
This is one of the greatest games that I have ever played. It will definitely stay within my top 5 games for a long, long time. I plan to at least do a second and third playthrough, if not more.

Before buying, there are 2 things that you must know:
 1. This is the very definition of a cult classic. If you find yourself only enjoying huge budget AAA games and never really straying into anything else, then perhaps this is not the game for you. This game must be played with an open mind, as it is very unique. Also, it is worth mentioning that the game really doesn't pick up until an hour or so into it. 

2. The PC port is not very good. I would only recommend buying it if you have intermediate computer skills, as you are going to have to edit a few files as well as apply a user-made patch, DPfix. 

The story: Simply put, it's amazing. You play as Francis York Morgan, an FBI agent sent to the small town of Greenvale to investigate the murder of a local teenager. The story quickly picks up from here and sucks you in. I wish that I could be less vague about the story, but I risk ruining the game's 20+ hour run. This is the kind of story that keeps you wanting to play the game to see what happens next. It takes many sharp turns and streches across several different genres, including, but by far not limited to: horror, mystery, survival, comedy, and even some romance. I consider myself to be good at predicting storylines in games and movies, but even I could not predict hardly any of this game. It truly kept me interested until the very end. Speaking of the end, you may just shed a tear. 

Characters: The characters in this game are incredibly varied and all have distinct personalities. I will certainly not ever forget any of them. The voice acting is great and really helps to bring the characters to life. 

Gameplay: The driving is pretty awful but far from the worst I've ever played. The pause menu map only shows your immediate surroundings and cannot zoom out, rendering it useless. You'll have to pay close attention and learn the town if you want to get around. While this map issue was mildly annoying, it made the game a little more challenging. The rest of the gameplay is good, but nothing new or super polished. I would recommend using a controller, as the keyboard and mouse control for this game just feels clunky. The game is open world and each character has a routine that they do. This is important to remember, as they may not always be home for you to ask questions. There are some points in the game in which you must wait a certain amount of in-game time before moving on to the next portion of the story. This gives you time to explore all that there is to do in Greenvale, including a ton of side missions and collectible items.

Soundtrack: The soundtrack in this game is great, and very memorable. I love the acoustic guitar song that plays at the main menu and at various points in the game. Each track suits the level that it was designed for, and nothing seems out of place. The only complaint I have is that the music volume levels occasionally overpower dialogue in cutscenes. 

Other thoughts: The game crashed to the desktop about a dozen times during my playthrough. The crashes all occured at set points in the game's story, so they are not random. There are some suggestions to remedy this with a quick search online though. I had luck passing these crashes by setting the game's launcher and .exe to Windows 98/ME mode and running as administrator. I am using an AMD gpu with the latest drivers (15.7.1 at time of writing) and Windows 7 64 bit. 

Bottom line: If you don't mind the possibility of some technical issues and you are a fan of survival-horror/mystery games, by all means, buy this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996065388', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1511, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1490, 'last_played': 1511722856}
review:
The curious case of Deadly Premonition.

Rare are the instances when a game comes along that is so horrible, yet so intriguing that you simply can not help but love it.

First, a word of warning. This port is, to be frank, atrocious. I experienced a dozen crashes or more, three during the end credits alone. Furthermore, you need to use fixes to change the in-game resolution. The graphics lie somewhere between badly aged and horrible. And finally, the game mechanics are often stiff, walking on the border between being boring or laughable. Using a gamepad is recommended.

But with that said, what is offered if you fight past these issues is in my opinion nothing short of amazing. A quirky, twin peaks-esque world full of strange characters, weird happenings and charming dialogue, and a story that more often than not is wonderfully over the top.

This is not a game you should play for the gameplay or the visuals - its all about the experience of visiting the small town of Greenvale and its residents. 

Seeing this story through is nothing I regret
Despite it being in perhaps the worst port yet
To Greenvale I think you should travel
So that this mystery, you can attempt to unravel

So says Mr. Stewart...

review:
Ja,der Mythos lebt.nach einem Eintrag im Guiness Buch der Rekorde als das schlechteste Survival Horror Spiel und einer Community die sich gegenseitig die KÃ¶pfe einhaut wie schlecht dieses Spiel nun wirklich ist,spielte ich es auf der PS3 und nun nochmal auf dem PC.

Und ja,das Spiel ist technisch alles andere als gut programmiert.Abgehackte Animationen wohin man schaut,gegner die mit ihrem schlechten geheule mehr Angst auslÃ¶sen als mit ihren Angriffen,ein Aiming,direkt aus der HÃ¶lle.Die hauptbewegung des protagonisten wenn dieser seine Marke zieht,als wollte er diese seinen GesprÃ¤chspartnern dick um die ohren knallen.Es gibt tausende von GrÃ¼nden dieses Spiel wirklich mies zu finden.Problem an der Sache:Genau das sollte man nicht.Jeder sollte diesem Spiel eine Chance geben.

man merkt das der Entwickler mit einem sehr kleinen team etwas BestÃ¤ndiges aufbauen wollte.Abseits der Technik ist die Geschichte um den regenmantelkiller nÃ¤mlich durchaus interessant,spannend geschrieben und wird genau so erzÃ¤hlt.Die Charaktere welche man im Laufe der Story trifft bringen Charakter mit.Jeder hat seine eigene PersÃ¶nlichkeit und als Spieler beginnt man nach kÃ¼rzester Zeit trotz der macken des Spiel Sympathien fÃ¼r den einen oder anderen zu entwickeln.Man mÃ¶chte wissen wie es weiter geht,wer eventuell wo mit drin hÃ¤ngt und gerade dieser Charme der tollen Figuren,der teils komischen Dialoge,gepaart mit einer trotzdem ernst zu nehmenden Handlung geben diesem Spiel seinen ganz eigenen Charakter.und das schaffen heute nicht mehr viele Spiele,trotz Budgets von mehreren Millionen Dollar.gerade da man dieses Spiel online oftmals fÃ¼r gerade mal einen Euro bekommt sollte man definitiv mal reinschauen!

author: {'steamid': '76561198054460924', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 3000, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2780, 'last_played': 1443704512}
review:
It's a weird game. Play it only if you have the patience to absorb the bugs and a bad port. Aiming weapons is really limited. Driving is atrocious. I have an issue with side quests available during a particular weather. That doesn't make sense. But availability of side quests at certain timings in a day is realistic.
But the game has a good story, keeps you guessing on who the killer is. All the characters are well written and there are many of them. Huge attention to detail.

author: {'steamid': '76561198120057861', 'num_games_owned': 507, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 367, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 346, 'last_played': 1570808814}
review:
Mi sono approcciato a questo gioco con tutte le buone intenzioni ma non Ã¨ riuscito a prendermi.
Tecnicamente, il titolo pecca da tutte le parti: i comandi sono terrificanti, level design per niente curato, innumerevoli bug e glich (grafici e sonori), animazioni brutte e un sistema di guida penoso...
Per non parlare delle musiche, sono poche e, spesso, sono fuori contesto.
Questo, gioco Ã¨, a mio parere, troppo dispersivo: prima di iniziare una missione saremo costretti ad aspettare tanto, TANTO, tempo, il che non sarebbe un problema se dormiamo in uno dei piÃ¹ punti in cui possiamo riposare, la rogna Ã¨ che la mappa non Ã¨ piccola (Ã¨ ingigantita dal fatto di essere, per la maggio parte, VUOTA, oltre ai pochi quartieri che, comunque, sembrano inabitati, oltre a qualche automobile, non c'Ã¨ anima viva) e i letti sono lontani tra loro, quindi inizia il nostro interminabile viaggio in auto molto frustrante.

Onestamente non so se collocare questo gioco nella categoria investigativa o horror, mettiamo le cose in chiaro: sono una persona che si impressiona facilmente, ma qusto gioco non Ã¨ riuscito a trasmettermi ansia o paranoia.
I nemici di questo gioco, probabilmente ispirati da Silent-Hill, sono davvero troppo facili da uccidere, in 6 ore di gioco non sono mai, MAI, stato toccato da uno di quei cosi; le armi, tranne la pistola, sono inutili perchÃ© grazie a quest'ultima saremo in grado di cavarcela alla grande, tanto le munizioni sono anche illimitate...
Evidenti le ispirazioni a Resident Evil come la cassa degli oggetti presente nei primi 3 capitoli di quest'ultima saga oppure i movimenti del protagonista.

Infine, credo non valga la pena l'acquisto del gioco, oltre ad essere un PESSIMO porting, crasha di continuo ed Ã¨ troppo dispersivo e a tratti noioso.

author: {'steamid': '76561198119390591', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 184, 'playtime_forever': 2614, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2604, 'last_played': 1443126731}
review:
[h1] Deadly Premonition: The Director's Cut [/h1]
[i] I can not recommend this to any person. The game has a very ugly graphics, nightmarish control vehicles and map interface is very weak but in my opinion the game makes up with a great story. About the game itself I must say that I played very nicely. The game takes on the character of the young FBI agent who comes to a small town in America to explain the mysterious murders. The game offers us an open world but it is boring and the tour it is very tiring. The advantage may be some side missions. Some of them are interesting and usually after finish it we get cards or quite useful stuff, weapons, suits or new cars. Soundtrack is good but sometimes goes weird music and i mean (using a Emilys car). The game has a very interesting but sometimes strange characters but for me another big advantage. Interface in the game you can get used to but this map is total fail. I personally love this game for amazing story and great characters and that joined to my favorit list. Yeah i know taht this game have a shitty graphic and truly speaking to everyone most of the stuff in this game is poorly done and it have a lot of bugs.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041850484', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 795, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 614, 'last_played': 1610141379}
review: Un jeu dont l'univers est original et marquant, avec une intelligente touche d'autodÃ©rision ; le seul jeu qui m'ait donnÃ©, par moments, de revivre les sensations que la sÃ©rie Twin Peaks avaient pu me procurer. Cette originalitÃ© fait oublier et pardonner la technique surannÃ©e de la rÃ©alisation digne d'une PS2 (sans avoir rien contre cette console qui avait ses chefs d'oeuvres) : ce jeu manque terriblement de rythme et on ne peut pas s'empÃªcher de s'imaginer ce qu'il aurait donnÃ© s'il avait Ã©tÃ© dÃ©veloppÃ© par un studio mieux douÃ©.

author: {'steamid': '76561198071115161', 'num_games_owned': 823, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 1395, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1369, 'last_played': 1442157584}
review: Even with crashing during important cutscenes, crashing during gameplay, crashing when opening doors, and an altered color palette, it's still Deadly Premonition at it's core, and when you reach that core, with that sweet, sweet, beautiful nectar of Deadly Premonition, you will love it. Right before crashing and doing it again. So says Mr. Stewart.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046101628', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1728, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1533, 'last_played': 1443549608}
review:
I love this game. I well and truly love it, it's a beautiful train wreck of a game where you either love it or utterly despise it. I seem to have fallen in love with it from the first time i played it back on my 360, then to the second time on PS3, now looking to do the hat trick by fully completing it once again on PC!

But For the love of GOD as much as i want to i can't! As much as i want to play my favourite game i can't due to the simply shocking port of it on PC. Constantly crashing, unreliable at almost every turn, and most recently when i hit act 1 Chapter 6 and saved outside the Greenvale Community Centre, my save file will not load at all. It shows the loading screen then tabs me out the game saying "Dp.exe has stopped responding"

So i warn you all now, fans of this game it is fantastic and the thought of playing it once again is exciting. But it's an utterly appaling port. Hence why it saddens me to downreview this just for that.

author: {'steamid': '76561197962064956', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 2985, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2865, 'last_played': 1442681012}
review:
For all its flaws, most of them coming from its engine, Deadly Premonition does a lot of things right. There is an extreme care for details (at the expense of others) that makes for an unique experience.
An impressive amount of work has been put into each of the characters. They have their routines, and what they have to tell you will change based on where and when you encounter them. Additionally, each of the game's side quests is an occasion to know more about those who live in Greenvale.
As a result, the world feels alive and inhabited, more than the vast majority of the open worlds I played, and I played a lot of them.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994046655', 'num_games_owned': 415, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 2176, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1237, 'last_played': 1568084817}
review:
Twin Peaks - The video game, if your a fan of the 1989-1992 TV series Twin Peaks, u will LOVE THIS GAME
the story, the characters, the fact that u can wait around town and catch unsuspecting citizens doing strange things, also therte is no other open world survival horror games like this, it truely is one of a kind...

NOW, the problem.... getting this thing to run, the devs really left the work to us, u MUST download a mod to get the game up to 1080p, but once u get this game running smooth, it really is the best way to experience the game, the 360 and ps3 versions each have their strengths and faults, but neither are a good experience, finally being able to ewnjoy this game at 1080p 60fps, and it is really a one-of-a-kind experience

PC:specs: mayber this will help anyone with a similar rig
Intel i7 3770K (overclocked to 4.5ghz) 16 gb RAM
GPU : R9 280x (overclocked to 1100mhz) [also known as Radeon HD 7900 series]
SSD: Samsung 500gb EVO
Operating system : Windows 8.1

Game options: DPfix (1080P run in a window)
compatability options : DEFAULT!!!!
the game will not run through the launcher, however the launcher itself runs to change input/controller settings.
run the game by clicking the dp.exe directly

EVERY system is different to get this game to run perfectly, but i hope this helps.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007444517', 'num_games_owned': 194, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 3928, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3837, 'last_played': 1438645024}
review:
[h1]Zack, Â¡tienes que ver esto![/h1]

Deadly Premonition es un juego raro. 

Primero lo feo: 

	El juego estÃ¡ repleto de errores  -incluyendo uno que puede imposibilitar completar el juego-, los cuadros por segundo son inestables, pasan de 57 a 43 a 18 luego a 60, la jugabilidad es extraÃ±a, especialmente la conducciÃ³n de los autos, los cuales a veces, en altas velocidades saltan y pueden hasta atravesar los objetos, y si no se le tienen parches, tiende a caerse cuando le place al juego, los efectos de sonido a veces se sienten de mala calidad.

	Dicho todo esto, Deadly Premonition es un grandioso juego  si puedes dejar pasar, o arreglar, todo lo anterior, la historia es basada en Twin Peaks, tiene muchas semejanzas con la serie misma, es interesante y con buena concordancia. Quitando todo lo feo que tiene, que se puede volver algo pasable a medida que uno juega, el juego es adictivo, los personajes son memorables, la ciudad tiene vida propia, los habitantes tienen una rutina para cada momento del dÃ­a, y varios pequeÃ±os detalles que son simplemente geniales. Lo recomiendo mucho, pero mÃ¡s por la historia, que por la jugabilidad.

Parches para mejorar el rendimiento y grÃ¡ficos:
[list]

author: {'steamid': '76561198016654400', 'num_games_owned': 506, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 539, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 539, 'last_played': 1440789028}
review:
When you've been playing the game for about 10 minutes and you're glad it hasn't crashed yet - that's not a good sign. I've played this game for about 4 hours, and I've spent another 4 hours to try to get this game to work. When I finally did get the game to run better (that is not crashing every 10 minutes but every 20 minutes instead), my save file became corrupted and I can't advance in the storyline. And I'm not the only one with these problems. 

It's a shame though, because the game itself is really really really good. The game hasn't been updated for years, so don't expect it to become any better.

Do not buy this game at any price. Do not even accept it for free. If you're really interested in this game you're better off buying the Xbox 360 version or watching a let's play on Youtube. Because this is one of the worst PC ports on Steam.
