author: {'steamid': '76561198032040911', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 2242, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1880, 'last_played': 1442778057}
review:
I'll start with the cons:

- Bugs and crashes galore, be prepared to deal with issues, more so if you're going to use Durante's Dp Fix mod (which is essential).  A great place to start is the pinned "Techinical Support Topic" in the forums if you decide to start playing this game (which is worth it, despite how this critique starts).  This is an issue that I wouldn't blame people for being really upset about but if you have the patience it'll work out fine.  

- No in-game graphic settings, no AA, no resolution settings (defaults to 1280x720)... zip, nadda, nothing.  Unless you use the afore mentionned Dp fix where Durante the modder added the ability to tune various settings in the mods .ini file. 

- Graphics are hit or miss, some areas in the game will leave you scratching your head wondering if the textures were vomited into the game as oppossed to programed. 

Sort of in the middle:

- Some Controls/gameplay:  There is controller support (I use an Xbox 360 wired controller without issue, thankfully...), haven't tried the keyboard and mouse controls.  Control is serviceable, I can vouch that the default settings are actually better than the xbox 360 version of the game, you can react a little faster and aim better with this control scheme. 

- Driving! Oh my...  Picture driving a giant heavy brick with wheels that are smaller bricks.  It's almost hilarious, it's a universe where turning down the street can only be done in small calculated increments. Miss a turn in one the games side races and then marvel at the excrutiatingly slow reverse function complete with the back up sounds of a forklift and the engine power of a small lawn mower. 

Finally the pros!

- The story is fascinating, the characters are eccentric and a joy to interact with. The main character is absolutely fantastic!!  He's funny, smart and a bit smarmy, it's a lot of fun to watch him rattle the towns folk.  The voice acting is pretty good as far as I'm concerned and each character exudes uniqueness, personality or eccentricity.  There are some pretty laugh out loud moments too!  Also helps that I'm a Twin Peaks fan as the game makes no bones about taking direct influence from that material.  
 
- Albeit the graphics are a bit dated, there are areas that have really good art style: like the interiours; the diner looks really cool and each house you can enter has  distinct personality and depth. 

- It's an open world, you are given plenty of time between points in the main story line to explore the town.  Nice details peppered all over the place and collectables to grab.  Lots of side quests that aren't too taxing and also some that add some extra context to the main mystery at hand.   Every interactable character seems to have differenct routines, so you won't always find characters in the same place.  For example: you can observe from the windows on the outside of some homes that have characters in them, one time I observed Emily the police officer, it was about 10pm game time, wearing a blue dress (which I've never seen her wear) and casually enjoying her living room or the time I peeked in on the Ingrams around dinner time, the whole family was there.  The twins appeared to be interacting with themselves while watching tv.  Mrs. Ingram was making dinner in the kitchen and then Keith walked in through the front door (I was there because I decided to follow him from the milk barn, not creeping, observing!!!), he went to the fridge grabbed a beer and sat next to the twins (how's the peeping Tommy... how's the peeping). I thought it was kind of neat because there was effort to make the world feel like it was living around you.  

- Some really tense moments in the game, especially the moments where it turns into screen on screen, your characters perspective and the killers perspective.  Those parts are amazing!

I originally played and finished the game on the xbox 360 and now  i've been compelled to play it again, this time the  directors cut on the p.c.  It's a budget game but get past some of the foibles and  you have a very unique and memorable game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198028080098', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 6038, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5890, 'last_played': 1442932317}
review:
[b]AnÃ¡lisis patrocinado por Sr. Sugus de PiÃ±a (Pulmonarro)[/b]

Deadly Premonition: The Director's Cut, juego del estudio japonÃ©s [b]Access Games,[/b] publicado en Abril de 2013 para PS3 en formato fÃ­sico y para PC en formato digital pudiendo adquirirse mediante Steam y GOG.com, el montaje del director es una versiÃ³n exclusiva de Europa y Estados Unidos e incluye mejoras a nivel grÃ¡fico y de jugabilidad asÃ­ como nuevo contenido como escenarios adicionales y un final alternativo entre otros.

[b]Dato curioso:[/b] En japÃ³n el juego es conocido como "Red Seeds Profile".

[h1][b]HISTORIA[/b][/h1]
Fancis York Morgan, un agente especial del FBI es enviado a Greenvale, un pueblo ficticio del Estado de Washington, para investigar el asesinato de Anna Graham, antes de su llegada al pueblo York sufre un accidente de coche provocado por la apariciÃ³n de un hombre con impermeable rojo en la carretera, viÃ©ndose obligado a dirigirse al pueblo a pie, momento en el cual descubrirÃ¡ que algo extraÃ±o ocurre en este pueblo; a partir de aquÃ­, empieza un largo periplo para averiguar la verdad que se esconde tras el asesinato de Anna Graham y la historia del pueblo,York contarÃ¡ con la inestimable ayuda del Sheriff George Woodman y los ayudantes Emily Wyatt y Thomas MacLaine, Â¿serÃ¡ capaz York de descubrir la verdad con la ayuda de su alter ego Zach?

[h1][b]DESARROLLO[/b][/h1]
[b]Deadly Premonition: Director's Cut[/b] es una experiencia jugable sin igual gracias a la mezcla de gÃ©neros que alberga en su interior, principalmente es un juego de mundo abierto (sandbox) en el que los momentos de acciÃ³n son desarrollados al estilo de los survival horror clÃ¡sicos, todo ello con dosis de thriller de terror, manteniendo una narrativa excepcional que mantiene al jugador expectante ante el desarrollo de la historia, algo que a su vez se complementa con la interacciÃ³n con los distintos habitantes del pueblo, cada uno con su personalidad bien definida y papel que desempeÃ±ar en la historia narrada.

A continuaciÃ³n profundizarÃ© en su vertiente sandbox, como buen juego de mundo abierto, la libertad de movimiento e interacciÃ³n es total pudiendo recorrer el mapeado que conforma el pueblo y sus alrededores al completo, ya sea a pie o en coche, hay gran variedad de coches que podremos manejar durante la aventura, cada uno con sus caracterÃ­sticas, y aunque el control no es el mejor, la mejor forma de disfrutar de estos momentos es desde la vista en primera persona, tanto por el recorrido como por la conducciÃ³n y por supuesto, habrÃ¡ que estar pendientes de la cantidad de gasolina que nos queda en el depÃ³sito para no quedarnos tirados en medio de la nada.

Podremos interactuar con los distintos habitantes del pueblo, ya sea simplemente hablando con ellos para recavar informaciÃ³n para el caso, cumplir una misiÃ³n secundaria (50 en total) o abastecernos de objetos, nuevos coches y armas o simplemente comer y beber; aunque las misiones secundarias no son obligatorias y no influyen directamente en la historia principal, si desvelarÃ¡n informaciÃ³n y detalles sobre ciertos habitantes que complementan la historia principal, asÃ­ como poder conseguir ciertas armas y objetos que nos serÃ¡n de gran utilidad durante la aventura. 

La climatologÃ­a es fundamental asÃ­ como el horario, ya que depende de estos dos factores la rutina diaria de los habitantes del pueblo, por ejemplo para poder realizar algunas misiones secundarias serÃ¡ necesario acudir a un determinado lugar con una climatologÃ­a y a una hora determinada, por otro lado, las distintas tiendas y el restaurante tienen un horario propio, lo que ayuda a transmitir el dÃ­a a dÃ­a de sus habitantes cuyas conversaciones y actos van cambiando segÃºn se desarrollan los acontecimientos de la historia principal.

York tendrÃ¡ que vigilar su hambre y cansancio, lo que harÃ¡ que el jugador se preocupe por visitar regularmente tiendas y el restaurante para abastecerse de comida y/o dormir para evitar que York caiga rendido, a su vez entra en juego el ritmo cardÃ­aco de York, el cual va aumentando mientras que corre o usa el turbo del coche que conduce, si llega al lÃ­mite deberÃ¡ usar un estabilizador para devolver su ritmo cardÃ­aco a la normalidad; el tener que estar pendiente del estado de salud, hambre y cansancio de York otorga al jugador mayor sensaciÃ³n de inmersiÃ³n en la historia e interacciÃ³n con el protagonista.

[h1][b]COMBATE[/b][/h1]
A continuaciÃ³n profundizarÃ© en la vertiente de acciÃ³n/survival horror del juego, en los momentos de acciÃ³n, en los que seremos trasladados al "Otro Mundo", nos enfrentaremos con seres conocidos como las sombras que son personas muertas controladas por "...", no pueden ver a los humanos pero si escuchar su respiraciÃ³n, hay dos tipos de estas, desarmadas, que nos atacarÃ¡n directamente intentando cogernos o armadas con armas de combate cuerpo a cuerpo o de fuego asÃ­ como su variante mÃ¡s peligrosa y letal que surge de los conductos de ventilaciÃ³n y se desplaza por el techo y paredes; si nos encontramos de 00:00 a 06:00 en las calles/alrededores del pueblo, el "Otro Mundo" harÃ¡ presencia y las sombras, bandadas de pÃ¡jaros y perros salvajes gigantes camparÃ¡n a sus anchas.

En ciertas ocasiones tendremos que hacer frente al "asesino del impermeable", ya sea evitÃ¡ndole al pulsar un botÃ³n determinado en eventos "QTE" o huir de Ã©l a toda carrera e incluso escondernos en taquillas manteniendo la respiraciÃ³n, momentos en los que se nos mostrarÃ¡  la visiÃ³n de York y la del propio asesino del impermeable.

En cuanto al armamento, tendremos gran variedad de armas de combate cuerpo a cuerpo y de fuego, cada una con sus propias caracterÃ­sticas, como son alcance, daÃ±o, durabilidad, velocidad de ataque y municiÃ³n, las encontraremos en los distintos escenarios, al derrotar enemigos o al comprarlas en la armerÃ­a; menciÃ³n especial merecen las que obtenemos al completar misiones secundarias, ya que son indestructibles o de municiÃ³n infinita.

[h1][b]MOTOR GRÃFICO / DISEÃ‘O ARTÃSTICO[/b][/h1]
Access Games se decantÃ³ por el uso del motor [b]PhysX[/b] de Nvidia, el port para PC sufre de popping en el paisaje lejano asÃ­ como de crasheos aleatorios, estÃ¡ capado a 720p en cuanto a resoluciÃ³n y apenas ofrece opciones grÃ¡ficas que configurar, asÃ­ como una paleta de colores bastante "frÃ­a", prÃ¡cticamente todo se puede solucionar empleando entre 5 y 10 minutos usando esta guÃ­a:

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=218647912

En cuanto al diseÃ±o artÃ­stico, algo desfasado cuando saliÃ³ la versiÃ³n original en 2010 pero aÃºn asÃ­, los personajes estÃ¡n muy detallados y la belleza de ciertos parajes del pueblo es excepcional, menciÃ³n especial merecen las habitaciones "roja y blanca". Los enemigos aunque no son muchos, si cuentan con varios modelos de sombras, igualmente bien detallados.

[h1][b]BANDA SONORA / SONIDOS FX[/b][/h1]
La B.S.O. del juego es excepcional, hay 3 Ã³ 4 temas que se repiten bastante a lo largo del juego, pero encaja perfectamente en cada momento, mientras pesquÃ©is silbarÃ©is, cada coche tiene su propia melodÃ­a, los momentos de acciÃ³n y trÃ¡gicos son acompaÃ±ados tambiÃ©n por melodÃ­as increÃ­bles, todo obra de [b]Riyou Kinugasa, Takuya Kobayashi e Hiromi Mizutani,[/b] podÃ©is adquirirla en Steam como DLC.

El doblaje aunque en inglÃ©s es de muy buena factura, en cuanto a los FX, cumplen su funciÃ³n, sin mÃ¡s.

[h1][b]COLECCIONABLES / EXTRAS / REJUGABILIDAD[/b][/h1]
50 misiones secundarias, 65 cromos que conseguir, armas de durabilidad y municiÃ³n infinitas, poder pescar distintos objetos en distintas localizaciones del pueblo, varios coches y trajes que conseguir y 60 horas de diversiÃ³n.

[h1][b]VALORACIÃ“N FINAL[/b][/h1]
Deadly Premonition DC se ha convertido en un juego de culto por su historia, ambientaciÃ³n, carisma de los personajes y mezcla de gÃ©neros, Â¡Â¡hazte con Ã©l YAAA!! 

[h1][b]NOTA: 9 sobre 10[/b][/h1]

author: {'steamid': '76561198008119266', 'num_games_owned': 1671, 'num_reviews': 116, 'playtime_forever': 437, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 412, 'last_played': 1503776585}
review:
This port is absolutely miserable, and frankly I could have lived without ever getting to experience Deadly Premonition if it also meant never having to experience a port this bad.

I don't think whatever good there is to the game, and there's a lot to recommend, is worth tearing your hair out getting it to work. Even after getting it to run at its best, I experienced myriad problems. One in particular is that, without wishing to spoil, there are moments when the game will pull a sort of picture-in-picture thing where you're seeing the main game camera, and a second camera from another character, and for whatever reason my computer found this the most difficult to manage, and I have a pretty decent rig. I do not have any explanation for why this is so. Garry's Mod has no issues with a similar set-up. Split-screen multiplayer games in general on my PC manage this with no problems. Why, then, does this game have an issue with it? It's a pretty important effect as far as the gameplay goes, why would they code it so poorly?

Rising Star ought to be ashamed of themselves for allowing this to make it to retail, and they should be even more ashamed that they have still yet to make any effort to fix it. Absolutely shameful.

author: {'steamid': '76561198047658367', 'num_games_owned': 1734, 'num_reviews': 165, 'playtime_forever': 1708, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1678, 'last_played': 1441588547}
review:
I spent a few hours trying to get the game to work.
It's crashed dozens of times.
The graphics are awful.
The port is basically a mess.

But despite it all this is one of the best games I've ever played. The story is great, the characters are quite interesting and the silly quirks will just make you laugh till your sides hurt. 

If you like a good story and enjoy well written characters then you won't want to put this cult classic down for a second. Don't forget to use DPFix!

author: {'steamid': '76561198034837285', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 327, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 327, 'last_played': 1441759321}
review: I love this game, but this is a ridiculously horrible port for PC.  Crashes render the game unplayable and there are no simple, or heck, even hard fixes that deal with the issues.  Unskippable Intros and Cutscenes make crashes even further infuriating.  I could not use a controller due to the buttons defaulting to unusual key bindings and not all of the buttons can be altered.  The start button was on the Right Trigger.  I doubt we'll see patches that deal with these problems as well.  I recommend buying it on a console, or watching someone on the internet play it for you, and save yourself the annoyance.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025461832', 'num_games_owned': 728, 'num_reviews': 198, 'playtime_forever': 294, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 180, 'last_played': 1645187618}
review:
Ya iba a sabiendas de que era un juego bastante horrendo en la parte tÃ©cnica: controles desfasados, crashes al escritorio, ralentizaciones que se arreglan reiniciando el ordenador (Â¿?)... pero esperaba que despuÃ©s de 3 horas de juego la historia me enganchase, pero de momento es bastante simplona y tarda muchÃ­simo en desarrollarse.

Tiene pinta de que es un juego que solo pueden disfrutar los que encuentren los guiÃ±os y referencias a Twin Peaks. El gameplay es monÃ³tono y aburrido, tÃ©cnicamente es un desastre, aunque he de reconocer que las cutscenes estÃ¡n muy curradas para el presupuesto que debiÃ³ tener el juego.

No es un juego injusto o frustrante, pero es rematadamente lento y la historia no ha conseguido engancharme durante el tiempo que lo he jugado.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030337217', 'num_games_owned': 584, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 1537, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1507, 'last_played': 1496032632}
review:
A solid game with some of the best characters in any game i've ever played and an amazing, gripping, hilarious, and interesting story that will suck you in and wash away the PS2-tier mistakes the game has.

It's one of my favourite games of all time, get it on xbox360 or ps3 though, the PC Port is quite terrible and will test your patience. 

It's like a really good, cheesy movie in the shell of a mediocre game. It's hard to explain, you really need to play it. Do not pay full price for it on PC though.

author: {'steamid': '76561198147621661', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 366, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 366, 'last_played': 1439754084}
review:
Can't recommend a game that doesn't work now, can I? 

I have 6 hours played, with about half of that actually being played and saved. It crashed every 60 seconds, to 5 mins. I spent almost 4 hours trying to fix this game with all the resources available online to no avail. 

I wish the devs, would have patched this before releasing it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198190380543', 'num_games_owned': 613, 'num_reviews': 602, 'playtime_forever': 2801, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2532, 'last_played': 1490940727}
review: Well, this game have both very positive and very negative reviews, with the positive praising it's narrative and the negative it's gameplay. They're both right, but in the end, i think that the game falls into the negative side for a couple of reasons: bad PC port with outdated graphics, fixed resolution and no settings; poor and repetitive sounds; poor shooting mechanics; bad map design, because while it's a small town everything it's spaced out; bugs and glitches; and for me the game crashed about 5-6 times. But beside the crashes, the game is completely playable, and i can recommend it for cheap because of: gripping story; interesting NPC's; you can relax, do 50 side-quests or replay chapters; nice soundtrack; plenty of achievements, has trading cards, and full gamepad support (no cloud though). It's a really weird and low budged game, but if you can overlook it's many faults, you may enjoy it if you get it on sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198050833345', 'num_games_owned': 455, 'num_reviews': 146, 'playtime_forever': 775, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12, 'last_played': 1452609056}

author: {'steamid': '76561198063766227', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 1257, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 608, 'last_played': 1440708862}
review:
It is a great game, the story is great, the characters and the soundtrack are amazing.
But it doesn't work properly. I spent two hours fix the dp.exe doesn't work problem. It crashes multiple times I have to repeat tedious activities like driving, the controls are complicated (press space, focus with right mouse than shoot with left) I always f**** up the quicktime events, because there too fast. no I am stuck at the diner and nobody can help me to fix my problem.
 if you are in the same situation like me and you have no playstation or xbox...watch a Let's play or ask a friend if you can play it on her/his console but don't buy this game, really it will spare you a lot of frustration.

author: {'steamid': '76561198024983274', 'num_games_owned': 2639, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 310, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 128, 'last_played': 1538172952}
review:
The time played (2h), is the time i spent trying to launch the game, and I am yet to see the menu.

I read the reviews before buying, and everyone complaining about how broken this is, and i mistakenly thought to myself that it was overblown by the community.

Lesson learnt, it is unplayable on my rig.
i did every fix on the faqs, and official troubleshootting guide, compatibility mode, fan-made patch, physX....
and the game crashes as soon as it launches

at least i got it on a bundle, so not a lot is lost, but this game at 24.99e is a ripoff in it's current state, in a win10 up to date environment, as of August 2015

update: it starts in win10 with latest nvidia and physx drivers as of date of this edit
still plenty of bugs, and 30 seconds black screens
i understand by the amount of reviews, that it is a really good game, but the current state of this port is unbearable, so i killed the process in about 15 minutes of broken "gameplay"

author: {'steamid': '76561198007197876', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 66, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 66, 'last_played': 1424028123}
review: I have purchased Deadly Premonition on every platform it has been released. The game's director Swery is the perfect kind of crazy, and he's a really sweet guy, and you should all support his work. His games aren't perfect, but they're beautiful windows into his soul. This world we live in does not deserve Swery, and he is a gift. Buy this game and D4, please.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970519782', 'num_games_owned': 168, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 28, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 28, 'last_played': 1440789836}
review:
Cons:
Obviously an awful port of a console game to PC.
Terrible keyboard control.
Sections of menu are unnavigable (options constantly scroll as if DOWN key is depressed).
Terrible graphics/visuals.
Trope: Game opens with murdered, naked woman.
Trope: Creepy twin children.
Trope: Awful voice acting and awful dialogue.

Pros:
* Something vaguely like Twin Peaks in the theme (at least of the first 10 minutes). That's a far as I could stomach the cons above before quitting and uninstalling.
* Game only cost $0.05 in my humble bundle purchase (all other funds went to other games in bundle).

author: {'steamid': '76561197974021377', 'num_games_owned': 1264, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 6, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6, 'last_played': 1440760843}
review: An unplayable port of a great game. Unplayable within the first 5 seconds of starting due to ridiculous framerates. Did not even get as far as the crashes. Community patches do nothing. I really wish I could play this game because I know for a fact that it's really good. I paid a dollar and I still feel cheated. Do yourself a favor and avoid this version like the plague. If you pay full price for this I can only pity you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007716642', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 410, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 163, 'last_played': 1467827031}

author: {'steamid': '76561198037780098', 'num_games_owned': 2100, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 46, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 46, 'last_played': 1440716236}
review:
Unplayable,I spent more time researching fixes for the constant crashing.It may be a good game and it is one I have had on my "to play" list for quiet some time now.I literally can't tell you waht combat is like as I crash prior to that.I have tried all fixes to no resolve.Finally I just gave up and uninstalled it.

Give it a miss or pick it up on console (never thought I would have ever heard myself say that).I really wish |Valve would clamp down on games like this as it's not my first time being left with a lemon due to what is possibly one of the worst pc ports (not forgetting Arkham Knight but at least that you can play for more than 15 minutes at a time)...

This game and many like it should be removed from the store, forcing the developers to realease a functioning product.I'm a huge fan of games like this and it pains me to review it in such a negative manner.

My specs are fine i7 3770k and a gtx 980 is overkill,so it's not my hardware holding me back..Fresh install of win 10 so its not that either.The game is just a terrible port,which is a real shame...


AVOID ON PC!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198067159810', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 251, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 150, 'last_played': 1485637309}
review:
So, let's get this straight: this is a TERRIBLE game. But I love it so much. Now to explain why I feel this way.

Deadly Premonition follows the story of a quirky FBI detective, Francis York Morgan (just call him York), as he and his imaginary friend Zach solve the mystery behind the murder of a young women, Anna Graham, in the fictional town of Greenvale, Washington. It's a classic "who dun it", story, which slowly melts more and more into the bizzare, and stange as you get further along into the game. It should be said, that this game clearly takes HEAVY inspiration from the 90s TV series Twin Peaks, which follows a similar story of a detective unravelling the murder of a young women, which also slowly gets more and more surreal as the series gets further along in it's story. 

The gameplay, and graphics are by far where most concerns arise regarding the game, with shoddy aiming, terrible driving while you drive around the town doing either the main quest, or the various other sidequests,
 bad textures, some character models look like ones you'd see in PS2 games, bad framerate, etc. Some gameplay decisions made in this game can be extremely baffling in how poorly designed they are. These are by far the games weakest aspect, and are honestly sometimes a hassle to play through. But, however I believe the game makes up for what it lacks in its characters, and overall quirkiness. 

I cannot tell you how many times I smiled, or gave a chuckle to the characters interacting with each other, I won't spoil any of these moments, as you should most definately experiance for themselves, but I can say that if the game hits any nail on the head, it is most definately in this aspect. Some may find some distaste in the campy/cheesy/sometimes downright TERRIBLE diolouge in this game, but I personally loved it, and I found myself getting excited when I was playing through the game, and a cutscene would appear, because it meant I would get a chuckle or two out of it. Something should also be said about the soundtrack, as it fits the surreal, quirky atmosphere of the game perectly. The game is also quite lengthy, with various sidequests you can do, in addition to the main story.

Now, many people wouldn't find this justification to buy this game, that the gameplay and graphics completely ruin the experiance, but I would seriously disagree. It seems to me that this game had a lot of love, and effort put behind it, but the game developers skills just didn't match up to what they were hoping would turn out. As I said, some may not like this game, some may even hate this game, but to those who want a different experiance, something that is out of norm, and completely changes the way you would normally think about games, I'd say give this game a go. I've bought this game three times already, on the Xbox 360, PS3, and of course PC, and I haven't regretting buying a single copy. This game will give you a unforgetable ride, which must be played to be believed.  In my opinion, this is without a doubt, the best worst game I have ever played. AND I LOVED EVERY MINUTE OF IT.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006579579', 'num_games_owned': 337, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 2968, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 167, 'last_played': 1516135185}

author: {'steamid': '76561198121767787', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1738, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1732, 'last_played': 1398326886}
review: Al principio te puede parecer un poco shit, pero luego aprendes a amar su rareza

author: {'steamid': '76561198006230589', 'num_games_owned': 1350, 'num_reviews': 106, 'playtime_forever': 1177, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1177, 'last_played': 1439932897}
review:
OK, this game surely has its problem. It's a bad port, it needs some twisting around from keeping it from crashing, the driving mechanics are objectively bad, and the graphics is surely not top notch.
But this game is a breath of fresh air from all the "this game mechanics work, let's copy-paste it" games, it's extremely original and has a great late 90's early 2000 japanese vibe. It has one of the best horror plot ever seen in video game history, the character development is incredible and i was surely not expecting anything even close to this level. The english production is great, the voice acting is magnificent. The game is an open world investigation horror with paranormal elements, and it's unique in its genre. It's surely a game to try out, sadly the first 15 minutes of tutorial are not representative of the rest of the game and can turn a lot of people off before they get to the real beginning of the game.
I really feel like recomending this to anyone who wants to try something different from the gaming standards we are accustomed today

author: {'steamid': '76561197977028524', 'num_games_owned': 485, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 2486, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2386, 'last_played': 1419777728}
review:
One of the most memorable video games you'll ever play. The gameplay won't blow you away, but it has a great story, a ton of characters, and quite a lot of fun side missions and stuff to do.

You might be better off getting the PS3 or 360 version of the game, since the PC port is notorious, but there's a guide: http://www.pcgamingwiki.com/wiki/Deadly_Premonition:_The_Director%27s_Cut that can help with the most common issues. Just remember to save often.

author: {'steamid': '76561198154396341', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 404, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 115, 'last_played': 1457581081}
review: PC Port is pretty bad, but if you tweak it a bit by going to your Deadly Premonition files located in your Steam folder, right click DP.exe, properties, change the Compaitablity to 98/ME, then go to DPLauncher.exe, and change that to Run as Admin, then launch it through the DPLauncher, it should be fully functioning, aside from the lack of options. Great game. prone to crashes and occasional graphics fuck ups

author: {'steamid': '76561198036875773', 'num_games_owned': 489, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1022, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1006, 'last_played': 1479946566}
review: It's Twin Peaks: The Game. It's weird, it's wonky, the animations are terrible and some parts are so poorly written that I burst out in laughter when I played through them. This is one of the best games I have ever played.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971252577', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 41, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 29, 'last_played': 1448748146}
review:
Bad PC port.  Be prepared to waste an hour figuring out how to install fixes to get it to work at all.  Almost unplayable in its normal state.  

Once I got it running it had a really trippy japanese horror movie thing going on, but I didn't get very far cause I think it crashed.

author: {'steamid': '76561197983177942', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 12, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12, 'last_played': 1439716387}
review:
Good game, bad port. For me, at first it literally wouldn't start (the process just shut down after clicking start on the config screen), now it will start but crashes randomly.

If you have the option, play a console version instead. They don't quite work perfectly either, but far better than this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198117396740', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 1615, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 883, 'last_played': 1454235991}
review:
Direkt zum Anfang eine Anmerkung: das ist kein richtiges Review und soll auch gar keins sein.

Warum?

Das Spiel, oder um ganz genau zu sein DIESE VERSION DES SPIELS ist so massiv verbuggt, dass es nur ein einziges Wort gibt, mit dem man es beschreiben kann:

[h1]UNSPIELBAR.[/h1]

[h1]Wie sieht das aus?[/h1] 
Es stÃ¼rzt an bestimmten Stellen IMMER ab. Diese scheinen von Spieler zu Spieler zu variieren, aber das Ã¤ndert an der Sache ja nichts. Meist sind es Cutscenes, bei denen das Spiel aufhÃ¶rt zu arbeiten. 
Genauer gesagt schlieÃŸt einfach das Spiel und man bekommt die Fehlermeldung "dp.exe funktioniert nicht mehr". Im Forum gibt es dafÃ¼r zwar Anleitungen was zu tun ist, aber NICHTS HILFT (Mir jedenfalls nicht). Ich selbst und ein paar andere haben es auch mit "Ersatz-Saves" probiert,die es zum Runterladen gibt, aber selbst das hilft nicht. 
In meinem Fall handelt es sich um die ALLGEMEIN BEKANNTE Stelle - Episode 2 / Kapitel 09 -, allgemein bekannt weil das Spiel an der Stelle wohl bei vielen Usern den Geist aufgibt. Ãœberspringt man die erste Sequenz des Kapitels (mit Hilfe des Saves), kommt man zwar an der ursprÃ¼nglichen "Absturzstelle" vorbei, allerdings nur bis zum nÃ¤chsten Dialog. D.h. das Spiel stÃ¼rzt weiterhin ab, nur eben an anderer, leicht verschobener Stelle.

Obwohl diese Tatsache allgemein und lange bekannt ist (das Spiel ist ja auch hier auf Steam NICHT neu), gibt es keinen Patch dafÃ¼r.
Wenn man [h1]GerÃ¼chten[/h1] glauben darf, wurde wohl das Entwicklerteam kurz nach dem Release der PC-Version des Spiels (das Spiel selbst ist ein xbox 360/PS 3 - Port) entlassen. Wahrscheinlich vom Publisher aus, oder wem auch immer ... ist ja auch egal. Es wÃ¼rde zumindest erklÃ¤ren, warum nicht mal solch spielzerstÃ¶rende Bugs behoben wurden. (Mal ganz abgesehen davon, dass sich der Port wie eine "Early-Access-Alpha"-Version spielt. AuÃŸerdem kann man lesen, dass es den Port ohnehin nur gab, weil es von der Community so gewollt wurde [i](siehe "Dark Souls - Prepare to Die Edition, die ja auch nur auf "flehen" der Community fÃ¼r den PC erschien ... mit dem Unterschied, dass diese zumindest spielbar ist, wenn man einen Controller besitzt)[/i] und man entsprechend halt einfach was fÃ¼r den PC zurechtgeklatscht hat, ohne zu testen, ob es Ã¼berhaupt lÃ¤uft.

Das  ist auch ein Grund, wieso ich kein "richtiges" Review schreiben kann. Mir fehlen einfach notwendige Infos und mir irgendwelche Sachen ausdenken oder wild zu spekulieren, nur um irgendetwas zu schreiben, wÃ¤re hier einfach nur dumm.

Nunja, einige kÃ¶nnen es scheinbar spielen, viele nicht. Ich kann es nicht. Deswegen 
[h1]DAUMEN RUNTER[/h1]

fÃ¼r diese Version.

(Die Originalversion soll wohl genial sein, weswegen ich nicht das Spiel generell bewerten will ... und auch gar nicht kann, wie gesagt ...)

In diesem Sinne nochmal deutlich:
[h1]FINGER WEG VON DER PC-VERSION[/h1]es sei denn ihr bekommt sie kostenlos. Dann hat man ja auch nichts verloren, auÃŸer ein paar Stunden Lebenszeit.

author: {'steamid': '76561198077867324', 'num_games_owned': 4168, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 883, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 850, 'last_played': 1426300724}
review:
I'm a big fan of the Twin Peaks TV show/movie which was obviously a major influence in the development of Deadly Premonition. This is one reason I really want to recommend this game, but I can't. It's simply too buggy to play. The game crashes constantly.  At ~14 hours gameplay, the game crashed (which happened frequently) but this time my save file was corrupted. So now I can start over from the beginning, or uninstall. Uninstall it is.

Maybe one day I will try it again & keep a backup of my save file, [i]maybe[/i]...

author: {'steamid': '76561198046033386', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 2921, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2850, 'last_played': 1533858862}
review:
You know what I love about this game?
Everything.

I show this game off all the time and most people think I'm joking.
I first played this back in 2012.
This is genuinely my favorite game of all time.

The story is like if you took Twin Peaks, translated it into Japanese, had a dude translate it back into English and then had another guy try to read back the lines in Japanese with his only exposure to English having been some late night sitcoms.
Basically what I'm saying is it's amazing, it has so many twists and major plot points that left me stunned.
One of the most satisfying boss fights of all time is against a cross dressing man who flys around calling you a skank.
The characters were likeable and kooky in their own way and were generally unique and not bland archetypes.
Some of the most memorable and funny lines in the world "FK in the coffee" and "The answer is [onion]"
The graphics while lackluster contribute to the off-kilter world of Greenvale.

The only downside is this version crashes all the time and the PS3/Xbox version is slow as hell.
But if you download DPfix it mostly fixes the crashes, except for some very specific ones.
(Hint: Wait for it to start raining before you go in the Town Hall to fix that crash)

This game is pretty swell.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042244402', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 764, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 250, 'last_played': 1562457214}
review: This recommendation comes with an asterisk. The vanilla PC version of DP is actually kind of disasterous. There are a handful of game breaking bugs and there's no native 1080. Get this game with the DP fix mod and consider getting color correction mods. That aside, this game is bliss. Don't play it if you're one of those "gameplay is king" people, because honestly the gameplay is mostly inconsequential. However, the script, animations, and overall plot will grab your attention in a way similar to a fantastic B-movie, and it's quite obviously intentional. Swery is like a mixture between Tommy Wiseu, Hideo Kojima, and David Lynch. Cannot recommend this game enough over and above the problems it has.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045553085', 'num_games_owned': 2431, 'num_reviews': 70, 'playtime_forever': 742, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 579, 'last_played': 1594944850}
review: This is a great game, but how can anyone write a positive review of this? This game is a mess. It's terribly ported, but at least that can be fixed with a fan patch. This game crashes all the time, whenever it wants. I was able to play for a hour without crashes. Now it's crashing every 10 minutes. It's unplayable. There is no telling when it's gonna crash, you just gotta get lucky.There is no auto-save or anything and you can only save at select places so unless you want to save every 5 minutes enjoy losing your progress over and over. I'd say this game is worth playing, but on PC? No way.

author: {'steamid': '76561198005505152', 'num_games_owned': 2225, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 1092, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 992, 'last_played': 1440946641}

author: {'steamid': '76561198001679065', 'num_games_owned': 308, 'num_reviews': 60, 'playtime_forever': 1459, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1441, 'last_played': 1441061219}
review: A cousin of Resident evil, with a twist of interesting mystery crime plot and a splash of light humour. The game having never a dull moment, takes you to new places continously, lots of sidequests.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970975120', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 2917, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2917, 'last_played': 1439067777}
review: This game is quirky, unpolished and unfortunately very crash prone - but nonetheless a hidden gem in my opinion. Story, characters and atmosphere are simply great. It is an open world mystery thriller with a strong resemblance to the TV series Twin Peaks by David Lynch, which is quite unique as far as I know. Apart from the main storyline there are numerous side missions. Most of them are somewhat hidden, but they provide additional understanding of the world (a North-American small town) and the people within it. After many entertaining hours it was hard for me to say goodbye to Greenvale in the end.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007977062', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 202, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 202, 'last_played': 1490368286}

author: {'steamid': '76561198029139401', 'num_games_owned': 1921, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 112, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 112, 'last_played': 1438985960}
review:
The game itself might be interesting, but this is an awful port.

I have no problem getting smooth framerates in games like Borderlands 2 or Far Cry 3, but here, I got a slideshow of between 5 and 10 FPS even when nothing was happening on the screen. The resolution cannot be changed. When windowed, the game has problems with cursor locking. Camera is awkward.

Not recommended.

author: {'steamid': '76561198024408836', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 116, 'playtime_forever': 433, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 420, 'last_played': 1401331130}
review:

I love it and you should too.

author: {'steamid': '76561198012736376', 'num_games_owned': 1983, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 2092, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2092, 'last_played': 1488545029}
review:
Just to get this out of the way. This is among the worst PC ports I ever dealt with. It takes quite the effort to get the game up and running and even then its not optimal experience. Game crashes quite often, so remember to save your game frequently. There are also some save game corrupting issues [spoiler]in chapter 9.[/spoiler]

Its also also quite dated in graphical department and gameplay is nothing to write home about. So whats good about it then?

Well, You've probably played nothing like it. Its weird, brutal and quirky. With some excellent characters and a story that is gonna keep your entertained from start to finish with some jaw dropping moments. Absolutely recommended if you are willing to deal with awful port.

Great experience! Now we need a sequel that actually has a budget.

author: {'steamid': '76561198050385190', 'num_games_owned': 784, 'num_reviews': 240, 'playtime_forever': 1290, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1290, 'last_played': 1438610468}
review:
Voy a dividir este analisis en dos partes, por que creo que se lo merece.
SerÃ¡n pues la parte jugable y la historia.

Jugable :

Simple y llanamente pÃ©simo, triste, ridiculo e incluso gracioso que a veces se aprecia.
Los controles son un completo caos, aparte aÃ±adiremos la mala optimizaciÃ³n, que hace que nuestro personaje parezca loco.
Como he dicho, el juego a veces se parece a un simulador de crash, en mi run de este juego tengo que decir que se me ha crasheado alrededor de 20-25 veces como mÃ­nimo.
Los recorridos de misiÃ³n a misiÃ³n son la mayoria abusivos, quiero decir, deberemos viajar unos 5 mins en coche y no bromeo.
No es todo negativo, la mÃºsica es preciosa, mÃºsica que evidentemente adquirirÃ© a la larga.

Historia :

Pues si DP falla en lo jugable, esto es un zasca, Simplemente en historia este juego para mi ha sido un "no-va-mÃ¡s", totalmente sorprendente este juego ha conseguido enomararme en su historia de manera que MUY pocos juegos han conseguido hacer a lo largo de su recorrido.
Deadly Premonition es el juego que juegas por su historia, por que sÃ­. podra ser complicado en  otros aspectos, pero realmente te sientes realizado e incluso vacÃ­o cuando completas la historia y sabes que ya no vas a ver mÃ¡s a Francis ni a Zack.

Jugable : 5/10
Historia : 9,5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198036069347', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 205, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 188, 'last_played': 1450582548}
review:
It's an incredible game, it's simultaneously terrible and amazing (beyond "so bad it's good", you're going to have to take my word for it)
making for one of the most unique, confusing, hilarious, and quotable gaming experiences ever to grace the face of the universe.

So why not recommended then? The port is probably the single worst I have ever had the misfortune of experiencing.
If you pick this up prepare to be greeted with such lovely features such as:[list]
[*]720p resolution lock (Can be fixed by DPFix)
[*]15fps, but only half the time you start the game. Also note it's still running at 60 (evident by some of the camera movement and the pause menu, but the timing is messed up for everything else).
[*]Bad controller support. This game was originally a XBox 360 game, which makes the dev's choice of DirectInput over XInput make even less sense. Editing controller binding happens in the launcher and is extremely limited & finicky (DPFix does give you a few more options through ini files).
[*]Random crashes, the game tends to crash randomly due to memory leaks or just bugs in the game code. There's some ways to lessen the effect but no way to get rid of all of them.
[*]Not so random crashes, some parts of the the game just outright crash and you have to do all sorts of stuff to try to work around them (such as running in compatibility mode for Win98, or rebooting your PC), but even that's not as bad as
[*]Save file corruption, save files can easily become corrupted, causing the game to crash soon after load, and usually in the same spots. Sometimes the only work around is to delete your save and start again. Save often and backup saves often.
[/list]

It's a great game but it's just not worth the money they're asking for considering the state of the port, however if it goes really cheap it might be worth the gamble if you can make the port bearable.
If you are a XB360 or PS3 owner then I highly recommended you pick it up for one of those if you can find it cheap (might need to import the PS3 version however).
If you just want your dose of SWERY then I suggest you go and pick up D4: Dark Dreams Don't Die, which is cheaper and has a good PC port (Unreal Engine 3).

author: {'steamid': '76561198018937335', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 134, 'playtime_forever': 2159, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1714, 'last_played': 1438075285}
review:
La historia es muy buena, el ritmo de la historia es bueno, es lo que debe ser un sandbox de investigaciÃ³n (que aprenda LA Noire), la variedad de secundarias estÃ¡ bastante bien, los personajes estan MUY bien construidos,... sin duda recomendarÃ­a el juego a pesar de sus limitaciones tÃ©cnicas, pero no puedo. Si bien me ha encantado la programaciÃ³n es un desastre. Problemas que he sufrido:

- Primero tuve que ejecutarlo en modo ventana, bajarme un programa para que use mÃ¡s RAM y ejecutarlo como modo administrador para hacerlo mÃ¡s estable
- Guardaba cada vez que encontraba un checkpoint, porque si no se me ha cerrado 30 veces el juego solo no se me ha cerrado ninguna.
- TenÃ­a que estar siempre antento de llevar tabaco (para pasar el tiempo rÃ¡pido) porque hay misiones que si te las pasas muy rÃ¡pido, como en el restaurante, se crashea
- Procurar no rejugar capÃ­tulos para hacer sus secundarias, porque te pueden desaparecer items importantes
- Ver como 6 o 7 secuencias en youtube porque se cuelga el juego si las dejo, sobre todo en la casa de cierto personaje
- AdemÃ¡s he sufrido bugs del tipo de que el personaje no corre bien y tengo que estar dÃ¡ndole al botÃ³n de correr varias veces, misiones que no salen en el mapa, la conducciÃ³n es horrible y a veces el mismo coche gira mÃ¡s que otras veces... es un despropÃ³sito.
- Si bien me marca mÃ¡s de 30 horas, la verdad es que son unas 15. Lo que pasa que si el juego iba bien durante mucho rato no lo cerraba para que aguantase mÃ¡s sin crashes

Si sois muy pacientes y estÃ¡is dispuestos a soportar todo eso, es un gran juego. Si no huid de Ã©l. Otra opciÃ³n es jugarlo en consola, que si bien tiene un montÃ³n de errores, al menos los crashes desaparecen casi todos.

El peor port de la historia sin duda

review:
Dos aÃ±os despuÃ©s de escribir mi primer anÃ¡lisis de este juego, el cual teneis un poco mÃ¡s abajo, he vuelto a instalarlo para darle otra oportunidad. Nada nuevo. Cuelgues en los mismo sitios, repetir la misma secciÃ³n cinco veces hasta que le dio por no colgarse y, finalmente, llegar a un determinado punto del juego, el mismo que la primera vez que juguÃ©, donde el juego colapsa definitivamente y no deja continuar. Para mÃ­ esta es la Ãºltima vez que lo intento, ya que le he metido parches y he intentado mil soluciones que hay por internet y nada de nada.

AsÃ­ pues NO RECOMIENDO este despropÃ³sito de videojuego a nadie.

------------------

HabÃ­a leÃ­do un montÃ³n de criticas acerca de este juego, en las cuales te dabas cuenta de que u odiabas este juego o lo amabas. No habÃ­a punto intermedio. Yo no sabrÃ­a deciros.

Soy capaz de perdonar su apartado grÃ¡fico totalmente desfasado y su jugabilidad arcaica. De hecho el juego me estaba gustando ya que la historia poco a poco engancha. No obstante lo que no soy capaz de perdonar son los continuos cuelgues del juego. No es normal que me tocase repetir cinco veces la misma parte del juego solo porque de repente le de por sufrir un error y colapsar el juego, llegando finalmente a dejar de funcionar en una parte especÃ­fica del juego e impidiendo continuar la historia.

Si algÃºn dÃ­a me vuelvo a animar probablemente lo instale y le de una segunda oportunidad. Sin embargo, si estais pensado en comprarlo yo os recomiendo que NO lo hagais, a no ser que estÃ© a precio de risa.

Un saludo

author: {'steamid': '76561197989668621', 'num_games_owned': 627, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 911, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 911, 'last_played': 1437368400}
review:
While I enjoy the story of this game I cannot overlook the constant crashes and bugs that abound in this poorly ported title, especially given the $25 USD price tag. 

My game freezes about 5-10% of the time when checking side quests.
Random freezing during loading screens.
Performance issues on a beefy rig when running windowed.
Unable to interact with required doors/objects during certian missions. 
Issues while driving that cause my tires to sink into the road bringing my car to a sudden stop. 

Also, this game is locked to 720p which can be fixed with the dpfix mod but installing that brought about an issue where the game freezes when I tab out. 

If my friend did not want to watch me stream this game I would have already deleted it within the first hour of gameplay. 

TL;DR : Great story, amusing characters in this Twin Peaks inspired game but bugs and crashes make the game nearly unplayable. Not worth the price. 3/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198040997872', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1219, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 857, 'last_played': 1440543776}
review:
Let me tell you something about Deadly Premonition.  The controls are clunky, and driving, being maybe half of the game, is a nightmare. The character animations are awkward and at times terrifying. The squirrels make public-domain monkey noises and the fast travel mechanic (if you get it) is punctuated with a cartoon car crash sound. The voice acting ranges from actually enjoyable to god-awful. Half of the time, the game crashes or won't let me load my saves, and I had to download a patch just to get the game to run at over 720p. 
This might be one of the best games I've ever played.
'Twin Peaks: The Game' is an accurate description for the storyline -- Except York could challenge Agent Cooper one-on-one with how downright charming he is as a character. If nothing else, play for the story and the interactions between the characters; this game has some moments that are truly hilarious, and some that are just completely off-the-wall, and the end has a twist that will make you want to replay to truly understand what's happened. True, you could just watch a Let's Play on Youtube, but in doing so you'll miss half of the true charm. The side-missions, while infuriating, and the long monologues York has in the driving sections are really the cherry on top of this sundae of dysfunctional oddity.
This isn't a game for everyone, but if you do like it, it's like this game was made for you. 
In short: This game is awful. I love every awful moment of it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043739801', 'num_games_owned': 341, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 374, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 206, 'last_played': 1500354096}
review: This game is a masterpiece. Honestly, in my book it wins best game of all time. The plot is just really awesome with twists and turns everywhere. The main character is hilarious. FK..in the coffee. I lost my shit. If you want a really good storytelling single player experince, this game does the best job on it. However, it dwindles in the graphics aspect as the characters' audio isn't usually in sync with the character's lip when they are talking. But that's only a small minor problem.

author: {'steamid': '76561197969864366', 'num_games_owned': 259, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 2882, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2759, 'last_played': 1436734430}
review:
How best to put this? 
Tldr version:

Do I like Deadly Premonition?   YES
Does it deserve it's Cult following?    I think So.
Is it a good, GAME?  No
Would I recommend it? 
Only if you are INCREDIBLY patient and have a love for Dark, Twin Peaks style mystery and quirky Humour.

----------------------------------

Firstly the Twin Peaks references are obvious, so if you're a fan, it's already got that to its advantage.
Initially it feels a bit too close for comfort, almost a carbon copy, but Deadly Premonition does a good job of building on its influences and has an engaging and exciting plotline the comes into its own as the game progresses.

The progression of the story is wonderfully executed and I felt genuinely invested in the characters at the end of the game, giving it all the more impact. 
The plot was dark and disturbing, yet light hearted and humourous at the right times and often left a number of potential candidates for the 'culprit', yet left enough uncertainty to make me doubt I was SURE who it was.

This side of Dead Premonition almost outshines all the negatives. The side missions in particular are wonderfully varied and offer a great glimpse into each character's personality and motivations. 



Regrettably, there are often some conflicting design choices where 'realism' and 'gameplay' butt heads.
Side missions often only unlock in certain weather conditions or require you to drive MILES to get to them, and you are hassled by characters to progress the main plot, which will often prevent you from accessing time-limited side missions.

Eating and sleeping appears to be a requirement in addition to health purely to irritate you and give you a reason to spend money on something.

The gameplay also often features a lot of clunky third person shooting sequences with intrusive quick time events thrown in for extra irritation. Although you do adapt to these over time, they did often feel 'bolted-on' to make it more of a "Game".



The nail in the coffin however is that the PC Port is frankly, terrible:

 - Many users find it crashes on startup until you reinstall DP's Physx
 - The Game crashes to desktop very frequently, making saving at every possible moment (and backing up save files) a requirement
- I had a wonderful bug where the handbrake 'Screech' sound of vehicles loops constantly while driving (I hear this is a 5.1 Audio issue)
 - the 'HD' is 720p and only really the core character models have anything resembling a good level of detail

Some attempts at fixing these issues are available from members of the community, but it's just not practical for the majority of users.


I Loved Deadly Premonition. I also hated it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198166354435', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1641, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1218, 'last_played': 1466779518}
review: I love this game - the music, the story, and the characters all envelop you in a sense of misplaced nostalgia, whether or not you've seen Twin Peaks (which this game has shamelessly ripped off, but in a "good way").  However, if you have a PS3, don't buy this game on PC.  It crashes with alarming frequency and for me, it is made unplayable by the fact that my save file was corrupted on Episode 9.  Seriously, just get it on PS3.  It's not worth the headache.

author: {'steamid': '76561197983550984', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1782, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1782, 'last_played': 1436770446}
review:
I actually got a brain aneurysm trying to complete this game while working past the dozens of different crashes, fixes, glitches and coma-inducing gameplay.

There's only so many dozens of times the game can crash on you, only so many hours you can waste trying to fix all the crashes and still say that the story will be worth it in the end.

I've had to run repair on the game's PhysX to even get the game to start. I had to download third-party files to get the game to play without crashing. I had to switch between multiple windows compatibility settings to avoid different crashes throughout the game.

Even then you don't know when the next crash is coming and so help you God you better pray that your last save point was close behind.

I haven't felt this much rage since the last time I played a dota 2 pub.

Fuck this game, fuck the developers.
Holy FUCK.

author: {'steamid': '76561198082834459', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 2693, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2687, 'last_played': 1436624003}
review:
Deadly Premonition Ã¨ uno di quei giochi che ormai sono diventati un "Cult" e che fanno parte di quei titoli unici e inimitabili.
Non conoscevo l'esistenza di esso finchÃ¨ non mi Ã¨ stato consigliato da un mio amico, e che dire..., non potevo ricevere consiglio migliore perchÃ¨ questo gioco Ã¨ bellissimo, ma davvero molto molto bello!
Posso dire con sinceritÃ  che Ã¨ entrato tra i miei giochi preferiti in assoluto perchÃ¨ ha tutto, per prima cosa il protagonista Ã¨ semplicemente "un grande", non ho mai visto un protagonista come questo in nessun altro videogioco, Ã¨ carismatico, brillante, geniale, divertente, misterioso e onesto, accompagnato sempre dal suo alter-ego "Zach".

La storia Ã¨ il VERO PUNTO FORTE di questo titolo, Ã¨ geniale, e grazie anche alle molte scene animate piano piano si riesce a capire cosa stÃ  realmente succedento a Greenvale dato che all'inizio ci saranno tantissimi interrogativi.
Un altro fattore interessante Ã¨ che ci saranno colpi di scena sempre piÃ¹ incredibili avanzando nel gioco che vi faranno rimanere veramente a bocca aperta e faranno aumentare la tensione al giocatore.

La LongevitÃ  Ã¨ desisamente un altro punto a suo favore, una volta completata la storia principale c'Ã¨ comunque tanto da fare e da esplorare perchÃ¨ la cittadina di Greenvale Ã¨ molto grande e se si vogliono fare le missioni secondarie e collezionare le carte il tempo di gioco aumenta di molto.

Il Gameplay puÃ² risultare con qualche difetto specialmente quando bisogna mirare o combattere ma niente di estremamente problematico, ci si fa l'abitudine velocemente.
Una buona cosa Ã¨ che questo Ã¨ anche un "Free Roaming" quindi si potrÃ  girare per tutta la cittadina e per tutte le strade e stradine di Greenvale in completa tranquillitÃ  scegliendo il veicolo che piÃ¹ ci piace, ed Ã¨ anche possibile interagire con gli abitanti del luogo per avere informazioni o per fare delle missioni secondarie.

Il comparto Sonoro Ã¨ un pÃ² scarno perchÃ¨ le musiche sono poche e ripetute molto, comunque io l'ho trovate carine e per niente stancanti.

La Grafica non Ã¨ il massimo ma neanche detestabile, si puÃ² definire in stile "PlayStation 2", i nemici sono quasi tutti uguali, non cambiano molto tra loro, invece gli abitanti del paese sono molto diversi tra loro ognuno con personalitÃ  e caratteristiche diverse.
L'atmosfera Ã¨ perfettamente intonata con i luoghi e con i personaggi.

Il difetto principale di questo gioco secondo me Ã¨ che una volta installato esso non si avvia pur premento il tasto "Play" e bisogna fare una correzione su un file per farlo partire, altri piccoli problemi sono dei Crash improvvisi, delle schermate di caricamento che si bloccano, qualche difetto nel Gameplay e qualche errore nella traduzione, ma vi garantisco che tutti questi problemi passano in secondo piano perchÃ¨ Deadly Premonition Ã¨ semplicemente unico e bellissimo.

Voto: 10/10
Nota Finale: Il gioco si ispira alla serie Tv chimata "Twin Peaks"

review:
The bottom line - not recommended.

The game mechanics is not intuitive, the combination of mouse\keyobard is not working well here.

The options menu - its hard to get arround in it, It took me over half a minute to figure out how to close it.

It seems the game has some performance issues, I ran the Witcher 3 and other more demanding titles on the same machine with ease, but here it seems clunky

About 30+ minutes into the game made me really disapointed, especially after seeing all the other good reviews,

author: {'steamid': '76561198011198852', 'num_games_owned': 1746, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 2512, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2054, 'last_played': 1632859168}
review:
Ein Review zu  Deadly Premonition oder gar eine klare Empfehlung oder auch Nicht-Empfehlung ist wirklich keine einfache Sache. Ich will versuchen, euch ein paar Infos an die Hand zu geben, die euch helfen, diese Enscheidung zu treffen und erklÃ¤ren, warum ich letztlich doch - zÃ¶gerlich - auf "Empfehlen" geklickt habe. Das hat zur Folge, dass dieses Review auch recht lang wird. Sorry dafÃ¼r!

Ihr seid Agent Francis York Morgan vom FBI (nennen wir euch York, das macht nÃ¤mlich jeder). Eure Aufgabe ist es, einen Mord an einer jungen Frau in einem kleinen Ort namens Greenvale aufzuklÃ¤ren. Ihr seid allerdings nicht einfach irgendein Agent, sondern der Mann fÃ¼r die besonderen, mysteriÃ¶seren FÃ¤lle. Das dies ein solcher werden wird, wird direkt bei eurer Ankunft klar...


In seinen GrundzÃ¼gen ist Deadly Premonition ein OpenWorld-Horror-Krimi-Action-Advenure. Wer die 90iger-Jahre-Serie "Twin Peaks" kennt, dem sollte gesagt sein, dass das hier praktisch das inoffizielle Spiel dazu ist. Das schlÃ¤gt sich im ErzÃ¤hlstil, dem Humor bis hin zu der Tatsache, dass viele Charaktere der Serie ihr GegenstÃ¼ck im Spiel gefunden habe, sehr deutlich nieder. Wer die Serie nicht kennt, dem sei gesagt, dass ihr es in  Deadly Premonition mit einem skurrilen Mix zu tun bekommt. Da ist einmal die wirklich spannende, sich an Erwachsene richtende Story, die sich vom einfachen Krimi langsam in Richtung japanischer Horror-Fantasy entwickelt. Dann haben wir die Ã¼berzogenen, Ã¼berkarikierten aber sehr markanten, gut ausgearbeiten Charaktere, die wegen ihrer Art und ihrer Inszenierung einfach auf eine positive Art lange im Gedachtnis bleiben werden. Dazu gibt es B-Movie-Trash und einem sehr speziellen Humor, der von tiefsten, zynischsten schwarz bis zu Slapstick eine breite Paltette abdeckt. So weit, so gut...

Leider kommen dazu auch viele SchwÃ¤chen. Teilweise die Gleichen, die man in den Konsolenversionen schon hatte. Da wÃ¤re einmal die Grafik, die selbst zum Erstrelease ihrer Zeit schon um mindestens 5 Jahre hinterher hing. Schusswechsel sind mÃ¤ÃŸig realisiert, was sowohl daran liegt, dass man keine Wucht bei den Waffen spÃ¼rt, als auch daran, das die Steuerung schwammig und unprÃ¤ziese ist. Und wo wir gerade bei schwammig sind: das Fahrverhalten dieses Spiels ist wohl das Mieseste, was ich je in einem Spiel erleben musste. Die StraÃŸenkarte, die sich kaum zoomen lÃ¤sst und sich dazu noch stÃ¤ndig mitdreht ist an Nutzlosigkeit kaum zu Ã¼berbieten und trÃ¤gt somit ebenfalls noch ihren Anteil zum "Fahrspass" bei. Und die deutsche Ãœbersetzung ist auch eher verstÃ¤ndlich als gut.

Und dann haben wir da leider noch eine Menge technischer Probleme, die quasi exklusiv in der PC-Version sind. Zuerst sei angemerkt, dass es eine ganze Menge Spieler gibt, die dieses Game Ã¼berhaupt niemals starten kÃ¶nnen. Selbst wenn das aber nach einigen Workarounds funktioniert (was keineswegs garantiert ist), wird man je nach System gegebenfalls von hÃ¤ufigen Crashes geplagt (Tipp: KomppatibilitÃ¤tsmods fÃ¼r Windows 98/ME, allerdings geht dadurch ggf. die Framerate in den einstelligen Bereich), ab und zu verweigern die Tasten des Gamepads bis zu einem Rechnerneustart den Dienst, das Bild bleibt schwarz oder der Ton verschollen. 

Dagegen wirken die restlichen UnzulÃ¤nglichkeiten, wie das das Spiel ohne Mod auschlieÃŸlich in 1280x720 Pixeln (720p)-AuflÃ¶sung lÃ¤uft, die nicht optimale Gamepadvorbelegung, die sich nur eingeschrÃ¤nkt Ã¤ndern lasst, die Farbpalette, die bei der PC-Version verbuggt ist und somit das ganze Spiel mit einem Grauschleier Ã¼berzogen ist, die miese und sehr instabile Framerate oder das das Spiel mit Maus und Tastatur fast unspielbar ist, fast schon vernachlÃ¤ssigbar.

Oder kurz: Technisch ist die PC-Umsetzung der eh schon altbacken wirkenden Konsolenversion eine absolute Katastrophe, wie ich sie noch nie erlebt habe. Und je moderner der PC ist, umso grÃ¶ÃŸer sind die Probleme. Wer kein fundiertes Wissen Ã¼ber seinen PC, Ã¼ber Treiber, deren Einstellungen und Ã¤hnliche Dinge hat und/oder wer keine Lust hat, sich auch mal 3 Stunden durch irgendwelche ForenbeitrÃ¤ge zu wÃ¼hlen, wenn er eigentlich lieber Zocken wÃ¼rde, sollte vom Kauf direkt absehen. FÃ¼r alle die es dennoch probieren wollen: denkt an das Steam RÃ¼ckerstattungssystem.


Warum empfehle ich nun dieses Spiel, dessen Gameplayelemente fÃ¼r sich genommen alle hÃ¶chstens Durchschnittlich sind und dessen technische Umsetzung eine Totalkatastrophe ist? Ein Spiel, dass ich ein halbes Jahr lang auf dem Laptop meiner Freundin spielen musste, weil es bei mir trotz allen Versuchen und aller Forentipps nicht zum Funktionieren zu bewegen war und das dann nur durch Zufall mehr oder minder "plÃ¶tzlich" auch bei mir startete?

Es ist die Einzigartigkeit. Lange bevor sich irgendwelche experimentellen Indie-Games ohne wirkliches Gameplay versuchten, statt eines Spiels eine Erfahrung zu schaffen und sich selbst eher als Kunst als als Spiel sahen, hat Deadly Premonition diesen Schritt zur Kunst meiner Meinung nach schon geschafft - und sogar mit richtigem "traditionellem Gameplay". Es ist ein Spiel, dass mit nichts vergleichbar ist, was ihr jemals gespielt habt und vermutlich auch mit nichts, was ihr noch spielen werdet. Die einzeln betrachtet unterdurchschnittlich umgesetzten Gameplayelemente ergeben zusammen genommen ein stimmiges, durchaus positives Bild. Die Story ist spannend, rÃ¤tselhaft und mit vielen Wendungen versehen, so das man unbedingt wissen mÃ¶chte, wie es weiter geht. Zu den einzelnen Charakteren baut man fÃ¼r ein Spiel ungewÃ¶hnlich starke Bindungen auf, so das man immer wieder gern in die Welt zurÃ¼ck kehrt. Der ErzÃ¤hlstil ist einzigartig und obwohl alles immer etwas "over the top" ist, wirkt es innerhalb der Spielwelt vÃ¶llig normal. Ja, selbst eine gepfiffene, sehr eingÃ¤ngige Melodie als Hintergrundmusik wirkt hier keineswegs albern, sondern perfekt passend. Die GesprÃ¤che des Protagonisten mit einer "unsichtbaren Person" werden auch nach kurzer Zeit fÃ¼r den Spieler zu etwas vÃ¶llig Normalem. Alles Dinge, die man schlecht erklÃ¤ren kann, aber die einen unglaublichen Sog entwickeln, der die zahlreichen Schattenseiten des Spiels irgendwann in Vergessenheit geraten lÃ¤sst.

Das Spiel lebt von seiner Story, von der Art, wie sie inszeniert wird und von den Charakteren als Darstellern - und spielt in diesen Disziplinen in der oberen Liga mit - nicht nur, was Spiele, sondern auch was BÃ¼cher und Filme angeht. Die Technik ist, wie schon umfassend erwÃ¤hnt, totaler Mist, der Schwierigkeitsgrad ist leicht, denn obwohl York Munition benÃ¶tigt, wird sie quasi niemals knapp, obwohl er essen, schlafen und Kleidung wechseln muss, stellt das niemals ein Problem dar. In der Community hat sich der Spruch etabliert, dass das Schwierigste am Spiel ist, es zum Laufen zu bekommen. Das sagt diesbezÃ¼glich schon alles. Die zahlreichen Nebenquests sind interessant, gut erzÃ¤hlt und geben nette Belohnungen, sind aber fÃ¼r das einfache Durchspielen des Spiels nicht im geringsten irgendwie Notwendig. FÃ¼r die NebenbeschÃ¤ftigungen wie Angeln, Dart spielen oder Rennen fahren gilt das Gleiche. Wenn also die Story und die Charaktere bei euch nicht funktionieren, gibt es nichts anderes fÃ¼r euch bei Deadly Premonition zu holen. Das ist wohl auch der Grund, warum dieses Spiel die Gamer in zwei Lager teilt. Entweder man liebt es - oder man hasst es. Bei mir hat es zielgenau den Nerv getroffen und wenn die technischen Probleme nicht wÃ¤ren, wÃ¼rdet ihr an dieser Stelle nun ein Ã¼berschwengliches Review mit absoluter Kaufempfehlung lesen. Das konnte es nun so leider nicht werden, aber fÃ¼r die geduldigeren Leute unter euch, die sich gern in gute Geschichten ziehen lassen - oder fÃ¼r Twin Peaks-Fans - ist es mÃ¶glicherweise dennoch einen Versuch wert. Wenns lÃ¤uft und ihr den ersten Technikschock Ã¼berwunden habt, werdet ihr hier eine einzigartige Spielerfahrung haben und eine tolle Story, die auch unpopulÃ¤re "erwachsene" Themen behandelt.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014490691', 'num_games_owned': 2466, 'num_reviews': 81, 'playtime_forever': 1325, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1325, 'last_played': 1432948921}
review:
As I kept playing, I've come to love this game's bulls***t. There's so much to like about it that I found myself ignoring a lot of errors and problems with the game. So, as a video game, this is actually a bad one. But as someone's vision, as a project, it's some kind of amazing.

PS: It's a very bad PC port, but with a quick fix it's playable.

review:

author: {'steamid': '76561197995084027', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 63, 'playtime_forever': 468, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 468, 'last_played': 1435605499}
review:
An interesting mix of crime solving, horror, and an odd sense of humor.

Sadly it's a pain in the ass to get running, and it still frequently crashes after the effort. 
Also trying to find where to go on the map reaaaaaaly sucks.

author: {'steamid': '76561197975567641', 'num_games_owned': 2655, 'num_reviews': 56, 'playtime_forever': 2366, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2303, 'last_played': 1435649607}
review:
I recommend Deadly Premonition to everyone who likes kind of weird characters, good storytelling (that takes it's time) with multiple perspectives from different points on the timeline. You should be stress resistant, because the game will probably crash just before your next save, so you will do some things twice. That should not bother you. It is a kick, because the game itself is not much of a challenge. If you can live with the flaws and see it as an Indie game you got for less than 3 bucks, it is an immersing adventure.

Since the beginning I like the habit of the main character "York" to talk to "Zack". It feels like he is talking to you, the player. It is fun to see other people being puzzled by the actions of the protagonist (as talking to Zack, a person no one can see) and not asking a question. That's what you as the player do: make a list in your mind of things you want to find out and hope that you will get your answers to the right time. Or at the end, at least. Because of the way the story is told you may guess some things and resolve some mysteries for yourself, but I assume that you will still be surprised sometimes. You won't find an answer to everything in the game, like with most scary stories, but that's fine. You will get all important answers to what is important in the game's universe.

Some insights of my journey with the game:
I was well aware of bugs because I read other reviews. I installed DPfix.  I can highly recommend that. By doing so, crashes did not occur too often and because I saved a lot I managed to play the game without becoming depressed. ;) I can only complain about spending too much time on loading screens. Moving the game from my HDD to my SSD did not seem to boost the time on loading screens. Too bad.
In chapter 7 I started to explore the vast world. I should have done that sooner (chapter 2) to have advantages in the game early on. In the first chapters you have time limits, but the game is nearly in real time, so you can do side quests. No worries. Do them! I got my radio, which allows me to drive to different locations in no time without really doing it] after chapter 21. I could have saved a lot of time, not driving myself through the world. You find information about the side quests in the game and also through the descriptions of the achievements.
After you finished a chapter, you can replay it. During a replay you cannot save. A replay is nice if you want to do side quests that may be easier in that level or not doable in another. Everything you gain will be available in any other replay and also in your current game progress. A replay only changes at the end (if you save after finishing the chapter) your inventory, trading cards and the quests you finished. So if you keep dying in your current level, do a replay to get food and medipacks in your inventory. Nice cheat. :)
I used the replays after I was stuck in chapter 22. I was too lazy to open the archive and therefore I did not find an important key. The game is in general, amazingly straightforward, because it shows in red where you need to go to or interact with to proceed. That is nice, as you always know what to do. (But you still have to solve the puzzles by yourself, the game only indicates where the important puzzle is.) You are never lost.

I like the chilling atmosphere of the game, the horror story itself and especially how it is told. One last hint: Don't miss to have lunch with your colleagues. Eat with them in every chapter possible. It's fun!
I am happy that the reviews I read convinced me to play this (indie?) gem.

author: {'steamid': '76561198055157481', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 2788, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2600, 'last_played': 1388568083}
review: This game crashed on me multiple times and might as well wasted almost 10 hours of my gameplay time yet it was one of the most surreal and undescribable deep experience I ever had. To be honest, how broken it is just add it to its charm. Everytime my car went bonkers, I chuckle, restart and play through it all over again with a heartfelt "oh, SWERY" moment.

author: {'steamid': '76561198163016672', 'num_games_owned': 1300, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 272, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 97, 'last_played': 1453797904}
review:
This game says controller support. What controller support? My xbox 360 is absolutely doing nothing at all. Can not get past the intro. Don't buy it, it can not be played at all. Total waste of money!

Update: the secret here is to have admin rights on your pc login and on Steam. Then everything works just fine. Saw this tip at another game and decided to reinstall this game and give it a try. Works just fine!

author: {'steamid': '76561198089121700', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 2245, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2016, 'last_played': 1435598742}
review:
How can i say, hm... 
At first, you may seem like this game is kinda awkward with many things like old graphics, control movement, random crash, but the more you play, the more you will EVENTUALLY enjoy it.
DP know how to make you love the characters like you're living with them. The story is AMAZING, A MASTERPIECE, at the ending, I actually did almost cry, more like got tearied-eyed !

author: {'steamid': '76561197997088496', 'num_games_owned': 102, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 535, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 508, 'last_played': 1435102069}
review:
This game is constantly crashing to the point where the game becomes unplayable by Chapter 6. Since that takes more than 2 hours to get to, it'll be impossible to get a refund for this broken mess.

It also doesn't help that the first hour or so was marred by a 15FPS framerate that was only fixed after rebooting and reinstalling the game.

I want to play this game so bad but the technical glitches make it impossible. I'm just glad I got this during the Summer sale because had I paid the full $30 I'd have broken my computer in a fit of rage.

author: {'steamid': '76561198164699130', 'num_games_owned': 207, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 3725, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3725, 'last_played': 1434909485}
review:
Il game design Ã¨ lacunoso.
Il porting da console Ã¨ mal ottimizzato e lockato a 720p.
Innumerevoli i glitch grafici e sonori.
Presenti crash occasionali, salvate la partita ogni volta che potete.
Graficamente mediocre, la situazione migliora col DPFix di Durante ma utilizzandolo i crash diventeranno certi dopo tot tempo di gioco, specialmente durante situazioni caotiche.
Buona narrativa, trae una forte ispirazione dalla serie tv Twin Peaks e identifica in Francis York Morgan il suo punto di forza.
OST tutto sommato piacevole, si alternano pezzi di dubbio gusto ad altri ben riusciti e adatti alla situazione.
Shooting system semplice da padroneggiare ma che spesso si rivela acerbo e scomodo, eventualmente gli si preferirÃ  un approccio melee, piÃ¹ svelto e sbrigativo.
Driving system TOTALMENTE da rivedere, guidare in questo gioco non Ã¨ affatto un piacere.

In definitiva: giocatelo solo se vi piacciono gli investigativi e/o Twin Peaks.

review:

Et citer Twin Peaks, Blue Velvet, Mulholland Drive ou bien encore Lost Highway n'y changera rien. De fait, si Deadly Premonition emprunte bien Ã  l'univers du cinÃ©aste amÃ©ricain, il faudra pouvoir s'affranchir d'une technique, d'un visuel et d'un gameplay dÃ©suets. Autant d'obstacles qu'il faudra braver pour dÃ©couvrir ce qui se cache derriÃ¨re cette alternative vidÃ©oludique Ã  l'un des shows TV les plus intangibles existants encore Ã  l'heure actuelle, ici prÃ©sente dans une version Director's Cut.

Les notes:

De nombreuses fautes d'orthographe
Pas mal de dialogues au son caverneux

En l'Ã©tat, on regrettera qu'Alan Wake n'ait pas fusionnÃ© avec Deadly Premonition, bien plus ambitieux sur certains points que l'oeuvre de Remedy. Plus proche de Twin Peaks que ne le fut le thriller psychologique finlandais, le soft nippon souffre nÃ©anmoins d'un nombre insurmontable de tares empÃªchant le joueur de se plonger pleinement dans ce monde Ã©trange. Au final, Deadly Premonition nous montre bien qu'un jeu vidÃ©o se doit avant tout de trouver un parfait Ã©quilibre entre la forme et le fond afin d'Ã©viter que l'oeuvre ne sombre dans un abÃ®me de mÃ©diocritÃ© duquel un synopsis, aussi bien rÃ©digÃ© soit-il, ne pourra l'en extirper.
