author: {'steamid': '76561197963010752', 'num_games_owned': 661, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 1232, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1232, 'last_played': 1434076458}
review:
This is the quintessential "so fucking bad it's good" game. Nothing else comes close. By the end you'll be questioning your sanity, asking god to smite you down, and screaming "WHY SWERY? WHY?"

"Very underrated." - York

author: {'steamid': '76561198014831291', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 1366, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1356, 'last_played': 1434242563}
review:
Ganz ehrlich: Ich war sehr unsicher, ob ich ein Daumen hoch oder runter geben sollte.
Zuerst die negativen Punkte:
Die Grafik ist sehr bescheiden, und nicht verstellbar. Muss man die Grafik durch Fixes aus dem Internet aufpeppen, ist schon mal etwas seltsam. 
Zudem ist das Spiel sehr buganfÃ¤llig, und es kann durchaus hin und wieder passieren, dass das Spiel abstÃ¼rzt. (Durch zahlreiche EintrÃ¤ge in Foren belegt). 
Dann noch etwas, das mich persÃ¶nlich ziemlich gestÃ¶rt hat: Das Spiel wiederholt einige VorgÃ¤nge und "Level" immer wieder, so dass man bald vorraussagen kann, was passieren wird, auch wenn man es zum ersten mal spielt, was meiner Meinung nach in einem Horrorspiel ein absolutes No-Go ist. 
Manchmal wird es durch die Riesenkarte auch etwas langweilig, da man vielleicht 10 Minuten stupides Autofahren Ã¼ben kann, um zum nÃ¤chsten Punkt zu gelangen.
Zum positiven: Ich mag die ganzen Figuren (vor allem York und Emily) 
und die Geschichte wird gut erzÃ¤hlt mit RÃ¼ckblenden und gewissen Hinweisen, welche die zukÃ¼nftigen Ereignisse andeuten. 
Auch das der Spieler als Zach eingebunden wird in die Geschichte finde ich genial. 
Die ganze AtmosphÃ¤re des Spiels (oder vor allem der Wechsel von Horror auf Krimi) ist super gelungen, der Spannungspegel steigt sofort, wenn man weiss, dass man jetzt vorsichtig sein muss.
Auch wenn die Grafik insgesamt wirklich traurig ist, muss man dennoch zugeben, dass das Spiel teilweise Bilder bietet, bei denen man staunen muss.
Alles in allem muss ich sagen, dass ich dieses Spiel zu dem Preis weiterempfehlen wÃ¼rde, trotz zahlreicher MÃ¤ngel. Wenn man jedoch ein perfektes Spiel erwartet zu diesem Preis, sollte man als Spieler die Finger davon lassen und sparen.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970725190', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 62, 'playtime_forever': 31, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 31, 'last_played': 1435347559}
review:
I have heard this game talked up for ages and wanted to play it for years. It finally comes on steam and is one of the worst most unplayable piles I have ever seen. I can't even get past the first area because the game decides I want to delete my melee weapon and can't break down a fence now. This port is utter garbage and a total scam that the publishers offload unto steam. As they are publishers they do not have any QA or vetting process restrictions and can drop whatever scum they want directly unto steam and clog up the store with shovelware. 

I have given this game a few tries just to get it to even run and now I can't get the control pad to actually do anything when I play. Total rip off.

author: {'steamid': '76561197967574905', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 186, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 138, 'last_played': 1646187431}
review: I wish I could give this a positive review, because the game itself it great. But the PC version is nearly unplayable. If you want to play Deadly Premonition (which you should, it's a great game) I'd recommend playing the xbox 360 version if it's available to you. I've tinkered with this game for hours and it still won't work, and it seems the developers have no intention of fixing this version of the game as it's been unplayable for years. I actually bought this when it first came out and gave up in frustration, and now, years later, it's still broken. I have to give this a thumbs down. Sorry.

author: {'steamid': '76561197978830939', 'num_games_owned': 420, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 81, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 81, 'last_played': 1433820477}
review:
I've not played a pc game as crash prone or broken since the original unpatched s.t.a.l.k.e.r.

Even with all the fixes and remedies you're going to need some luck to get through it.

I suggest just getting the console version even though that version isn't exactly stable neither but it's at least playable in some respects. 

Only because how poor the original console version does this game actually gets excused from being the worst pc port ever.

author: {'steamid': '76561198037089044', 'num_games_owned': 2095, 'num_reviews': 182, 'playtime_forever': 161, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 161, 'last_played': 1409016739}
review:
I loved the game, however it keeps crashing after hospital level no matter what I do.

I tried various fixes from all around the net, no use.

If you can get this game on a console OR you are confident it will work, you should definetly buy it, because it's a hidden gem.

HOWEVER, if you are unsure whether to buy it or not, don't risk.

author: {'steamid': '76561197968263647', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 613, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 613, 'last_played': 1433254230}
review:
It takes more to try to fix and work around all the different crashes and bugs this game has than actually finishing it.
If you're looking for the worst PC port ever made, here it is.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999110961', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 68, 'playtime_forever': 584, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 21, 'last_played': 1452676133}
review:
Really bad PC port. Can't even get past the opening video sequence in the beginning of the game without a crash. "Dp.exe has encountered a problem" and then crash to desktop.

This happens with DPfix AND without DPfix.

You may have better luck than me, but just to be safe, don't buy this game on Steam unless it's incredibly discounted in a sale. That way you won't lose much if it doesn't end up working.

It's a shame I wasn't able to get this working because it looks like a neat game otherwise. Just can't recommend such a sloppy port.

author: {'steamid': '76561198086450870', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 1165, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1144, 'last_played': 1432842329}
review: Gameplay isn't the best, but the story is good. One of the best games I ever played.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009593393', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 550, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 550, 'last_played': 1432838715}
review:
This game is amazing! It's almost like they took Patrick Bateman from American Psycho, and cast him individually as an FBI agent investigating a small town murder with a Silent Hill twist.

Unfortunately, you have to jump through hoops to get the game working, and god forbid you have 5.1 surround sound!

Unfortunately, going through the process of fixing the game, the game is still incredibly bugged, and is borderline unplayable. If this game functioned, I would give it a 9/10 (some gameplay elements are laughable). However, the sad reality is that you may end up wasting your money buying this game, especially if you are not persistent and willing to play through the many crashes that truly break the game's immersion.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049567850', 'num_games_owned': 830, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 534, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 479, 'last_played': 1586635701}
review: Most of my gameplay time is from redoing missions after I crash during cut scenes. It's almost as if the developers don't want me to play this game, Zach.

author: {'steamid': '76561198088775500', 'num_games_owned': 3174, 'num_reviews': 279, 'playtime_forever': 2688, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2563, 'last_played': 1433106321}
review:
[h1]â˜…â˜…â˜…â˜…â˜†[/h1]
Wonderfully great game, once you get past the graphics and driving you will find yourself enjoying a totally different type of game than what is available out there, I didn't go into the game thinking I'd like it much, but damn I was proven wrong, as the game progresses it just gets better, so if you're a fan of thriller/action/sandbox/murder-investigation you'll love this game, if not you could very possibly still be pleasantly surprised by this games story and gameplay style, so give it a try!

author: {'steamid': '76561198035606664', 'num_games_owned': 904, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 762, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 720, 'last_played': 1433442492}
review:
I really would like to finish playing this game but it keeps crashing on one of the loading screens in chapter 3.
I have tried a lot of the suggested solutions like: uncheck full screen, run in compatibility mode, run as administrator ...
- Like it should never be this hard to get a game to work.
What a pity.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999171047', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 2842, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2842, 'last_played': 1430893544}
review:
Lamentablemente aunque el juego en sÃ­ es bueno este port es pÃ©simo, algunos de los problemas que sufrÃ­:
Solo soporta monitores con formato 16/9 ( Esta indicado como requerimiento, pero me parece inaceptable )
El framerate empieza a 60 y a medida que pasa el tiempo cae hasta los 15, momento en el que es necesario reiniciar el      juego para que vuelva a ser jugable.
Crashes totalmente aleatorios.
Muy mala jugabilidad de los vehÃ­culos.
No hay opciones de grÃ¡ficos, lo que implica no poder cambiar la resoluciÃ³n, AA, AF, etc.
Cerca del fin del juego subirme a un vehiculo hacia que la pantalla se ponga totalmente negra.

El formato del monitor y las opciones de graficos se pueden solucionar usando "dpfix" creado por un usuario de steam, para el resto de los problemas no encontrÃ© soluciÃ³n definitiva, aunque dependiendo de el modo de compatibilidad bajo el cual se ejecute algunos empeoran y otros mejoran.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971811739', 'num_games_owned': 1876, 'num_reviews': 109, 'playtime_forever': 208, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 208, 'last_played': 1432067029}
review:
Maybe I missed something, maybe it's some cult classic I just don't get.
But this is one of the single most boring games I've played in a while...
The pace is so slow, I just couldn't stick with it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000388246', 'num_games_owned': 681, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2038, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2038, 'last_played': 1412332538}
review:
Likes: Story, the general feeling, the characters, the way it looks.

Dislikes: The crashes, the vehicle handling, the lack of official patches to fix the game.

This is a very strange game, it's a game I want to love, but the crashes ruin it a bit. It makes me think a bit of Vampire: The Masquerade - Bloodlines in that both games that could be held in the highest of regards if it weren't for some crashing (both improved due to fan made patches). The feel of the town and the characters will remind you of "Twin Peaks" a lot (at least did to me), your character is like a very strange version of Agent Cooper.

I recommend this game, as long as you don't mind the crashes too much (which can be fixed to an extent with unofficial patches available online).

author: {'steamid': '76561198064989269', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 907, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 405, 'last_played': 1698674407}

author: {'steamid': '76561198140667872', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 231, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 179, 'last_played': 1593716779}
review:
partiamo. io ho molti giochi nella mia lista dei desideri e molti di essi sono open world.un giorno mentre esploravo i titoli vidi questo deadly premonition che,nonostante la grafica datata,mi intricaava perchÃ¨ molti dissero che aveva una somilianza con heavy reain e , visto che non avevo una playstation 3 per giocarci, mi comprai una ricarica credito steam da 20 euro e lo acquistai a 2 euro con i saldi. non lo avessi mai fatto. il gioco partÃ¬ e subito si udi una canzone penso in tedesco. appena iniziato il gioco iniziÃ² un filmato che non centrava una beata minchia col gioco in se. appena partito il gioco mi ritrovai il bug che rovinÃ² tutta l'esperienza di gioco( che senza questo difetto un 7 se lo sarebbe meritato) : la telecamera vorticosa. mio dio volevo vomitare. pensate a quanto sia difficile giocare tutto il gioco con quella telecamera. dopo aver fatto la parte iniziale ti ritrovi nella cittadina . devo dire che i personaggi sono ben caratterizzati e caarismtici ,ma il suono Ã¨ penoso visto che i rumori e i suoni sono presi dall' atari ( scusa farenz se hopreso una tua citazione). 


pro:

buona caratterizazione  dei personaggi
battute divertenti e irriverenti situazioni
ottima interazione con l'ambiente

contro: 
telecamera vorticosa
tecnicamente ps2 
sonoro disastroso
pessimo free roaming

author: {'steamid': '76561198209374776', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 642, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 166, 'last_played': 1493316492}
review: Deadly Premonition: The Director's Cut brings you to a place where bizzarre and weird things happened in somewhat seems like you are in a dream...either way the story line is quite interesting where the more you play the more it will make you go deeper into what seems to be a mystery all along...I really recommend this game who loves to watch movies like "I Know What You Did Last Summer"...(^_^)

author: {'steamid': '76561198177622990', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 2656, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2550, 'last_played': 1430976979}
review: Twin Peaks, Resident Evil, and Silent Hill all mushed into a glorious biscuit. Unlocking fast-travel early on and saving frequently is what enabled me to enjoy this incredibly buggy game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197990984596', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1804, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1804, 'last_played': 1431297170}
review:
Quite possibly the only game that is both so bad that it's good, and legitimately great at the same time.

A weird, clunky, and absolutely engrossing gem unlike anything else out there.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000723673', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 100, 'playtime_forever': 23, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 23, 'last_played': 1431319570}
review:
Deadly Premonition. What can I say?
This game is known for being a Twin Peaks-esque cult classic that is easy to overlook as being horrible in every way, yet somehow pulling it all together perfectly.

Unfortunately, it's also notorious on the forums as being nigh unplayable by most people. I unfortunately am faced with the problem. Even after running a mandatory fix for the game, that only got me as far as the mandatory unskippable 5 minute opening cut-scene. Only after this part is over does my game crash every time. After trying a few different methods of fixing it, I concluded that this game is completely broken and not worth the time.

This is a game that I wanted to fall in love with and recommend to all, but I just can't in good conscience do.
If you're absolutely determined to play this game, then by all means purchase it for 90% off, but DON'T pay the full amount, and DON'T expect this game to work for you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198161484773', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 1759, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1642, 'last_played': 1654439541}
review: The best detective game ever. You get to talk to yourself and chase potential suspects around in their daily lives like follow them to the club or grocery store. Be prepared this game is so good you will talk to yourself and develop a close alter ego.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044293543', 'num_games_owned': 652, 'num_reviews': 62, 'playtime_forever': 1328, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1328, 'last_played': 1430634207}
review: It's buggy, and the zombies never make sense. The bad parts are... really bad. But the good parts are excellent. This is definitely one you want to pick up on sale. I'd recommend it at full price if the developers fixed the crashing, but let's face it, that's never going to happen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046816686', 'num_games_owned': 302, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 668, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 606, 'last_played': 1456966409}
review:
I really want to say yes to this game. Great music, Great story and just like twin peaks. To bad that they sell you the game broken and you need to go into the game files to fix it. Then you need a fan patch to get a playable frame rate and hope it dons't keep crashing on you. 

Everybody has this problem. I did my time trying to get this game to run but it refuses to co-operate. Can get maybe an hour or two in before another problem pops up.

author: {'steamid': '76561198012136406', 'num_games_owned': 582, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 301, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 299, 'last_played': 1430932005}
review:
Have you wondered what would happen if you replaced everyone in  RE4 with ham actors? Well wonder no more cause that's what Deadly Premonition is, delicious ham acting. Yeah there are times that the voices would change tone mid-conversation, and the driving is pure-crap but that's ok the story makes up for it so much. 

9/10 wish it had less bugs

P.S. You shoot a tree with moving hands, just so you can get a hand shaped doorknob.

author: {'steamid': '76561198172755715', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 2859, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2848, 'last_played': 1430002489}
review:
Si Twin Peaks fuese un videojuego, serÃ­a algo como esto.
Opiniones encontradas con este juego, no por sÃ­ mismo sino por el desastre de port que ha hecho Access Games.
Historia absorbente a mÃ¡s no poder, que harÃ¡ que pases horas en el pueblo de Greenvale sin apenas darte cuenta. Un pueblo, ademÃ¡s, muy rico en personajes a cada cual mÃ¡s variopinto.
Sin embargo, el apartado tÃ©cnico es otra historia. Obviando el tema grÃ¡fico, la adaptaciÃ³n que se ha hecho del juego a PC es un desastre absoluto. DifÃ­cil de ejecutar, cuelgues aleatorios, bajos FPS, resoluciÃ³n relativamente baja... Gracias a que existe una comunidad suficientemente rica que ha desarrollado un parche (DPfix), este juego es "jugable" (aunque no se consiguen eliminar muchos errores).
En resumen: por la historia y el juego en si, altamente recomendado. A mi, personalmente, fan de la serie de David Lynch, me ha encantado. Eso si, hay que armarse de paciencia a la hora de enfretarse a el.

review: I tried to like this, it's just the right kinda weird to be interestging, but it is a bug riddled mess, and one of the worst PC ports I've seen in a while. review:
Obra maestra con todas las letras.

La jugabilidad es bastante tosca y los grÃ¡ficos podrÃ­an haberse mejorado para el "Director's Cut" pero toda eso queda en un segundo plano por la historia, el desarrollo de los personajes, su humor y la mÃºsica.

Juegazo en toda regla si te logra enganchar la pedazo de historia que te espera en "Greenvale", recomendado!

author: {'steamid': '76561198033835837', 'num_games_owned': 1884, 'num_reviews': 329, 'playtime_forever': 1494, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1494, 'last_played': 1427275436}
review: Deadly Premonition is a game that David Lynch would have created had he been a Japanese game developer. It is strikingly similar to the television show Twin Peaks and one of the characters even bares an uncanny resemblance to an actress who played in 'Mulholland Drive', Naomi Watts. It's obvious the game's developers drew heavy inspiration from the show and Lynch's other works. If you ever wanted to play as Dale Cooper in a world so bizarre, spliced with elements of Silent Hill, then this is probably your best and only bet. Just be prepared for what is truly terrifying... a terrible PC port. Save often.

author: {'steamid': '76561198069490363', 'num_games_owned': 2597, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 348, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 290, 'last_played': 1434622038}
review:
Basically Twin Peaks but made into a game

Pros
-So many side missions
-Soundtrack (actually pretty good)
-Subtitles (Big and Easy to read)
-Reminds me of Resident Evil 4 (Probably the Graphics, Specific save points, over the shoulder gameplay and the BIG Subtitles)
-York is so quirky
-Characters are all so unique in some way (E.g. Gay Assistant, Thomas)
-Humor
-Quite lengthy

Cons
-Its a port
-Minor Hiccups
-Driving sections

Overall, some might say that this game is bad because of its outdated PS2 graphics and other it being a port and all but honestly, those people don't see the the good points, what good points you may ask? The over-the-top humor, a range of memorable characters & Nostalgic gameplay (RE4). I would say this game is worth a buy but you'll probably only during a sale since the game is kinda old and at $25 you can get other better games and besides its like $2.49 during a sale.

Score: Get during Sale
Final Verdict: 8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198010556344', 'num_games_owned': 292, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 166, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 166, 'last_played': 1428647624}
review: This game has wierd amusing moments, intriging story, some puzzles I ran into were kind of interesting and  there were alot of strange side activites that I found. I understand why this game was a cult hit. HOWEVER, the pc port of this game is terrible. Locked resolution that cant be changed unless you get the fix developed by someone outside the company that made this game (Which by the way, may or may not work for some people.... which it didnt work for me unless I used windowed mode LAME). Without the fix this game looks like garbage and what I would expect from a playstation 1 game. Awful controls, hit or miss voice acting (which wasnt that big a deal for me), terrible combat system, AND GAME CRASHES are also present in the game. If the developer actually took the time to fix some of these things in the directors cut and properly ported it to the pc, this may have been a fun experince. But since the game controls bad and crashes often, not to metion the resolution debacle, I would recommend you get the console version of this game or watch lets play on youtube or whatever

author: {'steamid': '76561198097064548', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 3451, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3131, 'last_played': 1428593069}
review:
This game has a lot of flaws: the graphic is terrible, the sounds ridiculous and the controls are awkward at best, not to mention the many grammar mistakes...
So you'll have to trust me on this: you will LOVE it.
Its atmosphere... the music.. the crazy and interesting characters... and the plot twists! God, don't even get me started on the plot twists!
It'sreally amazing.

Just an advice though: if you can get the console version instead of the pc one do it. Just do it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198090710690', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 1238, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1068, 'last_played': 1493287483}
review: If you can handle doing stuff over and over and over again because a cutscene always crashes, and figure out how to get it not to crash "press enter, skip the cutscene" Then yes I do recommend this game. It's equally hillarious and horrifying. It's basically "Twin Peaks" the video game. Lynch actually sued the creators. The main character is basically completely insane. Think "Barry" and "other Barry" from the show Archer. Im 3 chapters in, so not a full review, but I haven't loved a game this much since Psychonauts. Does it glitch out and crash constantly, yes, is it incredibly frustrating because you're loving the game and have to start over from the last save point up to five times before you figure out a workaround and can proceed? Oh hell yes. Is it worth it? In my oppinion, Yes. I went into this knowing the Port was screwed and I still love it. Port is totally horrible, but to play as a schizophrenic FBI agent is worth it, isn't it Zach? Play the game you'll get that last joke.

author: {'steamid': '76561198029260793', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 204, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 204, 'last_played': 1419724720}
review:
I bought this on sale for $5. I couldnt even imagine spending more.

The game is riddled with bugs and frequent crashes and the controls feel clunky and uncomfortable.  

The gameplay isnt really that good but the story and music are interesting and are just enough to justify buying it on sale. I can understand the almost seemlingly visual manifestation of something like Macintosh Plus (music) mixed in with heavy influences of Twin Peaks. The music is strange and it makes the whole experience and vibe strange, in a good way.  

Unless you like bizarre experimental type games that does not take it self seriously and/or a big fan of Twin Peaks or anything like that then I would skip this unless you can get it for $5 or less.

author: {'steamid': '76561197981539432', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 357, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 356, 'last_played': 1451578142}
review:
Although I never actually played through the game (watched SGF's LP of it), I WOULD recommend buying it. The controls are shit, graphics are dated a bit and bland, optimisation is awful (last time I checked), but the story, characters and voice acting are fenomenal. Everyone should at least watch a playthrough of it.

Buy it to support it. That's why I bought it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045604657', 'num_games_owned': 481, 'num_reviews': 115, 'playtime_forever': 17, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 17, 'last_played': 1442270624}
review:
I wasn't even able to play the game, the support is awfull, and the online help useless. I let the game run for 5 minutes just to warn you about this abomination. Dont buy it!!!

This is an update in my review.
After some time I managed to solve the crash on start problem.
The game is useful, just a pretentious game, with graphics from ps2. Is not a survival horror game in any way. You have infinities bullets, the enemies are really easy to kill, and not scary at all. The story is a little interesting but just for a couple of minutes, before it's pretentiousness kill all the mood. Above all it has a quick time event mechanics in the encounters with the main monster. 
Do not buy it!!

author: {'steamid': '76561197991981579', 'num_games_owned': 1232, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 429, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 429, 'last_played': 1427927993}
review:
I hate to not recommend this game, but I feel I must. 

The gameplay and graphics are fine. The story, what I did play, was intriguing.

However, I can't recommend a game that crashes on average every 30 minutes.

There's no rhyme or reason to the crashes. Could be during a loading screen, or just while you're wandering around.

You might lose a few minutes on a crash, or be set way back. 

As neat and interesting as it is, a game you can't play just isn't worth it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198051742400', 'num_games_owned': 1503, 'num_reviews': 179, 'playtime_forever': 1142, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1101, 'last_played': 1427910604}
review:
Questo gioco Ã¨ la prova vivente che i giochi anche se possono essere graficamente sottotono possono comunque essere perle videoludiche, e questo gioco ne Ã¨ la prova, persino Ã¨ entrato nella mia lista dei giochi piÃ¹ spettacolare che ho giocato nella mia vita videoludica e adesso Ã¨ diventato uno dei miei preferiti giochi Horror/Investigazione, spero tanto in un Sequel.
La trama Ã¨ spettacolare e non vi stancherete mai dall'inizio alla fine del gioco, il gioco parla di un Assassino che uccide le sue vittime, tagliando le lingue e lasciando in bocca dei particolari semi rossi, e voi dovrete scoprire chi Ã¨ l'Assassino, durante il gioco scoprirete che in questo Paesino gira una leggenda, in cui quando piove nelle strade si gira un'assassino che uccide le donne e viene chiamato "L'assassino dell'impermeabile", ed Ã¨ proprio lui che uccide le vittime e voi dovrete scoprire chi Ã¨ l'assassino, vi dirÃ² in anticipo che ci saranno MOLTISSIMI colpi di scena, per questo AMO questo gioco alla follia, per avere una trama veramente spettacolare.
La grafica Ã¨ sottotono diciamo "Grafica PS2" ma non Ã¨ male allo stesso tempo, ma la storia del gioco giustifica la grafica  non perfetta del gioco.
Le animazioni sono un pÃ² lineari e robotiche, ma come ho detto sopra la storia giustifica veramente tutto di questo gioco, che per quanto vi incuriosite sulla storia non ne fate nemmeno caso di queste particolaritÃ .
La longevitÃ  Ã¨ molto buona circa 20-25 ore, e puÃ² anche allungarsi visto che ci sono missioni secondarie e collezionabili.
I personaggi di questo gioco mi sono veramente piaciuti, sopratutto il protagonista, che farÃ  delle battute divertente ed Ã¨ molto "misterioso" andando avanti nella storia capirete cosa intendo.
Consiglio l'acquisto ASSOLUTAMENTE, perchÃ¨ questo gioco MERITA di essere comprato e giocato, spero moltissimo in un Sequel.

Pro:

+ Trama spettacolare
+ LongevitÃ  molto alta
+ Personaggi carismatici
+ Missioni secondarie
+ Horror/Investigazione
+ Suono
+ Spero Sequel

Con:

- Grafica sottotono
- Animazioni 

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
English

This game is living proof that the games even if they can be graphically undertone can still be pearl gaming, and this game is proof, even came into my list of the most spectacular games I've played in my life and now gaming has become one of my favorite games Horror / Investigation, so I hope in a Sequel.
The plot is spectacular and you will never tire from the beginning to the end of the game, the game is about a Murderess that kills its victims by cutting the languages and leaving in the mouth of the special red seeds, and you must find out who is the Murderess During the game you will find that in this village runs a legend, in which when it rains in the streets turns un'assassino that kills women and is called "The murderess Raincoat", and it is he who kills victims and you you'll have to find out who the murderess, I will tell you in advance that there will be MANY twists, for this I LOVE this game to madness, to have a plot really spectacular.
The graphics are subdued say "Graphic PS2" but not bad at the same time, but the story of the game justifies the graphics of the game is not perfect.
The animations are a little linear and robotic, but as I said above the story really justifies everything about this game, which as you curious about the history you do not even notice these peculiarities.
Longevity is very good about 20-25 hours, and may even stretch as there are side missions and collectibles.
The characters in this game I really liked them, especially the protagonist, who will make the jokes funny and is very "mysterious" going on in the story you will understand what I mean.
ABSOLUTELY recommend buying, because this game DESERVES to be bought and played, I hope very much in a Sequel.

Pro:

+ Plot spectacular
+ Longevity very high
+ Charismatic characters
+ Quests
+ Horror / Investigation
+ Sound
+ I hope Sequel

Con:

- Graphics undertone
- Animations

author: {'steamid': '76561198115108128', 'num_games_owned': 537, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 2173, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1700, 'last_played': 1437072268}
review:
Honestly, this game is worth every dollar. 

The downside for me was the numerous lags. The game in itself wasn't difficult but I had to look for ''walkthrough'' to avoid the lags and be able to keep playing, which is a shame really. The game in itself is a melting pot of humor, horror and drama. The story and characters are awesome and makes you want to keep playing to know what happens next. 

For me, this was a little gem and I'm recommending it for anyone who wants something a little different.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000906795', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1225, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1179, 'last_played': 1427733233}
review:
I just wanted to give a heads up about the current situation of the game. 
In other reviews I read about problems with the game that I did not encounter when playing the game over the last weeks. It might have been patched or maybe there is new information on how to get the game running.

It should be clear that this is by no means a perfect port, but I was able to complete it with only running into some minor problems.
Over the near 20hours of playing I experienced a total of 4 crashes, 2 of which where that DP.exe stopped working and 2 frozen screens that had me restart the PC. No framerate drop or other things that stopped me from playing.

When I first started the game it would always tell me that DP.exe did not work. The fix for that was to go into the Games folder: Steam/SteamApps/Common/Deadly Premonition The director's cut/redist
There you find the file: PhysX_SystemSoftware.msi
Right click Repair stopped the DP.exe from crashing and let me play the game. The error might occur again after some time when trying to start the game, so you might have to do this from time to time again when starting the game.
Apart from 2 times the error did not occur while actually playing the game.

I played the game under Windows 8.


If you bought the game a while ago and where unable to play it, maybe now is the time that it finally works.



Apart from these difficulties I really enjoyed the game. 
The negative sites are the boring and repeatitive combat and some very annoying quick-time-events (especially when playing on keyboard).
For me the story, atmosphere and gerneral experience where worth getting through this. Therefore I recommend this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025942897', 'num_games_owned': 475, 'num_reviews': 101, 'playtime_forever': 324, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 278, 'last_played': 1494983781}
review:
One of the worst ports ever. The game is a delight but I can't say bad fps, crashes, or potential save loses are worth experiencing from this version.

I recommend playing the original on the Xbox Series/One consoles via backwards compatibility. There is the PS3 or Switch versions, however the framerate is so terrible on those so its hard to recommend. 

There is the Directors Cut via RPCS3 (PS3 emulator) that was a solid 60fps and no crashes from my brief playtime on a 2070S and 3700x

I do not recommend playing it off Steam, sadly.

author: {'steamid': '76561197964134361', 'num_games_owned': 819, 'num_reviews': 344, 'playtime_forever': 2779, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2592, 'last_played': 1438567110}
review:
Heyyo,
"Do you feel it, Zach? My coffee warned me about it." Err... what? lol. Yep! This is a weird game... but weird in a good way. An oddly budget feeling, good way indeed. :P

I want to start this recommendation off with the major strength of this game and what will have you coming back despite the flawed gameplay and that is the story. You play as Fracis York Morgan, "But please, just call me York. That's what everyone calls me." Is the main character of the game who came to a small town to investigate a supernatural murder case and try to solve the mystery of why his most recent cases all have red seeds in them and where they are coming from.

The small town is filled with a pretty diverse set of characters and I think thatâ€™s the biggest strength in this game. Itâ€™s interesting to hear what they have to say and what kind of odd or oddly humorous things they have to say.

The gameplay, as stated earlier? Yep, itâ€™s quite flawed haha. The controls feel a little clunky and the aiming takes a while to get used to and donâ€™t flow as smoothly as for example Resident Evil 4 or 5.
The worst offender in the gameplay though? The vehicles. There is a small open town to drive around and the camera can give you motion sickness due to a bug that they never fixed in this port... For example, when you turn your car to the left? The camera pans slightly to the right and vise-versa. It messes with your brain and I found for the first few hours that yes, I was getting headaches or even a little nauseous as youâ€™d expect the camera to pan in the same direction of the vehicle.

Second? The vehicles physics are some kind of weird mix between Mafia 1â€™s and those budget games youâ€™d find on a rack at a gas station. Vehicles constantly clip in the ground when taking the exploratory paths, taking some corners too fast cause your vehicle to flip way too easily as if the weight of the vehicle is non-existent in this calculation and the engine sounds can sometimes be quite annoying.

So yeahâ€¦ vehicles? Definitely the worst part of the game. They will annoy the crap out of you. In  the PS2 era this game came out? We had good arcade vehicle physics from the likes of GTA 3 as a prime example of how they should have gone about it. But? I donâ€™t know the development cycle and I donâ€™t know their budget (which feels VERY tight btw) so this may have been an area that they didnâ€™t focus inâ€¦ but at least they should have fixed the damn camera pan when they made this PC port. :P
Oh, one warning about this port? It can be quite unstable. As nice as it is you get bonus points for remembering to use phones (to manually save your game) there are times you will get screwed over especially during side-missions where the game will crash and cost you time if you donâ€™t saveâ€¦ so itâ€™s up to you if you wish to use manual or auto saving (toggled in the options menu).

There are guides out there to resolving this, but I found using either Windows XP SP3 compatibility mode or Windows Vista (no service packs) got me through the full game along with this precompiled mod setup found here:
http://www.gog.com/forum/deadly_premonition_directors_cut/essentail_mods

Hope this helpsâ€¦ so says, Mr. Stuart. ;)

review:
My coffee warned me that I would have my balls chopped off by an axe-weilding madman in a raincoat if I didn't leave this review.

The port is horrendous, but if you have the patience to go through the fixes listed here ( http://pcgamingwiki.com/wiki/Deadly_Premonition:_The_Director%27s_Cut ), the game is playable and it's story will make up for any disapointments in gameplay.

You will laugh, cry, laugh, be afraid, have feels, and then laugh again.

author: {'steamid': '76561197965383380', 'num_games_owned': 239, 'num_reviews': 64, 'playtime_forever': 1459, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1459, 'last_played': 1415358004}
review:
This is the worst PC-port that I have ever seen. It constantly crashes and sometimes it won't start at all, without rebooting windows. There are some fixes and fanmade patches, but even these don't help that much. The game mechanics are rather bad, driving feels like from some bad 90's game and it's hard to believe that this was PS3 title, not PS2.

But even with all the crashing and very poor game design I still highly recommend this title. It's like Twin Peaks meets Resident Evil. It's kind of open world game, but actually there aren't much activities you can do, only some boring side quests that doesn't connect with the main story. 

The characters are lovable and interesting, you get attached to them just like watching Twin Peaks. Be ready for story twists and for very strange storyline, it keeps you playing to the very end, because you need to know what happens next.

author: {'steamid': '76561197979963295', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 1610, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1310, 'last_played': 1569055951}
review:
*Okay, before I say you should get Deadly Premonition, I must state that you should exercise caution into buying this PC port for the game. It is a terrible port from what I've been told and have experienced. However, though I think I'm only about halfway done with the game I have only experienced 1 crash so far... thought it was game breaking until I switched to Administrator mode for the game and the compatability for win 98.*

So far... this is one of those games that's so bad that it's good... And I mean that in a way in which no matter what platform you play it on, it will have some faults, but just the fun, interest in the plot, and characters and what not are gonna get you hooked on this game. If I play a bad game it's usually to torture myself for an audience, but this is a game that is instead very enjoyable even with it's faults.

The dialogue is some of the most ridiculous you'll ever hear and it is just god damned beautiful. It feels like a B-Movie on a low budget, but the director and the actors would have fun with it if it were an actual movie (which by the way the main character while driving WILL tell you some interesting movie trivia). The characters are for the most part likable and each have their own personality.... and... tend to overexaggerate their gestures while talking (seems to be very on purpose in all of it). The music is really damn good in my opinion. When the song, "Life is Beatiful," plays it will get stuck in your head, and it always seems to play at some of the most unappropriate spots.... just... making the situation that much wierder (perhaps it plays at such spots because it what the main character, York, feels at that moment.... simplicity in life). 

The controls, on the other hand.. are what set me off a bit.... So many times I wish I could walk or run while I shoot a gun or swing a crowbar, but instead I am locked in place and can only aim. Seems to be a control sceme that even older Resident Evil games suffered through. The driving in the game is very weird to me as well. You can buy new cars in the game, each with it's set of speed and steering difficulties. However, I found myself always having trouble turning or turning too hard and spinning out... or hell even parts of the road that will have the car think it's Ryu or Ken from Street Fighter doing the Hurricane Kick! 

One more gripe I HAVE to mention with the game is the map. It is one of the most difficult maps I've ever had to handle for one SIMPLE reason... It cannot zoom out far enough to properly know how to get from point A to point B, unless it is directly related to a plotpoint mission. If I want to do some side missions or go to the diner or gas station, I have to either start at my car and pan up the map until I HOPE to see a path that will take me to my desired location, OR I have to flip through set locations using the left or right bumpers on my controller and then from there try to search for the location of my car. It is very annoying, tedious, and frustrating. It would have been nice to either be able to zoom out even further to see more of the map, or even if there is a way to set your own waypoints like the game does for you when you have to proceed with the plot (seriously.... if there is a way to do that and I just can't find out, please message me and tell me how! Would help me greatly!!!).

With all that has been said, I still really enjoy this game and would recommend it! Just take caution, however, that it MAY or MAY NOT work on your pc, not matter what your specs are. Youtuber and Twitch Streamer Cryotic stated he can't get this game working on his rather powerful gaming set up, and yet I'm able to play this on a rather standard laptop myself, so... you have been warned... it may not work. I took the risk and was able to fix my one crashing issue thankfully by switching the compatability and turning on admin mode. Also do NOT GET THE DPFIX JUST YET!!!! It is still in alpha and needs to be throughally updated before it will do any sort of good... Tried it, and had to reinstall the game to make it work again... 

Anyhow, I talked on far too long. The bottom line is this is a good game! Give it a shot! If too afraid for the PC version, try it on xbl or psn!

author: {'steamid': '76561198071985647', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1560, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1560, 'last_played': 1427463747}
review:
Con unos grÃ¡ficos terribles y unos problemas bastante graves me veo en la obligaciÃ³n de recomendar este juego. Va a ser muy difÃ­cil que si no lo coges con muchas, muchÃ­simas ganas llegues a jugar mÃ¡s de dos horas pues el control es realmente pÃ©simo. A parte, la dificultad es muy sencilla (supongo que para paliar los problemas de control) y a pesar de que hay algÃºn que otro puzzle la complejidad de estos nunca llega a ser muy alta. Para colmo de males el juego estÃ¡ lleno de glitches e incluso alguna crasheo ocasional (aunque lo arreglaron en un Ãºltimo parche, o eso leÃ­, yo lo terminÃ© antes asÃ­ que no lo pude comprobar) y para completar el pack, el juego cuenta con una cuestionable traducciÃ³n en la que faltan ciertos caracteres de nuestro idioma ademÃ¡s de otros fallos.

Â¿Por quÃ© recomendar este juego entonces? En primer lugar, el argumento. No es que sea el mejor argumento que hemos visto en un videojuego, pero el caso es que estÃ¡ repleto de personajes geniales, toques surrealistas y secuencias muy divertidas todo metido en un ambiente de misterio. AdemÃ¡s, este juego es un homenaje enorme a Twin Peaks, si te gustÃ³ la serie, debes darle una oportunidad pues los guiÃ±os, referencias, plagios, etc, estÃ¡n por doquier y sinceramente se disfruta mucho.

El juego es una suerte de sandbox bastante vacÃ­o pero con sus misiones secundarias y un sistema de "horas" que hace que te apremie la situaciÃ³n y decidas que hacer con tu tiempo. Puede llegar a agobiar, pero le da un toque de realismo a la experiencia. Digo que es un sandbox vacÃ­o, sÃ­. Pero en cuanto a los elementos grÃ¡ficos en Ã©l. A pesar de eso contamos con un nÃºmero interesante de misiones secundarias, en general con tramas o situaciones bastante absurdas y divertidas.

La mÃºsica es otro elemento bastante curioso del juego. En general los temas estÃ¡n a un gran nivel. Pero el montaje realizado en algunas escenas es... Â¿muy japonÃ©s? Es difÃ­cil de explicar. El juego cuenta con un gran nÃºmero de escenas cÃ³micas entre los personajes protagonistas y hay un tema muy especÃ­fico para esas situaciones; el caso es que este tema tambiÃ©n suena en ciertas escenas dramÃ¡ticas o el cambio de una escena dramÃ¡tica a una cÃ³mica es tan brusco que resulta... sorprendente, que no malo, ojo.

Poco mÃ¡s tengo que decir, el control del movimiento del personaje, de la cÃ¡mara, de las fases de disparo, las de conducciÃ³n... es lo mÃ¡s terrible del conjunto pues unos grÃ¡ficos malos se pueden pasar fÃ¡cilmente por alto, pero el control es un tema mÃ¡s escabroso... aun asÃ­, si logras jugar lo suficiente como para que te hayas acostumbrado vas a encontrar una trama muy interesante repleta de extraÃ±os personajes, momentos muy divertidos y el homenaje mÃ¡s grande a Twin Peaks que se ha hecho en un videojuego.

SÃ­, yo lo recomiendo, pero avisados estais.

author: {'steamid': '76561198209168836', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 59, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 59, 'last_played': 1427201939}
review: Worst game I have ever played!  I am a big fan of mystery/adventure games and this game and controls were absolutley awful and half the time couldn't even make out where I was going and kept bumping into nothing. The "ghost" at the beginning was laughable and reminded me of something out of the grudge. I did not even finish this game and turned it off after 5 minutes of playing as I was fed up and bored. Sorry but if you are a fan of adventure games like me , I do not recommend this game as it will be a big disappointment. I want a refund even if was Â£1.99

author: {'steamid': '76561198021838317', 'num_games_owned': 144, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 904, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 819, 'last_played': 1427989529}
review:
Deadly Premonition is like the old cadillac you found in your grandpa's barn after he passed away. 

Getting it to work will give you all sorts of headaches, and more often than not, you just want to lock the barn and forget all about the damn thing. But if you actually manage to put up with all the crap it throws at you and manage to make it work, you're rewarded with a ride that's both, unique and unforgettable. 

Easily one of the best and worst games I've ever played.

author: {'steamid': '76561198059214582', 'num_games_owned': 313, 'num_reviews': 99, 'playtime_forever': 444, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 444, 'last_played': 1427059051}
review:
Its not the worst game on steam and makes for a good story.. but the graphics and gameplay are absymal especially the PC mouse and keyboard controls.

The guidance system and world map are trash I wish there were mods to fix this.

The worst part of the game for me is the driving element. THe map is huge but there isnt anything worthwhile to see or do on it, the sleep and eating mandate as well as waiting around for the right time to start your investigation are nothing but tedium.

Most wont be able to get past the fact that the game has visuals from 2006 at best.

review: This is one of the worst game I have ever played. Once you're actually able to run it(you'll probably have to google a fix like I did) be prepared... bad gfx, bad voice acting, bad story, bad controls, bad gameplay. Don't buy it, even if it's on special.

author: {'steamid': '76561198130371789', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 1391, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1391, 'last_played': 1427259516}
review: Lo 1Âº decir que este juego empezo a programarse allÃ¡ por 2003 para Playstation 2 , ( originalmente Rainywoods ) , y acabo recalando en la siguiente generaciÃ³n de rebote, asi que su apartado grafico es mas cercano al de una Ps2 que al de 360 o ps3 , los efectos de luces , sombras , animaciones etc. son de esa generaciÃ³n , si te haces a esa idea disfrutaras de un juego largo y entretenido , donde la historia y los personajes te atraparan sin remisiÃ³n , recuerda a ciertos juegos de la extinta consola Dreamcast , en muchos sentidos ..... , el control de combate del que se quejan muchos usuarios no es para nada malo y obedece a problemas de diseÃ±o del juego, cuando atacas con armas de mano , tu personaje se mueve y golpea como lo harian los de Silent Hill, cuando disparas tu personaje queda estatico y has de mover la reticula para afinar punteria ( como en D2 de Dreamcast y salvando las distancias,) esto no es malo ya que los enemigos tienen poca IA y si tu personaje pudiera moverse mientras dispara ya seria mas facil de lo que es , ( los enfrentamientos con los enemigos no entraÃ±an un reto serio ) , el control de conducciÃ³n de los coches es sin duda lo peor del juego hasta que te habituas,el diseÃ±o de personajes es muy cinematografico  ( Nuestro personaje parece un clon de Paul Newman en Harper detective privado, o la ayudante del comisario que es identica a Naomi WattsÂ´) , el resto de personajes van de lo gracioso a lo extraÃ±o y recuerdan a los de la serie Twin Peaks , algo normal ya que este juego en sus inicios iba a ser un homenaje descarado a dicha serie , hay mucho que investigar , misiones secundarias y coleccionables que cojer,si le das una oportunidad descubriras un juego que si hubiera tenido unos valores de producciÃ³n mas altos y se hubiera usado un motor grafico como el de ( por ejemplo ) Alan Wake , estariamos ante un triple A y de seguro juego de culto, ademas solo 3 euros de oferta en la store, lo unico que queda ahora es esperar a que saquen algun parche que solucione los diferentes crasheos del juego ( DP.EXE dejo de funcionar) , que de momento tiene este juego, tenlo tambien en cuenta antes de comprarlo. Por ultimo mira esto y sabras por donde iban los tiros   https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=PMZmCFogWlg

author: {'steamid': '76561198019345528', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 561, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 506, 'last_played': 1427025681}
review:
NON COMPRATE QUESTO GIOCO!

O, almeno, non su pc. Dopo averci giocato diverse ore (premetto che era forse il gioco console che attendevo di piÃ¹ su pc), potrei parlarne benissimo: trama interessante, personaggi ben riusciti, grande atmosfera, humour e citazioni a manetta. La grafica Ã¨ brutta, ok, le animazioni e i suoni pure, ma alla fine non Ã¨ niente di cosÃ¬ scandaloso. Se la storia prende, si passa oltre senza problemi.

Non si passa invece oltre sui problemi tecnici: appena si ha la possibilitÃ  di affrontare in libertÃ  la vasta mappa free-roaming, parte il festival del crash. Crash mentre si viaggia in auto, crash mentre si esplora a piedi, crash durante i caricamenti e crash se si prova ad aprire il menu delle missioni secondarie. Sui forum si trovano miliardi di fix e workaround ma almeno nel mio caso niente Ã¨ stato risolutivo, ho buttato solo via tempo.

Se avete una ps3 o una 360 Ã¨ STRACONSIGLIATO, su pc non spendeteci neanche un euro.

AGGIORNAMENTO
Ho recuperato questo titolo su PS3. Framerate ridicolo di quella versione a parte, ho potuto godermelo come si deve. Ho terminato la trama (e fatto un bel po' di sidequest) in 30 ore e sono assolutamente soddisfatto.
Nel frattempo un mio amico lo ha terminato su pc: se non si prova a fare le missioni secondarie in qualche modo sembra si riesca ad arrivare alla fine della storia, anche se Ã¨ andato incontro a problemi di qualsiasi tipo. Quindi, considerando che spesso si trova ad un paio d'euro, si puÃ² anche fare. Ma uomo avvisato...

Propongo qui il mio pensiero a caldo, scritto dopo aver finito il gioco:
http://sessantananosecondi.it/deadly-premonition/

author: {'steamid': '76561198045080783', 'num_games_owned': 424, 'num_reviews': 121, 'playtime_forever': 1884, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1884, 'last_played': 1418679293}
review:
The most of the game can be divided into three separate parts
one part sandbox, with mini-games, collectibles and all the awkward conversations you will get yourself into (best part)
one part slow boring zombies, (you have a pistol with infinite ammo), the phasing zombies appear after the half point
one part QTE boss encounters (not battles) with instant death failures.

As for the story, it initially seemed like a typical murder mystery, but the detective had moments where he was day dreaming where the undead were after him. But by the end you are not sure what is real or how to explain it.

The game also has Boss battles, but are both at the end with multiple stages, hope you are full with medkits.

Besides all that, it was a great game, but it takes a while for it to get going.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053058218', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 1485, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1064, 'last_played': 1426809071}
review:
I have rated this game as positive as it has a very different style and is atmospheric. Realistically what is needed is an intermediate option. Design wise this game reminds me of something that belongs on a PS1/PS2. Most importantly this game is designed for a console not pc. The cut scenes, music and feel of the game is similar to Japanese titles. The game play and menu layout hasn't been adapted for PC it almost doesn't take into account that you would be using a mouse. Perhaps a 360 controller or one of the upcomming steam products would be useful here. The most frustrating aspect of this would be the "autoaim/aim assist" system. Partitioning the target to legs, body or head. When playing I didn't use the lock-on system and just aimed for a headshot.

If you are looking for something a little different yes, otherwise don't bother and if buying this can be picked up for less than a couple of quid from third party sites.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004406947', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 118, 'playtime_forever': 78, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 66, 'last_played': 1426610097}
review: This is defenetily not a technical marvel. The Graphics are outdated i thought its a game made in the early 90Â´s but it released actually in 2010 for the PS3. I would rather think its a PS1 game. But beneath the detritus lie some good ideas, at least. You often find yourself sleeping through the day to hurry the game along. I didnt give this game more than an 1 Hour of chance, i was too bored. The Story doesnt seem interesting, or at least its not told in an interesting way. You have to watch way too many videosequences. Most of them are a waste of time and boring. For the 90 % off deal 2,49 $ right now the price is ok. The normal price of 25 â‚¬ for this is a ripp off. author: {'steamid': '76561198089598734', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 280, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 277, 'last_played': 1494867712}
review:
I LOVE THE GAME.... But the downside is the PC Port the sound quality and the effects are horrible especially 5.1
but overall it's a cult classic it's a beautiful game,there's something about this game that just simply reminds me of Sega
I just can't put a pin on it but I know it's something nostalgic but with that being said the storyline is so rich it draws you in
and just how corny the jokes are....to put it simply just reminds me of an old-school corny detective movie
do I recommend the game?, yes but buy it when it's on sale... like i did for 3 bucks

author: {'steamid': '76561198040354836', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 267, 'playtime_forever': 2421, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2164, 'last_played': 1413613156}
review:
This game is, sure, weird. But nice. It's nicely weird. And weirdly nice. As the console port it has a lot of bugs and glitches, it has it's undeniable flaws and till the very end it's impossible to decide if it's serious game or is it some kind of a parody. It's also impossible to stop playing, to stop enjoying the characters and the story that is weird... but nice.
That is why I love japanese games so much - they can be weird, but they would leave nice aftertaste. For sure.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000183506', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 223, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 156, 'last_played': 1427106890}
review: this is a fun game and the gamepad does work with the game now. ok first time downloaders if they run into this same problem i did. the DP.exe fix is. you need to go to your steam folder C:Drive/SteamLibary/Steamapps/common/Deadly Premonition The Director's Cut. go to folder redist. scroll down to the bottom and there should be two files. ones vcredist_x86. click on it and install it. next click on file called PhysX_SystemSoftware and install it. scroll up alittle bit half way and find file called DXSETUP and run that and install it. ok after that go back to folder Deadly Premonition The Director's Cut. right click on DP and click on properties. click on Compatibility tab up on top. click on box Run this program in compatibility mode for Windows 98/ Windows Me. dont need to check off run as administrator. click apply or ok. thats done. next right click on DPLauncher and click on properties again. click on Compatibility up on top. now down at the bottom where it says Privilege Level theres a box that says next to it Run this program as an administrator. click on that box, check it off. and now click apply and ok. and now boot up the game and have fun :) this may not fix every ones problems but if you freshly installed this game on a clean copy of Windows 7 ill guess 8 as well it should work with this method.

author: {'steamid': '76561198020891527', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 1240, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1236, 'last_played': 1425341890}
review:
I really want to reccomend this game. I really, really want to. The plot, dialogue, setting, characters et cetera are all fantastic. However, even after applying various fixes such as dpfix, and compatibility mode, I still experienced numerous errors. These include stuttering framerate, unable to get out of windowed mode, unable to alter resolution, and an inability to aim up or down rendering some puzzles literally incompletable. (I know compatibility mode is supposed to fix this but didn't for me.) Couple that with my save file getting corrupted somehow (twice) I can't reccomend the PC version. If you want this game, the console version works fine. 

I love this game, but the number of bugs is completely unreasonable. If it gets officially patched and this is fixed, I would reccomend it. But at this point, there are too many bugs to justify that.

author: {'steamid': '76561198080692382', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 113, 'playtime_forever': 1392, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 336, 'last_played': 1473080488}
review:
[h1]TERRIBLY AWFUL, SURPRISINGLY GOOD[/h1]

First impression of Deadly Premonition? Awful graphics, weird physics and models and confusing story. After getting past the prologue, however, it all makes sense. Getting into this weird game thinking it's going to be an amazing investigation title with interesting horror elements can get you very disappointed, but if you understand it's actually a parody and can enjoy it for that, then don't hesitate to dive into this bizarre adventure! And I don't really think there's much else to be said, only that if you keep an open mind you're in for a good time.

[b]Pros[/b]
[list]
    [*]High comic value
    [*]Interesting characters
    [*]Plot can get curious after you understand it's not all serious
    [*]Gameplay can be a little odd at first, but it's really easy to get used to it
    [*]Plays nicely with a controller
    [*]Possible to invert both X and Y axes of the camera
    [*]Despite port issues, it runs smoothly on a medium rig and enhanced with CCC
[/list]

[b]Cons[/b]
[list]
    [*]Terrible port:
    [*]Locked at 720p
    [*]No graphic options
    [*]Outdated graphics and physics
    [*]Menus might be confusing at first
    [*]No real explanation to the hunger and fatigue systems
    [*]Jokes might not be for everyone / not everyone might understand them
[/list]

[b][u]A note on the graphics and DPFix:[/u][/b] The game would not open with DPFix installed. I don't know if that's because the original (and only copy of the fix I could find on Durante's blog) release of it has also a fix for the controller support (and the current version on Steam has native controller support) or what, but it would simply not work at all. Maybe Durante has to fix this, maybe it's a problem with the current version of the game, but either way making the fix work won't be so easy as others released by Durante.

author: {'steamid': '76561197982411804', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 3297, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3256, 'last_played': 1426336800}
review:
The PC port is broken. It takes some work just to get it running, and you'll still have to live with intermittent crashes throughout the entire game. I've had problems with achievements not registering and my save file going corrupt in chapter 9, which forced me to replay stages of the game. DP also has a lot of flaws that are unrelated to the port, like lousy driving physics, clunky scene transitions, strange audio bugs, the list goes on...

Still, none of this could stop me from playing, because if you look past its issues, HOLY COW this game is really something else. A wacky murder mystery with excessively quirky characters that you just can't get enough of, accompanied by a soundtrack that does a really good job of building a unique atmosphere for the town of Greenvale. This game has easily become one of my all time favourites, but it's not for everyone. I generally don't like this expression, but in this case I think it applies; you either love it or hate it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197977833031', 'num_games_owned': 2112, 'num_reviews': 67, 'playtime_forever': 2517, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2294, 'last_played': 1426123526}
review:
[quote]Deadly premonition est une petite perle mÃ©connue bien cachÃ©e dans le magasin steam. Soyons clairs dÃ©s le dÃ©part : Deadly Premonition est assez exceptionnel en termes d'ambiance, de scÃ©nario et de chara-design mais il souffre Ã©galement de tares techniques Ã  mÃªme de rebuter 99% des joueurs tentÃ©s de se lancer dans l'aventure. En gros, [b]c'est le meilleur mauvais jeu auquel j'ai jamais jouÃ©[/b]. La lecture peut s'arrÃªter lÃ , mais je vais prendre le temps de dÃ©tailler mon avis ci-dessous.[/quote]

[h1]Points forts[/h1]

Le jeu place le joueur au cÃ´tÃ© de l'agent York Morgan du FBI, chargÃ© d'enquÃªter sur un meurtre ayant lieu dans une petite ville forestiÃ¨re. Niveau environnement, Deadly premonition est trÃ¨s proche de Twin Peaks (le jeu est truffÃ© de parallÃ¨les avec cette sÃ©rie) ou plus rÃ©cemment de Alan Wake. Un peu Ã  la maniÃ¨re d'un Majora's Mask, le joueur est rapidement lÃ¢chÃ© dans la ville avec la possibilitÃ© de faire ce qu'il veut pendant que chaque citadins vaque Ã  son emploi du temps. [b]Je me dois de prÃ©ciser l'excellence du studio Ã  avoir su insuffler une personnalitÃ© Ã  pratiquement chaque protagoniste[/b] (et il y en a quelques dizaines), chacun avec son caractÃ¨re, ses problÃ¨mes (quÃªtes secondaires), son planning et sa propre implication dans la trame gÃ©nÃ©rale. Cela se fait grÃ¢ce Ã  [b]un superbe travail sur les dialogues et le doublage qui permet de vÃ©ritablement s'immerger dans l'univers proposÃ©[/b]. Je terminerai sur ces aspects trÃ¨s positifs en prÃ©cisant que l'histoire ne s'essouffle pas du tout (malgrÃ© un dÃ©marrage un poil lent) et que pour une fois, le tout est trÃ¨s cohÃ©rent et la fin largement Ã  la hauteur peut vous prendre aux tripes (et pas que la fin d'ailleurs). Tout au long du jeu, [b]la nationalitÃ© japonaise des dÃ©veloppeurs apporte une extravagance bienvenue sur une histoire trÃ¨s sÃ©rieuse et un titre qui n'oublie pas avant tout Ãªtre un jeu, souvent complÃ¨tement dÃ©calÃ© comme en tÃ©moigne la BO complÃ¨tement barrÃ©e[/b]. Ne serait-ce que pour la faÃ§on dont elles sont employÃ©es, vous n'oublierez pas [u][url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Z6CYek7Mrtw&list=PL7C25F62540DF4C0E&index=16]certaines[/url][/u] [u][url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qwpzEpPkBE0&list=PL7C25F62540DF4C0E&index=14]pistes[/url][/u].

[h1]Points faibles[/h1]

Il n'est hÃ©las pas possible de cacher des dÃ©fauts presque rÃ©dhibitoires qui tiennent en deux mots : technique et gameplay. [b]Graphiquement parlant, Deadly Premonition aurait tout aussi bien pu sortir sur une Dreamcast Ã  peine boostÃ©e, et mÃªme Ã  cette Ã©poque, on aurait pestÃ© sur la lourdeur du gameplay.[/b] Citons en vrac : options graphiques absentes, modÃ©lisation Ã  la truelle, animations ridicules, synchro labiale Ã  cÃ´tÃ©, moteur physique sur la lune, mixage audio avec le moteur physique, conduite de vÃ©hicule dÃ©sastreuse, visÃ©e pire que dans un Resident evil. Et pour les quelques motivÃ©s qui passeront outre, [b]le jeu aura le bonheur de vous placer Ã  quelques moments des QTE atroces et surtout vous avez de bonnes chances sur PC de subir des plantages alÃ©atoires quelle que soit votre configuration[/b].

[quote] [h1]Conclusion[/h1]

Tout cela Ã©tant dit, [b]la mÃ©diocritÃ© des dÃ©fauts prÃ©cÃ©demment Ã©noncÃ©e n'a d'Ã©gale que les qualitÃ©s de ce titre en manque de reconnaissance[/b]. Les quelques passionnÃ©s persÃ©vÃ©rants qui auront lu cette recommandation jusqu'au bout pourraient adorer le jeu, mÃªme avec les crises de nerf garanties. Et puis honnÃªtement, [b]la prÃ©sence tellement improbable de Deadly Premonition sur steam en fait [i]de facto[/i] une curiositÃ© Ã  tester[/b].[/quote]

author: {'steamid': '76561197978131107', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 212, 'playtime_forever': 1203, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1203, 'last_played': 1426051214}
review:
There isn't anything I could say that hasn't been said. The game is an unabashed throwback to 80's b-movies crossed with anime. Is that not enough? There's enough open world wandering on an indie budget to make Phillip "fishfingers" mustachio cry, and enough side questing cityscaping to make Rockstar envious, but all done with a tonge-in-cheek half assedness (yet serious) enthusiasm that drives you up a wall. Why do the squirrels squeal like monkeys? Is agent York insane? One of the boss fights is against a crossdresser in a clock tower, and another is against an obese man who swings from the rafters. Then Amazing Grace plays as background music. You can't create this in a factory, it surely must be curated at some level? And the story wasn't bad! 

I wouldn't want every game I play to be like this, but once in a while, well heck, this is pretty fun. It is a great game to play with friends, watching and commenting like MST3K. The steam broadcasting feature was really nice.

author: {'steamid': '76561198037516396', 'num_games_owned': 471, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 1860, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1854, 'last_played': 1426723984}
review:
Objectively- this game is terrible. Even on consoles. It's a disaster on so many levels.
Despite that, you still need to experience this perfect train wreck. It sucks in so many ways that it literally creates its own gravitational pull that sucks you in. You won't understand why it fascinates you so. It just will. You won't understand why such an objectively bad game is so amusing. But it is. It's like the sirens of Greek mythology- you're not supposed to listen to their song. But you do anyway, and get drawn in. And then you can't get away. Because it's just that entralling.

10/10 Would suffer again. So says Mr. Stewart.


PS: If anyone can explain to me why I keep seeing Fk's in my coffee, that'd be great.


In all seriousness, despite some of the glaring gameplay issues and clunky menus, it does create an interesting story, albeit in a cheesy B-horror/comedy style that's reminiscent of Twin Peaks. Don't approach this game with the mentality that "This is a survival horror game" because it's not. Once you decide not to take the game seriously, you'll probably appreciate it if you can handle said B-horror comedy Twin Peaks stuff.

author: {'steamid': '76561198064865692', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1662, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1652, 'last_played': 1658344804}
review:
One of the greatest games I've ever played.

The story is one of the best I've seen in a video game, the characters are all interesting and fun to interact with. There's tons of sidequest and stuff to explore. 
The puzzles are also hard as fuck, my fav one is when the game kept crashing and I had to run it in windows 95 compatible mode to get it to work.

This is a must have for fans of surealistic horror games like Silent hill or clock tower.
Highly recomend that you get it for Xbox as the port is horrible, though entertaining.

author: {'steamid': '76561198039269193', 'num_games_owned': 1848, 'num_reviews': 74, 'playtime_forever': 2397, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2397, 'last_played': 1425795061}
review:
Bueno. En vista que pude arreglar el tema de los crasheos de forma permanente hasta poder terminarlo gracias a la misma comunidad que hizo un par de parches y fixes no oficiales -obligatorios a esta altura-, decidÃ­ modificar mi review inicial. Detalle que no quita el hecho que este port de PC sea terrible en muchos sentidos, pero darle una review negativa no seria justo. El juego en si es bastante brillante e independiente de lo malo que es el port de PC del mismo.

En fin y al hueso. Deadly Premonition serÃ­a uno de los pocos juegos que produce in tema de amor y odio. El gameplay es funcional, en terminos de gameplay se siente como estar jugando un juego de Playstation 2, incluso ya en esa epoca habian juegos que se controlaban mucho mejor. En resumen: es solamente funcionales a lo mÃ¡s. La conducciÃ³n de vehiculos es simplemente horrible. Lo bueno es que casi al principio puedes obtener un item que te permite hacer fast travel sin la necesidad de ir en vehiculo todo el tiempo. El Shooting es como estar jugando los GTAs clÃ¡sicos, sino peor.   

Leyendo todo eso. QuÃ© mierda es lo que hace a este titulo tan especial? Bueno. Es todo lo demas. La historia es por lejos lo mejor ademÃ¡s de los personajes. Todos los personajes tienen un transfordo, un carisma propio, y el juego los trabaja de una forma increible, ningÃºn personaje: incluyendo los secundarios estÃ¡n ahÃ­ por estÃ¡r. Como dije; su punto fuerte. Es por lo que juguÃ© DP justamente hasta terminarlo. 

Algo que tiene ademÃ¡s, es que dentro de todos sus problemas tecnicos. El pueblo donde de desarolla tiene un tremendo detalle. Cada ciudadado (Los pocos personajes que hay en el pueblo) tienen una vida propia. En ciertos horarios del dia van a estar hubicados en distintos lugares de la ciudad: Comiendo en el Restorant, comprando en el Market, viendo un obra ne el teatro, pescando, o haciendo algo en su respectiva casa. Tienen una rutina, lo que hace que el pequeÃ±o pueblo de Greenvale se sienta vivo. Es un detalle, pero que hace una gran diferencia.

El OST que hace gala es buenisimo, tiene un carisma propio, y resalta en hartos detalles el terror comico que el juego posee. Se me hace dificil no acordarme de Silent Hill, ya que tienen algunos detalles en comÃºn, pero sin llegar a ser una copia de esle Ãºltimo. 

Para terminar. Se me hace dificil recomendar este juego, ya que claramente no es para todo pÃºblico.-El juego se le conoce bastante bien por haber dividido la critica especializada... reviews desde el 2/10 hasta el famoso 10/10 de Destructoid, o el 9/10 de Eurogamer. No podria recomendarlo abiertamente, menos esta version con tantos problemas tÃ©cnicos. 

En fin, persolamente lo ame, y creo que estÃ¡ muy bien puesto como un juego de culto. No lo crees asi, Zach?

author: {'steamid': '76561198025141228', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 1851, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 481, 'last_played': 1655779678}
review:
If you can look past the dated graphics, this game has a very deep an interesting storyline and I found the whole locale really drew me in as I played it.  Controls are ok overall.  I couldn't get the controller to work, but keyboard functions seem to work pretty well.  

The reason I can't recommend it is because I just can't get it to stop crashing.  This game seems to be very poorly optimized and even using DPfix and upgrading my video card only postponed the issue before I kept continually crashing in the same spot.  It's not worth the hassle of getting the game to work.  If this game ran smoothly without the crashing, I would have no issue recommending it.  As it stands now, I have no idea whether it has been patched, but I highly doubt it.

*** EDIT 6-20-22 ***

As of today.  I've beaten this game.  As a story, it's phenominal.  However, the hoops and struggles I had to go through to actually beat this game for the PC is not worth it.  You have the 360, PS3, and even the newer Switch version to go with.  Play those, or emulate it.  Play the game, just for the love of god not this version.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004883323', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 27, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 27, 'last_played': 1424837579}
review:
Here's what I recommend: 
1. Buy the game; support the developer
2. Don't play it
3. Watch all the cutscenes on Youtube

While there's approximately 6 hours of cutscenes, you'll find this to be much more enjoyable. The game portion of it isn't that bad, but you're just playing it to see what happens next. 

Or you could just watch Twin Peaks (Oh damn, betcha never heard that one before).

This gentleman/woman took the time to piece together everything.
Youtube link: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dcqH4YENamM&feature=iv&src_vid=CARldSP8rJU&annotation_id=annotation_248541

author: {'steamid': '76561197973712385', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 42, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 42, 'last_played': 1403035395}
review:
This is a one B-movie of a game.
Imagine a Japanese Fred Olen Ray shooting a Twin Peaks rip-off with a twist of Silent Hill and a bit of GTA. The result is a campy and cliched mess that for some unexplainable reason fits really well into late-night TV program. You hate the game for being stupid and ugly and buggy, but can't stop playing it because it's obviously a labour of love.

Too bad the publisher doesn't give a rat's ass about compatibility. Many complain about technical issues to the point that the PC port being totally unplayable.
So it would probably be a better idea to get a PS3 version - which has it's own problems as well, but at least is more stable.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032992898', 'num_games_owned': 214, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 58, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 52, 'last_played': 1475088485}
review:
Stupid 3rd person view! In RL i have good aim, point blank as well as long range. And in a good 1st person view game that shows. I'm not about to let 3rd person view ruin my aim.

Besides, this is a small screen what can not be enlarged to full screen. The bones of decaying humanoids apparently are stronger then a steel pipe. Wasting bulets on extremely slow monsters? Just a plain stupid game.

7/8
