author: {'steamid': '76561198133348118', 'num_games_owned': 318, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 3589, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1978, 'last_played': 1421621521}
review:
[h1]Deadly Premonition - Poor PC Porting Perfection[/h1]

This game.  This.  RUDDY.  GAME.  

[b]Should you play it?[/b]  Yes, absolutely.

[b]Can you play it?[/b]  Possibly not.  

Let me explain, (briefly, I promise) this was originally a console game, following the adventures of FBI Investigator and friendly neighbourhood schizophrenic Francis York Morgan who is a walking mix of cliche and man as he attempts to solve a savage murder in a small town in America.  It has some driving and fighting elements but is mostly investigating and talking until you get to do these bits.  It has great atmosphere, is immensely cheesy and there was apparently a court case against it from Twin Peaks for plagiarism.  It feels like Twin Peaks' and Swery65 had an illicit trist and Deadly Premonition was the inbred offspring - perfectly normal until closer inspection.  As soon as the console game, which was a lot of fun if you like a disturbed American comedy murder, was brought to PC, things went wrong.

And oh so wrong.  The graphic quality was hampered to allow it to play on lower settings but the settings were not made accessible to the player so we can't ramp them back up.  The glitches  like walking and falling through walls and floors and tipping over vehicles are just the tip of the iceberg.  Crashes are horribly frequent with some players reporting a crash every hour of play, like clockwork, others getting crashes at certain points like when the camera is on a female characters legs and then again randomly in car parks.  And other points when it simply switches off for no apparent reason but doesn't allow itself to be switched back on without a full restart.  

Two full patches later and these problems are still occuring - there are also external patches that can fix the graphics issue.  It's pretty much unplayable but the game itself is FANTASTIC.  It's fun and strange and shocking in places and I recommend the game itself.

But can I recommend getting it on STEAM?  Probably not.  I've been playing for about 33 hours now and I still haven't completed the second episode, purely because crashes and bugs have made me restart 5 times.  If you can get it on a console, do so, though it's expensive.

Alternatively, here's some quick tips to help make it a little easier:
[list]
[*]Run the game in Admin mode (right click the game icon and click "Run as administrator")
Run in compatibility mode in Windows 98 if you have Windows 7 (WindowsXP Sv1 if you have Windows 8) that should fix the problem with aiming up and down
[*]Search for DPfix.ini in Google - it's a graphical fix patch, follow the creators instructions (not necessary and only useful if you have a really good PC)
[*]Use a controller - it will make your life easier, especially forthe driving sections, which are hilariously bad[/list]

author: {'steamid': '76561198135944203', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 1447, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1162, 'last_played': 1413971836}
review:
Al principio no espere que este juego realmente me dejase algo digno para recordarlo, de hecho, lo menosprecie demasiado antes de probarlo pero aun asÃ­ decidÃ­ comprarlo, no me arrepiento de ello excepto de una cosa, haberlo menospreciado. 

Deadly Premonition es un juego Ãºnico, que al principio es muy raro, confuso y hasta sin sentido pero a medida que avanzas en su historia te sumerges en ella, en su ambiente, los personajes y le coges cariÃ±o a cada uno y -por supuesto- odio algunos.

No sabrÃ­a definir que genero pertenece, ya que es una extraÃ±a pero muy buena combinaciÃ³n de Misterio, comedia, drama y un poco de acciÃ³n. La trama gira entre unos extraÃ±os asesinatos que han ocurrido en un pequeÃ±o pueblo, debido a esto, el FBI envÃ­a a un Agente especial a investigar sobre todos estos sucesos, un muy peculiar agente, con una personalidad carismÃ¡tica junto su amigo imaginario Zach. La trama suena simple al comienzo, pero luego se va tornando mas interesante hasta llegar a un punto en que si no terminas el juego no te quedas conforme.

Bajo aspectos tÃ©cnicos, el juego no esta mal, grÃ¡ficamente cumple pero obviamente para las mayorÃ­a de los consumidores son muy cortos, aun asÃ­, sus vÃ­deos y animaciones estÃ¡n bien hechas lo que le da un toque distinto al juego,en algunos casos son un poco torpes pero no le quita calidad y muchos menos entretenimiento. La banda sonora del juego es bastante pegajosa y repetitiva en ciertos casos, pero concuerda con cada escena del juego. 

Este juego es una clara muestra que no hace falta ser un estudio con altos presupuestos para elaborar productos de calidad, solo basta una buena idea y desarrollarla con mucho tiempo y dedicaciÃ³n, sin duda alguna, a estos chicos japoneses que desarrollaron el juego les comprare otro titulo que saquen en un futuro.

En definitiva, es un juego altamente recomendable, con muy buena duracion (25H en mi caso), trama increible con grandes personajes y un final digno de recordar.

Un juego diferente, una experiencia unica, y tal vez sea eso lo que hace de este juego un must have.

10/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561197976039320', 'num_games_owned': 3435, 'num_reviews': 148, 'playtime_forever': 1944, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1938, 'last_played': 1441073936}
review:
I wish there was a one thumb up, one thumb down rating; or a shoulder shrug or something for somewhere in-between a "Yes" or "No" Recommendation for these Steam-game Ratings.

RECOMMENDED - for the actual game experience: fantastic.
NOT RECOMMENDED - for the awful PC technical port: horrible.

Before I actually even get into what an outstanding actual gem of a game itself, let's start right up front with this:

*****WARNING!************ 
*****BUYER BEWARE!*****

While Deadly Premonition is a unique + outstanding game, it is such a crime that this game is riddled with technical disaster after technical disaster here on the PC. In terms of technical disasters on the PC, this is right down there with the likes of Bully PC version + Dark Souls PTD PC. While Dark Souls: PTD was at least very functional before even modding, Deadly Premonition is absolutely NOT. This is a very basic PC port, lacking of many of the typical PC features we're accustomed to. First off: the game is locked in 720p, so nevermind any sort of 1080p support. Don't expect any sort of fancy graphics bells + whistles officially, either. Durante's DPFix Mod is going to be a must for PC gamers here, if they have any sort of higher-end monitors + graphics cards; especially if they want to bump the resolution past 720p + even make this aging game look a bit more modern. 

Also, the game has crazy-issues with crashing to the desktop (CTD) frequently. You might want to even run a LAA (Large Address Awareness) program to make the game force using 4GB of RAM (since it runs even more horribly, without it), since this game has performance issues where it'll begin at 60 FPS (frames per second) when you start, eventually winding up - slowly, but surely - to a crawl. And if the game hasn't hit a crawl yet and crashed, give it time - it likely will. Saving constantly for most gamers anytime you get a chance will likely be a must.

While I did not try using KB-mouse, the game was a console-game: so, it was built around a gamepad. While you can change the controls configuration in the game's start-up config/splash-screen for the gamepad, you're better off not doing so - b/c some keys might not even function properly, if moved elsewhere. 

****END OF BUYER BEWARE SECTION***

Now, onto the actual game itself...

What do you get when you cross an open-world game, a surreal David Lynch movie/TV show, survival-horror games (Resident Evil + Silent Hill series), and numerous brutal detective movies involving ritualistic murders (i.e. the movie Seven)? You get Deadly Premonition, one of the strangest, oddest, weirdest, unique + most interesting games of this era. If any game has "cult classic" written all over it in this era, this game would certainly easily fit the bill. Also, this game is a flawed-gem + an absolute diamond in the rough in numerous ways, if I've ever seen one.

The story + plot goes like this: Francis "York" Morgan (who the player is, BTW) is a FBI Agent that comes to the small town of Greenvale, in an attempt to try to solve a bunch a murders occurring from what looks to be a serial killer. I don't want to spoil too much more + go off into the deep end here, as this is just the tip of the iceberg with this game's story, plot + characters; since this stuff should be experienced by the player, first-hand.

And boy, are there characters in this game! Most of the characters in this game do have something that make them stick-out in their own way, as either unique, bizarre, different, hilarious, ridiculous, or God knows what. The colorful cast of characters is always interesting + intriguing: for example, the lead "York" talks to himself a lot, and refers to someone named "Zach"; and there is a character that's filthy rich, wearing a gas mask and having his assistant speak in rhyme and poetically. Characters don't get often as unique, interesting, eccentric, hilarious (whether intentional, not intentional, or who knows on some occasions) than often what Deadly Premonition has on display here. 

The story + plot are also no stranger from this type of insanity, madness and colorful-ness, as well. While the plot starts off with a typical detectives are out to "catch the serial killer theme," it doesn't take long to eventually graduates into something much more weird, interesting, strange, unique, bizarre - and then eventually go way off into the deep end, by the time the game finally finishes. Gamers will no doubt be replaying the game; looking at an analysis online (or two, or three, or more); and having debates with their friends about things they couldn't figure out + things that are purposely left hanging ambiguously.

The controls and gameplay feels like it's right out of other classic survival-horror games. Think of the control-pad approach for Resident Evil 4 (especially since you can't move when you aim) - and you have the right idea. Combat always feels like it should with a controller: it feels solid. Areas often have their own "Nightmare" version of an area, which feels like it's plucked right out of a Silent Hill game. There are even QTE (Quick-Time Events) in this game here and there, though this game doesn't really hammer you over the head with them, unlike some other games (i.e. Fahrenheit AKA Indigo Prophecy).

Players, by performing main-quests and side-quests, can make money - all so that they can buy more guns, melee weapons, ammo, med-kits, and other things to keep them on their journey. Some quests, they can only be taken during a certain time of day - so, you might miss quests if you don't do them where they're placed in a game's Chapter or during a certain time of day. This could cause fans to replay the game, to see and experience more on an actual replay of the game. Quests varying from racing to get someone or something to another area; playing darts on a board; to just talking to NPC's and trying to get information out of them. That just doesn't tip the iceberg here, of what this game has on offer - as the game is constantly keeping the player immersed into the game, the world, the story, and especially the characters.

The game certainly lacks a lot of polish, in many areas. Sometimes, the game's sound effect doesn't sound strong, when hitting an enemy with a weapon. Sometimes, the dialogue isn't that juicy or great; while other times, it's fantastic. The quality of the graphics are nothing to write home about here, as it looks like a game that maybe should've been released on the PC years ago and/or this new version should've been updated with modern resolution support (1080p and above) + graphical features. Worst of all - as I've already stated, this game is an absolute technical mess, in terms of how this PC port was handled.

Deadly Premonition is a flawed-gem + a cult-classic, unfortunately riddled with having of the worst PC ports that I've ever seen - but it's an absolutely unforgettable experience, once you can everything in working order...hopefully, for the time being. It's a great gaming experience, when it's working. An experience that, per playthrough, likely will take the player 15-20 hours or so - if we're not counting all the crashes, frustrations, and other technical blunders that might cause the spike in the time-played. According to Steam, I had around 32 hours with this, if you count all of that madness; while the game itself had me clocked in around almost 20 hours. Unfortunately, this great game is brought down quite a bit because it's unfortunately riddled with an abysmal F-grade of a technical PC port - to the point that even mods can't even close to fix most of this game's technical mess. Even the abysmal PC port couldn't stop me from trying to finish this fantastic game.

Game Experience = A
PC Port = F.
FINAL Overall Grade = C.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011528847', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 620, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 65, 'last_played': 1504804003}
review:
Great game, TERRIBLE port.
Started out at about 5 FPS (unplayable/slideshow) on a computer that can handle Skyrim and the Arkham games just fine. With all the tricks and fixes you can find on the internet I eventually got it up to around 15 FPS, at which point the game was just barely playable. (First time I ever needed to use target lock with a mouse, though.)
Then the first boss showed up. The QTEs were impossible at that low framerate.

Don't be fooled by all the positive reviews: almost all of them are from people who played this game on the XBox, where it actually ran properly. The PC version is a broken mess, and it's almost certainly never going to be fixed. I got it for $6 as part of a Humble Bundle deal, and I feel ripped off.

review: Deadly Premonition is a beautiful train wreck. At first you donâ€™t want to look at it but playing on, you canâ€™t look away. The murder mystery plot is bonkers but when the story comes full circle has a almost stunning degree of cohesion to it. The gameplay is clunky and the visuals feel sub PlayStation 2 era but it doesnâ€™t matter because all these elements bizarrely work.

author: {'steamid': '76561198094489294', 'num_games_owned': 332, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 2498, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1817, 'last_played': 1424220833}
review:
El punto fuerte de este juego es la historia es muy atrapante, hace que queiras seguir jugando para saber que es lo que sucede, no tiene los mejores grÃ¡ficos ni la mejor jugabilidad pero la historia hace que todo eso no importe, ademÃ¡s nuestro personaje (York) tiene una personalidad Ãºnica muy carismÃ¡tico y divertido.
Hace tiempo que no disfrutaba tanto jugando un videojuego, me alegro de haberle dado una oprtunidad. Es un juego que tiene una opiniÃ³n muy dividida en metacritic los usuarios lo calificaron de 8.2 en promedio, sin embargo la mayorÃ­a de las paginas lo califican por debajo de 6 incluso IGN le diiÃ³ 2/10 puntos y 3Djuegos 3.5/10.
A mi me funcionÃ³ perfectamente tanto los vÃ­deos como el juego, todo estÃ¡ correcto no se de que se quejan los usuarios de PC, instalar DPfix para "arreglar" bugs y aumentar la calidad grÃ¡fica trae mas problemas que soluciones, DPFix fue lo Ãºnico que hizo que el juego se me crasheara

Yo le doy un 8/10 si el juego estuviera mas pulido tÃ©cnicamente serÃ­a una obra maestra. Aun asÃ­ es un juego Ãºnico, me gustarÃ­a que hicieran un remake o secuela mas adelante.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007480127', 'num_games_owned': 1526, 'num_reviews': 78, 'playtime_forever': 3552, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3487, 'last_played': 1407684466}
review:
Deadly premonition tries to mix elements of an open world action game with a survival horror game and it achieves this goal to an extent. It is a poor pc port (although this is somehow mitigated by DPfix) and the production values are subpar but for those who are willing to dig deeper there is a valuable treasure to be found. The direction of the script is exceptional, the characters are well fleshed out and memorable (at least, most of them)  and the overall mood is a perfect blend of comedy relief moments and serious thriller sequences. Also, the soundtrack is among the finest I've heard in any game the last 6-7 years.
So, give it a try and see for yourself if you can appreciate a one-of-a- kind flawed gem

Read more on: https://ragequit.gr/reviews/item/deadly-premonition-pc-review/

author: {'steamid': '76561198044773117', 'num_games_owned': 737, 'num_reviews': 64, 'playtime_forever': 679, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 246, 'last_played': 1595100142}
review: I really enjoyed this game on the 360 so when my box red ringed I was excited to pick it up on PC so I could actually finish it. That was not the case. This port is sooo broken. It crashes very very often and, since the game uses save points, it is likely you will be unable to progress. If you are thinking of purchasing this then check the forums first to see if a patch has been released. As of now, there are too many stability issues.

author: {'steamid': '76561198047737457', 'num_games_owned': 315, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1788, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1788, 'last_played': 1413323995}
review:
Ohh my fahcking GAWD, I did it, I actually did it, I FINISHED THE GAME. Somehow someway after NUMEROUS crashes, freezes, and playing 99.99% of the game with what I didn't know was bugged out aiming, I fahcking did it! I think this game is mesmerizing but first a few questions to determine if Deadly Premonition is right for you!

Do you enjoy quirky games?
Do you like the TV show "Twin Peaks"?
Do you enjoy games that are rough around the edges?

I'd say, if you answered yes to 2 of those questions you should definitely find a way to play this game. It has a great storyline, funny albeit intriguing dialouge, decent gameplay and an absolutely fantastic OST. However be warned this game can be a FAHCKING nuisance due to the terrible programing/coding that was implemented especially for the PC version. 

Keep in mind that this game has a BOATLOAD of problems but it is also a better experience than most "AAA" or "Indie" games out there!

****TIPS FOR RUNNING DEADLY PREMONITION****
I am using Windows 8 btw.

If the game crashes at start up---->look for redist folder and find the PhysX_Syssoftware installer and run Repair on it
If the game constantly crashes WHILE playing----> Try rebooting your system after exiting or disabling Steam overlay for the game or Run in Windows 98 Compatibility mode
If the aiming is extremely limited (ie. Only can aim within a small rectangle on the screen like i did for 99.99% of the game, lol)---> Run in windows 98 compatibility mode

ALSO sometimes deleting the game and reinstalling helps but it is not as reliable as just running in Windows 98 mode. 

Hope these tips help and happy gaming !

author: {'steamid': '76561197970821777', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 85, 'playtime_forever': 1855, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1855, 'last_played': 1413244544}
review: A near masterpiece, yeah I said it. Deadly Premonition tells the story of FBI Agent Frances York Morgan as he travels to the small city of Greenvale to solve a ritualistic killing which he thinks may lead to more. Deadly Premonition is a third person survival horror game with bits of comedy in it. You may think that sounds weird but it works very nicely. The comparisons to the TV show "Twin Peaks" are incredibly valid in setting, characterization & situations. I don't want to give away the story of Deadly Premoniotn as it's without a doubt the main draw. Agent Morgan goes into an "other world" when he's profiling and searching for clues. Here is also where you'll do some combat and a bit of minor puzzle solving. The story is so engrossing that you'll want to push ahead just to see the cutscenes which include great dialogue and voice acting. NOW the bad news. Deadly Premonition is a buggy console port.  The graphics are dated but serviceable. The biggest gripe is without a doubt the controls. To shoot guns is incredibly clunky as is the ability to use items. The driving is without a doubt some of the worst I've played in any game. Pole Position for the Atari 2600 is a breeze compared to this. And until you get the radio (if you ever do) you will drive A LOT. The two three tiered boss fights at the end also overstayed their welcome, the last being especially being an issue with the known aiming issue. This game is also very lengthy as it took me 30 hours to finish with only a few of the side missions completed. You will get your money's worth. Don't let the slow start fool you. The wonderful atmosphere, unusual music cues, the great story and amazing cast of characters more than make up for the many issues this game has. This game truly is not for everyone but I enjoyed the heck out of it. An easy 9/10 from me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198047455981', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 73, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 22, 'last_played': 1455598296}
review:
This product should not be sold on Steam.   Granted, there are some people who successfully installed and ran and even played it, BUT there are many many  others, myself included, who have tried and failed multiple times to play it.

Generally, I usually chuckle at people who have problems installing a game but this time the joke is on me.   I tried three different PCs, nothing funky in the hardware and OS of any of them (all Win 7 64bit).  Long story short, I did manage to run the game.   My gameplay (after actually entering the game) consisted of one interaction before the game crashed.   Repeated attempts came to the same conclusion:  it seemed that any interaction caused the game to crash.

There are a number of so-called fixes, none of which worked.  An amusing one requires you to run the PhysX driver over again, first to uninstall and then to reinstall.  This actually works, sorta.    It allowed me to get behind an instant crash and get the game running.  But as noted above, the game would crash soon thereafter.   

If you get DP as part of a cheap bundle, go for it and roll the dice, but don't pay even a Steam holiday sale price for this product.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970382583', 'num_games_owned': 1428, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 1963, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1872, 'last_played': 1412547053}
review: I can't think of a harder game to score, so I am glad I stopped giving them this year. The best way I can describe this is L.A. Noire meets Silent Hill, and that is some pretty hefty praise coming from me. The action could definitely be annoying, not unlike Silent Hill, but the story and all of the little touches elevated the game well above the sum of its parts. Looking back, I wonder how many of the deadly sins the "big bad" committed throughout the game. I could think of a few right away once I realized his persona. My only regret is that I didn't start chasing the side quests early enough to get them all done, and I really can't recommend the experience enough.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970940264', 'num_games_owned': 1138, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 3369, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3369, 'last_played': 1412573986}
review:
In the game, Deadly Premonition, the main character is recommended a sandwich consisting of turkey, strawberry jam and cereal stuffed between two pieces of bread. A few moments later, he declares it's the best. sandwich. ever.

That describes DP. It's a janky, open world game with poor controls, PS2-era graphics, the worst driving in any any game, and shooting controls that make you want to cry. The voice acting is painful (except York, the main character; I love that guy), and the character animation is so bad, I was shocked that they actually used motion capture for it.  It's plot is a convoluted mess, liberally rips off Alan Wake, Twin Peaks, Resident Evil, Silent Hill, and with a touch of Cthulu mythos.... and yet....

And yet it's been one of my favorite gaming experience of the year. It's a game so bad that it flips back to good, to bad again, and edges back to good again.  All the pieces are so bad, yet the whole was so satisfying in a crazy sort of way.

Now excuse me, I'm going to try that turkey sandwich. Maybe it will surprise me too.

Because it's like Twin Peaks but MORE mental. 

That said, it's a real mess of a port, and the patches still haven't fully fixed it. You have to get used to saving at every opportunity so that frequent crashes to desktop won't ruin too much progress.

But even in spite of that, it's still really worth having if you have an appetite for strange.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008426120', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 2484, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2484, 'last_played': 1412286136}
review: This game took me a while to get into, honestly. The PC port is not fantastic, and it would crash on me frequently, until I found a fix that would make it crash every few hours instead of every hour. So, y'know, still frequent crashes. Also, the gameplay isn't great, with the driving being especially terrible and the combat kind of feeling superfluous. However, the story itself is pretty great, with twists and turns that you don't quite expect. It's campy and great. I can't heartily actually recommend everyone play it, but if it sounds cool to you, give it a shot.

author: {'steamid': '76561197977599866', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 56, 'playtime_forever': 239, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 65, 'last_played': 1429911985}

author: {'steamid': '76561198049561956', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 44, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5, 'last_played': 1417819824}
review: Do not buy this game. I made that mistake and it wont even play. Really, It wont get past the play button witout "DP.exe has stopped working" error. Ive just spent more than an hour trying to find a solution and there is none. Ive verified the files and reinstalled. Wish I could get my money back. Supposedly there is a fix but Im not willing to ruin everything else on my machine to make it work. Also there are no real instructions on how to fix it. A bunch of people have posted various files they deleted or uninstalled to get it to work.

author: {'steamid': '76561198076368082', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 1820, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1723, 'last_played': 1429310009}
review:
Pro - Eccentric, creative storytelling with one of the most compelling and complex protagonists in recent years -  budget-priced and enhanced from the original.
Con - Game instability, stiff controls, limited soundtrack, repetitive sound samples, poor textures. Also gives me severe cravings for coffee.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042145099', 'num_games_owned': 406, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 234, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 73, 'last_played': 1423230933}
review:
Deadly Premonition The Director's Cut Ã¨ titolo davvero strano. E' un gioco assolutamente imperfetto, pieno di problemi, a partire dalla grafica, al livello di un gioco per Wii, con textures estremamente semplici, pop up evidente, animazioni molto legnose, motore fisico sprecato, illuminazione e blur a volte esagerati, modelli poligonali semplici. Poi il sonoro, che a fronte di un doppiaggio lodevole ed una stupenda colonna sonora, affianca alcuni tra i peggiori effetti sonori (come spari, esplosioni, passi ecc.) mai sentiti in un videogioco, arrivando alla ciliegina sulla torta, ovvero un porting su PC ben ottimizzato dal punto di vista del frame rate, ma orribile dal punto di vista tecnico, con frequenti crash, lunghi caricamenti, risoluzione bloccata (ma a questo si puÃ² ovviare con l'ottimo Durante Fix) e totale assenza di impostazioni video (ma anche a questo si puÃ² ovviare grazie al Durante Fix). Per non parlare della traduzione italiana, zeppa di errori e con i sottotitoli fuori sync con il parlato.

Ma allora perchÃ© lo consiglio? Un gioco con cosÃ¬ tanti difetti, ed un porting PC pedestre, come puÃ² essere consigliato?
E' la trama, che lo salva, e lo eleva come uno die giochi migliori della passata generazione. Profonda, originale, surreale, avvincente, e dotata di un cast di personaggi d'eccezione. Se siete amanti dei giochi con una ottima trama, e magari non avete le versioni console del gioco, decisamente migliori tecnicamente, allora compratelo senza indugiare, applicate il Durante Fix, e godetevi uno dei giochi piÃ¹ originali della passata gen.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960364982', 'num_games_owned': 561, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 1519, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1033, 'last_played': 1593288820}
review:
Do you want to play a game that feels, plays and tells a story like David Lynch's Twin Peaks? This is it.

But like Lynch's cinematography this game will leave you alone confused after it crashes (which it will - several times), so replay that shitty part again and listen to York's babbling - again.
So in simple words: this game is poorly made gameplay or mechanics wise, as well as graphics, sound mixing, just everything. The thing is: it tells you a story with rich but utterly strange characters like in Twin Peaks (or in videogames like Alan Wake's Latern Lady), which keeps you interested and motivates you to get through this nightmare of game. Whatever it throws at you, you will still appreciate this game and its charme. For me it's an classic shitty arthouse-trash game. I love it. Isn't that right, Zach?

author: {'steamid': '76561198026655498', 'num_games_owned': 797, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1066, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 449, 'last_played': 1589318111}
review: Deadly Premonition is the vieo game verson of Twin Peaks but with a supernatual twist and a japanese charm. Recomended if you like small town murder mysteries with bizzar characters and if you like the odd obscure Japanese game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197963746525', 'num_games_owned': 806, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 1134, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1134, 'last_played': 1405708099}
review: In every possible quantifiable way, this game is terrible.  The graphics are sub-par, the music is bad and the wrong volume.  The voice acting is dry.  This PC port crashes a lot.  But by god, if it all doesn't come together somehow in a broken hot mess that's one of the most enjoyable games I've played in a while.  As if Silent Hill and Twin Peaks had a twisted mutated baby.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993388099', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 406, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 343, 'last_played': 1539034363}
review:
Let me start off by saying I adore Deadly Premonition. After purchasing it on xbox360 at launch I was super excited to play the game again with this Director's Cut. The story is still great, the characters still quirky and awesome, the combat still forced and terrible.

However. After playing for an hour I ran into a bug that forced the game to crash again and again and again. Community fixes didn't work, I'm completely stuck, and from what I can tell on the forums I am not the only one. It's bad enough that the community had to fix the screen resolution because the game doesn't even give you options to adjust those yourself. But game breaking bugs that still haven't been fixed close to a year later? Ridiculous. 

TLDR: Game is great on consoles one of my favorite of all time, get it there. Pc version is a buggy mess that probably won't work for you or at the very least gives you headaches trying to fix it so it's barely playable.

Update late 2016. After installing the game again on a new pc I finally got past the part it crashed at on my other system... only for it to crash righ after at the next cutscene. As much as I love the game...there is just no excuse for the way they have handled this release.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992224405', 'num_games_owned': 13380, 'num_reviews': 121, 'playtime_forever': 204, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 194, 'last_played': 1699854907}

author: {'steamid': '76561197984741195', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 3006, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2873, 'last_played': 1411203206}
review:
Deadly Premonition is a unique experience that every videogame enthusiast should play. 

The game obviously looks a bit rough around the edges and surely doesn't have the tightest controls, but once you get used to it, it will suck you in and never let go until you get to the end.

Its setting is heavily inspired by David Lynch's Twin Peaks, which may be a plus (it is for me), however as the story progresses you realize that it stands on its own and it's actually pretty interesting.

Every character you'll meet has some peculiarity that makes him or her different from the others, and you will likely get attached to York, the protagonist, one of the best playable characters of the last gen, IMHO.

Things I didn't like are basically related to the bad PC port: long loading times even on an SSD, crashes and some problems with getting my gamepad to work. 

It was worth the trouble anyway.

Buy this game, you won't get to play anything like this for some time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198017135543', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1250, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 51, 'last_played': 1654199783}
review:
After living through the best 42 minutes of my fledging adult life I've come to the realization that I've ecountered the best single experience one can dream of.

Within this nearly 3/4 of an hour of bliss I've witnessed grotesque horrors beyond my mind's capabilities, dialogue AND monologue worthy competing of Shakespeare's best soliloquys. The life like animation engaged me on not only an emotional level but that of a spiritual one as well. The picturesque enviroment had me on the verge of tears in terms of sheer beauty; the amount of love the developers put into making every drop of water in the lakes and every leaf on the trees shows their commitment to the art that is VIDEO GAMES. The subtle yet numerous pop culture references to movies and films also shows how up to date and hip this studio is. The sound quality and level of fidelity to it is in of itself amazing, the character's voice actors really engage each other with passion for the roles they play. 

In short this game is the Citizen Kane of Schindler's Lists' and is truly deserving of being called art. if it was any more perfect I'd need to check myself for testicular cancer. I can't enjoy anything else now, this was the top and it'll be downhill from here on out.

9/11 it was an inside job worth making.

author: {'steamid': '76561198012820009', 'num_games_owned': 213, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 25, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 25, 'last_played': 1411170279}

author: {'steamid': '76561197970791901', 'num_games_owned': 4013, 'num_reviews': 413, 'playtime_forever': 155, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 155, 'last_played': 1411163402}
review:
Se non sapete Creare videogiochi, cambiate mestiere.
Andate a vendere granite per strada, perchÃ© state sicuri che fate ottimi affari.

Ottimo "respiro" artistico, ottima atmosfera. Gioco coinvolgentissimo per chi vive di Horror Orientale come me.

Ma Ã¨ talmente rotto che, davvero, non riesco a consigliarlo.

Nel momento in cui lo avete finito di installare, dovrete giÃ  armarvi di pazienza e cercare vari Fix NON ufficiali trovati su Internet.
(Consiglio il "Durante fix".) Tutto ciÃ² Ã¨ inaccettabile, specie per il prezzo di listino del gioco.
Gli sviluppatori hanno rilasciato una sola patch e se ne sono andati.
No, no. e No.
Prendetelo per Console, se potete. PerchÃ© il gioco merita.
Ma semplicemente, qui su Steam, NON riuscirete a giocarci. (per intenderci: senza fix funziona ad 1 persona su 10. con il fix a 6 persone su 10. Crash assurdi e senza motivo apparente.)
Chi usa Laptop come me, il gioco va a Scatti assurdi. e visibilmente la scheda video (anche se dedicata) non Ã¨ supportata.

No, evitatelo. Davvero. Vi rovinereste un'ottima esperienza.
(Ps: il mio evitatelo va anche per il grande motivo del NON supportare sviluppatori pigri. Logico, no?)

author: {'steamid': '76561197995702998', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 330, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 309, 'last_played': 1588940645}
review:
A Diamond in the rough... just DO NOT play it on PC!  Play it on console!

I first encountered this game on PC. I had heard a lot about it, and gave it a try. I wanted to like it, but the PC version is a mess. Even with the DP Fix patch, this game just isn't stable. Bugs, crashes, compatibilty fixes that randomly quit working, random framrate drops requiring reboot of PC, terrible/broken controller support, etc. It was a miracle i made it chapter 8 on PC. I tried it on 2 PCs, and on both Windows 8.1 and Windows 7 on each PC. On 7, I can't even get the game to boot - on either PC. My main PC isn't weak either, my rig is more than capable of handling the game; so that's not an issue.  Last but not least : there is no hope for an official update in sight. Long ago the delvelopers heard the complaints and basically replied "Oh, we are sorry the Dev team the did the Director's cut butchered the game, it's embarrising. We apologize" .....and left it at that. It's quite unfortunate that such a unique game fell victim to this shady practice.

..So I picked up the Director's Cut on PS3. It runs much more stable, and was enjoyable. The reivews don't lie though: The PS3 version does suffer from a low framrate at times. Sometimes its fine, and sometimes it drops to as low as 20 FPS. But it's still playable, and I'd pick it over PC anyday, having also played the PS3 version to chapter 8 to compare.

Having decided I loved the game after playing the much more stable PS3 version, I found a mint copy of the Xbox 360 version (Original Release, not a Director's cut) for a 10 bucks, and decide to try it too. I was shocked at the difference!!! Hands down, the Xbox 360 verion of this game is the definitive version of Deadly Premonition! It runs best out of all 3 versions, and there are no framerate issues on xbox, you can really see just how badly the port was done after playing the original release.

The things people complained about in the XBox version I just can't agree with. First, people complained of the tank-like controls on the 360 - they are fine. The classic control gives the game the feel it needs, and I find to be much more sharp and responsive, better in battle after practice. The ability to side-step and do an instant 180 turn in classic controls are a must. Second, people complained about the color filters - they are great! If your TV can support XBox 360's Higher/Darker Color Reference/Black levels - the way the color is done in the original version looks brilliant. They give the environment and the character's faces the perfect flares of color right when they need them, giving the game a feel from some older horror movies. Even when the filter aren't running, like in the pause menu you will notice the color is much more vivid - making both PC and PS3 Director's cut verions look washed out. With the exception of the black/gray/white color themed HUD, the Xbox version looks better than the PC and the PS3 version in every way. And if you aren't a whiny spoiled brat, the controls are better suited too, once you learn them.

Play this game before you die; just don't play it on PC, you are just robbing yourself of a great game experience if you do. And if you have an Xbox 360 -  get that version ASAP - it's getting pretty expensive. At the time of this review, a mint copy is going between $40 to $99 USD on ebay (both used and new copies are in that range). So clearly, I can't be the only one that realizes why the 360 version has become so cherished as more people discover this game...

Let me start by saying that I like this game, but I cant say enough how much you shouldnt buy it here. This port is broken. You are lucky if it works at all on your computer. For me, with my brand new gaming computer, this game crashes every seven muinets at the most, Making this game unplayable, as many of the save points can be as far as fifteen muinets apart.

Buy the 360 or PS3 version. Theyre still bugy, but at least they work.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008747421', 'num_games_owned': 614, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 2227, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2227, 'last_played': 1391544674}
review:
Chi ha ucciso Laura Palmer? Con questa domanda in testa l'agente speciale dell'FBI Dale Cooper si reca nella ridente cittadina di Twin Peaks, immersa nei boschi e ricca di misteri, un posto dove niente Ã¨ come sembra. 

Un momento...c'Ã¨ qualcosa che non quadra, potrei aver sbagliato qualcosa...meglio riformulare.

Chi ha ucciso Anna Graham? Con questa domanda in testa l'agente speciale dell'FBI Francis York Morgan si reca nella ridente cittadina di Greenvale, immersa nei boschi e ricca di misteri, un posto dove niente Ã¨ come sembra.

Ecco, adesso va bene.

Questa Ã¨ la premessa del titolo di cui mi appresto a parlare: Deadly Premonition, alias Twin Peaks: The Game.

Altro che Alan Wake, l'ispirazione a Twin Peaks qui Ã¨ ad un altro livello. Il titolo sviluppato dai ragazzi di Access Games eredita davvero tanto dal telefilm nato dalla mente di David Lynch (Dune vi dice niente?): il protagonista sopra le righe, l'ambientazione, le atmosfere malate e inquietanti, persino alcuni dei personaggi e aspetti della storia.

Indubbiamente il punto forte dell'offerta Ã¨ rappresentato da comparto narrativo, dialoghi e personaggi. Tra questi non puÃ² che risaltare lo strambo protagonista, Francis York Morgan (chiamatelo York, cosÃ¬ fanno tutti). Come Dale Cooper, questo strano individuo Ã¨ assolutamente fanatico di caffÃ¨, tanto da utilizzare quello che "legge" in esso per le sue indagini. A questo aggiungiamo la sua seconda personalitÃ , Zach, con cui non si fa problemi a conversare amabilmente, e una passione sfrenata per il cinema anni '80 e per le sigarette, che fuma anche nei momenti piÃ¹ inopportuni. Tutto questo va a costruire quello che secondo me Ã¨ uno dei personaggi piÃ¹ geniali mai ideati in un gioco. Anche il resto del cast, pur con diversi stereotipi, si difende davvero bene e aiuta non poco ad immergersi in un'ambientazione dove tutti, dietro un'apparenza di normalitÃ , nascondono grandi o piccoli segreti. La trama Ã¨ avvincente e appassiona fino al (lunghissimo) finale, peccato che proprio quando il caso si avvia alla conclusione ci siano un po' troppe cadute di stile, non tanto per quanto quello che accade, quanto per il modo in cui accade...imho giapponesate davvero evitabili. Non dico niente perchÃ© sarebbe un reato spoilerare anche una virgola.

Passando al gameplay iniziano purtroppo ad arrivare le numerose note dolenti. Il gioco si divide sostanzialmente in due componenti: quella free-roaming e quella action-investigativa. 

La prima ci da la possibilitÃ  di esplorare in quasi totale libertÃ  la ridente cittadina, facendo attenzione a rispettare le deadline temporali della storia...niente a che vedere con il tempo stringente di un Dead Rising, dato che una volta superato l'orario previsto la missione viene semplicemente rimandata al giorno successivo. Durante i nostri giri abbiamo la possibilitÃ  di dialogare coi png, svolgere diverse attivitÃ  (come pesca e freccette) e semplici quest secondarie, che permettono di approfondire ulteriormente ambientazione e personaggi. In questo caso avere una guida sotto gli occhi e pressochÃ© fondamentale, dato che molte missioni si sbloccano solo in presenza di determinati requisiti legati all'orario o al tempo atmosferico. A questo si aggiungono una serie di collezionabili sparsi in giro per la mappa. L'idea, per quanto balzana possa sembrare, funziona. Peccato che la navigazione sia resa a dir poco pesante da una mappa inutile e confusionaria (ruota di continuo, non la si puÃ² allontanare per avere una visione d'insieme, non si possono mettere segnalini) e da un modello di guida dei veicoli semplicemente terribile...sono lentissimi e completamene inguidabili a qualunque velocitÃ , per non parlare del sistema di collisioni raccapricciante. A questo si potrebbe ovviare con un sistema di fast travel ed effettivamente esso Ã¨ presente, peccato che sia legato ad una subquest facilmente mancabile.

Passando alla seconda componente, Ã¨ evidentemente quanto si siano ispirati agli ultimi Resident Evi: la telecamera Ã¨ ravvicinata con il personaggio posizionato sulla sinistra, non si puÃ² camminare mentre si spara, si punta attraverso un mirino laser, ci sono continui QTE e cosÃ¬ via. Anche qui i problemi non mancano: la varietÃ  dei nemici Ã¨ nulla, le location sono poco ispirate, le situazioni si ripetono fino allo sfinimento, il livello di difficoltÃ  Ã¨ inesistente (basti pensare che ho giocato il 70% della partita con armi aventi munizione infinite...senza trucchi ). Le investigazioni dal canto loro sono molto semplificate, si tratta in soldoni di individuare una serie di elementi (sempre ben evidenziati) e vedere un filmatino dove York ricostruisce quanto accaduto in quel luogo. Se non fosse che queste sezioni sempre uguali sono presenti in quantitÃ  semplicemente spropositata, si potrebbe passare sopra agli innumerevoli difetti.

Dal punto di vista grafico Deadly Premonition fa semplicemente schifo dall'inizio alla fine, con una motore che farebbe venire i brividi anche a chi Ã¨ abituato a giocare su PS2, piattaforma per cui era inizialmente previsto il gioco. Non mi soffermo sui singoli aspetti, dato che tutto quello che vediamo va dal bruttino (i modelli poligonali) all'orribile (le animazioni). La discreta direzione artistica delle ambientazioni esterne viene quasi completamente rovinata da tanta pochezza. Giochi cosÃ¬ osceni da questo punto di vista penso che se ne siano visti pochi in questa generazione ormai morente. 

Il sonoro Ã¨ leggermente migliore. Gli effetti fanno quasi sempre pena e spesso non sono neanche ben sincronizzati, mentre il doppiaggio Ã¨ quanto meno decente, a patto di abituarsi all'utilizzo di intonazioni un po' strane e alla ripetizione di certe formule...sfido chiunque a non sognarsi di notte Michael che dice "Mr. Francis York Morgan"  Discorso a parte per le musiche: alcune, main theme in testa, sono davvero ben fatte...peccato che la canzoni si contino sulle dita di una mano e che spesso siano riprodotte totalmente a sproposito...perchÃ© mettere una musichetta allegra mentre si sta facendo un autopsia? Boh. Forse a qualcuno puÃ² piacere questa caratteristica (che a quanto pare Ã¨ voluta), ma a me da semplicemente fastidio.

Arriviamo cosÃ¬ alla conclusione di questo lungo post. Devo ammettere che nel complesso il gioco mi Ã¨ piaciuto, ma Ã¨ oggettivo che prendendo singolarmente i vari elementi si assista ad una serie non indifferente di orrori. Praticamente questo gioco Ã¨ quello che sarebbe stato Alan Wake se avesse avuto un budget infinitamente minore, un team meno competente e fosse rimasto fedele all'impostazione inizialmente prevista. Mi sento di consigliarlo solo a chi apprezza l'aspetto narrativo ed Ã¨ disposto a ignorare le numerose magagne tecniche e di gameplay. Ãˆ sicuramente un'esperienza del tutto particolare, qualcosa che non si vede tutti i giorni...magari per pochi euro potrebbe valerne la pena.

author: {'steamid': '76561198110162609', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 459, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 458, 'last_played': 1413044232}
review: I love the game, but the PC version is terriable. I always keep on getting a steam fatal error saying that steam must be running to play the game. Get it for the PS3 instead.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010239660', 'num_games_owned': 431, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 432, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 432, 'last_played': 1410727733}
review:
Made me look for squirrel keyring and a dumbell called arnold for half an hour

10/10

Seriously tho, this port is really bad. Had a crash on start that could only be fixed be reinstalling physics installer in the game files.
Then, without durantes mod, the game is fixed at 720p and no graphical options whasoever.
The voice actings is terrible, and even in 1080p with mod added aa, ssao, af, dof and textures it looks bad.
The controls are clunky, especially shooting and driving. 
Animations are poor.

But, there is something about this game that still makes it quite fun,

Recommend? Sure, but only with durantes dpfix

author: {'steamid': '76561197998063143', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 322, 'playtime_forever': 420, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 230, 'last_played': 1494787396}
review: From a bizarre standpoint this is my favorite game.  I saw a clip of the "Sinner's Sandwich" scene and I had to play this.  I finished it on PS3 and then got it on sale here for all the DLC.  You may not like how it plays, you may laugh at the graphics, you may cringe at the driving, but you may just fall in love with this train wreck.  Zack would want it that way.

author: {'steamid': '76561198005684829', 'num_games_owned': 1117, 'num_reviews': 105, 'playtime_forever': 257, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 245, 'last_played': 1568080157}
review: Don't waste your money on this shit, it's worst port i have ever seen. Horribly broken game. No patch in nearly a year to fix this mess. Oh and botched controller support to put it bluntly it doesn't fucking work!!!! so ignore the store page. Fuck you rising star games you theiving shits, you might aswell have mugged me in the streets. Never buying any of your stuff again as i know it's a brand of lazy developers who can't be bothered to fix their own mess.

author: {'steamid': '76561198109515037', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 167, 'playtime_forever': 201, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 187, 'last_played': 1472948152}
review: Muy interesante juego, muy buena traducciÃ³n, buena historia y atrapante como lo positivo, lo negativo mala calidad grÃ¡ficos, anda cuando quiere, se nota que es un port, pero altamente recomendable por que lo que importa de un juego es su trama, su jugabilidad. Recomendado si tenes en cuenta los pro y contras.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009816180', 'num_games_owned': 531, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 780, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 468, 'last_played': 1410082689}
review: Horrible graphics for the year this came out in.. Plays like a ps2 game.   Great story, great characters, very Twin Peaks vibe.  10/10   Must play

author: {'steamid': '76561198097271711', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 758, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 678, 'last_played': 1562202494}
review: Highly underated on release. This game is unlike any other. Quirky small town Amrerica meets Resident Evil. True, the graphics are basic and the controls can feel a little clunky but if you like narrative and dark plot this game is a must. Ignore official reviews, enjoy this experience

author: {'steamid': '76561197998241239', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 2002, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 732, 'last_played': 1426468257}
review: I thought I was getting a horror game. I got a driving game, a typing game, a fishing game, a dressup game, a shaving simulator, and Twin Peaks with the serial numbers ever so lightly filed off. 10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198086295776', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 216, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 22, 'last_played': 1515544880}
review: This game can be summed up pretty easily: Twin Peaks plus zombies.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002091390', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 276, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 273, 'last_played': 1438935048}
review:
Positives:
Fantastically weird characters, and dialog.
Very Twin Peaks inspired setting.
Some decently creepy moments.
Absolutely deranged music.

Negatives:
Dated visuals.
Slightly clunky controls.
Absolutely deranged music (sometimes it can be annoying!)

author: {'steamid': '76561198022108691', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 191, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 183, 'last_played': 1468643008}
review: Deadly Premonition is a good game but good god this is a terrible port. It took a frankly embarrasing amount of fiddling with fan-made patches and with the games files to get it working and even then it's seems to be running slow. I liked this game a lot on Xbox but I can't recommend it on steam at all.

author: {'steamid': '76561198018966155', 'num_games_owned': 1227, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 1401, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1343, 'last_played': 1388446298}
review:
Questo gioco Ã¨ stato una delusione incredibile.
Sorvolando oltre un comparto tecnico a dir poco imbarazzante ed un porting su pc osceno, saltano fuori una trama piena di buchi, situazioni rimaste inspiegate anche dopo la fine e numerose cadute di stile (specialmente da metÃ  gioco in poi). Il tutto condito da un gameplay macchinoso, controlli legnosi e sessioni di guida da suicidio.
L'unica cosa che mi ha fatto continuare il gioco Ã¨ stato il voler scoprire l'assassino, ma mi sono pentito di averlo fatto. Se proprio avete voglia di farvi del male e giocare questo aborto, non prendetelo sul serio.

author: {'steamid': '76561198055712992', 'num_games_owned': 566, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1396, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1360, 'last_played': 1408527269}
review:
Es un gran juego pese a sus fallos.
Para mi es el mejor juego de serie B que he jugado, se nota un montÃ³n la influencia de David Lynch y sobre todo de su serie Twin peaks.
Un Juego que recomendarÃ­a a los que quieren disfrutar de una buena historia.

author: {'steamid': '76561198078910484', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 1766, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1766, 'last_played': 1408398501}
review:
I suggest reading the English subtitles to avoid the charactersâ€™ poorly animated mouths. Save as often as possible to avoid losing progress from crashes. 

The story and characters are weird and amazing. I loved the game. LOVED it.

You just have to play it!

author: {'steamid': '76561198070682954', 'num_games_owned': 610, 'num_reviews': 106, 'playtime_forever': 1262, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1262, 'last_played': 1407350142}
review:
I had a very hard time thinking of how to review this game. There is no [b]'yes'[/b] or [b]'no'[/b] for this game. Hell even if steam had it there isn't even a [b]'neutral'[/b] or [b]'maybe'[/b]. There is simply an 
[b]'I don't know'[/b]. So this game has what I think is an interesting story line but it is done very poorly. It has bad graphics, glitches, and it crashed a lot for me and others at points in the game to the point where I couldn't see the epilogue because it crashed every time I tried. There are mods to fix it, but I shouldn't have to go out of my way to fix a game the devs should have fixed. The core story is interesting. The only problem is that this game could have been much better if they took out the bad combat system and spent the money on polishing other mechanics. Not being able to change the resolution and the 'DP.exe has stopped working' are the big reasons I can't recommend this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198037386251', 'num_games_owned': 478, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 508, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 264, 'last_played': 1688454855}
review: Fuck you

author: {'steamid': '76561197998868549', 'num_games_owned': 854, 'num_reviews': 157, 'playtime_forever': 691, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 355, 'last_played': 1442188874}
review:
A game like no other. 
Anyone who has a taste for the unusual or the thoroughly insane, this is the game for you. For the rest of us there is still lots to enjoy in DP. 
-The games soundtrack is extremely repetitive but oddly relaxing and it doesn't bother me at all.
-The gameplay is absolutely horrendous, but that adds to the games charm.
-THE STORY: One of the best and most enticing yarns that have come out of Japan. The charecters are insane, but awsome and you'll love every single one of them.

In short. Why the hell not. It's cheap as chips on Ebay and there are a lot worse games you could spend your money on.

Zach/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198013582433', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 1650, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1175, 'last_played': 1409688467}
review:
This game is a good example of high concept not being matched by execution. There's a fix out there for the resolution issues, but nothing can save you from the crashes. If this game were a bit more polished, it would seriously be the greatest game of all time. As it stands, it's a flawed gem.

Buy it. Play it. Imagine a world in which it functioned better.

author: {'steamid': '76561198055774126', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 2479, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2479, 'last_played': 1407992097}
review: Deadly Premonition is one of the strangest games I have played. It has terrible graphics, a story largely ripped straight from Twin Peaks, combat that is so easy it feels tacked on, bad driving controls, and terrible sound design among other things. In the end though I enjoyed it enough to finish the game with all the side missions completed and I even got the 65th trading card. It isn't by any means a good game, but something about it just makes it fun. This is very much a video game equivalent of a cult film. Anyone who enjoys the sound of that should give the game a try.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043854545', 'num_games_owned': 636, 'num_reviews': 80, 'playtime_forever': 199, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 21, 'last_played': 1499216494}

author: {'steamid': '76561197975016498', 'num_games_owned': 816, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 644, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 644, 'last_played': 1392816011}
review:
Still can't recommend the PC version of Deadly Premonition. Even WITH Durantes fix it still crashes pretty much on the hour every time. Did I mention this games uses save points as the save method too? So save points + consistent crashing = Good luck making any damn progress.

That aside the parts I've played were interesting, but controls are clunky and graphics are PS2-era at best.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994215424', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 332, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 327, 'last_played': 1407782214}
review:
Deadly Premonition is an amazing game. The dialogue is hilarious, the cutscenes are cheesy and fun, and the plot's similarity to Twin Peaks (which the creators loved) is a huge plus. 

So why the thumbs down? Because this is a terrible, terrible port. The first issue I noticed was the camera shaking and vibrating during a lot of the scenes. Okay, not a huge deal, so I kept going. Then I started experiencing frequent crashes, some at key points that required me to run through the same (unskippable) scene four times before I found a proper workaround. The last straw was listening to the audio scratch and pop before leaving the hotel just to run into a loading screen that went on for over a minute before I gave up on it.

Again, Deadly Premonition is an excellent game. I can't recommend it enough for the PS3 or the Xbox. But this port? Save your money.

review: As probably everybody knows by now, this game is outright terrible, but then again it is also the best game that has ever been made. That's good enough for me. It's too bad that the PC port is really shabby. But even a shabby port cannot obscure the greatness of Swery's magnum opus. Highly recommended!

author: {'steamid': '76561198018539628', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1336, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1241, 'last_played': 1467925943}
review: This game aint for everyone, the shooting is clunky and easy, the camera can be annoying at times, the game crashes (and needs to be played as Admin, if you want to get past the part) and the graphics look worse then an early Xbox 360/PS3 game. That all said, the game is amazing. The story, the characters and the dialog make the game what it is. Its a special kinda game that cant really be said why its so great, you have to play it yourself. 10/10 we need more games like this.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970847570', 'num_games_owned': 1191, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 285, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 261, 'last_played': 1680429594}
review:

A dÃ­a de hoy FUNCIONA... milagrito de la virgen.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999496407', 'num_games_owned': 455, 'num_reviews': 222, 'playtime_forever': 740, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 675, 'last_played': 1409429269}
review:
Probably one the most abysmal PC ports ever made (even worse than the Dark Souls port), although it varies between PC's in how it performs. First half of the game gave me random crashes, second half would slow down gradually the more new areas I loaded into.

But this game is amazing. It's amazing amazing. You must remember or heard of Destructoid's Jim Sterling giving it a perfect 10/10? Yeah, I don't like him either, but now that I have gone back and read his review, it makes perfect sense. Also, if you love Twin Peaks, you can't help but fall in love with this game either. Not only does Deadly Premonition have an excellent soundtrack, story, and characters that just feel so real, natural and quirky, but it doesn't forget itself as being extremely videogamey in every sense of the word or feeling, however you want to interpret that. The only cons I can think of would be the possible issues (or no issues) you might have with the port, the game looking like it released late Xbox generation, and mediocre filler shooting sections.

author: {'steamid': '76561198018302427', 'num_games_owned': 769, 'num_reviews': 84, 'playtime_forever': 1353, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1343, 'last_played': 1407186476}
review:
This game is a lot of fun! One day, I will buy it on a console and complete it.
There is currently no chance that I will play this all the way through on the PC.
All it does is crash.
There are numerous help documents to help in making this game more playable for the PC, but I don't think they ever stop. I think we become immune to them at some point, but I have given up reloading this game again, it takes at least a minute to do that on its own.
You just have to look at the guide section of this game on Steam to realise that there are some serious issues with this game.

My thought is that a game can become immortalised by being released on PC. Thus being playable for years to come. In the case of Deadly Premonition, it is going to need a serious makeover.

Maybe it will or does work for you, but you are most likely one in a few who have had success with the PC version of this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198024634564', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 32, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 32, 'last_played': 1407141752}

author: {'steamid': '76561197997839377', 'num_games_owned': 1385, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 3327, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3327, 'last_played': 1407151882}
review:
Avoid this PC port, but play this game (on Xbox 360 or PS3)! It's a terrific, dramatic story, in a memorable, immersive, offbeat/surreal virtual town, PC porting issues aside.

If you do get the PC *port*, expect to put up with crashes every hour or so, long load times between zones and cutscenes (especially cutscenes), if you can even figure out the tricks to get it to run. Then, even when you're able to play, you still have to put up with broken vertical aiming that only shows up in the PC version.

If you still get the PC port, look at DPfix (and fiddle w/ resolution and windowing settings), and try setting compatibility to WinXP SP2, or better yet Win98 (but with Win98 you'll probably have to give up the built-in gamepad support and either use keyboard/mouse (mapped onto console/gamepad-first controls) or messing around w/ a third-party gamepad mapper).

I was on the fence "yes" or "no", but I'll leave it at "no" both to stand out in the reviews, and to stick w/ my opinion that this particular PC version should be avoided unless you really don't have a 360 or PS3. I would hate to have you sour on this game's story and world simply b/c the PC port sucks major suck (seriously, even if you could get around the keyboard/mouse, load times (with only a blank screen, no indication DP hasn't frozen--tip: unless it CTDs, it'll probably load, just give it a few more MINUTES) can be unbearable).

author: {'steamid': '76561198144051888', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 2661, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2513, 'last_played': 1410495797}
review:
I want you to play this game, just not on the PC. Do you have a PS3? If so, turn it on and download this classic. It really is one of a kind at the moment with no other game to compare it to. Sadly the PC port is a right pain in the a$$! I had to fight with it for way too long, starting my game over because of saves that corrupted. 

By the time I was done trying to get the game to work, I was afraid to mess with any of the add on content and played it in windowed mode in fear of it crashing. With that in mind, this game loves a good crash more than Nascar fans. If I could I would tell you it was worth it since the game is amazing when it is working, if you overlook the low budget that is. 

Yet, you might not at the moment have any other choice but to play it on PC. If you choose to endure that path, get ready to fight for your right to play the game without problems. Now with the port aside, the game is far from perfect at times even seeming to be broken in places. The vibe it sets and the story it tells is just so cool that you learn to live with the many flaws and ugly graphics. 

Also it does have one of the most annoying boss battles I can remember right at the end, but this game is still great and different. If you loved the TV show Twin Peaks, this is a must have and for any surreal fans, you would just be better off getting it on PS3 or finding a copy of the original on 360.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014836751', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 2353, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2279, 'last_played': 1406679839}
review:
This game is amazing. One of the funniest games I've ever played, and one of the only few games to capture that B-grade movie feeling of low budget, roughness and unnintentional humour. If you can overlook bugs and technical flaws you are out for quite an experience. 
Can't recommend it highly enough!

author: {'steamid': '76561198014023487', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 77, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 51, 'last_played': 1455918900}
review:
This game does not work. As soon as it gets past the first cut scene and enters into play mode, the camera just spins and spins. I've put more time into trying to fix this one problem than I have playing the actual game. I can't even leave the first scene!

I want a game that works or I want my money back.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971917310', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 2887, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2422, 'last_played': 1405558481}
review: Story of this game is well-made but also full of cliche, still fun. performance is low and lots of bugs and crashes. If you still want to play this game, you must prepare yourself with lots of patience for reboot your computer. I played this game about 48 hours (+several hours for reboot and finding solutions for crashes) but do not regret with it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996342496', 'num_games_owned': 538, 'num_reviews': 74, 'playtime_forever': 217, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 216, 'last_played': 1431113209}
review: Un juego muy raro....y ademas que me recuerda a otros juegos de mayor calibre...aun asi es interesante....es malo pero interesante, lo recomiendo.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971647119', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 951, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 679, 'last_played': 1406334523}
review: I bought this after playing the Xbox version, which was good but had a few minor glitches. The Directors Cut has so many glitches that it makes the game unplayable. The map screen constantly crashes the game, the inventory screen doesn't recognise items nor does the item storage boxes - which means I can't equip things I need. The cars drive like busses and topple over at relatively slow speed, NPC's aren't where they're supposed to be, some of the internal buildings have bad graphics - 'daylight' streaming in from windows is green. In my view, this game shouldn't have been released with so many bugs, is a waste of money and impossible to play due to constant crashing. Don't buy it and get the Xbox version instead.

review:
Le jeu s'est lancÃ© une seule fois. Devant le vide intersidÃ©ral d'options graphiques, j'ai souhaitÃ© le fermer et vÃ©rifier dans le launcher, constatant qu'aucune option graphique n'existe pour ce jeu. Pire encore, depuis, il ne se lance plus du tout.

DP.exe a rencontrÃ© un problÃ¨me et va fermer. Encore, et encore. Je dÃ©couvre avec horreur que les plantages de Deadly Premonition dÃ¨s le lancement sont monnaie courante, que la plupart des solutions trouvÃ©es par les joueurs et non fournies par les dÃ©veloppeurs qui eux se taisent, ne fonctionnent presque jamais !

Et personnellement, avec un tel niveau de foutage de gueule, j'ose espÃ©rer que l'Ã©diteur et le dÃ©veloppeur ne toucheront plus jamais Ã  un jeu vidÃ©o de leur vie.

author: {'steamid': '76561198026335843', 'num_games_owned': 1614, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 352, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 230, 'last_played': 1483539013}
review:
Este juego posiblemente sea bueno, aun con lo bizarro que es si pudiera hacerlo funcionar. A estas altura, que un juego como este de tantos errores en su ejecucion en diversos usuarios sin importar si emplean todas las guias posibles para hacerlo funcionar deja demasiado que desear.
Si bien es cierto que Dark Souls PTDE no es un buen port, gracias al fix de Durante se soluciona gran parte de esto mientras que en este juego aun con eso no se puede solucionar mucho. DespuÃ©s los creadores se pregunta porque nadie comprar sus juegos...
Edit: Lo hermoso del tener como plataforma de juego al PC es que puedes encontrar soluciones a problemas que los creadores dejaron ahi. En mi caso, fue el desconectar ambos controles usb y ahora si funciona el juego. Por el momento lo cambio a positivo por darle la duda al juego, modifico analisis al terminar el juego.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970841939', 'num_games_owned': 1498, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 44, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 35, 'last_played': 1419270426}
review: I really wanted to play this game, after having watched a full LP of it. It really seems like a unique experience, despite its many many many apparent flaws. However, after an hour or two of launching, tweaking, relaunching, browsing numerous forum threads, and generally throwing everythign I can think of at this thing, I CANNOT get it to function properly, be it running with a decent framerate or even properly recognizing my controller's analog sticks and d-pad (standard 360 pad). Even after trying every downloadable fix, and recommendation, I have not been able to play any of this game, so I obviously can only recommend you stay far far away from this particular version. If you want to check it out, get it on PS3 or 360. The devs deserve none of your money for this non-functional port.

author: {'steamid': '76561197981834842', 'num_games_owned': 961, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 1438, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1438, 'last_played': 1405184126}
review:
Absolutely terrible port! No graphic option, not even resolution.
It has a crashed a lot of times for me.

As a game I have mixedfeelings.
First impression was a low budget game with terrible writing and voice acting, yet for some reason I kept playing.
The story got somewhat interesting and made me wanna see the ending.
Halfway through the game the story just takes a turn for freaking weird. It's a shame cause it had could have been a very interresing story.

On the gameplay side there are a lot of things wrong with the game.
The driving for one is abysmal, you would have more luck driving concrete then cars in this game.
The shooting is a bit so so but entertaining enough.
There are a lot of sidemissions which are basicly all very short and very boring.
The writing of some of the dialogue can be absolutely terrible, whilst the writing of the main story is not to bad.

Oh and make no mistake this is not a horror game not by a long shot!
It's more of a murder mystery game, yet it's so weird it's hard to follow what is actually going on.

Still even in all it's flaws I would recommend trying it.

6/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198080270239', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 370, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10, 'last_played': 1406841983}
review: First off....NO ONE is able to play this game right after downloading it from Steam. Some can get it to work after just tweaking compatibility mode to windows 98 BUT MOST have to download a THIRD PARTY FIX (how sad is that) called DPFIX to get this game to work. Guess what?!?!??!?!? Even if you do that.....the game just might not work lol....yup that is correct. Guess where I fall in that group. After following 10+ threads/tips on how to possibly fix it, and dling dpfix and following multiple videos how to get it to work...yup not happening. Sorry, but i don't even blame the developers I have to blame Steam for this. I mean devs are gonna be money hungry and poop out shit products that are half assed developed it's expected. Steam, by allowing them to put these games on Steam, are not only giving themselves a bad name, but insulting their customers. We should be able to trust Steam to at least make sure games are PLAYABLE.....crappy maybe....but playable w/o these crazy fixes.

review: I forget to save for 3 hours and a fence appeared a few feet infront of me and I exploded 10/10.  Other than that the port is shit and it looks like an upscaled dreamcast game. The shooting is resident evil 4-esc. The story features your typical japanese wackyness that you find in a suda 51 or early Dead rising game. Is it worth 25 dollars? No.
